1.brief: the first letter of the Greek alphabet
1.long: alpha; the first letter of the Greek alphabet.

2.long: Aaron, son of Amram and Jochebed, brother of Moses.

3.long: Abaddon, Destroyer (i.e. Destroying Angel) or "place of destruction" (personified).

4.long: not burdensome, bringing no weight or oppression upon.

6.long: Abel, second son of Adam and Eve, brother of Cain.

7.long: Abijah, (a) a king, son of Rehoboam, (b) founder of the eighth class of priests.

8.long: Abiathar, a priest in King David's time.

9.long: the Abilenian territory, the territory of Abila (in Syria), a small principality in the mountains of Damascus.

10.long: Abiud, son of Zerubbabel and father of Eliakim.

11.long: Abraham, progenitor of the Hebrew race.

12.long: the abyss, unfathomable depth, an especially Jewish conception, the home of the dead and of evil spirits.

14.long: I work that which is good, perform good deeds.

15.brief: I do that which is good
15.long: I do that which is good.

16.brief: the doing of that which is good
16.long: the doing of that which is good, well-doing.

17.brief: a doer of that which is good
17.long: a doer of that which is good.

18.long: intrinsically good, good in nature, good whether it be seen to be so or not, the widest and most colorless of all words with this meaning.

19.long: intrinsic goodness, especially as a personal quality, with stress on the kindly (rather than the righteous) side of goodness.

20.long: wild joy, ecstatic delight, exultation, exhilaration.

21.brief: I exult, am full of joy
21.long: I exult, am full of joy.

22.long: unmarried, of a person not in a state of wedlock, whether he or she has formerly been married or not.

25.long: I love, wish well to, take pleasure in, long for; denotes the love of reason, esteem.

26.long: love, benevolence, good will, esteem; plur: love-feasts.

27.long: loved, beloved, with two special applications: the Beloved, a title of the Messiah (Christ), as beloved beyond all others by the God who sent Him; of Christians, as beloved by God, Christ, and one another.

28.long: Hagar, the servant of Sarah, concubine of Abraham.

29.long: I impress (into my service), send (on an errand).

32.long: a messenger, generally a (supernatural) messenger from God, an angel, conveying news or behests from God to men.

35.long: of unrecorded genealogy, whose descent cannot be traced.

36.long: lit: without family, hence: ignoble, base.

37.long: I make holy, treat as holy, set apart as holy, sanctify, hallow, purify.

38.long: the process of making or becoming holy, set apart, sanctification, holiness, consecration.

40.long: set apart by (or for) God, holy, sacred.

41.long: holiness, sanctity, as an abstract quality.

43.long: an arm, especially as bent to receive a burden.

48.long: I cleanse, purify, either ceremonially, actually, or morally.

50.brief: I do not know, am ignorant of
50.long: I do not know, am ignorant of (a person, thing, or fact), sometimes with the idea of willful ignorance.

51.long: an offence committed through ignorance, an error due to (willful or culpable) ignorance.

52.long: ignorance, inadvertence, sometimes with the idea of willful blindness.

53.long: (originally, in a condition prepared for worship), pure (either ethically, or ritually, ceremonially), chaste.

55.long: purely, sincerely, with pure motives, honestly.

58.long: market-place, forum, public place of assembly.

60.long: a lounger in the market-place, perhaps with the idea of agitator.

62.long: unlettered, illiterate, uneducated, perhaps with the narrower idea: unacquainted with Rabbinic teaching.

63.brief: I spend the night in the open
63.long: I spend the night in the open, bivouac.

68.long: a field, especially as bearing a crop; the country, lands, property in land, a country estate.

69.long: I am not asleep, am awake; especially: I am watchful, careful.

70.long: the state of being awake (at night), sleeplessness, watching.

71.long: I lead, lead away, bring (a person, or animal), guide, spend a day, go.

72.long: a leading, guiding; hence: mode of life, conduct.

73.long: an (athletic) contest; hence, a struggle (in the soul).

74.long: (properly the feeling of the athlete before a contest), great fear, terror, of death; anxiety, agony.

75.long: I am struggling, striving (as in an athletic contest or warfare); I contend, as with an adversary.

76.long: Adam, the first man, the first parent of the human race.

77.long: without expense, for which nothing has to be paid.

78.long: Addi, son of Cosam, and father of Melchi, one of the ancestors of Jesus.

79.long: a sister, a woman (fellow-)member of a church, a Christian woman.

80.long: a brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian.

81.long: brotherhood (in the collective sense), the members of the Christian Church, Christendom.

83.long: the quality of being unseen (of disappearing), indefiniteness, uncertainty.

84.long: out of sight, obscurely, inconspicuously, uncertainly, without certain aim.

85.long: I feel fear, lack courage, am distressed, troubled.

91.long: I act unjustly towards, injure, harm.

92.long: a legal wrong, crime (with which one is charged), misdeed, crime against God, a sin.

96.long: failing to pass the test, unapproved, counterfeit.

98.long: belonging to Adramyttium, a port in Mysia, in Asia Minor.

99.long: the Hadria, a name given by sailors not merely to the Adriatic Sea, to which it properly belonged, but also to the open Mediterranean to the south-east of Italy, to the sea that lay between Malta, Italy, Greece, and Crete.

101.long: to be impossible; I am unable.

102.long: of persons: incapable; of things: impossible; either the inability, or that which is impossible.

104.long: always, unceasingly, perpetually; on every occasion.

106.long: unleavened, the paschal feast (a feast of the Hebrews); fig: uncorrupted, sincere.

107.long: Azor, son of Eliakim and father of Zadok, an ancestor of Jesus.

108.long: Azotus, Ashdod, a coast town of Palestine belonging to the ancient Philistia, and part of Herod's kingdom.

109.long: air, the lower air we breathe.

112.long: without god, without (the only true) God, godless.

114.long: I annul, make of no effect, set aside, ignore, slight; I break faith with.

116.long: Athens, the intellectual capital of Greece.

118.long: I engage, compete, in an (athletic) contest.

119.long: a struggling (as in an athletic contest).

120.long: I lose heart, am despondent, am disheartened.

123.long: sea-coast, (sandy) beach; shore (of sea or lake), land.

130.brief: a shedding or pouring forth of blood
130.long: a shedding or pouring forth of blood (in sacrifice).

131.brief: I suffer from a continual flow (oozing) of blood
131.long: I suffer from a continual flow (oozing) of blood.

137.long: Aenon; Eusebius and Jerome place this site 8 (Roman) miles south of Scythopolis near the Jordan.

139.long: a self-chosen opinion, a religious or philosophical sect, discord or contention.

141.long: disposed to form sects, sectarian, heretical, factious.

142.long: I raise, lift up, take away, remove.

147.long: greedily, in a spirit of eagerness for base gain.

153.brief: I am ashamed, am put to shame
153.long: I am ashamed, am put to shame.

156.long: a cause, reason, excuse; a charge, accusation; guilt; circumstances, case.

159.brief: the cause of, the originator of
159.long: the cause, author; the culprit, the accused; the crime.

163.long: I take captive (in war); I subdue, ensnare.

165.brief: an age, a cycle of time
165.long: an age, a cycle (of time), especially of the present age as contrasted with the future age, and of one of a series of ages stretching to infinity.

166.long: age-long, and therefore: practically eternal, unending; partaking of the character of that which lasts for an age, as contrasted with that which is brief and fleeting.

170.brief: I am without a suitable opportunity
170.long: I am without a suitable opportunity.

171.long: unseasonably, out of due season, inopportunely.

173.long: a thorn-bush, prickly plant; a thorn.

176.long: not open to just rebuke; irreprehensible.

179.brief: indissoluble, that cannot be broken up
179.long: indissoluble, that cannot be broken up.

180.long: not ceasing from, not abandoning (giving up).

181.long: disturbance, upheaval, revolution, almost anarchy, first in the political, and thence in the moral sphere.

182.long: unsettled, unstable (though these are hardly strong enough equivalents), almost anarchic.

187.long: I reach maturity, become ripe, am in full vigor.

189.long: hearing, faculty of hearing, ear; report, rumor.

191.long: I hear, listen, comprehend by hearing; pass: is heard, reported.

192.long: incontinence, intemperance (in wide sense), lack of restraint.

193.long: lacking self-control, powerless, inclined to excess.

195.long: strictness, accuracy, exactness, attention to detail, scrupulousness.

198.long: I learn carefully, inquire with exactness.

201.long: auditorium, recitation hall, court room (for hearing cases).

202.brief: a hearer of, a listener to
202.long: a hearer of, a listener to.

203.long: (a technical word of Jewish use) foreskin, prepuce: used sometimes as a slang term by Jews, of Gentiles.

204.long: in the corner (of a building); subst: corner-(stone).

205.long: (lit: top of a heap), first-fruits, spoil, treasure (taken in war).

207.long: the Greek way of writing the Latin Aquila, a male proper name; the husband of Priscilla (Prisca), and a Jew, of a family belonging to (Sinope in ?) Pontus.

208.brief: I annul, make of no effect, cancel
208.long: I annul, make of no effect, cancel.

209.long: (characteristic of legal documents), without hindrance, freely.

210.long: unwilling, generally used where English would express by an adverb: unwillingly.

211.long: a phial or bottle of perfumed ointment, usually of alabaster.

212.long: boasting, show, arrogant display, ostentation; plur: occasions of ostentation.

213.long: a boaster, one who gives one's self airs in a loud and flaunting way.

214.brief: I cry aloud, a clanging or clashing cymbal
214.long: I cry aloud, raise a war-cry; a clanging or clashing cymbal.

216.long: unable to speak or articulate; speechless.

218.long: I anoint: festivally, in homage, medicinally, or in anointing the dead.

219.long: the cockcrow, as a period of time, between midnight and 3 a.m.

221.long: an Alexandrian, a native (or resident) of Alexandria in Egypt.

222.long: Alexandrian, belonging to Alexandria in Egypt.

223.long: Alexander, a name of Greek origin, (a) son of Simon of Cyrene, (b) the High Priest's kinsman, (c) an Ephesian Jew, (d) the coppersmith.

225.long: truth, but not merely truth as spoken; truth of idea, reality, sincerity, truth in the moral sphere, divine truth revealed to man, straightforwardness.

226.brief: I say, speak truth, I do truth
226.long: I say (speak) truth, do truth, maintain truth (the truth).

227.long: unconcealed, true, true in fact, worthy of credit, truthful.

228.long: true (lit: made of truth), real, genuine.

233.brief: I salt, sprinkle with salt, keep fresh and sound
233.long: I salt, sprinkle with salt (of sacrifices or of those who offer sacrifice), keep fresh and sound, and so acceptable to God.

234.long: pollution, perhaps a polluted thing (especially of food).

237.brief: from another quarter, by another way
237.long: from another place, by another way.

242.long: I leap, leap up; of water: I spring up, bubble up.

243.long: other, another (of more than two), different.

244.brief: a prier into other men's affairs
244.long: one who meddles in things alien to his calling or in matters belonging to others; factious.

245.long: belonging to another person, belonging to others, foreign, strange.

246.long: foreign, of another tribe or race.

249.long: without reason, irrational; contrary to reason, absurd.

250.long: aloes, the powdered fragrant aloe wood.

256.long: Alphaeus; apparently two persons, (a) father of Levi, and (b) father of James.

258.long: a fox; a fox-like, crafty person.

260.brief: at the same time, along with
260.long: at the same time, therewith, along with, together with.

264.long: originally: I miss the mark, hence (a) I make a mistake, (b) I sin, commit a sin (against God); sometimes the idea of sinning against a fellow-creature is present.

266.long: prop: missing the mark; hence: (a) guilt, sin, (b) a fault, failure (in an ethical sense), sinful deed.

269.long: peaceable, abstaining from fighting, not contentious.

271.long: amethyst (a kind of rock crystal: the best specimens are the color of unmixed wine, whence perhaps the name), believed to stave off drunkenness.

272.long: I neglect, am careless of, disregard.

273.long: blameless, free from fault or defect.

275.long: free from anxiety (though anxiety is rather too strong a word) or care.

278.long: not to be repented of, about which no change of mind can take place, not affected by change of mind.

280.long: not measurable, immeasurable, to a limitless degree.

281.brief: verily, truly, amen, so let it be
281.long: verily, truly, amen; at the end of sentences may be paraphrased by: So let it be.

282.brief: whose mother's name is not recorded or known
282.long: (lit: motherless), whose mother's name is not recorded (or known).

284.long: Amminadab, son of Ram and father of Nahshon, one of the ancestors of Jesus.

286.long: a lamb (as a type of innocence, and with sacrificial connotation).

287.long: a change, an exchange; hence plur: reciprocal good deeds (services), a fitting requital.

291.long: Ampliatus (Amplias), a male member of the church at Rome, probably of the imperial household.

292.long: I ward off, defend myself against, resist, defend, assist.

293.long: prop: something thrown around; a fishing-net, drag-net.

295.long: Amphipolis, a leading city of Macedonia.

296.long: prop: a road around anything; the street of a village.

300.long: Amon (Amos), son of Manasseh and father of Josiah, an ancestor of Jesus.

301.long: Amos, son of Manasseh and father of Josiah, an ancestor of Jesus.

302.brief: an untranslatable word that makes a statement contingent
302.long: an untranslatable word (under the circumstances, in that case, anyhow), the general effect of which is to make a statement contingent, which would otherwise be definite: it is thus regularly used with the subjunctive mood.

303.brief: and, apiece, by, each, every, in, through
303.long: prep. Rare in NT; prop: upwards, up; among, between; in turn; apiece, by; as a prefix: up, to, anew, back.

304.brief: a step, a flight of steps
304.long: a step, a flight of steps; the well-known "stairs" leading up from the temple to the tower of Antonia at Jerusalem.

305.long: I go up, mount, ascend; of things: I rise, spring up, come up.

306.long: I postpone, defer, especially: I postpone the trial of.

307.long: I draw up, as a net to shore.

308.brief: I look up, recover my sight
308.long: I look up, recover my sight.

310.brief: I shout upwards, cry out, raise my voice
310.long: I shout upwards, cry out, raise my voice.

312.long: I bring back word, report; I announce, declare.

313.brief: I beget again, beget into a new life
313.long: I beget again, beget into a new life.

314.long: I read, know again, know certainly, recognize, discern.

317.long: by way of compulsion, unwillingly, by force, necessarily.

318.long: necessity, constraint, compulsion; there is need to; force, violence.

319.brief: I make known to again, make to be recognized
319.long: I recognize; pass: I am made known, cause myself to be recognized.

320.long: recognition, reading; public reading (of the law and prophets in synagogue or church).

321.brief: I lead up, put to sea, set sail
321.long: I lead up, bring up, offer, produce, put to sea, set sail.

322.brief: I show forth, show clearly, proclaim, appoint
322.long: I show forth, show clearly; hence: I proclaim (a person's appointment to an office), appoint.

323.long: the proclamation of an appointment (to an office); perhaps rather admission to membership of a society.

324.long: I welcome, receive kindly; I undertake, assume the responsibility of.

325.brief: I send up, deliver, hand over
325.long: I send up, deliver, hand over, yield.

326.brief: I come to life again, revive
326.long: I come to life again, revive, regain life.

327.long: I seek out, search for (implying the difficulty of the task).

328.long: I gird up, brace up (with a view to active exertion); a metaphor from the girding of the flowing tunic, to prevent its hampering one in active work.

329.brief: I stir up the fire, fan the flame of
329.long: I stir up the fire, fan the flame of.

330.long: I thrive or flourish again, revive.

331.long: a votive offering, a thing devoted to God; a curse, the thing cursed.

332.long: I curse, invoke curses, devote to destruction.

333.long: I look at attentively, gaze at, consider.

334.brief: an offering dedicated by a worshipper
334.long: an offering dedicated (hung up in a temple) by a worshipper; a gift or offering consecrated to God.

336.long: taking away (of life), killing, slaying, murder.

337.long: I take up, take away the life of, make an end of, murder.

340.long: I make fresh again, renew, restore.

342.long: renewing; a renewal or change of heart and life.

344.long: I bend or turn back; I return.

345.brief: I recline, especially at a dinner-table
345.long: I recline, especially at a dinner-table.

346.brief: I sum up, summarize, recapitulate, gather up in one
346.long: I sum up, summarize, recapitulate, gather up in one.

347.brief: I make to recline, I recline at a table
347.long: I lay upon, lean against, lay down, make to recline; pass: I lie back, recline.

350.long: I examine, inquire into, investigate, question.

352.long: I raise myself, look up, am elated.

353.long: I take up, raise; I pick up, take on board; I carry off, lead away.

359.long: a loosing, departing, departure (from this life); (Probably a metaphor from the yoking and unyoking of transport animals).

360.long: I unloose, unloose for departure, depart, return.

362.long: I await (one whose coming is expected).

363.long: I remind, admonish, am reminded, remind myself; pass: I remember, recall.

365.long: I renew; mid: I renew myself, am renewed.

366.brief: I become sober again, recover sound sense
366.long: I become sober again, recover sound sense.

367.long: Ananias, (a) husband of Sapphira, a member of the early church at Jerusalem, (b) a member of the church at Damascus, (c) the high priest at Jerusalem.

368.long: indisputable, undeniable, not to be contradicted.

373.brief: I make to rest, give rest to, rest, take my ease
373.long: I make to rest, give rest to; mid. and pass: I rest, take my ease.

374.brief: I urge by evil persuasion, I tempt

375.brief: I send up to a higher tribunal, I send back
375.long: I send up (to a higher tribunal), send back.

377.brief: I lie down, recline, fall back upon
377.long: I lie down, recline (at a dinner-table), fall back upon (the breast of another person reclining at dinner).

378.brief: I fill up, make up, fulfill
378.long: I fill up, make up, complete the measure of, fulfill, carry out the commands (provisions, etc.) of.

381.long: I kindle, set on fire, light.

382.long: uncountable, innumerable, that cannot be numbered.

383.brief: I shake up, stir up, excite
383.long: I shake up, stir up, excite.

384.long: I pervert, subvert, dismantle, unsettle, overthrow, destroy.

385.long: I drag up, pull up, draw up, draw out.

387.brief: I turn upside down, upset, unsettle
387.long: (perhaps a political metaphor), I turn upside down, upset, unsettle.

390.brief: I overturn, turn upside down, return, mid. and pass: I conduct myself, live
390.long: I overturn; I turn back, return; I turn hither and thither; pass: I turn myself about; I sojourn, dwell; I conduct myself, behave, live.

391.long: dealing with other men, conduct, life, behavior, manner of life.

392.long: I arrange, draw up, compose, but perhaps: I set down from memory, restore from memory.

393.brief: I make to rise, I rise, shine
393.long: I make to rise, I rise, shine (generally of the sun, and hence met.).

394.brief: I lay a case before, impart, communicate, relate
394.long: I lay (a case) before, impart, communicate, declare, relate (with a view to consulting).

395.brief: rising of the sun, the East
395.long: (a) rising of the sun, hence (b) (sing. and plur.) the quarter whence the sun rises, the East.

396.long: I overturn (lit. or met.), subvert, overthrow, corrupt.

397.long: I rear, bring up, nourish, educate.

398.long: (a) a nautical term: I sight (a place), (b) mid: I appear (as it were, out of the unseen), (c) I bring to light, make to appear.

399.brief: I carry up, lead up, offer up
399.long: (a) I carry up, lead up, (b) I offer up (on a high altar) as a sacrifice, offer up to God on high.

401.long: outpouring, excess, overflow, a pouring out.

402.long: I return, retire, withdraw, depart (underlying idea perhaps of taking refuge from danger or of going into retirement).

405.long: an enslaver, one who forcibly enslaves, a kidnapper.

406.long: Andrew, brother of Simon Peter, and one of the apostles of Jesus, belonging to Bethsaida.

407.brief: I act like a man, am brave
407.long: I act like a man, am brave.

408.long: Andronicus, a member of the Roman church, and a kinsman or fellow-tribesman of Paul.

411.brief: indescribable, that cannot be thoroughly related
411.long: indescribable, that cannot be thoroughly related, inexpressible.

416.brief: I am blown with the wind
416.long: I am blown with the wind (referring to the gentler motions of the air).

417.long: the wind; fig: applied to empty doctrines.

419.brief: that cannot be searched into, inscrutable
419.long: that cannot be searched into, inscrutable, unfathomable.

420.long: enduring evil, patient of evil, patiently forbearing.

422.brief: having no cause to be ashamed
422.long: having no cause to be ashamed.

424.long: I come up, go up, ascend.

426.long: I examine (a person on trial, a witness) judicially (frequently by the aid of torture).

427.brief: without, without the cooperation or knowledge of
427.long: without, without the cooperation (or knowledge) of.

428.long: unfitted, unsuitable, inconvenient, not well placed.

429.long: I find by seeking out, discover.

430.long: I endure, bear with, have patience with, suffer, admit, persist.

435.brief: a male human being, a man
435.long: a male human being; a man, husband.

436.brief: I take a stand against, oppose, resist
436.long: I set against; I withstand, resist, oppose.

437.long: I make a mutual agreement; I confess, acknowledge, formally admit, give thanks to.

438.long: bloom, possibly a reference to the bright flowers, such as poppies (among the grass).

439.long: a coal-fire, a heap of burning coals.

441.long: desirous of pleasing men, a renderer of service to human beings (as opposed to God).

442.long: belonging to human beings (especially as contrasted with God), human (as contrasted with divine).

444.brief: a man, one of the human race
444.long: a man, one of the human race.

445.brief: to act as proconsul, be a deputy
445.long: to act as proconsul, be a deputy.

447.brief: I let go, loosen, release, give up, neglect
447.long: I send up, produce, send back; I let go; I relax, loosen, hence met: I give up, desist from.

450.brief: I raise up, set up, rise from
450.long: I raise up, set up; I rise from among (the) dead; I arise, appear.

451.long: Anna, a prophetess, who visited the infant Jesus.

456.long: I rebuild, build up (what has fallen or been razed to the ground), sometimes merely: I build.

461.brief: I make straight again, rear again, restore
461.long: I make upright (straight) again, rear again, restore.

463.long: forbearance, suspense or delay (of punishment), patience.

466.brief: I fill up in place of someone else
466.long: I fill up in place of someone else, complete, supply.

468.brief: a gift in return, a return, a recompense
468.long: a gift in return (for another), a return, recompense, requital.

470.long: I contradict, reply against, give a hostile answer.

471.brief: I speak or say in opposition, I contradict
471.long: I speak or say in opposition, contradict (oppose, resist).

472.long: trans: I hold against; intrans: I withstand; mid: I hold out against, hold firmly to, cleave to.

473.long: (a) instead of, in return for, over against, opposite, in exchange for, as a substitute for, (b) on my behalf, (c) wherefore, because.

474.brief: I throw at in opposition, exchange words with
474.long: I throw at in opposition, exchange (words) with, perhaps: I compare.

477.long: a proposition, tenet, opinion advanced by one party against another; opposition.

480.long: I resist, oppose, withstand, lie opposite to.

481.long: right opposite, off (nautical sense), over against.

482.brief: I take hold of, help, share in
482.long: I take hold of, help, share in, partake of, enjoy.

483.brief: I speak or say in opposition, contradict
483.long: I speak or say in opposition, contradict (oppose, resist).

486.brief: I abuse in return, give abuse for abuse
486.long: I abuse in return, give abuse for abuse.

488.brief: I measure in return, give equivalent measure
488.long: I measure in return, give equivalent measure.

490.long: Antioch, (a) Antioch on the river Orontes, capital of the Province Syria, (b) "Pisidian" Antioch, not in Pisidia, but near Pisidia, in the Roman Province Galatia.

491.long: an Antiochian, an inhabitant of Antioch.

492.long: I pass opposite, on the opposite side of the road.

493.long: Antipas, a Christian martyr of Pergamum.

494.long: Antipatris, a town, where was a Roman colony, on the road between Caesarea and Jerusalem.

495.brief: on the opposite side or shore
495.long: on the opposite side or shore.

496.brief: I fall foul of, resist, oppose
496.long: I resist, oppose, fall against or upon.

498.long: I set myself against, resist (the attack of).

499.brief: typical of, representing by type or pattern
499.long: typical of, representing by type (or pattern), corresponding to, an image.

500.long: antichrist, either one who puts himself in the place of, or the enemy (opponent) of the Messiah.

501.long: I draw (generally water from a deep well in the ground); perhaps: I draw out.

502.long: what is drawn; a vessel or bucket to draw with.

503.long: I face (lit: "I present my eye to"), resist, withstand; as nautical term: I bear up against the wind.

504.long: without water, dry; subst: dry places, desert.

507.long: up, above, up to the top, up to the brim, things above, heaven, the heavenly region.

509.brief: from above, from the beginning, again
509.long: (a) from above, from heaven, (b) from the beginning, from their origin (source), from of old, (c) again, anew.

511.brief: higher, to a more honorable place, previously, above
511.long: higher, to a more honorable place (at the dinner table); previously, in an earlier passage (or a book), above.

5552.long: golden, made of gold, adorned with gold.

5553.long: a piece of gold, golden ornament.

5555.long: a topaz, a gem with a bright yellow color.

5556.long: a chrysoprase, gem of a golden-greenish color.

5557.long: gold, anything made of gold, a gold coin.

5559.long: the skin, surface of the body.

5560.long: lame, deprived of a foot, limping.

5561.long: (a) a country or region, (b) the land, as opposed to the sea, (c) the country, distinct from town, (d) plur: fields.

5562.long: (lit: I make room, hence) (a) I have room for, receive, contain, (b) I make room for by departing, go, make progress, turn myself.

5563.long: (a) I separate, put apart, (b) mid. or pass: I separate myself, depart, withdraw.

5564.brief: a place, piece of land, field
5564.long: a place, piece of land, field, property, estate.

5566.long: the north-west wind, and the quarter of the sky from which it comes.

5567.long: I sing, sing psalms; earlier: I play on a stringed instrument.

5568.long: a psalm, song of praise, the Hebrew book of Psalms.

5572.long: a false teacher, teacher of false things.

5576.long: I testify falsely, bear false witness.

5578.long: a false prophet; one who in God's name teaches what is false.

5579.long: a lie, falsehood, untruth; false religion.

5581.long: falsely named, under a false name.

5584.brief: I feel, touch, handle, grope for
5584.long: I feel, touch, handle; I feel after, grope for.

5586.long: (a) a pebble, small stone, (b) hence, from their use in voting: a vote.

5590.long: (a) the vital breath, breath of life, (b) the human soul, (c) the soul as the seat of affections and will, (d) the self, (e) a human person, an individual.

5594.long: I cool, pass: I grow cold.

5598.long: omega, the last letter of the Greek alphabet.

5599.long: O, an exclamation, used in addressing someone.

5602.long: here, the things here, what is here, what is going on here, the state of affairs here.

5604.brief: the pain of childbirth, severe agony
5604.long: the pain of childbirth, acute pain, severe agony, a snare.

5605.brief: I am in travail, suffer birth-pangs
5605.long: I am in travail, suffer birth-pangs.

5610.long: (a) a definite space of time, a season, (b) an hour, (c) the particular time for anything.

5612.long: I roar, howl, as a beast.

5613.brief: as, like as, how, while, so that
5613.long: as, like as, about, as it were, according as, how, when, while, as soon as, so that.

5614.long: (Aramaic and Hebrew, originally a cry for help), hosanna!, a cry of happiness.

5615.long: in like manner, likewise, just so.

5616.brief: as if, as it were, like, about
5616.long: as if, as it were, like; with numbers: about.

5619.brief: just as if, as it were
5619.long: just as if, as it were.

5620.long: so that, therefore, so then, so as to.

5623.long: I help, benefit, do good, am useful (to), profit.

1.long:
Meaning: "father", in a literal and immediate, or figurative and remote application.
Usage: chief, (fore-) father(-less), × patrimony, principal. Compare names in 'Abi-'.
Source: a primitive word;

3.long:
Meaning: a "green" plant.
Usage: greenness, fruit.
Source: from the same as "H24";

5.long:
Meaning: "Abagtha", a eunuch of Xerxes.
Usage: Abagtha.
Source: of foreign origin;

6.long:
Meaning: properly, to "wander" away, i.e. "lose" oneself; by implication to "perish" (causative, "destroy").
Usage: break, destroy(-uction), not escape, fail, lose, (cause to, make) perish, spend, × and surely, take, be undone, × utterly, be void of, have no way to flee.
Source: a primitive root;

8.long:
Meaning: (concrete) "wretched" or (abstract) "destruction".
Usage: perish.
Source: active of participle of "H6";

9.long:
Meaning: concrete, something "lost"; abstract, "destruction", i.e. Hades.
Usage: lost.
Source: from "H6"; Compare "H10".

10.long:
Meaning: a "perishing".
Usage: destruction.
Source: the same as "H9", miswritten for "H11";

11.long:
Meaning: abstract, a "perishing"; concrete, Hades.
Usage: destruction.
Source: intensive from "H6";

14.long:
Meaning: to "breathe" after, i.e. (figuratively) to "be acquiescent".
Usage: consent, rest content will, be willing.
Source: a primitive root;

16.long:
Meaning: "the papyrus".
Usage: swift.
Source: from "H14" (in the sense of bending toward);

17.long:
Meaning: "want".
Usage: sorrow.
Source: from "H14" (in the sense of desiring);

19.long:
Meaning: "brandishing of a sword".
Usage: point.
Source: from an unused root (apparently meaning to turn);

20.long:
Meaning: a "melon" (only plural).
Usage: melon.
Source: of uncertain derivation;

22.long:
Meaning: "Abiel", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Abiel.
Source: from "H1" and "H410"; father (i.e. possessor) of God;

23.long:
Meaning: "Abiasaph", an Israelite.
Usage: Abiasaph.
Source: from "H1" and "H622"; father of gathering (i.e. gatherer);

24.long:
Meaning: "green", i.e. a young "ear" of grain; hence, the name of the month "Abib" or Nisan.
Usage: Abib, ear, green ears of corn (not maize).
Source: from an unused root (meaning to "be tender");

25.long:
Meaning: "Abi-Gibon", perhaps an Israelite.
Usage: father of Gibeon.
Source: from "H1" and "H1391"; father (i.e. founder) of Gibon;

26.long:
Meaning: "Abigail" or "Abigal", the name of two Israelitesses.
Usage: Abigal.
Source: or shorter "אֲבִיגַל"; from "H1" and "H1524"; father (i.e. source) of joy;

27.long:
Meaning: "Abidan", an Israelite.
Usage: Abidan.
Source: from "H1" and "H1777"; father of judgment (i.e. judge);

28.long:
Meaning: "Abida", a son of Abraham by Keturah.
Usage: Abida, Abidah.
Source: from "H1" and "H3045"; "father of knowledge" (i.e. knowing);

29.long:
Meaning: "Abijah", the name of several Israelite men and two Israelitesses.
Usage: Abiah, Abijah.
Source: or prolonged "אֲבִיָּהוּ" ; from "H1" and "H3050"; father (i.e. worshipper) of Jah;

30.long:
Meaning: "Abihu", a son of Aaron.
Usage: Abihu.
Source: from "H1" and "H1931"; father (i.e. worshipper) of Him (i.e. God);

31.long:
Meaning: "Abihud", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Abihud.
Source: from "H1" and "H1935"; father (i.e. possessor) of renown;

32.long:
Meaning: "Abihail" or "Abichail", the name of three Israelites and two Israelitesses.
Usage: Abihail.
Source: or (more correctly) "אֲבִיחַיִל" ; from "H1" and "H2428"; father (i.e. possessor) of might;

33.long:
Meaning: an "Abiezrite" or descendant of Abiezer.
Usage: Abiezrite.
Source: from "H44" with the article inserted; father of the Ezrite;

34.long:
Meaning: "destitute".
Usage: beggar, needy, poor (man).
Source: from "H14", in the sense of "want" (especially in feeling);

35.long:
Meaning: "provocative of desire"; the "caper berry" (from its stimulative taste).
Usage: desire.
Source: from "H14";

36.long:
Meaning: "Abitub", an Israelite.
Usage: Abitub.
Source: from "H1" and "H2898"; father of goodness (i.e. good);

37.long:
Meaning: "Abital", a wife of King David.
Usage: Abital.
Source: from "H1" and "H2919"; father of dew (i.e. fresh);

38.long:
Meaning: "Abijam" (or Abijah), a king of Judah.
Usage: Abijam.
Source: from "H1" and "H3220"; father of (the) sea (i.e. seaman);

39.long:
Meaning: "Abimael", a son of Joktan.
Usage: Abimael.
Source: from "H1" and an elsewhere unused (probably foreign) word; father of Mael (apparently some Arab tribe);

40.long:
Meaning: "Abimelek", the name of two Philistine kings and of two Israelites.
Usage: Abimelech.
Source: from "H1" and "H4428"; father of (the) king;

41.long:
Meaning: "Abinadab", the name of four Israelites.
Usage: Abinadab.
Source: from "H1" and "H5068"; father of generosity (i.e. liberal);

42.long:
Meaning: "Abinoam", an Israelite.
Usage: Abinoam.
Source: from "H1" and "H5278"; father of pleasantness (i.e. gracious);

44.long:
Meaning: "Abiezer", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Abiezer.
Source: from "H1" and "H5829"; father of help (i.e. helpful);

45.long:
Meaning: "Abialbon", an Israelite.
Usage: Abialbon.
Source: from "H1" and an unused root of uncertain derivation; probably, father of strength (i.e. valiant);

47.long:
Usage: angel, bull, chiefest, mighty (one), stout(-hearted), strong (one), valiant.
Source: for "H46"

48.long:
Meaning: "Abiram", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Abiram.
Source: from "H1" and "H7311"; father of height (i.e. lofty);

49.long:
Meaning: "Abishag", a concubine of David.
Usage: Abishag.
Source: from "H1" and "H7686"; father of error (i.e. blundering);

50.long:
Meaning: "Abishua", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Abishua.
Source: from "H1" and "H7771"; father of plenty (i.e. prosperous);

51.long:
Meaning: "Abishur", an Israelite.
Usage: Abishur.
Source: from "H1" and "H7791"; father of (the) wall (i.e. perhaps mason);

52.long:
Meaning: "Abishai", an Israelite.
Usage: Abishai.
Source: or (shorter) "אַבְשַׁי" ; from "H1" and "H7862"; father of a gift (i.e. probably generous);

53.long:
Meaning: "Abshalom", a son of David; also (the fuller form) a later Israelite.
Usage: Abishalom, Absalom.
Source: or (shortened) "אַבְשָׁלוֹם" ; from "H1" and "H7965"; father of peace (i.e. friendly);

54.long:
Meaning: "Ebjathar", an Israelite.
Usage: Abiathar.
Source: contracted from "H1" and "H3498"; father of abundance (i.e. liberal);

55.long:
Meaning: probably to "coil" upward.
Usage: mount up.
Source: a primitive root;

56.long:
Meaning: to "bewail".
Usage: lament, mourn.
Source: a primitive root;

58.long:
Meaning: "a meadow".
Usage: plain. Compare also the proper names beginning with Abel-.
Source: from an unused root (meaning to be grassy);

59.long:
Meaning: "Abel", the name of two places in Palestine.
Usage: Abel.
Source: from "H58"; a meadow;

61.long:
Meaning: "nay", i.e. "truly" or "yet".
Usage: but, indeed, nevertheless, verily.
Source: apparently from "H56" through the idea of negation;

62.long:
Meaning: "Abel of Beth-maakah", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Abel-beth-maachah, Abel of Beth-maachah.
Source: from "H58" and "H1004" and "H4601"; meadow of Beth-Maakah;

63.long:
Meaning: "Abel hash-Shittim", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Abelshittim.
Source: from "H58" and the plural of "H7848", with the article inserted; meadow of the acacias;

64.long:
Meaning: "Abel-Keramim", a place in Palestine.
Usage: plain of the vineyards.
Source: from "H58" and the plural of "H3754"; meadow of vineyards;

65.long:
Meaning: "Abel-Mecholah", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Abel-meholah.
Source: from "H58" and "H4246"; meadow of dancing;

66.long:
Meaning: "Abel-Majim", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Abel-maim.
Source: from "H58" and "H4325"; meadow of water;

67.long:
Meaning: "Abel-Mitsrajim", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Abel-mizraim.
Source: from "H58" and "H4714"; meadow of Egypt;

68.long:
Meaning: a "stone".
Usage: carbuncle, mason, plummet, (chalk-, hail-, head-, sling-) stone(-ny), (divers) weight(-s).
Source: from the root of "H1129" through the meaning to "build";

70.long:
Meaning: a "pair of stones" (only dual); a "potter's wheel" or a "midwife's stool" (consisting alike of two horizontal disks with a support between).
Usage: wheel, stool.
Source: from the same as "H68";

71.long:
Meaning: "Abanah", a river near Damascus.
Usage: Abana.
Source: perhaps feminine of "H68"; stony; Compare "H549".

72.long:
Meaning: "Eben-ha-Ezer", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Ebenezer.
Source: from "H68" and "H5828" with the article inserted; stone of the help;

74.long:
Meaning: "Abner", an Israelite.
Usage: Abner.
Source: or (fully) "אֲבִינֵר" ; from "H1" and "H5216"; father of light (i.e. enlightening);

75.long:
Meaning: to "fodder".
Usage: fatted, stalled.
Source: a primitive root;

76.long:
Meaning: an "inflammatory pustule" (as eruption).
Usage: blains.
Source: (by reduplication) from an unused root (meaning to belch forth);

77.long:
Meaning: "Ebets", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Abez.
Source: from an unused root probably meaning to gleam; conspicuous;

78.long:
Meaning: "Ibtsan", an Israelite.
Usage: Ibzan.
Source: from the same as "H76"; splendid;

79.long:
Meaning: to "bedust", i.e. "grapple".
Usage: wrestle.
Source: a primitive root, probably to "float" away (as vapor), but used only as denominative from "H80";

80.long:
Meaning: light "particles" (as "volatile").
Usage: (small) dust, powder.
Source: from root of "H79";

85.long:
Meaning: "Abraham", the later name of Abram.
Usage: Abraham.
Source: contracted from "H1" and an unused root (probably meaning to be populous); father of a multitude;

86.long:
Meaning: "kneel".
Usage: bow the knee.
Source: probably an Egyptian word meaning

87.long:
Meaning: "Abram", the original name of Abraham.
Usage: Abram.
Source: contracted from "H48"; high father;

88.long:
Meaning: "Oboth", a place in the Desert.
Usage: Oboth.
Source: plural of "H178"; water-skins;

89.long:
Meaning: "Age", an Israelite.
Usage: Agee.
Source: of uncertain derivation (compare "H90");

90.long:
Meaning: "Agag", a title of Amalekitish kings.
Usage: Agag.
Source: or "אֲגָג"; of uncertain derivation (compare "H89"); flame;

91.long:
Meaning: an "Agagite" or descendent (subject) of Agag.
Usage: Agagite.
Source: patrial or patronymic from "H90";

92.long:
Meaning: a "band", "bundle", "knot", or "arch".
Usage: bunch, burden, troop.
Source: feminine passive participle of an unused root (meaning to "bind");

93.long:
Meaning: a "nut".
Usage: nut.
Source: prob of Persian origin;

94.long:
Meaning: "Agur", a fanciful name for Solomon.
Usage: Agur.
Source: passive participle of "H103"; gathered (i.e. received among the sages);

95.long:
Meaning: properly, something "gathered", i.e. perhaps a "grain" or "berry"; used only of a "small" (silver) "coin".
Usage: piece (of) silver.
Source: from the same as "H94";

96.long:
Meaning: a "reservoir".
Usage: drop.
Source: from an unused root (meaning to flow down or together as drops);

97.long:
Meaning: "Eglajim", a place in Moab.
Usage: Eglaim.
Source: dual of "H96".; a "double pond";

98.long:
Meaning: a "marsh"; hence a "rush" (as growing in swamps); hence a "stockade" of reeds.
Usage: pond, pool, standing (water).
Source: from an unused root (meaning to "collect" as water);

99.long:
Meaning: figuratively, "sad".
Usage: pond.
Source: probably from the same as "H98" (in the sense of "stagnant" water);

100.long:
Meaning: a "rush" (as growing there); collectively a "rope" of rushes.
Usage: bulrush, caldron, hook, rush.
Source: from the same as "H98"; a marshy "pool" (others from a different root, a "kettle"); by implication

101.long:
Meaning: a "bowl" (as "pounded" out hollow).
Usage: basin, cup, goblet.
Source: probably from "H5059";

102.long:
Meaning: (only plural) "wings of an army", or "crowds of troops".
Usage: bands.
Source: probably from "H5062" (through the idea of impending); a cover or heap; i.e.

104.long:
Meaning: an "epistle" (as carried by a state courier or postman).
Usage: letter.
Source: (Aramaic) of Persian origin;

106.long:
Meaning: the "clenched" hand.
Usage: fist.
Source: from "H1640" (in the sense of "grasping");

108.long:
Meaning: a "fog".
Usage: mist, vapor.
Source: from the same as "H181" (in the sense of enveloping);

110.long:
Meaning: "Adbeel", a son of Ishmael.
Usage: Adbeel.
Source: probably from "H109" (in the sense of chastisement) and "H410"; disciplined of God;

111.long:
Meaning: "Adad" (or Hadad), an Edomite.
Usage: Hadad.
Source: probably an orthographical variation for "H2301";

112.long:
Meaning: "Iddo", an Israelite.
Usage: Iddo.
Source: of uncertain derivation;

113.long:
Meaning: "sovereign", i.e. "controller" (human or divine).
Usage: lord, master, owner. Compare also names beginning with 'Adoni-'.
Source: or (shortened) "אָדֹן"; from an unused root (meaning to "rule");

114.long:
Meaning: "Addon", apparently an Israelite.
Usage: Addon.
Source: probably intensive for "H113"; "powerful";

115.long:
Meaning: "Adorajim", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Adoraim.
Source: dual from "H142" (in the sense of eminence); double mound;

116.long:
Meaning: "then" (of time).
Usage: now, that time, then.
Source: (Aramaic) of uncertain derivation;

117.long:
Meaning: "wide" or (generally) "large"; figuratively, "powerful".
Usage: excellent, famous, gallant, glorious, goodly, lordly, mighty(-ier one), noble, principal, worthy.
Source: from "H142";

118.long:
Meaning: "Adalja", a son of Haman.
Usage: Adalia.
Source: of Persian derivation;

119.long:
Meaning: to "show blood" (in the face), i.e. "flush" or turn rosy.
Usage: be (dyed, made) red (ruddy).

120.long:
Meaning: "ruddy" i.e. a "human being" (an individual or the species, "mankind", etc.).
Usage: × another, hypocrite, common sort, × low, man (mean, of low degree), person.
Source: from "H119";

121.long:
Meaning: "Adam" the name of the first man, also of a place in Palestine.
Usage: Adam.
Source: the same as "H120";

123.long:
Meaning: "Edom", the elder twin-brother of Jacob; hence the region (Idumaea) occupied by him.
Usage: Edom, Edomites, Idumea.
Source: or (fully) "אֱדוֹם" ; from "H122"; "red" (see Genesis 25:25);

124.long:
Meaning: "redness", i.e. the "ruby", "garnet", or some other red gem.
Usage: sardius.
Source: from "H119";

126.long:
Meaning: "Admah", a place near the Dead Sea.
Usage: Admah.
Source: contracted for "H127"; earthy;

127.long:
Meaning: "soil" (from its general redness).
Usage: country, earth, ground, husband(-man) (-ry), land.
Source: from "H119";

128.long:
Meaning: "Adamah", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Adamah.
Source: the same as "H127";

129.long:
Meaning: "Adami", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Adami.
Source: from "H127"; earthy;

130.long:
Meaning: an "Edomite", or descendants from (or inhabitants of) Edom.
Usage: Edomite.
Source: or (fully) "אֱדוֹמִי" ; patronymic from "H123"; See "H726".

131.long:
Meaning: "Adummim", a pass in Palestine.
Usage: Adummim.
Source: plural of "H121"; red spots;

132.long:
Meaning: "reddish" (of the hair or the complexion).
Usage: red, ruddy.
Source: or (fully) "אַדְמוֹנִי" ; from "H119";

133.long:
Meaning: "Admatha", a Persian nobleman.
Usage: Admatha.
Source: probably of Persian derivation;

134.long:
Meaning: a "basis" (of a building, a column, etc.).
Usage: foundation, socket.
Source: from the same as "H113" (in the sense of "strength");

135.long:
Meaning: "Addan", an Israelite.
Usage: Addan.
Source: intensive from the same as "H134"; firm;

136.long:
Meaning: the "Lord" (used as a proper name of God only).
Usage: (my) Lord.
Source: an emphatic form of "H113";

137.long:
Meaning: "Adoni-Bezek"; a Canaanitish king.
Usage: Adonibezek.
Source: from "H113" and "H966"; lord of Bezek;

138.long:
Meaning: "Adonijah", the name of three Israelites.
Usage: Adonijah.
Source: original (prolonged) "אֲדֹנִיָּהוּ" ; from "H113" and "H3050"; lord (i.e. worshipper) of Jah;

139.long:
Meaning: "Adoni-Tsedek", a Canaanitish king.
Usage: Adonizedec.
Source: from "H113" and "H6664"; lord of justice;

140.long:
Meaning: "Adonikam", the name of one or two Israelites.
Usage: Adonikam.
Source: from "H113" and "H6965"; lord of rising (i.e. high);

141.long:
Meaning: "Adoniram", an Israelite.
Usage: Adoniram.
Source: from "H113" and "H7311"; lord of height;

142.long:
Meaning: to "expand", i.e. "be great" or (figuratively) "magnificent".
Usage: (become) glorious, honourable.
Source: a primitive root;

143.long:
Meaning: "Adar", the 12th Hebrew month.
Usage: Adar.
Source: probably of foreign derivation; perhaps meaning fire;

145.long:
Meaning: "amplitude", i.e. (concrete) a "mantle"; also (figuratively) "splendor".
Usage: goodly, robe.
Source: from "H142";

146.long:
Meaning: "Addar", a place in Palestine; also an Israelite.
Usage: Addar.
Source: intensive from "H142"; ample;

147.long:
Meaning: "ample", i.e. a "threshing-floor".
Usage: threshingfloor.
Source: (Aramaic) intensive, from a root corresponding to "H142";

148.long:
Meaning: a "chief diviner", or "astrologer".
Usage: judge.
Source: (Aramaic) from the same as "H147", and "H1505";

149.long:
Meaning: "quickly" or "carefully".
Usage: diligently.
Source: (Aramaic) probably of Persian origin;

150.long:
Meaning: "a daric" or "Persian coin".
Usage: dram.
Source: of Persian origin;

151.long:
Meaning: "Adoram" (or Adoniram), an Israelite.
Usage: Adoram.
Source: contracted for "H141";

152.long:
Meaning: "Adrammelek", the name of an Assyrian idol, also of a son of Sennacherib.
Usage: Adrammelech.
Source: from "H142" and "H4428"; "splendor of" (the) "king";

153.long:
Meaning: an "arm", i.e. (figuratively) "power".
Usage: force.
Source: (Aramaic) an orthographical variation for "H1872";

154.long:
Meaning: "Edrei", the name of two places in Palestine.
Usage: Edrei.
Source: from the equivalent of "H153"; "mighty";

155.long:
Meaning: something "ample" (as a large vine, a wide dress).
Usage: garment, glory, goodly, mantle, robe.
Source: feminine of "H117"; ; also the same as "H145"

156.long:
Meaning: to "tread" out (grain).
Usage: thresh.
Source: a primitive root;

157.long:
Meaning: to "have affection" for (sexually or otherwise).
Usage: (be-) love(-d, -ly, -r), like, friend.
Source: or "אָהֵב" ; a primitive root;

158.long:
Meaning: "affection" (in a good or a bad sense).
Usage: love(-r).
Source: from "H157";

159.long:
Usage: love.
Source: from "H156"; meaning the same as "H158"

160.long:
Usage: love.
Source: feminine of "H158" and meaning the same

161.long:
Meaning: "Ohad", an Israelite.
Usage: Ohad.
Source: from an unused root meaning to be united; unity;

162.long:
Meaning: "Oh!".
Usage: ah, alas.
Source: apparently a primitive word expressing pain exclamatorily;

163.long:
Meaning: "Ahava", a river of Babylonia.
Usage: Ahava.
Source: probably of foreign origin;

164.long:
Meaning: "Ehud", the name of two or three Israelites.
Usage: Ehud.
Source: from the same as "H161"; united;

165.long:
Meaning: "where".
Usage: I will be (Hosea 13:10,14) (which is often the rendering of the same Hebrew form from "H1961").
Source: apparently an orthographical variation for "H346";

166.long:
Meaning: to "be clear".
Usage: shine.
Source: a primitive root;

167.long:
Meaning: to "tent".
Usage: pitch (remove) a tent.
Source: a denominative from "H168";

168.long:
Meaning: a "tent" (as clearly conspicuous from a distance).
Usage: covering, (dwelling) (place), home, tabernacle, tent.
Source: from "H166";

169.long:
Meaning: "Ohel", an Israelite.
Usage: Ohel.
Source: the same as "H168";

170.long:
Meaning: "Oholah", a symbolic name for Samaria.
Usage: Aholah.
Source: in form a feminine of "H168", but in fact for "אׇהֳלָהּ"; from "H168"; her tent (i.e. idolatrous sanctuary);

171.long:
Meaning: "Oholiab", an Israelite.
Usage: Aholiab.
Source: from "H168" and "H1"; "tent of" (his) "father";

172.long:
Meaning: "Oholibah", a symbolic name for Judah.
Usage: Aholibah.
Source: (similarly with "H170") for "אׇהֳלִיבָהּ" ; from "H168"; my tent (is) in her;

173.long:
Meaning: "Oholibamah", a wife of Esau.
Usage: Aholibamah.
Source: from "H168" and "H1116"; tent of (the) height;

174.long:
Meaning: "aloe wood" (i.e. sticks).
Usage: (tree of lign-) aloes.
Source: or (feminine) "אֲהָלוֹת" (only used thus in the plural); of foreign origin;

175.long:
Meaning: "Aharon", the brother of Moses.
Usage: Aaron.
Source: of uncertain derivation;

176.long:
Meaning: "desire" (and so probably in Proverbs 31:4); hence (by way of alternative) "or", also "if".
Usage: also, and, either, if, at the least, × nor, or, otherwise, then, whether.
Source: presumed to be the 'constructive' or genitival form of "אַו" ; short for "H185";

177.long:
Meaning: "Uel", and Israelite.
Usage: Uel.
Source: from "H176" and "H410"; wish of God;

178.long:
Meaning: properly, a "mumble", i.e. a water-"skin" (from its hollow sound); hence a "necromancer" (ventriloquist, as from a jar).
Usage: bottle, familiar spirit.
Source: from the same as "H1" (apparently through the idea of "prattling" a father's name);

179.long:
Meaning: "Obil", an Ishmaelite.
Usage: Obil.
Source: probably from "H56"; mournful;

180.long:
Meaning: a "stream".
Usage: river.
Source: or (shortened) "אֻבָל" ; from "H2986" (in the sense of "H2988");

181.long:
Meaning: a "poker" (for "turning" or "gathering" embers).
Usage: (fire-) brand.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "rake" together;

182.long:
Meaning: "turnings" (i.e. "occasions"); (adverb) on "account" of.
Usage: (be-) cause, concerning, sake.
Source: or (shortened) "אֹדוֹת" (only thus in the plural); from the same as "H181";

183.long:
Meaning: to "wish for".
Usage: covet, (greatly) desire, be desirous, long, lust (after).
Source: a primitive root;

184.long:
Meaning: to "extend" or "mark out".
Usage: point out.
Source: a primitive root;

186.long:
Meaning: "Uzai", an Israelite.
Usage: Uzai.
Source: perhaps by permutation for "H5813", strong;

187.long:
Meaning: "Uzal", a son of Joktan.
Usage: Uzal.
Source: of uncertain derivation;

188.long:
Meaning: "lamentation"; also interjectionally "Oh!".
Usage: alas, woe.
Source: probably from "H183" (in the sense of "crying" out after);

189.long:
Meaning: "Evi", a Midianitish chief.
Usage: Evi.
Source: probably from "H183"; desirous;

191.long:
Meaning: (figuratively) "silly".
Usage: fool(-ish) (man).
Source: from an unused root (meaning to be "perverse");

192.long:
Meaning: "Evil-Merodak", a Babylonian king.
Usage: Evil-merodach.
Source: of Aramaic derivation and probably meaning soldier of Merodak;

193.long:
Meaning: "the body" (as being rolled together); also "powerful".
Usage: mighty, strength.
Source: from an unused root meaning to twist, i.e. (by implication) be strong;

194.long:
Meaning: "if not"; hence perhaps.
Usage: if so be, may be, peradventure, unless.
Source: or (shortened) "אֻלַי"; from "H176";

195.long:
Meaning: the "Ulai" (or Eulaeus), a river of Persia.
Usage: Ulai.
Source: of Persian derivation;

197.long:
Meaning: a "vestibule" (as bound to the building).
Usage: porch.
Source: or (shortened), "אֻלָם" ; from "H481" (in the sense of tying);

198.long:
Meaning: "Ulam", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Ulam.
Source: appar, from "H481" (in the sense of dumbness); solitary;

199.long:
Meaning: "however" or "on the contrary".
Usage: as for, but, howbeit, in very deed, surely, truly, wherefore.
Source: apparently a variation of "H194";

200.long:
Meaning: "silliness".
Usage: folly, foolishly(-ness).
Source: from the same as "H191";

201.long:
Meaning: "Omar", a grandson of Esau.
Usage: Omar.
Source: from "H559"; "talkative";

202.long:
Meaning: "ability", "power", (figuratively) "wealth".
Usage: force, goods, might, strength, substance.
Source: probably from the same as "H205" (in the sense of "effort", but successful);

203.long:
Meaning: "On", an Israelite.
Usage: On.
Source: the same as "H202";

204.long:
Meaning: "On", a city of Egypt.
Usage: On.
Source: or (shortened); "אֹן"; of Egyptian derivation;

205.long:
Meaning: strictly "nothingness"; also "trouble", "vanity", "wickedness"; specifically an "idol".
Usage: affliction, evil, false, idol, iniquity, mischief, mourners(-ing), naught, sorrow, unjust, unrighteous, vain, vanity, wicked(-ness). Compare "H369".
Source: from an unused root perhaps meaning properly, to "pant" (hence, to "exert" oneself, usually in vain; to "come to naught");

206.long:
Meaning: "Aven", the contemptuous synonym of three places, one in Coele-Syria, one in Egypt (On), and one in Palestine (Bethel).
Usage: Aven. See also "H204", "H1007".
Source: the same as "H205"; idolatry;

207.long:
Meaning: "Ono", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Ono.
Source: or (shortened) "אֹנוֹ"; prolonged from "H202"; strong;

208.long:
Meaning: "Onam", the name of an Edomite and of an Israelite.
Usage: Onam.
Source: a variation of "H209"; "strong";

209.long:
Meaning: "Onan", a son of Judah.
Usage: Onan.
Source: a variation of "H207"; "strong";

210.long:
Meaning: "Uphaz", a famous gold region.
Usage: Uphaz.
Source: perhaps a corruption of "H211";

211.long:
Meaning: "Ophir", the name of a son of Joktan, and of a gold region in the East.
Usage: Ophir.
Source: or (shortened) "אֹפִיר"; and "אוֹפִר"; of uncertain derivation;

212.long:
Meaning: a "wheel".
Usage: wheel.
Source: or (shortened) "אֹפָן"; from an unused root meaning to revolve;

213.long:
Meaning: to "press"; (by implication) to "be close", "hurry", "withdraw".
Usage: (make) haste(-n, -y), labor, be narrow.
Source: a primitive root;

214.long:
Meaning: a "depository".
Usage: armory, cellar, garner, store(-house), treasure(-house) (-y).
Source: from "H686";

215.long:
Meaning: to "be" (causative, "make") "luminous" (literally and metaphorically).
Usage: × break of day, glorious, kindle, (be, en-, give, show) light (-en, -ened), set on fire, shine.
Source: a primitive root;

216.long:
Meaning: "illumination" or (concrete) "luminary" (in every sense, including lightning, happiness, etc.).
Usage: bright, clear, day, light (-ning), morning, sun.
Source: from "H215";

217.long:
Meaning: "flame"; hence (in the plural) "the East" (as being the region of light).
Usage: fire, light. See also "H224".
Source: from "H215";

218.long:
Meaning: "Ur", a place in Chaldaea; also an Israelite.
Usage: Ur.
Source: the same as "H217";

219.long:
Meaning: "luminousness", i.e. (figuratively) "prosperity"; also "a plant" (as being bright).
Usage: herb, light.
Source: feminine of "H216";

221.long:
Meaning: "Uri", the name of three Israelites.
Usage: Uri.
Source: from "H217"; "fiery";

222.long:
Meaning: "Uriel", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Uriel.
Source: from "H217" and "H410"; flame of God;

223.long:
Meaning: "Urijah", the name of one Hittite and five Israelites.
Usage: Uriah, Urijah.
Source: or (prolonged) "אוּרִיָּהוּ" ; from "H217" and "H3050"; flame of Jah;

224.long:
Meaning: "Urim", the oracular brilliancy of the figures in the high-priest's breastplate.
Usage: Urim.
Source: plural of "H217"; lights;

225.long:
Meaning: properly, to "come", i.e. (implied) to "assent".
Usage: consent.
Source: a primitive root;

226.long:
Meaning: a "signal" (literally or figuratively), as a "flag", "beacon", "monument", "omen", "prodigy", "evidence", etc.
Usage: mark, miracle, (en-) sign, token.
Source: probably from "H225" (in the sense of "appearing");

227.long:
Meaning: "at that time" or "place"; also as a conjunction, "therefore".
Usage: beginning, for, from, hitherto, now, of old, once, since, then, at which time, yet.
Source: a demonstrative adverb;

228.long:
Meaning: to "kindle"; (by implication) "to heat".
Usage: heat, hot.
Source: (Aramaic) or "אֲזָה" (Aramaic);

229.long:
Meaning: "Ezbai", an Israelite.
Usage: Ezbai.
Source: probably from "H231"; hyssop-like;

232.long:
Meaning: something "girt"; a "belt", also a "band".
Usage: girdle.
Source: from "H246";

235.long:
Meaning: to "go away", hence, to "disappear".
Usage: fail, gad about, go to and fro (but in Ezekiel 27:19 the word is rendered by many 'from Uzal,' by others 'yarn'), be gone (spent).
Source: a primitive root;

237.long:
Meaning: "Ezel", a memorial stone in Palestine.
Usage: Ezel.
Source: from "H235"; departure;

238.long:
Meaning: to "broaden out the ear" (with the hand), i.e. (by implication) to "listen".
Usage: give (perceive by the) ear, hear(-ken). See "H239".
Source: a primitive root; probably to "expand"; but used only as a denominative from "H241";

239.long:
Meaning: to "weigh", i.e. (figuratively) "ponder".
Usage: give good heed.
Source: a primitive root (rather identical with "H238" through the idea of scales as if two ears);

240.long:
Meaning: a "spade" or "paddle" (as having a broad end).
Usage: weapon.
Source: from "H238";

241.long:
Meaning: "broadness". i.e. (concrete) the "ear" (from its form in man).
Usage: advertise, audience, displease, ear, hearing, show.
Source: from "H238";

242.long:
Meaning: "Uzzen-Sheerah", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Uzzen-sherah.
Source: from "H238" and "H7609"; plot of Sheerah (i.e. settled by him);

243.long:
Meaning: "Aznoth-Tabor", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Aznoth-tabor.
Source: from "H238" and "H8396"; flats (i.e. tops) of Tabor (i.e. situated on it);

244.long:
Meaning: "Ozni", an Israelite; also an Oznite (collectively), his descendant.
Usage: Ozni, Oznites.
Source: from "H241"; having (quick) ears;

245.long:
Meaning: "Azanjah", an Israelite.
Usage: Azaniah.
Source: from "H238" and "H3050"; heard by Jah;

247.long:
Meaning: to "belt".
Usage: bind (compass) about, gird (up, with).
Source: a primitive root;

249.long:
Meaning: a spontaneous "growth", i.e. "native" (tree or persons).
Usage: bay tree, (home-) born (in the land), of the (one's own) country (nation).
Source: from "H2224" (in the sense of "springing up");

250.long:
Meaning: an "Ezrachite" or descendant of Zerach.
Usage: Ezrahite.
Source: patronymic from "H2226";

251.long:
Meaning: a "brother" (used in the widest sense of literal relationship and metaphorical affinity or resemblance [like "H1"]).
Usage: another, brother(-ly); kindred, like, other. Compare also the proper names beginning with 'Ah-' or 'Ahi-'.
Source: a primitive word;

253.long:
Meaning: "Oh!" (expressive of grief or surprise).
Usage: ah, alas.
Source: a variation for "H162";

254.long:
Meaning: a "fire-pot" or "chafing dish".
Usage: hearth.
Source: of uncertain derivation;

255.long:
Meaning: a "howler" or lonesome wild animal.
Usage: doleful creature.
Source: probably from "H253";

256.long:
Meaning: "Achab", the name of a king of Israel and of a prophet at Babylon.
Usage: Ahab.
Source: once (by contraction) "אֶחָב" (Jeremiah 29:22); from "H251" and "H1"; brother (i.e. friend) of (his) father;

257.long:
Meaning: "Achban", an Israelite.
Usage: Ahban.
Source: from "H251" and "H995"; brother (i.e. possessor) of understanding;

258.long:
Meaning: to "unify", i.e. (figuratively) "collect" (one's thoughts).
Usage: go one way or other.
Source: perhaps a primitive root;

259.long:
Meaning: properly, "united", i.e. "one"; or (as an ordinal) "first".
Usage: a, alike, alone, altogether, and, any(-thing), apiece, a certain, (dai-) ly, each (one), eleven, every, few, first, highway, a man, once, one, only, other, some, together.
Source: a numeral from "H258";

260.long:
Meaning: a "bulrush" or any marshy grass (particularly that along the Nile).
Usage: flag, meadow.
Source: of uncertain (perhaps Egyptian) derivation;

261.long:
Meaning: "Echud", the name of three Israelites.
Usage: Ehud.
Source: from "H258"; united;

262.long:
Meaning: an "utterance".
Usage: declaration.
Source: from "H2331" (in the sense of "H2324");

265.long:
Meaning: "Achoach", an Israelite.
Usage: Ahoah.
Source: by reduplication from "H251"; brotherly;

266.long:
Meaning: an "Achochite" or descendant of Achoach.
Usage: Ahohite.
Source: patronymic from "H264";

267.long:
Meaning: "Achumai", an Israelite.
Usage: Ahumai.
Source: perhaps from "H251" and "H4325"; brother (i.e. neighbour) of water;

268.long:
Meaning: the "hinder" part; hence (adverb) "behind", "backward"; also (as facing north) the "West".
Usage: after(-ward), back (part, -side, -ward), hereafter, (be-) hind(-er part), time to come, without.
Source: or (shortened) "אָחֹר" ; from "H299";

269.long:
Meaning: a "sister" (used very widely [like "H251"], literally and figuratively).
Usage: (an-) other, sister, together.
Source: irregular feminine of "H251";

270.long:
Meaning: to "seize" (often with the accessory idea of holding in possession).
Usage: be affrighted, bar, (catch, lay, take) hold (back), come upon, fasten, handle, portion, (get, have or take) possess(-ion).
Source: a primitive root;

271.long:
Meaning: "Achaz", the name of a Jewish king and of an Israelite.
Usage: Ahaz.
Source: from "H270"; "possessor";

272.long:
Meaning: something "seized", i.e. a "possession" (especially of land).
Usage: possession.
Source: feminine passive participle from "H270";

274.long:
Meaning: "Achazjah", the name of a Jewish and an Israelite king.
Usage: Ahaziah.
Source: or (prolonged) "אֲחַזְיָהוּ" ; from "H270" and "H3050"; Jah has seized;

276.long:
Meaning: "Achuzzath", a Philistine.
Usage: Ahuzzath.
Source: a variation of "H272"; "possession";

277.long:
Meaning: "Achi", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Ahi.
Source: from "H251"; brotherly;

278.long:
Meaning: "Echi", an Israelite.
Usage: Ehi.
Source: probably the same as "H277";

279.long:
Meaning: "Achiam", an Israelite.
Usage: Ahiam.
Source: from "H251" and "H517"; brother of the mother (i.e. uncle);

281.long:
Meaning: "Achijah", the name of nine Israelites.
Usage: Ahiah, Ahijah.
Source: or (prolonged) "אֲחִיָּהוּ" ; from "H251" and "H3050"; brother (i.e. worshipper) of Jah;

282.long:
Meaning: "Achihud", an Israelite.
Usage: Ahihud.
Source: from "H251" and "H1935"; brother (i.e. possessor) of renown;

283.long:
Meaning: "Achio", the name of three Israelites.
Usage: Ahio.
Source: prolonged from "H251"; brotherly;

284.long:
Meaning: "Achichud", an Israelite.
Usage: Ahihud.
Source: from "H251" and "H2330"; brother of a riddle (i.e. mysterious);

285.long:
Meaning: "Achitub", the name of several priests.
Usage: Ahitub.
Source: from "H251" and "H2898"; brother of goodness;

286.long:
Meaning: "Achilud", an Israelite.
Usage: Ahilud.
Source: from "H251" and "H3205"; brother of one born;

287.long:
Meaning: "Achimoth", an Israelite.
Usage: Ahimoth.
Source: from "H251" and "H4191"; brother of death;

288.long:
Meaning: "Achimelek", the name of an Israelite and of a Hittite.
Usage: Ahimelech.
Source: from "H251" and "H4428"; brother of (the) king;

289.long:
Meaning: "Achiman", the name of an Anakite and of an Israelite.
Usage: Ahiman.
Source: or "אֲחִימָן" ; from "H251" and "H4480"; brother of a portion (i.e. gift);

290.long:
Meaning: "Achimaats", the name of three Israelites.
Usage: Ahimaaz.
Source: from "H251" and the equivalent of "H4619"; brother of anger;

292.long:
Meaning: "Achinadab", an Israelite.
Usage: Ahinadab.
Source: from "H251" and "H5068"; brother of liberality;

293.long:
Meaning: "Achinoam", the name of two Israelitesses.
Usage: Ahinoam.
Source: from "H251" and "H5278"; brother of pleasantness;

294.long:
Meaning: "Achisamak", an Israelite.
Usage: Ahisamach.
Source: from "H251" and "H5564"; "brother of support";

295.long:
Meaning: "Achiezer", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Ahiezer.
Source: from "H251" and "H5828"; brother of help;

296.long:
Meaning: "Achikam", an Israelite.
Usage: Ahikam.
Source: from "H251" and "H6965"; brother of rising (i.e. high);

297.long:
Meaning: "Achiram", an Israelite.
Usage: Ahiram.
Source: from "H251" and "H7311"; brother of height (i.e. high);

298.long:
Meaning: an "Achiramite" or descendant (collectively) of Achiram.
Usage: Ahiramites.
Source: patronymic from "H297";

299.long:
Meaning: "Achira", an Israelite.
Usage: Ahira.
Source: from "H251" and "H7451"; brother of wrong;

300.long:
Meaning: "Achishachar", an Israelite.
Usage: Ahishar.
Source: from "H251" and "H7837"; brother of (the) dawn;

301.long:
Meaning: "Achishar", an Israelite.
Usage: Ahishar.
Source: from "H251" and "H7891"; brother of (the) singer;

302.long:
Meaning: "Achithophel", an Israelite.
Usage: Ahithophel.
Source: from "H251" and "H8602"; brother of folly;

303.long:
Meaning: "Achlab", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Ahlab.
Source: from the same root as "H2459"; fatness (i.e. fertile);

304.long:
Meaning: "Achlai", the name of an Israelitess and of an Israelite.
Usage: Ahlai.
Source: the same as "H305"; wishful;

305.long:
Meaning: "would that!".
Usage: O that, would God.
Source: or "אַחֲלֵי"; prob from "H253" and a variation of "H3863";

306.long:
Meaning: a gem, probably the "amethyst".
Usage: amethyst.
Source: perhaps from "H2492" (and thus "dream-stone");

307.long:
Meaning: "Achmetha" (i.e. Ecbatana), the summer capital of Persia.
Usage: Achmetha.
Source: of Persian derivation;

308.long:
Meaning: "Achasbai", an Israelite.
Usage: Ahasbai.
Source: of uncertain derivation;

309.long:
Meaning: to "loiter" (i.e. be behind); by implication to "procrastinate".
Usage: continue, defer, delay, hinder, be late (slack), stay (there), tarry (longer).
Source: a primitive root;

310.long:
Meaning: properly, "the hind part"; generally used as an adverb or conjunction, "after" (in various senses).
Usage: after (that, -ward), again, at, away from, back (from, -side), behind, beside, by, follow (after, -ing), forasmuch, from, hereafter, hinder end, + out (over) live, + persecute, posterity, pursuing, remnant, seeing, since, thence(-forth), when, with.
Source: from "H309";

312.long:
Meaning: properly, "hinder"; generally, "next", "other", etc.
Usage: (an-) other man, following, next, strange.
Source: from "H309";

313.long:
Meaning: "Acher", an Israelite.
Usage: Aher.
Source: the same as "H312";

314.long:
Meaning: "hinder"; generally, "late" or "last"; specifically (as facing the east) "western".
Usage: after (-ward), to come, following, hind(-er, -ermost, -most), last, latter, rereward, ut(ter) most.
Source: or (shortened) "אַחֲרֹן"; from "H309";

315.long:
Meaning: "Achrach", an Israelite.
Usage: Aharah.
Source: from "H310" and "H251"; after (his) brother;

316.long:
Meaning: "Acharchel", an Israelite.
Usage: Aharhel.
Source: from "H310" and "H2426"; behind (the) intrenchment (i.e. safe);

319.long:
Meaning: the "last" or "end", hence, the "future"; also "posterity".
Usage: (last, latter) end (time), hinder (utter) -most, length, posterity, remnant, residue, reward.
Source: from "H310";

323.long:
Meaning: a "satrap" or "governor" of a main province (of Persia).
Usage: lieutenant.
Source: of Persian derivation;

325.long:
Meaning: "Achashverosh" (i.e. Ahasuerus or Artaxerxes, but in this case Xerxes), the title (rather than name) of a Persian king.
Usage: Ahasuerus.
Source: or (shortened) "אַחַשְׁרֹשׁ" (Esther 10:1); of Persian origin;

326.long:
Meaning: an "achastarite" (i.e. courier); the designation (rather than name) of an Israelite.
Usage: Haakashtari (includ. the article).
Source: probably of Persian derivation;

328.long:
Meaning: (as a noun) a "necromancer" (from their soft incantations), (as an adverb) "gently".
Usage: charmer, gently, secret, softly.
Source: from an unused root perhaps meaning to move softly;

329.long:
Meaning: a "thorn-tree" (especially the buckthorn).
Usage: Atad, bramble, thorn.
Source: from an unused root probably meaning to pierce or make fast;

330.long:
Meaning: properly, "twisted" (yarn), i.e. "tapestry".
Usage: fine linen.
Source: from an unused root (probably meaning to bind);

331.long:
Meaning: to "close" (the lips or ears); by analology to "contract" (a window by bevelled jambs).
Usage: narrow, shut, stop.
Source: a primitive root;

332.long:
Meaning: to "close up".
Usage: shut.
Source: a primitive root;

333.long:
Meaning: "Ater", the name of three Israelites.
Usage: Ater.
Source: from "H332"; maimed;

334.long:
Meaning: "shut up", i.e. "impeded" (as to the use of the right hand).
Usage: left-handed.
Source: from "H332";

335.long:
Meaning: "where?" hence "how?".
Usage: how, what, whence, where, whether, which (way).
Source: perhaps from "H370";

336.long:
Meaning: "not".
Usage: island (Job 22:30).
Source: probably identical with "H335" (through the idea of a query);

338.long:
Meaning: a "howler" (used only in the plural), i.e. any solitary wild creature.
Usage: wild beast of the islands.
Source: probably identical with "H337" (through the idea of a "doleful" sound);

339.long:
Meaning: properly, a "habitable spot" (as desirable); "dry land", a "coast", an "island".
Usage: country, isle, island.
Source: from "H183";

340.long:
Meaning: "to hate" (as one of an opposite tribe or party); hence to be hostile.
Usage: be an enemy.
Source: a primitive root;

341.long:
Meaning: "hating"; an "adversary".
Usage: enemy, foe.
Source: or (fully) "אוֹיֵב"; active participle of "H340";

343.long:
Meaning: "oppression"; by implication "misfortune", "ruin".
Usage: calamity, destruction.
Source: from the same as "H181" (in the sense of bending down);

344.long:
Meaning: the "screamer", i.e. a "hawk".
Usage: kite, vulture.
Source: perhaps from "H337";

345.long:
Meaning: "Ajah", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Aiah, Ajah.
Source: the same as "H344";

347.long:
Meaning: "Ijob", the patriarch famous for his patience.
Usage: Job.
Source: from "H340"; hated (i.e. persecuted);

348.long:
Meaning: "Izebel", the wife of king Ahab.
Usage: Jezebel.
Source: from "H336" and "H2083";

349.long:
Meaning: "how?" or "how!"; also "where".
Usage: how, what.
Source: also "אֵיכָה" ; and "אֵיכָכָה" ; prolonged from "H335";

350.long:
Meaning: "Ikabod", a son of Phineas.
Usage: I-chabod.
Source: from "H336" and "H3519"; (there is) no glory, i.e. inglorious;

351.long:
Meaning: "where".
Usage: where.
Source: probably a variation for "H349", but not as an interogative;

352.long:
Meaning: properly, "strength"; hence, anything "strong"; specifically a "chief" (politically); also a "ram" (from his strength); a "pilaster" (as a strong support); an "oak" or other strong tree.
Usage: mighty (man), lintel, oak, post, ram, tree.
Source: from the same as "H193";

354.long:
Meaning: a "stag" or "male deer".
Usage: hart.
Source: an intensive form of "H352" (in the sense of ram);

355.long:
Meaning: a "doe" or "female deer".
Usage: hind.
Source: feminine of "H354";

356.long:
Meaning: "Elon", the name of a place in Palestine, and also of one Hittite, two Israelites.
Usage: Elon.
Source: or (shortened) "אֵלוֹן" ; or "אֵילֹן" ; from "H352"; oak-grove;

357.long:
Meaning: "Ajalon", the name of five places in Palestine.
Usage: Aijalon, Ajalon.
Source: from "H354"; deer-field;

358.long:
Meaning: "Elon of Beth-chanan", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Elon-bethhanan.
Source: from "H356", "H1004", and "H2603"; oak-grove of (the) house of favor;

359.long:
Meaning: "Eloth" or "Elath", a place on the Red Sea.
Usage: Elath, Eloth.
Source: or "אֵילַת" ; from "H352"; trees or a grove (i.e. palms);

361.long:
Meaning: a "pillar-space" (or colonnade), i.e. a "pale" (or portico).
Usage: arch.
Source: or (shortened) "אֵלָם" ; or (feminine) "אֵלַמָּה" ; probably from "H352";

362.long:
Meaning: "Elim", a place in the Desert.
Usage: Elim.
Source: plural of "H352"; palm-"trees";

364.long:
Meaning: "El-Paran", a portion of the district of Paran.
Usage: El-paran.
Source: from "H352" and "H6290"; "oak of Paran";

365.long:
Meaning: a "doe".
Usage: hind, Aijeleth.
Source: the same as "H355";

366.long:
Meaning: "frightful".
Usage: terrible.
Source: from an unused root (meaning to frighten);

367.long:
Meaning: "fright"; concrete, an "idol" (as a bugbear).
Usage: dread, fear, horror, idol, terrible, terror.
Source: or (shortened) "אֵמָה"; from the same as "H366";

368.long:
Meaning: "Emim", an early Canaanitish (or Maobitish) tribe.
Usage: Emims.
Source: plural of "H367"; "terrors";

369.long:
Meaning: a "nonentity"; generally used as a negative particle.
Usage: else, except, fail, (father-) less, be gone, in(-curable), neither, never, no (where), none, nor, (any, thing), not, nothing, to nought, past, un(-searchable), well-nigh, without. Compare "H370".
Source: as if from a primitive root meaning to "be nothing" or "not exist";

370.long:
Meaning: "where?" (only in connection with prepositional prefix, whence).
Usage: whence, where.
Source: probably identical with "H369" in the sense of query (compare "H336")

371.long:
Meaning: "is it not?".
Usage: not.
Source: apparently a shortened form of "H369"; but (like "H370") an interrogative;

372.long:
Meaning: "Iezer", an Israelite.
Usage: Jeezer.
Source: from "H336" and "H5828"; helpless;

373.long:
Meaning: "an Iezrite" or descendant of Iezer.
Usage: Jezerite.
Source: patronymic from "H372";

374.long:
Meaning: an "ephah" or measure for grain; hence, a "measure" in general.
Usage: ephah, (divers) measure(-s).
Source: or (shortened) "אֵפָה" ; of Egyptian derivation;

375.long:
Meaning: "what place?"; also (of time) "when?"; or (of means) "how?".
Usage: what manner, where.
Source: from "H335" and "H6311";

376.long:
Meaning: a "man" as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation).
Usage: also, another, any (man), a certain, champion, consent, each, every (one), fellow, (foot-, husband-) man, (good-, great, mighty) man, he, high (degree), him (that is), husband, man(-kind), none, one, people, person, steward, what (man) soever, whoso(-ever), worthy. Compare "H802".
Source: contracted for "H582" (or perhaps rather from an unused root meaning to "be extant");

377.long:
Meaning: to "be a man", i.e. act in a manly way.
Usage: show (one) self a man.
Source: denominative from "H376";

378.long:
Meaning: "Ish-Bosheth", a son of King Saul.
Usage: Ish-bosheth.
Source: from "H376" and "H1322"; man of shame;

379.long:
Meaning: "Ishod", an Israelite.
Usage: Ishod.
Source: from "H376" and "H1935"; man of renown;

380.long:
Meaning: the "little man" of the eye; the "pupil" or "ball"; hence, the "middle" (of night).
Usage: apple (of the eye), black, obscure.
Source: diminutive from "H376";

381.long:
Meaning: "Ishchail" (or Ish-chai), an Israelite.
Usage: a valiant man.
Source: from "H376" and "H2428"; man of might; by defective transcription (2 Samuel 23:20) "אִישׁ־חַי"; as if from "H376" and "H2416"; living man;

382.long:
Meaning: "Ish-Tob", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Ish-tob.
Source: from "H376" and "H2897"; man of Tob;

383.long:
Meaning: properly, "entity"; used only as a "particle of affirmation", "there is".
Usage: art thou, can, do ye, have, it be, there is (are), × we will not.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H3426";

384.long:
Meaning: "Ithiel", the name of an Israelite, also of a symbolical person.
Usage: Ithiel.
Source: perhaps from "H837" and "H410"; God has arrived;

385.long:
Meaning: "Ithamar", a son of Aaron.
Usage: Ithamar.
Source: from "H339" and "H8558"; coast of the palm-tree;

386.long:
Meaning: "permanence"; hence (concrete) "permanent"; specifically a "chieftain".
Usage: hard, mighty, rough, strength, strong.
Source: or (shortened) "אֵתָן" ; from an unused root (meaning to "continue");

387.long:
Meaning: "Ethan", the name of four Israelites.
Usage: Ethan.
Source: the same as "H386"; "permanent";

388.long:
Meaning: "Ethanim", the name of a month.
Usage: Ethanim.
Source: plural of "H386"; always with the article; the permanent brooks;

389.long:
Meaning: a particle of "affirmation", "surely"; hence (by limitation) "only".
Usage: also, in any wise, at least, but, certainly, even, howbeit, nevertheless, notwithstanding, only, save, surely, of a surety, truly, verily, wherefore, yet (but).
Source: akin to "H403";

390.long:
Meaning: "Accad", a place in Babylon.
Usage: Accad.
Source: from an unused root probably meaning to strengthen; a fortress;

392.long:
Meaning: "Akzib", the name of two places in Palestine.
Usage: Achzib.
Source: from "H391"; "deceitful" (in the sense of a winter-torrent which fails in summer);

393.long:
Meaning: "violent"; by implication "deadly"; also (in a good sense) "brave".
Usage: cruel, fierce.
Source: from an unused root (apparently meaning to act harshly);

397.long:
Meaning: "Akish", a Philistine king.
Usage: Achish.
Source: of uncertain derivation;

398.long:
Meaning: to "eat" (literally or figuratively).
Usage: × at all, burn up, consume, devour(-er, up), dine, eat(-er, up), feed (with), food, × freely, × in...wise(-deed, plenty), (lay) meat, × quite.
Source: a primitive root;

400.long:
Meaning: "food".
Usage: eating, food, meal(-time), meat, prey, victuals.
Source: from "H398";

401.long:
Meaning: "Ucal", a fancy name.
Usage: Ucal.
Source: or "אֻכָּל"; apparently from "H398"; "devoured";

402.long:
Meaning: "food".
Usage: consume, devour, eat, food, meat.
Source: feminine of "H401";

403.long:
Meaning: "firmly"; figuratively, "surely"; also (adversative) "but".
Usage: but, certainly, nevertheless, surely, truly, verily.
Source: from "H3559" (compare "H3651");

404.long:
Meaning: to "urge".
Usage: crave.
Source: a primitive root; apparently meaning to curve (as with a burden);

405.long:
Meaning: a "load"; by implication, a "stroke" (others dignity).
Usage: hand.
Source: from "H404";

406.long:
Meaning: a "farmer".
Usage: husbandman, ploughman.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "dig";

407.long:
Meaning: "Acshaph", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Achshaph.
Source: from "H3784"; fascination;

408.long:
Meaning: "not" (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, "nothing".
Usage: nay, neither, + never, no, nor, not, nothing (worth), rather than.
Source: a negative particle (akin to "H3808");

410.long:
Meaning: "strength"; as adjective, "mighty"; especially the "Almighty" (but used also of any "deity").
Usage: God (god), × goodly, × great, idol, might(-y one), power, strong. Compare names in '-el.'.
Source: shortened from "H352";

411.long:
Meaning: "these" or "those".
Usage: these, those. Compare "H428".
Source: a demonstrative particle (but only in a plural sense)

413.long:
