Meaning: "near", "with" or "among"; often in general, "to".
Usage: about, according to, after, against, among, as for, at, because(-fore, -side), both...and, by, concerning, for, from, × hath, in(-to), near, (out) of, over, through, to(-ward), under, unto, upon, whether, with(-in).
Source: (but only used in the shortened constructive form "אֶל" ); a primitive particle; properly, denoting motion "towards", but occasionally used of a quiescent position, i.e.

414.long:
Meaning: "Ela", an Israelite.
Usage: Elah.
Source: a variation of "H424"; oak;

415.long:
Meaning: "El-Elohi-Jisrael", the title given to a consecrated spot by Jacob.
Usage: Elelohe-israel.
Source: from "H410" and "H430" and "H3478"; the mighty god if Jisrael;

416.long:
Meaning: "El-Bethel", the title given to a consecrated spot by Jacob.
Usage: El-beth-el.
Source: from "H410" and "H1008"; the God of Bethel;

417.long:
Meaning: "hail" (as if a great pearl).
Usage: great hail(-stones).
Source: from "H410" and "H1378";

418.long:
Meaning: "sticks of algum wood".
Usage: algum (trees).
Source: by transposition for "H484";

419.long:
Meaning: "Eldad", an Israelite.
Usage: Eldad.
Source: from "H410" and "H1730"; God has loved;

420.long:
Meaning: "Eldaah", a son of Midian.
Usage: Eldaah.
Source: from "H410" and "H3045"; "God of knowledge";

421.long:
Meaning: to "bewail".
Usage: lament.
Source: a primitive root (rather identical with "H422" through the idea of invocation);

422.long:
Meaning: properly, to "adjure", i.e. (usually in a bad sense) "imprecate".
Usage: adjure, curse, swear.
Source: a primitive root;

423.long:
Meaning: an "imprecation".
Usage: curse, cursing, execration, oath, swearing.
Source: from "H422";

424.long:
Meaning: an "oak" or other strong tree.
Usage: elm, oak, teil-tree.
Source: feminine of "H352";

425.long:
Meaning: "Elah", the name of an Edomite, of four Israelites, and also of a place in Palestine.
Usage: Elah.
Source: the same as "H424";

428.long:
Meaning: "these" or "those".
Usage: an-(the) other; one sort, so, some, such, them, these (same), they, this, those, thus, which, who(-m).
Source: prolonged from "H411";

430.long:
Meaning: "gods" in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme "God"; occasionally applied by way of deference to "magistrates"; and sometimes as a superlative.
Usage: angels, × exceeding, God (gods) (-dess, -ly), × (very) great, judges, × mighty.
Source: plural of "H433";

432.long:
Meaning: "nay", i.e. (softened) "if".
Usage: but if, yea though.
Source: probably from "H408";

433.long:
Meaning: a "deity" or the "Deity".
Usage: God, god. See "H430".
Source: rarely (shortened) "אֱלֹהַּ"; probably prolonged (emphatic) from "H410";

434.long:
Meaning: "good for nothing".
Usage: thing of nought.
Source: for "H457";

435.long:
Meaning: "Elul", the sixth Jewish month.
Usage: Elul.
Source: probably of foreign derivation;

436.long:
Meaning: an "oak" or other strong tree.
Usage: plain. See also "H356".
Source: prolonged from "H352";

438.long:
Meaning: "Allon", an Israelite, also a place in Palestine.
Usage: Allon.
Source: the same as "H437";

439.long:
Meaning: "Allon-Bakuth", a monumental tree.
Usage: Allon-bachuth.
Source: from "H437" and a variation of "H1068"; oak of weeping;

440.long:
Meaning: an "Elonite" or descendant (collectively) of Elon.
Usage: Elonites.
Source: or rather (shortened) "אֵלֹנִי"; patron from "H438";

441.long:
Meaning: "familiar"; a "friend", also "gentle"; hence, a "bullock" (as being tame; applied, although masculine, to a "cow"); and so, a "chieftain" (as notable, like neat cattle).
Usage: captain, duke, (chief) friend, governor, guide, ox.
Source: or (shortened) "אַלֻּף"; from "H502";

442.long:
Meaning: "Alush", a place in the Desert.
Usage: Alush.
Source: of uncertain derivation;

443.long:
Meaning: "Elzabad", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Elzabad.
Source: from "H410" and "H2064"; God has bestowed;

444.long:
Meaning: to "muddle", i.e. (figuratively and intransitive) to "turn" (morally) "corrupt".
Usage: become filthy.
Source: a primitive root;

445.long:
Meaning: "Elchanan", an Israelite.
Usage: Elkanan.
Source: from "H410" and "H2603"; God (is) gracious;

446.long:
Meaning: "Eliab", the name of six Israelites.
Usage: Eliab.
Source: from "H410" and "H1"; God of (his) father;

447.long:
Meaning: "Eliel", the name of nine Israelites.
Usage: Eliel.
Source: from "H410" repeated; God of (his) God;

448.long:
Meaning: "Eliathah", an Israelite.
Usage: Eliathah.
Source: or (contraction) "אֱלִיָּתָה"; from "H410" and "H225"; God of (his) consent;

449.long:
Meaning: "Elidad", an Israelite.
Usage: Elidad.
Source: from the same as "H419"; God of (his) love;

450.long:
Meaning: "Eljada", the name of two Israelites and of an Aramaean leader.
Usage: Eliada.
Source: from "H410" and "H3045"; God (is) knowing;

451.long:
Meaning: the "stout" part, i.e. the fat "tail" of the Oriental sheep.
Usage: rump.
Source: from "H422" (in the original sense of "strength");

452.long:
Meaning: "Elijah", the name of the famous prophet and of two other Israelites.
Usage: Elijah, Eliah.
Source: or prolonged "אֵלִיָּהוּ"; from "H410" and "H3050"; God of Jehovah;

453.long:
Meaning: "Elihu", the name of one of Job's friends, and of three Israelites.
Usage: Elihu.
Source: or (fully) "אֱלִיהוּא"; from "H410" and "H1931"; God of him;

454.long:
Meaning: "Eljehoenai" or "Eljoenai", the name of seven Israelites.
Usage: Elihoenai, Elionai.
Source: or (shortened) "אֶלְיוֹעֵינַי"; from "H413" and "H3068" and "H5869"; towards Jehovah (are) my eyes;

455.long:
Meaning: "Eljachba", an Israelite.
Usage: Eliahbah.
Source: from "H410" and "H2244"; God will hide;

456.long:
Meaning: "Elichoreph", an Israelite.
Usage: Elihoreph.
Source: from "H410" and "H2779"; God of autumn;

457.long:
Meaning: good for "nothing", by analogy "vain" or "vanity"; specifically an "idol".
Usage: idol, no value, thing of nought.
Source: apparently from "H408";

458.long:
Meaning: "Elimelek", an Israelite.
Usage: Elimelech.
Source: from "H410" and "H4428"; "God of" (the) "king";

459.long:
Meaning: "these".
Usage: the, these.
Source: (Aramaic) or shorter "אִלֵּן"; prolonged from "H412";

460.long:
Meaning: "Eljasaph", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Eliasaph.
Source: from "H410" and "H3254"; God (is) gatherer;

461.long:
Meaning: "Eliezer", the name of a Damascene and of ten Israelites.
Usage: Eliezer.
Source: from "H410" and "H5828"; "God of help";

462.long:
Meaning: "Elienai", an Israelite.
Usage: Elienai.
Source: probably contracted for "H454";

463.long:
Meaning: "Eliam", an Israelite.
Usage: Eliam.
Source: from "H410" and "H5971"; God of (the) people;

464.long:
Meaning: "Eliphaz", the name of one of Job's friends, and of a son of Esau.
Usage: Eliphaz.
Source: from "H410" and "H6337"; "God of gold";

465.long:
Meaning: "Eliphal", an Israelite.
Usage: Eliphal.
Source: from "H410" and "H6419"; God of judgment;

466.long:
Meaning: "Eliphelehu", an Israelite.
Usage: Elipheleh.
Source: from "H410" and "H6395"; God of his distinction;

467.long:
Meaning: "Eliphelet" or "Elpelet", the name of six Israelites.
Usage: Eliphalet, Eliphelet, Elpalet.
Source: or (shortened) "אֱלְפֶּלֶט"; from "H410" and "H6405"; God of deliverance;

468.long:
Meaning: "Elitsur", an Israelite.
Usage: Elizur.
Source: from "H410" and "H6697"; God of (the) rock;

469.long:
Meaning: "Elitsaphan" or "Eltsaphan", an Israelite.
Usage: Elizaphan, Elzaphan.
Source: or (shortened) "אֶלְצָפָן"; from "H410" and "H6845"; God of treasure;

470.long:
Meaning: "Elika", an Israelite.
Usage: Elika.
Source: from "H410" and "H6958"; God of rejection;

471.long:
Meaning: "Eljakim", the name of four Israelites.
Usage: Eliakim.
Source: from "H410" and "H6965"; "God of raising";

472.long:
Meaning: "Elisheba", the wife of Aaron.
Usage: Elisheba.
Source: from "H410" and "H7651" (in the sense of "H7650"); God of (the) oath;

473.long:
Meaning: "Elishah", a son of Javan.
Usage: Elishah.
Source: probably of foreign derivation;

474.long:
Meaning: "Elishua", the son of King David.
Usage: Elishua.
Source: from "H410" and "H7769"; God of supplication (or of riches);

475.long:
Meaning: "Eljashib", the name of six Israelites.
Usage: Eliashib.
Source: from "H410" and "H7725"; God will restore;

476.long:
Meaning: "Elishama", the name of seven Israelites.
Usage: Elishama.
Source: from "H410" and "H8085"; God of hearing;

477.long:
Meaning: "Elisha", the famous prophet.
Usage: Elisha.
Source: contracted for "H474".;

478.long:
Meaning: "Elishaphat", an Israelite.
Usage: Elishaphat.
Source: from "H410" and "H8199"; God of judgment;

481.long:
Meaning: to "tie" fast; hence (of the mouth) to be "tongue-tied".
Usage: bind, be dumb, put to silence.
Source: a primitive root;

484.long:
Meaning: "almug" (i.e. probably sandle-wood) "sticks".
Usage: almug trees. Compare "H418".
Source: probably of foreign derivation (used thus only in the plural);

485.long:
Meaning: something "bound"; a "sheaf".
Usage: sheaf.
Source: or (masculine) "אָלֻם"; passive participle of "H481";

486.long:
Meaning: "Almodad", a son of Joktan.
Usage: Almodad.
Source: probably of foreign derivation

487.long:
Meaning: "Allammelek", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Alammelech.
Source: from "H427" and "H4428"; oak of (the) king;

488.long:
Meaning: "discarded" (as a divorced person).
Usage: forsaken.
Source: prolonged from "H481" in the sense of bereavement;

490.long:
Meaning: a "widow"; also a "desolate place".
Usage: desolate house (palace), widow.
Source: feminine of "H488";

491.long:
Meaning: concrete, a "widow"; abstract, "widowhood".
Usage: widow, widowhood.
Source: feminine of "H488";

492.long:
Meaning: "some" one (i.e. "so and so", without giving the name of the person or place).
Usage: one, and such.
Source: from "H489" in the sense of "concealment";

493.long:
Meaning: "Elnaam", an Israelite.
Usage: Elnaam.
Source: from "H410" and "H5276"; God (is his) delight;

494.long:
Meaning: "Elnathan", the name of four Israelites.
Usage: Elnathan.
Source: from "H410" and "H5414"; God (is the) giver;

495.long:
Meaning: "Ellasar", an early country of Asia.
Usage: Ellasar.
Source: probably of foreign derivation;

496.long:
Meaning: "Elad", an Israelite.
Usage: Elead.
Source: from "H410" and "H5749"; God has testified;

497.long:
Meaning: "Eladah", an Israelite.
Usage: Eladah.
Source: from "H410" and "H5710"; God has decked;

498.long:
Meaning: "Eluzai", an Israelite.
Usage: Eluzai.
Source: from "H410" and "H5756" (in the sense of "H5797"); God (is) defensive;

499.long:
Meaning: "Elazar", the name of seven Israelites.
Usage: Eleazar.
Source: from "H410" and "H5826"; God (is) helper;

500.long:
Meaning: "Elale" or "Elaleh", a place east of the Jordan.
Usage: Elealeh.
Source: or (more properly) "אֶלְעָלֵה"; from "H410" and "H5927"; "God" (is) "going up";

501.long:
Meaning: "Elasah", the name of four Israelites.
Usage: Elasah, Eleasah.
Source: from "H410" and "H6213"; God has made;

502.long:
Meaning: hence, to "learn" (and causatively to "teach").
Usage: learn, teach, utter.
Source: a primitive root, to associate with;

503.long:
Meaning: causative, to "make a thousandfold".
Usage: bring forth thousands.
Source: denominative from "H505";

504.long:
Meaning: a "family"; also (from the sense of yoking or taming) an "ox" or "cow".
Usage: family, kine, oxen.
Source: from "H502";

505.long:
Meaning: hence (the ox's head being the first letter of the alphabet, and this eventually used as a numeral) a "thousand".
Usage: thousand.
Source: prop, the same as "H504";

507.long:
Meaning: "Eleph", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Eleph.
Source: the same as "H505";

508.long:
Meaning: "Elpaal", an Israelite.
Usage: Elpaal.
Source: from "H410" and "H6466"; God (is) act;

510.long:
Meaning: a "non-rising" (i.e. resistlessness).
Usage: no rising up.
Source: probably from "H408" and "H6965";

511.long:
Meaning: "Elkanah", the name of several Israelites.
Usage: Elkanah.
Source: from "H410" and "H7069"; God has obtained;

512.long:
Meaning: an "Elkoshite" or native of Elkosh.
Usage: Elkoshite.
Source: patrial from a name of uncertain derivation;

513.long:
Meaning: "Eltolad", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Eltolad.
Source: probably from "H410" and a masculine form of "H8435" (compare "H8434"); God (is) generator;

514.long:
Meaning: "Eltekeh" or "Elteke", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Eltekeh.
Source: or (more properly) "אֶלְתְּקֵה"; of uncertain derivation;

515.long:
Meaning: "Eltekon", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Eltekon.
Source: from "H410" and "H8626"; God (is) straight;

516.long:
Meaning: "'Thou must not destroy'"; probably the opening words to a popular song.
Usage: Al-taschith.
Source: from "H408" and "H7843";

517.long:
Meaning: a "mother" (as the bond of the family); in a wide sense (both literally and figuratively [like father]).
Usage: dam, mother, × parting.
Source: a primitive word;

518.long:
Meaning: used very widely as demonstrative, "lo!"; interrogative, "whether?"; or conditional, "if", "although"; also "Oh that!", "when"; hence, as a negative, "not".
Usage: (and, can-, doubtless, if, that) (not), + but, either, + except, + more(-over if, than), neither, nevertheless, nor, oh that, or, + save (only, -ing), seeing, since, sith, + surely (no more, none, not), though, + of a truth, + unless, + verily, when, whereas, whether, while, + yet.
Source: a primitive particle;

519.long:
Meaning: a "maid-servant" or female slave.
Usage: (hand-) bondmaid(-woman), maid(-servant).
Source: apparently a primitive word;

520.long:
Meaning: properly, "a mother" (i.e. unit of measure, or the fore-arm (below the elbow), i.e. "a cubit"; also "a door-base" (as a bond of the entrance).
Usage: cubit, + hundred (by exchange for "H3967"), measure, post.
Source: prolonged from "H517";

522.long:
Meaning: "Ammah", a hill in Palestine.
Usage: Ammah.
Source: the same as "H520";

523.long:
Meaning: a "collection", i.e. "community" of persons.
Usage: nation, people.
Source: from the same as "H517";

525.long:
Meaning: "skilled", i.e. "an architect".
Usage: one brought up.
Source: from "H539", probably in the sense of training; like "H542"

526.long:
Meaning: "Amon", the name of three Israelites.
Usage: Amon.
Source: the same as "H525";

527.long:
Meaning: "a throng of people".
Usage: multitude.
Source: a variation for "H1995";

528.long:
Meaning: "Amon" (i.e. Ammon or Amn), a deity of Egypt.
Usage: multitude, populous.
Source: of Egyptian derivation; used only as an adjunct of "H4996"

530.long:
Meaning: literally "firmness"; figuratively "security"; morally "fidelity".
Usage: faith(-ful, -ly, -ness, (man)), set office, stability, steady, truly, truth, verily.
Source: or (shortened) "אֱמֻנָה"; feminine of "H529";

532.long:
Meaning: "Ami", an Israelite.
Usage: Ami.
Source: an abbreviated form for "H526";

533.long:
Meaning: "strong" or (abstractly) "strength".
Usage: courageous, mighty, strong (one).
Source: or (shortened) "אַמִּץ"; from "H553";

534.long:
Meaning: a "summit" (of a tree or mountain).
Usage: bough, branch.
Source: apparently from "H559" (in the sense of "self-exaltation");

535.long:
Meaning: to "droop"; by implication to "be sick", to "mourn".
Usage: languish, be weak, wax feeble.
Source: a primitive root;

538.long:
Meaning: "Amam", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Amam.
Source: from "H517"; gathering-spot;

539.long:
Meaning: properly, to "build up" or "support"; to "foster" as a parent or nurse; figuratively to "render" (or "be") "firm" or faithful, to "trust" or believe, to be "permanent" or quiet; morally to "be true" or certain.
Usage: hence, assurance, believe, bring up, establish, fail, be faithful (of long continuance, stedfast, sure, surely, trusty, verified), nurse, (-ing father), (put), trust, turn to the right.
Source: a primitive root; (Isaiah 30:21; interchangeable with "H541", to "go to the right hand")

541.long:
Meaning: to take the "right hand" road.
Usage: turn to the right. See "H539".
Source: denominative from "H3225";

542.long:
Meaning: an "expert".
Usage: cunning workman.
Source: from "H539" (in the sense of training);

543.long:
Meaning: "sure"; abstract, "faithfulness"; adverb, "truly".
Usage: Amen, so be it, truth.
Source: from "H539";

545.long:
Meaning: "tutelage".
Usage: brought up.
Source: feminine of "H544" (in the specific sense of training);

546.long:
Meaning: adverb, "surely".
Usage: indeed.
Source: feminine form of "H544" (in its usual sense);

547.long:
Meaning: "a column".
Usage: pillar.
Source: feminine active participle of "H544" (in the original sense of supporting);

548.long:
Meaning: something "fixed", i.e. a "covenant". an "allowance".
Usage: certain portion, sure.
Source: feminine of "H543";

549.long:
Meaning: "Amanah", a mountain near Damascus.
Usage: Amana.
Source: the same as "H548";

550.long:
Meaning: "Amnon" (or Aminon), a son of David.
Usage: Amnon.
Source: or "אֲמִינוֹן"; from "H539"; faithful;

551.long:
Meaning: "verily".
Usage: indeed, no doubt, surely, (it is, of a) true(-ly, -th).
Source: adverb from "H544";

552.long:
Usage: in (very) deed; of a surety.
Source: an orthographical variation of "H551"

553.long:
Meaning: to "be alert", physically (on foot) or mentally (in courage).
Usage: confirm, be courageous (of good courage, stedfastly minded, strong, stronger), establish, fortify, harden, increase, prevail, strengthen (self), make strong (obstinate, speed).
Source: a primitive root;

554.long:
Meaning: of a "strong" color, i.e. "red" (others fleet).
Usage: bay.
Source: probably from "H553";

558.long:
Meaning: "Amatsjah", the name of four Israelites.
Usage: Amaziah.
Source: or "אֲמַצְיָהוּ"; from "H553" and "H3050"; strength of Jah;

559.long:
Meaning: to "say" (used with great latitude).
Usage: answer, appoint, avouch, bid, boast self, call, certify, challenge, charge, (at the, give) command(-ment), commune, consider, declare, demand, × desire, determine, × expressly, × indeed, × intend, name, × plainly, promise, publish, report, require, say, speak (against, of), × still, × suppose, talk, tell, term, × that is, × think, use (speech), utter, × verily, × yet.
Source: a primitive root;

560.long:
Usage: command, declare, say, speak, tell.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H559"

561.long:
Meaning: "something said".
Usage: answer, × appointed unto him, saying, speech, word.
Source: from "H559";

562.long:
Usage: promise, speech, thing, word.
Source: the same as "H561"

563.long:
Meaning: a "lamb".
Usage: lamb.
Source: (Aramaic) perhaps from "H560" (in the sense of bringing forth);

564.long:
Meaning: "Immer", the name of five Israelites.
Usage: Immer.
Source: from "H559"; talkative;

565.long:
Usage: commandment, speech, word.
Source: or "אֶמְרָה"; feminine of "H561", and meaning the same

566.long:
Meaning: "Imri", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Imri.
Source: from "H564";

567.long:
Meaning: an "Emorite", one of the Canaanitish tribes.
Usage: Amorite.
Source: probably a patronymic from an unused name derived from "H559" in the sense of "publicity", i.e. prominence; thus, a "mountaineer";

568.long:
Meaning: "Amarjah", the name of nine Israelites.
Usage: Amariah.
Source: or prolonged "אֲמַרְיָהוּ"; from "H559" and "H3050"; Jah has said (i.e. promised);

569.long:
Meaning: "Amraphel", a king of Shinar.
Usage: Amraphel.
Source: of uncertain (perhaps foreign) derivation;

570.long:
Meaning: "yesterday" or "last night".
Usage: former time, yesterday(-night).
Source: time past, i.e.

571.long:
Meaning: "stability"; (figuratively) "certainty", "truth", "trustworthiness".
Usage: assured(-ly), establishment, faithful, right, sure, true (-ly, -th), verity.
Source: contracted from "H539";

572.long:
Meaning: properly, something "expansive", i.e. a "bag".
Usage: sack.
Source: from "H4969";

574.long:
Meaning: "well-loined" (i.e. burly) or "mighty".
Usage: terrible.
Source: (Aramaic) from a root corresponding to that of "H4975";

575.long:
Meaning: "where?"; hence, "whither?", "when?"; also "hither" and "thither".
Usage: any (no) whither, now, where, whither(-soever).
Source: or "אָנָה"; contracted from "H370";

576.long:
Meaning: "I".
Usage: I, as for me.
Source: (Aramaic) or "אֲנָה"; (Aramaic), corresponding to "H589";

577.long:
Meaning: "oh now!".
Usage: I (me) beseech (pray) thee, O.
Source: or "אָנָּה"; apparent contracted from "H160" and "H4994";

578.long:
Meaning: to "groan".
Usage: lament, mourn.
Source: a primitive root;

579.long:
Meaning: to "approach"; hence, to "meet" in various senses.
Usage: befall, deliver, happen, seek a quarrel.
Source: a primitive root (perhaps rather identical with "H578" through the idea of "contraction" in anguish);

581.long:
Meaning: "they".
Usage: × are, them, these.
Source: (Aramaic) or (feminine) "אִנִּין"; (Aramaic), corresponding to "H1992";

582.long:
Meaning: properly, a "mortal" (and thus differing from the more dignified "H120"); hence, a "man" in general (singly or collectively).
Usage: another, × (blood-) thirsty, certain, chap(-man); divers, fellow, × in the flower of their age, husband, (certain, mortal) man, people, person, servant, some (× of them), stranger, those, their trade. It is often unexpressed in the English versions, especially when used in apposition with another word. Compare "H376".
Source: from "H605";

583.long:
Meaning: "Enosh", a son of Seth.
Usage: Enos.
Source: the same as "H582";

584.long:
Meaning: to "sigh".
Usage: groan, mourn, sigh.
Source: a primitive root;

588.long:
Meaning: "Anacharath", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Anaharath.
Source: probably from the same root as "H5170"; a gorge or narrow pass;

589.long:
Meaning: "I".
Usage: I, (as for) me, mine, myself, we, × which, × who.
Source: contracted from "H595";

590.long:
Meaning: a "ship" or (collectively) a "fleet".
Usage: galley, navy (of ships).
Source: probably from "H579" (in the sense of "conveyance");

593.long:
Meaning: "Aniam", an Israelite.
Usage: Aniam.
Source: from "H578" and "H5971"; groaning of (the) people;

594.long:
Meaning: according to most a "plumb-line", and to others a "hook".
Usage: plumb-line.
Source: probably from an unused root meaning to be narrow;

595.long:
Meaning: "I".
Usage: I, me, × which.
Source: sometimes, "אָנֹכִי"; a primitive pronoun;

596.long:
Meaning: to "mourn", i.e. "complain".
Usage: complain.
Source: a primitive root;

599.long:
Meaning: to "breathe" hard, i.e. "be enraged".
Usage: be angry (displeased).
Source: a primitive root;

600.long:
Meaning: the "face".
Usage: face, visage.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H639" (only in the plural as a singular);

601.long:
Meaning: an "unclean bird", perhaps the "parrot" (from its irascibility).
Usage: heron.
Source: from "H599";

602.long:
Meaning: to "shriek".
Usage: cry, groan.
Source: a primitive root;

604.long:
Meaning: some kind of "lizard", probably the "gecko" (from its wail).
Usage: ferret.
Source: the same as "H603";

605.long:
Meaning: to "be frail", "feeble", or (figuratively) "melancholy".
Usage: desperate(-ly wicked), incurable, sick, woeful.
Source: a primitive root;

606.long:
Meaning: a "man".
Usage: man, whosoever.
Source: (Aramaic) or "אֱנַשׁ"; (Aramaic), corresponding to "H582";

607.long:
Meaning: "thou".
Usage: as for thee, thou.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H859";

609.long:
Meaning: "Asa", the name of a king and of a Levite.
Usage: Asa.
Source: of uncertain derivation;

612.long:
Meaning: a "bond" (especially manacles of a prisoner).
Usage: band, prison.
Source: from "H631";

614.long:
Meaning: "gathered", i.e. (abstractly) a "gathering in of crops".
Usage: ingathering.
Source: or "אָסִף"; from "H622";

615.long:
Meaning: "bound", i.e. a "captive".
Usage: (those which are) bound, prisoner.
Source: from "H631";

617.long:
Meaning: "Assir", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Assir.
Source: the same as "H616"; prisoner;

618.long:
Meaning: a "storehouse" (only in the plural).
Usage: barn, storehouse.
Source: from an unused root meaning to heap together;

619.long:
Meaning: "Asnah", one of the Nethinim.
Usage: Asnah.
Source: of uncertain derivation;

620.long:
Meaning: "Osnappar", an Assyrian king.
Usage: Asnapper.
Source: of foreign derivation;

621.long:
Meaning: "Asenath", the wife of Joseph.
Usage: Asenath.
Source: of Egyptian derivation;

622.long:
Meaning: to "gather" for any purpose; hence, to "receive", "take away", i.e. "remove" (destroy, leave behind, put up, restore, etc.).
Usage: assemble, bring, consume, destroy, felch, gather (in, together, up again), × generally, get (him), lose, put all together, receive, recover (another from leprosy), (be) rereward, × surely, take (away, into, up), × utterly, withdraw.
Source: a primitive root;

623.long:
Meaning: "Asaph", the name of three Israelites, and of the family of the first.
Usage: Asaph.
Source: from "H622"; "collector";

624.long:
Meaning: "collected" (only in the plural), i.e. a "collection of offerings".
Usage: threshold, Asuppim.
Source: passive participle of "H622";

626.long:
Meaning: a "collection" of people (only adverbial).
Usage: × together.
Source: from "H622";

627.long:
Meaning: a "collection of" (learned) "men" (only in the plural).
Usage: assembly.
Source: feminine of "H624";

628.long:
Meaning: "gathered up together", i.e. a "promiscuous assemblage" (of people).
Usage: mixt multitude.
Source: by reduplication from "H624";

629.long:
Meaning: "diligently".
Usage: fast, forthwith, speed(-ily).
Source: (Aramaic) of Persian derivation;

630.long:
Meaning: "Aspatha", a son of Haman.
Usage: Aspatha.
Source: of Persian derivation;

631.long:
Meaning: to "yoke" or "hitch"; by analogy, to "fasten" in any sense, to "join" battle.
Usage: bind, fast, gird, harness, hold, keep, make ready, order, prepare, prison(-er), put in bonds, set in array, tie.
Source: a primitive root;

632.long:
Meaning: an "obligation" or "vow" (of abstinence).
Usage: binding, bond.
Source: or "אִסָּר"; from "H631";

633.long:
Meaning: an "interdict".
Usage: decree.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H632" in a legal sense;

634.long:
Meaning: "Esarchaddon", an Assyrian king.
Usage: Esar-haddon.
Source: of foreign derivation;

635.long:
Meaning: "Ester", the Jewish heroine.
Usage: Esther.
Source: of Persian derivation;

636.long:
Meaning: a "tree" or "wood".
Usage: timber, wood.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H6086";

637.long:
Meaning: meaning "accession" (used as an adverb or conjunction); also or "yea"; adversatively "though".
Usage: also, + although, and (furthermore, yet), but, even, + how much less (more, rather than), moreover, with, yea.
Source: a primitive particle;

639.long:
Meaning: properly, the "nose" or "nostril"; hence, the "face", and occasionally a "person"; also (from the rapid breathing in passion) "ire".
Usage: anger(-gry), before, countenance, face, forebearing, forehead, (long-) suffering, nose, nostril, snout, × worthy, wrath.
Source: from "H599";

640.long:
Meaning: to "gird" on (the ephod).
Usage: bind, gird.
Source: a primitive root [rather a denominative from "H646"];

641.long:
Meaning: "Ephod", an Israelite.
Usage: Ephod.
Source: the same as "H646" shortened;

642.long:
Meaning: a "girding" on (of the ephod); hence, generally, a "plating" (of metal).
Usage: ephod, ornament.
Source: feminine of "H646";

643.long:
Meaning: a "pavilion" or "palace-tent".
Usage: palace.
Source: apparently of foreign derivation;

644.long:
Meaning: to "cook", especially to "bake".
Usage: bake(-r, (-meats)).
Source: a primitive root;

645.long:
Meaning: strictly a demonstrative particle, "here"; but used of time, "now" or "then".
Usage: here, now, where?.
Source: or "אֵפוֹא"; from "H6311";

646.long:
Meaning: a "girdle"; specifically the "ephod" or highpriest's shoulder-piece; also generally, an "image".
Usage: ephod.
Source: rarely "אֵפֹד"; probably of foreign derivation

647.long:
Meaning: "Aphiach", an Israelite.
Usage: Aphiah.
Source: perhaps from "H6315"; breeze;

648.long:
Meaning: "unripe".
Usage: not grown up.
Source: from the same as "H651" (in the sense of weakness);

649.long:
Meaning: "Appajim", an Israelite.
Usage: Appaim.
Source: dual of "H639"; two nostrils;

650.long:
Meaning: properly, "containing", i.e. a "tube"; also a "bed" or "valley" of a stream; also a "strong" thing or a "hero".
Usage: brook, channel, mighty, river, scale, stream, strong piece.
Source: from "H622";

651.long:
Meaning: "dusky".
Usage: very dark.
Source: from an unused root meaning to set as the sun;

652.long:
Meaning: "dusk".
Usage: darkness, obscurity, privily.
Source: from the same as "H651";

653.long:
Meaning: "duskiness", figuratively, "misfortune"; concrete, "concealment".
Usage: dark, darkness, gloominess, × thick.
Source: feminine of "H651";

655.long:
Meaning: a "turn", i.e. a "season".
Usage: fitly.
Source: from an unused root meaning to revolve;

656.long:
Meaning: to "disappear", i.e. "cease".
Usage: be clean gone (at an end, brought to nought), fail.
Source: a primitive root;

657.long:
Meaning: "cessation", i.e. "an end" (especially of the earth); often used adverb, "no further"; also "the ankle" (in the dual), as being the extremity of the leg or "foot".
Usage: ankle, but (only), end, howbeit, less than nothing, nevertheless (where), no, none (beside), not (any, -withstanding), thing of nought, save(-ing), there, uttermost part, want, without (cause).
Source: from "H656"; (sometimes like "H6466")

658.long:
Meaning: "Ephes-Dammim", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Ephes-dammim.
Source: from "H657" and the plural of "H1818"; boundary of blood-drops;

659.long:
Meaning: properly, a "breath", i.e. "nothing".
Usage: of nought.
Source: from an unused root probably meaning to "breathe";

660.long:
Meaning: an "asp" or other venomous serpent.
Usage: viper.
Source: from "H659" (in the sense of "hissing");

662.long:
Meaning: to "contain", i.e. (reflex.) "abstain".
Usage: force (oneself), restrain.
Source: a primitive root;

663.long:
Meaning: "Aphek" (or Aphik), the name of three places in Palestine.
Usage: Aphek, Aphik.
Source: or "אֲפִיק"; from "H662" (in the sense of strength); fortress;

664.long:
Meaning: "Aphekah", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Aphekah.
Source: feminine of "H663"; fortress;

665.long:
Meaning: "ashes".
Usage: ashes.
Source: from an unused root meaning to bestrew;

666.long:
Meaning: a "turban".
Usage: ashes.
Source: from the same as "H665" (in the sense of covering);

667.long:
Meaning: the "brood" of a bird.
Usage: young (one).
Source: from "H6524" (in the sense of bursting the shell);

668.long:
Meaning: a "palanquin".
Usage: chariot.
Source: probably of Egyptian derivation;

669.long:
Meaning: "Ephrajim", a son of Joseph; also the tribe descended from him, and its territory.
Usage: Ephraim, Ephraimites.
Source: dual of masculine form of "H672"; "double fruit";

670.long:
Meaning: an "Apherasite" or inhabitant of an unknown region of Assyria.
Usage: Apharsite.
Source: (Aramaic) of foreign origin (only in the plural);

671.long:
Meaning: "an Apharsekite" or "Apharsathkite", an unknown Assyrian tribe.
Usage: Apharsachites, Apharasthchites.
Source: (Aramaic) or "אֲפַרְסַתְכַי"; (Aramaic), of foreign origin (only in the plural);

672.long:
Meaning: "Ephrath", another name for "Bethlehem".
Usage: once (Psalm 132:6) perhaps for Ephraim; also of an Israelitish woman; Ephrath, Ephratah.
Source: or "אֶפְרָתָה"; from "H6509"; fruitfulness;

673.long:
Meaning: an "Ephrathite" or an "Ephraimite".
Usage: Ephraimite, Ephrathite.
Source: patrial from "H672";

674.long:
Meaning: "revenue"; "others at the last".
Usage: revenue.
Source: (Aramaic) of Persian origin;

675.long:
Meaning: "Etsbon", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Ezbon.
Source: or "אֶצְבֹּן"; of uncertain derivation;

676.long:
Meaning: something to "sieze" with, i.e. a "finger"; by analogy, a "toe".
Usage: finger, toe.
Source: from the same as "H6648" (in the sense of "grasping");

678.long:
Meaning: an "extremity" (Isaiah 41:9), also a "noble".
Usage: chief man, noble.
Source: from "H680" (in its secondary sense of "separation");

679.long:
Meaning: a "joint of the hand" (i.e. knuckle); also (according to some) a "party-wall" (Ezekiel 41:8).
Usage: (arm) hole, great.
Source: from "H680" (in its primary sense of uniting);

680.long:
Meaning: properly, to "join"; used only as a denominative from "H681"; to "separate"; hence, to "select", "refuse", "contract".
Usage: keep, reserve, straiten, take.
Source: a primitive root;

681.long:
Meaning: a "side"; (as a preposition) "near".
Usage: at, (hard) by, (from) (beside), near (unto), toward, with. See also "H1018".
Source: from "H680" (in the sense of joining);

682.long:
Meaning: "Atsel", the name of an Israelite, and of a place in Palestine.
Usage: Azal, Azel.
Source: from "H680"; noble;

683.long:
Meaning: "Atsaljah", an Israelite.
Usage: Azaliah.
Source: from "H680" and "H3050" prolonged; Jah has reserved;

684.long:
Meaning: "Otsem", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Ozem.
Source: from an unused root probably meaning to be strong; strength (i.e. strong);

685.long:
Meaning: properly, a "step-chain"; by analogy, a "bracelet".
Usage: bracelet, chain.
Source: a variation from "H6807";

686.long:
Meaning: to "store" up.
Usage: (lay up in) store, (make) treasure(-r).
Source: a primitive root;

688.long:
Meaning: "burning", i.e. a "carbuncle" or "other fiery gem".
Usage: carbuncle.
Source: from "H6916";

689.long:
Meaning: "slender", i.e. the "ibex".
Usage: wild goat.
Source: probably from "H602";

690.long:
Meaning: "Ara", an Israelite.
Usage: Ara.
Source: probably for "H738"; lion;

692.long:
Meaning: "Areli" (or an Arelite, collectively), an Israelite and his descendants.
Usage: Areli, Arelites.
Source: from "H691"; "heroic";

693.long:
Meaning: to "lurk".
Usage: (lie in) ambush(-ment), lay (lie in) wait.
Source: a primitive root;

694.long:
Meaning: "Arab", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Arab.
Source: from "H693"; ambush;

697.long:
Meaning: a "locust" (from its rapid increase).
Usage: grasshopper, locust.
Source: from "H7235";

698.long:
Meaning: "ambuscades".
Usage: spoils.
Source: feminine of "H696" (only in the plural);

699.long:
Meaning: a "lattice"; (by implication) a "window", "dovecot" (because of the pigeon-holes), "chimney" (with its apertures for smoke), "sluice" (with openings for water).
Usage: chimney, window.
Source: feminine participle passive of "H693" (as if for lurking);

700.long:
Meaning: "Arubboth", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Aruboth.
Source: plural of "H699";

701.long:
Meaning: an "Arbite" or native of Arab.
Usage: Arbite.
Source: patrial from "H694";

704.long:
Meaning: "Arba", one of the Anakim.
Usage: Arba.
Source: the same as "H702";

707.long:
Meaning: to "plait" or "weave".
Usage: weaver(-r).
Source: a primitive root;

708.long:
Meaning: a "weaving"; a "braid"; also a "shuttle".
Usage: beam, weaver's shuttle.
Source: from "H707";

709.long:
Meaning: "Argob", a district of Palestine.
Usage: Argob.
Source: from the same as "H7263"; stony;

712.long:
Meaning: a "box" (as a pannier).
Usage: coffer.
Source: perhaps from "H7264" (in the sense of being suspended),

713.long:
Meaning: "purple" (the color or the dyed stuff).
Usage: purple.
Source: of foreign origin;

714.long:
Meaning: "Ard", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Ard.
Source: from an unused root probably meaning to wander; "fugitive";

715.long:
Meaning: "Ardon", an Israelite.
Usage: Ardon.
Source: from the same as "H714"; roaming;

716.long:
Meaning: an "Ardite" (collectively) or descendant of Ard.
Usage: Ardites.
Source: patronymic from "H714";

717.long:
Meaning: to "pluck".
Usage: gather, pluck.
Source: a primitive root;

719.long:
Meaning: "Arvad", an island-city of Palestine.
Usage: Arvad.
Source: probably from "H7300"; a refuge for the roving;

720.long:
Meaning: "Arod", an Israelite.
Usage: Arod.
Source: an orthographical variation of "H719"; "fugitive";

721.long:
Meaning: an "Arvadite" or "citizen of Arvad".
Usage: Arvadite.
Source: patrial from "H719";

722.long:
Meaning: an "Arodite" or descendant of Arod.
Usage: Arodi, Arodites.
Source: patronymic from "H721";

723.long:
Meaning: a "herding-place" for an animal.
Usage: stall.
Source: or "אֲרָיָה"; from "H717" (in the sense of feeding);

724.long:
Meaning: "wholeness" (literally or figuratively).
Usage: health, made up, perfected.
Source: or "אֲרֻכָה"; feminine passive participle of "H748" (in the sense of "restoring" to soundness);

725.long:
Meaning: "Arumah", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Arumah.
Source: a variation of "H7316"; height;

726.long:
Meaning: an "Edomite" (as in the margin).
Usage: Syrian.
Source: a clerical error for "H130";

727.long:
Meaning: a "box".
Usage: ark, chest, coffin.
Source: or "אָרֹן"; from "H717" (in the sense of gathering);

728.long:
Meaning: "Aravnah" (or Arnijah or Ornah), a Jebusite.
Usage: Araunah.
Source: or (by transposition) "אוֹרְנָה"; or "אַרְנִיָּה"; all by orthographical variation for "H771";

729.long:
Meaning: "of cedar".
Usage: made of cedar.
Source: a primitive root; to be firm; used only in the passive participle as a denominative from "H730";

730.long:
Meaning: a "cedar" tree (from the tenacity of its roots).
Usage: cedar (tree).
Source: from "H729";

732.long:
Meaning: to "travel".
Usage: go, wayfaring (man).
Source: a primitive root;

733.long:
Meaning: "Arach", the name of three Israelites.
Usage: Arah.
Source: from "H732"; way faring;

734.long:
Meaning: a well-trodden "road" (literally or figuratively); also a "caravan".
Usage: manner, path, race, rank, traveller, troop, (by-, high-) way.
Source: from "H732";

736.long:
Meaning: a "caravan".
Usage: (travelling) company.
Source: feminine active participle of "H732";

737.long:
Meaning: a "ration of food".
Usage: allowance, diet, dinner, victuals.
Source: feminine passive participle of "H732" (in the sense of appointing);

738.long:
Meaning: a "lion".
Usage: (young) lion, pierce (from the margin).
Source: or (prolonged) "אַרְיֵה"; from "H717" (in the sense of violence);

739.long:
Meaning: "lion of God"; i.e. "heroic".
Usage: lionlike men.
Source: or "אֲרִאֵל"; from "H738" and "H410";

740.long:
Meaning: "Ariel", a symbolical name for Jerusalem, also the name of an Israelite.
Usage: Ariel.
Source: the same as "H739";

741.long:
Meaning: the "altar of the temple".
Usage: altar.
Source: either by transposition for "H739" or, more probably, an orthographical variation for "H2025";

742.long:
Meaning: "Aridai", a son of Haman.
Usage: Aridai.
Source: of Persian origin;

743.long:
Meaning: "Aridatha", a son of Haman.
Usage: Aridatha.
Source: of Persian origin;

745.long:
Meaning: "Arjeh", an Israelite.
Usage: Arieh.
Source: the same as "H738"; lion;

746.long:
Meaning: "Arjok", the name of two Babylonians.
Usage: Arioch.
Source: of foreign origin;

747.long:
Meaning: "Arisai", a son of Haman.
Usage: Arisai.
Source: of Persian origin;

748.long:
Meaning: to "be" (causative, "make") "long" (literally or figuratively).
Usage: defer, draw out, lengthen, (be, become, make, pro-) long, (out-, over-) live, tarry (long).
Source: a primitive root;

749.long:
Meaning: to "suit".
Usage: be meet.
Source: (Aramaic) properly, corresponding to "H748", but used only in the sense of "reaching" to a given point;

751.long:
Meaning: "Erek", a place in Babylon.
Usage: Erech.
Source: from "H748"; length;

755.long:
Meaning: the "knee".
Usage: knee.
Source: (Aramaic) from an unused root corresponding to "H7392" (in the sense of bending the knee);

756.long:
Meaning: an "Arkevite" (collectively) or native of Erek.
Usage: Archevite.
Source: (Aramaic) patrial from "H751";

757.long:
Meaning: an "Arkite" or native of Erek.
Usage: Archi, Archite.
Source: patrial from another place (in Palestine) of similar name with "H751";

758.long:
Meaning: "Aram" or "Syria", and its inhabitants; also the name of the son of Shem, a grandson of Nahor, and of an Israelite.
Usage: Aram, Mesopotamia, Syria, Syrians.
Source: from the same as "H759"; the highland;

759.long:
Meaning: a "citadel" (from its "height").
Usage: castle, palace. Compare "H2038".
Source: from an unused root (meaning to "be elevated");

760.long:
Meaning: "Aram of Tsoba" (or Coele-Syria).
Usage: Aram-zobah.
Source: from "H758" and "H6678";

761.long:
Meaning: an "Aramite" or "Aramaean".
Usage: Syrian, Aramitess.
Source: patrial from "H758";

762.long:
Meaning: (only adverbial) "in Aramæan".
Usage: in the Syrian language (tongue), in Syriac.
Source: feminine of "H761";

763.long:
Meaning: "Aram" of (the) two rivers (Euphrates and Tigris) or Mesopotamia.
Usage: Aram-naharaim, Mesopotamia.
Source: from "H758" and the dual of "H5104";

766.long:
Meaning: the "ash" tree (from its toughness).
Usage: ash.
Source: from the same as "H765" (in the sense of "strength");

767.long:
Meaning: "Oren", an Israelite.
Usage: Oren.
Source: the same as "H766";

769.long:
Meaning: the "Arnon", a river east of the Jordan, also its territory.
Usage: Arnon.
Source: or "אַרְנֹן"; from "H7442"; a "brawling" stream;

770.long:
Meaning: "Arnan", an Israelite.
Usage: Arnan.
Source: probably from the same as "H769"; "noisy";

771.long:
Meaning: "Ornan", a Jebusite.
Usage: Ornan. See "H728".
Source: probably from "H766"; strong;

772.long:
Meaning: the "earth"; by implication (figuratively) "low".
Usage: earth, interior.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H776";

774.long:
Meaning: "Arpad", a place in Syria.
Usage: Arpad, Arphad.
Source: from "H7502"; "spread" out;

775.long:
Meaning: "Arpakshad", a son of Noah; also the region settled by him.
Usage: Arphaxad.
Source: probably of foreign origin;

776.long:
Meaning: the "earth" (at large, or partitively a "land").
Usage: × common, country, earth, field, ground, land, × natins, way, + wilderness, world.
Source: from an unused root probably meaning to "be firm";

779.long:
Meaning: to "execrate".
Usage: × bitterly curse.
Source: a primitive root;

780.long:
Meaning: "Ararat" (or rather Armenia).
Usage: Ararat, Armenia.
Source: of foreign origin;

781.long:
Meaning: to "engage for matrimony".
Usage: betroth, espouse.
Source: a primitive root;

782.long:
Meaning: a "longing for".
Usage: request.
Source: from "H781" (in the sense of desiring to possess);

783.long:
Meaning: "Artachshasta" (or Artaxerxes), a title (rather than name) of several Persian kings.
Usage: Artaxerxes.
Source: or "אַרְתַּחְשַׁשְׁתְּא"; or by permutation "אַרְתַּחְשַׁסְתְּא"; of foreign origin;

784.long:
Meaning: "fire" (literally or figuratively).
Usage: burning, fiery, fire, flaming, hot.
Source: a primitive word;

786.long:
Meaning: "entity", used only adverbially, "there is" or "are".
Usage: are there, none can. Compare "H3426".
Source: identical (in origin and formation) with "H784";

787.long:
Meaning: a "foundation".
Usage: foundation.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding (by transposition and abbreviation) to "H803";

788.long:
Meaning: "Ashbel", an Israelite.
Usage: Ashbel.
Source: probably from the same as "H7640"; "flowing";

789.long:
Meaning: an "Ashbelite" (collectively) or descendant of Ashbel.
Usage: Ashbelites.
Source: patronymic from "H788";

790.long:
Meaning: "Eshban", an Idumaean.
Usage: Eshban.
Source: probably from the same as "H7644"; "vigorous";

792.long:
Meaning: "Eshbaal" (or Ishbosheth), a son of Saul.
Usage: Eshbaal.
Source: from "H376" and "H1168"; man of Baal;

793.long:
Meaning: an "outpouring".
Usage: stream.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "pour";

795.long:
Meaning: "Ashdod", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Ahdod.
Source: from "H7703"; "ravager";

796.long:
Meaning: an "Ashdodite" (often collectively) or inhabitant of Asdod.
Usage: Ashdodites, of Ashdod.
Source: patrial from "H795";

797.long:
Meaning: (only adverb) "in the language of Ashdod".
Usage: in the speech of Ashdod.
Source: feminine of "H796";

798.long:
Meaning: "Ashdoth-Pisgah", a place east of the Jordan.
Usage: Ashdoth-pisgah.
Source: from the plural of "H794" and "H6449" with the article interposed; ravines of the Pisgah;

801.long:
Meaning: properly, a "burnt-offering"; but occasionally of any "sacrifice".
Usage: (offering, sacrifice), (made) by fire.
Source: the same as "H800", but used in a liturgical sense;

802.long:
Meaning: a "woman".
Usage: (adulter) ess, each, every, female, × many, none, one, together, wife, woman. Often unexpressed in English.
Source: feminine of "H376" or "H582"; irregular plural, "נָשִׁים";(used in the same wide sense as "H582")

803.long:
Meaning: "foundation".
Usage: foundation.
Source: feminine passive participle from an unused root meaning to "found";

804.long:
Meaning: "Ashshur", the second son of Shem; also his descendants and the country occupied by them (i.e. Assyria), its region and its empire.
Usage: Asshur, Assur, Assyria, Assyrians. See "H838".
Source: or "אַשֻּׁר"; apparently from "H833" (in the sense of successful);

805.long:
Meaning: "an Ashurite" (collectively) or inhabitant of Ashur, a district in Palestine.
Usage: Asshurim, Ashurites.
Source: or "אַשּׁוּרִי"; from a patrial word of the same form as "H804";

807.long:
Meaning: "Ashima", a deity of Hamath.
Usage: Ashima.
Source: of foreign origin;

808.long:
Meaning: a (ruined) "foundation".
Usage: foundation.
Source: from the same as "H784" (in the sense of "pressing" down firmly; compare "H803");

809.long:
Meaning: something "closely pressed together", i.e. a "cake of raisins" or "other comfits".
Usage: flagon.
Source: feminine of "H808";

810.long:
Meaning: a "testicle" (as a lump).
Usage: stone.
Source: from an unused root (probably meaning to bunch together);

811.long:
Meaning: a "bunch of grapes" or other fruit.
Usage: cluster (of grapes).
Source: or "אֶשְׁכֹּל"; probably prolonged from "H810";

812.long:
Meaning: "Eshcol", the name of an Amorite, also of a valley in Palestine.
Usage: Eshcol.
Source: the same as "H811";

813.long:
Meaning: "Ashkenaz", a Japhethite, also his descendants.
Usage: Ashkenaz.
Source: of foreign origin;

815.long:
Meaning: a "tamarisk tree"; by extension, a "grove" of any kind.
Usage: grove, tree.
Source: from a root of uncertain signification;

816.long:
Meaning: to "be guilty"; by implication to "be punished" or "perish".
Usage: × certainly, be(-come, made) desolate, destroy, × greatly, be(-come, found, hold) guilty, offend (acknowledge offence), trespass.
Source: or "אָשֵׁם"; a primitive root;

817.long:
Meaning: "guilt"; by implication, a "fault"; also a "sin-offering".
Usage: guiltiness, (offering for) sin, trespass (offering).
Source: from "H816";

818.long:
Meaning: "guilty"; hence, "presenting a sin-offering".
Usage: one which is faulty, guilty.
Source: from "H816";

819.long:
Meaning: "guiltiness", a "fault", the "presentation of a sin-offering".
Usage: offend, sin, (cause of) trespass(-ing, offering).
Source: feminine of "H817";

820.long:
Meaning: a "fat" field.
Usage: desolate place.
Source: probably from "H8081";

821.long:
Meaning: a night "watch".
Usage: watch.
Source: or "אַשׁמוּרָה"; or "אַשׁמֹרֶת"; (feminine) from "H8104";

822.long:
Meaning: a "latticed window".
Usage: casement, lattice.
Source: apparently from an unused root (probably meaning to leave interstices);

823.long:
Meaning: "Ashnah", the name of two places in Palestine.
Usage: Ashnah.
Source: probably a variation for "H3466";

824.long:
Meaning: "Eshan", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Eshean.
Source: from "H8172"; "support";

825.long:
Meaning: a "conjurer".
Usage: astrologer.
Source: from an unused root (probably meaning to lisp, i.e. practice enchantment);

827.long:
Meaning: a "quiver" or arrow-case.
Usage: quiver.
Source: perhaps (feminine) from the same as "H825" (in the sense of "covering");

828.long:
Meaning: "Ashpenaz", a Babylonian eunuch.
Usage: Ashpenaz.
Source: of foreign origin;

829.long:
Meaning: a "measured portion".
Usage: good piece (of flesh).
Source: of uncertain derivation;

830.long:
Meaning: a heap of "rubbish" or "filth".
Usage: dung (hill).
Source: or "אַשְׁפּוֹת"; or "שְׁפֹת"; (contraction) plural of a noun of the same form as "H827", from "H8192" (in the sense of "scraping");

831.long:
Meaning: "Ashkelon", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Ashkelon, Askalon.
Source: probably from "H8254" in the sense of weighing-place (i.e. mart);

832.long:
Meaning: "Ashkelonite" (collectively) or inhabitant of Ashkelon.
Usage: Eshkalonites.
Source: patrial from "H831";

833.long:
Meaning: to "be straight" (used in the widest sense, especially to "be level", "right", "happy"); figuratively, to "go forward", "be honest", "prosper".
Usage: (call, be) bless(-ed, happy), go, guide, lead, relieve.
Source: or "אָשֵׁר"; a primitive root;

834.long:
Meaning: "who", "which", "what", "that"; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) "when", "where", "how", "because", "in order that", etc.
Usage: × after, × alike, as (soon as), because, × every, for, + forasmuch, + from whence, + how(-soever), × if, (so) that ((thing) which, wherein), × though, + until, + whatsoever, when, where (+ -as, -in, -of, -on, -soever, -with), which, whilst, + whither(-soever), who(-m, -soever, -se). As it is indeclinable, it is often accompanied by the personal pronoun expletively, used to show the connection.
Source: a primitive relative pronoun (of every gender and number);

835.long:
Meaning: "happiness"; only in masculine plural construction as interjection, how "happy!".
Usage: blessed, happy.
Source: from "H833";

836.long:
Meaning: "Asher", a son of Jacob, and the tribe descended from him, with its territory; also a place in Palestine.
Usage: Asher.
Source: from "H833", "happy";

838.long:
Meaning: a "step".
Usage: going, step.
Source: or "אַשֻּׁר"; from "H833" in the sense of going;

839.long:
Meaning: the "cedar tree" or some other light elastic wood.
Usage: Ashurite.
Source: contracted for "H8391";

840.long:
Meaning: "Asarel", an Israelite.
Usage: Asareel.
Source: by orthographical variation from "H833" and "H410"; right of God;

841.long:
Meaning: "Asarelah", an Israelite.
Usage: Asarelah. Compare "H3480".
Source: from the same as "H840"; right toward God;

842.long:
Meaning: "Asherah" (or Astarte) a Phoenician goddess; also an "image" of the same.
Usage: grove. Compare "H6253".
Source: or "אֲשֵׁירָה"; from "H833"; "happy";

843.long:
Meaning: an "Asherite" (collectively) or descendant of Asher.
Usage: Asherites.
Source: patronymic from "H836";

844.long:
Meaning: "Asriel", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Ashriel, Asriel.
Source: an orthographical variation for "H840";

845.long:
Meaning: an "Asrielite" (collectively) or descendant of Asriel.
Usage: Asrielites.
Source: patronymic from "H844";

846.long:
Meaning: a "wall" (from its uprightness).
Usage: wall.
Source: (Aramaic) from a root corresponding to "H833";

847.long:
Meaning: "Eshtaol", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Eshtaol.
Source: or "אֶשְׁתָּאוֹל"; probably from "H7592"; intreaty;

848.long:
Meaning: an "Eshtaolite" (collectively) or inhabitant of Eshtaol.
Usage: Eshtaulites.
Source: patrial from "H847";

850.long:
Meaning: "Eshton", an Israelite.
Usage: Eshton.
Source: probably from the same as "H7764"; restful;

851.long:
Meaning: "Eshtemoa" or "Eshtemoh", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Eshtemoa, Eshtemoh.
Source: or "אֶשְׁתְּמוֹעַ"; or "אֶשְׁתְּמֹה"; from "H8085" (in the sense of obedience);

853.long:
Meaning: properly, "self" (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, "even" or "namely").
Usage: [as such unrepresented in English].
Source: apparent contracted from "H226" in the demonstrative sense of "entity";

854.long:
Meaning: properly, "nearness" (used only as a preposition or an adverb), "near"; hence, generally, "with", "by", "at", "among", etc.
Usage: against, among, before, by, for, from, in(-to), (out) of, with. Often with another prepositional prefix.
Source: probably from "H579";

855.long:
Meaning: a "hoe" or other digging implement.
Usage: coulter, plowshare.
Source: of uncertain derivation;

856.long:
Meaning: "Ethbaal", a Phoenician king.
Usage: Ethbaal.
Source: from "H854" and "H1168"; with Baal;

857.long:
Meaning: to "arrive".
Usage: (be-, things to) come (upon), bring.
Source: or "אָתָא"; a primitive root (collateral to "H225" contraction);

859.long:
Meaning: "thou" and "thee", or (plural) "ye" and "you".
Usage: thee, thou, ye, you.
Source: or (shortened); "אַתָּ"; or "אַת"; feminine (irregular) sometimes "אַתִּי"; plural masculine "אַתֶּם"; feminine "אַתֶּן"; or "אַתֵּנָה"; or "אַתֵּנָּה"; a primitive pronoun of the second person;

860.long:
Meaning: a "female donkey" (from its docility).
Usage: (she) ass.
Source: probably from the same as "H386" (in the sense of patience);

861.long:
Meaning: probably a "fire-place", i.e. "furnace".
Usage: furnace.
Source: (Aramaic) probably from the corresponding to "H784";

862.long:
Meaning: a "ledge" or offset in a building.
Usage: gallery.
Source: or "אַתִּיק"; from "H5423" in the sense of decreasing;

863.long:
Meaning: "Ittai" or "Ithai", the name of a Gittite and of an Israelite.
Usage: Ithai, Ittai.
Source: or "אִיתַי"; from "H854"; near;

864.long:
Meaning: "Etham", a place in the Desert.
Usage: Etham.
Source: of Egyptian derivation;

865.long:
Meaning: "heretofore"; definitely "yesterday".
Usage: before (that) time, heretofore, of late (old), times past, yester(day).
Source: or "אִתְמוֹל"; or "אֶתְמוּל"; probably from "H853" or "H854" and "H4136";

866.long:
Meaning: a "present" (as the price of harlotry).
Usage: reward.
Source: from "H8566";

867.long:
Meaning: "Ethni", an Israelite.
Usage: Ethni.
Source: perhaps from "H866"; munificence;

868.long:
Meaning: a "gift" (as the price of harlotry or idolatry).
Usage: hire, reward.
Source: the same as "H866";

869.long:
Meaning: "Ethnan", an Israelite.
Usage: Ethnan.
Source: the same as "H868" in the sense of "H867";

870.long:
Meaning: a "place"; (adverb) "after".
Usage: after, place.
Source: (Aramaic) from a root corresponding to that of "H871";

871.long:
Meaning: "Atharim", a place near Palestine.
Usage: spies. b.
Source: plural from an unused root (probably meaning to step); places;

872.long:
Meaning: an "entrance" to a building.
Usage: entry.
Source: from "H935";

874.long:
Meaning: to "dig"; by analogy, to "engrave"; figuratively, to "explain".
Usage: declare, (make) plain(-ly).
Source: a primitive root;

875.long:
Meaning: a "pit"; especially a "well".
Usage: pit, well.
Source: from "H874";

876.long:
Meaning: "Beer", a place in the Desert, also one in Palestine.
Usage: Beer.
Source: the same as "H875";

878.long:
Meaning: "Beera", an Israelite.
Usage: Beera.
Source: from "H875"; a well;

879.long:
Meaning: "Beer-Elim", a place in the Desert.
Usage: Beer-elim.
Source: from "H875" and the plural of "H410"; "well of heroes";

880.long:
Meaning: "Beerah", an Israelite.
Usage: Beerah.
Source: the same as "H878";

881.long:
Meaning: "Beeroth", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Beeroth.
Source: feminine plural of "H875"; "wells";

882.long:
Meaning: "Beeri", the name of a Hittite and of an Israelite.
Usage: Beeri.
Source: from "H875"; fountained;

883.long:
Meaning: "Beer-Lachai-Roi", a place in the Desert.
Usage: Beer-lahai-roi.
Source: from "H875" and "H2416" (with prefix) and "H7203"; well of a living (One) my Seer;

884.long:
Meaning: "Beer-Sheba", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Beer-shebah.
Source: from "H875" and "H7651" (in the sense of "H7650"); well of an oath;

885.long:
Meaning: "Beeroth-Bene-Jaakan", a place in the Desert.
Usage: Beeroth of the children of Jaakan.
Source: from the feminine plural of "H875", and the plural contraction of "H1121", and "H3292"; wells of (the) sons of Jaakan;

886.long:
Meaning: a "Beerothite" or inhabitant of Beeroth.
Usage: Beerothite.
Source: patrial from "H881";

887.long:
Meaning: to "smell" bad; figuratively, to "be offensive" morally.
Usage: (make to) be abhorred (had in abomination, loathsome, odious), (cause a, make to) stink(-ing savour), × utterly.
Source: a primitive root;

890.long:
Meaning: "stink-weed" or any other "noxious" or "useless" plant.
Usage: cockle.
Source: feminine of "H889";

892.long:
Meaning: something" hollowed" (as a gate), i.e. "pupil of the eye".
Usage: apple (of the eye).
Source: feminine active participle of an unused root meaning to hollow out;

893.long:
Meaning: "Bebai", an Israelite.
Usage: Bebai.
Source: probably of foreign origin;

894.long:
Meaning: "Babel" (i.e. Babylon), including "Babylonia" and the "Babylonian empire".
Usage: Babel, Babylon.
Source: from "H1101"; confusion;

897.long:
Meaning: "food".
Usage: spoil (from the margin for "H957".).
Source: a Persian word;

898.long:
Meaning: to "cover" (with a garment); figuratively, to "act covertly"; by implication, to "pillage".
Usage: deal deceitfully (treacherously, unfaithfully), offend, transgress(-or), (depart), treacherous (dealer, -ly, man), unfaithful(-ly, man), × very.
Source: a primitive root;

899.long:
Meaning: a "covering", i.e. "clothing"; also "treachery" or "pillage".
Usage: apparel, cloth(-es, ing), garment, lap, rag, raiment, robe, × very (treacherously), vesture, wardrobe.
Source: from "H898";

900.long:
Meaning: "treacheries".
Usage: treacherous.
Source: feminine plural active participle of "H898";

902.long:
Meaning: "Bigvai", an Israelite.
Usage: Bigvai.
Source: probably of foreign origin;

903.long:
Meaning: "Bigtha", a eunuch of Xerxes.
Usage: Bigtha.
Source: of Persian derivation;

904.long:
Meaning: "Bigthan" or "Bigthana", a eunuch of Xerxes.
Usage: Bigthan, Bigthana.
Source: or "בִּגְתָנָא"; of similar derivation to "H903";

905.long:
Meaning: properly, "separation"; by implication, a "part" of the body, "branch" of a tree, "bar" for carrying; figuratively, "chief" of a city; especially (with prepositional prefix) as an adverb, "apart", "only", "besides".
Usage: alone, apart, bar, besides, branch, by self, of each alike, except, only, part, staff, strength.
Source: from "H909";

906.long:
Meaning: flaxen "thread" or yarn; hence, a "linen" garment.
Usage: linen.
Source: perhaps from "H909" (in the sense of "divided" fibres);

907.long:
Meaning: a "brag" or "lie"; also a "liar".
Usage: liar, lie.
Source: from "H908";

908.long:
Meaning: (figuratively) to "invent".
Usage: devise, feign.
Source: a primitive root;

909.long:
Meaning: to "divide", i.e. (reflex.) "be solitary".
Usage: alone.
Source: a primitive root;

910.long:
Meaning: "separate"; adverb, "separately".
Usage: alone, desolate, only, solitary.
Source: from "H909";

912.long:
Meaning: "Bedejah", an Israelite.
Usage: Bedeiah.
Source: probably a shortened form "H5662"; servant of Jehovah;

913.long:
Meaning: "alloy" (because "removed" by smelting); by analogy, "tin".
Usage: plummet, tin.
Source: from "H914";

914.long:
Meaning: to "divide" (in variation senses literally or figuratively, separate, distinguish, differ, select, etc.).
Usage: (make, put) difference, divide (asunder), (make) separate (self, -ation), sever (out), × utterly.
Source: a primitive root;

916.long:
Meaning: "something in pieces", i.e. "bdellium", a (fragrant) "gum" (perhaps amber); others a "pearl".
Usage: bdellium.
Source: probably from "H914";

917.long:
Meaning: "Bedan", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Bedan.
Source: probably shortened for "H5658"; servile;

918.long:
Meaning: to "mend" a breach.
Usage: repair.
Source: a primitive root; to "gap" open; used only as a denominative from "H919";

919.long:
Meaning: a "gap" or "leak" (in a building or a ship).
Usage: breach, calker.
Source: from "H918";

920.long:
Meaning: "Bidkar", an Israelite.
Usage: Bidkar.
Source: probably from "H1856" with a prepositional prefix; by stabbing, i.e. assassin;

922.long:
Meaning: a "vacuity", i.e. (superficially) an "undistinguishable ruin".
Usage: emptiness, void.
Source: from an unused root (meaning to be empty);

923.long:
Meaning: "white marble" or perhaps "alabaster".
Usage: red (marble).
Source: from an unused root (probably meaning to glisten);

924.long:
Meaning: a "hurry"; only adverb, "hastily".
Usage: in haste.
Source: (Aramaic) from "H927";

925.long:
Meaning: "shining".
Usage: bright.
Source: from an unused root (meaning to be bright);

926.long:
Meaning: to "tremble" inwardly (or "palpitate"), i.e. (figuratively) "be" (causative, "make") (suddenly) "alarmed" or "agitated"; by implication to "hasten" anxiously.
Usage: be (make) affrighted (afraid, amazed, dismayed, rash), (be, get, make) haste(-n, -y, -ily), (give) speedy(-ily), thrust out, trouble, vex.
Source: a primitive root;

927.long:
Meaning: to "terrify", "hasten".
Usage: in haste, trouble.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H926";

929.long:
Meaning: properly, a "dumb" beast; especially any large quadruped or "animal" (often collective).
Usage: beast, cattle.
Source: from an unused root (probably meaning to be "mute");

930.long:
Meaning: a "water-ox", i.e. the "hippopotamus" or "Nile-horse".
Usage: Behemoth.
Source: in form a plural or "H929", but really a singular of Egyptian derivation;

931.long:
Meaning: the "thumb" of the hand or "great toe" of the foot.
Usage: thumb, great toe.
Source: from an unused root apparently meaning to be "thick";

932.long:
Meaning: "thumb", "Bohan", an Israelite.
Usage: Bohan.
Source: an orthographical variation of "H931";

933.long:
Meaning: "white scurf".
Usage: freckled spot.
Source: from an unused root meaning to be pale;

934.long:
Meaning: a "whitish spot on the skin".
Usage: bright spot.
Source: feminine active participle of the same as "H925";

935.long:
Meaning: to "go" or "come" (in a wide variety of applications).
Usage: abide, apply, attain, × be, befall, besiege, bring (forth, in, into, to pass), call, carry, × certainly, (cause, let, thing for) to come (against, in, out, upon, to pass), depart, × doubtless again, eat, employ, (cause to) enter (in, into, -tering, -trance, -try), be fallen, fetch, follow, get, give, go (down, in, to war), grant, have, × indeed, (in-) vade, lead, lift (up), mention, pull in, put, resort, run (down), send, set, × (well) stricken (in age), × surely, take (in), way.
Source: a primitive root;

936.long:
Meaning: to "disrespect".
Usage: contemn, despise, × utterly.
Source: a primitive root;

938.long:
Meaning: "Buz", the name of a son of Nahor, and of an Israelite.
Usage: Buz.
Source: the same as "H937";

939.long:
Meaning: something "scorned"; an object of "contempt".
Usage: despised.
Source: feminine passive participle of "H936";

940.long:
Meaning: a "Buzite" or descendant of Buz.
Usage: Buzite.
Source: patronymic from "H938";

941.long:
Meaning: "Buzi", an Israelite.
Usage: Buzi.
Source: the same as "H940";

942.long:
Meaning: "Bavvai", an Israelite.
Usage: Bavai.
Source: probably of Persian origin;

943.long:
Meaning: to "involve" (literally or figuratively).
Usage: be entangled, (perplexed).
Source: a primitive root;

944.long:
Meaning: "produce" (of the earth, etc.).
Usage: food, stock.
Source: for "H2981";

945.long:
Meaning: "Bul", the eighth Hebrew month.
Usage: Bul.
Source: the same as "H944" (in the sense of rain);

947.long:
Meaning: to "trample" (literally or figuratively).
Usage: loath, tread (down, under (foot)), be polluted.
Source: a primitive root;

948.long:
Meaning: probably "cotton" (of some sort).
Usage: fine (white) linen.
Source: from an unused root (of the same form) meaning to bleach, i.e. (intransitive) be white;

949.long:
Meaning: "Botsets", a rock near Michmash.
Usage: Bozez.
Source: from the same as "H948"; shining;

950.long:
Meaning: "emptiness" (as adjective).
Usage: empty.
Source: feminine passive participle of an unused root (meaning to be hollow);

951.long:
Meaning: a "cattle-tender".
Usage: herdman.
Source: properly, active participle from "H1239" as denominative from "H1241";

952.long:
Meaning: to "bore", i.e. (figuratively) "examine".
Usage: declare.
Source: a primitive root;

953.long:
Meaning: a pit "hole" (especially one used as a cistern or a prison).
Usage: cistern, dungeon, fountain, pit, well.
Source: from "H952" (in the sense of "H877");

954.long:
Meaning: properly, to "pale", i.e. by implication to "be ashamed"; also (by implication) to "be disappointed" or "delayed".
Usage: (be, make, bring to, cause, put to, with, a-) shamed(-d), be (put to) confounded(-fusion), become dry, delay, be long.
Source: a primitive root;

956.long:
Meaning: to "lodge" over night.
Usage: pass the night.
Source: (Aramaic) apparent denominative from "H1005";

958.long:
Meaning: probably to "cleave".
Usage: spoil.
Source: a primitive root;

959.long:
Meaning: to "disesteem".
Usage: despise, disdain, contemn(-ptible), think to scorn, vile person.
Source: a primitive root;

962.long:
Meaning: to "plunder".
Usage: catch, gather, (take) for a prey, rob(-ber), spoil, take (away, spoil), × utterly.
Source: a primitive root;

964.long:
Meaning: "Bizjothjah", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Bizjothjah.
Source: from "H959" and "H3050"; contempts of Jah;

965.long:
Meaning: a "flash of lightning".
Usage: flash of lightning.
Source: from an unused root meaning to lighten;

966.long:
Meaning: "Bezek", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Bezek.
Source: from "H965"; lightning;

968.long:
Meaning: "Biztha", a eunuch of Xerxes.
Usage: Biztha.
Source: of Persian origin;

970.long:
Meaning: properly, "selected", i.e. a "youth" (often collective).
Usage: (choice) young (man), chosen, × hole.
Source: or "בָּחֻר"; participle passive of "H977";

971.long:
Meaning: a watch-"tower" of besiegers.
Usage: tower.
Source: another form of "H975";

973.long:
Meaning: to "loath".
Usage: abhor, get hastily (from the margin for "H926").
Source: a primitive root;

974.long:
Meaning: to "test" (especially metals); generally and figuratively, to "investigate".
Usage: examine, prove, tempt, try (trial).
Source: a primitive root;

975.long:
Meaning: a watch-"tower".
Usage: tower.
Source: from "H974" (in the sense of keeping a "look-out");

977.long:
Meaning: properly, to "try", i.e. (by implication) "select".
Usage: acceptable, appoint, choose (choice), excellent, join, be rather, require.
Source: a primitive root;

978.long:
Meaning: a "Bacharumite" or inhabitant of Bachurim.
Usage: Baharumite.
Source: patrial from "H980" (by transposition);

979.long:
Meaning: "youth" (collectively and abstractly).
Usage: young men, youth.
Source: or "בְּחוּרוֹת"; feminine plural of "H970"; also (masculine plural) "בְּחֻרִים";

980.long:
Meaning: "Bachurim", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Bahurim.
Source: or "בַּחוּרִים"; masculine plural of "H970"; young men;

981.long:
Meaning: to "babble"; hence, to "vociferate angrily".
Usage: pronounce, speak (unadvisedly).
Source: or "בָּטָה"; a primitive root;

982.long:
Meaning: properly, to "hie" for refuge (but not so "precipitately" as "H2620"); figuratively, to "trust", be "confident" or "sure".
Usage: be bold (confident, secure, sure), careless (one, woman), put confidence, (make to) hope, (put, make to) trust.
Source: a primitive root;

983.long:
Meaning: properly, a "place of refuge"; abstract, "safety", both the fact (security) and the feeling (trust); often (adverb with or without preposition) "safely".
Usage: assurance, boldly, (without) care(-less), confidence, hope, safe(-ly, -ty), secure, surely.
Source: from "H982";

984.long:
Meaning: "Betach", a place in Syria.
Usage: Betah.
Source: the same as "H983";

988.long:
Meaning: to "desist from labor".
Usage: cease.
Source: a primitive root;

989.long:
Meaning: to "stop".
Usage: (cause, make to), cease, hinder.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H988";

990.long:
Meaning: the "belly", especially the "womb"; also the "bosom" or "body" of anything.
Usage: belly, body, as they be born, within, womb.
Source: from an unused root probably meaning to be hollow;

991.long:
Meaning: "Beten". a place in Palestine.
Usage: Beten.
Source: the same as "H990";

992.long:
Meaning: (only in plural) a "pistachio-nut" (from its form).
Usage: nut.
Source: from "H990";

993.long:
Meaning: "Betonim", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Betonim.
Source: probably plural from "H992"; hollows;

994.long:
Meaning: "oh that!"; "with leave", or "if it please".
Usage: alas, O, oh.
Source: perhaps from "H1158" (in the sense of asking); properly, a request; used only adverbially (always with 'my Lord');

995.long:
Meaning: to "separate" mentally (or "distinguish"), i.e.(generally) "understand".
Usage: attend, consider, be cunning, diligently, direct, discern, eloquent, feel, inform, instruct, have intelligence, know, look well to, mark, perceive, be prudent, regard, (can) skill(-full), teach, think, (cause, make to, get, give, have) understand(-ing), view, (deal) wise(-ly, man).
Source: a primitive root;

996.long:
Meaning: "between" (repeated before each noun, often with other particles); also as a conjunction, "either"..."or".
Usage: among, asunder, at, between (-twixt...and), + from (the widest), × in, out of, whether (it be...or), within.
Source: (sometimes in the plural masculine or feminine); properly, the constructive form of an otherwise unused noun from "H995"; a distinction; but used only as a preposition,

998.long:
Meaning: "understanding".
Usage: knowledge, meaning, × perfectly, understanding, wisdom.
Source: from "H995";

1000.long:
Meaning: an "egg" (from its whiteness).
Usage: egg.
Source: from the same as "H948";

1002.long:
Meaning: a "castle" or "palace".
Usage: palace.
Source: of foreign origin;

1004.long:
Meaning: "a house" (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.).
Usage: court, daughter, door, + dungeon, family, + forth of, × great as would contain, hangings, home(born), (winter) house(-hold), inside(-ward), palace, place, + prison, + steward, + tablet, temple, web, + within(-out).
Source: probably from "H1129" abbreviated;

1006.long:
Meaning: "Bajith", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Bajith.
Source: the same as "H1004";

1007.long:
Meaning: "Beth-Aven", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Beth-aven.
Source: from "H1004" and "H205"; house of vanity;

1008.long:
Meaning: "Beth-El", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Beth-el.
Source: from "H1004" and "H410"; house of God;

1009.long:
Meaning: "Beth-Arbel", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Beth-Arbel.
Source: from "H1004" and "H695" and "H410"; house of God's ambush;

1010.long:
Meaning: "Beth-Baal-Meon", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Beth-baal-meon. Compare "H1186" and "H1194".
Source: from "H1004" and "H1168" and "H4583"; house of Baal of (the) habitation of (apparently by transposition); or (shorter) "בֵּית מְעוֹן"; house of habitation of (Baal);

1011.long:
Meaning: "Beth-Biri", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Bethbirei.
Source: from "H1004" and "H1254"; house of a creative one;

1012.long:
Meaning: "Beth-Barah", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Beth-barah.
Source: probably from "H1004" and "H5679"; house of (the) ford;

1013.long:
Meaning: "Beth-Gader", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Beth-gader.
Source: from "H1004" and "H1447"; house of (the) wall;

1014.long:
Meaning: "Beth-Gamul", a place East of the Jordan.
Usage: Beth-gamul.
Source: from "H1004" and the passive participle of "H1576"; house of (the) weaned;

1015.long:
Meaning: "Beth-Diblathajim", a place East of the Jordan.
Usage: Beth-diblathaim.
Source: from "H1004" and the dual of "H1690"; house of (the) two figcakes;

1016.long:
Meaning: "Beth-Dagon", the name of two places in Palestine.
Usage: Beth-dagon.
Source: from "H1004" and "H1712"; house of Dagon;

1017.long:
Meaning: a "Beth-elite", or inhabitant of Bethel.
Usage: Bethelite.
Source: patrial from "H1008" with the article interposed;

1018.long:
Meaning: "Beth-ha-Etsel", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Beth-ezel.
Source: from "H1004" and "H681" with the article interposed; house of the side;

1019.long:
Meaning: "Beth-hag-Gilgal", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Beth-gilgal.
Source: from "H1004" and "H1537" with the article interposed; house of Gilgal (or rolling);

1020.long:
Meaning: "Beth-ha-Jeshimoth", a town East of the Jordan.
Usage: Beth-jeshimoth.
Source: from "H1004" and the plural of "H3451" with the article interposed; house of the deserts;

1021.long:
Meaning: "Beth-hak-Kerem", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Beth-haccerem.
Source: from "H1004" and "H3754" with the article interposed; house of the vineyard;

1022.long:
Meaning: a "Beth-lechemite", or native of Bethlechem.
Usage: Bethlehemite.
Source: patrial from "H1035" with the article inserted;

1023.long:
Meaning: "Beth-ham-Merchak", a place in Palestine.
Usage: place that was far off.
Source: from "H1004" and "H4801" with the article interposed; house of the breadth;

1024.long:
Meaning: "Beth-ham-Markaboth" or "Beth-Markaboth", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Bethmarcaboth.
Source: or (shortened) "בֵּית מַרְכָּבוֹת"; from "H1004" and the plural of "H4818" (with or without the article interposed); place of (the) chariots;

1025.long:
Meaning: "Beth-ha-Emek", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Beth-emek.
Source: from "H1004" and "H6010" with the article interposed; house of the valley;

1026.long:
Meaning: "Beth-ha-Arabah", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Beth-arabah.
Source: from "H1004" and "H6160" with the article interposed; house of the Desert;

1027.long:
Meaning: "Beth-ha-Ram", a place East of the Jordan.
Usage: Beth-aram.
Source: from "H1004" and "H7311" with the article interposed; house of the height;

1028.long:
Meaning: "Beth-ha-Ran", a place East of the Jordan.
Usage: Beth-haran.
Source: probably for "H1027";

1029.long:
Meaning: "Beth-hash-Shittah", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Beth-shittah.
Source: from "H1004" and "H7848" with the article interposed; house of the acacia;

1030.long:
Meaning: a "Beth-shimshite", or inhabitant of Bethshemesh.
Usage: Bethshemite.
Source: patrial from "H1053" with the article inserted;

1031.long:
Meaning: "Beth-Choglah", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Beth-hoglah.
Source: from "H1004" and the same as "H2295"; house of a partridge;

1032.long:
Meaning: "Beth-Choron", the name of two adjoining places in Palestine.
Usage: Beth-horon.
Source: from "H1004" and "H2356"; house of hollowness;

1033.long:
Meaning: "Beth-Car", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Beth-car.
Source: from "H1004" and "H3733"; house of pasture;

1034.long:
Meaning: "Beth-Lebaoth", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Beth-lebaoth. Compare "H3822".
Source: from "H1004" and the plural of "H3833"; house of lionesses;

1035.long:
Meaning: "Beth-Lechem", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Bethlehem.
Source: from "H1004" and "H3899"; "house of bread";

1036.long:
Meaning: "Beth-le-Aphrah", a place in Palestine.
Usage: house of Aphrah.
Source: from "H1004" and the feminine of "H6083" (with preposition interposed); house to (i.e. of) dust;

1037.long:
Meaning: "Beth-Millo", the name of two citadels.
Usage: house of Millo.
Source: or "בֵּית מִלֹּא"; from "H1004" and "H4407"; house of (the) rampart;

1038.long:
Meaning: "Beth-Maakah", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Beth-maachah.
Source: from "H1004" and "H4601"; house of Maakah;

1039.long:
Meaning: "Beth-Nimrah", a place east of the Jordan.
Usage: Beth-Nimrah. Compare "H5247".
Source: from "H1004" and the feminine of "H5246"; "house of" (the) "leopard";

1040.long:
Meaning: "Beth-Eden", a place in Syria.
Usage: Beth-eden.
Source: from "H1004" and "H5730"; house of pleasure;

1041.long:
Meaning: "house of Azmaveth", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Bethaz-maveth. Compare "H5820".
Source: from "H1004" and "H5820";

1042.long:
Meaning: "Beth-Anoth", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Beth-anoth.
Source: from "H1004" and a plural from "H6030"; house of replies;

1043.long:
Meaning: "Beth-Anath", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Beth-anath.
Source: an orthographical variation for "H1042";

1044.long:
Meaning: "Beth-Eked", a place in Palestine.
Usage: shearing house.
Source: from "H1004" and a derivative of "H6123"; house of (the) binding (for sheep-shearing);

1045.long:
Meaning: "Beth-Ashtaroth", a place in Palestine.
Usage: house of Ashtaroth. Compare "H1203", "H6252".
Source: ; from "H1004" and "H6252"; house of Ashtoreths;

1046.long:
Meaning: "Beth-Palet", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Beth-palet.
Source: from "H1004" and "H6412"; house of escape;

1047.long:
Meaning: "Beth-Peor", a place East of the Jordan.
Usage: Bethpeor.
Source: from "H1004" and "H6465"; "house of Peor";

1048.long:
Meaning: "Beth-Patstsets", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Beth-pazzez.
Source: from "H1004" and a derivative from "H6327"; house of dispersion;

1049.long:
Meaning: "Beth-Tsur", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Beth-zur.
Source: from "H1004" and "H6697"; house of (the) rock;

1050.long:
Meaning: "Beth-Rechob", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Beth-rehob.
Source: from "H1004" and "H7339"; house of (the) street;

1051.long:
Meaning: "Beth-Rapha", an Israelite.
Usage: Beth-rapha.
Source: from "H1004" and "H7497"; house of (the) giant;

1052.long:
Meaning: "Beth-Shean" or "Beth-Shan", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Beth-shean, Beth-Shan.
Source: or "בֵּית שָׁן"; from "H1004" and "H7599"; house of ease;

1053.long:
Meaning: "Beth-Shemesh", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Beth-shemesh.
Source: from "H1004" and "H8121"; house of (the) sun;

1054.long:
Meaning: "Beth-Tappuach", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Beth-tappuah.
Source: from "H1004" and "H8598"; house of (the) apple;

1055.long:
Meaning: a "palace" (i.e. large house).
Usage: palace.
Source: probably from "H1004";

1056.long:
Meaning: "Baca", a valley in Palestine.
Usage: Baca.
Source: from "H1058", weeping;

1057.long:
Meaning: the "weeping tree" (some gum-distilling tree, perhaps the balsam).
Usage: mulberry tree.
Source: the same as "H1056";

1058.long:
Meaning: to "weep"; generally to "bemoan".
Usage: × at all, bewail, complain, make lamentation, × more, mourn, × sore, × with tears, weep.
Source: a primitive root;

1061.long:
Meaning: the "first-fruits" of the crop.
Usage: first fruit (-ripe (figuratively)), hasty fruit.
Source: from "H1069";

1062.long:
Meaning: the "firstling" of man or beast; abstractly "primogeniture".
Usage: birthright, firstborn(-ling).
Source: or (short) "בְּכֹרָה"; feminine of "H1060";

1064.long:
Meaning: "Bekorath", an Israelite.
Usage: Bechorath.
Source: feminine of "H1062"; primogeniture;

1065.long:
Meaning: a "weeping"; by analogy, a "dripping".
Usage: overflowing, × sore, (continual) weeping, wept.
Source: from "H1058";

1066.long:
Meaning: "Bo-kim", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Bochim.
Source: plural active participle of "H1058"; (with the article) the weepers;

1069.long:
Meaning: to "give the birthright".
Usage: make firstborn, be firstling, bring forth first child (new fruit).
Source: a primitive root; properly, to burst the womb, i.e. (causatively) bear or make early fruit (of woman or tree); also (as denominative from "H1061")

1070.long:
Meaning: a young "camel".
Usage: dromedary.
Source: from "H1069" (in the sense of "youth");

1071.long:
Meaning: "Beker", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Becher.
Source: the same as "H1070";

1073.long:
Meaning: a "first-ripe" fig.
Usage: first-ripe.
Source: by orthographical variation for "H1063";

1076.long:
Meaning: a "Bakrite" (collectively) or descendants of Beker.
Usage: Bachrites.
Source: patronymically from "H1071";

1077.long:
Meaning: properly, a "failure"; by implication "nothing"; usually (adverb) "not" at all; also "lest".
Usage: lest, neither, no, none (that...), not (any), nothing.
Source: from "H1086";

1078.long:
Meaning: "Bel", the Baal of the Babylonians.
Usage: Bel.
Source: by contraction for "H1168";

1079.long:
Meaning: properly, "anxiety", i.e. (by implication) the "heart" (as its seat).
Usage: heart.
Source: (Aramaic) from "H1080";

1080.long:
Meaning: to "afflict".
Usage: wear out.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H1086" (but used only in a mental sense);

1081.long:
Meaning: "Baladan", the name of a Babylonian prince.
Usage: Baladan.
Source: from "H1078" and "H113" (contracted); "Bel" (is his) "lord";

1082.long:
Meaning: to "break off" or "loose" (in a favorable or unfavorable sense), i.e. "desist" (from grief) or "invade" (with destruction).
