Usage: comfort, (recover) strength(-en).
Source: a primitive root;

1083.long:
Meaning: "Bilgah", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Bilgah.
Source: from "H1082"; desistance;

1085.long:
Meaning: "Bildad", one of Job's friends.
Usage: Bildad.
Source: of uncertain derivation;

1086.long:
Meaning: to "fail"; by implication to "wear out", "decay" (causatively, "consume", "spend").
Usage: consume, enjoy long, become (make, wax) old, spend, waste.
Source: a primitive root;

1088.long:
Meaning: "Balah", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Balah.
Source: feminine of "H1087"; failure;

1089.long:
Meaning: to "palpitate"; hence, (causatively) to "terrify".
Usage: trouble.
Source: a primitive root (rather by transposition for "H926");

1090.long:
Meaning: "Bilhah", the name of one of Jacob's concubines; also of a place in Palestine.
Usage: Bilhah.
Source: from "H1089"; timid;

1092.long:
Meaning: "Bilhan", the name of an Edomite and of an Israelite.
Usage: Bilhan.
Source: from "H1089"; "timid";

1093.long:
Meaning: "excise" (on articles consumed).
Usage: tribute.
Source: (Aramaic) from a root corresponding to "H1086";

1094.long:
Meaning: (only in plural construction) "rags".
Usage: old.
Source: or (fully) "בְּלוֹי"; from "H1086";

1095.long:
Meaning: "Belteshatstsar", the Babylonian name of Daniel.
Usage: Belteshazzar.
Source: of foreign derivation;

1097.long:
Meaning: properly, "failure", i.e. "nothing" or "destruction"; usually (with preposition) "without", "not yet", "because not", "as long as", etc.
Usage: corruption, ig(norantly), for lack of, where no...is, so that no, none, not, un(awares), without.
Source: from "H1086";

1098.long:
Meaning: "mixed", i.e. (specifically) "feed" (for cattle).
Usage: corn, fodder, provender.
Source: from "H1101";

1100.long:
Meaning: "without profit", "worthlessness"; by extension, "destruction", "wickedness".
Usage: Belial, evil, naughty, ungodly (men), wicked.
Source: from "H1097" and "H3276";(often in connection with "H376", "H802", "H1121", etc.)

1101.long:
Meaning: to "overflow" (specifically with oil.); by implication, to "mix"; to "fodder".
Usage: anoint, confound, × fade, mingle, mix (self), give provender, temper.
Source: a primitive root; (also denominatively from "H1098") to fodder

1102.long:
Meaning: to "muzzle".
Usage: be held in.
Source: a primitive root;

1103.long:
Meaning: to "pinch sycamore figs" (a process necessary to ripen them).
Usage: gatherer.
Source: a primitive root;

1104.long:
Meaning: to "make away with" (specifically by "swallowing"); generally, to "destroy".
Usage: cover, destroy, devour, eat up, be at end, spend up, swallow down (up).
Source: a primitive root;

1105.long:
Meaning: a "gulp"; figuratively, "destruction".
Usage: devouring, that which he hath swallowed up.
Source: from "H1104";

1106.long:
Meaning: "Bela", the name of a place, also of an Edomite and of two Israelites.
Usage: Bela.
Source: the same as "H1105";

1107.long:
Meaning: "except", "without", "besides".
Usage: beside, not (in), save, without.
Source: or "בַּלְעֲדֵי"; constructive plural from "H1077" and "H5703", not till, i.e. (as preposition or adverb)

1108.long:
Meaning: a "Belaite" (collectively) or descendants of Bela.
Usage: Belaites.
Source: patronymically from "H1106";

1109.long:
Meaning: "Bilam", a Mesopotamian prophet; also a place in Palestine.
Usage: Balaam, Bileam.
Source: probably from "H1077" and "H5971"; not (of the) people, i.e. foreigner;

1111.long:
Meaning: "Balak", a Moabitish king.
Usage: Balak.
Source: from "H1110"; waster;

1112.long:
Meaning: "Belshatstsar", a Babylonian king.
Usage: Belshazzar.
Source: or "בֵּלְאשַׁצַּר"; of foreign origin (compare "H1095");

1114.long:
Meaning: "Bilshan", an Israelite.
Usage: Bilshan.
Source: of uncertain derivation;

1115.long:
Meaning: properly, a "failure of", i.e. (used only as a negative particle, usually with a prepositional prefix) "not", "except", "without", "unless", "besides", "because not", "until", etc.
Usage: because un(satiable), beside, but, continual, except, from, lest, neither, no more, none, not, nothing, save, that no, without.
Source: constructive feminine of "H1086" (equivalent to "H1097");

1116.long:
Meaning: an "elevation".
Usage: height, high place, wave.
Source: from an unused root (meaning to "be high");

1117.long:
Meaning: "Bamah", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Bamah. See also "H1120".
Source: the same as "H1116";

1118.long:
Meaning: "Bimhal", an Israelite.
Usage: Bimhal.
Source: probably from "H4107" with prepositional prefix; with pruning;

1119.long:
Meaning: "in", "with", "by", etc.
Usage: for, in into, through.
Source: prolongation for prepositional prefix;

1120.long:
Meaning: "Bamoth" or "Bamoth-Baal", a place East of the Jordan.
Usage: Bamoth, Bamoth-baal.
Source: plural of "H1116"; heights; or (fully) "בָּמוֹת בַּעַל"; from the same and "H1168"; heights of Baal;

1121.long:
Meaning: a "son" (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.).
Usage: afflicted, age, (Ahoh-) (Ammon-) (Hachmon-) (Lev-) ite, (anoint-) ed one, appointed to, ( ) arrow, (Assyr-) (Babylon-) (Egypt-) (Grec-) ian, one born, bough, branch, breed, (young) bullock, (young) calf, × came up in, child, colt, × common, × corn, daughter, × of first, firstborn, foal, very fruitful, postage, × in, kid, lamb, ( ) man, meet, mighty, nephew, old, ( ) people, rebel, robber, × servant born, × soldier, son, spark, steward, stranger, × surely, them of, tumultuous one, valiant(-est), whelp, worthy, young (one), youth.
Source: from "H1129";

1122.long:
Meaning: "Ben", an Israelite.
Usage: Ben.
Source: the same as "H1121";

1124.long:
Meaning: to "build".
Usage: build, make.
Source: (Aramaic) or "בְּנָה"; (Aramaic), corresponding to "H1129";

1125.long:
Meaning: "Ben-Abinadab", an Israelite.
Usage: the son of Abinadab.
Source: from "H1121" and "H40"; (the) son of Abinadab;

1126.long:
Meaning: "Ben-Oni", the original name of Benjamin.
Usage: Ben-oni.
Source: from "H1121" and "H205"; "son of my sorrow";

1127.long:
Meaning: "Ben-Geber", an Israelite.
Usage: the son of Geber.
Source: from "H1121" and "H1397"; son of (the) hero;

1128.long:
Meaning: "Ben-Deker", an Israelite.
Usage: the son of Dekar.
Source: from "H1121" and a derivative of "H1856"; son of piercing (or of a lance);

1129.long:
Meaning: to "build" (literally and figuratively).
Usage: (begin to) build(-er), obtain children, make, repair, set (up), × surely.
Source: a primitive root;

1130.long:
Meaning: "Ben-Hadad", the name of several Syrian kings.
Usage: Benhadad.
Source: from "H1121" and "H1908"; son of Hadad;

1131.long:
Meaning: "Binnui", an Israelite.
Usage: Binnui.
Source: from "H1129"; built up;

1132.long:
Meaning: "Ben-Zocheth", an Israelite.
Usage: Ben-zoketh.
Source: from "H1121" and "H2105"; son of Zocheth;

1133.long:
Meaning: "Ben-Chur", an Israelite.
Usage: the son of Hur.
Source: from "H1121" and "H2354"; son of Chur;

1134.long:
Meaning: "Ben-Chail", an Israelite.
Usage: Ben-hail.
Source: from "H1121" and "H2428"; son of might;

1135.long:
Meaning: "Ben-Chanan", an Israelite.
Usage: Ben-hanan.
Source: from "H1121" and "H2605"; son of Chanan;

1136.long:
Meaning: "Ben-Chesed", an Israelite.
Usage: the son of Hesed.
Source: from "H1121" and "H2617"; son of kindness;

1137.long:
Meaning: "Bani", the name of five Israelites.
Usage: Bani.
Source: from "H1129"; built;

1138.long:
Meaning: "Bunni" or "Buni", an Israelite.
Usage: Bunni.
Source: or (fuller) "בּוּנִי"; from "H1129"; built;

1139.long:
Meaning: "sons of lightning", "Bene-berak", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Bene-barak.
Source: from the plural construction of "H1121" and "H1300";

1141.long:
Meaning: "Benajah", the name of twelve Israelites.
Usage: Benaiah.
Source: or "בּנָיָהוּ"; (prolonged) from "H1129" and "H3050"; Jah has built;

1142.long:
Meaning: "Bene-Jaakan", a place in the Desert.
Usage: Bene-jaakan.
Source: from the plural of "H1121" and "H3292"; sons of Yaakan;

1143.long:
Meaning: "a double interval", i.e. "the space between two armies".
Usage: + champion.
Source: dual of "H996";

1144.long:
Meaning: "Binjamin", youngest son of Jacob; also the tribe descended from him, and its territory.
Usage: Benjamin.
Source: from "H1121" and "H3225"; son of (the) right hand;

1145.long:
Meaning: a "Benjaminite", or descendent of Benjamin.
Usage: Benjamite, of Benjamin.
Source: sometimes (with the article inserted) "בֵּן־הַיּמִינִי"; with "H376" inserted (1 Samuel 9:1) "בֶּן־אִישׁ ימִינִי"; son of a man of Jemini; or shortened "אִישׁ יְמִינִי"; (1 Samuel 9:4; Esther 2:5) a man of Jemini, or (1 Samuel 20:1) simply "יְמִינִי"; a Jeminite; (plural) "בְּנֵי יְמִינִי"; patron from "H1144";

1148.long:
Meaning: "Beninu", an Israelite.
Usage: Beninu.
Source: probably from "H1121" with pron. suff.; our son;

1149.long:
Meaning: to "be enraged".
Usage: be angry.
Source: (Aramaic) of uncertain affinity;

1150.long:
Meaning: "Bina" or "Binah", an Israelite.
Usage: Binea, Bineah.
Source: or "בִּנְעָה"; of uncertain derivation;

1151.long:
Meaning: "Ben-Ammi", a son of Lot.
Usage: Ben-ammi.
Source: from "H1121" and "H5971" with pronomial suffix; son of my people;

1152.long:
Meaning: "Besodejah", an Israelite.
Usage: Besodeiah.
Source: from "H5475" and "H3050" with prepositional prefix; in (the) counsel of Jehovah;

1153.long:
Meaning: "Besai", one of the Nethinim.
Usage: Besai.
Source: from "H947"; domineering;

1154.long:
Meaning: "an immature grape".
Usage: unripe grape.
Source: from an unused root meaning to be sour;

1155.long:
Usage: sour grape.
Source: from the same as "H1154"

1156.long:
Meaning: to "seek" or "ask".
Usage: ask, desire, make (petition), pray, request, seek.
Source: (Aramaic) or "בְּעָה"; (Aramaic), corresponding to "H1158";

1157.long:
Meaning: "in up to" or "over against"; generally "at", "beside", "among", "behind", "for", etc.
Usage: about, at by (means of), for, over, through, up (-on), within.
Source: from "H5704" with prepositional prefix;

1158.long:
Meaning: to "gush" over, i.e. to "swell"; (figuratively) to "desire" earnestly; by implication to "ask".
Usage: cause, inquire, seek up, swell out.
Source: a primitive root;

1160.long:
Meaning: "Beor", the name of the father of an Edomitish king; also of that of Balaam.
Usage: Beor.
Source: from "H1197" (in the sense of burning); a "lamp";

1162.long:
Meaning: "Boaz", the ancestor of David; also the name of a pillar in front of the temple.
Usage: Boaz.
Source: from an unused root of uncertain meaning;

1163.long:
Meaning: to "trample" down, i.e. (figuratively) "despise".
Usage: kick.
Source: a primitive root;

1165.long:
Meaning: "cattle".
Usage: beast, cattle.
Source: from "H1197" (in the sense of eating);

1166.long:
Meaning: to "be master"; hence, to "marry".
Usage: have dominion (over), be husband, marry(-ried, × wife).
Source: a primitive root; also as denominative from "H1167"

1167.long:
Meaning: a "master"; hence, a "husband", or (figuratively) "owner" (often used with another noun in modifications of this latter sense).
Usage: archer, babbler, bird, captain, chief man, confederate, have to do, dreamer, those to whom it is due, furious, those that are given to it, great, hairy, he that hath it, have, horseman, husband, lord, man, married, master, person, sworn, they of.
Source: from "H1166";

1168.long:
Meaning: "Baal", a Phoenician deity.
Usage: Baal, (plural) Baalim.
Source: the same as "H1167";

1170.long:
Meaning: "Baal-Berith", a special deity of the Shechemites.
Usage: Baal-berith.
Source: from "H1168" and "H1285"; Baal of (the) covenant;

1171.long:
Meaning: "Baal-Gad", a place in Syria.
Usage: Baal-gad.
Source: from "H1168" and "H1409"; Baal of Fortune;

1172.long:
Meaning: a "mistress".
Usage: that hath, mistress.
Source: feminine of "H1167";

1173.long:
Meaning: "Baalah", the name of three places in Palestine.
Usage: Baalah.
Source: the same as "H1172";

1174.long:
Meaning: "Baal-Hamon", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Baal-hamon.
Source: from "H1167" and "H1995"; possessor of a multitude;

1175.long:
Meaning: "Bealoth", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Bealoth, in Aloth (by mistake for a plural from "H5927" with prepositional prefix).
Source: plural of "H1172"; mistresses;

1176.long:
Meaning: "Baal-Zebub", a special deity of the Ekronites.
Usage: Baal-zebub.
Source: from "H1168" and "H2070"; Baal of (the) Fly;

1177.long:
Meaning: "Baal-Chanan", the name of an Edomite, also of an Israelite.
Usage: Baal-hanan.
Source: from "H1167" and "H2603"; "possessor of grace";

1178.long:
Meaning: "Baal-Chatsor", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Baal-hazor.
Source: from "H1167" and a modification of "H2691"; possessor of a village;

1179.long:
Meaning: "Baal-Chermon", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Baal-hermon.
Source: from "H1167" and "H2768"; possessor of Hermon;

1180.long:
Meaning: "Baali", a symbolical name for Jehovah.
Usage: Baali.
Source: from "H1167" with pron. suff.; my master;

1181.long:
Meaning: "Baale-Bamoth", a place East of the Jordan.
Usage: lords of the high places.
Source: from the plural of "H1168" and the plural of "H1116"; Baals of (the) heights;

1182.long:
Meaning: "Beeljada", an Israelite.
Usage: Beeliada.
Source: from "H1168" and "H3045"; Baal has known;

1183.long:
Meaning: "Bealjah", an Israelite.
Usage: Bealiah.
Source: from "H1167" and "H3050"; Jah (is) master;

1184.long:
Meaning: "Baale-Jehudah", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Baale of Judah.
Source: from the plural of "H1167" and "H3063"; masters of Judah;

1185.long:
Meaning: "Baalis", an Ammonitish king.
Usage: Baalis.
Source: probably from a derivative of "H5965" with prepositional prefix; in exultation;

1186.long:
Meaning: "Baal-Meon", a place East of the Jordan.
Usage: Baal-meon.
Source: from "H1168" and "H4583"; "Baal of" (the) "habitation" (of) (compare "H1010");

1187.long:
Meaning: "Baal-Peor", a Moabitish deity.
Usage: Baal-peor.
Source: from "H1168" and "H6465"; Baal of Peor;

1188.long:
Meaning: "Baal-Peratsim", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Baal-perazim.
Source: from "H1167" and the plural of "H6556"; possessor of breaches;

1189.long:
Meaning: "Baal-Tsephon", a place in Eqypt.
Usage: Baal-zephon.
Source: from "H1168" and "H6828" (in the sense of "cold") (according to others an Egyptian form of "Typhon", the destroyer); "Baal of winter";

1190.long:
Meaning: "Baal of Shalishah", Baal-Shalishah, a place in Palestine.
Usage: Baal-shalisha.
Source: from "H1168" and "H8031";

1191.long:
Meaning: "Baalath", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Baalath.
Source: a modification of "H1172"; mistressship;

1192.long:
Meaning: "Baalath-Beer", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Baalath-beer.
Source: from "H1172" and "H875"; mistress of a well;

1193.long:
Meaning: "Baal-Tamar", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Baal-tamar.
Source: from "H1167" and "H8558"; possessor of (the) palm-tree;

1194.long:
Meaning: "Beön", a place East of the Jordan.
Usage: Beon.
Source: probably a contraction of "H1010";

1195.long:
Meaning: "Baana", the name of four Israelite.
Usage: Baana, Baanah.
Source: the same as "H1196";

1196.long:
Meaning: "Baanah", the name of four Israelites.
Usage: Baanah.
Source: from a derivative of "H6031" with prepositional prefix; in affliction

1197.long:
Meaning: to "kindle", i.e. "consume" (by fire or by eating); to "be (-come) brutish".
Usage: be brutish, bring (put, take) away, burn, (cause to) eat (up), feed, heat, kindle, set (on fire), waste.
Source: a primitive root; also as denominative from "H1198"

1198.long:
Meaning: properly, "foot" (as consumed); i.e. (by exten.) of cattle "brutishness"; (concretely) "stupid".
Usage: brutish (person), foolish.
Source: from "H1197";

1199.long:
Meaning: "Baara", an Israelitish woman.
Usage: Baara.
Source: from "H1198"; brutish;

1201.long:
Meaning: "Basha", a king of Israel.
Usage: Baasha.
Source: from an unused root meaning to stink; offensiveness;

1202.long:
Meaning: "Baasejah", an Israelite.
Usage: Baaseiah.
Source: from "H6213" and "H3050" with a prepositional prefix; in (the) work of Jah;

1203.long:
Meaning: "Beeshterah", a place East of the Jordan.
Usage: Beeshterah.
Source: from "H6251" (as singular of "H6252") with a prepositional prefix; with Ashtoreth;

1204.long:
Meaning: to "fear".
Usage: affright, be (make) afraid, terrify, trouble.
Source: a primitive root;

1206.long:
Meaning: "mud" (as whitish clay).
Usage: mire.
Source: probably the same as "H948";

1207.long:
Meaning: a "swamp".
Usage: fen, mire(-ry place).
Source: intensive from "H1206";

1209.long:
Meaning: "Betsai", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Bezai.
Source: perhaps the same as "H1153";

1211.long:
Meaning: an "onion".
Usage: onion.
Source: from an unused root apparently meaning to peel;

1212.long:
Meaning: "Betsalel", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Bezaleel.
Source: probably from "H6738" and "H410" with a prepositional prefix; "in" (the) "shadow" (i.e. protection) "of God";

1213.long:
Meaning: "Batsluth" or "Batslith", an Israelite.
Usage: Bazlith, Bazluth.
Source: or "בַּצְלִית"; from the same as "H1211"; a peeling;

1214.long:
Meaning: to "break" off, i.e. (usually) "plunder"; figuratively, to "finish", or (intransitively) "stop".
Usage: (be) covet(-ous), cut (off), finish, fulfill, gain (greedily), get, be given to (covetousness), greedy, perform, be wounded.
Source: a primitive root

1215.long:
Meaning: "plunder"; by extension, "gain" (usually unjust).
Usage: covetousness, (dishonest) gain, lucre, profit.
Source: from "H1214";

1216.long:
Meaning: perhaps to "swell up", i.e. "blister".
Usage: swell.
Source: a primitive root;

1217.long:
Meaning: "dough" (as swelling by fermentation).
Usage: dough, flour.
Source: from "H1216";

1218.long:
Meaning: "Botscath", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Bozcath, Boskath.
Source: from "H1216"; a swell of ground;

1219.long:
Meaning: to "gather grapes"; also to "be isolated" (i.e. inaccessible by height or fortification).
Usage: cut off, (de-) fenced, fortify, (grape) gather(-er), mighty things, restrain, strong, wall (up), withhold.
Source: a primitive root; to clip off; specifically (as denominative from "H1210")

1220.long:
Meaning: strictly a "clipping", i.e. "gold" (as dug out).
Usage: gold defence.
Source: from "H1219";

1221.long:
Meaning: "Betser", a place in Palestine; also an Israelite.
Usage: Bezer.
Source: the same as "H1220", an inaccessible spot;

1223.long:
Meaning: an "enclosure", i.e. "sheep fold".
Usage: Bozrah.
Source: feminine from "H1219";

1224.long:
Meaning: "Botsrah", a place in Edom.
Usage: Bozrah.
Source: the same as "H1223";

1226.long:
Meaning: "restraint" (of rain), i.e. "drought".
Usage: dearth, drought.
Source: feminine intensive from "H1219";

1227.long:
Meaning: "Bakbuk", one of the Nethinim.
Usage: Bakbuk.
Source: the same as "H1228";

1228.long:
Meaning: a "bottle" (from the gurgling in emptying).
Usage: bottle, cruse.
Source: from "H1238";

1229.long:
Meaning: "Bakbukjah", an Israelite.
Usage: Bakbukiah.
Source: from "H1228" and "H3050"; emptying (i.e. wasting) of Jah;

1230.long:
Meaning: "Bakbakkar", an Israelite.
Usage: Bakbakkar.
Source: reduplicated from "H1239"; searcher;

1231.long:
Meaning: "Bukki", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Bukki.
Source: from "H1238"; wasteful;

1232.long:
Meaning: "Bukkijah", an Israelite.
Usage: Bukkiah.
Source: from "H1238" and "H3050"; wasting of Jah;

1234.long:
Meaning: to "cleave"; generally, to "rend", "break", "rip" or "open".
Usage: make a breach, break forth (into, out, in pieces, through, up), be ready to burst, cleave (asunder), cut out, divide, hatch, rend (asunder), rip up, tear, win.
Source: a primitive root;

1235.long:
Meaning: a "section" (half) of a shekel, i.e. a "beka" (a weight and a coin).
Usage: bekah, half a shekel.
Source: from "H1234";

1237.long:
Meaning: properly, a "split", i.e. a wide level valley between mountains.
Usage: plain, valley.
Source: from "H1234";

1238.long:
Meaning: to "pour" out, i.e. to "empty", figuratively, to "depopulate"; by analogy, to "spread" out (as a fruitful vine).
Usage: (make) empty (out), fail, × utterly, make void.
Source: a primitive root;

1239.long:
Meaning: properly, to "plough", or (generally) "break" forth, i.e. (figuratively) to "inspect", "admire", "care for", "consider".
Usage: (make) inquire (-ry), (make) search, seek out.
Source: a primitive root;

1241.long:
Meaning: a "beeve" or an animal of the ox family of either gender (as used for "plowing"); collectively, a "herd".
Usage: beeve, bull ( -ock), calf, cow, great (cattle), heifer, herd, kine, ox.
Source: from "H1239";

1242.long:
Meaning: properly, "dawn" (as the break of day); generally, "morning".
Usage: ( ) day, early, morning, morrow.
Source: from "H1239";

1243.long:
Meaning: a "looking after".
Usage: seek out.
Source: intensive from "H1239";

1245.long:
Meaning: to "search" out (by any method, specifically in worship or prayer); by implication, to "strive after".
Usage: ask, beg, beseech, desire, enquire, get, make inquisition, procure, (make) request, require, seek (for).
Source: a primitive root;

1247.long:
Meaning: a "son", "grandson", etc.
Usage: × old, son.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H1121";

1248.long:
Meaning: the "heir" (apparent to the throne).
Usage: son.
Source: borrowed (as a title) from "H1247";

1249.long:
Meaning: "beloved"; also "pure", "empty".
Usage: choice, clean, clear, pure.
Source: from "H1305" (in its various senses);

1250.long:
Meaning: "grain" of any kind (even while standing in the field); by extension "the open country".
Usage: corn, wheat.
Source: or "בַּר"; from "H1305" (in the sense of winnowing);

1253.long:
Meaning: vegetable "lye" (from its "cleansing"); used as a "soap" for washing, or a "flux" for metals.
Usage: × never so, purely.
Source: the same as "H1252";

1254.long:
Meaning: (absolutely) to "create"; (qualified) to "cut down" (a wood), "select", "feed" (as formative processes).
Usage: choose, create (creator), cut down, dispatch, do, make (fat).
Source: a primitive root;

1255.long:
Meaning: "Berodak-Baladan", a Babylonian king.
Usage: Berodach-baladan.
Source: a variation of "H4757";

1256.long:
Meaning: "Berajah", an Israelite.
Usage: Beraiah.
Source: from "H1254" and "H3050"; Jah has created;

1257.long:
Meaning: a "fowl" (as fattened on grain).
Usage: fowl.
Source: by reduplication from "H1250";

1260.long:
Meaning: "Bered", the name of a place south of Palestine, also of an Israelite.
Usage: Bered.
Source: from "H1258"; hail;

1262.long:
Meaning: to "select"; to "feed"; to "render clear".
Usage: choose, (cause to) eat, manifest, (give) meat.
Source: a primitive root; to select; also (as denominative from "H1250") to feed; also (as equivalent to "H1305") to render clear (Ecclesiastes 3:18)

1263.long:
Meaning: "Baruk", the name of three Israelites.
Usage: Baruch.
Source: passive participle from "H1288"; blessed;

1264.long:
Meaning: "damask" (stuff of variegated thread).
Usage: rich apparel.
Source: probably of foreign origin;

1265.long:
Meaning: a "cypress" (?) tree; hence, a "lance" or a "musical" instrument (as made of that wood).
Usage: fir (tree).
Source: of uncertain derivation;

1266.long:
Meaning: the "cypress" (or some elastic tree).
Usage: fir.
Source: a variation of "H1265";

1268.long:
Meaning: "Berothah" or "Berothai", a place north of Palestine.
Usage: Berothah, Berothai.
Source: or "בֵּרֹתַי"; probably from "H1266"; cypress or cypresslike;

1269.long:
Meaning: "Birzoth", an Israelite.
Usage: Birzavith (from the marg.).
Source: probably feminine plural from an unused root (apparently mean to pierce); holes;

1270.long:
Meaning: "iron" (as cutting); by extension, an "iron implement".
Usage: (ax) head, iron.
Source: perhaps from the root of "H1269";

1271.long:
Meaning: "Barzillai", the name of three Israelites.
Usage: Barzillai.
Source: from "H1270"; iron-hearted;

1272.long:
Meaning: to "bolt", i.e. figuratively, to "flee" suddenly.
Usage: chase (away); drive away, fain, flee (away), put to flight, make haste, reach, run away, shoot.
Source: a primitive root;

1273.long:
Meaning: a "Barchumite", or native of Bachurim.
Usage: Barhumite.
Source: by transposition for "H978";

1275.long:
Meaning: "Beri", an Israelite.
Usage: Beri.
Source: probably by contraction from "H882";

1276.long:
Meaning: (only in the plural and with the article) the "Berites", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Berites.
Source: of uncertain derivation;

1277.long:
Meaning: "fatted" or "plump".
Usage: fat ((fleshed), -ter), fed, firm, plenteous, rank.
Source: from "H1254" (in the sense of "H1262");

1278.long:
Meaning: a "creation", i.e. a "novelty".
Usage: new thing.
Source: feminine from "H1254";

1281.long:
Meaning: a "fugitive", i.e. the "serpent" (as "fleeing"), and the constellation by that name.
Usage: crooked, noble, piercing.
Source: or "בָּרִחַ"; (shortened) from "H1272";

1282.long:
Meaning: "Bariach", an Israelite.
Usage: Bariah.
Source: the same as "H1281";

1283.long:
Meaning: "Beriah", the name of four Israelites.
Usage: Beriah.
Source: apparently from the feminine of "H7451" with a prepositional prefix; "in trouble";

1284.long:
Meaning: a "Beriite" (collectively) or descendants of Beriah.
Usage: Beerites.
Source: patronymically from "H1283";

1285.long:
Meaning: a "compact" (because made by passing between pieces of flesh).
Usage: confederacy, (con-) feder(-ate), covenant, league.
Source: from "H1262" (in the sense of cutting [like "H1254"]);

1286.long:
Meaning: "Berith", a Shechemitish deity.
Usage: Berith.
Source: the same as "H1285";

1288.long:
Meaning: to "kneel"; by implication to "bless" God (as an act of adoration), and (vice-versa) man (as a benefit); also (by euphemism) to "curse" (God or the king, as treason).
Usage: × abundantly, × altogether, × at all, blaspheme, bless, congratulate, curse, × greatly, × indeed, kneel (down), praise, salute, × still, thank.
Source: a primitive root;

1292.long:
Meaning: "Barakel", the father of one of Job's friends.
Usage: Barachel.
Source: from "H1288" and "H410", God has blessed;

1293.long:
Meaning: "benediction"; by implication "prosperity".
Usage: blessing, liberal, pool, present.
Source: from "H1288";

1294.long:
Meaning: "Berakah", the name of an Israelite, and also of a valley in Palestine.
Usage: Berachah.
Source: the same as "H1293";

1295.long:
Meaning: a "reservoir" (at which camels "kneel" as a resting-place).
Usage: (fish-) pool.
Source: from "H1288";

1296.long:
Meaning: "Berekjah", the name of six Israelites.
Usage: Berachiah, Berechiah.
Source: or "בֶּרֶכְיָהוּ"; from "H1290" and "H3050"; knee (i.e. blessing) of Jah;

1297.long:
Meaning: properly, "highly", i.e. "surely"; but used adversatively, "however".
Usage: but, nevertheless, yet.
Source: (Aramaic) perhaps from "H7313" with a prepositional prefix;

1298.long:
Meaning: "Bera", a Sodomitish king.
Usage: Bera.
Source: of uncertain derivation;

1299.long:
Meaning: "to lighten" (lightning).
Usage: cast forth.
Source: a primitive root;

1300.long:
Meaning: "lightning"; by analogy, a "gleam"; concretely, a "flashing sword".
Usage: bright, glitter(-ing sword), lightning.
Source: from "H1299";

1301.long:
Meaning: "Barak", an Israelite.
Usage: Barak.
Source: the same as "H1300";

1302.long:
Meaning: "Barkos", one of the Nethimim.
Usage: Barkos.
Source: of uncertain derivation;

1303.long:
Meaning: a "thorn" (perhaps as burning brightly).
Usage: brier.
Source: from "H1300";

1304.long:
Meaning: a gem (as "flashing"), perhaps the "emerald".
Usage: carbuncle.
Source: or "בָּרְקַת"; from "H1300";

1305.long:
Meaning: to "clarify" (i.e. "brighten"), "examine", "select".
Usage: make bright, choice, chosen, cleanse (be clean), clearly, polished, (shew self) pure(-ify), purge (out).
Source: a primitive root;

1306.long:
Meaning: "Birsha", a king of Gomorrah.
Usage: Birsha.
Source: probably from "H7562" with a prepositional prefix; with wickedness;

1307.long:
Meaning: a "Berothite", or inhabitant of Berothai.
Usage: Berothite.
Source: patrial from "H1268";

1308.long:
Meaning: "Besor", a stream of Palestine.
Usage: Besor.
Source: from "H1319"; cheerful;

1309.long:
Meaning: "glad tidings"; by implication, "reward for good news".
Usage: reward for tidings.
Source: or (shortened) "בְּשֹׂרָה"; feminine from "H1319";

1310.long:
Meaning: properly, to "boil" up; hence, to "be done" in cooking; figuratively to "ripen".
Usage: bake, boil, bring forth, roast, seethe, sod (be sodden).
Source: a primitive root;

1312.long:
Meaning: "Bishlam", a Persian.
Usage: Bishlam.
Source: of foreign derivation;

1313.long:
Meaning: "the balsam plant".
Usage: spice.
Source: from an unused root meaning to be fragrant; (compare "H5561")

1314.long:
Meaning: "fragrance"; by implication, "spicery"; also the "balsam" plant.
Usage: smell, spice, sweet (odour).
Source: or "בֹּשֶׂם"; from the same as "H1313";

1315.long:
Meaning: "Bosmath", the name of a wife of Esau, and of a daughter of Solomon.
Usage: Bashemath, Basmath.
Source: feminine of "H1314" (the second form); "fragrance";

1316.long:
Meaning: "Bashan" (often with the article), a region East of the Jordan.
Usage: Bashan.
Source: of uncertain derivation;

1318.long:
Meaning: to "trample down".
Usage: tread.
Source: a primitive root;

1319.long:
Meaning: properly, to "be fresh", i.e. "full" ("rosy", figuratively "cheerful"); "to announce" (glad news).
Usage: messenger, preach, publish, shew forth, (bear, bring, carry, preach, good, tell good) tidings.
Source: a primitive root;

1320.long:
Meaning: "flesh" (from its "freshness"); by extension, "body", "person"; also (by euphemistically) the "pudenda" of a man.
Usage: body, (fat, lean) flesh(-ed), kin, (man-) kind, nakedness, self, skin.
Source: from "H1319";

1322.long:
Meaning: "shame" (the feeling and the condition, as well as its cause); by implication (specifically) an "idol".
Usage: ashamed, confusion, greatly, (put to) shame(-ful thing).
Source: from "H954";

1323.long:
Meaning: a "daughter" (used in the same wide sense as other terms of relationship, literally and figuratively).
Usage: apple (of the eye), branch, company, daughter, × first, × old, owl, town, village.
Source: from "H1129" (as feminine of "H1121");

1324.long:
Meaning: a "bath" or Hebrew measure (as a means of "division") of liquids.
Usage: bath.
Source: probably from the same as "H1327";

1326.long:
Meaning: "desolation".
Usage: waste.
Source: probably an orthographical variation for "H1327";

1327.long:
Meaning: "desolation".
Usage: desolate.
Source: feminine from an unused root (meaning to "break" in pieces);

1328.long:
Meaning: "Bethuel", the name of a nephew of Abraham, and of a place in Palestine.
Usage: Bethuel. Compare "H1329".
Source: apparently from the same as "H1326" and "H410"; destroyed of God;

1329.long:
Meaning: "Bethul" (i.e. Bethuel), a place in Palestine.
Usage: Bethuel.
Source: for "H1328";

1330.long:
Meaning: a "virgin" (from her privacy); sometimes (by continuation) a "bride"; also (figuratively) a city or state.
Usage: maid, virgin.
Source: feminine passive participle of an unused root meaning to separate;

1331.long:
Meaning: (collectively and abstractly) "virginity"; by implication and concretely, the "tokens" of it.
Usage: × maid, virginity.
Source: masculine plural of the same as "H1330";

1332.long:
Meaning: "Bithjah", an Egyptian woman.
Usage: Bithiah.
Source: from "H1323" and "H3050"; daughter (i.e. worshipper) of Jah;

1333.long:
Meaning: to "cut in pieces".
Usage: thrust through.
Source: a primitive root;

1334.long:
Meaning: to "chop up".
Usage: divide.
Source: a primitive root,

1336.long:
Meaning: "Bether", a (craggy) place in Palestine.
Usage: Bether.
Source: the same as "H1335";

1337.long:
Meaning: the "daughter" (i.e. city) "of Rabbah".
Usage: Bath-rabbim.
Source: from "H1323" and a masculine plural from "H7227";

1338.long:
Meaning: "Bithron", a place East of the Jordan.
Usage: Bithron.
Source: from "H1334"; (with the article) the craggy spot;

1339.long:
Meaning: "Bath-Sheba", the mother of Solomon.
Usage: Bath-sheba.
Source: from "H1323" and "H7651" (in the sense of "H7650"); daughter of an oath;

1340.long:
Meaning: "Bath-shua".
Usage: Bath-shua.
Source: from "H1323" and "H7771"; daughter of wealth; the same as "H1339"

1342.long:
Meaning: to "mount" up; hence, in general, to "rise", (figuratively) be "majestic".
Usage: gloriously, grow up, increase, be risen, triumph.
Source: a primitive root;

1345.long:
Meaning: "Geuel", an Israelite.
Usage: Geuel.
Source: from "H1342" and "H410"; majesty of God;

1346.long:
Meaning: "arrogance" or "majesty"; by implication, (concretely) "ornament".
Usage: excellency, haughtiness, highness, pride, proudly, swelling.
Source: from "H1342";

1347.long:
Meaning: the same as "H1346".
Usage: arrogancy, excellency(-lent), majesty, pomp, pride, proud, swelling.
Source: from "H1342";

1348.long:
Meaning: the same as "H1346".
Usage: excellent things, lifting up, majesty, pride, proudly, raging.
Source: from "H1342";

1350.long:
Meaning: to "redeem" (according to the Oriental law of kinship), i.e. to "be the next of kin" (and as such to "buy back" a relative's property, "marry" his widow, etc.).
Usage: × in any wise, × at all, avenger, deliver, (do, perform the part of near, next) kinsfolk(-man), purchase, ransom, redeem(-er), revenger.
Source: a primitive root,

1351.long:
Meaning: to "soil" or (figuratively) "desecrate".
Usage: defile, pollute, stain.
Source: a primitive root, (rather identified with "H1350", through the idea of "freeing", i.e. "repudiating");

1353.long:
Meaning: "redemption" (including the right and the object); by implication, "relationship".
Usage: kindred, redeem, redemption, right.
Source: feminine passive participle of "H1350";

1354.long:
Meaning: the "back" (as rounded); by analogy, the "top" or "rim", a "boss", a "vault", "arch of eye", "bulwarks", etc.
Usage: back, body, boss, eminent (higher) place, (eye) brows, nave, ring.
Source: from an unused root meaning to hollow or curve; (compare "H1460" and "H1479")

1356.long:
Meaning: a "log" (as cut out); also "well" or "cistern" (as dug).
Usage: beam, ditch, pit.
Source: from "H1461";

1357.long:
Meaning: a "locust" (from its cutting).
Usage: locust.
Source: probably from "H1461" (compare "H1462");

1358.long:
Meaning: a "pit" (for wild animals) (as cut out).
Usage: den.
Source: (Aramaic) from a root corresponding to "H1461";

1359.long:
Meaning: "Gob", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Gob.
Source: or (fully) "גּוֹב"; from "H1461"; pit;

1360.long:
Meaning: a "reservoir"; by analogy, a "marsh".
Usage: marish, pit.
Source: from an unused root meaning probably to "collect";

1361.long:
Meaning: to "soar", i.e. "be lofty"; figuratively, to "be haughty".
Usage: exalt, be haughty, be (make) high(-er), lift up, mount up, be proud, raise up great height, upward.
Source: a primitive root;

1363.long:
Meaning: "elation", "grandeur", "arrogance".
Usage: excellency, haughty, height, high, loftiness, pride.
Source: from "H1361";

1364.long:
Meaning: "elevated" (or elated), "powerful", "arrogant".
Usage: haughty, height, high(-er), lofty, proud, × exceeding proudly.
Source: or "גָּבוֹהַּ"; (fully) from "H1361";

1366.long:
Meaning: properly, a "cord" (as "twisted"), i.e. (by implication) a "boundary"; by extension the "territory" inclosed.
Usage: border, bound, coast, × great, landmark, limit, quarter, space.
Source: or "גְּבֻל"; (shortened) from "H1379";

1367.long:
Meaning: a "boundary", "region".
Usage: border, bound, coast, landmark. place.
Source: or "גְּבֻלָה"; (shortened) feminine of "H1366";

1368.long:
Meaning: "powerful"; by implication, "warrior", "tyrant".
Usage: champion, chief, × excel, giant, man, mighty (man, one), strong (man), valiant man.
Source: or "גִּבֹּר"; (shortened) intensive from the same as "H1397";

1369.long:
Meaning: "force" (literally or figuratively); by implication, "valor", "victory".
Usage: force, mastery, might, mighty (act, power), power, strength.
Source: feminine passive participle from the same as "H1368";

1371.long:
Meaning: "bald" in the forehead.
Usage: forehead bald.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "be high" (in the forehead);

1372.long:
Meaning: "baldness" in the forehead; by analogy, a "bare spot" on the right side of cloth.
Usage: bald forehead, × without.
Source: from the same as "H1371";

1373.long:
Meaning: "Gabbai", an Israelite.
Usage: Gabbai.
Source: from the same as "H1354"; collective

1374.long:
Meaning: "Gebim", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Gebim.
Source: plural of "H1356"; "cisterns";

1375.long:
Meaning: a "goblet"; by analogy, the "calyx" of a flower.
Usage: house, cup, pot.
Source: from an unused root (meaning to be convex);

1378.long:
Meaning: "crystal" (from its resemblance to ice).
Usage: pearl.
Source: from an unused root (probably meaning to freeze);

1379.long:
Meaning: properly, to "twist" as a rope; to "bound" (as by a line).
Usage: be border, set (bounds about).
Source: a primitive root; also as a denominative from "H1366"

1380.long:
Meaning: "Gebal", a place in Phoenicia.
Usage: Gebal.
Source: from "H1379" (in the sense of a chain of hills); a mountain;

1381.long:
Meaning: "Gebal", a region in Idumaea.
Usage: Gebal.
Source: the same as "H1380";

1382.long:
Meaning: a "Gebalite", or inhabitant of Gebal.
Usage: Giblites, stone-squarer.
Source: ; patrial from "H1380";

1384.long:
Meaning: "hunch-backed".
Usage: crookbackt.
Source: from an unused root meaning to be arched or contracted;

1385.long:
Meaning: "curdled milk".
Usage: cheese.
Source: feminine from the same as "H1384";

1386.long:
Meaning: a "hump" or "peak of hills".
Usage: high.
Source: from the same as "H1384";

1387.long:
Meaning: "Geba", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Gaba, Geba, Gibeah.
Source: from the same as "H1375", a "hillock";

1388.long:
Meaning: "Giba", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Gibeah.
Source: by permutation for "H1389"; a hill;

1389.long:
Meaning: a "hillock".
Usage: hill, little hill.
Source: feminine from the same as "H1387";

1390.long:
Meaning: "Gibah"; the name of three places in Palestine.
Usage: Gibeah, the hill.
Source: the same as "H1389";

1391.long:
Meaning: "Gibon", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Gibeon.
Source: from the same as "H1387"; "hilly";

1392.long:
Meaning: the "calyx of a flower".
Usage: bolled.
Source: prolonged from "H1375";

1393.long:
Meaning: a "Gibonite", or inhabitant of Gibon.
Usage: Gibeonite.
Source: patrial from "H1391";

1395.long:
Meaning: a "Gibathite", or inhabitant of Gibath.
Usage: Gibeathite.
Source: patrial from "H1390";

1396.long:
Meaning: to "be strong"; by implication, to "prevail", "act insolently".
Usage: exceed, confirm, be great, be mighty, prevail, put to more (strength), strengthen, be stronger, be valiant.
Source: a primitive root;

1397.long:
Meaning: properly, a "valiant" man or "warrior"; generally, a "person" simply.
Usage: every one, man, × mighty.
Source: from "H1396";

1398.long:
Meaning: "Geber", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Geber.
Source: the same as "H1397";

1399.long:
Meaning: a person.
Usage: man.
Source: from "H1396"; the same as "H1397";

1403.long:
Meaning: "Gabriel", an archangel.
Usage: Gabriel.
Source: from "H1397" and "H410"; man of God;

1405.long:
Meaning: "Gibbethon", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Gibbethon.
Source: intensive from "H1389"; a hilly spot;

1406.long:
Meaning: a "roof"; by analogy, the "top" of an altar.
Usage: roof (of the house), (house) top (of the house).
Source: probably by reduplication from "H1342";

1407.long:
Meaning: "coriander" seed (from its furrows).
Usage: coriander.
Source: from "H1413" (in the sense of "cutting");

1408.long:
Meaning: "Fortune", a Babylonian deity.
Usage: that troop.
Source: a variation of "H1409";

1409.long:
Meaning: "fortune".
Usage: troop.
Source: from "H1464" (in the sense of distributing);

1410.long:
Meaning: "Gad", a son of Jacob, including his tribe and its territory; also a prophet.
Usage: Gad.
Source: from "H1464";

1412.long:
Meaning: "Gudgodah", a place in the Desert.
Usage: Gudgodah.
Source: by reduplication from "H1413" (in the sense of cutting) "cleft";

1413.long:
Meaning: to "crowd"; also to "gash" (as if by pressing into).
Usage: assemble (selves by troops), gather (selves together, self in troops), cut selves.
Source: a primitive root (compare "H1464");

1414.long:
Meaning: to "cut down".
Usage: hew down.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H1413";

1415.long:
Meaning: a "border" of a river (as "cut" into by the stream).
Usage: bank.
Source: from an unused root (meaning to "cut" off);

1416.long:
Meaning: a "crowd" (especially of soldiers).
Usage: army, band (of men), company, troop (of robbers).
Source: from "H1413";

1418.long:
Meaning: an "incision".
Usage: cutting.
Source: feminine participle passive of "H1413";

1419.long:
Meaning: "great" (in any sense); hence, "older"; also "insolent".
Usage: aloud, elder(-est), exceeding(-ly), far, (man of) great (man, matter, thing,-er,-ness), high, long, loud, mighty, more, much, noble, proud thing, × sore, (×) very.
Source: or "גָּדֹל"; (shortened) from "H1431";

1420.long:
Meaning: "greatness"; (concretely) "mighty acts".
Usage: dignity, great things(-ness), majesty.
Source: or "גְּדֻלָּה"; (shortened) or (less accurately) "גְּדוּלָּה"; feminine of "H1419";

1421.long:
Meaning: "vilification".
Usage: reproach, reviling.
Source: or (shortened) "גִּדֻּף"; and (feminine) "גִּדּוּפָה"; or "גִּדֻּפָה"; from "H1422";

1422.long:
Meaning: a "revilement".
Usage: taunt.
Source: feminine passive participle of "H1442";

1423.long:
Meaning: a "young goat" (from browsing).
Usage: kid.
Source: from the same as "H1415";

1425.long:
Meaning: a "Gadite" (collectively) or descendants of Gad.
Usage: Gadites, children of Gad.
Source: patronymically from "H1410";

1427.long:
Meaning: "Gaddiel", an Israelite.
Usage: Gaddiel.
Source: from "H1409" and "H410"; "fortune of God";

1428.long:
Meaning: "a river brink".
Usage: bank.
Source: or "גַּדיָה"; the same as "H1415";

1429.long:
Meaning: a "young female goat".
Usage: kid.
Source: feminine of "H1423";

1430.long:
Meaning: a "stack" of sheaves; by analogy, a "tomb".
Usage: shock (stack) (of corn), tomb.
Source: from an unused root (meaning to heap up);

1431.long:
Meaning: to "be" (causatively "make") "large" (in various senses, as in body, mind, estate or honor, also in pride).
Usage: advance, boast, bring up, exceed, excellent, be(-come, do, give, make, wax), great(-er, come to... estate, things), grow(up), increase, lift up, magnify(-ifical), be much set by, nourish (up), pass, promote, proudly (spoken), tower.
Source: a primitive root; properly, to twist (compare "H1434"), i.e.

1434.long:
Meaning: "thread", i.e. a "tassel" or "festoon".
Usage: fringe, wreath.
Source: from "H1431" (in the sense of twisting);

1435.long:
Meaning: "Giddel", the name of one of the Nethinim, also of one of 'Solomon's servants'.
Usage: Giddel.
Source: from "H1431"; stout;

1436.long:
Meaning: "Gedaljah", the name of five Israelites.
Usage: Gedaliah.
Source: or (prolonged) "גְּדַלְיָהוּ"; from "H1431" and "H3050"; Jah has become great;

1437.long:
Meaning: "Giddalti", an Israelite.
Usage: Giddalti.
Source: from "H1431"; I have made great;

1438.long:
Meaning: to "fell" a tree; generally, to "destroy" anything.
Usage: cut (asunder, in sunder, down, off), hew down.
Source: a primitive root;

1439.long:
Meaning: "Gidon", an Israelite.
Usage: Gideon.
Source: from "H1438"; feller (i.e. warrior);

1440.long:
Meaning: "Gidom", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Gidom.
Source: from "H1438"; a cutting (i.e. desolation);

1442.long:
Meaning: to "hack" (with words), i.e. "revile".
Usage: blaspheme, reproach.
Source: a primitive root;

1443.long:
Meaning: to "wall" in or around.
Usage: close up, fence up, hedge, inclose, make up (a wall), mason, repairer.
Source: a primitive root;

1445.long:
Meaning: "Geder", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Geder.
Source: ; the same as "H1444";

1446.long:
Meaning: "Gedor", a place in Palestine; also the name of three Israelites.
Usage: Gedor.
Source: or (fully) "גְּדוֹר"; from "H1443"; inclosure;

1447.long:
Meaning: a "circumvallation"; by implication, an "inclosure".
Usage: fence, hedge, wall.
Source: from "H1443";

1448.long:
Meaning: "inclosure" (especially for flocks).
Usage: (sheep-) cote (fold) hedge, wall.
Source: feminine of "H1447";

1449.long:
Meaning: (with the article) "Gederah", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Gederah, hedges.
Source: the same as "H1448";

1450.long:
Meaning: "Gederoth", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Gederoth.
Source: plural of "H1448"; walls;

1451.long:
Meaning: a "Gederite", or inhabitant of Geder.
Usage: Gederite.
Source: patrial from "H1445";

1452.long:
Meaning: a "Gederathite", or inhabitant of Gederah.
Usage: Gederathite.
Source: patrial from "H1449";

1453.long:
Meaning: "Gederothajim", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Gederothaim.
Source: dual of "H1448"; double wall;

1454.long:
Meaning: "this".
Usage: this.
Source: probably a clerical error for "H2088";

1455.long:
Meaning: to "remove" (a bandage from a wound, i.e. heal it).
Usage: cure.
Source: a primitive root;

1457.long:
Meaning: to "prostrate oneself".
Usage: cast self down, stretch self.
Source: a primitive root;

1459.long:
Meaning: the "middle".
Usage: midst, same, there-(where-) in.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H1460";

1460.long:
Meaning: the "back"; by analogy, the "middle".
Usage: among, back, body.
Source: from "H1342" (corresponding to "H1354");

1462.long:
Meaning: the "locust" (from its grubbing as a larvae).
Usage: grasshopper, × great.
Source: from "H1461";

1463.long:
Meaning: "Gog", the name of an Israelite, also of some northern nation.
Usage: Gog.
Source: of uncertain derivation;

1464.long:
Meaning: to "crowd upon", i.e. "attack".
Usage: invade, overcome.
Source: a primitive root (akin to "H1413");

1465.long:
Meaning: the "back", i.e. (by extension) the "person".
Usage: body.
Source: feminine of "H1460";

1466.long:
Meaning: "exaltation"; (figuratively) "arrogance".
Usage: lifting up, pride.
Source: the same as "H1465";

1468.long:
Meaning: properly, to "shear off"; but used only in the (figuratively) sense of "passing rapidly".
Usage: bring, cut off.
Source: a primitive root (compare "H1494");

1469.long:
Meaning: a "nestling" (as being comparatively nude of feathers).
Usage: young (pigeon).
Source: or (shortened) "גֹזָל"; from "H1497";

1470.long:
Meaning: "Gozan", a province of Assyria.
Usage: Gozan.
Source: probably from "H1468"; a "quarry" (as a place of "cutting" stones);

1471.long:
Meaning: a foreign "nation"; hence, "a Gentile"; also (figuratively) a "troop" of animals, or a "flight" of locusts.
Usage: Gentile, heathen, nation, people.
Source: rarely (shortened) "גֹּי"; apparently from the same root as "H1465" (in the sense of massing);

1472.long:
Meaning: a "body", whether alive or dead.
Usage: (dead) body, carcase, corpse.
Source: prolonged for "H1465";

1473.long:
Meaning: "exile"; concretely and collectively "exiles".
Usage: (carried away), captive(-ity), removing.
Source: or (shortened) "גֹּלָה"; active participle feminine of "H1540";

1474.long:
Meaning: "Golan", a place east of the Jordan.
Usage: Golan.
Source: from "H1473"; "captive";

1476.long:
Meaning: "Guni", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Guni.
Source: probably from "H1598"; "protected";

1477.long:
Meaning: a "Gunite" (collectively with article prefix) or descendants of Guni.
Usage: Gunites.
Source: patronymically from "H1476";

1478.long:
Meaning: to "breathe out", i.e. (by implication) "expire".
Usage: die, be dead, give up the ghost, perish.
Source: a primitive root;

1479.long:
Meaning: properly, to "hollow" or "arch", i.e. (figuratively) "close"; to "shut".
Usage: shut.
Source: a primitive root;

1480.long:
Meaning: a "corpse" (as closed to sense).
Usage: body.
Source: from "H1479";

1481.long:
Meaning: properly, to "turn" aside from the road (for a lodging or any other purpose), i.e. "sojourn" (as a guest); also to "shrink", "fear" (as in a "strange" place); also to "gather" for hostility (as "afraid").
Usage: abide, assemble, be afraid, dwell, fear, gather (together), inhabitant, remain, sojourn, stand in awe, (be) stranger, × surely.
Source: a primitive root;

1482.long:
Meaning: a "cub" (as still abiding in the lair), especially of the "lion".
Usage: whelp, young one.
Source: or (shortened) "גֻּר"; perhaps from "H1481";

1483.long:
Meaning: "Gur", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Gur.
Source: the same as "H1482";

1485.long:
Meaning: "Gur-Baal", a place in Arabia.
Usage: Gur-baal.
Source: from "H1481" and "H1168"; dwelling of Baal;

1486.long:
Meaning: properly, a "pebble", i.e. a "lot" (small stones being used for that purpose); figuratively, a "portion" or "destiny" (as if determined by lot).
Usage: lot.
Source: or (shortened) "גֹּרָל"; from an unused root meaning to be rough (as stone);

1487.long:
Meaning: a "mass of earth".
Usage: clod.
Source: or rather (by permutation) "גִּישׁ"; of uncertain derivation;

1488.long:
Meaning: a "fleece" (as shorn); also "mown grass".
Usage: fleece, mowing, mown grass.
Source: from "H1494";

1491.long:
Meaning: to "cut off", i.e. "portion out".
Usage: take.
Source: a primitive root (akin to "H1468");

1493.long:
Meaning: a "Gizonite" or inhabitant of Gizoh.
Usage: Gizonite.
Source: patrial from the unused name of a place apparently in Palestine;

1494.long:
Meaning: to "cut off"; specifically to "shear" a flock or "shave" the hair; figuratively to "destroy" an enemy.
Usage: cut off (down), poll, shave, (sheep-) shear(-er).
Source: a primitive root (akin to "H1468");

1495.long:
Meaning: "Gazez", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Gazez.
Source: from "H1494"; shearer;

1496.long:
Meaning: something "cut", i.e. "dressed" stone.
Usage: hewed, hewn stone, wrought.
Source: from "H1491";

1497.long:
Meaning: to "pluck off"; specifically to "flay", "strip" or "rob".
Usage: catch, consume, exercise (robbery), pluck (off), rob, spoil, take away (by force, violence), tear.
Source: a primitive root;

1498.long:
Meaning: "robbery", or (concretely) "plunder".
Usage: robbery, thing taken away by violence.
Source: from "H1497";

1499.long:
Meaning: "plunder", i.e. "violence".
Usage: violence, violent perverting.. gozal. See "H1469".
Source: from "H1497";

1500.long:
Usage: that (he had robbed) (which he took violently away), spoil, violence.
Source: feminine of "H1498" and meaning the same

1501.long:
Meaning: a kind of "locust".
Usage: palmer-worm.
Source: from an unused root meaning to devour;

1502.long:
Meaning: "Gazzam", one of the Nethinim.
Usage: Gazzam.
Source: from the same as "H1501"; devourer

1503.long:
Meaning: the "trunk" or "stump" of a tree (as felled or as planted).
Usage: stem, stock.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "cut" down (trees);

1504.long:
Meaning: to "cut" down or off; (figuratively) to "destroy", "divide", "exclude", or "decide".
Usage: cut down (off), decree, divide, snatch.
Source: a primitive root;

1505.long:
Meaning: to "quarry"; "determine".
Usage: cut out, soothsayer.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H1504";

1506.long:
Meaning: something "cut off"; a "portion".
Usage: part, piece.
Source: from "H1504";

1507.long:
Meaning: "Gezer", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Gazer, Gezer.
Source: the same as "H1506";

1508.long:
Meaning: the "figure" or "person" (as if cut out); also an "inclosure" (as separated).
Usage: polishing, separate place.
Source: feminine of "H1506";

1511.long:
Meaning: a "Grizite" (collectively) or member of a native tribe in Palestine.
Usage: Gezrites.
Source: (in the m patrial from "H1507"; a Gezerite (collectively) or inhabitants of Gezer; but better (as in the text) bytransposition "גִּזְרִי"; patrial of "H1630";

1512.long:
Meaning: the "external abdomen", "belly" (as the source of the faetus).
Usage: belly.
Source: probably from "H1518"; (compare "H1521")

1513.long:
Meaning: an "ember".
Usage: (burning) coal.
Source: or (feminine) "גַּחֶלֶת"; from an unused root meaning to "glow" or "kindle";

1514.long:
Meaning: "Gacham", a son of Nahor.
Usage: Gaham.
Source: from an unused root meaning to burn; flame;

1515.long:
Meaning: "Gachar", one of the Nethinim.
Usage: Gahar.
Source: from an unused root meaning to hide; lurker;

1516.long:
Meaning: a "gorge" (from its "lofty" sides; hence, narrow, but not a gully or winter-torrent).
Usage: valley.
Source: or (shortened) "גַּי"; probably (by transmutation) from the same root as "H1466" (abbreviated);

1517.long:
Meaning: a "thong" (as compressing); by analogy, a "tendon".
Usage: sinew.
Source: probably from "H1464";

1518.long:
Meaning: to "gush forth" (as water), generally to "issue".
Usage: break forth, labor to bring forth, come forth, draw up, take out.
Source: or (shortened) "גֹּחַ"; a primitive root;

1519.long:
Meaning: to "rush" forth.
Usage: strive.
Source: (Aramaic) or (shortened) "גּוּחַ"; (Aramaic), corresponding to "H1518";

1520.long:
Meaning: "Giach", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Giah.
Source: from "H1518"; a fountain;

1521.long:
Meaning: "Gichon", a river of Paradise; also a valley (or pool) near Jerusalem.
Usage: Gihon.
Source: or (shortened) "גִּחוֹן"; from "H1518"; stream;

1522.long:
Meaning: "Gechazi", the servant of Elisha.
Usage: Gehazi.
Source: or "גֵּחֲזִי"; apparently from "H1516" and "H2372"; valley of a visionary;

1523.long:
Meaning: properly, to "spin" round (under the influence of any violent emotion), i.e. usually "rejoice", or (as "cringing") "fear".
Usage: be glad, joy, be joyful, rejoice.
Source: or (by permutation) "גּוּל"; a primitive root;

1524.long:
Meaning: a "revolution" (of time, i.e. an age); also "joy".
Usage: × exceedingly, gladness, × greatly, joy, rejoice(-ing), sort.
Source: from "H1523";

1526.long:
Meaning: a "Gilonite" or inhabitant of Giloh.
Usage: Gilonite.
Source: patrial from "H1542";

1527.long:
Meaning: "Ginath", an Israelite.
Usage: Ginath.
Source: of uncertain derivation;

1529.long:
Meaning: "Geshan", an Israelite.
Usage: Geshan.
Source: from the same as "H1487"; lumpish;

1530.long:
Meaning: something "rolled", i.e. a "heap" of stone or dung (plural "ruins"), by analogy, a "spring" of water (plural "waves").
Usage: billow, heap, spring, wave.
Source: from "H1556";

1531.long:
Meaning: "a cup for oil" (as round).
Usage: bowl.
Source: from "H1556";

1532.long:
Meaning: a "barber".
Usage: barber.
Source: from an unused root meaning to shave;

1533.long:
Meaning: "Gilboa", a mountain of Palestine.
Usage: Gilboa.
Source: from "H1530" and "H1158"; fountain of ebullition;

1534.long:
Meaning: a "wheel"; by analogy, a "whirlwind"; also "dust" (as "whirled").
Usage: heaven, rolling thing, wheel.
Source: by reduplication from "H1556";

1537.long:
Meaning: "Gilgal", the name of three places in Palestine.
Usage: Gilgal. See also "H1019".
Source: the same as "H1536" (with the article as a properly, noun);

1538.long:
Meaning: a "skull" (as "round"); by implication, a "head" (in enumeration of persons).
Usage: head, every man, poll, skull.
Source: by reduplication from "H1556";

1539.long:
Meaning: the (human) "skin" (as smooth).
Usage: skin.
Source: from an unused root probably meaning to polish;

1540.long:
Meaning: to "denude" (especially in a disgraceful sense); by implication, to "exile" (captives being usually stripped); figuratively, to "reveal".
Usage: advertise, appear, bewray, bring, (carry, lead, go) captive (into captivity), depart, disclose, discover, exile, be gone, open, × plainly, publish, remove, reveal, × shamelessly, shew, × surely, tell, uncover.
Source: a primitive root;

1541.long:
Usage: bring over, carry away, reveal.
Source: (Aramaic) or "גְּלָא"; (Aramaic), corresponding to "H1540"

1542.long:
Meaning: "Giloh", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Giloh.
Source: or (fully) "גִּילֹה"; from "H1540"; open;

1543.long:
Meaning: a "fountain", "bowl" or "globe" (all as "round").
Usage: bowl, pommel, spring.
Source: feminine from "H1556";

1544.long:
Meaning: properly, a "log" (as round); by implication, an "idol".
Usage: idol.
Source: or (shortened) "גִּלֻּל"; from "H1556";

1546.long:
Meaning: "captivity"; concretely, "exiles" (collectively).
Usage: (they that are carried away) captives(-ity).
Source: feminine from "H1540";

1548.long:
Meaning: properly, to "be bald", i.e. (causatively) to "shave"; figuratively to "lay waste".
Usage: poll, shave (off).
Source: a primitive root;

1549.long:
Meaning: a "tablet" for writing (as "bare"); by analogy, a "mirror" (as a "plate").
Usage: glass, roll.
Source: or "גִּלְיוֹן"; from "H1540";

1550.long:
Meaning: a "valve of a folding door" (as turning); also a "ring" (as round).
Usage: folding, ring.
Source: from "H1556";

1551.long:
Meaning: "Galil" (as a special circuit) in the North of Palestine.
Usage: Galilee.
Source: or (prolonged) "גָּלִילָה"; the same as "H1550"; a circle (with the article);

1552.long:
Meaning: a "circuit" or "region".
Usage: border, coast, country.
Source: feminine of "H1550";

1553.long:
Meaning: "Geliloth", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Geliloth.
Source: plural of "H1552"; circles;

1554.long:
Meaning: "Gallim", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Gallim.
Source: plural of "H1530"; "springs";

1555.long:
Meaning: "Goljath", a Philistine.
Usage: Goliath.
Source: perhaps from "H1540"; exile;

1556.long:
Meaning: to "roll" (literally or figuratively).
Usage: commit, remove, roll (away, down, together), run down, seek occasion, trust, wallow.
Source: a primitive root;

1558.long:
Meaning: a "circumstance" (as rolled around); only used adverbially, "on account of".
Usage: because of, for (sake).
Source: from "H1556";

1559.long:
Meaning: "Galal", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Galal.
Source: from "H1556", in the sense of "H1560"; great;

1560.long:
Meaning: "weight" or "size" (as if rolled).
Usage: great.
Source: (Aramaic) from a root corresponding to "H1556";

1561.long:
Meaning: "dung" (plural balls of dung).
Usage: dung.
Source: a variation of "H1557";

1563.long:
Meaning: to "fold".
Usage: wrap together.
Source: a primitive root;

1564.long:
Meaning: a "wrapped" (and unformed mass, i.e. as the embryo).
Usage: substance yet being unperfect.
Source: from "H1563";

1565.long:
Meaning: "sterile" (as "wrapped" up too hard); figuratively, "desolate".
Usage: desolate, solitary.
Source: probably by prolonged from "H1563";

1566.long:
Meaning: to "be obstinate".
Usage: (inter-) meddle (with).
Source: a primitive root;

1567.long:
Meaning: "Galed", a memorial cairn East of the Jordan.
Usage: Galeed.
Source: from "H1530" and "H5707"; heap of testimony;

1568.long:
Meaning: "Gilad", a region East of the Jordan; also the name of three Israelites.
Usage: Gilead, Gileadite.
Source: probably from "H1567";

1569.long:
Meaning: a "Giladite" or descendant of Gilad.
Usage: Gileadite.
Source: patronymically from "H1568";

1570.long:
Meaning: probably to "caper" (as a goat).
Usage: appear.
Source: a primitive root;

1571.long:
Meaning: properly, "assemblage"; used only adverbially "also", "even", "yea", "though"; often repeated as correl. "both"..."and".
Usage: again, alike, also, (so much) as (soon), both (so)...and, but, either...or, even, for all, (in) likewise (manner), moreover, nay...neither, one, then(-refore), though, what, with, yea.
Source: by contraction from an unused root meaning to gather;

1572.long:
Meaning: to "absorb".
Usage: swallow, drink.
Source: a primitive root (literally or figuratively) to absorb

1573.long:
Meaning: properly, an "absorbent", i.e. the "bulrush" (from its "porosity"); specifically the "papyrus".
Usage: (bul-) rush.
Source: from "H1572";

1574.long:
Meaning: properly, a "span".
Usage: cubit.
Source: from an unused root apparently meaning to grasp;

1575.long:
Meaning: a "warrior" (as grasping weapons).
Usage: Gammadims.
Source: from the same as "H1574";

1576.long:
Meaning: "treatment", i.e. an "act" (of good or ill); by implication, "service" or "requital".
Usage: as hast served, benefit, desert, deserving, that which he hath given, recompense, reward.
Source: from "H1580";

1577.long:
Meaning: "Gamul", an Israelite.
Usage: Gamul. See also "H1014".
Source: passive participle of "H1580"; rewarded;

1578.long:
Meaning: meaning the same.
Usage: deed, recompense, such a reward.
Source: feminine of "H1576";

1579.long:
Meaning: "Gimzo", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Gimzo.
Source: of uncertain derivation;

1580.long:
Meaning: to "treat" a person (well or ill), i.e. "benefit" or "requite"; by implication (of toil), to "ripen", i.e. (specifically) to "wean".
Usage: bestow on, deal bountifully, do (good), recompense, requite, reward, ripen, serve, mean, yield.
Source: a primitive root;

1581.long:
Meaning: a "camel".
Usage: camel.
Source: apparently from "H1580" (in the sense of labor or burden-bearing);

1582.long:
Meaning: "Gemalli", an Israelite.
Usage: Gemalli.
Source: probably from "H1581"; cameldriver;

1583.long:
Meaning: "Gamliel", an Israelite.
Usage: Gamaliel.
Source: from "H1580" and "H410"; "reward of God";

1584.long:
Meaning: to "end" (in the sense of completion or failure).
Usage: cease, come to an end, fail, perfect, perform.
Source: a primitive root;

1586.long:
Meaning: "Gomer", the name of a son of Japheth and of his descendants; also of a Hebrewess.
Usage: Gomer.
Source: from "H1584"; completion;

1587.long:
Meaning: "Gemarjah", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Gemariah.
Source: or "גְּמַרְיָהוּ"; from "H1584" and "H3050"; Jah has perfected;

1589.long:
Meaning: to "thieve" (literally or figuratively); by implication, to "deceive".
Usage: carry away, × indeed, secretly bring, steal (away), get by stealth.
Source: a primitive root;

1592.long:
Meaning: "Genubath", an Edomitish prince.
Usage: Genubath.
Source: from "H1589"; theft;

1595.long:
Meaning: "treasure"; by implication, a "coffer".
Usage: chest, treasury.
Source: from an unused root meaning to store;

1598.long:
Meaning: to "hedge" about, i.e. (generally) "protect".
Usage: defend.
Source: a primitive root;

1599.long:
Meaning: "Ginnethon" or "Ginnetho", an Israelite.
Usage: Ginnetho, Ginnethon.
Source: or "גִּנְּתוֹ"; from "H1598"; gardener;

1600.long:
Meaning: to "bellow" (as cattle).
Usage: low.
Source: a primitive root;

1601.long:
Meaning: "Goah", a place near Jerusalem.
Usage: Goath.
Source: feminine active participle of "H1600"; lowing;

1602.long:
Meaning: to "detest"; by implication, to "reject".
Usage: abhor, fail, lothe, vilely cast away.
Source: a primitive root;

1605.long:
Meaning: to "chide".
Usage: corrupt, rebuke, reprove.
Source: a primitive root;

1607.long:
Meaning: to "agitate violently".
Usage: move, shake, toss, trouble.
Source: a primitive root

1608.long:
Meaning: "Gaash", a hill in Palestine.
Usage: Gaash.
Source: from "H1607"; a quaking;

1609.long:
Meaning: "Gatam", an Edomite.
Usage: Gatam.
Source: of uncertain derivation;

1610.long:
Meaning: the "back"; by extension the "body" or self.
Usage: highest places, himself.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "arch";

1612.long:
Meaning: a "vine" (as "twining"), especially the grape.
Usage: vine, tree.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "bend";

1613.long:
Meaning: a kind of "tree" or "wood" (as used for building), apparently the "cypress".
Usage: gopher.
Source: from an unused root, probably meaning to house in;

1614.long:
Meaning: properly, "cypress-resin"; by analogy, "sulphur" (as equally inflammable).
Usage: brimstone.
Source: probably feminine of "H1613";

1615.long:
Meaning: "lime" (from being "burned" in a kiln).
Usage: chalk(-stone).
Source: perhaps from "H3564";

1616.long:
Meaning: properly, a "guest"; by implication, a "foreigner".
Usage: alien, sojourner, stranger.
Source: or (fully) geyr (gare); from "H1481";

1617.long:
Meaning: "Gera", the name of six Israelites.
Usage: Gera.
Source: perhaps from "H1626"; a grain;

1618.long:
Meaning: "scurf" (from itching).
Usage: scab, scurvy.
Source: from an unused root meaning to scratch;

1619.long:
Meaning: "Gareb", the name of an Israelite, also of a hill near Jerusalem.
Usage: Gareb.
Source: from the same as "H1618"; scabby;

1620.long:
Meaning: a "berry" (as if a pellet of "rumination").
Usage: berry.
Source: by reduplication from "H1641";

1621.long:
Meaning: the "throat" (as used in rumination).
Usage: neck.
Source: feminine plural from "H1641";

1622.long:
Meaning: a "Girgashite", one of the native tribes of Canaan.
Usage: Girgashite, Girgasite.
Source: patrial from an unused name (of uncertain derivation);

1624.long:
Meaning: properly, "to grate", i.e. (figuratively) "to anger".
Usage: contend, meddle, stir up, strive.
Source: a primitive root;

1625.long:
Meaning: the "cud" (as scraping the throat).
Usage: cud.
Source: from "H1641";

1626.long:
Meaning: a "gerah" or small weight (and coin).
Usage: gerah.
Source: from "H1641" (as in "H1625"); properly, (like "H1620") a "kernel" (round as if "scraped"), i.e.

1627.long:
Meaning: the "throat" (as "roughened" by swallowing).
Usage: × aloud, mouth, neck, throat.
Source: or (shortened) "גָּרֹן"; from "H1641"; (compare "H1621")

1629.long:
Meaning: to "cut off".
Usage: cut off.
Source: a primitive root;

1630.long:
Meaning: "Gerizim", a mountain of Palestine.
Usage: Gerizim.
Source: plural of an unused noun from "H1629" (compare "H1511"), cut up (i.e. rocky);

1632.long:
Meaning: "harsh".
Usage: man of great (as in the margin which reads "H1419").
Source: from the same as "H1486";

1633.long:
Meaning: (causative) to "bone", i.e. "denude" (by extensive, craunch) the "bones".
Usage: gnaw the bones, break.
Source: a primitive root; to be spare or skeleton-like; used only as a denominative from "H1634";

1634.long:
Meaning: a "bone" (as the skeleton of the body); hence, "self", i.e. (figuratively) "very".
Usage: bone, strong, top.
Source: from "H1633";

1637.long:
Meaning: a "threshing-floor" (as made even); by analogy, any "open area".
Usage: (barn, corn, threshing-) floor, (threshing-, void) place.
Source: from an unused root meaning to smooth;

1638.long:
Meaning: to "crush"; also (intransitively and figuratively) to "dissolve".
Usage: break.
Source: a primitive root;

1639.long:
Meaning: to "scrape" off; by implication, to "shave", "remove", "lessen", "withhold".
Usage: abate, clip, (di-) minish, do (take) away, keep back, restrain, make small, withdraw.
Source: a primitive root;

1640.long:
Meaning: to "bear off violently".
Usage: sweep away.
Source: a primitive root;

1641.long:
Meaning: to "drag off roughly"; by implication, to "bring up the cud" (i.e. ruminate); by analogy, to "saw".
Usage: catch, chew, × continuing, destroy, saw.
Source: a primitive root;

1642.long:
Meaning: "Gerar", a Philistine city.
Usage: Gerar.
Source: probably from "H1641"; a rolling country;

1643.long:
Meaning: a "kernel" (collectively), i.e. "grain".
Usage: beaten corn.
Source: from an unused root meaning to husk;

1644.long:
Meaning: to "drive out" from a possession; especially to "expatriate" or "divorce".
Usage: cast up (out), divorced (woman), drive away (forth, out), expel, × surely put away, trouble, thrust out.
Source: a primitive root;

1647.long:
Meaning: "Gereshom", the name of four Israelites.
Usage: Gershom.
Source: for "H1648";

1648.long:
Meaning: "Gereshon" or "Gereshom", an Israelite.
Usage: Gershon, Gershom.
Source: or "גֵּרְשׁוֹם"; from "H1644"; a "refugee";

1649.long:
Meaning: a "Gereshonite" or descendant of Gereshon.
Usage: Gershonite, sons of Gershon.
Source: patronymically from "H1648";

1650.long:
Meaning: "Geshur", a district of Syria.
Usage: Geshur, Geshurite.
Source: from an unused root (meaning to join); bridge;

1651.long:
Meaning: a "Geshurite" (also collectively) or inhabitants of Geshur.
Usage: Geshuri, Geshurites.
Source: patrial from "H1650";

1652.long:
Meaning: to "shower violently".
Usage: (cause to) rain.
Source: a primitive root;

1654.long:
Meaning: "Geshem" or "Gashmu", an Arabian.
Usage: Geshem, Gashmu.
Source: or (prolonged) "גַּשְׁמוּ"; the same as "H1653";

1655.long:
Meaning: used in a peculiar sense, the "body" (probably for the (figuratively) idea of a "hard rain)".
Usage: body.
Source: (Aramaic) apparently the same as "H1653";

1657.long:
Meaning: "Goshen", the residence of the Israelites in Egypt; also a place in Palestine.
Usage: Goshen.
Source: probably of Egyptian origin;

1658.long:
Meaning: "Gishpa", an Israelite.
Usage: Gispa.
Source: of uncertain derivation;

1659.long:
Meaning: to "feel about".
Usage: grope.
Source: a primitive root; apparently

1660.long:
Meaning: a wine-"press" (or vat for holding the grapes in pressing them).
Usage: (wine-) press (fat).
Source: probably from "H5059" (in the sense of "treading" out grapes);

1661.long:
Meaning: "Gath", a Philistine city.
Usage: Gath.
Source: the same as "H1660";

1662.long:
Meaning: "Gath-Chepher", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Gath-kephr, Gittah-kephr.
Source: or (abridged) "גִּתָּה־חֵפֶר"; from "H1660" and "H2658" with the article inserted; wine-press of (the) well;

1663.long:
Meaning: a "Gittite" or inhabitant of Gath.
Usage: Gittite.
Source: patrial from "H1661";

1664.long:
Meaning: "Gittajim", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Gittaim.
Source: dual of "H1660"; double winepress;

1666.long:
Meaning: "Gether", a son of Aram, and the region settled by him.
Usage: Gether.
Source: of uncertain derivation;

1667.long:
Meaning: "Gath-Rimmon", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Gath-rimmon. d.
Source: from "H1660" and "H7416"; wine-press of (the) pomegranate;

1669.long:
Meaning: to "pine".
Usage: mourn, sorrow(-ful).
Source: a primitive root;

1672.long:
Meaning: "be anxious".
Usage: be afraid (careful, sorry), sorrow, take thought.
Source: a primitive root;

1673.long:
Meaning: "Doeg", an Edomite.
Usage: Doeg.
Source: or (fully) "דּוֹאֵג"; active participle of "H1672"; anxious;

1675.long:
Meaning: to "dart", i.e. "fly rapidly".
Usage: fly.
Source: a primitive root;

1676.long:
Meaning: the "kite" (from its rapid flight).
Usage: vulture. See "H7201".
Source: from "H1675";

1679.long:
Meaning: "quiet".
Usage: strength.
Source: from an unused root (compare "H1680") (probably meaning to be sluggish, i.e. restful);

1680.long:
Meaning: to "move slowly", i.e. "glide".
Usage: cause to speak.
Source: a primitive root (compare "H1679");

1681.long:
Meaning: "slander".
Usage: defaming, evil report, infamy, slander.
Source: from "H1680" (in the sense of furtive motion);

1682.long:
Meaning: the "bee" (from its "systematic" instincts).
Usage: bee.
Source: or (shortened) "דְּבֹרָה"; from "H1696" (in the sense of "orderly" motion);

1683.long:
Meaning: "Deborah", the name of two Hebrewesses.
Usage: Deborah.
Source: or (shortened) "דְּבֹרָה"; the same as "H1682";

1686.long:
Meaning: probably some cheap "vegetable", perhaps a "bulbous root".
Usage: dove's dung.
Source: in the margin for the textual reading, "חֶרְיוֹן"; both, (in the plural only and) of uncertain derivation,

1687.long:
Meaning: the "shrine" or innermost part of the sanctuary.
Usage: oracle.
Source: or (shortened) "דְּבִר"; from "H1696" (apparently in the sense of oracle);

1688.long:
Meaning: "Debir", the name of an Amoritish king and of two places in Palestine.
Usage: Debir.
Source: or (shortened) "דְּבִר"; (Joshua 13:26 (but see "H3810")), the same as "H1687";

1689.long:
Meaning: "Diblah", a place in Syria.
Usage: Diblath.
Source: probably an orthographical error for "H7247";

1690.long:
Meaning: a "cake" of pressed figs.
Usage: cake (lump) of figs.
Source: from an unused root (akin to "H2082") probably meaning to "press" together;

1691.long:
Meaning: "Diblajim", a symbolic name.
Usage: Diblaim.
Source: dual from the masculine of "H1690"; two cakes;

1692.long:
Meaning: properly, to "impinge", i.e. "cling" or "adhere"; figuratively, to "catch" by pursuit.
Usage: abide fast, cleave (fast together), follow close (hard after), be joined (together), keep (fast), overtake, pursue hard, stick, take.
Source: a primitive root;

1694.long:
Meaning: a "joint"; by implication, "solder".
Usage: joint, solder.
Source: from "H1692";

1696.long:
Meaning: perhaps properly, to "arrange"; but used figuratively (of words), to "speak"; rarely (in a destructive sense) to "subdue".
Usage: answer, appoint, bid, command, commune, declare, destroy, give, name, promise, pronounce, rehearse, say, speak, be spokesman, subdue, talk, teach, tell, think, use (entreaties), utter, × well, × work.
Source: a primitive root;

1697.long:
Meaning: a "word"; by implication, a "matter" (as "spoken" of) or "thing"; adverbially, a "cause".
Usage: act, advice, affair, answer, × any such (thing), because of, book, business, care, case, cause, certain rate, chronicles, commandment, × commune(-ication), concern(-ing), confer, counsel, dearth, decree, deed, × disease, due, duty, effect, eloquent, errand, (evil favoured-) ness, glory, harm, hurt, iniquity, judgment, language, lying, manner, matter, message, (no) thing, oracle, × ought, × parts, pertaining, please, portion, power, promise, provision, purpose, question, rate, reason, report, request, × (as hast) said, sake, saying, sentence, sign, so, some (uncleanness), somewhat to say, song, speech, × spoken, talk, task, that, × there done, thing (concerning), thought, thus, tidings, what(-soever), wherewith, which, word, work.
Source: from "H1696";

1698.long:
Meaning: a "pestilence".
Usage: murrain, pestilence, plague.
Source: from "H1696" (in the sense of destroying);

1699.long:
Meaning: a "pasture" (from its arrangement of the flock).
Usage: fold, manner.
Source: from "H1696" (in its original sense);

1700.long:
Meaning: a "reason", "suit" or "style".
Usage: cause, end, estate, order, regard.
Source: feminine of "H1697";

1702.long:
Meaning: a "raft".
Usage: float.
Source: feminine active participle of "H1696" in the sense of driving (compare "H1699");

1705.long:
Meaning: "Daberath", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Dabareh, Daberath.
Source: from "H1697" (perhaps in the sense of "H1699");

1706.long:
Meaning: "honey" (from its "stickiness"); by analogy, "syrup".
Usage: honey(-comb).
Source: from an unused root meaning to "be gummy";

1707.long:
Meaning: a sticky "mass", i.e. the "hump" of a camel.
Usage: hunch (of a camel).
Source: intensive from the same as "H1706";

1708.long:
Meaning: "Dabbesheth", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Dabbesheth.
Source: the same as "H1707";

1709.long:
Meaning: a "fish" (often used collectively).
Usage: fish.
Source: or (fully) "דָּאג"; (Nehemiah 13:16), from "H1711"; a fish (as prolific); or perhaps rather from "H1672" (as timid); but still better from "H1672" (in the sense of squirming, i.e. moving by the vibratory action of the tail);

1710.long:
Usage: fish.
Source: feminine of "H1709", and meaning the same

1711.long:
Meaning: to "spawn", i.e. "become numerous".
Usage: grow.
Source: a primitive root; to move rapidly; used only as a denominative from "H1709";

1712.long:
Meaning: "Dagon", a Philistine deity.
Usage: Dagon.
Source: from "H1709"; the fish-god;

1713.long:
Meaning: to "flaunt", i.e. "raise a flag"; figuratively, to "be conspicuous".
Usage: (set up, with) banners, chiefest.
Source: a primitive root;

1716.long:
Meaning: to "brood" over eggs or young.
Usage: gather, sit.
Source: a primitive root,

1717.long:
Meaning: the "breast" (as the seat of love, or from its shape).
Usage: breast, teat.
Source: apparently from the same as "H1730";

1718.long:
Meaning: to "walk gently".
Usage: go (softly, with).
Source: a doubtful root;

1719.long:
Meaning: "Dedan", the name of two Cushites and of their territory.
Usage: Dedan.
Source: or (prolonged) "דְּדָנֶה"; (Ezekiel 25:13), of uncertain derivation;

1720.long:
Meaning: "Dedanites", the descendants or inhabitants of Dedan.
Usage: Dedanim.
Source: plural of "H1719" (as patrial);

1721.long:
Meaning: "Dodanites", or descendants of a son of Javan.
Usage: Dodanim.
Source: or (by orthographical error) "רֹדָנִים" (1 Chronicles 1:7); a plural of uncertain derivation;

1723.long:
Meaning: "Dahava", a people colonized in Samaria.
Usage: Dehavites.
Source: (Aramaic) of uncertain derivation;

1724.long:
Meaning: to "be dumb", i.e. (figuratively) "dumbfounded".
Usage: astonished.
Source: a primitive root (compare "H1740");

1725.long:
Meaning: to "curvet" or "move irregularly".
Usage: pause.
Source: a primitive root;

1727.long:
Meaning: to "mope", i.e. (figuratively) "pine".
Usage: sorrow.
Source: a primitive root;

1728.long:
Meaning: a "fisherman".
Usage: fisher.
Source: an orthographical variation of "H1709" as a denominative ("H1771");

1729.long:
Meaning: properly, "fishery", i.e. a "hook for fishing".
Usage: fish (hook).
Source: feminine from the same as "H1728";

1730.long:
Meaning: (figuratively) to "love"; by implication, a "love-token", "lover", "friend"; specifically an "uncle".
Usage: (well-) beloved, father's brother, love, uncle.
Source: or (shortened) "דֹּד"; from an unused root meaning properly, to "boil", i.e.

1731.long:
Meaning: a "pot" (for "boiling"); also (by resemblance of shape) a "basket".
Usage: basket, caldron, kettle, (seething) pot.
Source: from the same as "H1730";

1732.long:
Meaning: "David", the youngest son of Jesse.
Usage: David.
Source: rarely (fully); "דָּוִיד"; from the same as "H1730"; "loving";

1733.long:
Meaning: an "aunt".
Usage: aunt, father's sister, uncle's wife.
Source: feminine of "H1730";

1734.long:
Meaning: "Dodo", the name of three Israelites.
Usage: Dodo.
Source: from "H1730"; loving;

1735.long:
Meaning: "Dodavah", an Israelite.
Usage: Dodavah.
Source: from "H1730" and "H3050"; love of Jah;

1736.long:
Meaning: a "boiler" or "basket"; also the "mandrake" (as an aphrodisiac).
Usage: basket, mandrake.
Source: from "H1731";

1737.long:
Meaning: "Dodai", an Israelite.
Usage: Dodai.
Source: formed like "H1736"; amatory;

1738.long:
Meaning: to "be sick" (as if in menstruation).
Usage: infirmity.
Source: a primitive root;

1739.long:
Meaning: "sick" (especially in menstruation).
Usage: faint, menstruous cloth, she that is sick, having sickness.
Source: from "H1738";

1740.long:
Meaning: to "thrust" away; figuratively, to "cleanse".
Usage: cast out, purge, wash.
Source: a primitive root;

1743.long:
Meaning: to "bruise" in a mortar.
Usage: beat.
Source: a primitive root;

1744.long:
Meaning: the "hoopoe" or else the "grouse".
Usage: lapwing.
Source: of uncertain derivation;

1745.long:
Meaning: "silence"; figuratively, "death".
Usage: silence.
Source: from an unused root meaning to be dumb (compare "H1820");

1746.long:
Meaning: "Dumah", a tribe and region of Arabia.
Usage: Dumah.
Source: the same as "H1745";

1747.long:
Meaning: "stillness"; adverbially, "silently"; abstractly "quiet", "trust".
Usage: silence, silent, waiteth.
Source: from "H1820";

1748.long:
Meaning: "still"; adverbially, "silently".
Usage: dumb, silent, quietly wait.
Source: from "H1826";

1750.long:
Meaning: to "leap".
Usage: be turned.
Source: a primitive root;

1751.long:
Meaning: to "crumble".
Usage: be broken to pieces.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H1854";

1752.long:
Meaning: properly, to "gyrate" (or move in a circle), i.e. to "remain".
Usage: dwell.
Source: a primitive root;

1754.long:
Meaning: a "circle", "ball" or "pile".
Usage: ball, turn, round about.
Source: from "H1752";

1755.long:
Meaning: properly, a "revolution" of time, i.e. an "age" or generation; also a "dwelling".
Usage: age, × evermore, generation, (n-) ever, posterity.
Source: or (shortened) "דֹּר"; from "H1752";

1756.long:
Meaning: "Dor", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Dor.
Source: or (by permutation) "דֹּאר"; (Joshua 17:11; 1 Kings 4:11), from "H1755"; dwelling;

1757.long:
Meaning: "Dura", a place in Babylonia.
Usage: Dura.
Source: (Aramaic) probably from "H1753"; circle or dwelling;

1758.long:
Meaning: to "trample" or "thresh".
Usage: break, tear, thresh, tread out (down), at grass (Jeremiah 50:11, by mistake for "H1877").
