Source: or "דּוֹשׁ"; or "דִּישׁ"; a primitive root;

1760.long:
Meaning: to "push down".
Usage: chase, drive away (on), overthrow, outcast, × sore, thrust, totter.
Source: or "דָּחַח"; (Jeremiah 23:12), a primitive root;

1761.long:
Meaning: probably a "musical instrument" (as being struck).
Usage: instrument of music.
Source: (Aramaic) from the equivalent of "H1760";

1762.long:
Meaning: a "push", i.e. (by implication) a "fall".
Usage: falling.
Source: from "H1760";

1763.long:
Meaning: to "slink", i.e. (by implication) to "fear", or (causatively) "be formidable".
Usage: make afraid, dreadful, fear, terrible.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H2119";

1765.long:
Meaning: to "urge", i.e. "hasten".
Usage: (be) haste(-ned), pressed on.
Source: a primitive root;

1766.long:
Meaning: to "press", i.e. "oppress".
Usage: thrust, vex.
Source: a primitive root;

1767.long:
Meaning: "enough" (as noun or adverb), used chiefly with preposition in phrases.
Usage: able, according to, after (ability), among, as (oft as), (more than) enough, from, in, since, (much as is) sufficient(-ly), too much, very, when.
Source: of uncertain derivation;

1768.long:
Meaning: "that", used as relative conjunction, and especially (with a preposition) in adverbial phrases; also as preposition "of".
Usage: × as, but, for(-asmuch ), now, of, seeing, than, that, therefore, until, what (-soever), when, which, whom, whose.
Source: (Aramaic) apparently for "H1668";

1769.long:
Meaning: "Dibon", the name of three places in Palestine.
Usage: Dibon. (Also, with "H1410" added, Dibon-gad.).
Source: or (shortened) "דִּיבֹן"; from "H1727"; "pining":—

1772.long:
Meaning: a "falcon" (from its rapid flight).
Usage: vulture.
Source: intensive from "H1675";

1774.long:
Meaning: "Dizahab", a place in the Desert.
Usage: Dizahab.
Source: as if from "H1768" and "H2091"; of gold;

1775.long:
Meaning: "Dimon", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Dimon.
Source: perhaps for "H1769";

1776.long:
Meaning: "Dimonah", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Dimonah.
Source: feminine of "H1775";

1777.long:
Meaning: to "rule"; by implication to "judge" (as umpire); also to "strive" (as at law).
Usage: contend contend execute (judgment) judge minister judgment plead (the cause) at strife strive.
Source: or (Genesis 6:3) "דּוּן"; a primitive root;

1779.long:
Meaning: "judgement" (the suit, justice, sentence or tribunal); by implication also "strife".
Usage: cause, judgement, plea, strife.
Source: or (Job 19:29) "דּוּן"; from "H1777";

1783.long:
Meaning: "Dinah", the daughter of Jacob.
Usage: Dinah.
Source: feminine of "H1779"; justice;

1784.long:
Meaning: a "Dinaite" or inhabitant of some unknown Assyria province.
Usage: Dinaite.
Source: (Aramaic) partial from uncertain primitive;

1785.long:
Meaning: a "battering-tower".
Usage: fort.
Source: from a root corresp. to "H1751";

1787.long:
Meaning: "Dishon", the name of two Edomites.
Usage: Dishon.
Source: Diyshon, the same as "H1788";

1789.long:
Meaning: "Dishan", an Edomite.
Usage: Dishan, Dishon.
Source: another form of "H1787"

1790.long:
Meaning: "crushed", i.e. (figuratively) "injured".
Usage: afflicted, oppressed.
Source: from an unused root (compare "H1794");

1791.long:
Meaning: "this".
Usage: the same, this.
Source: (Aramaic) or "דָּךְ"; (Aramaic), prolonged from "H1668";

1792.long:
Meaning: to "crumble"; transitively, to "bruise" (literally or figuratively).
Usage: beat to pieces, break (in pieces), bruise, contrite, crush, destroy, humble, oppress, smite.
Source: a primitive root (compare "H1794");

1793.long:
Meaning: "crushed" (literally powder, or figuratively, contrite).
Usage: contrite, destruction.
Source: from "H1792";

1794.long:
Meaning: to "collapse" (phys. or mentally).
Usage: break (sore), contrite, crouch.
Source: a primitive root (compare "H1790", "H1792");

1798.long:
Meaning: properly, a "male", i.e. "of sheep".
Usage: ram.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H2145";

1800.long:
Meaning: properly, "dangling", i.e. (by implication) "weak" or "thin".
Usage: lean, needy, poor (man), weaker.
Source: from "H1809";

1802.long:
Meaning: properly, to "dangle", i.e. to "let down a bucket" (for drawing out water); figuratively, to "deliver".
Usage: draw (out), × enough, lift up.
Source: a primitive root (compare "H1809");

1803.long:
Meaning: properly, something "dangling", i.e. a "loose thread" or "hair"; figuratively, "indigent".
Usage: hair, pining sickness, poor(-est sort).
Source: from "H1802";

1804.long:
Meaning: to "roil water".
Usage: trouble.
Source: a primitive root;

1805.long:
Meaning: a "pail" or "jar" (for "drawing" water).
Usage: bucket.
Source: or "דֳּלִי"; from "H1802";

1806.long:
Meaning: "Delajah", the name of five Israelites.
Usage: Dalaiah, Delaiah.
Source: or (prolonged) "דְּלָיָהוּ"; from "H1802" and "H3050"; Jah has delivered;

1807.long:
Meaning: "Delilah", a Philistine woman.
Usage: Delilah.
Source: from "H1809"; languishing

1809.long:
Meaning: to "slacken" or "be feeble"; figuratively, to "be oppressed".
Usage: bring low, dry up, be emptied, be not equal, fail, be impoverished, be made thin.
Source: a primitive root (compare "H1802");

1810.long:
Meaning: "Dilan", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Dilean.
Source: of uncertain derivation;

1811.long:
Meaning: to "drip"; by implication, to "weep".
Usage: drop through, melt, pour out.
Source: a primitive root;

1813.long:
Meaning: "Dalphon", a son of Haman.
Usage: Dalphon.
Source: from "H1811"; dripping;

1814.long:
Meaning: to "flame" (literally or figuratively).
Usage: burning, chase, inflame, kindle, persecute(-or), pursue hotly.
Source: a primitive root;

1817.long:
Meaning: "something swinging", i.e. "the valve of a door".
Usage: door (two-leaved), gate, leaf, lid. (Psalm 141:3).
Source: from "H1802";

1818.long:
Meaning: "blood" (as that which when shed causes death) of man or an animal; by analogy, the "juice" of the grape; figuratively (especially in the plural) "bloodshed" (i.e. drops of blood).
Usage: blood(-y, -guiltiness, (-thirsty), innocent.
Source: from "H1826" (compare "H119");

1819.long:
Meaning: to "compare"; by implication, to "resemble", "liken", "consider".
Usage: compare, devise, (be) like(-n), mean, think, use similitudes.
Source: a primitive root;

1820.long:
Meaning: to "be dumb" or "silent"; hence, to "fail" or "perish"; "trans". to "destroy".
Usage: cease, be cut down (off), destroy, be brought to silence, be undone, × utterly.
Source: a primitive root;

1823.long:
Meaning: "resemblance"; concretely, "model", "shape"; adverbially, "like".
Usage: fashion, like (-ness, as), manner, similitude.
Source: from "H1819";

1824.long:
Meaning: "quiet".
Usage: cutting off, rest, silence.
Source: or "דֳּמִי"; from "H1820";

1826.long:
Meaning: to "be dumb"; by implication, to "be astonished", to "stop"; also to "perish".
Usage: cease, be cut down (off), forbear, hold peace, quiet self, rest, be silent, keep (put to) silence, be (stand) still, tarry, wait.
Source: a primitive root (compare "H1724", "H1820");

1829.long:
Meaning: "Dimnah", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Dimnah.
Source: feminine from the same as "H1828"; a dung-heap;

1830.long:
Meaning: to "weep".
Usage: × sore, weep.
Source: a primitive root;

1833.long:
Meaning: "damask" (as a fabric of Damascus).
Usage: in Damascus.
Source: by orthographical variation from "H1834";

1834.long:
Meaning: "Damascus", a city of Syria.
Usage: Damascus.
Source: or "דּוּמֶשֶׂק"; or "דַּרְמֶשֶׂק"; of foreign origin;

1835.long:
Meaning: "Dan", one of the sons of Jacob; also the tribe descended from him, and its territory; likewise a place in Palestine colonized by them.
Usage: Daniel.
Source: from "H1777"; "judge";

1836.long:
Meaning: "this".
Usage: (afore-) time, after this manner, here (-after), one...another, such, there(-fore), these, this (matter), thus, where(-fore), which.
Source: (Aramaic) an orthographical variation of "H1791";

1837.long:
Meaning: "Dannah", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Dannah.
Source: of uncertain derivation;

1838.long:
Meaning: "Dinhabah", an Edomitish town.
Usage: Dinhaban.
Source: of uncertain derivation;

1839.long:
Meaning: a "Danite" (often collectively) or descendants (or inhabitants) of Dan.
Usage: Danites, of Daniel.
Source: patronymically from "H1835";

1840.long:
Meaning: "Daniel" or "Danijel", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Daniel.
Source: in Ezekiel it is; "דָּנִאֵל"; from "H1835" and "H410"; judge of God;

1841.long:
Meaning: "Danijel", the Hebrew prophet.
Usage: Daniel.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H1840";

1842.long:
Meaning: "Dan-Jaan", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Dan-jaan.
Source: from "H1835" and (apparently) "H3282"; judge of purpose;

1845.long:
Meaning: "Deuel", an Israelite.
Usage: Deuel.
Source: from "H3045" and "H410"; "known of God";

1846.long:
Meaning: to "be extinguished"; figuratively, to "expire" or "be dried up".
Usage: be extinct, consumed, put out, quenched.
Source: a primitive root;

1848.long:
Meaning: a "stumbling-block".
Usage: slanderest.
Source: from an unused root (meaning to push over);

1849.long:
Meaning: to "knock"; by analogy, to "press severely".
Usage: beat, knock, overdrive.
Source: a primitive root;

1850.long:
Meaning: "Dophkah", a place in the Desert.
Usage: Dophkah.
Source: from "H1849"; a knock;

1851.long:
Meaning: "crushed", i.e. (by implication) "small" or "thin".
Usage: dwarf, lean(-fleshed), very little thing, small, thin.
Source: from "H1854";

1852.long:
Meaning: something "crumbling", i.e. "fine" (as a "thin" cloth).
Usage: curtain.
Source: from "H1854";

1853.long:
Meaning: "Diklah", a region of Arabia.
Usage: Diklah.
Source: of foreign origin;

1854.long:
Meaning: to "crush" (or intransitively) "crumble".
Usage: beat in pieces (small), bruise, make dust, (into) × powder, (be, very) small, stamp (small).
Source: a primitive root (compare "H1915");

1855.long:
Meaning: to "crumble" or (trans.) "crush".
Usage: break to pieces.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H1854";

1856.long:
Meaning: to "stab"; by analogy, to "starve"; figuratively, to "revile".
Usage: pierce, strike (thrust) through, wound.
Source: a primitive root;

1857.long:
Meaning: "Deker", an Israelite.
Usage: Dekar.
Source: from "H1856"; a stab;

1858.long:
Meaning: properly, a "pearl" (from its sheen as rapidly turned); by analogy, "pearl-stone", i.e. "mother-of-pearl" or "alabaster".
Usage: × white.
Source: apparently from the same as "H1865";

1860.long:
Meaning: an object of "aversion".
Usage: abhorring, contempt.
Source: or "דֵּרָאוֹן"; from an unused root (meaning to "repulse");

1861.long:
Meaning: a "goad".
Usage: goad.
Source: (also dor-bawn'); of uncertain derivation;

1862.long:
Meaning: "Darda", an Israelite.
Usage: Darda.
Source: apparently from "H1858" and "H1843"; pearl of knowledge;

1864.long:
Meaning: the "south"; poet. the "south wind".
Usage: south.
Source: of uncertain derivation;

1865.long:
Meaning: "freedom"; hence, "spontaneity" of outflow, and so "clear".
Usage: liberty, pure.
Source: from an unused root (meaning to "move rapidly");

1866.long:
Meaning: the "swift", a "kind of swallow".
Usage: swallow.
Source: the same as "H1865", applied to a bird;

1867.long:
Meaning: "Darejavesh", a title (rather than name) of several Persian kings.
Usage: Darius.
Source: of Persian origin;

1869.long:
Meaning: to "tread"; by implication, to "walk"; also to "string" a bow (by treading on it in bending).
Usage: archer, bend, come, draw, go (over), guide, lead (forth), thresh, tread (down), walk.
Source: a primitive root;

1870.long:
Meaning: a "road" (as "trodden"); figuratively, a "course" of life or "mode" of action, often adverb.
Usage: along, away, because of, by, conversation, custom, (east-) ward, journey, manner, passenger, through, toward, (high-) (path-) way(-side), whither(-soever).
Source: from "H1869";

1871.long:
Meaning: a "'drachma'", or "coin".
Usage: dram.
Source: of Persian origin;

1873.long:
Meaning: "Dara", an Israelite.
Usage: Dara.
Source: probably a contraction from "H1862";

1874.long:
Meaning: "Darkon", one of 'Solomon's servants'.
Usage: Darkon.
Source: of uncertain derivation;

1875.long:
Meaning: properly, to "tread" or "frequent"; usually to "follow" (for pursuit or search); by implication, to "seek" or "ask"; specifically to "worship".
Usage: ask, × at all, care for, × diligently, inquire, make inquisition, (necro-) mancer, question, require, search, seek (for, out), × surely.
Source: a primitive root;

1876.long:
Meaning: to "sprout".
Usage: bring forth, spring.
Source: a primitive root;

1877.long:
Meaning: a "sprout"; by analogy, "grass".
Usage: (tender) grass, green, (tender) herb.
Source: from "H1876";

1878.long:
Meaning: to "be fat"; transitively, to "fatten" (or regard as fat); specifically to "anoint"; figuratively, to "satisfy"; to "remove" (fat) "ashes" (of sacrifices).
Usage: accept, anoint, take away the (receive) ashes (from), make (wax) fat.
Source: a primitive root; also denominatively (from "H1880")

1880.long:
Meaning: the "fat"; abstractly "fatness", i.e. (figuratively) "abundance"; specifically the (fatty) "ashes" of sacrifices.
Usage: ashes, fatness.
Source: from "H1878";

1881.long:
Meaning: a "royal edict" or "statute".
Usage: commandment, commission, decree, law, manner.
Source: of uncertain (perhaps foreign) derivation;

1884.long:
Meaning: "meaning one skilled in law"; a "judge".
Usage: counsellor.
Source: (Aramaic) of Persian origin;

1885.long:
Meaning: "Dathan", an Israelite.
Usage: Dathan.
Source: of uncertain derivation;

1886.long:
Meaning: "Dothan", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Dothan. h.
Source: or (Aramaic dual) "דֹּתַיִן"; (Genesis 37:17), of uncertain derivation;

1890.long:
Meaning: "gift" (in sacrifice), i.e. "holocaust".
Usage: offering.
Source: by reduplication from "H3051";

1891.long:
Meaning: to "be vain" in act, word, or expectation; specifically to "lead astray".
Usage: be (become, make) vain.
Source: a primitive root;

1892.long:
Meaning: "emptiness" or "vanity"; figuratively, something "transitory" and "unsatisfactory"; often used as an adverb.
Usage: × altogether, vain, vanity.
Source: or (rarely in the abs.) "הֲבֵל"; from "H1891";

1893.long:
Meaning: "Hebel", the son of Adam.
Usage: Abel.
Source: the same as "H1892";

1894.long:
Meaning: "ebony".
Usage: ebony.
Source: only in plural, from an unused root meaning to be hard;

1895.long:
Meaning: to "be a horoscopist".
Usage: (astro-) loger.
Source: a primitive root of uncertain (perhaps foreign) derivation;

1896.long:
Meaning: "Hege" or "Hegai", a eunuch of Xerxes.
Usage: Hegai, Hege.
Source: or (by permutation) "הֵגַי"; probably of Persian origin;

1897.long:
Meaning: to "murmur" (in pleasure or anger); by implication, to "ponder".
Usage: imagine, meditate, mourn, mutter, roar, × sore, speak, study, talk, utter.
Source: a primitive root (compare "H1901");

1898.long:
Meaning: to "remove".
Usage: stay, stay away.
Source: a primitive root;

1899.long:
Meaning: a "muttering" (in sighing, thought, or as thunder).
Usage: mourning, sound, tale.
Source: from "H1897";

1901.long:
Meaning: properly, a "murmur", i.e. "complaint".
Usage: meditation, musing.
Source: from an unused root akin to "H1897";

1902.long:
Meaning: a "murmuring sound", i.e. a "musical notation" (probably similar to the modern affettuoso to indicate solemnity of movement); by implication, a "machination".
Usage: device, Higgaion, meditation, solemn sound.
Source: intensive from "H1897";

1903.long:
Meaning: perhaps "suitable" or "turning".
Usage: directly.
Source: of uncertain derivation;

1904.long:
Meaning: "Hagar", the mother of Ishmael.
Usage: Hagar.
Source: of uncertain (perhaps foreign) derivation;

1905.long:
Meaning: a "Hagrite" or member of a certain Arabian clan.
Usage: Hagarene, Hagarite, Haggeri.
Source: or (prolonged) "הַגְרִיא"; perhaps patronymically from "H1904";

1907.long:
Meaning: a "vizier".
Usage: counsellor.
Source: (Aramaic) probably of foreign origin;

1908.long:
Meaning: "Hadad", the name of an idol, and of several kings of Edom.
Usage: Hadad.
Source: probably of foreign origin (compare "H111");

1909.long:
Meaning: "Hadadezer", a Syrian king.
Usage: Hadadezer. Compare "H1928".
Source: from "H1908" and "H5828"; Hadad (is his) help;

1910.long:
Meaning: "Hadad-Rimmon", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Hadad-rimmon.
Source: from "H1908" and "H7417";

1911.long:
Meaning: to "stretch" forth the hand.
Usage: put.
Source: a primitive root (compare "H3034");

1913.long:
Meaning: "Hadoram", a son of Joktan, and the tribe descended from him.
Usage: Hadoram.
Source: or "הֲדֹרָם"; probably of foreign derivation;

1914.long:
Meaning: "Hiddai", an Israelite.
Usage: Hiddai.
Source: of uncertain derivation;

1915.long:
Meaning: to "crush with the foot".
Usage: tread down.
Source: a primitive root (compare "H1854");

1916.long:
Meaning: a "footstool".
Usage: (foot-) stool.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "stamp" upon;

1917.long:
Meaning: something "stamped to pieces", i.e. a "bit".
Usage: piece.
Source: (Aramaic) from a root corresponding to that of "H1916";

1920.long:
Meaning: to "push" away or down.
Usage: cast away (out), drive, expel, thrust (away).
Source: a primitive root;

1921.long:
Meaning: to "swell" up (literally or figuratively, active or passive); by implication, to "favor" or "honour", "be high" or "proud".
Usage: countenance, crooked place, glorious, honour, put forth.
Source: a primitive root;

1924.long:
Meaning: "Hadar", an Edomite.
Usage: Hadar.
Source: the same as "H1926";

1925.long:
Meaning: "honour"; used (figuratively) for the capital city (Jerusalem).
Usage: glory.
Source: from "H1921";

1926.long:
Meaning: "magnificence", i.e. ornament or splendor.
Usage: beauty, comeliness, excellency, glorious, glory, goodly, honour, majesty.
Source: from "H1921";

1928.long:
Meaning: "Hadarezer", a Syrian king.
Usage: Hadarezer.
Source: from "H1924" and "H5828"; Hadar (i.e. Hadad, "H1908") is his help; (i.e. Hadadezer, "H1909")

1929.long:
Meaning: "ah! expressing grief".
Usage: woe worth.
Source: a shortened form of "H162";

1931.long:
Meaning: "he" ("she" or "it"); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) "self", or (especially with the article) the "same"; sometimes (as demonstrative) "this" or "that"; occasionally (instead of copula) "as" or "are".
Usage: he, as for her, him(-self), it, the same, she (herself), such, that (...it), these, they, this, those, which (is), who.
Source: of which the feminine (beyond the Pentateuch) is "הִיא"; "he" a primitive word, the third person pronoun singular;

1932.long:
Usage: × are, it, this.
Source: (Aramaic) or (feminine) "הִיא"; (Aramaic), corresponding to "H1931"

1933.long:
Meaning: to "be" (in the sense of existence).
Usage: be, × have.
Source: or "הָוָה"; a primitive root (compare "H183", "H1961") supposed to mean properly, to breathe;

1934.long:
Meaning: to "exist"; used in a great variety of applications (especially in connection with other words).
Usage: be, become, behold, came (to pass), cease, cleave, consider, do, give, have, judge, keep, labour, mingle (self), put, see, seek, set, slay, take heed, tremble, walk, would.
Source: (Aramaic) or "הָוָה"; (Aramaic), corresponding to "H1933";

1935.long:
Meaning: "grandeur" (i.e. an imposing form and appearance).
Usage: beauty, comeliness, excellency, glorious, glory, goodly, honour, majesty.
Source: from an unused root;

1936.long:
Meaning: "Hod", an Israelite.
Usage: Hod.
Source: the same as "H1935";

1937.long:
Meaning: "Hodevah" (or Hodevjah), an Israelite.
Usage: Hodevah.
Source: a form of "H1938";

1938.long:
Meaning: "Hodavjah", the name of three Israelites.
Usage: Hodaviah.
Source: from "H1935" and "H3050"; "majesty of Jah";

1939.long:
Meaning: "Hodajvah", an Israelite.
Usage: Hodaiah.
Source: a form of "H1938";

1940.long:
Meaning: a "Jewess".
Usage: Hodiah.
Source: a form for the feminine of "H3064";

1941.long:
Meaning: "Hodijah", the name of three Israelites.
Usage: Hodijah.
Source: a form of "H1938";

1942.long:
Meaning: by implication, of "falling)"; "desire"; also "ruin".
Usage: calamity, iniquity, mischief, mischievous (thing), naughtiness, naughty, noisome, perverse thing, substance, very wickedness.
Source: from "H1933" (in the sense of eagerly coveting and rushing upon;

1944.long:
Meaning: "Hoham", a Canaanitish king.
Usage: Hoham.
Source: of uncertain derivation;

1945.long:
Meaning: "oh!".
Usage: ah, alas, ho, O, woe.
Source: a prolonged form of "H1930" (akin to "H188");

1946.long:
Meaning: to "go"; causatively, to "bring".
Usage: bring again, come, go (up).
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H1981";

1949.long:
Meaning: to "make an uproar", or "agitate" greatly.
Usage: destroy, move, make a noise, put, ring again.
Source: a primitive root (compare "H2000");

1950.long:
Meaning: "Homam", an Edomitish chieftain.
Usage: Homam. Compare "H1967".
Source: from "H2000"; raging;

1951.long:
Meaning: properly, to "be naught", i.e. (figuratively) to "be" (causatively, "act") "light".
Usage: be ready.
Source: a primitive root;

1952.long:
Meaning: "wealth"; by implication, "enough".
Usage: enough, for nought, riches, substance, wealth.
Source: from the same as "H1951" in the sense of "H202";

1953.long:
Meaning: "Hoshama", an Israelite.
Usage: Hoshama.
Source: from "H3068" and "H8085"; Jehovah has heard;

1954.long:
Meaning: "Hoshea", the name of five Israelites.
Usage: Hosea, Hoshea, Oshea.
Source: from "H3467"; "deliverer";

1955.long:
Meaning: "Hoshajah", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Hoshaiah.
Source: from "H3467" and "H3050"; "Jah has saved";

1956.long:
Meaning: "Hothir", an Israelite.
Usage: Hothir.
Source: from "H3498"; he has caused to remain;

1959.long:
Meaning: "acclamation".
Usage: shout(-ing).
Source: from an unused root (meaning to "shout");

1960.long:
Meaning: properly, an "acclaim", i.e. a "choir of singers".
Usage: thanksgiving.
Source: from the same as "H1959";

1961.long:
Meaning: to "exist", i.e. "be" or "become", "come to pass" (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary).
Usage: beacon, × altogether, be(-come), accomplished, committed, like), break, cause, come (to pass), do, faint, fall, follow, happen, × have, last, pertain, quit (one-) self, require, × use.
Source: a primitive root (compare "H1933");

1964.long:
Meaning: a large public building, such as a "palace" or "temple".
Usage: palace, temple.
Source: probably from "H3201" (in the sense of "capacity");

1966.long:
Meaning: the "morning-star".
Usage: lucifer.
Source: from "H1984" (in the sense of "brightness");

1967.long:
Meaning: "Hemam", an Idumaean.
Usage: Hemam.
Source: another form for "H1950";

1968.long:
Meaning: "Heman", the name of at least two Israelites.
Usage: Heman.
Source: probably from "H539"; faithful;

1969.long:
Meaning: a "hin" or liquid measure.
Usage: hin.
Source: probably of Egyptian origin;

1970.long:
Meaning: to "injure".
Usage: make self strange.
Source: a primitive root; apparently

1972.long:
Meaning: to "remove" or "be remote".
Usage: cast far off.
Source: probably denominatively from "H1973";

1973.long:
Meaning: to the "distance", i.e. "far away"; also (of time) "thus far".
Usage: back, beyond, (hence,-) forward, hitherto, thence, forth, yonder.
Source: from the primitive form of the article (hal);

1974.long:
Meaning: a "celebration of thanksgiving for harvest".
Usage: merry, praise.
Source: from "H1984" (in the sense of rejoicing);

1976.long:
Meaning: "this very".
Usage: this.
Source: from the article (see "H1973") and "H2088";

1978.long:
Meaning: a "walk", i.e. (by implication) a "step".
Usage: step.
Source: from "H1980";

1979.long:
Meaning: a "walking"; by implication, a "procession" or "march", a "caravan".
Usage: company, going, walk, way.
Source: feminine of "H1978";

1980.long:
Meaning: to "walk" (in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively).
Usage: (all) along, apace, behave (self), come, (on) continually, be conversant, depart, be eased, enter, exercise (self), follow, forth, forward, get, go (about, abroad, along, away, forward, on, out, up and down), greater, grow, be wont to haunt, lead, march, × more and more, move (self), needs, on, pass (away), be at the point, quite, run (along), send, speedily, spread, still, surely, tale-bearer, travel(-ler), walk (abroad, on, to and fro, up and down, to places), wander, wax, (way-) faring man, × be weak, whirl.
Source: akin to "H3212"; a primitive root;

1982.long:
Meaning: properly, a "journey", i.e. (by implication) a "wayfarer"; also a "flowing".
Usage: × dropped, traveller.
Source: from "H1980";

1983.long:
Meaning: properly, a "journey", i.e. (by implication) "toll on goods at a road".
Usage: custom.
Source: (Aramaic) from "H1981";

1984.long:
Meaning: to "be clear" (orig. of sound, but usually of color); to "shine"; hence, "to make a show", to "boast"; and thus to "be" (clamorously) "foolish"; "to rave"; causatively, to "celebrate"; also to "stultify".
Usage: (make) boast (self), celebrate, commend, (deal, make), fool(-ish, -ly), glory, give (light), be (make, feign self) mad (against), give in marriage, (sing, be worthy of) praise, rage, renowned, shine.
Source: a primitive root;

1985.long:
Meaning: "Hillel", an Israelite.
Usage: Hillel.
Source: from "H1984"; praising (namely God);

1986.long:
Meaning: to "strike" down; by implication, to "hammer", "stamp", "conquer", "disband".
Usage: beat (down), break (down), overcome, smite (with the hammer).
Source: a primitive root;

1987.long:
Meaning: "Helem", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Helem.
Source: from "H1986"; smiter;

1988.long:
Meaning: "hither".
Usage: here, hither(-(to)), thither.
Source: from the article (see "H1973");

1990.long:
Meaning: "Ham", a region of Palestine.
Usage: Ham.
Source: of uncertain derivation;

1992.long:
Meaning: "they" (only used when emphatic).
Usage: it, like, × (how, so) many (soever, more as) they (be), (the) same, × so, × such, their, them, these, they, those, which, who, whom, withal, ye.
Source: or (prolonged) "הֵמָּה"; masculine plural from "H1931";

1993.long:
Meaning: to "make a loud sound" (like English 'hum'); by implication, to "be in great commotion" or "tumult", to "rage", "war", "moan", "clamor".
Usage: clamorous, concourse, cry aloud, be disquieted, loud, mourn, be moved, make a noise, rage, roar, sound, be troubled, make in tumult, tumultuous, be in an uproar.
Source: a primitive root (compare "H1949");

1994.long:
Meaning: "they".
Usage: × are, them, those.
Source: (Aramaic) or (prolonged) "הִמּוֹן"; (Aramaic), corresponding to "H1992";

1995.long:
Meaning: a "noise", "tumult", "crowd"; also "disquietude", "wealth".
Usage: abundance, company, many, multitude, multiply, noise, riches, rumbling, sounding, store, tumult.
Source: or "הָמֹן"; (Ezekiel 5:7), from "H1993";

1996.long:
Meaning: the "multitude of Gog"; the fanciful name of an emblematic place in Palestine.
Usage: Hamon-gog.
Source: from "H1995" and "H1463";

1997.long:
Meaning: "Hamonah".
Usage: Hamonah.
Source: feminine of "H1995"; "multitude"; , the same as "H1996"

1999.long:
Meaning: a "sound".
Usage: speech, tumult.
Source: or (too fully) "הֲמוּלָּה"; (Jeremiah 11:16), feminine passive participle of an unused root meaning to rush (as rain with a windy roar);

2000.long:
Meaning: properly, to "put in commotion"; by implication, to "disturb", "drive", "destroy".
Usage: break, consume, crush, destroy, discomfit, trouble, vex.
Source: a primitive root (compare "H1949", "H1993");

2001.long:
Meaning: "Haman", a Persian vizier.
Usage: Haman.
Source: of foreign derivation;

2002.long:
Meaning: a "necklace".
Usage: chain.
Source: (Aramaic) but the text is "הֲמוּנֵךְ"; of foreign origin;

2003.long:
Meaning: a dry "twig" or "brushwood".
Usage: melting.
Source: from an unused root apparently meaning to "crackle";

2004.long:
Meaning: "they" (only used when emphatic).
Usage: × in, such like, (with) them, thereby, therein, (more than) they, wherein, in which, whom, withal.
Source: feminine plural from "H1931";

2005.long:
Meaning: "lo!"; also (as expressing surprise) "if".
Usage: behold, if, lo, though.
Source: a primitive particle;

2006.long:
Meaning: "lo!" also "there"(-fore), (un-) "less", "whether", "but", "if".
Usage: (that) if, or, whether.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H2005";

2007.long:
Meaning: "themselves" (often used emphatic for the copula, also in indirect relation).
Usage: × in, × such (and such things), their, (into) them, thence, therein, these, they (had), on this side, whose, wherein.
Source: prolongation for "H2004";

2008.long:
Meaning: "hither" or "thither" (but used both of place and time).
Usage: here, hither(-to), now, on this (that) side, since, this (that) way, thitherward, thus far, to...fro, yet.
Source: from "H2004";

2011.long:
Meaning: "Hinnom", apparently a Jebusite.
Usage: Hinnom.
Source: probably of foreign origin;

2012.long:
Meaning: "Hena", a place apparently in Mesopotamia.
Usage: Hena.
Source: probably of foreign derivation;

2013.long:
Meaning: to "hush".
Usage: hold peace (tongue), (keep) silence, be silent, still.
Source: a primitive root;

2015.long:
Meaning: to "turn" about or over; by implication, to "change", "overturn", "return", "pervert".
Usage: × become, change, come, be converted, give, make (a bed), overthrow (-turn), perverse, retire, tumble, turn (again, aside, back, to the contrary, every way).
Source: a primitive root;

2016.long:
Meaning: a "turn", i.e. the "reverse".
Usage: contrary.
Source: ; or "הֵפֶךְ"; from "H2015";

2017.long:
Meaning: an "upset", i.e. (abstract) "perversity".
Usage: turning of things upside down.
Source: from "H2015";

2021.long:
Meaning: a "weapon of war".
Usage: chariot.
Source: from an unused root meaning apparently to be sharp or strong;

2022.long:
Meaning: a "mountain" or "range" of hills (sometimes used figuratively).
Usage: hill (country), mount(-ain), × promotion.
Source: a shortened form of "H2042";

2023.long:
Meaning: "Hor", the name of a peak in Idumaea and of one in Syria.
Usage: Hor.
Source: another form of "H2022"; "mountain";

2024.long:
Meaning: "Hara", a region of Media.
Usage: Hara.
Source: perhaps from "H2022"; mountainousness;

2025.long:
Meaning: "mount of God"; figuratively, the "altar" of burnt-offering.
Usage: altar. Compare "H739".
Source: from "H2022" and "H410";

2026.long:
Meaning: to "smite" with deadly intent.
Usage: destroy, out of hand, kill, murder(-er), put to (death), make (slaughter), slay(-er), × surely.
Source: a primitive root;

2029.long:
Meaning: to "be" (or "become") "pregnant", "conceive" (literally or figuratively).
Usage: been, be with child, conceive, progenitor.
Source: a primitive root;

2030.long:
Meaning: "pregnant".
Usage: (be, woman) with child, conceive, × great.
Source: or "הָרִי"; (Hosea 14:1), from "H2029";

2031.long:
Meaning: a "mental conception".
Usage: thought.
Source: (Aramaic) from a root corresponding to "H2029";

2033.long:
Meaning: a "Harorite" or "mountaineer".
Usage: Harorite.
Source: another form for "H2043";

2036.long:
Meaning: "Horam", a Canaanitish king.
Usage: Horam.
Source: from an unused root (meaning to tower up); high;

2037.long:
Meaning: "Harum", an Israelite.
Usage: Harum.
Source: passive participle of the same as "H2036"; high;

2038.long:
Meaning: a "castle" (from its height).
Usage: palace.
Source: from the same as "H2036";

2039.long:
Meaning: "Haran", the name of two men.
Usage: Haran.
Source: perhaps from "H2022"; mountaineer;

2040.long:
Meaning: to "pull" down or in pieces, "break", "destroy".
Usage: beat down, break (down, through), destroy, overthrow, pluck down, pull down, ruin, throw down, × utterly.
Source: a primitive root;

2042.long:
Meaning: a "mountain".
Usage: hill, mount(-ain).
Source: from an unused root meaning to loom up;

2043.long:
Usage: Hararite.
Source: or "הָרָרִי"; (2 Samuel 23:11), or "הָארָרִי"; (2 Samuel 23:34, last clause), apparently from "H2042"; a mountaineer

2044.long:
Meaning: "Hashem", an Israelite.
Usage: Hashem.
Source: perhaps from the same as "H2828"; wealthy;

2047.long:
Meaning: "Hathak", a Persian eunuch.
Usage: Hatach.
Source: probably of foreign origin;

2048.long:
Meaning: to "deride"; by implication, to "cheat".
Usage: deal deceitfully, deceive, mock.
Source: a primitive root;

2049.long:
Meaning: a "derision".
Usage: mocker.
Source: from "H2048" (only in plural collectively);

2050.long:
Meaning: properly, to "break in upon", i.e. to "assail".
Usage: imagine mischief.
Source: a primitive root;

2051.long:
Meaning: "Vedan" (or Aden), a place in Arabia.
Usage: Dan also.
Source: perhaps for "H5730";

2052.long:
Meaning: "Vaheb", a place in Moab.
Usage: what he did.
Source: of uncertain derivation;

2053.long:
Meaning: a "hook" (the name of the sixth Hebrew letter).
Usage: hook.
Source: probably

2054.long:
Meaning: "crime".
Usage: × strange.
Source: presumed to be from an unused root meaning to bear guilt;

2055.long:
Meaning: "Vajezatha", a son of Haman.
Usage: Vajezatha.
Source: of foreign origin;

2059.long:
Meaning: "Vashni", an Israelite.
Usage: Vashni.
Source: probably from "H3461"; weak;

2060.long:
Meaning: "Vashti", the queen of Xerxes.
Usage: Vashti. z.
Source: of Persian origin;

2061.long:
Meaning: a "wolf".
Usage: wolf.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "be yellow";

2062.long:
Meaning: "Zeeb", a Midianitish prince.
Usage: Zeeb.
Source: the same as "H2061";

2063.long:
Meaning: "this" (often used adverb).
Usage: hereby (-in, -with), it, likewise, the one (other, same), she, so (much), such (deed), that, therefore, these, this (thing), thus.
Source: irregular feminine of "H2088";

2066.long:
Meaning: "Zabad", the name of seven Israelites.
Usage: Zabad.
Source: from "H2064"; giver;

2067.long:
Meaning: "Zabdi", the name of four Israelites.
Usage: Zabdi.
Source: from "H2065"; giving;

2068.long:
Meaning: "gift of God"; "Zabdiel", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Zabdiel.
Source: from "H2065" and "H410";

2069.long:
Meaning: "Zebadjah", the name of nine Israelites.
Usage: Zebadiah.
Source: or "זְבַדְיָהוּ"; from "H2064" and "H3050"; Jah has given;

2070.long:
Meaning: a "fly" (especially one of a stinging nature).
Usage: fly.
Source: from an unused root (meaning to "flit");

2072.long:
Meaning: "Zabbud", an Israelite.
Usage: Zabbud.
Source: a form of "H2071"; "given";

2073.long:
Meaning: a "residence".
Usage: dwell in, dwelling, habitation.
Source: or "זְבֻל"; from "H2082";

2074.long:
Meaning: "Zebulon", a son of Jacob; also his territory and tribe.
Usage: Zebulun.
Source: or "זְבֻלוּן"; or "זְבוּלֻן"; from "H2082"; habitation;

2075.long:
Meaning: a "Zebulonite" or descendant of Zebulun.
Usage: Zebulonite.
Source: patronymically from "H2074";

2076.long:
Meaning: to "slaughter" an animal (usually in sacrifice).
Usage: kill, offer, (do) sacrifice, slay.
Source: a primitive root;

2077.long:
Meaning: properly, a "slaughter", i.e. the "flesh" of an animal; by implication, a "sacrifice" (the victim or the act).
Usage: offer(-ing), sacrifice.
Source: from "H2076";

2078.long:
Meaning: "Zebach", a Midianitish prince.
Usage: Zebah.
Source: the same as "H2077"; "sacrifice";

2079.long:
Meaning: "Zabbai" (or Zaccai), an Israelite.
Usage: Zabbai.
Source: probably by orthographical error for "H2140";

2080.long:
Meaning: "Zebidah", an Israelitess.
Usage: Zebudah.
Source: feminine from "H2064"; giving;

2081.long:
Meaning: "Zebina", an Israelite.
Usage: Zebina.
Source: from an unused root (meaning to purchase); gainfulness;

2082.long:
Meaning: to "reside".
Usage: dwell with.
Source: a primitive root; apparently properly, to inclose, i.e.

2083.long:
Meaning: "Zebul", an Israelite.
Usage: Zebul. Compare "H2073".
Source: the same as "H2073"; dwelling;

2084.long:
Meaning: to "acquire by purchase".
Usage: gain.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to the root of "H2081";

2085.long:
Meaning: the "skin of a grape".
Usage: husk.
Source: from an unused root probably meaning to inclose;

2088.long:
Meaning: the masculine demonstrative pronoun, "this" or "that".
Usage: he, × hence, × here, it(-self), × now, × of him, the one...the other, × than the other, (× out of) the (self) same, such (a one) that, these, this (hath, man), on this side...on that side, × thus, very, which. Compare "H2063", "H2090", "H2097", "H2098".
Source: a primitive word;

2089.long:
Meaning: "a sheep".
Usage: lamb.
Source: (1 Samuel 17:34) by permutation for "H7716";

2090.long:
Meaning: "this" or "that".
Usage: as well as another, it, this, that, thus and thus.
Source: for "H2088";

2091.long:
Meaning: "gold", figuratively, "something gold-colored" (i.e. yellow), as "oil", a "clear sky".
Usage: gold(-en), fair weather.
Source: from an unused root meaning to shimmer;

2092.long:
Meaning: to "be rancid", i.e. (transitively) to "loathe".
Usage: abhor.
Source: a primitive root;

2094.long:
Meaning: to "gleam"; figuratively, to "enlighten" (by caution).
Usage: admonish, shine, teach, (give) warn(-ing).
Source: a primitive root;

2098.long:
Meaning: "this" or "that".
Usage: that, this, × wherein, which, whom.
Source: for "H2088";

2099.long:
Meaning: "Ziv" (corresponding to Ijar or May).
Usage: Zif.
Source: probably from an unused root meaning to be prominent; properly, brightness (compare "H2122"), i.e. (figuratively) the month of flowers;

2100.long:
Meaning: to "flow" freely (as water), i.e. (specifically) to "have" a (sexual) "flux"; figuratively, to "waste" away; also to "overflow".
Usage: flow, gush out, have a (running) issue, pine away, run.
Source: a primitive root;

2102.long:
Meaning: to "seethe"; figuratively, to "be insolent".
Usage: be proud, deal proudly, presume, (come) presumptuously, sod.
Source: or (by permutation) "זִיד"; a primitive root;

2103.long:
Meaning: to "be proud".
Usage: in pride.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H2102";

2104.long:
Meaning: "Zuzites", an aboriginal tribe of Palestine.
Usage: Zuzims.
Source: plural probably from the same as "H2123"; prominent;

2105.long:
Meaning: "Zocheth", an Israelite.
Usage: Zoheth.
Source: of uncertain origin;

2106.long:
Meaning: an "angle" (as projecting), i.e. (by implication) a "corner-column" (or anta).
Usage: corner(stone).
Source: apparently from the same root as "H2099" (in the sense of prominence);

2107.long:
Meaning: probably to "shake" out, i.e. (by implication) to "scatter" profusely; figuratively, to "treat lightly".
Usage: lavish, despise.
Source: a primitive root (compare "H2151");

2108.long:
Meaning: probably "scattering", i.e. "removal"; used adverbially, "except".
Usage: beside, but, only, save.
Source: from "H2107";

2109.long:
Meaning: perhaps properly, to "be plump", i.e. (transitively) to "nourish".
Usage: feed.
Source: a primitive root;

2111.long:
Meaning: properly, to "shake off", i.e. (figuratively) to "agitate" (as with fear).
Usage: move, tremble, vex.
Source: a primitive root;

2113.long:
Meaning: "agitation", "fear".
Usage: be removed, trouble, vexation. Compare "H2189".
Source: from "H2111";

2114.long:
Meaning: to "turn aside" (especially for lodging); hence to "be a foreigner", "strange", "profane"; specifically (active participle) to "commit adultery".
Usage: (come from) another (man, place), fanner, go away, (e-) strange(-r, thing, woman).
Source: a primitive root;

2115.long:
Meaning: to "press together", "tighten".
Usage: close, rush, thrust together.
Source: a primitive root (compare "H6695");

2116.long:
Meaning: "trodden" on.
Usage: that which is crushed.
Source: from "H2115";

2117.long:
Meaning: "Zaza", an Israelite.
Usage: Zaza.
Source: probably from the root of "H2123"; prominent;

2118.long:
Meaning: to "shove" or "displace".
Usage: loose.
Source: a primitive root;

2119.long:
Meaning: to "crawl"; by implication, to "fear".
Usage: be afraid, serpent, worm.
Source: a primitive root;

2120.long:
Meaning: "Zocheleth", a boundary stone in. Palestine.
Usage: Zoheleth.
Source: feminine active participle of "H2119"; crawling (i.e. serpent);

2123.long:
Meaning: "fulness" of the breast; also a moving "creature".
Usage: abundance, wild beast.
Source: from an unused root apparently meaning to "be conspicuous";

2124.long:
Meaning: "Ziza", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Ziza.
Source: apparently from the same as "H2123"; prominence;

2125.long:
Meaning: "Zizah", an Israelite.
Usage: Zizah.
Source: another form for "H2124";

2126.long:
Meaning: "Zina", an Israelite.
Usage: Zina.
Source: from "H2109"; well-fed; or perhaps an orthographical error for "H2124";

2128.long:
Meaning: "Ziph", the name of a place in Palestine; also of an Israelite.
Usage: Ziph.
Source: from the same as "H2203"; flowing;

2129.long:
Meaning: "Ziphah", an Israelite.
Usage: Ziphah.
Source: feminine of "H2128"; a flowing;

2130.long:
Meaning: a "Ziphite" or inhabitant of Ziph.
Usage: Ziphim, Ziphite.
Source: patrial from "H2128";

2131.long:
Meaning: properly, what "leaps" forth, i.e. "flash" of fire, or a burning "arrow"; also (from the original sense of the root) a "bond".
Usage: chain, fetter, firebrand, spark.
Source: (Isaiah 50:11) (feminine); and "זִק"; or "זֵק"; from "H2187";

2132.long:
Meaning: an "olive" (as yielding illuminating oil), the "tree", the "branch" or the "berry".
Usage: olive (tree, -yard), Olivet.
Source: probably from an unused root (akin to "H2099");

2133.long:
Meaning: "Zethan", an Israelite.
Usage: Zethan.
Source: from "H2132"; olive grove;

2135.long:
Meaning: to "be translucent"; figuratively, to "be innocent".
Usage: be (make) clean, cleanse, be clear, count pure.
Source: a primitive root (compare "H2141");

2136.long:
Meaning: "purity".
Usage: innocency.
Source: (Aramaic) from a root corresponding to "H2135";

2138.long:
Meaning: a "male" (of man or animals).
Usage: males, men-children.
Source: properly, passive participle of "H2142", but used for "H2145";

2139.long:
Meaning: "Zakkur", the name of seven Israelites.
Usage: Zaccur, Zacchur.
Source: from "H2142"; "mindful";

2141.long:
Meaning: to "be transparent" or "clean" (phys. or morally).
Usage: be (make) clean, be pure(-r).
Source: a primitive root (compare "H2135");

2142.long:
Meaning: properly, to "mark" (so as to be recognized), i.e. to "remember"; by implication, to "mention"; to "be male".
Usage: × burn (incense), × earnestly, be male, (make) mention (of), be mindful, recount, record(-er), remember, make to be remembered, bring (call, come, keep, put) to (in) remembrance, × still, think on, × well.
Source: a primitive root; also as denominative from "H2145"

2143.long:
Meaning: a "memento", abstractly "recollection" (rarely if ever); by implication, "commemoration".
Usage: memorial, memory, remembrance, scent.
Source: or "זֶכֶר"; from "H2142";

2144.long:
Meaning: "Zeker", an Israelite.
Usage: Zeker.
Source: the same as "H2143";

2145.long:
Meaning: properly, "remembered", i.e. a "male" (of man or animals, as being the most noteworthy sex).
Usage: × him, male, man(child, -kind).
Source: from "H2142";

2146.long:
Meaning: a "memento" (or memorable thing, day or writing).
Usage: memorial, record.
Source: from "H2142";

2147.long:
Meaning: "Zicri", the name of twelve Israelites.
Usage: Zichri.
Source: from "H2142"; memorable;

2148.long:
Meaning: "Zecarjah", the name of twenty-nine Israelites.
Usage: Zachariah, Zechariah.
Source: or "זְכַרְיָהוּ"; from "H2142" and "H3050"; Jah has remembered;

2149.long:
Meaning: properly, a "shaking", i.e. perhaps a "tempest".
Usage: vilest.
Source: from "H2151";

2150.long:
Meaning: "tremulous", i.e. a "twig".
Usage: sprig.
Source: by reduplication from "H2151";

2151.long:
Meaning: to "shake" (as in the wind), i.e. to "quake"; figuratively, to "be loose" morally, "worthless" or "prodigal".
Usage: blow down, glutton, riotous (eater), vile.
Source: a primitive root (compare "H2107");

2152.long:
Meaning: a "glow" (of wind or anger); also a "famine" (as consuming).
Usage: horrible, horror, terrible.
Source: or "זִלְעָפָה"; from "H2196";

2153.long:
Meaning: "Zilpah", Leah's maid.
Usage: Zilpah.
Source: ; from an unused root apparently meaning to trickle, as myrrh; fragrant dropping;

2154.long:
Meaning: a "plan", especially a "bad one".
Usage: heinous crime, lewd(-ly, -ness), mischief, purpose, thought, wicked (device, mind, -ness).
Source: or "זַמָּה"; from "H2161";

2155.long:
Meaning: "Zimmah", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Zimmah.
Source: the same as "H2154";

2156.long:
Meaning: a "twig" (as "pruned").
Usage: vine, branch, slip.
Source: or "זְמֹרָה" (feminine); and "זְמֹר" (masculine); from "H2168";

2157.long:
Meaning: a "Zamzumite", or native tribe of Palestine.
Usage: Zamzummim.
Source: from "H2161"; intriguing;

2158.long:
Meaning: a "song" to be accompanied with instrumental music.
Usage: psalm(-ist), singing, song.
Source: or "זָמִר"; and (feminine) "זְמִרָה"; from "H2167";

2160.long:
Meaning: "Zemirah", an Israelite.
Usage: Zemira.
Source: feminine of "H2158"; song;

2161.long:
Meaning: to "plan", usually in a bad sense.
Usage: consider, devise, imagine, plot, purpose, think (evil).
Source: a primitive root;

2163.long:
Meaning: to "fix" (a time).
Usage: appoint.
Source: a primitive root;

2164.long:
Meaning: to "agree" (on a time and place).
Usage: prepare.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H2163";

2166.long:
Usage: season, time.
Source: (Aramaic) from "H2165"; the same as "H2165"

2167.long:
Meaning: properly, to "touch" the strings or parts of a musical instrument, i.e. "play" upon it; to make "music", accompanied by the voice; hence to "celebrate" in song and music.
Usage: give praise, sing forth praises, psalms.
Source: a primitive root (perhaps identical with "H2168" through the idea of "striking" with the fingers);

2168.long:
Meaning: to "trim" (a vine).
Usage: prune.
Source: a primitive root (compare "H2167", "H5568", "H6785");

2169.long:
Meaning: a "gazelle" (from its lightly touching the ground).
Usage: chamois.
Source: apparently from "H2167" or "H2168";

2170.long:
Meaning: "instrumental music".
Usage: musick.
Source: (Aramaic) from a root corresponding to "H2167";

2171.long:
Meaning: an "instrumental musician".
Usage: singer.
Source: (Aramaic) from the same as "H2170";

2172.long:
Meaning: a "musical" piece or "song" to be accompanied by an instrument.
Usage: melody, psalm.
Source: from "H2167";

2174.long:
Meaning: "Zimri", the name of five Israelites, and of an Arabian tribe.
Usage: Zimri.
Source: from "H2167"; musical;

2175.long:
Meaning: "Zimran", a son of Abraham by Keturah.
Usage: Zimran.
Source: from "H2167"; musical;

2177.long:
Meaning: properly, "nourished" (or fully developed), i.e. a "form" or "sort".
Usage: divers kinds, × all manner of store.
Source: from "H2109";

2179.long:
Meaning: to "curtail", i.e. "cut off the rear".
Usage: smite the hindmost.
Source: a primitive root meaning to wag; used only as a denominative from "H2180";

2180.long:
Meaning: the "tail" (literally or figuratively).
Usage: tail.
Source: from "H2179" (in the original sense of "flapping");

2181.long:
Meaning: to "commit adultery" (usually of the female, and less often of simple fornication, rarely of involuntary ravishment); figuratively, to "commit idolatry" (the Jewish people being regarded as the spouse of Jehovah).
Usage: (cause to) commit fornication, × continually, × great, (be an, play the) harlot, (cause to be, play the) whore, (commit, fall to) whoredom, (cause to) go a-whoring, whorish.
Source: a primitive root [highly "fed" and therefore "wanton"];

2182.long:
Meaning: "Zanoach", the name of two places in Palestine.
Usage: Zanoah.
Source: from "H2186"; "rejected";

2185.long:
Meaning: "harlots".
Usage: armour.
Source: regarded by some as if from "H2109" or an unused root, and applied to military equipments; but evidently the feminine plural active participle of "H2181";

2186.long:
Meaning: "reject", "forsake", "fail".
Usage: cast away (off), remove far away (off).
Source: a primitive root meaning to "push" aside, i.e.

2187.long:
Meaning: properly, to "draw together the feet" (as an animal about to dart upon its prey), i.e. to "spring forward".
Usage: leap.
Source: a primitive root;

2191.long:
Meaning: "small".
Usage: little.
Source: from an unused root (akin (by permutation) to "H6819"), meaning to "dwindle";

2193.long:
Meaning: to "extinguish".
Usage: be extinct.
Source: a primitive root;

2194.long:
Meaning: properly, to "foam" at the mouth, i.e. to "be enraged".
Usage: abhor, abominable, (be) angry, defy, (have) indignation.
Source: a primitive root;

2195.long:
Meaning: strictly "froth" at the mouth, i.e. (figuratively) "fury" (especially of God's displeasure with sin).
Usage: angry, indignation, rage.
Source: from "H2194";

2196.long:
Meaning: properly, to "boil up", i.e. (figuratively) to "be peevish" or "angry".
Usage: fret, sad, worse liking, be wroth.
Source: a primitive root;

2199.long:
Meaning: to "shriek" (from anguish or danger); by analogy, (as a herald) to "announce" or "convene" publicly.
Usage: assemble, call (together), (make a) cry (out), come with such a company, gather (together), cause to be proclaimed.
Source: a primitive root;

2200.long:
Meaning: to "make an outcry".
Usage: cry.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H2199";

2202.long:
Meaning: "Ziphron", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Ziphron.
Source: from an unused root (meaning to be fragrant);

2203.long:
Meaning: "asphalt" (from its tendency to "soften" in the sun).
Usage: pitch.
Source: from an unused root (meaning to "liquify");

2204.long:
Meaning: to "be old".
Usage: aged man, be (wax) old (man).
Source: a primitive root;

2205.long:
Meaning: "old".
Usage: aged, ancient (man), elder(-est), old (man, men and...women), senator.
Source: from "H2204";

2208.long:
Meaning: "old age".
Usage: old age.
Source: properly, passive participle of "H2204" (used only in the plural as a noun);

2210.long:
Meaning: to "life", i.e. (figuratively) "comfort".
Usage: raise (up).
Source: a primitive root;

2211.long:
Meaning: to "hang", i.e. "impale".
Usage: set up.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H2210";

2212.long:
Meaning: to "strain", (figuratively) "extract", "clarify".
Usage: fine, pour down, purge, purify, refine.
Source: a primitive root;

2213.long:
Meaning: a "chaplet" (as "spread" around the top), i.e. (specifically) a border "moulding".
Usage: crown.
Source: from "H2237" (in the sense of "scattering");

2215.long:
Meaning: to "flow away".
Usage: wax warm.
Source: a primitive root;

2216.long:
Meaning: "Zerubbabel", an Israelite.
Usage: Zerubbabel.
Source: from "H2215" and "H894"; descended of (i.e. from) Babylon, i.e. born there;

2218.long:
Meaning: "Zered", a brook East of the Dead Sea.
Usage: Zared, Zered.
Source: from an unused root meaning to be exuberant in growth; lined with shrubbery;

2219.long:
Meaning: to "toss" about; by implication, to "diffuse", "winnow".
Usage: cast away, compass, disperse, fan, scatter (away), spread, strew, winnow.
Source: a primitive root (compare "H2114");

2220.long:
Meaning: the "arm" (as "stretched" out), or (of animals) the "foreleg"; figuratively, "force".
Usage: arm, help, mighty, power, shoulder, strength.
Source: or (shortened) "זְרֹעַ"; and (feminine) "זְרוֹעָה"; or "זְרֹעָה"; from "H2232";

2221.long:
Meaning: something "sown", i.e. a "plant".
Usage: sowing, thing that is sown.
Source: from "H2232";

2222.long:
Meaning: a "pouring rain".
Usage: water.
Source: by reduplication from an unused root meaning to flow;

2223.long:
Meaning: properly, "tightly girt", i.e. probably a "racer", or "some fleet animal" (as being slender in the waist).
Usage: greyhound.
Source: by reduplication from "H2115";

2224.long:
Meaning: properly, to "irradiate" (or shoot forth beams), i.e. to "rise" (as the sun); specifically, to "appear" (as a symptom of leprosy).
Usage: arise, rise (up), as soon as it is up.
Source: a primitive root;

2226.long:
Meaning: "Zerach", the name of three Israelites, also of an Idumaean and an Ethiopian prince.
Usage: Zarah, Zerah.
Source: the same as "H2225";

2227.long:
Meaning: a "Zarchite" or descendant of Zerach.
Usage: Zarchite.
Source: patronymically from "H2226";

2228.long:
Meaning: "Zerachjah", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Zerahiah.
Source: from "H2225" and "H3050"; Jah has risen;

2229.long:
Meaning: to "gush" (as water).
Usage: carry away as with a flood, pour out.
Source: a primitive root;

2230.long:
Meaning: a "gush" of water.
Usage: flood, overflowing, shower, storm, tempest.
Source: from "H2229";

2231.long:
Meaning: a "gushing of fluid" (semen).
Usage: issue.
Source: feminine of "H2230";

2232.long:
Meaning: to "sow"; figuratively, to "disseminate", "plant", "fructify".
Usage: bear, conceive seed, set with sow(-er), yield.
Source: a primitive root;

2233.long:
Meaning: "seed"; figuratively, "fruit", "plant", "sowing-time", "posterity".
Usage: × carnally, child, fruitful, seed(-time), sowing-time.
Source: from "H2232";

2235.long:
Meaning: something "sown" (only in the plural), i.e. a "vegetable" (as food).
Usage: pulse.
Source: or "זֵרָעֹן"; from "H2232";

2236.long:
Meaning: to "sprinkle" (fluid or solid particles).
Usage: be here and there, scatter, sprinkle, strew.
Source: a primitive root;

2237.long:
Meaning: perhaps to "diffuse", i.e. (specifically) to "sneeze".
Usage: sneeze.
Source: a primitive root (compare "H2114");

2238.long:
Meaning: "Zeresh", Haman's wife.
Usage: Zeresh.
Source: of Persian origin;

2239.long:
Meaning: the "spread" of the fingers, i.e. a "span".
Usage: span.
Source: from "H2219";

2240.long:
Meaning: "Zattu", an Israelite.
Usage: Zattu.
Source: of uncertain derivation;

2241.long:
Meaning: "Zetham", an Israelite.
Usage: Zetham.
Source: apparently a variation for "H2133";

2242.long:
Meaning: "Zethar", a eunuch of Xerxes.
Usage: Zethar.
Source: of Persian origin;

2243.long:
Meaning: properly, a "cherisher", i.e. the "bosom".
Usage: bosom.
Source: by contraction from "H2245";

2244.long:
Meaning: to "secrete".
Usage: × held, hide (self), do secretly.
Source: a primitive root (compare "H2245");

2245.long:
Meaning: properly, to "hide" (as in the bosom), i.e. to "cherish" (with affection).
Usage: love.
Source: a primitive root (compare "H2244", "H2247");

2249.long:
Meaning: "Chabor", a river of Assyria.
Usage: Habor.
Source: from "H2266"; "united";

2250.long:
Meaning: properly, "bound" (with stripes), i.e. a "weal" (or black-and-blue mark itself).
Usage: blueness, bruise, hurt, stripe, wound.
Source: or "חַבֻּרָה"; or "חֲבֻרָה"; from "H2266";

2251.long:
Meaning: to "knock" out or off.
Usage: beat (off, out), thresh.
Source: a primitive root;

2252.long:
Meaning: "Chabajah", an Israelite.
Usage: Habaiah.
Source: or "חֲבָיָה"; from "H2247" and "H3050"; Jah has hidden;

2254.long:
Meaning: to "wind" tightly (as a rope), i.e. to "bind"; specifically, by a "pledge"; figuratively, to "pervert", "destroy"; also to "writhe" in pain (especially of parturition).
Usage: × at all, band, bring forth, (deal) corrupt(-ly), destroy, offend, lay to (take a) pledge, spoil, travail, × very, withhold.
Source: a primitive root;

2256.long:
Meaning: a "rope" (as twisted), especially a measuring "line"; by implication, a "district" or "inheritance" (as measured); or a "noose" (as of cords); figuratively, a "company" (as if tied together); a "throe" (especially of parturition); also "ruin".
Usage: band, coast, company, cord, country, destruction, line, lot, pain, pang, portion, region, rope, snare, sorrow, tackling.
Source: or "חֵבֶל"; from "H2254";

2258.long:
Meaning: a "pawn" (as security for debt).
Usage: pledge.
Source: or (feminine) "חֲבֹלָה"; from "H2254";

2259.long:
Meaning: a "sailor".
Usage: pilot, shipmaster.
Source: active participle from "H2254" (in the sense of handling ropes);

2260.long:
Meaning: a "mast".
Usage: mast.
Source: from "H2254" (in the sense of furnished with ropes);

2262.long:
Meaning: "Chabatstsanjah", a Rechabite.
Usage: Habazaniah.
Source: of uncertain derivation;

2263.long:
Meaning: to "clasp" (the hands or in embrace).
Usage: embrace, fold.
Source: a primitive root;

2264.long:
Meaning: a "clasping of the hands" (in idleness).
Usage: fold.
Source: from "H2263";

2265.long:
Meaning: "Chabakkuk", the prophet.
Usage: Habakkuk.
Source: by reduplication from "H2263"; embrace;

2266.long:
Meaning: to "join" (literally or figuratively); specifically (by means of spells) to "fascinate".
Usage: charm(-er), be compact, couple (together), have fellowship with, heap up, join (self, together), league.
Source: a primitive root;

2267.long:
Meaning: a "society"; also a "spell".
Usage: charmer(-ing), company, enchantment, × wide.
Source: from "H2266";

2268.long:
Meaning: "Cheber", the name of a Kenite and of three Israelites.
Usage: Heber.
Source: the same as "H2267"; "community";

2269.long:
Meaning: an "associate".
Usage: companion, fellow.
Source: (Aramaic) from a root corresponding to "H2266";

2270.long:
Meaning: an "associate".
Usage: companion, fellow, knit together.
Source: from "H2266";

2272.long:
Meaning: a "streak" (like a line), as on the tiger.
Usage: spot.
Source: by reduplication from "H2266";

2275.long:
Meaning: "Chebron", a place in Palestine, also the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Hebron.
Source: from "H2267"; seat of association;

2276.long:
Meaning: "Chebronite" (collectively), an inhabitant of Chebron.
Usage: Hebronites.
Source: or "חֶבְרֹנִי"; patronymically from "H2275";

2277.long:
Meaning: a "Chebrite" (collectively) or descendants of Cheber.
Usage: Heberites.
Source: patronymically from "H2268";

2279.long:
Meaning: a "joint".
Usage: which coupleth, coupling.
Source: feminine active participle of "H2266";

2280.long:
Meaning: to "wrap" firmly (especially a turban, compress, or "saddle"); figuratively, to "stop", to "rule".
Usage: bind (up), gird about, govern, healer, put, saddle, wrap about.
Source: a primitive root;

2281.long:
Meaning: something "fried", probably a "griddle-cake".
Usage: pan.
Source: from an unused root probably meaning to cook (compare "H4227");

2282.long:
Meaning: a "festival", or a "victim" therefor.
Usage: (solemn) feast (day), sacrifice, solemnity.
Source: or "חָג"; from "H2287";

2283.long:
Meaning: properly, "vertigo", i.e. (figuratively) "fear".
Usage: terror.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "revolve" (compare "H2287");

2285.long:
Meaning: "Chagab", one of the Nethinim.
Usage: Hagab.
Source: the same as "H2284"; "locust";

2286.long:
Meaning: "Chagaba" or "Chagabah", one of the Nethinim.
Usage: Hagaba, Hagabah.
Source: or "חֲגָבָה"; feminine of "H2285"; "locust";

2287.long:
Meaning: properly, to "move in a circle", i.e. (specifically) to "march" in a sacred procession, to "observe" a festival; by implication, to "be giddy".
Usage: celebrate, dance, (keep, hold) a (solemn) feast (holiday), reel to and fro.
Source: a primitive root (compare "H2283", "H2328");

2288.long:
Meaning: a "rift in rocks".
Usage: cleft.
Source: from an unused root meaning to take refuge;

2290.long:
Meaning: a "belt" (for the waist).
Usage: apron, armour, gird(-le).
Source: or "חֲגֹר"; and (feminine) "חֲגוֹרָה"; or "חֲגֹרָה"; from "H2296";

2291.long:
Meaning: "Chaggi", an Israelite; also (patronymically) a "Chaggite", or descendant of the same.
Usage: Haggi, Haggites.
Source: from "H2287"; "festive"

2293.long:
Meaning: "Chaggijah", an Israelite.
Usage: Haggiah.
Source: from "H2282" and "H3050"; festival of Jah;

2294.long:
Meaning: "Chaggith", a wife of David.
Usage: Haggith.
Source: feminine of "H2291"; festive;

2295.long:
Meaning: "Choglah", an Israelitess.
Usage: Hoglah. See also "H1031".
Source: of uncertain derivation; probably a partridge;

2296.long:
Meaning: to "gird" on (as a belt, armor, etc.).
Usage: be able to put on, be afraid, appointed, gird, restrain, × on every side.
Source: a primitive root;

2298.long:
Meaning: as card. "one"; as article "single"; as an ordinal, "first"; adverbially, "at once".
Usage: a, first, one, together.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H2297";

2300.long:
Meaning: to "be" (causatively, "make") "sharp" or (figuratively) "severe".
Usage: be fierce, sharpen.
Source: a primitive root;

2302.long:
Meaning: to "rejoice".
Usage: make glad, be joined, rejoice.
Source: a primitive root;

2307.long:
Meaning: "Chadid", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Hadid.
Source: from "H2300"; a peak;

2308.long:
Meaning: properly, to "be flabby", i.e. (by implication) "desist"; (figuratively) "be lacking" or "idle".
Usage: cease, end, fall, forbear, forsake, leave (off), let alone, rest, be unoccupied, want.
Source: a primitive root;

2309.long:
Meaning: "rest", i.e. the state of the "dead".
Usage: world.
Source: from "H2308";

2310.long:
Meaning: "vacant", i.e. "ceasing" or "destitute".
Usage: he that forbeareth, frail, rejected.
Source: from "H2308";

2312.long:
Meaning: a "prickly plant".
Usage: brier, thorn.
Source: from an unused root meaning to sting;

2313.long:
Meaning: the "Chiddekel" (or Tigris) "river".
Usage: Hiddekel.
Source: probably of foreign origin;

2314.long:
Meaning: properly, to "inclose" (as a room), i.e. (by analogy,) to "beset" (as in a siege).
Usage: enter a privy chamber.
Source: a primitive root;

2315.long:
Meaning: an "apartment" (usually literal).
Usage: ((bed) inner) chamber, innermost(-ward) part, parlour, south, × within.
Source: from "H2314";

2316.long:
Meaning: "Chadar", an Ishmaelite.
Usage: Hadar.
Source: another form for "H2315"; chamber;

2317.long:
Meaning: "Chadrak", a Syrian deity.
Usage: Hadrach.
Source: of uncertain derivation;

2318.long:
Meaning: to "be new"; causatively, to "rebuild".
Usage: renew, repair.
Source: a primitive root;

2320.long:
Meaning: the "new" moon; by implication, a "month".
Usage: month(-ly), new moon.
Source: from "H2318";

2321.long:
Meaning: "Chodesh", an Israelitess.
Usage: Hodesh.
Source: the same as "H2320";

2322.long:
Meaning: "Chadashah", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Hadashah.
Source: feminine of "H2319"; new;

2325.long:
Meaning: properly, perhaps to "tie", i.e. (figuratively and reflexively) to "owe", or (by implication) to "forfeit".
Usage: make endanger.
Source: also "חָיַב"; a primitive root;

2327.long:
Meaning: "Chobah", a place in Syria.
Usage: Hobah.
Source: feminine active participle of "H2247"; "hiding place";

2328.long:
Meaning: to "describe a circle".
Usage: compass.
Source: a primitive root (compare "H2287");

2330.long:
Meaning: properly, to "tie" a knot, i.e. (figuratively) to "propound" a riddle.
Usage: put forth.
Source: a primitive root;

2331.long:
Meaning: properly, to "live"; by implication (intensively) to "declare" or "show".
Usage: show.
Source: a primitive root; (compare "H2324", "H2421");

2332.long:
Meaning: "Chavvah" (or "Eve"), the first woman.
Usage: Eve.
Source: causatively from "H2331"; life-giver;

2333.long:
Meaning: by implication, an encampment or "village".
Usage: (small) town.
Source: properly, the same as "H2332" ("life-giving", i.e. "living-place");

2334.long:
Meaning: "hamlets of Jair", a region of Palestine.
Usage: (Bashan-) Havoth-jair.
Source: from the plural of "H2333" and a modification of "H3265";

2335.long:
Meaning: "Chozai", an Israelite.
Usage: the seers.
Source: from "H2374"; visionary;

2336.long:
Meaning: a "thorn"; by analogy, a "ring" for the nose.
Usage: bramble, thistle, thorn.
Source: from an unused root apparently meaning to "pierce";

2337.long:
Meaning: a "dell" or "crevice" (as if pierced in the earth).
Usage: thicket.
Source: perhaps the same as "H2336";

2338.long:
Meaning: to "string together", i.e. (figuratively) to "repair".
Usage: join.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to the root of "H2339", perhaps as a denominative;

2339.long:
Meaning: a "string"; by implication, a "measuring tape".
Usage: cord, fillet, line, thread.
Source: from an unused root probably meaning to sew;

2340.long:
Meaning: a "Chivvite", one of the aboriginal tribes of Palestine.
Usage: Hivite.
Source: perhaps from "H2333"; a "villager";

2341.long:
Meaning: "Chavilah", the name of two or three eastern regions; also perhaps of two men.
Usage: Havilah.
Source: probably from "H2342"; circular;

2342.long:
Meaning: properly, to "twist" or "whirl" (in a circular or spiral manner), i.e. (specifically) to "dance", to "writhe in pain" (especially of parturition) or "fear"; figuratively, to "wait", to "pervert".
Usage: bear, (make to) bring forth, (make to) calve, dance, drive away, fall grievously (with pain), fear, form, great, grieve, (be) grievous, hope, look, make, be in pain, be much (sore) pained, rest, shake, shapen, (be) sorrow(-ful), stay, tarry, travail (with pain), tremble, trust, wait carefully (patiently), be wounded.
Source: or "חִיל"; a primitive root;

2343.long:
Meaning: "Chul", a son of Aram; also the region settled by him.
Usage: Hul.
Source: from "H2342"; a circle;

2344.long:
Meaning: "sand" (as round or whirling particles).
Usage: sand.
Source: from "H2342";

2345.long:
Meaning: "sunburnt" or "swarthy" (blackish).
Usage: brown.
Source: from an unused root meaning to be warm, i.e. (by implication)

2346.long:
Meaning: a "wall" of protection.
Usage: wall, walled.
Source: feminine active participle of an unused root apparently meaning to "join";

2347.long:
Meaning: properly, to "cover", i.e. (figuratively) to "compassionate".
Usage: pity, regard, spare.
Source: a primitive root;

2348.long:
Meaning: a "cove" (as a sheltered bay).
Usage: coast (of the sea), haven, shore, (sea-) side.
Source: from an unused root meaning to cover;

2349.long:
Meaning: "Chupham", an Israelite.
Usage: Hupham.
Source: from the same as "H2348"; protection;

2350.long:
Meaning: a "Chuphamite" or descendant of Chupham.
Usage: Huphamites.
Source: patronymically from "H2349";

2351.long:
Meaning: properly, "separate by a wall", i.e. "outside", "outdoors".
Usage: abroad, field, forth, highway, more, out(-side, -ward), street, without.
Source: or (shortened) "חֻץ"; (both forms feminine in the plural) from an unused root meaning to sever;

2352.long:
Meaning: the "crevice" of a serpent; the "cell" of a prison.
Usage: hole.
Source: or (shortened) "חֻר"; from an unused root probably meaning to "bore";

2354.long:
Meaning: "Chur", the name of four Israelites and one Midianite.
Usage: Hur.
Source: the same as "H2353" or "H2352";

2355.long:
Meaning: "white" linen.
Usage: network. Compare "H2715".
Source: the same as "H2353";

2356.long:
Meaning: a "cavity", "socket", "den".
Usage: cave, hole.
Source: or (shortened) "חֹר"; the same as "H2352";

2357.long:
Meaning: to "blanch" (as with shame).
Usage: wax pale.
Source: a primitive root;

2358.long:
Meaning: "white".
Usage: white.
Source: (Aramaic) from a root corresponding to "H2357";

2359.long:
Meaning: "Churi", an Israelite.
Usage: Huri.
Source: probably from "H2353"; linen-worker;

2360.long:
Meaning: "Churai", an Israelite.
Usage: Hurai.
Source: probably an orthographical variation for "H2359";

2361.long:
Meaning: "Churam", the name of an Israelite and two Syrians.
Usage: Huram. Compare "H2438".
Source: probably from "H2353"; whiteness, i.e. noble;

2362.long:
Meaning: "Chavran", a region East of the Jordan.
Usage: Hauran.
Source: apparently from "H2357" (in the sense of "H2352"); cavernous;

2363.long:
Meaning: to "hurry"; figuratively, to "be eager with excitement" or "enjoyment".
Usage: (make) haste(-n), ready.
Source: a primitive root;

2366.long:
Meaning: "Chushim", the name of three Israelites.
Usage: Hushim.
Source: or "חֻשִׁים"; or "חֻשִׁם"; plural from "H2363"; hasters;

2369.long:
Meaning: "Chotham", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Hotham, Hothan.
Source: the same as "H2368"; seal;

2370.long:
Meaning: to "gaze upon"; mentally to "dream", "be usual" (i.e. seem).
Usage: behold, have (a dream), see, be wont.
Source: (Aramaic) or "חֲזָה"; (Aramaic), corresponding to "H2372";

2371.long:
Meaning: "Chazael", a king of Syria.
Usage: Hazael.
Source: or "חֲזָהאֵל"; from "H2372" and "H410"; God has seen;

2372.long:
Meaning: to "gaze" at; mentally to "perceive", "contemplate" (with pleasure); specifically, to "have a vision of".
Usage: behold, look, prophesy, provide, see.
Source: a primitive root;

2373.long:
Meaning: the "breast" (as most "seen" in front).
Usage: breast.
Source: from "H2372";

2374.long:
Meaning: a "beholder" in vision; also a "compact" (as "looked upon" with approval).
Usage: agreement, prophet, see that, seer, (star-) gazer.
Source: active participle of "H2372";

2375.long:
Meaning: "Chazo", "a nephew of Abraham".
Usage: Hazo.
Source: from "H2372"; seer;

2377.long:
Meaning: a "sight" (mentally), i.e. a "dream", "revelation", or "oracle".
Usage: vision.
Source: from "H2372";

2380.long:
Meaning: a "look"; hence (figuratively) striking "appearance", "revelation", or (by implication) "compact".
Usage: agreement, notable (one), vision.
Source: from "H2372";

2381.long:
Meaning: "Chaziel", a Levite.
Usage: Haziel.
Source: from "H2372" and "H410"; seen of God;

2382.long:
Meaning: "Chazajah", an Israelite.
Usage: Hazaiah.
Source: from "H2372" and "H3050"; Jah has seen;

2385.long:
Meaning: a "flash of lightning".
Usage: bright cloud, lightning.
Source: from an unused root meaning to glare;

2386.long:
Meaning: a "hog" (perhaps as "penned").
Usage: boar, swine.
Source: from an unused root probably meaning to "inclose";

2387.long:
Meaning: "Chezir", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Hezir.
Source: from the same as "H2386"; perhaps protected;

2388.long:
Meaning: to "fasten" upon; hence, to "seize", "be strong" (figuratively, "courageous", causatively "strengthen", "cure", "help", "repair", "fortify"), "obstinate"; to "bind", "restrain", "conquer".
Usage: aid, amend, × calker, catch, cleave, confirm, be constant, constrain, continue, be of good (take) courage(-ous, -ly), encourage (self), be established, fasten, force, fortify, make hard, harden, help, (lay) hold (fast), lean, maintain, play the man, mend, become (wax) mighty, prevail, be recovered, repair, retain, seize, be (wax) sore, strengthen (self), be stout, be (make, shew, wax) strong(-er), be sure, take (hold), be urgent, behave self valiantly, withstand.
Source: a primitive root;

2389.long:
Meaning: "strong" (usu. in a bad sense, "hard", "bold", "violent").
Usage: harder, hottest, impudent, loud, mighty, sore, stiff(-hearted), strong(-er).
Source: from "H2388";

2393.long:
Meaning: prevailing "power".
Usage: strength(-en self), (was) strong.
Source: feminine of "H2391";

2394.long:
Meaning: "vehemence" (usually in a bad sense).
Usage: force, mightily, repair, sharply.
Source: feminine of "H2392";

2396.long:
Meaning: "Chizkijah", a king of Judah, also the name of two other Israelites.
Usage: Hezekiah, Hizkiah, Hizkijah. Compare "H3169".
Source: or "חִזְקִיָּהוּ"; also "יְחִזְקִיָּה"; or "יְחִזְקִיָּהוּ"; from "H2388" and "H3050"; "strengthened of Jah";

2397.long:
Meaning: a "ring" for the nose (or lips).
Usage: bracelet, chain, hook.
Source: once (Ezekiel 29:4) "חָחִי"; from the same as "H2336";

2398.long:
Meaning: properly, to "miss"; hence (figuratively and generally) to "sin"; by inference, to "forfeit", "lack", "expiate", "repent", (causatively) "lead astray", "condemn".
Usage: bear the blame, cleanse, commit (sin), by fault, harm he hath done, loss, miss, (make) offend(-er), offer for sin, purge, purify (self), make reconciliation, (cause, make) sin(-ful, -ness), trespass.
Source: a primitive root;

2399.long:
Meaning: a "crime" or its "penalty".
Usage: fault, × grievously, offence, (punishment of) sin.
Source: from "H2398";

2400.long:
Meaning: a "criminal", or one accounted guilty.
Usage: offender, sinful, sinner.
Source: intensively from "H2398";

2401.long:
Meaning: an "offence", or a "sacrifice" for it.
Usage: sin (offering).
Source: feminine of "H2399";

2402.long:
Meaning: "an offence", and "the penalty" or "sacrifice for it".
Usage: sin (offering).
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H2401";

2403.long:
Meaning: an "offence" (sometimes habitual sinfulness), and its "penalty", "occasion", "sacrifice", or "expiation"; also (concretely) an "offender".
Usage: punishment (of sin), purifying(-fication for sin), sin(-ner, offering).
Source: or "חַטָּאת"; from "H2398";

2404.long:
Meaning: to "chop" or "carve" wood.
Usage: cut down, hew(-er), polish.
Source: a primitive root;

2405.long:
Meaning: properly, a "carving"; hence, a "tapestry" (as figured).
Usage: carved.
Source: feminine passive participle of "H2404";

2406.long:
Meaning: "wheat", whether the grain or the plant.
Usage: wheat(-en).
Source: of uncertain derivation;

2407.long:
Meaning: "Chattush", the name of four or five Israelites.
Usage: Hattush.
Source: from an unused root of uncertain signification;

2408.long:
Meaning: an "offence".
Usage: sin.
Source: (Aramaic) from a root corresponding to "H2398";

2409.long:
Meaning: an "expiation".
Usage: sin offering.
Source: (Aramaic) from the same as "H2408";

2410.long:
Meaning: "Chatita", a temple porter.
Usage: Hatita.
Source: from an unused root apparently meaning to dig out; explorer;

2411.long:
Meaning: "Chattil", one of 'Solomon's servants'.
Usage: Hattil.
Source: from an unused root apparently meaning to wave; fluctuating;

2412.long:
Meaning: "Chatipha", one of the Nethinim.
Usage: Hatipha.
Source: from "H2414"; robber;

2414.long:
Meaning: to "clutch"; hence, to "seize as a prisoner".
Usage: catch.
Source: a primitive root;

2415.long:
Meaning: a "twig".
Usage: rod.
Source: from an unused root of uncertain signification;

2416.long:
Meaning: "alive"; hence, "raw" (flesh); "fresh" (plant, water, year), "strong"; also (as noun, especially in the feminine singular and masculine plural) "life" (or living thing), whether literally or figuratively.
Usage: age, alive, appetite, (wild) beast, company, congregation, life(-time), live(-ly), living (creature, thing), maintenance, merry, multitude, (be) old, quick, raw, running, springing, troop.
Source: from "H2421";

2417.long:
Meaning: "alive"; also (as noun in plural) "life".
Usage: life, that liveth, living.
Source: (Aramaic) from "H2418";

2418.long:
Meaning: to "live".
Usage: live, keep alive.
Source: (Aramaic) or "חֲיָה"; (Aramaic), corresponding to "H2421";

2419.long:
Meaning: "Chiel", an Israelite.
Usage: Hiel.
Source: from "H2416" and "H410"; living of God;

2420.long:
Meaning: a "puzzle", hence, a "trick", "conundrum", sententious "maxim".
Usage: dark saying (sentence, speech), hard question, proverb, riddle.
Source: from "H2330";

2421.long:
Meaning: to "live", whether literally or figuratively; causatively, to "revive".
Usage: keep (leave, make) alive, × certainly, give (promise) life, (let, suffer to) live, nourish up, preserve (alive), quicken, recover, repair, restore (to life), revive, (× God) save (alive, life, lives), × surely, be whole.
Source: a primitive root (compare "H2331", "H2421");

2425.long:
Meaning: to "live"; causatively to "revive".
Usage: live, save life.
Source: a primitive root (compare "H2421");

2426.long:
Meaning: an "army"; also (by analogy,) an "intrenchment".
Usage: army, bulwark, host, poor, rampart, trench, wall.
Source: or (shortened) "חֵל"; a collateral form of "H2428";

2427.long:
Meaning: a "throe" (expectant of childbirth).
Usage: pain, pang, sorrow.
Source: and (feminine) "חִילָה"; from "H2342";

2428.long:
Meaning: probably a "force", whether of men, means or other resources; an "army", "wealth", "virtue", "valor", "strength".
Usage: able, activity, ( ) army, band of men (soldiers), company, (great) forces, goods, host, might, power, riches, strength, strong, substance, train, ( ) valiant(-ly), valour, virtuous(-ly), war, worthy(-ily).
Source: from "H2342";

2429.long:
Meaning: an "army", or "strength".
Usage: aloud, army, × most (mighty), power.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H2428";

2431.long:
Meaning: "Chelam", a place East of Palestine.
Usage: Helam.
Source: or "חֵלָאם"; from "H2428"; "fortress";

2432.long:
Meaning: "Chilen", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Hilen.
Source: from "H2428"; fortress;

2435.long:
Meaning: properly, the (outer) "wall side"; hence, "exterior"; figuratively, "secular" (as opposed to sacred).
Usage: outer, outward, utter, without.
Source: from "H2434";

2436.long:
Meaning: the "bosom" (literally or figuratively).
Usage: bosom, bottom, lap, midst, within.
Source: or "חֵק"; and "חוֹק"; from an unused root, apparently meaning to inclose;

2437.long:
Meaning: "Chirah", an Adullamite.
Usage: Hirah.
Source: from "H2357" in the sense of splendor;

2438.long:
Meaning: "Chiram" or "Chirom", the name of two Tyrians.
Usage: Hiram, Huram.
Source: or "חִירוֹם"; another form of "H2361";

2439.long:
Meaning: to "hurry".
Usage: make haste.
Source: another form of "H2363";

2441.long:
Meaning: properly, the "palate" or inside of the mouth; hence, the "mouth" itself (as the organ of speech, taste and kissing).
Usage: (roof of the) mouth, taste.
Source: probably from "H2596" in the sense of tasting;

2442.long:
Meaning: properly, to "adhere" to; hence, to await.
Usage: long, tarry, wait.
Source: a primitive root (apparently akin to "H2707" through the idea of "piercing");

2444.long:
Meaning: "Chakilah", a hill in Palestine.
Usage: Hachilah.
Source: from the same as "H2447"; dark;

2445.long:
Meaning: "wise", i.e. a "Magian".
Usage: wise.
Source: (Aramaic) from a root corresponding to "H2449";

2446.long:
Meaning: "Chakaljah", an Israelite.
Usage: Hachaliah.
Source: from the base of "H2447" and "H3050"; darkness of Jah;

2447.long:
Meaning: "darkly flashing" (only of the eyes); in a good sense, "brilliant" (as stimulated by wine).
Usage: red.
Source: by reduplication from an unused root apparently meaning to be dark;

2448.long:
Meaning: "flash" (of the eyes); in a bad sense, "blearedness".
Usage: redness.
Source: from "H2447";

2449.long:
Meaning: to "be wise" (in mind, word or act).
Usage: × exceeding, teach wisdom, be (make self, shew self) wise, deal (never so) wisely, make wiser.
Source: a primitive root,

2450.long:
Meaning: "wise", (i.e. intelligent, skilful or artful).
Usage: cunning (man), subtil, (un-), wise((hearted), man).
Source: from "H2449";

2451.long:
Meaning: "wisdom" (in a good sense).
Usage: skilful, wisdom, wisely, wit.
Source: from "H2449";

2453.long:
Meaning: "Chakmoni", an Israelite.
Usage: Hachmoni, Hachmonite.
Source: from "H2449"; skilful;

2454.long:
Meaning: "wisdom".
Usage: wisdom, every wise (woman).
Source: or "חַכְמוֹת"; collateral forms of "H2451";

2455.long:
Meaning: properly, "exposed"; hence, "profane".
Usage: common, profane (place), unholy.
Source: from "H2490";

2456.long:
Meaning: to "be sick".
Usage: be diseased.
Source: a primitive root (compare "H2470");

2458.long:
Meaning: "Chelah", an Israelitess.
Usage: Helah.
Source: the same as "H2457";

2459.long:
Meaning: "fat", whether literally or figuratively; hence, the "richest" or "choice" part.
Usage: × best, fat(-ness), × finest, grease, marrow.
Source: or "חֵלֶב"; from an unused root meaning to be fat;

2460.long:
Meaning: "Cheleb", an Israelite.
Usage: Heleb.
Source: the same as "H2459"; "fatness";

2461.long:
Meaning: "milk" (as the "richness" of kine).
Usage: cheese, milk, sucking.
Source: from the same as "H2459";

2462.long:
Meaning: "Chelbah", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Helbah.
Source: feminine of "H2459"; fertility;

2463.long:
Meaning: "Chelbon", a place in Syria.
Usage: Helbah.
Source: from "H2459"; fruitful;

2464.long:
Meaning: "galbanam", an odorous gum (as if "fatty").
Usage: galbanum.
Source: from "H2459";

2465.long:
Meaning: "life" (as a fleeting portion of time); hence, the "world" (as transient).
Usage: age, short time, world.
Source: from an unused root apparently meaning to glide swiftly;

2466.long:
Meaning: "Cheled", an Israelite.
Usage: Heled.
Source: the same as "H2465";

2467.long:
Meaning: a "weasel" (from its gliding motion).
Usage: weasel.
Source: from the same as "H2465";

2469.long:
Meaning: "Cheldai", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Heldai.
Source: from "H2466"; worldliness;
