2470.long:
Meaning: properly, to "be rubbed" or "worn"; hence (figuratively) to "be weak", "sick", "afflicted"; or (causatively) to "grieve", "make sick"; also to "stroke" (in flattering), "entreat".
Usage: beseech, (be) diseased, (put to) grief, be grieved, (be) grievous, infirmity, intreat, lay to, put to pain, × pray, make prayer, be (fall, make) sick, sore, be sorry, make suit (× supplication), woman in travail, be (become) weak, be wounded.
Source: a primitive root (compare "H2342", "H2470", "H2490");

2473.long:
Meaning: "Cholon", the name of two places in Palestine.
Usage: Holon.
Source: or (shortened) "חֹלֹן"; probably from "H2344"; sandy;

2476.long:
Meaning: "defeat".
Usage: being overcome.
Source: feminine passive participle of "H2522";

2477.long:
Meaning: "Chalach", a region of Assyria.
Usage: Halah.
Source: probably of foreign origin;

2478.long:
Meaning: "Chalchul", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Halhul.
Source: by reduplication from "H2342"; contorted;

2479.long:
Meaning: "writhing" (in childbirth); by implication, "terror".
Usage: (great, much) pain.
Source: feminine from the same as "H2478";

2480.long:
Meaning: to "snatch at".
Usage: catch.
Source: a primitive root;

2482.long:
Meaning: "Chali", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Hali.
Source: the same as "H2481";

2486.long:
Meaning: literal for a "profaned" thing; used (interj.) "far be it!".
Usage: be far, (× God) forbid.
Source: or "חָלִלָה"; a directive from "H2490";

2489.long:
Meaning: a "wretch", i.e. "unfortunate".
Usage: poor.
Source: or "חֵלְכָה"; apparently from an unused root probably meaning to be dark or (figuratively) unhappy;

2490.long:
Meaning: properly, to "bore", i.e. (by implication) to "wound", to "dissolve"; figuratively, to "profane" (a person, place or thing), to "break" (one's word), to "begin" (as if by an 'opening wedge'); to "play" (the flute).
Usage: begin (× men began), defile, × break, defile, × eat (as common things), × first, × gather the grape thereof, × take inheritance, pipe, player on instruments, pollute, (cast as) profane (self), prostitute, slay (slain), sorrow, stain, wound.
Source: a primitive root (compare "H2470"); also denominative (from "H2485")

2491.long:
Meaning: "pierced" (especially to death); figuratively, "polluted".
Usage: kill, profane, slain (man), × slew, (deadly) wounded.
Source: from "H2490";

2492.long:
Meaning: properly, to "bind firmly", i.e. (by implication) to "be" (causatively to "make") "plump"; also (through the figurative sense of dumbness) to "dream".
Usage: (cause to) dream(-er), be in good liking, recover.
Source: a primitive root;

2493.long:
Meaning: a "dream".
Usage: dream.
Source: (Aramaic) from a root corresponding to "H2492";

2494.long:
Meaning: "Chelem", an Israelite.
Usage: Helem. Compare "H2469".
Source: from "H2492"; a "dream";

2495.long:
Meaning: probably "purslain".
Usage: egg.
Source: from "H2492" (in the sense of insipidity);

2496.long:
Meaning: "flint".
Usage: flint(-y), rock.
Source: probably from "H2492" (in the sense of "hardness");

2498.long:
Meaning: properly, to "slide" by, i.e. (by implication) to "hasten" away, "pass" on, "spring" up, "pierce" or "change".
Usage: abolish, alter, change, cut off, go on forward, grow up, be over, pass (away, on, through), renew, sprout, strike through.
Source: a primitive root;

2499.long:
Meaning: to "pass on" (of time).
Usage: pass.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H2498";

2500.long:
Meaning: properly, "exchange"; hence (as preposition) "instead" of.
Usage: × for.
Source: from "H2498";

2501.long:
Meaning: "Cheleph", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Heleph.
Source: the same as "H2500"; change;

2502.long:
Meaning: to "pull off"; hence (intensively) to "strip", (reflex.) to "depart"; by implication, to "deliver", "equip" (for fight); "present", "strengthen".
Usage: arm (self), (go, ready) armed (× man, soldier), deliver, draw out, make fat, loose, (ready) prepared, put off, take away, withdraw self.
Source: a primitive root;

2503.long:
Meaning: "Chelets", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Helez.
Source: or "חֵלֶץ"; from "H2502"; perhaps, strength;

2504.long:
Meaning: the "loins" (as the seat of vigor).
Usage: loins, reins.
Source: from "H2502" (in the sense of "strength"); only in the dual;

2505.long:
Meaning: to "be smooth" (figuratively); by implication (as smooth stones were used for lots) to "apportion" or "separate".
Usage: deal, distribute, divide, flatter, give, (have, im-) part(-ner), take away a portion, receive, separate self, (be) smooth(-er).
Source: a primitive root;

2506.long:
Meaning: properly, "smoothness" (of the tongue); also an "allotment".
Usage: flattery, inheritance, part, × partake, portion.
Source: from "H2505";

2507.long:
Meaning: "Chelek", an Israelite.
Usage: Helek.
Source: the same as "H2506"; portion;

2508.long:
Meaning: a "part".
Usage: portion.
Source: (Aramaic) from a root corresponding to "H2505";

2510.long:
Meaning: "Chalak", a mountain of Idumaea.
Usage: Halak.
Source: the same as "H2509"; bare;

2513.long:
Meaning: properly, "smoothness"; figuratively, "flattery"; also an "allotment".
Usage: field, flattering(-ry), ground, parcel, part, piece of land (ground), plat, portion, slippery place, smooth (thing).
Source: feminine of "H2506";

2516.long:
Meaning: a "Chelkite" or descendant of Chelek.
Usage: Helkites.
Source: patronymically from "H2507";

2518.long:
Meaning: "Chilhijah", the name of eight Israelites.
Usage: Hillkiah.
Source: or "חִלְקִיָּהוּ"; from "H2506" and "H3050"; "portion of Jah";

2519.long:
Meaning: properly, something "very smooth"; i.e. a "treacherous" spot; figuratively, "blandishment".
Usage: flattery, slippery.
Source: by reduplication from "H2505";

2520.long:
Meaning: "Chelkath", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Helkath.
Source: a form of "H2513"; smoothness;

2521.long:
Meaning: "Chelkath Hats-tsurim", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Helkath-hazzurim.
Source: from "H2520" and the plural of "H6697", with the article inserted; smoothness of the rocks;

2522.long:
Meaning: to "prostrate"; by implication, to "overthrow", "decay".
Usage: discomfit, waste away, weaken.
Source: a primitive root;

2524.long:
Meaning: a "father-in-law" (as in affinity).
Usage: father in law.
Source: from the same as "H2346";

2526.long:
Meaning: "Cham", a son of Noah; also (as a patronymic) his descendants or their country.
Usage: Ham.
Source: the same as "H2525"; hot (from the tropical habitat);

2529.long:
Meaning: "curdled milk" or "cheese".
Usage: butter.
Source: or (shortened) "חֵמָה"; from the same root as "H2346";

2530.long:
Meaning: to "delight in".
Usage: beauty, greatly beloved, covet, delectable thing, (× great) delight, desire, goodly, lust, (be) pleasant (thing), precious (thing).
Source: a primitive root;

2532.long:
Meaning: "delight".
Usage: desire, goodly, pleasant, precious.
Source: feminine of "H2531";

2534.long:
Meaning: "heat"; figuratively, "anger", "poison" (from its fever).
Usage: anger, bottles, hot displeasure, furious(-ly, -ry), heat, indignation, poison, rage, wrath(-ful). See "H2529".
Source: or (Daniel 11:44) "חֵמָא"; from "H3179";

2535.long:
Meaning: "heat"; by implication, the "sun".
Usage: heat, sun.
Source: from "H2525";

2536.long:
Meaning: "Chammuel", an Israelite.
Usage: Hamuel.
Source: from "H2535" and "H410"; anger of God;

2537.long:
Meaning: "Chamutal" or "Chamital", an Israelitess.
Usage: Hamutal.
Source: or "חֲמִיטַל"; from "H2524" and "H2919"; father-in-law of dew;

2539.long:
Meaning: a "Chamulite" (collectively) or descendants of Chamul.
Usage: Hamulites.
Source: patronymically from "H2538";

2540.long:
Meaning: "Chammon", the name of two places in Palestine.
Usage: Hammon.
Source: from "H2552"; warm spring;

2541.long:
Meaning: properly, "violent"; by implication, a "robber".
Usage: oppressed.
Source: from "H2556";

2543.long:
Meaning: a male "ass" (from its dun "red").
Usage: (he) ass.
Source: or (shortened) "חֲמֹר"; from "H2560";

2544.long:
Meaning: "Chamor", a Canaanite.
Usage: Hamor.
Source: the same as "H2543"; "donkey";

2545.long:
Meaning: a "mother-in-law".
Usage: mother in law.
Source: or (shortened) "חֲמֹת"; feminine of "H2524";

2546.long:
Meaning: a "lizard" (as creeping).
Usage: snail.
Source: from an unused root probably meaning, to lie low;

2547.long:
Meaning: "Chumtah", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Humtah.
Source: feminine of "H2546"; low;

2549.long:
Meaning: "fifth"; also a "fifth".
Usage: fifth (part).
Source: or "חֲמִשִּׁי"; ordinal from "H2568";

2550.long:
Meaning: to "commiserate"; by implication, to "spare".
Usage: have compassion, (have) pity, spare.
Source: a primitive root;

2552.long:
Meaning: to "be hot" (literally or figuratively).
Usage: enflame self, get (have) heat, be (wax) hot, (be, wax) warm (self, at).
Source: a primitive root;

2554.long:
Meaning: to "be violent"; by implication, to "maltreat".
Usage: make bare, shake off, violate, do violence, take away violently, wrong, imagine wrongfully.
Source: a primitive root;

2555.long:
Meaning: "violence"; by implication, "wrong"; by metonymy "unjust gain".
Usage: cruel(-ty), damage, false, injustice, × oppressor, unrighteous, violence (against, done), violent (dealing), wrong.
Source: from "H2554";

2556.long:
Meaning: to "be pungent"; i.e. in taste ("sour", i.e. literally "fermented", or figuratively, "harsh"), in color ("dazzling").
Usage: cruel (man), dyed, be grieved, leavened.
Source: a primitive root;

2559.long:
Meaning: properly, to "wrap"; hence, to "depart" (i.e. turn about).
Usage: go about, withdraw self.
Source: a primitive root;

2560.long:
Meaning: properly, to "boil" up; hence, to "ferment" (with scum); to "glow" (with redness); to "smear" with pitch.
Usage: daub, befoul, be red, trouble.
Source: a primitive root; also as denominative (from "H2564")

2563.long:
Meaning: properly, a "bubbling" up, i.e. of water, a "wave"; of earth, "mire" or "clay" (cement); also a "heap"; hence, a "chomer" or dry measure.
Usage: clay, heap, homer, mire, motion.
Source: from "H2560";

2564.long:
Meaning: "bitumen" (as rising to the surface).
Usage: slime(-pit).
Source: from "H2560";

2567.long:
Meaning: to "tax a fifth".
Usage: take up the fifth participle.
Source: a denominative from "H2568";

2568.long:
Meaning: "five".
Usage: fif(-teen), fifth, five (× apiece).
Source: masculine "חֲמִשָּׁה"; a primitive numeral;

2570.long:
Meaning: the "abdomen" (as obese).
Usage: fifth (rib).
Source: from an unused root probably meaning, to be stout;

2571.long:
Meaning: "staunch", i.e. able-bodied "soldiers".
Usage: armed (men), harnessed.
Source: passive participle of the same as "H2570";

2573.long:
Meaning: a "skin bottle" (as tied up).
Usage: bottle.
Source: from the same as "H2346";

2574.long:
Meaning: "Chamath", a place in Syria.
Usage: Hamath, Hemath.
Source: from the same as "H2346"; "walled";

2575.long:
Meaning: "Chammath", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Hammath.
Source: a variation for the first part of "H2576"; hot springs;

2576.long:
Meaning: "Chammath-Dor", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Hamath-Dor.
Source: from the plural of "H2535" and "H1756"; hot springs of Dor;

2577.long:
Meaning: a "Chamathite" or native of Chamath.
Usage: Hamathite.
Source: patrial from "H2574";

2578.long:
Meaning: "Chamath-Tsobah".
Usage: Hamath-Zobah.
Source: from "H2574" and "H6678"; Chamath of Tsobah; probably the same as "H2574"

2579.long:
Meaning: "Chamath-Rabbah".
Usage: Hamath the great.
Source: from "H2574" and "H7237"; Chamath of Rabbah; probably the same as "H2574".

2580.long:
Meaning: "graciousness", i.e. subjective ("kindness", "favor") or objective ("beauty").
Usage: favour, grace(-ious), pleasant, precious, (well-) favoured.
Source: from "H2603";

2581.long:
Meaning: "Chen", a figurative name for an Israelite.
Usage: Hen.
Source: the same as "H2580"; "grace";

2582.long:
Meaning: "Chenadad", an Israelite.
Usage: Henadad.
Source: probably from "H2580" and "H1908"; favor of Hadad;

2583.long:
Meaning: properly, to "incline"; by implication, to "decline" (of the slanting rays of evening); specifically, to "pitch" a tent; generally to "encamp" (for abode or siege).
Usage: abide (in tents), camp, dwell, encamp, grow to an end, lie, pitch (tent), rest in tent.
Source: a primitive root (compare "H2603");

2585.long:
Meaning: "Chanok", an antediluvian patriach.
Usage: Enoch.
Source: from "H2596"; initiated;

2586.long:
Meaning: "Chanun", the name of an Ammonite and of two Israelites.
Usage: Hanun.
Source: from "H2603"; favored;

2588.long:
Meaning: properly, a "vault" or "cell" (with an arch); by implication, a "prison".
Usage: cabin.
Source: from "H2583";

2589.long:
Meaning: "supplication".
Usage: be gracious, intreated.
Source: from "H2603" (in the sense of prayer);

2590.long:
Meaning: to "spice"; by implication, to "embalm"; also to "ripen".
Usage: embalm, put forth.
Source: a primitive root;

2592.long:
Meaning: "Channiel", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Hanniel.
Source: from "H2603" and "H410"; favor of God;

2595.long:
Meaning: a "lance" (for "thrusting", like "pitching" a tent).
Usage: javelin, spear.
Source: from "H2583";

2596.long:
Meaning: properly, to "narrow"; figuratively, to "initiate" or "discipline".
Usage: dedicate, train up.
Source: a primitive root; (compare "H2614")

2599.long:
Meaning: a "Chanokite" (collectively) or descendants of Chanok.
Usage: Hanochites.
Source: patronymically from "H2585";

2600.long:
Meaning: "gratis", i.e. devoid of cost, reason or advantage.
Usage: without a cause (cost, wages), causeless, to cost nothing, free(-ly), innocent, for nothing (nought, in vain.
Source: from "H2580";

2601.long:
Meaning: "Chanamel", an Israelite.
Usage: Hanameel.
Source: probably by orthographical variation for "H2606";

2602.long:
Meaning: perhaps the "aphis" or "plantlouse".
Usage: frost.
Source: of uncertain derivation;

2603.long:
Meaning: properly, to "bend" or stoop in kindness to an inferior; to "favor", "bestow"; causatively to "implore" (i.e. move to favor by petition).
Usage: beseech, × fair, (be, find, shew) favour(-able), be (deal, give, grant (gracious(-ly), intreat, (be) merciful, have (shew) mercy (on, upon), have pity upon, pray, make supplication, × very.
Source: a primitive root (compare "H2583");

2604.long:
Meaning: to "favor" or (causatively) to "entreat".
Usage: shew mercy, make supplication.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H2603";

2605.long:
Meaning: "Chanan", the name of seven Israelites.
Usage: Canan.
Source: from "H2603"; "favor";

2606.long:
Meaning: "Chananel", probably an Israelite, from whom a tower of Jerusalem was named.
Usage: Hananeel.
Source: from "H2603" and "H410"; God has favored;

2607.long:
Meaning: "Chanani", the name of six Israelites.
Usage: Hanani.
Source: from "H2603"; gracious;

2608.long:
Meaning: "Chananjah", the name of thirteen Israelites.
Usage: Hananiah.
Source: or "חֲנַנְיָהוּ"; from "H2603" and "H3050"; Jah has favored;

2609.long:
Meaning: "Chanes", a place in Egypt.
Usage: Hanes.
Source: of Egyptian derivation;

2610.long:
Meaning: to "soil", especially in a moral sense.
Usage: corrupt, defile, × greatly, pollute, profane.
Source: a primitive root;

2614.long:
Meaning: to "be narrow"; by implication, to "throttle", or (reflex.) to "choke oneself to death" (by a rope).
Usage: hang self, strangle.
Source: a primitive root (compare "H2596");

2615.long:
Meaning: "Channathon", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Hannathon.
Source: probably from "H2603"; favored;

2616.long:
Meaning: properly, perhaps to "bow" (the neck only [compare "H2603"] in courtesy to an equal), i.e. to "be kind"; also (by euphemistically [compare "H1288"], but rarely) to "reprove".
Usage: shew self merciful, put to shame.
Source: a primitive root

2617.long:
Meaning: "kindness"; by implication (towards God) "piety"; rarely (by opposition) "reproof", or (subject.) "beauty".
Usage: favour, good deed(-liness, -ness), kindly, (loving-) kindness, merciful (kindness), mercy, pity, reproach, wicked thing.
Source: from "H2616";

2618.long:
Meaning: "Chesed", an Israelite.
Usage: Hesed.
Source: the same as "H2617"; favor;

2619.long:
Meaning: "Chasadjah", an Israelite.
Usage: Hasadiah.
Source: from "H2617" and "H3050"; Jah has favored;

2620.long:
Meaning: to "flee" for protection; figuratively, to "confide" in.
Usage: have hope, make refuge, (put) trust.
Source: a primitive root; (compare "H982")

2621.long:
Meaning: "Chosah", an Israelite; also a place in Palestine.
Usage: Hosah.
Source: from "H2620"; hopeful;

2623.long:
Meaning: properly, "kind", i.e. (religiously) "pious" (a saint).
Usage: godly (man), good, holy (one), merciful, saint, (un-) godly.
Source: from "H2616";

2624.long:
Meaning: the "kind" (maternal) "bird", i.e. a "stork".
Usage: × feather, stork.
Source: feminine of "H2623";

2627.long:
Meaning: "deficient".
Usage: wanting.
Source: (Aramaic) from a root corresponding to "H2637";

2628.long:
Meaning: to "eat off".
Usage: consume.
Source: a primitive root;

2629.long:
Meaning: to "muzzle"; by analogy, to "stop the nose".
Usage: muzzle, stop.
Source: a primitive root;

2630.long:
Meaning: properly, to ("be") "compact"; by implication, to "hoard".
Usage: lay up.
Source: a primitive root;

2631.long:
Meaning: to "hold in occupancy".
Usage: possess.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H2630";

2635.long:
Meaning: a "clod".
Usage: clay.
Source: (Aramaic) from a root corresponding to that of "H2636";

2636.long:
Meaning: a "shred" or "scale".
Usage: round thing.
Source: reduplicated from an unused root meaning apparently to "peel";

2637.long:
Meaning: to "lack"; by implication, to "fail", "want", "lessen".
Usage: be abated, bereave, decrease, (cause to) fail, (have) lack, make lower, want.
Source: a primitive root;

2638.long:
Meaning: "lacking"; hence, "without".
Usage: destitute, fail, lack, have need, void, want.
Source: from "H2637";

2643.long:
Meaning: "pure".
Usage: innocent.
Source: from "H2653" (in the moral sense of covered from soil);

2644.long:
Meaning: properly, to "cover", i.e. (in a sinister sense) to "act covertly".
Usage: do secretly.
Source: an orthographical variation of "H2645";

2645.long:
Meaning: to "cover"; by implication, to "veil", to "encase", "protect".
Usage: ceil, cover, overlay.
Source: a primitive root (compare "H2644", "H2653");

2647.long:
Meaning: "Chuppah", an Israelite.
Usage: Huppah.
Source: the same as "H2646";

2648.long:
Meaning: properly, to "start up suddenly", i.e. (by implication) to "hasten away", to "fear".
Usage: (make) haste (away), tremble.
Source: a primitive root;

2651.long:
Meaning: a "fist" (only in the dual).
Usage: fists, (both) hands, hand(-ful).
Source: from an unused root of uncertain signification;

2652.long:
Meaning: "Chophni", an Israelite.
Usage: Hophni.
Source: from "H2651"; perhaps pugilist;

2653.long:
Meaning: to "cover" (in protection).
Usage: cover.
Source: a primitive root (compare "H2645", "H3182");

2654.long:
Meaning: properly, to "incline" to; by implication (literally but rarely) to "bend"; figuratively, to "be pleased" with, "desire".
Usage: × any at all, (have, take) delight, desire, favour, like, move, be (well) pleased, have pleasure, will, would.
Source: a primitive root;

2655.long:
Meaning: "pleased with".
Usage: delight in, desire, favour, please, have pleasure, whosoever would, willing, wish.
Source: from "H2654";

2656.long:
Meaning: "pleasure"; hence (abstractly) "desire"; concretely, a "valuable" thing; hence (by extension) a "matter" (as something in mind).
Usage: acceptable, delight(-some), desire, things desired, matter, pleasant(-ure), purpose, willingly.
Source: from "H2654";

2657.long:
Meaning: "Cheptsi-bah", a fanciful name for Palestine.
Usage: Hephzi-bah.
Source: from "H2656" with suffixes; "my delight" (is) "in her";

2658.long:
Meaning: properly, to "pry into"; by implication, to "delve", to "explore".
Usage: dig, paw, search out, seek.
Source: a primitive root;

2659.long:
Meaning: to "blush"; figuratively, to "be ashamed", "disappointed"; causatively, to "shame", "reproach".
Usage: be ashamed, be confounded, be brought to confusion (unto shame), come (be put to) shame, bring reproach.
Source: a primitive root (perhaps rather the same as "H2658" through the idea of "detection");

2660.long:
Meaning: "Chepher", a place in Palestine; also the name of three Israelites.
Usage: Hepher.
Source: from "H2658" or "H2659"; a pit of shame;

2661.long:
Meaning: a "burrower", i.e. probably a "rat".
Usage: mole.
Source: from "H2658"; a "hole"; only in connection with "H6512", which ought rather to be joined as one word, thus "חַפַרְפֵּרָה"; by reduplication from "H2658";

2662.long:
Meaning: a "Chephrite" (collectively) or descendants of Chepher.
Usage: Hepherites.
Source: patronymically from "H2660";

2663.long:
Meaning: "Chapharajim", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Haphraim.
Source: dual of "H2660"; double pit;

2664.long:
Meaning: to "seek"; causatively, to "conceal oneself" (i.e. let be sought), or "mask".
Usage: change, (make) diligent (search), disquise self, hide, search (for, out).
Source: a primitive root;

2666.long:
Meaning: to "spread loose"; figuratively, to "manumit".
Usage: be free.
Source: a primitive root;

2667.long:
Meaning: something "spread loosely", i.e. a "carpet".
Usage: precious.
Source: from "H2666";

2669.long:
Meaning: "prostration by sickness".
Usage: several.
Source: and "חׇפְשִׁית"; from "H2666"; (with "H1004", a hospital)

2670.long:
Meaning: "exempt" (from bondage, tax or care).
Usage: free, liberty.
Source: from "H2666";

2671.long:
Meaning: properly, a "piercer", i.e. an "arrow"; by implication, a "wound"; figuratively, (of God) thunder-"bolt"; the "shaft" of a spear.
Usage: archer, arrow, dart, shaft, staff, wound.
Source: from "H2686"; also by interchange for "H6086"

2672.long:
Meaning: to "cut" or carve (wood, stone or other material); by implication, to "hew", "split", "square", "quarry", "engrave".
Usage: cut, dig, divide, grave, hew (out, -er), made, mason.
Source: or "חָצֵב"; a primitive root;

2673.long:
Meaning: to "cut" or "split" in two; to "halve".
Usage: divide, × live out half, reach to the midst, participle.
Source: a primitive root (compare "H2086"));

2674.long:
Meaning: "Chatsor", the name (thus simply) of two places in Palestine and of one in Arabia.
Usage: Hazor.
Source: a collective form of "H2691"; village;

2675.long:
Meaning: "new Chatsor", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Hazor, Hadattah (as if two places).
Source: from "H2674" and a Aramaizing form of the feminine of "H2319" (compare "H2323");

2677.long:
Meaning: the "half" or "middle".
Usage: half, middle, mid(-night), midst, part, two parts.
Source: from "H2673";

2679.long:
Meaning: "Chatsi-ham-Menuchoth", an Israelite.
Usage: half of the Manahethites.
Source: from "H2677" and the plural of "H4496", with the article interposed; midst of the resting-places;

2680.long:
Meaning: a "Chatsi-ham-Menachtite" or descendant of Chatsi-ham-Menuchoth.
Usage: half of the Manahethites.
Source: patronymically from "H2679";

2681.long:
Meaning: a "court" or "abode".
Usage: court.
Source: a collateral form of "H2691";

2682.long:
Meaning: "grass"; also a "leek" (collectively).
Usage: grass, hay, herb, leek.
Source: perhaps originally the same as "H2681", from the "greenness" of a courtyard;

2683.long:
Meaning: the "bosom" (as comprised between the arms).
Usage: bosom.
Source: from an unused root meaning to hold firmly;

2684.long:
Usage: arm, lap.
Source: a collateral form of "H2683", and meaning the same

2685.long:
Meaning: properly, to "shear" or "cut close"; figuratively, to "be severe".
Usage: hasty, be urgent.
Source: (Aramaic) a primitive root;

2686.long:
Meaning: properly, to "chop" into, "pierce" or "sever"; hence, to "curtail", to "distribute" (into ranks); to "shoot" an arrow.
Usage: archer, × bands, cut off in the midst.
Source: a primitive root (compare "H2673"); also as denominative from "H2671"

2687.long:
Meaning: properly, something "cutting"; hence, "gravel" (as grit); an "arrow".
Usage: arrow, gravel (stone).
Source: from "H2687"; also like "H2671"

2688.long:
Meaning: "Chatsetson-tamar", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Hazezon-tamar.
Source: or "חַצֲצֹן תָּמָר"; from "H2686" and "H8558"; division (i.e. perhaps row) of (the) palm-tree;

2689.long:
Meaning: a "trumpet" (from its "sundered" or quavering note).
Usage: trumpet(-er).
Source: by reduplication from "H2690";

2690.long:
Meaning: to "trumpet", i.e. "blow on that instrument".
Usage: blow, sound, trumpeter.
Source: a primitive root; properly, to surround with a stockade, and thus separate from the open country; but used only in the reduplicated form "חֲצֹצֵר"; or (2 Chronicles 5:12) "חֲצֹרֵר"; as dem. from "H2689";

2691.long:
Meaning: a "yard" (as inclosed by a fence); also a "hamlet" (as similarly surrounded with walls).
Usage: court, tower, village.
Source: (masculine and feminine); from "H2690" in its original sense;

2692.long:
Meaning: "Chatsar-Addar", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Hazar-addar.
Source: from "H2691" and "H146"; (the) village of Addar;

2693.long:
Meaning: "Chatsar-Gaddah", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Hazar-gaddah.
Source: from "H2691" and a feminine of "H1408"; (the) village of (female) Fortune;

2694.long:
Meaning: "Chatsar-hat-Tikon", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Hazar-hatticon.
Source: from "H2691" and "H8484" with the article interposed; village of the middle;

2695.long:
Meaning: "Chetsro", an Israelite.
Usage: Hezro, Hezrai.
Source: by an orthographical variation for "H2696"; enclosure;

2696.long:
Meaning: "Chetsron", the name of a place in Palestine; also of two Israelites.
Usage: Hezron.
Source: from "H2691"; court-yard;

2697.long:
Meaning: a "Chetsronite" or (collectively) descendants of Chetsron.
Usage: Hezronites.
Source: patronymically from "H2696";

2698.long:
Meaning: "Chatseroth", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Hazeroth.
Source: feminine plural of "H2691"; "yards";

2699.long:
Meaning: "Chatserim", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Hazerim.
Source: plural masculine of "H2691"; yards;

2700.long:
Meaning: "Chatsarmaveth", a place in Arabia.
Usage: Hazarmaveth.
Source: from "H2691" and "H4194"; village of death;

2701.long:
Meaning: "Chatsar-Susah", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Hazar-susah.
Source: from "H2691" and "H5484"; village of cavalry;

2702.long:
Meaning: "Chatsar-Susim", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Hazar-susim.
Source: from "H2691" and the plural of "H5483"; village of horses;

2703.long:
Meaning: "Chatsar-Enon", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Hazar-enon.
Source: from "H2691" and a derivative of "H5869"; village of springs;

2704.long:
Meaning: "Chatsar-Enan", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Hazar-enan.
Source: from "H2691" and the same as "H5881"; village of springs;

2705.long:
Meaning: "Chatsar-Shual", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Hazar-shual.
Source: from "H2691" and "H7776"; village of (the) fox;

2706.long:
Meaning: an "enactment"; hence, an "appointment" (of time, space, quantity, labor or usage).
Usage: appointed, bound, commandment, convenient, custom, decree(-d), due, law, measure, × necessary, ordinance(-nary), portion, set time, statute, task.
Source: from "H2710";

2707.long:
Meaning: to "carve"; by implication, to "delineate"; also to "entrench".
Usage: carved work, portrayed, set a print.
Source: a primitive root;

2708.long:
Usage: appointed, custom, manner, ordinance, site, statute.
Source: feminine of "H2706", and meaning substantially the same

2709.long:
Meaning: "Chakupha", one of the Nethinim.
Usage: Hakupha.
Source: from an unused root probably meaning to bend; crooked;

2710.long:
Meaning: properly, to "hack", i.e. "engrave" (Judges 5:14, to "be a scribe" simply); by implication, to "enact" (laws being "cut" in stone or metal tablets in primitive times) or (gen.) "prescribe".
Usage: appoint, decree, governor, grave, lawgiver, note, pourtray, print, set.
Source: a primitive root;

2712.long:
Meaning: "Chukkok" or "Chukok", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Hukkok, Hukok.
Source: or (fully) "חוּקֹק"; from "H2710"; appointed;

2713.long:
Meaning: properly, to "penetrate"; hence, to "examine intimately".
Usage: find out, (make) search (out), seek (out), sound, try.
Source: a primitive root;

2714.long:
Meaning: "examination", "enumeration", "deliberation".
Usage: finding out, number, (un-) search(-able, -ed, out, -ing).
Source: from "H2713";

2715.long:
Meaning: properly, "white" or "pure" (from the "cleansing" or "shining" power of fire); hence (figuratively) "noble" (in rank).
Usage: noble.
Source: or (fully) "חוֹר"; from "H2787"; (compare "H2751")

2716.long:
Meaning: "excrement".
Usage: dung. Also "חֲרִי".
Source: from an unused (and vulgar) root probably meaning to "evacuate" the bowels;

2717.long:
Meaning: to "parch" (through drought) i.e. (by analogy,) to "desolate", "destroy", "kill".
Usage: decay, (be) desolate, destroy(-er), (be) dry (up), slay, × surely, (lay, lie, make) waste.
Source: or "חֲרֵב"; a primitive root;

2718.long:
Meaning: to "demolish".
Usage: destroy.
Source: (Aramaic) a root corresponding to "H2717";

2719.long:
Meaning: "drought"; also a "cutting" instrument (from its "destructive" effect), as a "knife", "sword", or other sharp implement.
Usage: axe, dagger, knife, mattock, sword, tool.
Source: from "H2717";

2721.long:
Meaning: "drought" or "desolation".
Usage: desolation, drought, dry, heat, × utterly, waste.
Source: a collaterally form of "H2719";

2722.long:
Meaning: "Choreb", a (generic) name for the Sinaitic mountains.
Usage: Horeb.
Source: from "H2717"; "desolate";

2723.long:
Meaning: properly, "drought", i.e. (by implication) a "desolation".
Usage: decayed place, desolate (place, -tion), destruction, (laid) waste (place).
Source: feminine of "H2721";

2726.long:
Meaning: "Charbona" or "Charbonah", a eunuch of Xerxes.
Usage: Harbona, Harbonah.
Source: or "חַרְבוֹנָה"; of Persian origin;

2727.long:
Meaning: properly, to "leap suddenly", i.e. (by implication) to "be dismayed".
Usage: be afraid.
Source: a primitive root;

2728.long:
Meaning: the "leaping insect", i.e. a "locust".
Usage: beetle.
Source: from "H2727";

2729.long:
Meaning: to "shudder" with terror; hence, to "fear"; also to "hasten" (with anxiety).
Usage: be (make) afraid, be careful, discomfit, fray (away), quake, tremble.
Source: a primitive root;

2731.long:
Meaning: "fear", "anxiety".
Usage: care, × exceedingly, fear, quaking, trembling.
Source: feminine of "H2730";

2732.long:
Meaning: "Charadah", a place in the Desert.
Usage: Haradah.
Source: the same as "H2731";

2733.long:
Meaning: a "Charodite", or inhabitant of Charod.
Usage: Harodite.
Source: patrial from a derivative of "H2729" (compare "H5878");

2734.long:
Meaning: to "glow" or "grow warm"; figuratively (usually) to "blaze up", of anger, zeal, jealousy.
Usage: be angry, burn, be displeased, × earnestly, fret self, grieve, be (wax) hot, be incensed, kindle, × very, be wroth. See "H8474".
Source: a primitive root (compare "H2787");

2735.long:
Meaning: "Chor-hag-Gidgad", a place in the Desert.
Usage: Hor-hagidgad.
Source: from "H2356" and a collateral (masculine) form of "H1412", with the article interposed; hole of the cleft;

2736.long:
Meaning: "Charhajah", an Israelite.
Usage: Harhaiah.
Source: ; from "H2734" and "H3050"; fearing Jah;

2737.long:
Meaning: properly, "pierced", i.e. a "bead of pearl", "gems" or "jewels" (as strung).
Usage: chain.
Source: from an unused root meaning to perforate;

2738.long:
Meaning: properly, "pointed", i.e. a "bramble" or other thorny weed.
Usage: nettle.
Source: or (shortened) "חָרֻל"; apparently, a passive participle of an unused root probably meaning to be prickly;

2739.long:
Meaning: "Charumaph", an Israelite.
Usage: Harumaph.
Source: from passive participle of "H2763" and "H639"; snub-nosed;

2740.long:
Meaning: a "burning" of anger.
Usage: sore displeasure, fierce(-ness), fury, (fierce) wrath(-ful).
Source: or (shortened) "חָרֹן"; from "H2734";

2741.long:
Meaning: "a Charuphite" or inhabitant of Charuph (or Chariph).
Usage: Haruphite.
Source: a patrial from (probably) a collateral form of "H2756";

2742.long:
Meaning: properly, "incised" or (active) "incisive"; hence (as noun masculine or feminine) a "trench" (as dug), "gold" (as mined), a "threshing-sledge" (having sharp teeth); (figuratively) "determination"; also "eager".
Usage: decision, diligent, (fine) gold, pointed things, sharp, threshing instrument, wall.
Source: or "חָרֻץ"; passive participle of "H2782";

2743.long:
Meaning: "Charuts", an Israelite.
Usage: Haruz.
Source: the same as "H2742"; earnest;

2744.long:
Meaning: "Charchur", one of the Nethinim.
Usage: Harhur.
Source: a fuller form of "H2746"; inflammation;

2745.long:
Meaning: "Charchas", an Israelite.
Usage: Harhas.
Source: from the same as "H2775"; perhaps shining;

2747.long:
Meaning: a "chisel" or "graver"; also a "style" for writing.
Usage: graving tool, pen.
Source: from a primitive root meaning to "engrave";

2748.long:
Meaning: a "horoscopist" (as drawing magical lines or circles).
Usage: magician.
Source: from the same as "H2747";

2750.long:
Meaning: a "burning" (i.e. intense) anger.
Usage: fierce, × great, heat.
Source: from "H2734";

2751.long:
Meaning: "white bread".
Usage: white.
Source: from the same as "H2353";

2752.long:
Meaning: a "Chorite" or aboriginal Idumaean.
Usage: Horims, Horites.
Source: from "H2356"; cave-dweller or troglodyte;

2753.long:
Meaning: "Chori", the name of two men.
Usage: Hori.
Source: or "חוֹרִי"; the same as "H2752";

2754.long:
Meaning: properly, "cut" out (or "hollow"), i.e. (by implication) a "pocket".
Usage: bag, crisping pin.
Source: or "חָרִט"; from the same as "H2747";

2755.long:
Meaning: "excrements of doves".
Usage: doves' dung.
Source: from the plural of "H2716" and the plural of "H3123"; or perhaps rather the plural of a single word "חֲרָאיוֹן", probably a kind of vegetable

2756.long:
Meaning: "Chariph", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Hariph.
Source: from "H2778"; "autumnal";

2757.long:
Meaning: properly, "incisure" or (passively) "incised"; hence, a "threshing-sledge" (with sharp teeth); also a "slice" (as cut).
Usage: cheese, harrow.
Source: or "חֲרִץ"; from "H2782"; (compare "H2742")

2759.long:
Meaning: "quiet", i.e. "sultry" (as feminine noun, the sirocco or hot east wind).
Usage: vehement.
Source: from "H2790" in the sense of silence;

2760.long:
Meaning: to "braid" (i.e. to entangle or snare) or "catch" (game) "in a net".
Usage: roast.
Source: a primitive root;

2761.long:
Meaning: to "scorch".
Usage: singe.
Source: (Aramaic) a root probably allied to the equivalent of "H2787";

2762.long:
Meaning: properly, a "net", i.e. (by analogy) "lattice".
Usage: lattice.
Source: from "H2760";

2763.long:
Meaning: to "seclude"; specifically (by a ban) to "devote to religious uses" (especially destruction); physical and reflexive, to "be blunt as to the nose".
Usage: make accursed, consecrate, (utterly) destroy, devote, forfeit, have a flat nose, utterly (slay, make away).
Source: a primitive root;

2764.long:
Meaning: physical (as shutting in) a "net" (either literally or figuratively); usually a "doomed object"; abstractly "extermination".
Usage: (ac-) curse(-d, -d thing), dedicated thing, things which should have been utterly destroyed, (appointed to) utter destruction, devoted (thing), net.
Source: or (Zechariah 14:11) "חֶרֶם"; from "H2763";

2765.long:
Meaning: "Chorem", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Horem.
Source: from "H2763"; "devoted";

2767.long:
Meaning: "Chormah", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Hormah.
Source: from "H2763"; "devoted";

2768.long:
Meaning: "Chermon", a mount of Palestine.
Usage: Hermon.
Source: from "H2763"; "abrupt";

2769.long:
Meaning: "Hermons", i.e. "its peaks".
Usage: the Hermonites.
Source: plural of "H2768";

2771.long:
Meaning: "Charan", the name of a man and also of a place.
Usage: Haran.
Source: from "H2787"; parched;

2772.long:
Meaning: a "Choronite" or inhabitant of Choronaim.
Usage: Horonite.
Source: patrial from "H2773";

2773.long:
Meaning: "Choronajim", a place in Moab.
Usage: Horonaim.
Source: dual of a derivative from "H2356"; "double cave-town";

2774.long:
Meaning: "Charnepher", an Israelite.
Usage: Harnepher.
Source: of uncertain derivation;

2775.long:
Meaning: the "sun".
Usage: sun.
Source: or (with a directive enclitic) "חַרְסָה"; from an unused root meaning to scrape; also perhaps from the mediating idea of "H2777"

2776.long:
Meaning: "Cheres", a mountain in Palestine.
Usage: Heres.
Source: the same as "H2775"; "shining";

2777.long:
Meaning: "a potsherd", i.e. (by implication) "a pottery"; the name of a gate at Jerusalem.
Usage: east.
Source: from "H2775" (apparently in the sense of a red tile used for scraping);

2778.long:
Meaning: to "pull off", i.e. (by implication) to "expose" (as by stripping); specifically, to "betroth" (as if a surrender); figuratively, to "carp at", i.e. "defame"; to "spend the winter".
Usage: betroth, blaspheme, defy, jeopard, rail, reproach, upbraid.
Source: a primitive root; also denominative (from "H2779")

2779.long:
Meaning: properly, the "crop gathered", i.e. (by implication) the "autumn" (and winter) "season"; figuratively, "ripeness of age".
Usage: cold, winter (-house), youth.
Source: from "H2778";

2782.long:
Meaning: properly, to "point" sharply, i.e. (literally) to "wound"; figuratively, to "be alert", to "decide".
Usage: bestir self, decide, decree, determine, maim, move.
Source: a primitive root;

2783.long:
Meaning: the "loin" (as the seat of strength).
Usage: loin.
Source: (Aramaic) from a root corresponding to "H2782" in the sense of vigor;

2784.long:
Meaning: a "fetter"; figuratively, a "pain".
Usage: band.
Source: of uncertain derivation;

2785.long:
Meaning: a "sour" grape (as "sharp" in taste).
Usage: kernel.
Source: from "H2782";

2786.long:
Meaning: to "grate the teeth".
Usage: gnash.
Source: a primitive root;

2787.long:
Meaning: to "glow", i.e. literally (to "melt", "burn", "dry" up) or figuratively (to "show" or "incite passion").
Usage: be angry, burn, dry, kindle.
Source: a primitive root;

2789.long:
Meaning: a piece of "pottery".
Usage: earth(-en), (pot-) sherd, stone.
Source: a collateral form mediating between "H2775" and "H2791";

2790.long:
Meaning: to "scratch", i.e. (by implication) to "engrave", "plough"; hence (from the use of tools) to "fabricate" (of any material); figuratively, to "devise" (in a bad sense); hence (from the idea of secrecy) to "be silent", to "let alone"; hence (by implication) to "be deaf" (as an accompaniment of dumbness).
Usage: × altogether, cease, conceal, be deaf, devise, ear, graven, imagine, leave off speaking, hold peace, plow(-er, man), be quiet, rest, practise secretly, keep silence, be silent, speak not a word, be still, hold tongue, worker.
Source: a primitive root;

2792.long:
Meaning: "Cheresh", a Levite.
Usage: Heresh.
Source: the same as "H2791"

2793.long:
Meaning: a "forest" (perhaps as furnishing the material for fabric).
Usage: bough, forest, shroud, wood.
Source: from "H2790";

2794.long:
Meaning: a "fabricator" or "mechanic".
Usage: artificer.
Source: active participle of "H2790";

2796.long:
Meaning: a "fabricator" or any material.
Usage: artificer, ( ) carpenter, craftsman, engraver, maker, mason, skilful, ( ) smith, worker, workman, such as wrought.
Source: from "H2790";

2797.long:
Meaning: "Charsha", one of the Nethinim.
Usage: Harsha.
Source: from "H2792"; magician;

2798.long:
Meaning: "mechanics", the name of a valley in Jerusalem.
Usage: Charashim, craftsmen.
Source: plural of "H2796";

2800.long:
Meaning: "Charosheth", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Harosheth.
Source: the same as "H2799";

2802.long:
Meaning: "Chereth", a thicket in Palestine.
Usage: Hereth.
Source: from "H2801" (but equivalent to "H2793"); forest;

2803.long:
Meaning: properly, to "plait" or "interpenetrate", i.e. (literally) to "weave" or (generally) to "fabricate"; figuratively, to "plot" or "contrive" (usually in a malicious sense); hence (from the mental effort) to "think", "regard", "value", "compute".
Usage: (make) account (of), conceive, consider, count, cunning (man, work, workman), devise, esteem, find out, forecast, hold, imagine, impute, invent, be like, mean, purpose, reckon(-ing be made), regard, think.
Source: a primitive root;

2805.long:
Meaning: a "belt" or strap (as being interlaced).
Usage: curious girdle.
Source: from "H2803";

2806.long:
Meaning: "Chasbaddanah", an Israelite.
Usage: Hasbadana.
Source: from "H2803" and "H1777"; considerate judge;

2808.long:
Meaning: properly, "contrivance"; by implication, "intelligence".
Usage: account, device, reason.
Source: from "H2803";

2809.long:
Meaning: "Cheshbon", a place East of the Jordan.
Usage: Heshbon.
Source: the same as "H2808";

2810.long:
Meaning: a "contrivance", i.e. "actual" (a warlike machine) or "mental" (a machination).
Usage: engine, invention.
Source: from "H2803";

2811.long:
Meaning: "Chashabjah", the name of nine Israelites.
Usage: Hashabiah.
Source: or "חֲשַׁבְיָהוּ"; from "H2803" and "H3050"; Jah has regarded;

2812.long:
Meaning: "Chashnah", an Israelite.
Usage: Hashabnah.
Source: feminine of "H2808"; inventiveness;

2813.long:
Meaning: "Chashabnejah", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Hashabniah.
Source: from "H2808" and "H3050"; thought of Jah;

2814.long:
Meaning: to "hush" or keep quiet.
Usage: hold peace, keep silence, be silent, (be) still.
Source: a primitive root;

2815.long:
Meaning: "Chashshub", the name of two or three Israelites.
Usage: Hashub, Hasshub.
Source: from "H2803"; intelligent;

2816.long:
Meaning: the "dark".
Usage: darkness.
Source: (Aramaic) from a root corresponding to "H2821";

2817.long:
Meaning: "Chasupha", one of the Nethinim.
Usage: Hashupha, Hasupha.
Source: or "חֲשֻׂפָא"; from "H2834"; nakedness;

2818.long:
Meaning: to "be necessary" (from the idea of convenience) or (transitively) to "need".
Usage: careful, have need of.
Source: (Aramaic) a collateral root to one corresponding to "H2363" in the sense of readiness;

2819.long:
Meaning: "necessity".
Usage: be needful.
Source: from a root corresponding to "H2818";

2820.long:
Meaning: to "restrain" or (reflex.) "refrain"; by implication, to "refuse", "spare", "preserve"; to "observe".
Usage: assuage, × darken, forbear, hinder, hold back, keep (back), punish, refrain, reserve, spare, withhold.
Source: a primitive root; also interchangeable with "H2821"

2821.long:
Meaning: to "be dark" (as "withholding" light); transitively, to "darken".
Usage: be black, be (make) dark, darken, cause darkness, be dim, hide.
Source: a primitive root;

2822.long:
Meaning: the "dark"; hence (literally) "darkness"; figuratively, "misery", "destruction", "death", "ignorance", "sorrow", "wickedness".
Usage: dark(-ness), night, obscurity.
Source: from "H2821";

2826.long:
Meaning: to "make" (intrans. "be") "unsteady", i.e. "weak".
Usage: feeble.
Source: a primitive root;

2827.long:
Meaning: to "weaken", i.e. "crush".
Usage: subdue.
Source: (Aramaic) a root corresponding to "H2826";

2828.long:
Meaning: "Chashum", the name of two or three Israelites.
Usage: Hashum.
Source: from the same as "H2831"; enriched;

2829.long:
Meaning: "Cheshmon", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Heshmon.
Source: the same as "H2831"; opulent;

2830.long:
Meaning: probably "bronze" or "polished spectrum metal".
Usage: amber.
Source: of uncertain derivation;

2831.long:
Meaning: "wealthy".
Usage: princes.
Source: from an unused root (probably meaning firm or capacious in resources); apparently

2832.long:
Meaning: "Chasmonah", a place in the Desert.
Usage: Hashmonah.
Source: feminine of "H2831"; fertile;

2833.long:
Meaning: perhaps a "pocket" (as holding the Urim and Thummim), or "rich" (as containing gems), used only of the "gorget" of the highpriest.
Usage: breastplate.
Source: from an unused root probably meaning to "contain" or "sparkle";

2834.long:
Meaning: to "strip" off, i.e. generally to "make naked" (for exertion or in disgrace), to "drain" away or "bail" up (a liquid).
Usage: make bare, clean, discover, draw out, take, uncover.
Source: a primitive root;

2835.long:
Meaning: properly, "drawn off", i.e. "separated"; hence, a "small company" (as divided from the rest).
Usage: little flock.
Source: from "H2834";

2836.long:
Meaning: to "cling", i.e. "join", (figuratively) to "love", "delight in"; elliptically; to "deliver".
Usage: have a delight, (have a) desire, fillet, long, set (in) love.
Source: a primitive root; also interchangeable for "H2820"

2838.long:
Meaning: "attached", i.e. a fence-"rail" or rod connecting the posts or pillars.
Usage: fillet.
Source: or "חָשׁוּק"; past participle of "H2836";

2839.long:
Meaning: "conjoined", i.e. a "wheel-spoke" or rod connecting the hub with the rim.
Usage: felloe.
Source: from "H2836";

2840.long:
Meaning: "combined", i.e. the "nave" or "hub" of a wheel (as holding the spokes together).
Usage: spoke.
Source: from an unused root meaning to bind together;

2841.long:
Meaning: properly, a "combination" or "gathering", i.e. of watery clouds.
Usage: dark.
Source: from the same as "H2840";

2843.long:
Meaning: a "Chushathite" or descendant of Chushah.
Usage: Hushathite.
Source: patronymically from "H2364";

2844.long:
Meaning: concretely, "crushed"; also "afraid"; abstractly, "terror".
Usage: broken, dismayed, dread, fear.
Source: from "H2865";

2845.long:
Meaning: "Cheth", an aboriginal Canaanite.
Usage: Heth.
Source: from "H2865"; terror;

2846.long:
Meaning: to lay "hold" of; especially to "pick" up fire.
Usage: heap, take (away).
Source: a primitive root;

2850.long:
Meaning: a "Chittite", or descendant of Cheth.
Usage: Hittite, Hittities.
Source: patronymically from "H2845";

2852.long:
Meaning: properly, to "cut off", i.e. (figuratively) to "decree".
Usage: determine.
Source: a primitive root;

2853.long:
Meaning: to "swathe".
Usage: × at all, swaddle.
Source: a primitive root;

2855.long:
Meaning: "Chethlon", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Hethlon.
Source: from "H2853"; "enswathed";

2856.long:
Meaning: to "close" up; especially to "seal".
Usage: make an end, mark, seal (up), stop.
Source: a primitive root;

2857.long:
Meaning: to "seal".
Usage: seal.
Source: (Aramaic) a root corresponding to "H2856";

2858.long:
Meaning: a "seal".
Usage: signet.
Source: feminine active participle of "H2856";

2859.long:
Meaning: to "give" (a daughter) "away in marriage"; hence (generally) to "contract affinity by marriage".
Usage: join in affinity, father in law, make marriages, mother in law, son in law.
Source: a primitive root;

2860.long:
Meaning: a "relative by marriage" (especially through the bride); figuratively, a "circumcised child" (as a species of religious espousal).
Usage: bridegroom, husband, son in law.
Source: from "H2859";

2862.long:
Meaning: to "clutch".
Usage: take away.
Source: a primitive root;

2864.long:
Meaning: to "force a passage", as by burglary; figuratively, "with oars".
Usage: dig (through), row.
Source: a primitive root;

2865.long:
Meaning: properly, to "prostrate"; hence, to "break" down, either (literally) by violence, or (figuratively) by confusion and fear.
Usage: abolish, affright, be (make) afraid, amaze, beat down, discourage, (cause to) dismay, go down, scare, terrify.
Source: a primitive root;

2867.long:
Meaning: "Chathath", an Israelite.
Usage: cathath. f.
Source: the same as "H2866";

2868.long:
Meaning: to "rejoice".
Usage: be glad.
Source: (Aramaic) a primitive root;

2870.long:
Meaning: "Tabeel", the name of a Syrian and of a Persian.
Usage: Tabeal, Tabeel.
Source: from "H2895" and "H410"; pleasing (to) God;

2871.long:
Meaning: properly, "dyed", i.e. a "turban" (probably as of colored stuff).
Usage: dyed attire.
Source: passive participle of "H2881";

2872.long:
Meaning: properly, "accumulated"; i.e. (by implication) a "summit".
Usage: middle, midst.
Source: from an unused root meaning to pile up;

2873.long:
Meaning: to "slaughter" (animals or men).
Usage: kill, (make) slaughter, slay.
Source: a primitive root;

2874.long:
Meaning: properly, something "slaughtered"; hence, a "beast" (or "meat", as butchered); abstractly "butchery" (or concretely, a place of slaughter).
Usage: × beast, slaughter, × slay, × sore.
Source: from "H2873";

2875.long:
Meaning: "Tebach", the name of a Mesopotamian and of an Israelite.
Usage: Tebah.
Source: the same as "H2874"; massacre;

2876.long:
Meaning: properly, a "butcher"; hence, a "lifeguardsman" (because he was acting as an executioner); also a "cook" (usually slaughtering the animal for food).
Usage: cook, guard.
Source: from "H2873";

2878.long:
Usage: flesh, slaughter.
Source: feminine of "H2874" and meaning the same

2880.long:
Meaning: "Tibchath", a place in Syria.
Usage: Tibhath.
Source: from "H2878"; slaughter;

2881.long:
Meaning: to "dip", to "immerse".
Usage: dip, plunge.
Source: a primitive root;

2882.long:
Meaning: "Tebaljah", an Israelite.
Usage: Tebaliah.
Source: from "H2881" and "H3050"; "Jah has dipped";

2883.long:
Meaning: to "sink".
Usage: drown, fasten, settle, sink.
Source: a primitive root;

2884.long:
Meaning: "Tabbaoth", one of the Nethinim.
Usage: Tabaoth.
Source: plural of "H2885"; rings;

2885.long:
Meaning: properly, a "seal" (as "sunk" into the wax), i.e. "signet" (for sealing); hence (generally) a "ring" of any kind.
Usage: ring.
Source: from "H2883";

2886.long:
Meaning: "Tabrimmon", a Syrian.
Usage: Tabrimmon.
Source: from "H2895" and "H7417"; pleasing (to) Rimmon;

2887.long:
Meaning: "Tebeth", the tenth Hebrew month.
Usage: Tebeth.
Source: probably of foreign derivation;

2888.long:
Meaning: "Tabbath", a place East of the Jordan.
Usage: Tabbath.
Source: of uncertain derivation;

2889.long:
Meaning: "pure" (in a physical, chemical, ceremonial or moral sense).
Usage: clean, fair, pure(-ness).
Source: or "טָהֹר"; from "H2891";

2891.long:
Meaning: to "be pure" (physical sound, clear, unadulterated; Levitically, uncontaminated; morally, innocent or holy).
Usage: be (make, make self, pronounce) clean, cleanse (self), purge, purify(-ier, self).
Source: a primitive root; properly, to be bright; i.e. (by implication)

2892.long:
Meaning: literally "brightness"; ceremonially "purification".
Usage: clearness, glory, purifying.
Source: from "H2891";

2893.long:
Meaning: ceremonial "purification"; moral "purity".
Usage: × is cleansed, cleansing, purification(-fying).
Source: feminine of "H2892";

2894.long:
Meaning: to "sweep away".
Usage: sweep.
Source: a primitive root;

2895.long:
Meaning: to "be" (transitively, "do" or "make") "good" (or well) in the widest sense.
Usage: be (do) better, cheer, be (do, seem) good, (make) goodly, × please, (be, do, go, play) well.
Source: a primitive root,

2896.long:
Meaning: "good" (as an adjective) in the widest sense; used likewise as a noun, both in the masculine and the feminine, the singular and the plural (good, a good or good thing, a good man or woman; the good, goods or good things, good men or women), also as an adverb (well).
Usage: beautiful, best, better, bountiful, cheerful, at ease, × fair (word), (be in) favour, fine, glad, good (deed, -lier, -liest, -ly, -ness, -s), graciously, joyful, kindly, kindness, liketh (best), loving, merry, × most, pleasant, pleaseth, pleasure, precious, prosperity, ready, sweet, wealth, welfare, (be) well(-favoured).
Source: from "H2895";

2897.long:
Meaning: "Tob", a region apparently East of the Jordan.
Usage: Tob.
Source: the same as "H2896"; good;

2898.long:
Meaning: "good" (as a noun), in the widest sense, especially "goodness" (superlative concretely, the "best"), "beauty", "gladness", "welfare".
Usage: fair, gladness, good(-ness, thing, -s), joy, go well with.
Source: from "H2895";

2899.long:
Meaning: "Tob-Adonijah", an Israelite.
Usage: Tob-adonijah.
Source: from "H2896" and "H138"; pleasing (to) Adonijah;

2900.long:
Meaning: "Tobijah", the name of three Israelites and of one Samaritan.
Usage: Tobiah, Tobijah.
Source: or "טוֹבִיָּהוּ"; from "H2896" and "H3050"; goodness of Jehovah;

2902.long:
Meaning: to "smear", especially with lime.
Usage: daub, overlay, plaister, smut.
Source: a primitive root;

2903.long:
Meaning: a "fillet" for the forehead.
Usage: frontlet.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "go around" or "bind";

2904.long:
Meaning: to "pitch" over or "reel"; hence (transitively) to "cast" down or out.
Usage: carry away, (utterly) cast (down, forth, out), send out.
Source: a primitive root;

2905.long:
Meaning: a "row"; hence, a "wall".
Usage: row.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "range" in a regular manner;

2907.long:
Meaning: to "pounce" as a bird of prey.
Usage: haste.
Source: a primitive root;

2908.long:
Meaning: "hunger" (as twisting).
Usage: fasting.
Source: (Aramaic) from a root corresponding to "H2901";

2909.long:
Meaning: to "stretch" a bow, as an archer.
Usage: (bow-) shot.
Source: a primitive root;

2910.long:
Meaning: (in the plural only) the "kidneys" (as being covered); hence (figuratively) the "inmost thought".
Usage: inward parts.
Source: from "H2909" (or "H2902") in the sense of overlaying;

2911.long:
Meaning: a "hand mill"; hence, a "millstone".
Usage: to grind.
Source: from "H2912";

2912.long:
Meaning: to "grind" meal; hence, to "be a concubine" (that being their employment).
Usage: grind(-er).
Source: a primitive root;

2914.long:
Meaning: a "boil" or "ulcer" (from the inflammation), especially a "tumor" in the anus or pudenda (the piles).
Usage: emerod.
Source: from an unused root meaning to burn;

2916.long:
Meaning: "mud" or "clay"; figuratively, "calamity".
Usage: clay, dirt, mire.
Source: from an unused root meaning apparently to "be sticky" (rather perhaps a demonstrative); from "H2894", through the idea of dirt to be "swept" away);

2917.long:
Meaning: "clay".
Usage: miry.
Source: (Aramaic) perhaps, by interchange, for a word corresponding to "H2916";

2918.long:
Meaning: a "wall"; hence, a "fortress" or a "hamlet".
Usage: (goodly) castle, habitation, palace, row.
Source: feminine of (an equivalent to) "H2905";

2921.long:
Meaning: properly, to "cover" with pieces; i.e. (by implication) to "spot" or "variegate" (as tapestry).
Usage: clouted, with divers colours, spotted.
Source: a primitive root;

2922.long:
Meaning: a "lamb".
Usage: lamb.
Source: apparently from "H2921" in the (orig.) sense of "covering" (for protection); (compare "H2924")

2923.long:
Meaning: "Telaim", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Telaim.
Source: from the plural of "H2922"; lambs;

2926.long:
Meaning: properly, to "strew over", i.e. (by implication) to "cover in" or "plate" (with beams).
Usage: cover.
Source: a primitive root;

2927.long:
Meaning: to "cover" with shade.
Usage: have a shadow.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H2926";

2928.long:
Meaning: "Telem", the name of a place in Idumaea, also of a temple doorkeeper.
Usage: Telem.
Source: from an unused root meaning to break up or treat violently; oppression;

2929.long:
Meaning: "Talmon", a temple doorkeeper.
Usage: Talmon.
Source: from the same as "H2728"; oppressive;

2930.long:
Meaning: to "be foul", especially in a ceremial or moral sense (contaminated).
Usage: defile (self), pollute (self), be (make, make self, pronounce) unclean, × utterly.
Source: a primitive root;

2931.long:
Meaning: "foul" in a religious sense.
Usage: defiled, infamous, polluted(-tion), unclean.
Source: from "H2930";

2933.long:
Meaning: to "be impure" in a religious sense.
Usage: be defiled, be reputed vile.
Source: a collateral form of "H2930";

2934.long:
Meaning: to "hide" (by "covering" over).
Usage: hide, lay privily, in secret.
Source: a primitive root;

2935.long:
Meaning: a "basket" (of interlaced osiers).
Usage: basket.
Source: from an unused root probably meaning to weave;

2937.long:
Meaning: to "wander"; causatively to "lead astray".
Usage: seduce.
Source: a primitive root;

2938.long:
Meaning: to "taste"; figuratively, to "perceive".
Usage: × but, perceive, taste.
Source: a primitive root;

2939.long:
Meaning: to "taste"; causatively to "feed".
Usage: make to eat, feed.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H2938";

2940.long:
Meaning: properly, a "taste", i.e. (figuratively) "perception"; by implication, "intelligence"; transitively, a "mandate".
Usage: advice, behaviour, decree, discretion, judgment, reason, taste, understanding.
Source: from "H2938";

2941.long:
Meaning: properly, "a taste", i.e. "a judicial sentence".
Usage: account, × to be commanded, commandment, matter.
Source: (Aramaic) from "H2939"; compare "H2940")

2942.long:
Meaning: properly, "flavor"; figuratively, "judgment" (both subjective and objective); hence, "account" (both subjectively and objectively).
Usage: chancellor, command, commandment, decree, regard, taste, wisdom.
Source: (Aramaic) from "H2939", and equivalent to "H2941";

2943.long:
Meaning: to "load" a beast.
Usage: lade.
Source: a primitive root;

2944.long:
Meaning: to "stab".
Usage: thrust through.
Source: a primitive root;

2945.long:
Meaning: a "family" (mostly used collectively in the singular).
Usage: (little) children (ones), families.
Source: from "H2952" (perhaps referring to the tripping gait of children);

2946.long:
Meaning: to "flatten" out or "extend" (as a tent); figuratively, to "nurse" a child (as "promotive" of growth).
Usage: span, swaddle.
Source: a primitive root; or perhaps a denominative from "H2947", from dandling on the palms

2947.long:
Meaning: a "spread of the hand", i.e. a "palm-breadth" (not 'span' of the fingers); architecturally, a "corbel" (as a supporting palm).
Usage: coping, hand-breadth.
Source: from "H2946";

2950.long:
Meaning: properly, to "stick on as a patch"; figuratively, to "impute falsely".
Usage: forge(-r), sew up.
Source: a primitive root;

2951.long:
Meaning: a "military governor".
Usage: captain.
Source: of foreign derivation;

2952.long:
Meaning: to "trip" (with short steps) coquettishly.
Usage: mince.
Source: a primitive root; apparently

2953.long:
Meaning: a "finger-nail"; also a "hoof" or "claw".
Usage: nail.
Source: (Aramaic) from a root corresponding to "H6852", and meaning the same as "H6856";

2954.long:
Meaning: properly, apparently to "be thick"; figuratively, to "be stupid".
Usage: be fat.
Source: a primitive root;

2955.long:
Meaning: "Taphath", an Israelitess.
Usage: Taphath.
Source: probably from "H5197"; a dropping (of ointment);

2956.long:
Meaning: to "drive on"; figuratively, to "follow close".
Usage: continual.
Source: a primitive root;

2961.long:
Meaning: properly, "dripping"; hence, "fresh" (i.e. recently made such).
Usage: new, putrefying.
Source: from an unused root apparently meaning to be "moist";

2962.long:
Meaning: properly, "non-occurrence"; used adverbially, "not yet" or "before".
Usage: before, ere, not yet.
Source: from an unused root apparently meaning to interrupt or suspend;

2963.long:
Meaning: to "pluck off" or "pull to pieces"; causatively to "supply" with food (as in morsels).
Usage: catch, × without doubt, feed, ravin, rend in pieces, × surely, tear (in pieces).
Source: a primitive root;

2964.long:
Meaning: something "torn", i.e. a fragment, e.g. a "fresh" leaf, "prey", "food".
Usage: leaf, meat, prey, spoil.
Source: from "H2963";

2965.long:
Meaning: "recently torn off", i.e. "fresh".
Usage: pluckt off.
Source: from "H2963";

2966.long:
Meaning: "prey", i.e. flocks devoured by animals.
Usage: ravin, (that which was) torn (of beasts, in pieces).
Source: feminine (collectively) of "H2964";

2967.long:
Meaning: a "Tarpelite" (collectively) or inhabitants of Tarpel, a place in Assyria.
Usage: Tarpelites. y.
Source: (Aramaic) from a name of foreign derivation;

2969.long:
Meaning: to "be suitable".
Usage: appertain.
Source: a primitive root;

2970.long:
Meaning: "Jaazanjah", the name of four Israelites.
Usage: Jaazaniah. Compare "H3153".
Source: or "יַאֲזַנְיָהוּ"; from "H238" and "H3050"; heard of Jah;

2971.long:
Meaning: "Jair", the name of four Israelites.
Usage: Jair.
Source: from "H215"; "enlightener";

2972.long:
Meaning: a "Jairite" or descendant of Jair.
Usage: Jairite.
Source: patronymically from "H2971";

2973.long:
Meaning: properly, to "be slack", i.e. (figuratively) to "be foolish".
Usage: dote, be (become, do) foolish(-ly).
Source: a primitive root;

2974.long:
Meaning: properly, to "yield", especially "assent"; hence (pos.) to "undertake" as an act of volition.
Usage: assay, begin, be content, please, take upon, × willingly, would.
Source: a primitive root (probably rather the same as "H2973" through the idea of mental weakness);

2975.long:
Meaning: a "channel", e.g. a fosse, canal, shaft; specifically the "Nile", as the one river of Egypt, including its collateral trenches; also the "Tigris", as the main river of Assyria.
Usage: brook, flood, river, stream.
Source: of Egyptian origin;

2976.long:
Meaning: to "desist", i.e. (figuratively) to "despond".
Usage: (cause to) despair, one that is desperate, be no hope.
Source: a primitive root;

2977.long:
Meaning: "Joshijah", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Josiah.
Source: or "יֹאשִׁיָּהוּ"; from the same root as "H803" and "H3050"; "founded of Jah";

2979.long:
Meaning: "Jeatherai", an Israelite.
Usage: Jeaterai.
Source: from the same as "H871"; stepping;

2980.long:
Meaning: to "bawl".
Usage: cry out.
Source: a primitive root;

2981.long:
Meaning: "produce", i.e. a "crop" or (figuratively) "wealth".
Usage: fruit, increase.
Source: from "H2986";

2982.long:
Meaning: "Jebus", the original name of Jerusalem.
Usage: Jebus.
Source: from "H947"; trodden, i.e. threshing-place;

2983.long:
Meaning: a "Jebusite" or inhabitant of Jebus.
Usage: Jebusite(-s).
Source: patrial from "H2982";

2985.long:
Meaning: "Jabin", the name of two Canaanitish kings.
Usage: Jabin.
Source: from "H995"; intelligent;

2986.long:
Meaning: properly, to "flow"; causatively, to "bring" (especially with pomp).
Usage: bring (forth), carry, lead (forth).
Source: a primitive root;

2989.long:
Meaning: "Jabal", an antediluvian.
Usage: Jabal.
Source: the same as "H2988";

2991.long:
Meaning: "Jibleam", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Ibleam.
Source: from "H1104" and "H5971"; devouring people;

2992.long:
Meaning: to "marry" a (deceased) brother's widow.
Usage: perform the duty of a husband's brother, marry.
Source: a primitive root of doubtful meaning; used only as a denominative from "H2993";

2993.long:
Meaning: a "brother-in-law".
Usage: husband's brother.
Source: from (the orig. of) "H2992";

2994.long:
Meaning: a "sister-in-law".
Usage: brother's wife, sister in law.
Source: feminine participle of "H2992";

2995.long:
Meaning: "Jabneel", the name of two places in Palestine.
Usage: Jabneel.
Source: from "H1129" and "H410"; built of God;

2996.long:
Meaning: "Jabneh", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Jabneh.
Source: from "H1129"; a building;

2997.long:
Meaning: "Jibnejah", an Israelite.
Usage: Ibneiah.
Source: from "H1129" and "H3050"; built of Jah;

2998.long:
Meaning: "Jibnijah", an Israelite.
Usage: Ibnijah.
Source: from "H1129" and "H3050"; building of Jah;

2999.long:
Meaning: "Jabbok", a river east of the Jordan.
Usage: Jabbok.
Source: probably from "H1238"; pouring forth;

3000.long:
Meaning: "Jeberekjah", an Israelite.
Usage: Jeberechiah.
Source: from "H1288" and "H3050"; "blessed of Jah";

3001.long:
Meaning: to "be ashamed", "confused" or "disappointed"; also (as failing) to "dry up" (as water) or "wither" (as herbage).
Usage: be ashamed, clean, be confounded, (make) dry (up), (do) shame(-fully), × utterly, wither (away).
Source: a primitive root;

3003.long:
Meaning: "Jobesh", the name of an Israelite and of a place in Palestine.
Usage: Jobesh (-Gilead).
Source: the same as "H3002" (also "יָבֵישׁ"; often with the addition of "H1568", i.e. Jabesh of Gilad);

3005.long:
Meaning: "Jibsam", an Israelite.
Usage: Jibsam.
Source: from the same as "H1314"; "fragrant";

3006.long:
Meaning: "dry ground".
Usage: dry land.
Source: a variation of "H3004";

3008.long:
Meaning: "Jigal", the name of three Israelites.
Usage: Igal, Igeal.
Source: from "H1350"; avenger;

3009.long:
Meaning: to "dig" or "plow".
Usage: husbandman.
Source: a primitive root;

3011.long:
Meaning: "Jogbehah", a place East of the Jordan.
Usage: Jogbehah.
Source: feminine from "H1361"; "hillock";

3012.long:
Meaning: "Jigdaljah", an Israelite.
Usage: Igdaliah.
Source: from "H1431" and "H3050"; magnified of Jah;

3013.long:
Meaning: to "grieve".
Usage: afflict, cause grief, grieve, sorrowful, vex.
Source: a primitive root;

3014.long:
Meaning: to "push away".
Usage: be removed.
Source: a primitive root (probably rather the same as "H3013" through the common idea of dissatisfaction);

3017.long:
Meaning: "Jagur", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Jagur.
Source: probably from "H1481"; a lodging;

3018.long:
Meaning: "toil"; hence, a "work", "produce", "property" (as the result of labor).
Usage: labour, work.
Source: from "H3021";

3021.long:
Meaning: properly, to "gasp"; hence, to "be exhausted", to "tire", to "toil".
Usage: faint, (make to) labour, (be) weary.
Source: a primitive root;

3022.long:
Meaning: "earnings" (as the product of toil).
Usage: that which he laboured for.
Source: from "H3021";

3023.long:
Meaning: "tired"; hence (transitive) "tiresome".
Usage: full of labour, weary.
Source: from "H3021";

3025.long:
Meaning: to "fear".
Usage: be afraid, fear.
Source: a primitive root;

3026.long:
Meaning: "Jegar-Sahadutha", a cairn East of the Jordan.
Usage: Jegar-Sahadutha.
Source: (Aramaic) from a word derived from an unused root (meaning to gather) and a derivation of a root corresponding to "H7717"; heap of the testimony;

3027.long:
Meaning: a "hand" (the "open" one [indicating "power", "means", "direction", etc.], in distinction from "H3709", the "closed" one); used (as noun, adverb, etc.) in a great variety of applications, both literally and figuratively, both proximate and remote [as follows].
Usage: ( be) able, × about, armholes, at, axletree, because of, beside, border, × bounty, broad, (broken-) handed, × by, charge, coast, consecrate, creditor, custody, debt, dominion, × enough, fellowship, force, × from, hand(-staves, -y work), × he, himself, × in, labour, large, ledge, (left-) handed, means, × mine, ministry, near, × of, × order, ordinance, × our, parts, pain, power, × presumptuously, service, side, sore, state, stay, draw with strength, stroke, swear, terror, × thee, × by them, × themselves, × thine own, × thou, through, × throwing, thumb, times, × to, × under, × us, × wait on, (way-) side, where, wide, × with (him, me, you), work, yield, × yourselves.
Source: a primitive word;

3030.long:
Meaning: "Jidalah", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Idalah.
Source: of uncertain derivation;

3031.long:
Meaning: "Jidbash", an Israelite.
Usage: Idbash.
Source: from the same as "H1706"; perhaps honeyed;

3032.long:
Meaning: properly, to "handle", i.e. to "throw", e.g. "lots".
Usage: cast.
Source: a primitive root; (compare "H3034")

3033.long:
Meaning: properly, "affection"; concretely, a "darling object".
Usage: dearly beloved.
Source: from "H3039";

3034.long:
Meaning: physically, to "throw" (a stone, an arrow) at or away; especially to "revere" or "worship" (with extended hands); intensively, to "bemoan" (by wringing the hands).
Usage: cast (out), (make) confess(-ion), praise, shoot, (give) thank(-ful, -s, -sgiving).
Source: a primitive root; used only as denominative from "H3027"; literally, to use (i.e. hold out) the hand;

3037.long:
Meaning: "Jaddua", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Jaddua.
Source: from "H3045"; knowing;

3038.long:
Meaning: "Jeduthun", an Israelite.
Usage: Jeduthun.
Source: or "יְדֻתוּן"; or "יְדִיתוּן"; probably from "H3034"; laudatory;

3039.long:
Meaning: "loved".
Usage: amiable, (well-) beloved, loves.
Source: from the same as "H1730";

3040.long:
Meaning: "Jedidah", an Israelitess.
Usage: Jedidah.
Source: feminine of "H3039"; beloved;

3041.long:
Meaning: "Jedidejah", a name of Solomon.
Usage: Jedidiah.
Source: from "H3039" and "H3050"; beloved of Jah;

3042.long:
Meaning: "Jedajah", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Jedaiah.
Source: from "H3034" and "H3050"; praised of Jah;

3043.long:
Meaning: "Jediael", the name of three Israelites.
Usage: Jediael.
Source: from "H3045" and "H410"; knowing God;

3045.long:
Meaning: to "know" (properly, to ascertain by "seeing"); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including "observation", "care", "recognition"; and causatively, "instruction", "designation", "punishment", etc.).
Usage: acknowledge, acquaintance(-ted with), advise, answer, appoint, assuredly, be aware, (un-) awares, can(-not), certainly, comprehend, consider, × could they, cunning, declare, be diligent, (can, cause to) discern, discover, endued with, familiar friend, famous, feel, can have, be (ig-) norant, instruct, kinsfolk, kinsman, (cause to let, make) know, (come to give, have, take) knowledge, have (knowledge), (be, make, make to be, make self) known, be learned, lie by man, mark, perceive, privy to, × prognosticator, regard, have respect, skilful, shew, can (man of) skill, be sure, of a surety, teach, (can) tell, understand, have (understanding), × will be, wist, wit, wot.
Source: a primitive root;

3046.long:
Usage: certify, know, make known, teach.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H3045"

3048.long:
Meaning: "Jedajah", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Jedaiah.
Source: from "H3045" and "H3050"; Jah has known;

3049.long:
Meaning: properly, a "knowing" one; specifically, a "conjurer"; (by impl) a "ghost".
Usage: wizard.
Source: from "H3045";

3050.long:
Meaning: "Jah", the sacred name.
Usage: Jah, the Lord, most vehement. Compare names in '-iah,' '-jah.'.
Source: contraction for "H3068", and meaning the same;

3051.long:
Meaning: to "give" (whether literal or figurative); generally, to "put"; imperatively (reflexive) "come".
Usage: ascribe, bring, come on, give, go, set, take.
Source: a primitive root;

3052.long:
Usage: deliver, give, lay, prolong, pay, yield.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H3051"

3053.long:
Meaning: properly, "what is given" (by Providence), i.e. a "lot".
Usage: burden.
Source: from "H3051";

3054.long:
Meaning: to "Judaize", i.e. become Jewish.
Usage: become Jews.
Source: denominative from a form corresponding to "H3061";

3055.long:
Meaning: "Jehud", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Jehud.
Source: a briefer form of one corresponding to "H3061";

3056.long:
Meaning: "Jehdai", an Israelite.
Usage: Jehdai.
Source: perhaps from a form corresponding to "H3061"; Judaistic;

3058.long:
Meaning: "Jehu", the name of five Israelites.
Usage: Jehu.
Source: from "H3068" and "H1931"; Jehovah (is) He;

3059.long:
Meaning: "Jehoachaz", the name of three Israelites.
Usage: Jehoahaz. Compare "H3099".
Source: from "H3068" and "H270"; Jehovah-seized;

3060.long:
Meaning: "Jehoash", the name of two Israelite kings.
Usage: Jehoash. Compare "H3101".
Source: from "H3068" and (perhaps) "H784"; Jehovah-fired;

3061.long:
Meaning: properly, "Judah", hence, "Judaea".
Usage: Jewry, Judah, Judea.
Source: (Aramaic) contracted from a form corresponding to "H3063";

3062.long:
Meaning: a "Jehudaite" (or Judaite), i.e. "Jew".
Usage: Jew.
Source: (Aramaic) patrial from "H3061";

3063.long:
Meaning: "Jehudah" (or Judah), the name of five Israelites; also of the tribe descended from the first, and of its territory.
Usage: Judah.
Source: from "H3034"; "celebrated";

3064.long:
Meaning: a "Jehudite" (i.e. Judaite or Jew), or descendant of Jehudah (i.e. Judah).
Usage: Jew.
Source: patronymically from "H3063";

3065.long:
Meaning: "Jehudi", an Israelite.
Usage: Jehudi.
Source: the same as "H3064";

3066.long:
Meaning: the "Jewish" (used adverbially) language.
Usage: in the Jews' language.
Source: feminine of "H3064";

3067.long:
Meaning: "Jehudith", a Canaanitess.
Usage: Judith.
Source: the same as "H3066"; Jewess;

3068.long:
Meaning: (the) self-"Existent" or Eternal; "Jeho-vah", Jewish national name of God.
Usage: Jehovah, the Lord. Compare "H3050", "H3069".
Source: from "H1961";

3069.long:
Usage: God.
Source: a variation of "H3068" [used after "H136", and pronounced by Jews as "H430", in order to prevent the repetition of the same sound, since they elsewhere pronounce "H3068" as "H136"]

3070.long:
Meaning: "Jehovah-Jireh", a symbolical name for Mount Moriah.
Usage: Jehovah-jireh.
Source: from "H3068" and "H7200"; Jehovah will see (to it);

3071.long:
Meaning: "Jehovah-Nissi", a symbolical name of an altar in the Desert.
Usage: Jehovah-nissi.
Source: from "H3068" and "H5251" with the prononimal suffix; Jehovah (is) my banner;

3072.long:
Meaning: "Jehovah-Tsidkenu", a symbolical epithet of the Messiah and of Jerusalem.
Usage: the Lord our righteousness.
Source: from "H3068" and "H6664" with pronominal suffix; Jehovah (is) our right;

3073.long:
Meaning: "Jehovah-Shalom", a symbolical name of an altar in Palestine.
Usage: Jehovah-shalom.
Source: from "H3068" and "H7965"; Jehovah (is) peace;

3074.long:
Meaning: "Jehovah-Shammah", a symbolic title of Jerusalem.
Usage: Jehovahshammah.
Source: from "H3068" and "H8033" with directive enclitic; Jehovah (is) thither;

3075.long:
Meaning: "Jehozabad", the name of three Israelites.
Usage: Jehozabad. Compare "H3107".
Source: from "H3068" and "H2064"; Jehovah-endowed;

3076.long:
Meaning: "Jehochanan", the name of eight Israelites.
Usage: Jehohanan, Johanan. Compare "H3110".
Source: from "H3068" and "H2603"; Jehovah-favored;

3077.long:
Meaning: "Jehojada", the name of three Israelites.
Usage: Jehoiada. Compare "H3111".
Source: from "H3068" and "H3045"; Jehovah-known;

3078.long:
Meaning: "Jehojakin", a Jewish king.
Usage: Jehoiachin. Compare "H3112".
Source: from "H3068" and "H3559"; Jehovah will establish;

3079.long:
Meaning: "Jehojakim", a Jewish king.
Usage: Jehoiakim. Compare "H3113".
Source: from "H3068" abbreviated and "H6965"; "Jehovah will raise";

3080.long:
Meaning: "Jehojarib", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Jehoiarib. Compare "H3114".
Source: from "H3068" and "H7378"; Jehovah will contend;

3081.long:
Meaning: "Jehukal", an Israelite.
Usage: Jehucal. Compare "H3116".
Source: from "H3201"; potent;

3082.long:
Meaning: "Jehonadab", the name of an Israelite and of an Arab.
Usage: Jehonadab, Jonadab. Compare "H3122".
Source: from "H3068" and "H5068"; Jehovah-largessed;

3083.long:
Meaning: "Jehonathan", the name of four Israelites.
Usage: Jonathan. Compare "H3129".
Source: from "H3068" and "H5414"; Jehovah-given;

3084.long:
Meaning: "Jehoseph" (i.e. Joseph), a son of Jacob.
Usage: Joseph.
Source: a fuller form of "H3130";

3085.long:
Meaning: "Jehoaddah", an Israelite.
Usage: Jehoada.
Source: from "H3068" and "H5710"; Jehovah-adorned;

3086.long:
Meaning: "Jehoaddin" or "Jehoaddan", an Israelitess.
Usage: Jehoaddan.
Source: or "יְהוֹעַדָּן"; from "H3068" and "H5727"; Jehovahpleased;

3087.long:
Meaning: "Jehotsadak", an Israelite.
Usage: Jehozadek, Josedech. Compare "H3136".
Source: from "H3068" and "H6663"; Jehovah-righted;

3088.long:
Meaning: "Jehoram", the name of a Syrian and of three Israelites.
Usage: Jehoram, Joram. Compare "H3141".
Source: from "H3068" and "H7311"; Jehovah-raised;

3089.long:
Meaning: "Jehosheba", an Israelitess.
Usage: Jehosheba. Compare "H3090".
Source: from "H3068" and "H7650"; Jehovah-sworn;

3090.long:
Meaning: "Jehoshabath", an Israelitess.
Usage: Jehoshabeath.
Source: a form of "H3089";

3091.long:
Meaning: "Jehoshua" (i.e. Joshua), the Jewish leader.
Usage: Jehoshua, Jehoshuah, Joshua. Compare "H1954", "H3442".
Source: or "יְהוֹשֻׁעַ"; from "H3068" and "H3467"; "Jehovah-saved";

3092.long:
Meaning: "Jehoshaphat", the name of six Israelites; also of a valley near Jerusalem.
Usage: Jehoshaphat. Compare "H3146".
Source: from "H3068" and "H8199"; Jehovah-judged;

3093.long:
Meaning: "elated"; hence, "arrogant".
Usage: haughty, proud.
Source: probably from the same as "H2022";

3094.long:
Meaning: "Jehallelel", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Jehalellel, Jehalelel.
Source: from "H1984" and "H410"; praising God;

3095.long:
Meaning: a precious stone, probably "onyx".
Usage: diamond.
Source: from "H1986" (in the sense of "hardness");

3096.long:
Meaning: "Jahats" or "Jahtsah", a place East of the Jordan.
Usage: Jahaz, Jahazah, Jahzah.
Source: or "יַהְצָה"; or (feminine) "יַהְצָה"; from an unused root meaning to "stamp"; perhaps "threshing"-floor;

3097.long:
Meaning: "Joab", the name of three Israelites.
Usage: Joab.
Source: from "H3068" and "H1"; Jehovah-fathered;

3098.long:
Meaning: "Joach", the name of four Israelites.
Usage: Joah.
Source: from "H3068" and "H251"; "Jehovah-brothered";

3099.long:
Meaning: "Joachaz", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Jehoahaz, Joahaz.
Source: a form of "H3059";

3100.long:
Meaning: "Joel", the name of twelve Israelites.
Usage: Joel.
Source: from "H3068" and "H410"; Jehovah (is his) God;

3101.long:
Meaning: "Joash", the name of six Israelites.
Usage: Joash.
Source: or "יֹאָשׁ"; (2 Chronicles 24:1), a form of "H3060";

3102.long:
Meaning: "Job", an Israelite.
Usage: Job.
Source: perhaps a form of "H3103", but more probably by erroneous transcription for "H3437";

3103.long:
Meaning: "Jobab", the name of two Israelites and of three foreigners.
Usage: Jobab.
Source: from "H2980"; howler;

3104.long:
Meaning: the "blast" of a horn (from its "continuous" sound); specifically, the "signal" of the silver trumpets; hence, the instrument itself and the festival thus introduced.
Usage: jubile, ram's horn, trumpet.
Source: or "יֹבֵל"; apparently from "H2986";

3107.long:
Meaning: "Jozabad", the name of ten Israelites.
Usage: Josabad, Jozabad.
Source: a form of "H3075";

3108.long:
Meaning: "Jozacar", an Israelite.
Usage: Jozachar.
Source: from "H3068" and "H2142"; Jehovah-remembered;

3109.long:
Meaning: "Jocha", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Joha.
Source: probably from "H3068" and a variation of "H2421"; Jehovah-revived;

3110.long:
Meaning: "Jochanan", the name of nine Israelites.
Usage: Johanan.
Source: a form of "H3076";

3111.long:
Meaning: "Jojada", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Jehoiada, Joiada.
Source: a form of "H3077";

3112.long:
Meaning: "Jojakin", an Israelite king.
Usage: Jehoiachin.
Source: a form of "H3078";

3113.long:
Meaning: "Jojakim", an Israelite.
Usage: Joiakim. Compare "H3137".
Source: a form of "H3079";

3114.long:
Meaning: "Jojarib", the name of four Israelites.
Usage: Joiarib.
Source: a form of "H3080";

3115.long:
Meaning: "Jokebed", the mother of Moses.
Usage: Jochebed.
Source: from "H3068" contracted and "H3513"; Jehovah-gloried;

3116.long:
Meaning: "Jukal", an Israelite.
Usage: Jucal.
Source: a form of "H3081";

3117.long:
Meaning: a "day" (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb).
Usage: age, always, chronicals, continually(-ance), daily, ((birth-), each, to) day, (now a, two) days (agone), elder, × end, evening, (for) ever(-lasting, -more), × full, life, as (so) long as (... live), (even) now, old, outlived, perpetually, presently, remaineth, × required, season, × since, space, then, (process of) time, as at other times, in trouble, weather, (as) when, (a, the, within a) while (that), × whole ( age), (full) year(-ly), younger.
Source: from an unused root meaning to be hot;

3118.long:
Meaning: a "day".
Usage: day (by day), time.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H3117";

3120.long:
Meaning: "Javan", the name of a son of Joktan, and of the race (Ionians, i.e. Greeks) descended from him, with their territory; also of a place in Arabia.
Usage: Javan.
Source: probably from the same as "H3196"; effervescing (i.e. hot and active);

3121.long:
Meaning: properly, "dregs" (as effervescing); hence, "mud".
Usage: mire, miry.
Source: from the same as "H3196";

3122.long:
