Meaning: "Jonadab", the name of an Israelite and of a Rechabite.
Usage: Jonadab.
Source: a form of "H3082";

3123.long:
Meaning: a "dove" (apparently from the warmth of their mating).
Usage: dove, pigeon.
Source: probably from the same as "H3196";

3124.long:
Meaning: "Jonah", an Israelite.
Usage: Jonah.
Source: the same as "H3123";

3125.long:
Meaning: a "Jevanite", or descendant of Javan.
Usage: Grecian.
Source: patronymically from "H3121";

3126.long:
Meaning: a "sucker"; hence, a "twig" (of a tree felled and sprouting).
Usage: tender plant.
Source: active participle of "H3243";

3127.long:
Meaning: a "sprout".
Usage: (tender) branch, young twig.
Source: feminine of "H3126";

3128.long:
Meaning: "dove of" (the) "silence" (i.e. dumb Israel) "of" (i.e. among) "distances" (i.e. strangers); the title of a ditty (used for a name of its melody).
Usage: Jonath-elem-rechokim.
Source: from "H3123" and "H482" and the plural of "H7350";

3129.long:
Meaning: "Jonathan", the name of ten Israelites.
Usage: Jonathan.
Source: a form of "H3083";

3130.long:
Meaning: "Joseph", the name of seven Israelites.
Usage: Joseph. Compare "H3084".
Source: future of "H3254"; "let him add" (or perhaps simply active participle "adding");

3131.long:
Meaning: "Josiphjah", an Israelite.
Usage: Josiphiah.
Source: from active participle of "H3254" and "H3050"; Jah (is) adding;

3132.long:
Meaning: "Joelah", an Israelite.
Usage: Joelah.
Source: perhaps feminine active participle of "H3276"; furthermore;

3133.long:
Meaning: "Joed", an Israelite.
Usage: Joed.
Source: apparently the active participle of "H3259"; appointer;

3134.long:
Meaning: "Joezer", an Israelite.
Usage: Joezer.
Source: from "H3068" and "H5828"; Jehovah (is his) help;

3135.long:
Meaning: "Joash", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Joash.
Source: from "H3068" and "H5789"; Jehovahhastened;

3136.long:
Meaning: "Jotsadak", an Israelite.
Usage: Jozadak.
Source: a form of "H3087";

3137.long:
Meaning: "Jokim", an Israelite.
Usage: Jokim.
Source: a form of "H3113";

3138.long:
Meaning: "sprinkling"; hence, a "sprinkling" (or autumnal showers).
Usage: first rain, former (rain).
Source: active participle of "H3384";

3141.long:
Meaning: "Joram", the name of three Israelites and one Syrian.
Usage: Joram.
Source: a form of "H3088";

3142.long:
Meaning: "Jushab-Chesed", an Israelite.
Usage: Jushab-hesed.
Source: from "H7725" and "H2617"; "kindness will be returned";

3143.long:
Meaning: "Josibjah", an Israelite.
Usage: Josibiah.
Source: from "H3427" and "H3050"; Jehovah will cause to dwell;

3144.long:
Meaning: "Joshah", an Israelite.
Usage: Joshah.
Source: probably a form of "H3145";

3145.long:
Meaning: "Joshavjah", an Israelite.
Usage: Joshaviah. Compare "H3144".
Source: from "H3068" and "H7737"; Jehovah-set;

3146.long:
Meaning: "Joshaphat", an Israelite.
Usage: Joshaphat.
Source: a form of "H3092";

3147.long:
Meaning: "Jotham", the name of three Israelites.
Usage: Jotham.
Source: from "H3068" and "H8535"; Jehovah (is) perfect;

3148.long:
Meaning: properly, "redundant"; hence, "over and above", as adjective, noun, adverb or conjunction.
Usage: better, more(-over), over, profit.
Source: active participle of "H3498";

3149.long:
Meaning: "Jezavel", an Israelite.
Usage: Jeziel (from the margin).
Source: from an unused root (meaning to sprinkle) and "H410"; sprinkled of God;

3150.long:
Meaning: "Jizzijah", an Israelite.
Usage: Jeziah.
Source: from the same as the first part of "H3149" and "H3050"; "sprinkled of Jah";

3151.long:
Meaning: "Jaziz", an Israelite.
Usage: Jaziz.
Source: from the same as "H2123"; he will make prominent;

3152.long:
Meaning: "Jizliah", an Israelite.
Usage: Jezliah.
Source: perhaps from an unused root (meaning to draw up); he will draw out;

3153.long:
Meaning: "Jezanjah", an Israelite.
Usage: Jezaniah.
Source: or "יְזַנְיָהוּ"; probably for "H2970";

3154.long:
Meaning: "sweat", i.e. (by implication) a "sweating dress".
Usage: any thing that causeth sweat.
Source: from an unused root mean to ooze;

3155.long:
Meaning: a "Jizrach" (i.e. Ezrachite or Zarchite) or descendant of Zerach.
Usage: Izrahite.
Source: a variation for "H250";

3156.long:
Meaning: "Jizrachjah", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Izrahiah, Jezrahiah.
Source: from "H2224" and "H3050"; Jah will shine;

3157.long:
Meaning: "Jizreel", the name of two places in Palestine and of two Israelites.
Usage: Jezreel.
Source: from "H2232" and "H410"; God will sow;

3158.long:
Meaning: a "Jizreelite" or native of Jizreel.
Usage: Jezreelite.
Source: patronymically from "H3157";

3161.long:
Meaning: to "be" (or become) "one".
Usage: join, unite.
Source: a primitive root;

3162.long:
Meaning: properly, a "unit", i.e. (adverb) "unitedly".
Usage: alike, at all (once), both, likewise, only, (al-) together, withal.
Source: from "H3161";

3163.long:
Meaning: "Jachdo", an Israelite.
Usage: Jahdo.
Source: from "H3162" with pronominal suffix; his unity, i.e. (adverb) together;

3164.long:
Meaning: "Jachdiel", an Israelite.
Usage: Jahdiel.
Source: from "H3162" and "H410"; unity of God;

3165.long:
Meaning: "Jechdijah", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Jehdeiah.
Source: from "H3162" and "H3050"; unity of Jah;

3166.long:
Meaning: "Jachaziel", the name of five Israelites.
Usage: Jahaziel, Jahziel.
Source: from "H2372" and "H410"; beheld of God;

3167.long:
Meaning: "Jachzejah", an Israelite.
Usage: Jahaziah.
Source: from "H2372" and "H3050"; Jah will behold;

3168.long:
Meaning: "Jechezkel", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Ezekiel, Jehezekel.
Source: from "H2388" and "H410"; God will strengthen;

3169.long:
Meaning: "Jechizkijah", the name of five Israelites.
Usage: Hezekiah, Jehizkiah. Compare "H2396".
Source: or "יְחִזְקִיָּהוּ"; from "H3388" and "H3050"; strengthened of Jah;

3170.long:
Meaning: "Jachzerah", an Israelite.
Usage: Jahzerah.
Source: from the same as "H2386"; perhaps protection;

3171.long:
Meaning: "Jechiel" (or Jechavel), the name of eight Israelites.
Usage: Jehiel.
Source: or (2 Chronicles 29:14) "יְחַוְאֵל"; from "H2421" and "H410"; God will live;

3172.long:
Meaning: a "Jechielite" or descendant of Jechiel.
Usage: Jehieli.
Source: patronymically from "H3171";

3173.long:
Meaning: properly, "united", i.e. "sole"; by implication, "beloved"; also "lonely"; (feminine) the "life" (as not to be replaced).
Usage: darling, desolate, only (child, son), solitary.
Source: from "H3161";

3174.long:
Meaning: "Jechijah", an Israelite.
Usage: Jehiah.
Source: from "H2421" and "H3050"; Jah will live;

3176.long:
Meaning: to "wait"; by implication, to "be patient", "hope".
Usage: (cause to, have, make to) hope, be pained, stay, tarry, trust, wait.
Source: a primitive root;

3177.long:
Meaning: "Jachleel", an Israelite.
Usage: Jahleel.
Source: from "H3176" and "H410"; expectant of God;

3178.long:
Meaning: a "Jachleelite" or descendant of Jachleel.
Usage: Jahleelites.
Source: patronymically from "H3177";

3179.long:
Meaning: probably to "be hot"; figuratively, to "conceive".
Usage: get heat, be hot, conceive, be warm.
Source: a primitive root;

3180.long:
Meaning: a "kind of deer".
Usage: fallow deer.
Source: from "H2560";

3182.long:
Meaning: "unsandalled".
Usage: barefoot, being unshod.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "take off the shoes";

3183.long:
Meaning: "Jachtseel", an Israelite.
Usage: Jahzeel. Compare "H3185".
Source: from "H2673" and "H410"; God will allot;

3184.long:
Meaning: a "Jachtseelite" (collectively) or descendants of Jachtseel.
Usage: Jahzeelites.
Source: patronymically from "H3183";

3185.long:
Meaning: "Jachtsiel", an Israelite.
Usage: Jahziel. Compare "H3183".
Source: from "H2673" and "H410"; allotted of God;

3186.long:
Meaning: to "delay".
Usage: tarry longer.
Source: a primitive root;

3187.long:
Meaning: to "enroll" by pedigree.
Usage: (number after, number throughout the) genealogy (to be reckoned), be reckoned by genealogies.
Source: a primitive root; to "sprout"; used only as denominative from "H3188";

3188.long:
Meaning: a "pedigree" or "family list" (as growing spontaneously).
Usage: genealogy.
Source: from "H3187";

3189.long:
Meaning: "Jachath", the name of four Israelites.
Usage: Jahath.
Source: from "H3161"; unity;

3190.long:
Meaning: to "be" (causative) "make well", literally (sound, beautiful) or figuratively (happy, successful, right).
Usage: be accepted, amend, use aright, benefit, be (make) better, seem best, make cheerful, be comely, be content, diligent(-ly), dress, earnestly, find favour, give, be glad, do (be, make) good(-ness), be (make) merry, please ( well), shew more (kindness), skilfully, × very small, surely, make sweet, thoroughly, tire, trim, very, be (can, deal, entreat, go, have) well (said, seen).
Source: a primitive root;

3192.long:
Meaning: "Jotbah", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Jotbah.
Source: from "H3190"; "pleasantness";

3193.long:
Meaning: "Jotbathah", a place in the Desert.
Usage: Jotbath, Jotbathah.
Source: from "H3192";

3194.long:
Meaning: "Juttah" (or Jutah), a place in Palestine.
Usage: Juttah.
Source: or "יוּטָה"; from "H5186"; "extended";

3195.long:
Meaning: "Jetur", a son of Ishmael.
Usage: Jetur.
Source: probably from the same as "H2905"; encircled (i.e. inclosed);

3196.long:
Meaning: "wine" (as fermented); by implication, "intoxication".
Usage: banqueting, wine, wine(-bibber).
Source: from an unused root meaning to effervesce;

3197.long:
Meaning: "a hand" or "side".
Usage: (way-) side.
Source: by erroneous transcription for "H3027";

3198.long:
Meaning: to "be right" (i.e. correct); reciprocal, to "argue"; causatively, to "decide", "justify" or "convict".
Usage: appoint, argue, chasten, convince, correct(-ion), daysman, dispute, judge, maintain, plead, reason (together), rebuke, reprove(-r), surely, in any wise.
Source: a primitive root;

3199.long:
Meaning: "Jakin", the name of three Israelites and of a temple pillar.
Usage: Jachin.
Source: from "H3559"; he (or it) will establish;

3200.long:
Meaning: a "Jakinite" (collectively) or descendants of Jakin.
Usage: Jachinites.
Source: patronymically from "H3199";

3201.long:
Meaning: to "be able", literally ("can", "could") or morally ("may", "might").
Usage: be able, any at all (ways), attain, can (away with, (-not)), could, endure, might, overcome, have power, prevail, still, suffer.
Source: or (fuller) "יָכוֹל"; a primitive root;

3202.long:
Usage: be able, can, couldest, prevail.
Source: (Aramaic) or "יְכִיל"; (Aramaic), to "H3201"

3203.long:
Meaning: "Jekoljah" or "Jekiljah", an Israelitess.
Usage: Jecholiah, Jecoliah.
Source: and "יְכׇלְיָהוּ"; or (2 Chronicles 26:3) "יְכִילְיָה"; from "H3201" and "H3050"; Jah will enable;

3204.long:
Meaning: "Jekonjah", a Jewish king.
Usage: Jeconiah. Compare "H3659".
Source: and "יְכׇנְיָהוּ"; or (Jeremiah 27:20) "יְכוֹנְיָה"; from "H3559" and "H3050"; "Jah will establish";

3205.long:
Meaning: to "bear young"; causatively, to "beget"; medically, to "act as midwife"; specifically, to "show lineage".
Usage: bear, beget, birth(-day), born, (make to) bring forth (children, young), bring up, calve, child, come, be delivered (of a child), time of delivery, gender, hatch, labour, (do the office of a) midwife, declare pedigrees, be the son of, (woman in, woman that) travail(-eth, -ing woman).
Source: a primitive root;

3206.long:
Meaning: "something born", i.e. a "lad" or "offspring".
Usage: boy, child, fruit, son, young man (one).
Source: from "H3205";

3212.long:
Meaning: to "walk" (literally or figuratively); causatively, to "carry" (in various senses).
Usage: × again, away, bear, bring, carry (away), come (away), depart, flow, follow(-ing), get (away, hence, him), (cause to, made) go (away, -ing, -ne, one's way, out), grow, lead (forth), let down, march, prosper, pursue, cause to run, spread, take away (-journey), vanish, (cause to) walk(-ing), wax, × be weak.
Source: a primitive root (compare "H1980");

3213.long:
Meaning: to "howl" (with a wailing tone) or "yell" (with a boisterous one).
Usage: (make to) howl, be howling.
Source: a primitive root;

3216.long:
Meaning: to "blurt" or utter inconsiderately.
Usage: devour.
Source: a primitive root;

3217.long:
Meaning: "scurf" or "tetter".
Usage: scabbed.
Source: from an unused root apparently meaning to stick or scrape;

3218.long:
Meaning: a "devourer"; specifically, the "young locust".
Usage: cankerworm, caterpillar.
Source: from an unused root meaning to lick up;

3219.long:
Meaning: a "travelling pouch" (as if for gleanings).
Usage: scrip.
Source: from "H3950";

3220.long:
Meaning: a "sea" (as breaking in noisy surf) or "large body of water"; specifically (with the article), the "Mediterranean Sea"; sometimes a "large river", or an "artifical basin"; locally, the "west", or (rarely) the "south".
Usage: sea (× -faring man, (-shore)), south, west (-ern, side, -ward).
Source: from an unused root meaning to roar;

3222.long:
Meaning: a "warm spring".
Usage: mule.
Source: from the same as "H3117";

3223.long:
Meaning: "Jemuel", an Israelite.
Usage: Jemuel.
Source: from "H3117" and "H410"; "day of God";

3224.long:
Meaning: "Jemimah", one of Job's daughters.
Usage: Jemimah.
Source: perhaps from the same as "H3117"; properly, warm, i.e. affectionate; hence, dove (compare "H3123");

3225.long:
Meaning: the "right" hand or side (leg, eye) of a person or other object (as the "stronger" and more dexterous); locally, the "south".
Usage: left-handed, right (hand, side), south.
Source: from "H3231";

3226.long:
Meaning: "Jamin", the name of three Israelites.
Usage: Jamin. See also "H1144".
Source: the same as "H3225";

3228.long:
Meaning: a "Jeminite" (collectively) or descendants of Jamin.
Usage: Jaminites. See also "H1145".
Source: patronymically from "H3226";

3229.long:
Meaning: "Jimla" or "Jimlah", an Israelite.
Usage: Imla, Imlah.
Source: or "יִמְלָה"; from "H4390"; "full";

3230.long:
Meaning: "Jamlek", an Israelite.
Usage: Jamlech.
Source: from "H4427"; he will make king;

3231.long:
Meaning: to "be right-handed" or "take the right-hand" side.
Usage: go (turn) to (on, use) the right hand.
Source: a primitive root; to "be" (physically) "right" (i.e. firm); but used only as denominative from "H3225" and transitive,

3232.long:
Meaning: "Jimnah", the name of two Israelites; also (with the article) of the posterity of one of them.
Usage: Imna, Imnah, Jimnah, Jimnites.
Source: from "H3231"; "prosperity" (as betokened by the right hand);

3233.long:
Meaning: "right" (i.e. at the right hand).
Usage: (on the) right (hand).
Source: from "H3231";

3234.long:
Meaning: "Jimna", an Israelite.
Usage: Imna.
Source: from "H4513"; "he will restrain";

3235.long:
Meaning: to "exchange"; by implication, to "change places".
Usage: boast selves, change.
Source: a primitive root;

3238.long:
Meaning: to "rage" or "be violent"; by implication, to "suppress", to "maltreat".
Usage: destroy, (thrust out by) oppress(-ing, -ion, -or), proud, vex, do violence.
Source: a primitive root;

3239.long:
Meaning: "Janoach", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Janoah, Janohah.
Source: from "H3240"; "quiet";

3240.long:
Meaning: to "deposit"; by implication, to "allow to stay".
Usage: bestow, cast down, lay (down, up), leave (off), let alone (remain), pacify, place, put, set (down), suffer, withdraw, withhold. (The Hiphil forms with the dagesh are here referred to, in accordance with the older grammarians; but if any distinction of the kind is to be made, these should rather be referred to "H5117", and the others here.).
Source: a primitive root;

3241.long:
Meaning: "Janim", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Janum (from the margin).
Source: from "H5123"; "asleep";

3243.long:
Meaning: to "suck"; causatively, to "give milk".
Usage: milch, nurse(-ing mother), (give, make to) suck(-ing child, -ling).
Source: a primitive root;

3244.long:
Meaning: an "unclean" (acquatic) "bird"; probably the "heron" (perhaps from its blowing cry, or because the nightheron is meant).
Usage: (great) owl.s.
Source: or "יַנְשׁוֹף"; apparently from "H5398"; (compare "H5399")

3245.long:
Meaning: to "set" (literally or figuratively); intensively, to "found"; reflexively, to "sit" down together, i.e. "settle", "consult".
Usage: appoint, take counsel, establish, (lay the, lay for a) found(-ation), instruct, lay, ordain, set, × sure.
Source: a primitive root;

3247.long:
Meaning: a "foundation" (literally or figuratively).
Usage: bottom, foundation, repairing.
Source: from "H3245";

3251.long:
Meaning: to "pour" (intransitive).
Usage: be poured.
Source: a primitive root;

3252.long:
Meaning: "Jiskah", sister of Lot.
Usage: Iscah.
Source: from an unused root meaning to watch; observant;

3253.long:
Meaning: "Jismakjah", an Israelite.
Usage: Ismachiah.
Source: from "H5564" and "H3050"; "Jah will sustain";

3254.long:
Meaning: to "add" or "augment" (often adverbial, to "continue" to do a thing).
Usage: add, × again, × any more, × cease, × come more, conceive again, continue, exceed, × further, × gather together, get more, give more-over, × henceforth, increase (more and more), join, × longer (bring, do, make, much, put), × (the, much, yet) more (and more), proceed (further), prolong, put, be (strong-) er, × yet, yield.
Source: a primitive root;

3256.long:
Meaning: to "chastise", literally (with blows) or figuratively (with words); hence, to "instruct".
Usage: bind, chasten, chastise, correct, instruct, punish, reform, reprove, sore, teach.
Source: a primitive root;

3258.long:
Meaning: "Jabets", the name of an Israelite, and also of a place in Palestine.
Usage: Jabez.
Source: from an unused root probably meaning to "grieve"; "sorrowful";

3259.long:
Meaning: to "fix" upon (by agreement or appointment); by implication, to "meet" (at a stated time), to "summon" (to trial), to "direct" (in a certain quarter or position), to "engage" (for marriage).
Usage: agree,(maxke an) appoint(-ment, a time), assemble (selves), betroth, gather (selves, together), meet (together), set (a time).
Source: a primitive root;

3260.long:
Meaning: "Jedi", an Israelite.
Usage: Iddo (from the margin) See "H3035".
Source: from "H3259"; appointed;

3261.long:
Meaning: to "brush" aside.
Usage: sweep away.
Source: a primitive root; apparently

3262.long:
Meaning: "Jeuel", the name of four Israelites.
Usage: Jehiel, Jeiel, Jeuel. Compare "H3273".
Source: from "H3261" and "H410"; carried away of God;

3265.long:
Meaning: "Jaur", an Israelite.
Usage: Jair(from the margin).
Source: apparently the passive participle of the same as "H3293"; "wooded";

3266.long:
Meaning: "Jeush", the name of an Edomite and of four Israelites.
Usage: Jehush, Jeush. Compare "H3274".
Source: from "H5789"; "hasty";

3267.long:
Meaning: to be "bold" or "obstinate".
Usage: fierce.
Source: a primitive root;

3268.long:
Meaning: "Jaaziel", an Israelite.
Usage: Jaaziel.
Source: from "H3267" and "H410"; "emboldened of God";

3269.long:
Meaning: "Jaazijah", an Israelite.
Usage: Jaaziah.
Source: from "H3267" and "H3050"; "emboldened of Jah";

3270.long:
Meaning: "Jaazer" or "Jazer", a place East of the Jordan.
Usage: Jaazer, Jazer.
Source: or "יַעְזֵר"; from "H5826"; "helpful";

3272.long:
Meaning: to "counsel"; reflexively, to "consult".
Usage: counsellor, consult together.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H3289";

3273.long:
Meaning: "Jeiel", the name of six Israelites.
Usage: Jeiel, Jehiel. Compare "H3262".
Source: from "H3261" and "H410"; carried away of God;

3274.long:
Meaning: "Jeish", the name of an Edomite and of a an Israelite.
Usage: Jeush (from the margin). Compare "H3266".
Source: from "H5789"; hasty;

3275.long:
Meaning: "Jakan", an Israelite.
Usage: Jachan.
Source: from the same as "H5912"; "troublesome";

3276.long:
Meaning: properly, to "ascend"; figuratively, to "be valuable" (objectively; "useful", subjectively; "benefited").
Usage: × at all, set forward, can do good, (be, have) profit, (able).
Source: a primitive root;

3278.long:
Meaning: "Jael", a Canaanite.
Usage: Jael.
Source: the same as "H3277";

3279.long:
Meaning: "Jaala" or "Jaalah", one of the Nethinim.
Usage: Jaala, Jaalah.
Source: or "יַעֲלָה"; the same as "H3280" or direct from "H3276";

3282.long:
Meaning: properly, "heed"; by implication, "purpose" (sake or account); used adverbially to indicate the "reason" or "cause".
Usage: because (that), forasmuch ( as), seeing then, that, whereas, why.
Source: from an unused root meaning to pay attention;

3283.long:
Meaning: the "ostrich" (probably from its answering cry.
Usage: ostrich.
Source: from the same as "H3282";

3284.long:
Usage: owl.
Source: feminine of "H3283", and meaning the same

3285.long:
Meaning: "Jaanai", an Israelite.
Usage: Jaanai.
Source: from the same as "H3283"; responsive;

3286.long:
Meaning: to "tire" (as if from wearisome "flight").
Usage: faint, cause to fly, (be) weary (self).
Source: a primitive root;

3289.long:
Meaning: to "advise"; reflexively, to "deliberate" or "resolve".
Usage: advertise, take advise, advise (well), consult, (give, take) counsel(-lor), determine, devise, guide, purpose.
Source: a primitive root;

3290.long:
Meaning: "Jaakob", the Israelitish patriarch.
Usage: Jacob.
Source: from "H6117"; heel-catcher (i.e. supplanter);

3292.long:
Meaning: "Jaakan", an Idumaean.
Usage: Jaakan. Compare "H1142".
Source: from the same as "H6130";

3293.long:
Meaning: a "copse of bushes"; hence, a "forest"; hence, "honey in the comb" (as hived in trees).
Usage: (honey-) comb, forest, wood.
Source: from an unused root probably meaning to thicken with verdure;

3294.long:
Meaning: "Jarah", an Israelite.
Usage: Jarah.
Source: a form of "H3295";

3295.long:
Usage: (honey-) comb, forest.
Source: feminine of "H3293", and meaning the same

3296.long:
Meaning: "Jaare-Oregim", an Israelite.
Usage: Jaare-oregim.
Source: from the plural of "H3293" and the masculine plural active participle of "H707"; woods of weavers;

3297.long:
Meaning: "Jearim", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Jearim. Compare "H7157".
Source: plural of "H3293"; forests;

3298.long:
Meaning: "Jaareshjah", an Israelite.
Usage: Jaresiah.
Source: from an unused root of uncertain signification and "H3050";

3299.long:
Meaning: "Jaasu", an Israelite.
Usage: Jaasau.
Source: from "H6213"; "they will do";

3300.long:
Meaning: "Jaasiel", an Israelite.
Usage: Jaasiel, Jasiel.
Source: from "H6213" and "H410"; "made of God";

3301.long:
Meaning: "Jiphdejah", an Israelite.
Usage: Iphedeiah.
Source: from "H6299" and "H3050"; "Jah will liberate";

3302.long:
Meaning: properly, to "be bright", i.e. (by implication) "beautiful".
Usage: be beautiful, be (make self) fair(-r), deck.
Source: a primitive root;

3303.long:
Meaning: "beautiful" (literally or figuratively).
Usage: beautiful, beauty, comely, fair(-est, one), goodly, pleasant, well.
Source: from "H3302";

3304.long:
Meaning: "very beautiful".
Usage: very fair.
Source: from "H3302" by reduplication;

3305.long:
Meaning: "Japho", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Japha, Joppa.
Source: or "יָפוֹא"; (Ezra 3:7), from "H3302"; beautiful;

3306.long:
Meaning: properly, to "breathe hard", i.e. (by implication) to "sigh".
Usage: bewail self.
Source: a primitive root;

3307.long:
Meaning: properly, "puffing", i.e. (figuratively) "meditating".
Usage: such as breathe out.
Source: from "H3306";

3309.long:
Meaning: "Japhia", the name of a Canaanite, an Israelite, and a place in Palestine.
Usage: Japhia.
Source: from "H3313"; bright;

3310.long:
Meaning: "Japhlet", an Israelite.
Usage: Japhlet.
Source: from "H6403"; "he will deliver";

3311.long:
Meaning: a "Japhletite" or descendant of Japhlet.
Usage: Japhleti.
Source: patronymically from "H3310";

3312.long:
Meaning: "Jephunneh", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Jephunneh.
Source: from "H6437"; he will be prepared;

3313.long:
Meaning: to "shine".
Usage: be light, shew self, (cause to) shine (forth).
Source: a primitive root;

3315.long:
Meaning: "Jepheth", a son of Noah; also his posterity.
Usage: Japheth.
Source: from "H6601"; "expansion";

3316.long:
Meaning: "Jiphtach", an Israelite; also a place in Palestine.
Usage: Jephthah, Jiphtah.
Source: from "H6605"; "he will open";

3317.long:
Meaning: "Jiphtach-el", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Jiphthah-el.
Source: from "H6605" and "H410"; "God will open";

3318.long:
Meaning: to "go" (causatively, "bring") "out", in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively, direct and proxim.
Usage: × after, appear, × assuredly, bear out, × begotten, break out, bring forth (out, up), carry out, come (abroad, out, thereat, without), be condemned, depart(-ing, -ure), draw forth, in the end, escape, exact, fail, fall (out), fetch forth (out), get away (forth, hence, out), (able to, cause to, let) go abroad (forth, on, out), going out, grow, have forth (out), issue out, lay (lie) out, lead out, pluck out, proceed, pull out, put away, be risen, × scarce, send with commandment, shoot forth, spread, spring out, stand out, × still, × surely, take forth (out), at any time, × to (and fro), utter.
Source: a primitive root;

3320.long:
Meaning: to "place" (any thing so as to stay); reflexively, to "station", "offer", "continue".
Usage: present selves, remaining, resort, set (selves), (be able to, can, with-) stand (fast, forth, -ing, still, up).
Source: a primitive root;

3321.long:
Meaning: to "be firm"; hence, to "speak surely".
Usage: truth.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H3320";

3322.long:
Meaning: to "place" permanently.
Usage: establish, leave, make, present, put, set, stay.
Source: a primitive root;

3323.long:
Meaning: "oil" (as producing light); figuratively, "anointing".
Usage: anointed oil.
Source: from "H6671";

3324.long:
Meaning: "Jitshar", an Israelite.
Usage: Izhar.
Source: the same as "H3323";

3325.long:
Meaning: a "Jitsharite" or descendant of Jitshar.
Usage: Izeharites, Izharites.
Source: patronymically from "H3324";

3326.long:
Meaning: "spread", i.e. a "bed"; (architecture) an "extension", i.e. "wing" or "lean-to" (a single story or collectively).
Usage: bed, chamber, couch.
Source: passive participle of "H3331";

3327.long:
Meaning: "Jitschak" (or Isaac), son of Abraham.
Usage: Isaac. Compare "H3446".
Source: from "H6711"; laughter (i.e. mochery);

3328.long:
Meaning: "Jitschar", an Israelite.
Usage: and Zehoar (from the margin).
Source: from the same as "H6713"; he will shine;

3329.long:
Meaning: "issue", i.e. "offspring".
Usage: those that came forth.
Source: from "H3318";

3331.long:
Meaning: to "strew" as a surface.
Usage: make (one's) bed, × lie, spread.
Source: a primitive root;

3332.long:
Meaning: properly, to "pour out" (transitive or intransitive); by implication, to "melt" or "cast as metal"; by extension, to "place firmly", to "stiffen" or "grow hard".
Usage: cast, cleave fast, be (as) firm, grow, be hard, lay out, molten, overflow, pour (out), run out, set down, stedfast.
Source: a primitive root;

3333.long:
Meaning: "poured out", i.e. "run into a mould".
Usage: when it was cast.
Source: passive participle feminine of "H3332";

3334.long:
Meaning: to "press" (intransitive), i.e. "be narrow"; figuratively, "be in distress".
Usage: be distressed, be narrow, be straitened (in straits), be vexed.
Source: a primitive root;

3335.long:
Meaning: to "mould" into a form; especially as a "potter"; figuratively, to "determine" (i.e. form a resolution).
Usage: × earthen, fashion, form, frame, make(-r), potter, purpose.
Source: probably identical with "H3334" (through the squeezing into shape); (compare "H3331");

3336.long:
Meaning: a "form"; figuratively, "conception" (i.e. purpose).
Usage: frame, thing framed, imagination, mind, work.
Source: from "H3335";

3337.long:
Meaning: "Jetser", an Israelite.
Usage: Jezer.
Source: the same as "H3336";

3338.long:
Meaning: "structure", i.e. "limb" or "part".
Usage: member.ql.
Source: passive participle of "H3335";

3340.long:
Meaning: a "Jitsrite" (collectively) or descendants of Jetser.
Usage: Jezerites.
Source: ; patronymically from "H3337";

3341.long:
Meaning: to "burn" or "set on fire"; figuratively, to "desolate".
Usage: burn (up), be desolate, set (on) fire (fire), kindle.
Source: a primitive root;

3342.long:
Meaning: a "trough" (as dug out); specifically, a wine-"vat" (whether the lower one, into which the juice drains; or the upper, in which the grapes are crushed).
Usage: fats, presses, press-fat, wine(-press).
Source: from an unused root meaning to "excavate";

3343.long:
Meaning: "Jekabtseel", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Jekabzeel. Compare "H6909".
Source: from "H6908" and "H410"; "God will gather";

3344.long:
Meaning: to "burn".
Usage: (be) burn(-ing), × from the hearth, kindle.
Source: a primitive root;

3347.long:
Meaning: "Jokdeam", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Jokdeam.
Source: from "H3344" and "H5971"; burning of (the) people;

3348.long:
Meaning: "Jakeh", a symbolical name (for Solomon).
Usage: Jakeh.
Source: from an unused root probably meaning to obey; obedient;

3349.long:
Meaning: "obedience".
Usage: gathering, to obey.
Source: from the same as "H3348";

3351.long:
Meaning: properly, "standing" (extant), i.e. by implication, a "living thing".
Usage: (living) substance.
Source: from "H6965";

3353.long:
Meaning: properly, "entangled", i.e. by implication (intransitively) a "snare", or (transitive) a "snarer".
Usage: fowler, snare.
Source: passive participle of "H3369";

3354.long:
Meaning: "Jekuthiel", an Israelite.
Usage: Jekuthiel.
Source: from the same as "H3348" and "H410"; obedience of God;

3355.long:
Meaning: "Joktan", an Arabian patriarch.
Usage: Joktan.
Source: from "H6994"; he will be made little;

3356.long:
Meaning: "Jakim", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Jakim. Compare "H3079".
Source: from "H6965"; "he will raise";

3359.long:
Meaning: "Jekamjah", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Jekamiah. Compare "H3079".
Source: from "H6965" and "H3050"; "Jah will rise";

3360.long:
Meaning: "Jekamam", an Israelite.
Usage: Jekameam. Compare "H3079", "H3361".
Source: from "H6965" and "H5971"; (the) "people will rise";

3361.long:
Meaning: "Jokmeam", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Jokmeam. Compare "H3360", "H3362".
Source: from "H6965" and "H5971"; (the) "people will be raised";

3362.long:
Meaning: "Jokneam", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Jokneam.
Source: from "H6969" and "H5971"; (the) people will be lamented;

3363.long:
Meaning: properly, to "sever" oneself, i.e. (by implication) to "be dislocated"; figuratively, to "abandon"; causatively, to "impale" (and thus allow to drop to pieces by rotting).
Usage: be alienated, depart, hang (up), be out of joint.
Source: a primitive root;

3365.long:
Meaning: properly, apparently, to "be heavy", i.e. (figuratively) "valuable"; causatively, to "make rare" (figuratively, to "inhibit").
Usage: be (make) precious, be prized, be set by, withdraw.
Source: a primitive root;

3366.long:
Meaning: "value", i.e. (concretely) "wealth"; abstractly, "costliness", "dignity".
Usage: honour, precious (things), price.
Source: from "H3365";

3368.long:
Meaning: "valuable" (objectively or subjectively).
Usage: brightness, clear, costly, excellent, fat, honourable women, precious, reputation.
Source: from "H3365";

3369.long:
Meaning: to "ensnare" (literally or figuratively).
Usage: fowler (lay a) snare.
Source: a primitive root;

3370.long:
Meaning: "Jokshan", an Arabian patriarch.
Usage: Jokshan.
Source: from "H3369"; insidious;

3371.long:
Meaning: "Joktheel", the name of a place in Palestine, and of one in Idumaea.
Usage: Joktheel.
Source: probably from the same as "H3348" and "H410"; veneration of God (compare "H3354");

3372.long:
Meaning: to "fear"; morally to "revere"; causatively to "frighten".
Usage: affright, be (make) afraid, dread(-ful), (put in) fear(-ful, -fully, -ing), (be had in) reverence(-end), × see, terrible (act, -ness, thing).
Source: a primitive root;

3374.long:
Meaning: "fear" (also used as infinitive); morally, "reverence".
Usage: × dreadful, × exceedingly, fear(-fulness).
Source: feminine of "H3373";

3375.long:
Meaning: "Jiron", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Iron.
Source: from "H3372"; fearfulness;

3376.long:
Meaning: "Jirijah", an Israelite.
Usage: Irijah.
Source: from "H3373" and "H3050"; "fearful of Jah";

3377.long:
Meaning: "Jareb", a symbolical name for Assyria.
Usage: Jareb. Compare "H3402".
Source: from "H7378"; "he will contend";

3378.long:
Meaning: "Jerubbaal", a symbolic name of Gideon.
Usage: Jerubbaal.
Source: from "H7378" and "H1168"; Baal will contend;

3379.long:
Meaning: "Jarobam", the name of two Israelite kings.
Usage: Jeroboam.
Source: from "H7378" and "H5971"; (the) "people will contend";

3380.long:
Meaning: "Jerubbesheth", a symbolic name for Gideon.
Usage: Jerubbesheth.
Source: from "H7378" and "H1322"; shame (i.e. the idol) will contend;

3381.long:
Meaning: to "descend" (literally, to "go downwards"; or conventionally to a lower region, as the shore, a boundary, the enemy, etc.; or figuratively, to "fall"); causatively, to "bring down" (in all the above applications).
Usage: × abundantly, bring down, carry down, cast down, (cause to) come(-ing) down, fall (down), get down, go(-ing) down(-ward), hang down, × indeed, let down, light (down), put down (off), (cause to, let) run down, sink, subdue, take down.
Source: a primitive root;

3382.long:
Meaning: "Jered", the name of an antediluvian, and of an Israelite.
Usage: Jared.
Source: from "H3381"; a descent;

3383.long:
Meaning: "Jarden", the principal river of Palestine.
Usage: Jordan.
Source: from "H3381"; a descender;

3384.long:
Meaning: properly, to "flow" as water (i.e. to rain); transitively, to "lay" or "throw" (especially an arrow, i.e. to "shoot"); figuratively, to "point" out (as if by "aiming" the finger), to "teach".
Usage: ( ) archer, cast, direct, inform, instruct, lay, shew, shoot, teach(-er,-ing), through.
Source: or (2 Chronicles 26:15) "יָרָא"; a primitive root;

3385.long:
Meaning: "Jeruel", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Jeruel.
Source: from "H3384" and "H410"; founded of God;

3386.long:
Meaning: "Jaroach", an Israelite.
Usage: Jaroah.
Source: perhaps denominative from "H3394"; (born at the) new moon;

3388.long:
Meaning: "Jerusha" or "Jerushah", as Israelitess.
Usage: Jerusha, Jerushah.
Source: or "יְרוּשָׁה" feminine passive participle of "H3423"; possessed;

3389.long:
Meaning: "Jerushalaim" or "Jerushalem", the capital city of Palestine.
Usage: Jerusalem.
Source: rarely "יְרוּשָׁלַיִם"; a dual (in allusion to its two main hills (the true pointing, at least of the former reading, seems to be that of "H3390")); probably from (the passive participle of) "H3384" and "H7999"; "founded peaceful";

3391.long:
Meaning: a "lunation", i.e. "month".
Usage: month, moon.
Source: from a unused root of uncertain signification;

3392.long:
Meaning: "Jerach", an Arabian patriarch.
Usage: Jerah.
Source: the same as "H3391";

3394.long:
Meaning: the "moon".
Usage: moon. Yrechow. See "H3405".
Source: from the same as "H3391";

3395.long:
Meaning: "Jerocham", the name of seven or eight Israelites.
Usage: Jeroham.
Source: from "H7355"; "compassionate";

3396.long:
Meaning: "Jerachmeel", the name of three Israelites.
Usage: Jerahmeel.
Source: from "H7355" and "H410"; "God will compassionate";

3397.long:
Meaning: a "Jerachmeelite" or descendant of Jerachmeel.
Usage: Jerahmeelites.
Source: patronymically from "H3396";

3398.long:
Meaning: "Jarcha", an Egyptian.
Usage: Jarha.
Source: probably of Egyptian origin;

3399.long:
Meaning: to "precipitate" or "hurl" ("rush") headlong; (intransitively) to "be rash".
Usage: be perverse, turn over.
Source: a primitive root;

3400.long:
Meaning: "Jeriel", an Israelite.
Usage: Jeriel. Compare "H3385".
Source: from "H3384" and "H410"; thrown of God;

3401.long:
Meaning: literally "he will contend"; properly, adjective "contentious"; used as noun, an "adversary".
Usage: that content(-eth), that strive.
Source: from "H7378";

3402.long:
Meaning: "Jarib", the name of three Israelites.
Usage: Jarib.
Source: the same as "H3401";

3404.long:
Meaning: "Jerijah", an Israelite.
Usage: Jeriah, Jerijah.
Source: or "יְרִיָּהוּ"; from "H3384" and "H3050"; Jah will throw;

3405.long:
Meaning: "Jericho" or "Jerecho", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Jericho.
Source: or "יְרֵחוֹ"; or variation (1 Kings 16:34) "יְרִיחֹה"; perhaps from "H3394"; its month; or else from "H7306"; "fragrant";

3406.long:
Meaning: "Jerimoth" or "Jeremoth", the name of twelve Israelites.
Usage: Jermoth, Jerimoth, and Ramoth (from the margin).
Source: or "יְרֵימוֹת"; or "יְרֵמוֹת"; feminine plural from "H7311"; elevations;

3409.long:
Meaning: the "thigh" (from its fleshy softness); by euphemistically the "generative parts"; figuratively, a "shank", "flank", "side".
Usage: × body, loins, shaft, side, thigh.
Source: from an unused root meaning to be soft;

3411.long:
Meaning: properly, the "flank"; but used only figuratively, the "rear" or "recess".
Usage: border, coast, part, quarter, side.
Source: feminine of "H3409";

3412.long:
Meaning: "Jarmuth", the name of two places in Palestine.
Usage: Jarmuth.
Source: from "H7311"; elevation;

3414.long:
Meaning: "Jirmejah", the name of eight or nine Israelites.
Usage: Jeremiah.
Source: or "יִרְמְיָהוּ"; from "H7311" and "H3050"; "Jah will rise";

3415.long:
Meaning: properly, to "be broken" up (with any violent action) i.e. (figuratively) to "fear".
Usage: be grevious (only Isaiah 15:4; the rest belong to "H7489").
Source: a primitive root;

3416.long:
Meaning: "Jirpeel", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Irpeel.
Source: from "H7495" and "H410"; "God will heal";

3417.long:
Meaning: to "spit".
Usage: × but, spit.
Source: a primitive root;

3418.long:
Meaning: properly, "pallor", i.e. hence, the "yellowish green" of young and sickly vegetation; concretely, "verdure", i.e. "grass" or "vegetation".
Usage: grass, green (thing).
Source: from "H3417" (in the sense of vacuity of color);

3419.long:
Meaning: properly, "green"; concretely, a "vegetable".
Usage: green, herbs.
Source: from the same as "H3418";

3420.long:
Meaning: "paleness", whether of persons (from fright), or of plants (from drought).
Usage: greenish, yellow.
Source: from "H3418";

3421.long:
Meaning: "Jorkeam", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Jorkeam.
Source: from "H7324" and "H5971"; people will be poured forth;

3422.long:
Meaning: "yellowishness".
Usage: greenish, yellow.
Source: from the same as "H3418";

3423.long:
Meaning: to "occupy" (by "driving" out previous tenants, and "possessing" in their place); by implication, to "seize", to "rob", to "inherit"; also to "expel", to "impoverish", to "ruin".
Usage: cast out, consume, destroy, disinherit, dispossess, drive(-ing) out, enjoy, expel, × without fail, (give to, leave for) inherit(-ance, -or) magistrate, be (make) poor, come to poverty, (give to, make to) possess, get (have) in (take) possession, seize upon, succeed, × utterly.
Source: or "יָרֵשׁ"; a primitive root;

3425.long:
Meaning: something "occupied"; a "conquest"; also a "patrimony".
Usage: heritage, inheritance, possession.
Source: from "H3423";

3426.long:
Meaning: there "is" or "are" (or any other form of the verb to "be", as may suit the connection).
Usage: (there) are, (he, it, shall, there, there may, there shall, there should) be, thou do, had, hast, (which) hath, (I, shalt, that) have, (he, it, there) is, substance, it (there) was, (there) were, ye will, thou wilt, wouldest.
Source: perhaps from an unused root meaning to "stand out", or "exist"; "entity"; used adverbially or as a copula for the substantive verb ("H1961");

3427.long:
Meaning: properly, to "sit" down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to "dwell", to "remain"; causatively, to "settle", to "marry".
Usage: (make to) abide(-ing), continue, (cause to, make to) dwell(-ing), ease self, endure, establish, × fail, habitation, haunt, (make to) inhabit(-ant), make to keep (house), lurking, × marry(-ing), (bring again to) place, remain, return, seat, set(-tle), (down-) sit(-down, still, -ting down, -ting (place) -uate), take, tarry.
Source: a primitive root;

3428.long:
Meaning: "Jeshebab", an Israelite.
Usage: Jeshebeab.
Source: from "H3427" and "H1"; seat of (his) father;

3429.long:
Meaning: "Joshebbash-Shebeth", an Israelite.
Usage: that sat in the seat.
Source: from the active participle of "H3427" and "H7674", with a preposition and the article interposed; sitting in the seat;

3430.long:
Meaning: "Jishbo-be-Nob", a Philistine.
Usage: Ishbi-benob (from the margin).
Source: from "H3427" and "H5011", with a pronominal suffix and a preposition interposed; his dwelling (is) in Nob;

3431.long:
Meaning: "Jishbach", an Israelite.
Usage: Ishbah.
Source: from "H7623"; "he will praise";

3432.long:
Meaning: a "Jashubite", or descendant of Jashub.
Usage: Jashubites.
Source: patronymically from "H3437";

3433.long:
Meaning: "Jashubi-Lechem", an Israelite.
Usage: Jashubi-lehem. (Prob. the text should be pointed "יֹשְׁבֵי לֶחֶם" and rendered '(they were) inhabitants of Lechem,' i.e. of Bethlehem (by contraction). Compare "H3902").
Source: from "H7725" and "H3899"; returner of bread;

3434.long:
Meaning: "Jashobam", the name of two or three Israelites.
Usage: Jashobeam.
Source: from "H7725" and "H5971"; "people will return";

3435.long:
Meaning: "Jishbak", a son of Abraham.
Usage: Ishbak.
Source: from an unused root corresponding to "H7662"; "he will leave";

3436.long:
Meaning: "Joshbekashah", an Israelite.
Usage: Joshbekashah.
Source: from "H3427" and "H7186"; a hard seat;

3437.long:
Meaning: "Jashub", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Jashub.
Source: or "יָשִׁיב"; from "H7725"; "he will return";

3438.long:
Meaning: "Jishvah", an Israelite.
Usage: Ishvah, Isvah.
Source: from "H7737"; "he will level";

3439.long:
Meaning: "Jeshochajah", an Israelite.
Usage: Jeshoaiah.
Source: from the same as "H3445" and "H3050"; "Jah will empty";

3440.long:
Meaning: "Jishvi", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Ishuai, Ishvi, Isui, Jesui.
Source: from "H7737"; "level";

3441.long:
Meaning: a "Jishvite" (collectively) or descendants of Jishvi.
Usage: Jesuites.
Source: patronymically from "H3440";

3442.long:
Meaning: "Jeshua", the name of ten Israelites, also of a place in Palestine.
Usage: Jeshua.
Source: for "H3091"; "he will save";

3444.long:
Meaning: something "saved", i.e. (abstractly) "deliverance"; hence, "aid", "victory", "prosperity".
Usage: deliverance, health, help(-ing), salvation, save, saving (health), welfare.
Source: feminine passive participle of "H3467";

3445.long:
Meaning: "hunger".
Usage: casting down.
Source: from an unused root meaning to gape (as the empty stomach);

3446.long:
Meaning: "Jischak", the heir of Abraham.
Usage: Isaac. Compare "H3327".
Source: from "H7831"; he will laugh;

3447.long:
Meaning: to "extend".
Usage: hold out.
Source: a primitive root;

3448.long:
Meaning: "Jishai", David's father.
Usage: Jesse.
Source: by Aramaic "אִישַׁי"; from the same as "H3426"; "extant";

3449.long:
Meaning: "Jishshijah", the name of five Israelites.
Usage: Ishiah, Isshiah, Ishijah, Jesiah.
Source: or "יִשִּׁיָּהוּ"; from "H5383" and "H3050"; "Jah will lend";

3450.long:
Meaning: "Jesimael", an Israelite.
Usage: Jesimael.
Source: from "H7760" and "H410"; "God will place";

3451.long:
Meaning: "desolation".
Usage: let death seize (from the margin).
Source: from "H3456";

3452.long:
Meaning: a "desolation".
Usage: desert, Jeshimon, solitary, wilderness.
Source: from "H3456";

3453.long:
Meaning: an "old man".
Usage: (very) aged (man), ancient, very old.
Source: from "H3486";

3455.long:
Meaning: to "place"; intransitively, to "be placed".
Usage: be put (set).
Source: a primitive root;

3456.long:
Meaning: to "lie waste".
Usage: be desolate.
Source: a primitive root;

3458.long:
Meaning: "Jishmael", the name of Abraham's oldest son, and of five Israelites.
Usage: Ishmael.
Source: from "H8085" and "H410"; God will hear;

3459.long:
Meaning: a "Jishmaelite" or descendant of Jishmael.
Usage: Ishmaelite.
Source: patronymically from "H3458";

3460.long:
Meaning: "Jishmajah", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Ishmaiah.
Source: or "יִשְׁמַעְיָהוּ"; from "H8085" and "H3050"; "Jah will hear";

3462.long:
Meaning: properly, to "be slack" or "languid", i.e. (by implication) "sleep" (figuratively, to "die"); also to "grow old", "stale" or "inveterate".
Usage: old (store), remain long, (make to) sleep.
Source: a primitive root;

3463.long:
Meaning: "sleepy".
Usage: asleep, (one out of) sleep(-eth, -ing), slept.
Source: from "H3462";

3464.long:
Meaning: "Jashen", an Israelite.
Usage: Jashen.
Source: the same as "H3463";

3466.long:
Meaning: "Jeshanah", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Jeshanah.
Source: feminine of "H3465";

3467.long:
Meaning: properly, to "be open", "wide" or "free", i.e. (by implication) to "be safe"; causatively, to "free" or "succor".
Usage: × at all, avenging, defend, deliver(-er), help, preserve, rescue, be safe, bring (having) salvation, save(-iour), get victory.
Source: a primitive root;

3469.long:
Meaning: "Jishi", the name of four Israelites.
Usage: Ishi.
Source: from "H3467"; saving;

3470.long:
Meaning: "Jeshajah", the name of seven Israelites.
Usage: Isaiah, Jesaiah, Jeshaiah.
Source: or "יְשַׁעְיָהוּ"; from "H3467" and "H3050"; "Jah has saved";

3471.long:
Meaning: a gem supposed to be "jasper" (from the resemblance in name).
Usage: jasper.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "polish";

3472.long:
Meaning: "Jishpah", an Israelite.
Usage: Ispah.
Source: perhaps from "H8192"; "he will scratch";

3473.long:
Meaning: "Jishpan", an Israelite.
Usage: Ishpan.
Source: probably from the same as "H8227"; "he will hide";

3474.long:
Meaning: to "be straight" or "even"; figuratively, to "be" (causatively, to "make") "right", "pleasant", "prosperous".
Usage: direct, fit, seem good (meet), please (will), be (esteem, go) right (on), bring (look, make, take the) straight (way), be upright(-ly).
Source: a primitive root;

3475.long:
Meaning: "Jesher", an Israelite.
Usage: Jesher.
Source: from "H3474"; the right;

3476.long:
Meaning: the "right".
Usage: equity, meet, right, upright(-ness).
Source: from "H3474";

3477.long:
Meaning: "straight" (literally or figuratively).
Usage: convenient, equity, Jasher, just, meet(-est), pleased well right(-eous), straight, (most) upright(-ly, -ness).
Source: from "H3474";

3478.long:
Meaning: "he will rule as God"; "Jisraël", a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity.
Usage: Israel.
Source: from "H8280" and "H410";

3480.long:
Meaning: "Jesarelah", an Israelite.
Usage: Jesharelah.
Source: by variation from "H3477" and "H410" with directive enclitic; right towards God;

3481.long:
Meaning: "a Jisreelite" or descendant of Jisrael.
Usage: of Israel, Israelite.
Source: patronymically from "H3478";

3482.long:
Meaning: a "Jisreelitess" or female descendant of Jisrael.
Usage: Israelitish.
Source: feminine of "H3481";

3484.long:
Meaning: "Jeshurun", a symbolic name for Israel.
Usage: Jeshurun.
Source: from "H3474"; "upright";

3485.long:
Meaning: "Jissaskar", a son of Jacob.
Usage: Issachar.
Source: (strictly yis-saws-kawr'); from "H5375" and "H7939"; he will bring a reward;

3486.long:
Meaning: "gray-haired", i.e. an "aged man".
Usage: stoop for age.
Source: from an unused root meaning to blanch;

3487.brief: sign of the object of a verb
3487.long:
Meaning: a "sign of the object of a verb".
Usage: whom.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H853";

3488.long:
Meaning: to "sit" or "dwell".
Usage: dwell, (be) set, sit.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H3427";

3489.long:
Meaning: a "peg".
Usage: nail, paddle, pin, stake.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "pin" through or fast;

3490.long:
Meaning: a "bereaved" person.
Usage: fatherless (child), orphan.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "be lonely";

3491.long:
Meaning: properly, "what is left", i.e. (by implication) a "gleaning".
Usage: range.
Source: passive participle of "H3498";

3492.long:
Meaning: "Jattir", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Jattir.
Source: from "H3498"; redundant;

3493.long:
Meaning: "preeminent"; as an adverb, "very".
Usage: exceeding(-ly), excellent.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H3492";

3494.long:
Meaning: "Jithlah", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Jethlah.
Source: probably from "H8518"; it will hang, i.e. "be high";

3495.long:
Meaning: "Jithmah", an Israelite.
Usage: Ithmah.
Source: from the same as "H3490"; orphanage;

3496.long:
Meaning: "Jathniel", an Israelite.
Usage: Jathniel.
Source: from an unused root meaning to endure, and "H410"; "continued of God";

3497.long:
Meaning: "Jithnan", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Ithnan.
Source: from the same as "H8577"; "extensive";

3498.long:
Meaning: to "jut" over or "exceed"; by implication, to "excel"; (intransitively) to "remain" or "be left"; causatively to "leave", "cause to abound", "preserve".
Usage: excel, leave (a remnant), left behind, too much, make plenteous, preserve, (be, let) remain(-der, -ing, -nant), reserve, residue, rest.
Source: a primitive root;

3499.long:
Meaning: properly, an "overhanging", i.e. (by implication) an "excess", "superiority", "remainder"; also a small "rope" (as hanging free).
Usage: abundant, cord, exceeding, excellancy(-ent), what they leave, that hath left, plentifully, remnant, residue, rest, string, with.
Source: from "H3498";

3500.long:
Meaning: "Jether", the name of five or six Israelites and of one Midianite.
Usage: Jether, Jethro. Compare "H3503".
Source: the same as "H3499";

3501.long:
Meaning: "Jithra", an Israelite (or Ishmaelite).
Usage: Ithra.
Source: by variation for "H3502";

3502.long:
Meaning: properly, "excellence", i.e. (by implication) "wealth".
Usage: abundance, riches.
Source: feminine of "H3499";

3503.long:
Meaning: "Jethro", Moses' father-in-law.
Usage: Jethro. Compare "H3500".
Source: from "H3499" with pron. suffix; "his excellence";

3505.long:
Meaning: a "Jithrite" or descendant of Jether.
Usage: Ithrite.
Source: patronymically from "H3500";

3506.long:
Meaning: "Jithran", the name of an Edomite and of an Israelite.
Usage: Ithran.
Source: from "H3498"; "excellent";

3507.long:
Meaning: "Jithream", a son of David.
Usage: Ithream.
Source: from "H3499" and "H5971"; "excellence of people";

3508.long:
Meaning: the "lobe" or "flap" of the liver (as if redundant or outhanging).
Usage: caul.
Source: feminine active participle of "H3498";

3509.long:
Meaning: "Jetheth", an Edomite.
Usage: Jetheth.
Source: of uncertain derivation;

3510.long:
Meaning: properly, to "feel pain"; by implication, to "grieve"; figuratively, to "spoil".
Usage: grieving, mar, have pain, make sad (sore), (be) sorrowful.
Source: a primitive root;

3511.long:
Meaning: "suffering" (physical or mental), "adversity".
Usage: grief, pain, sorrow.
Source: from "H3510";

3512.long:
Meaning: to "despond"; causatively, to "deject".
Usage: broken, be grieved, make sad.
Source: a primitive root;

3513.long:
Meaning: to "be heavy", i.e. in a bad sense ("burdensome", "severe", "dull") or in a good sense ("numerous", "rich", "honorable"); causatively, to "make weighty" (in the same two senses).
Usage: abounding with, more grievously afflict, boast, be chargeable, × be dim, glorify, be (make) glorious (things), glory, (very) great, be grievous, harden, be (make) heavy, be heavier, lay heavily, (bring to, come to, do, get, be had in) honour (self), (be) honourable (man), lade, × more be laid, make self many, nobles, prevail, promote (to honour), be rich, be (go) sore, stop.
Source: or "כָּבֵד"; a primitive root;

3515.long:
Meaning: "heavy"; figuratively in a good sense ("numerous") or in a bad sense ("severe", "difficult", "stupid").
Usage: (so) great, grievous, hard(-ened), (too) heavy(-ier), laden, much, slow, sore, thick.
Source: from "H3513";

3516.long:
Meaning: the "liver" (as the "heaviest" of the viscera).
Usage: liver.
Source: the same as "H3515";

3518.long:
Meaning: to "expire" or (causatively) to "extinguish" (fire, light, anger).
Usage: go (put) out, quench.
Source: a primitive root;

3519.long:
Meaning: properly, "weight", but only figuratively in a good sense, "splendor" or "copiousness".
Usage: glorious(-ly), glory, honour(-able).
Source: rarely "כָּבֹד"; from "H3513";

3520.long:
Meaning: "weightiness", i.e. "magnificence", "wealth".
Usage: carriage, all glorious, stately.
Source: irregular feminine passive participle of "H3513";

3521.long:
Meaning: "Cabul", the name of two places in Palestine.
Usage: Cabul.
Source: from the same as "H3525" in the sense of limitation; sterile;

3522.long:
Meaning: "Cabon", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Cabbon.
Source: from an unused root meaning to heap up; hilly;

3523.long:
Meaning: a "matrass" (of intertwined materials).
Usage: pillow.
Source: from "H3527" in the original sense of plaiting;

3524.long:
Meaning: "vast", whether in extent (figuratively, of power, "mighty"; of time, "aged"), or in number, "many".
Usage: feeble, mighty, most, much, strong, valiant.
Source: from "H3527";

3525.long:
Meaning: a "fetter".
Usage: fetter.
Source: from an unused root meaning to twine or braid together;

3526.long:
Meaning: to "trample"; hence, to "wash" (properly, by stamping with the feet), whether literal (including the "fulling" process) or figurative.
Usage: fuller, wash(-ing).
Source: a primitive root;

3527.long:
Meaning: properly, to "plait together", i.e. (figuratively) to "augment" (especially in number or quantity, to accumulate).
Usage: in abundance, multiply.
Source: a primitive root;

3528.long:
Meaning: properly, "extent of time", i.e. a "great while"; hence, "long ago", "formerly", "hitherto".
Usage: already, (seeing that which), now.
Source: from "H3527";

3529.long:
Meaning: "Kebar", a river of Mesopotamia.
Usage: Chebar. Compare "H2249".
Source: the same as "H3528"; length;

3530.long:
Meaning: properly, "length", i.e. a "measure" (of uncertain dimension).
Usage: × little.
Source: feminine of "H3528";

3531.long:
Meaning: a "sieve" (as netted).
Usage: sieve.
Source: from "H3527" in its original sense;

3532.long:
Meaning: a "ram" (just old enough to butt).
Usage: lamb, sheep.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "dominate";

3533.long:
Meaning: to "tread down"; hence, negatively, to "disregard"; positively, to "conquer", "subjugate", "violate".
Usage: bring into bondage, force, keep under, subdue, bring into subjection.
Source: a primitive root;

3537.long:
Meaning: properly, a "pail"; but generally of earthenware; a "jar" for domestic purposes.
Usage: barrel, pitcher.
Source: from an unused root meaning to deepen;

3538.long:
Meaning: "false".
Usage: lying.
Source: (Aramaic) from a root corresponding to "H3576";

3539.long:
Meaning: a "sparkling gem", probably the "ruby".
Usage: agate.
Source: from the same as "H3537" in the sense of striking fire from a metal forged;

3540.long:
Meaning: "Kedorlaomer", an early Persian king.
Usage: Chedorlaomer.
Source: of foreign origin;

3541.long:
Meaning: properly, "like this", i.e. by implication, (of manner) "thus" (or "so"); also (of place) "here" (or "hither"); or (of time) "now".
Usage: also, here, hitherto, like, on the other side, so (and much), such, on that manner, (on) this (manner, side, way, way and that way), mean while, yonder.
Source: from the prefix k and "H1931";

3543.long:
Meaning: to "be weak", i.e. (figuratively) to "despond" (causatively, "rebuke"), or (of light, the eye) to "grow dull".
Usage: darken, be dim, fail, faint, restrain, × utterly.
Source: a primitive root;

3544.long:
Meaning: "feeble", "obscure".
Usage: somewhat dark, darkish, wax dim, heaviness, smoking.
Source: from "H3543";

3545.long:
Meaning: properly, a "weakening"; figuratively, "alleviation", i.e. "cure".
Usage: healing.
Source: feminine of "H3544";

3546.long:
Meaning: to "be able".
Usage: be able, could.
Source: (Aramaic) a root corresponding to and "H3557";

3547.long:
Meaning: to "officiate" as a priest; figuratively, to "put on regalia".
Usage: deck, be (do the office of a, execute the, minister in the) priest('s office).
Source: a primitive root, apparently meaning to mediate in religious services; but used only as denominative from "H3548";

3548.long:
Meaning: literally one "officiating", a "priest"; also (by courtesy) an "acting priest" (although a layman).
Usage: chief ruler, × own, priest, prince, principal officer.
Source: active participle of "H3547";

3551.long:
Meaning: a "window" (as a perforation).
Usage: window.
Source: (Aramaic) from a root corresponding to "H3854" in the sense of piercing;

3552.long:
Meaning: "Kub", a country near Egypt.
Usage: Chub.
Source: of foreign derivation;

3553.long:
Meaning: a "helmet" (as "arched").
Usage: helmet. Compare "H6959".
Source: from an unused root meaning to be "high" or "rounded";

3554.long:
Meaning: properly, to "prick" or "penetrate"; hence, to "blister" (as smarting or eating into).
Usage: burn.
Source: a primitive root;

3556.long:
Meaning: a "star" (as round or as shining); figuratively, a "prince".
Usage: star(-gazer).
Source: probably from the same as "H3522" (in the sense of rolling) or "H3554" (in the sense of blazing);

3557.long:
Meaning: properly, to "keep in"; hence, to "measure"; figuratively, to "maintain" (in various senses).
Usage: (be able to, can) abide, bear, comprehend, contain, feed, forbearing, guide, hold(-ing in), nourish(-er), be present, make provision, receive, sustain, provide sustenance (victuals).
Source: a primitive root;

3558.long:
Meaning: a "jewel" (probably gold beads).
Usage: tablet.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "store" away;

3559.long:
Meaning: properly, to "be erect" (i.e. stand perpendicular); hence (causatively) to "set up", in a great variety of applications, whether literal ("establish", "fix", "prepare", "apply"), or figurative ("appoint", "render sure", "proper" or "prosperous").
Usage: certain(-ty), confirm, direct, faithfulness, fashion, fasten, firm, be fitted, be fixed, frame, be meet, ordain, order, perfect, (make) preparation, prepare (self), provide, make provision, (be, make) ready, right, set (aright, fast, forth), be stable, (e-) stablish, stand, tarry, × very deed.
Source: a primitive root;

3560.long:
Meaning: "Kun", a place in Syria.
Usage: Chun.
Source: probably from "H3559"; "established";

3561.long:
Meaning: something "prepared", i.e. a "sacrificial wafer".
Usage: cake.
Source: from "H3559";

3562.long:
Meaning: "Conanjah", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Conaniah, Cononiah. Compare "H3663".
Source: from "H3559" and "H3050"; "Jah has sustained";

3563.long:
Meaning: a "cup" (as a container), often figuratively, a "lot" (as if a potion); also some unclean bird, probably an "owl" (perhaps from the cup-like cavity of its eye).
Usage: cup, (small) owl. Compare "H3599".
Source: from an unused root meaning to hold together;

3564.long:
Meaning: a "pot" or "furnace" (as if excavated).
Usage: furnace. Compare "H3600".
Source: from an unused root meaning properly, to "dig" through;

3565.long:
Meaning: "Cor-Ashan", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Chorashan.
Source: from "H3564" and "H6227"; furnace of smoke;

3566.long:
Meaning: "Koresh" (or Cyrus), the Persian king.
Usage: Cyrus.
Source: or (Ezra 1:1 (last time),2) "כֹּרֶשׁ"; from the Persian;

3568.long:
Meaning: "Cush" (or Ethiopia), the name of a son of Ham, and of his territory; also of an Israelite.
Usage: Chush, Cush, Ethiopia.
Source: probably of foreign origin;

3569.long:
Meaning: a "Cushite", or descendant of Cush.
Usage: Cushi, Cushite, Ethiopian(-s).
Source: patronymically from "H3568";

3570.long:
Meaning: "Cushi", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Cushi.
Source: the same as "H3569";

3572.long:
Meaning: "Cushan", a region of Arabia.
Usage: Cushan.
Source: perhaps from "H3568";

3573.long:
Meaning: "Cushan-Rishathajim", a Mesopotamian king.
Usage: Chushan-rishathayim.
Source: apparently from "H3572" and the dual of "H7564"; Cushan of double wickedness;

3575.long:
Meaning: "Cuth" or "Cuthah", a province of Assyria.
Usage: Cuth.
Source: or (feminine) "כּוּתָה"; of foreign origin;

3576.long:
Meaning: to "lie" (i.e. "deceive"), literally or figuratively.
Usage: fail, (be found a, make a) liar, lie, lying, be in vain.
Source: a primitive root;

3577.long:
Meaning: "falsehood"; literally (untruth) or figuratively (idol).
Usage: deceitful, false, leasing, liar, lie, lying.
Source: from "H3576";

3578.long:
Meaning: "Cozeba", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Choseba.
Source: from "H3576"; fallacious;

3580.long:
Meaning: "Kezib", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Chezib.
Source: from "H3576"; "falsified";

3581.long:
Meaning: "vigor", literally (force, in a good or a bad sense) or figuratively (capacity, means, produce); also (from its hardiness) a "large lizard".
Usage: ability, able, chameleon, force, fruits, might, power(-ful), strength, substance, wealth.
Source: or (Daniel 11:6) "כּוֹחַ"; from an unused root meaning to be firm;

3582.long:
Meaning: to "secrete", by act or word; hence (intensively) to "destroy".
Usage: conceal, cut down (off), desolate, hide.
Source: a primitive root;

3583.long:
Meaning: to "paint" (with stibium).
Usage: paint.
Source: a primitive root;

3584.long:
Meaning: to "be untrue", in word (to "lie", "feign", "disown") or deed (to "disappoint", "fail", "cringe").
Usage: deceive, deny, dissemble, fail, deal falsely, be found liars, (be-) lie, lying, submit selves.
Source: a primitive root;

3585.long:
Meaning: literally a "failure of flesh", i.e. "emaciation"; figuratively, "hypocrisy".
Usage: leanness, lies, lying.
Source: from "H3584";

3588.long:
Meaning: (by implication) very widely used as a "relative conjunction" or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed.
Usage: and, (forasmuch, inasmuch, where-) as, assured(-ly), but, certainly, doubtless, else, even, except, for, how, (because, in, so, than) that, nevertheless, now, rightly, seeing, since, surely, then, therefore, (al-) though, till, truly, until, when, whether, while, whom, yea, yet.
Source: a primitive particle (the full form of the prepositional prefix) indicating causal relations of all kinds, antecedent or consequent;

3589.long:
Meaning: a "crushing"; figuratively, "calamity".
Usage: destruction.
Source: from a primitive root meaning to strike;

3590.long:
Meaning: properly, something "struck off", i.e. a "spark" (as struck).
Usage: spark.
Source: from the same as "H3589" (compare "H3539");

3591.long:
Meaning: properly, something to "strike" with, i.e. a "dart".
Usage: lance, shield, spear, target.
Source: from the same as "H3589"; (perhaps smaller than "H2595")

3592.long:
Meaning: "Kidon", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Chidon.
Source: the same as "H3591";

3594.long:
Meaning: properly, a "statue", i.e. "idol"; but used (by euphemism) for some "heathen deity" (perhaps corresponding to Priapus or Baal-peor).
Usage: Chiun.
Source: from "H3559";

3595.long:
Meaning: properly, something "round" (as "excavated" or "bored"), i.e. a chafing-"dish" for coals or a "caldron" for cooking; hence (from similarity of form) a "washbowl"; also (for the same reason) a "pulpit" or platform.
Usage: hearth, laver, pan, scaffold.
Source: or "כִּיֹּר"; from the same as "H3564";

3596.long:
Meaning: "niggardly".
Usage: churl.
Source: or "כֵּלַי"; from "H3557" in the sense of "withholding";

3597.long:
Meaning: a "club" or "sledge-hammer".
Usage: hammer.
Source: from an unused root meaning to clap or strike with noise;

3598.long:
Meaning: a "cluster of stars", i.e. the "Pleiades".
Usage: Pleiades, seven stars.
Source: from the same as "H3558";

3599.long:
Meaning: a "cup"; also a "bag" for money or weights.
Usage: bag, cup, purse.
Source: a form for "H3563";

3600.long:
Meaning: a "cooking range" (consisting of two parallel stones, across which the boiler is set).
Usage: ranges for pots.
Source: a form for "H3564" (only in the dual);

3601.long:
Meaning: literally a "director", i.e. the "spindle" or "shank of a distaff", by which it is twirled.
Usage: spindle.
Source: from "H3787"; compare "H6418"

3602.long:
Meaning: "just so", referring to the previous or following context.
Usage: after that (this) manner, this matter, (even) so, in such a case, thus.
Source: from "H3541";

3603.long:
Meaning: a "circle", i.e. (by implication) a circumjacent tract or region, especially the "Ghor" or valley of the Jordan; also a (round) "loaf"; also a "talent" (or large [round] "coin").
Usage: loaf, morsel, piece, plain, talent.
Source: from "H3769";

3605.long:
Meaning: properly, the "whole"; hence, "all", "any" or "every" (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense).
Usage: (in) all (manner, (ye)), altogether, any (manner), enough, every (one, place, thing), howsoever, as many as, (no-) thing, ought, whatsoever, (the) whole, whoso(-ever).
Source: or (Jeremiah 33:8) "כּוֹל"; from "H3634";

3606.long:
Usage: all, any, (forasmuch) as, be-(for this) cause, every, no (manner, -ne), there (where) -fore, though, what (where, who) -soever, (the) whole.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H3605"

3607.long:
Meaning: to "restrict", by act ("hold back" or "in") or word ("prohibit").
Usage: finish, forbid, keep (back), refrain, restrain, retain, shut up, be stayed, withhold.
Source: a primitive root;

3609.long:
Meaning: "Kilab", an Israelite.
Usage: Chileab.
Source: apparently from "H3607" and "H1"; restraint of (his) father;

3610.long:
Meaning: "two heterogeneities".
Usage: divers seeds (-e kinds), mingled (seed).
Source: dual of "H3608" in the original sense of separation;

3611.long:
Meaning: a "dog"; hence (by euphemism) a male "prostitute".
Usage: dog.
Source: from an unused root means. to "yelp", or else to "attack";

3612.long:
Meaning: "Caleb", the name of three Israelites.
Usage: Caleb.
Source: perhaps a form of "H3611", or else from the same root in the sense of forcible;

3613.long:
Meaning: "Caleb-Ephrathah", a place in Egypt (if the text is correct).
Usage: Caleb-ephrathah.
Source: from "H3612" and "H672";

3614.long:
Meaning: a "Calebite" or descendant of Caleb.
Usage: of the house of Caleb.
Source: probably by erroneous transcription for "כָּלֵבִי"; patronymically from "H3612";

3615.long:
Meaning: to "end", whether intransitive (to "cease", "be finished", "perish") or transitive (to "complete", "prepare", "consume").
Usage: accomplish, cease, consume (away), determine, destroy (utterly), be (when... were) done, (be an) end (of), expire, (cause to) fail, faint, finish, fulfil, × fully, × have, leave (off), long, bring to pass, wholly reap, make clean riddance, spend, quite take away, waste.
Source: a primitive root;

3617.long:
Meaning: a "completion"; adverb, "completely"; also "destruction".
Usage: altogether, (be, utterly) consume(-d), consummation(-ption), was determined, (full, utter) end, riddance.
Source: from "H3615";

3618.long:
Meaning: a "bride" (as if perfect); hence, a "son's wife".
Usage: bride, daughter-in-law, spouse.
Source: from "H3634";

3619.long:
Meaning: a "bird-trap" (as furnished with a clap-stick or treadle to spring it); hence, a "basket" (as resembling a wicker cage).
Usage: basket, cage.
Source: from the same as "H3611";

3620.long:
Meaning: "Kelub", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Chelub.
Source: the same as "H3619";

3621.long:
Meaning: "Kelubai", an Israelite.
Usage: Chelubai.
Source: a form of "H3612";

3623.long:
Meaning: "bridehood" (only in the plural).
Usage: espousal.
Source: denominative passive participle from "H3618";

3624.long:
Meaning: "maturity".
Usage: full (old) age.
Source: from an unused root meaning to be complete;

3625.long:
Meaning: "Kelach", a place in Assyria.
Usage: Calah.
Source: the same as "H3624";

3626.long:
Meaning: "Col-Chozeh", an Israelite.
Usage: Col-hozeh.
Source: from "H3605" and "H2374"; every seer;

3627.long:
Meaning: something "prepared", i.e. any "apparatus" (as an implement, utensil, dress, vessel or weapon).
Usage: armour(-bearer), artillery, bag, carriage, furnish, furniture, instrument, jewel, that is made of, × one from another, that which pertaineth, pot, psaltery, sack, stuff, thing, tool, vessel, ware, weapon, whatsoever.
Source: from "H3615";

3629.long:
Meaning: a "kidney" (as an essential "organ"); figuratively, the "mind" (as the interior self).
Usage: kidneys, reins.
Source: feminine of "H3627" (only in the plural);

3630.long:
Meaning: "Kiljon", an Israelite.
Usage: Chilion.
Source: a form of "H3631";

3632.long:
Meaning: "complete"; as noun, the "whole" (specifically, a sacrifice "entirely consumed"); as adverb, "fully".
Usage: all, every whit, flame, perfect(-ion), utterly, whole burnt offering (sacrifice), wholly.
Source: from "H3634";

3633.long:
Meaning: "Calcol", an Israelite.
Usage: Calcol, Chalcol.
Source: from "H3557"; sustenance;

3635.long:
Meaning: to "complete".
Usage: finish, make (set) up.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H3634";

3637.long:
Meaning: properly, to "wound"; but only figuratively, to "taunt" or "insult".
Usage: be (make) ashamed, blush, be confounded, be put to confusion, hurt, reproach, (do, put to) shame.
Source: a primitive root;

3638.long:
Meaning: "Kilmad", a place apparently in the Assyrian empire.
Usage: Chilmad.
Source: of foreign derivation;

3641.long:
Meaning: "Calneh" or "Calno", a place in the Assyrian empire.
Usage: Calneh, Calno. Compare "H3656".
Source: or "כַּלְנֵה"; also "כַּלְנוֹ"; of foreign derivation;

3642.long:
Meaning: to "pine after".
Usage: long.
Source: a primitive root;

3644.long:
Meaning: "as", "thus", "so".
Usage: according to, (such) as (it were, well as), in comparison of, like (as, to, unto), thus, when, worth.
Source: or "כָּמוֹ"; a form of the prefix "k", but used separately [compare "H3651"];

3645.long:
Meaning: "Kemosh", the god of the Moabites.
Usage: Chemosh.
Source: or (Jeremiah 48:7) "כְּמִישׁ"; from an unused root meaning to "subdue"; the "powerful";

3646.long:
Meaning: "'cummin'" (from its use as a "condiment").
Usage: cummin.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "store" up or "preserve";

3647.long:
Meaning: to "store away", i.e. (figuratively) in the memory.
Usage: lay up in store.
Source: a primitive root;

3648.long:
Meaning: properly, to "intertwine" or "contract", i.e. (by implication) to "shrivel" (as with heat); figuratively, to "be deeply affected with passion" (love or pity).
Usage: be black, be kindled, yearn.
Source: a primitive root;

3649.long:
Meaning: properly, an "ascetic" (as if shrunk with self-maceration), i.e. an "idolatrous priest" (only in plural).
Usage: Chemarims (idolatrous) priests.
Source: from "H3648";

3650.long:
Meaning: "obscuration" (as if from shrinkage of light), i.e. an eclipse (only in plural).
Usage: blackness.
Source: redupl. from "H3648";

3651.long:
Meaning: properly, "set upright"; hence (figuratively as adjective) "just"; but usually (as adverb or conjunction) "rightly" or "so" (in various applications to manner, time and relation; often with other particles).
Usage: after that (this, -ward, -wards), as... as, (for-) asmuch as yet, be (for which) cause, following, howbeit, in (the) like (manner, -wise), × the more, right, (even) so, state, straightway, such (thing), surely, there (where) -fore, this, thus, true, well, × you.
Source: from "H3559";

3653.long:
Meaning: a "stand", i.e. "pedestal" or "station".
Usage: base, estate, foot, office, place, well.
Source: the same as "H3651", used as a noun;

3654.long:
Meaning: a "gnat".
Usage: lice, × manner.
Source: from "H3661" in the sense of fastening; (from infixing its sting; used only in plural (and irregular in Exodus 8:17,18; Hebrews 13:14))

3655.long:
Meaning: to "address" by an additional name; hence, to "eulogize".
Usage: give flattering titles, surname (himself).
Source: a primitive root;

3656.long:
Meaning: "Canneh", a place in Assyria.
Usage: Canneh.
Source: for "H3641";

3658.long:
Meaning: a "harp".
Usage: harp.
Source: from a unused root meaning to twang;

3660.long:
Meaning: "so" or "thus".
Usage: so, (in) this manner (sort), thus.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H3644";

3661.long:
Meaning: "to set out", i.e. "plant".
Usage: × vineyard.
Source: a primitive root;

3663.long:
Meaning: "Kenanjah", an Israelite.
Usage: Chenaniah.
Source: or "כְּנַנְיָהוּ"; from "H3661" and "H3050"; Jah has planted;

3664.long:
Meaning: to "collect"; hence, to "enfold".
Usage: gather (together), heap up, wrap self.
Source: a primitive root;

3665.long:
Meaning: properly, to "bend" the knee; hence, to "humiliate", "vanquish".
Usage: bring down (low), into subjection, under, humble (self), subdue.
Source: a primitive root;

3666.long:
Meaning: a "package".
Usage: wares.
Source: from "H3665" in the sense of folding (compare "H3664");

3667.long:
Meaning: "Kenaan", a son a Ham; also the country inhabited by him.
Usage: Canaan, merchant, traffick.
Source: from "H3665"; humiliated;

3668.long:
Meaning: "Kenaanah", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Chenaanah.
Source: feminine of "H3667";

3669.long:
Meaning: a "Kenaanite" or inhabitant of Kenaan; by implication, a "pedlar" (the Canaanites standing for their neighbors the Ishmaelites, who conducted mercantile caravans).
Usage: Canaanite, merchant, trafficker.
Source: patrial from "H3667";

3670.long:
Meaning: properly, to "project laterally", i.e. probably (reflexive) to "withdraw".
Usage: be removed.
Source: a primitive root;

3671.long:
Meaning: an "edge" or "extremity"; specifically (of a bird or army) a "wing", (of a garment or bedclothing) a "flap", (of the earth) a "quarter", (of a building) a "pinnacle".
Usage: bird, border, corner, end, feather(-ed), × flying, (one an-) other, overspreading, × quarters, skirt, × sort, uttermost part, wing(-ed).
Source: from "H3670";

3672.long:
Meaning: "Kinneroth" or "Kinnereth", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Chinnereth, Chinneroth, Cinneroth.
Source: or "כִּנֶּרֶת"; respectively plural and singular feminine from the same as "H3658"; perhaps harp-shaped;

3674.long:
Meaning: a "colleague" (as having the same title).
Usage: companion.
Source: from "H3655";

3676.long:
Usage: sworn.
Source: apparently a contraction for "H3678", but probably by erroneous transcription for "H5251"

3677.long:
Meaning: properly, "fulness" or the "full moon", i.e. its "festival".
Usage: (time) appointed.
Source: or "כֶּסֶה"; apparently from "H3680";

3678.long:
Meaning: properly, "covered", i.e. a "throne" (as "canopied").
Usage: seat, stool, throne.
Source: or "כִּסֵּה"; from "H3680";

3680.long:
Meaning: properly, to "plump", i.e. "fill up" hollows; by implication, to "cover" (for clothing or secrecy).
Usage: clad self, close, clothe, conceal, cover (self), (flee to) hide, overwhelm. Compare "H3780".
Source: a primitive root;

3681.long:
Meaning: properly, "covered", i.e. (as noun) a "covering".
Usage: covering.
Source: passive participle of "H3680";

3682.long:
Meaning: a "cover" ("garment"); figuratively, a "veiling".
Usage: covering, raiment, vesture.
Source: from "H3680";

3683.long:
Meaning: to "cut off".
Usage: cut down (up).
Source: a primitive root;

3685.long:
Meaning: any notable "constellation"; specifically "Orion" (as if a "burly" one).
Usage: constellation, Orion.
Source: the same as "H3684";

3686.long:
Meaning: "Kesil", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Chesil.
Source: the same as "H3684";

3688.long:
Meaning: properly, to "be fat", i.e. (figuratively) "silly".
Usage: be foolish.
Source: a primitive root;

3689.long:
Meaning: properly, "fatness", i.e. by implication (literally) the "loin" (as the seat of the leaf fat) or (generally) the "viscera"; also (figuratively) "silliness" or (in a good sense) "trust".
Usage: confidence, flank, folly, hope, loin.
Source: from "H3688";

3690.long:
Meaning: in a good sense, "trust"; in a bad one, "silliness".
Usage: confidence, folly.
Source: feminine of "H3689";

3691.long:
Meaning: "Kisleu", the 9th Hebrew month.
Usage: Chisleu.
Source: probably of foreign origin;

3693.long:
Meaning: "Kesalon", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Chesalon.
Source: from "H3688"; "fertile";

3694.long:
Meaning: "Kesulloth", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Chesulloth.
Source: feminine plural of passive participle of "H3688"; "fattened";

3695.long:
Meaning: "Casluchim", a people cognate to the Egyptians.
Usage: Casluhim.
Source: a plural probably of foreign derivation;

3696.long:
Meaning: "Kisloth-Tabor", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Chisloth-tabor.
Source: from the feminine plural of "H3689" and "H8396"; flanks of Tabor;

3697.long:
Meaning: to "shear".
Usage: × only, poll. Compare "H3765".
Source: a primitive root;

3698.long:
Meaning: "spelt" (from its bristliness as if just "shorn").
Usage: fitches, rie.
Source: from "H3697";

3699.long:
Meaning: to "estimate".
Usage: make count.
Source: a primitive root;

3700.long:
Meaning: properly, to "become pale", i.e. (by implication) to "pine after"; also to "fear".
Usage: (have) desire, be greedy, long, sore.
Source: a primitive root;

3701.long:
Meaning: "silver" (from its "pale" color); by implication, "money".
Usage: money, price, silver(-ling).
Source: from "H3700";

3703.long:
Meaning: "Casiphja", a place in Babylon.
Usage: Casiphia.
Source: perhaps from "H3701"; silvery;

3704.long:
Meaning: a "cushion" or "pillow" (as covering a seat or bed).
Usage: pillow.
Source: from "H3680";

3706.long:
Meaning: "thus" (only in the formula 'and so forth').
Usage: at such a time.
Source: (Aramaic) or "כְּעֶת"; (Aramaic), feminine of "H3705";

3707.long:
Meaning: to "trouble"; by implication, to "grieve", "rage", "be indignant".
Usage: be angry, be grieved, take indignation, provoke (to anger, unto wrath), have sorrow, vex, be wroth.
Source: a primitive root;

3708.long:
Meaning: "vexation".
Usage: anger, angry, grief, indignation, provocation, provoking, × sore, sorrow, spite, wrath.
Source: or (in Job) "כַּעַשׂ"; from "H3707";

3709.long:
Meaning: the "hollow hand" or "palm" (so of the paw of an animal, of the sole, and even of the bowl of a dish or sling, the handle of a bolt, the leaves of a palm-tree); figuratively, "power".
Usage: branch, foot, hand((-ful), -dle, (-led)), hollow, middle, palm, paw, power, sole, spoon.
Source: from "H3721";

3711.long:
Meaning: properly, to "bend", i.e. (figuratively) to "tame" or "subdue".
Usage: pacify.
Source: a primitive root;

3712.long:
Meaning: a "leaf" of a palmtree.
Usage: branch.
Source: feminine of "H3709";

3713.long:
Meaning: properly, a "cover", i.e. (by implication) a "tankard" (or covered goblet); also "white frost" (as covering the ground).
Usage: bason, hoar(-y) frost.
Source: from "H3722";

3714.long:
Meaning: a "girder".
Usage: beam.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "connect";

3715.long:
Meaning: a "village" (as covered in by walls); also a "young lion" (perhaps as covered with a mane).
Usage: (young) lion, village. Compare "H3723".
Source: from "H3722";

3716.long:
Meaning: "Kephirah", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Chephirah.
Source: feminine of "H3715"; the village (always with the art.);

3717.long:
Meaning: to "fold" together; figuratively, to "repeat".
Usage: double.
Source: a primitive root;

3720.long:
Meaning: "hunger" (as making to stoop with emptiness and pain).
Usage: famine.
Source: from "H3719";

3721.long:
Meaning: to "curve".
Usage: bow down (self).
Source: a primitive root;

3722.long:
Meaning: to "cover" (specifically with bitumen); figuratively, to "expiate" or "condone", to "placate" or "cancel".
Usage: appease, make (an atonement, cleanse, disannul, forgive, be merciful, pacify, pardon, purge (away), put off, (make) reconcile(-liation).
Source: a primitive root;

3723.long:
Meaning: "a village" (as protected by walls).
Usage: village. Compare "H3715".
Source: from "H3722";

3724.long:
Meaning: properly, a "cover", i.e. (literally) a "village" (as covered in); (specifically) "bitumen" (as used for coating), and the "henna plant" (as used for dyeing); figuratively, a "redemption-price".
Usage: bribe, camphire, pitch, ransom, satisfaction, sum of money, village.
Source: from "H3722";
