3726.long:
Meaning: "Kefar-ha-Ammoni", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Chefarhaamonai.
Source: from "H3723" and "H5984", with the article interposed; village of the Ammonite;

3727.long:
Meaning: a "lid" (used only of the "cover" of the sacred Ark).
Usage: mercy seat.
Source: from "H3722";

3728.long:
Meaning: to "tread down"; figuratively, to "humiliate".
Usage: cover.
Source: a primitive root;

3729.long:
Meaning: to "fetter".
Usage: bind.
Source: (Aramaic) a root of uncertain correspondence;

3730.long:
Meaning: a "chaplet"; but used only in an architectonic sense, i.e. the "capital" of a column, or a wreath-like "button" or "disk" on the candelabrum.
Usage: knop, (upper) lintel.
Source: or (Amos 9:1) "כַּפְתּוֹר"; probably from an unused root meaning to "encircle";

3731.long:
Meaning: "Caphtor" (i.e. a wreath-shaped island), the original seat of the Philistines.
Usage: Caphtor.
Source: or (Amos 9:7) "כַּפְתּוֹר"; apparently the same as "H3730";

3732.long:
Meaning: a "Caphtorite" (collectively) or native of Caphtor.
Usage: Caphthorim, Caphtorim(-s).
Source: patrial from "H3731";

3733.long:
Meaning: a "ram" (as full-grown and fat), including a "battering-ram" (as butting); hence, a "meadow" (as for sheep); also a "pad" or "camel's saddle" (as puffed out).
Usage: captain, furniture, lamb, (large) pasture, ram. See also "H1033", "H3746".
Source: from "H3769" in the sense of plumpness;

3734.long:
Meaning: properly, a deep round "vessel", i.e. (specifically) a "cor" or measure for things dry.
Usage: cor, measure. Aramaic the same.
Source: from the same as "H3564";

3735.long:
Meaning: to "grieve".
Usage: be grieved.
Source: (Aramaic) probably corresponding to "H3738" in the sense of piercing(figuratively);

3736.long:
Meaning: to "gird" or "clothe".
Usage: clothed.
Source: from the same as "H3525";

3737.long:
Meaning: a "mantle".
Usage: hat.
Source: (Aramaic) from a verb corresponding to that of "H3736";

3738.long:
Meaning: properly, to "dig"; figuratively, to "plot"; generally, to "bore" or "open".
Usage: dig, × make (a banquet), open.
Source: a primitive root;

3739.long:
Meaning: to "purchase".
Usage: buy, prepare.
Source: usually assigned as a primitive root, but probably only a special application of "H3738" (through the common idea of planning implied in a bargain);

3742.long:
Meaning: a "cherub" or "imaginary figure".
Usage: cherub, (plural) cherubims.
Source: of uncertain derivation;

3743.long:
Meaning: "Kerub", a place in Babylon.
Usage: Cherub.
Source: the same as "H3742";

3745.long:
Meaning: to "proclaim".
Usage: make a proclamation.
Source: (Aramaic) probably of Greek origin;

3746.long:
Meaning: a "life-guardsman".
Usage: captains, Cherethites (from the margin).
Source: perhaps an abridged plural of "H3733" in the sense of leader (of the flock);

3747.long:
Meaning: "Kerith", a brook of Palestine.
Usage: Cherith.
Source: from "H3772"; a "cut";

3748.long:
Meaning: a "cutting" (of the matrimonial bond), i.e. "divorce".
Usage: divorce(-ment).
Source: from "H3772";

3749.long:
Meaning: a "rim" or "top margin".
Usage: compass.
Source: expanded from the same as "H3522";

3750.long:
Meaning: the "crocus".
Usage: saffron.
Source: probably of foreign origin;

3751.long:
Meaning: "Karkemish", a place in Syria.
Usage: Carchemish.
Source: of foreign derivation;

3752.long:
Meaning: "Karkas", a eunuch of Xerxes.
Usage: Carcas.
Source: of Persian origin;

3753.long:
Meaning: a "dromedary" (from its "rapid" motion as if dancing).
Usage: swift beast.
Source: from "H3769";

3754.long:
Meaning: a "garden" or "vineyard".
Usage: vines, (increase of the) vineyard(-s), vintage. See also "H1021".
Source: from an unused root of uncertain meaning;

3755.long:
Meaning: a "vinedresser".
Usage: vine dresser (as one or two words).
Source: active participle of an imaginary denominative from "H3754";

3756.long:
Meaning: "Karmi", the name of three Israelites.
Usage: Carmi.
Source: from "H3754"; gardener;

3757.long:
Meaning: a "Karmite" or descendant of Karmi.
Usage: Carmites.
Source: patronymically from "H3756";

3758.long:
Meaning: "carmine", a deep red.
Usage: crimson.
Source: probably of foreign origin;

3759.long:
Meaning: a planted "field" (garden, orchard, vineyard or park); by implication, garden "produce".
Usage: full (green) ears (of corn), fruitful field (place), plentiful (field).
Source: from "H3754";

3760.long:
Meaning: "Karmel", the name of a hill and of a town in Palestine.
Usage: Carmel, fruitful (plentiful) field, (place).
Source: the same as "H3759";

3761.long:
Meaning: a "Karmelite" or inhabitant of Karmel (the town).
Usage: Carmelite.
Source: patron from "H3760";

3762.long:
Meaning: a "Karmelitess" or female inhabitant of Karmel.
Usage: Carmelitess.
Source: feminine of "H3761";

3763.long:
Meaning: "Keran", an aboriginal Idumaean.
Usage: Cheran.
Source: of uncertain derivation;

3766.long:
Meaning: to "bend" the knee; by implication, to "sink", to "prostrate".
Usage: bow (down, self), bring down (low), cast down, couch, fall, feeble, kneeling, sink, smite (stoop) down, subdue, × very.
Source: a primitive root;

3767.long:
Meaning: the "leg" (from the knee to the ankle) of men or locusts (only in the dual).
Usage: leg.
Source: from "H3766";

3768.long:
Meaning: "byssus" or "fine vegetable wool".
Usage: green.
Source: of foreign origin;

3769.long:
Meaning: to "dance" (i.e. whirl).
Usage: dance(-ing).
Source: a primitive root;

3770.long:
Meaning: the "paunch" or "belly" (as swelling out).
Usage: belly.
Source: by variation from "H7164";

3771.long:
Meaning: "Karshena", a courtier of Xerxes.
Usage: Carshena.
Source: of foreign origin;

3772.long:
Meaning: to "cut" (off, down or asunder); by implication, to "destroy" or "consume"; specifically, to "covenant" (i.e. make an alliance or bargain, originally by cutting flesh and passing between the pieces).
Usage: be chewed, be con-(feder-) ate, covenant, cut (down, off), destroy, fail, feller, be freed, hew (down), make a league (covenant), × lose, perish, × utterly, × want.
Source: a primitive root;

3773.long:
Meaning: something "cut", i.e. a "hewn timber".
Usage: beam.
Source: passive participle feminine of "H3772";

3774.long:
Meaning: a "Kerethite" or "life-guardsman".
Usage: Cherethims, Cherethites.
Source: probably from "H3772" in the sense of executioner; (compare "H2876") (only collectively in the singular as plural)

3775.long:
Meaning: a "young sheep".
Usage: lamb.
Source: apparently by transposition for "H3532";

3777.long:
Meaning: "Kesed", a relative of Abraham.
Usage: Chesed.
Source: from an unused root of uncertain meaning;

3778.long:
Meaning: a "Kasdite", or descendant of Kesed; by implication, a Chaldaean (as if so descended); also an astrologer (as if proverbial of that people.
Usage: Chaldeans, Chaldees, inhabitants of Chaldea.
Source: (occasionally with enclitic) "כַּשְׂדִּימָה"; towards the Kasdites into Chaldea), patronymically from "H3777" (only in the plural);

3779.long:
Meaning: a "Chaldaean" or inhabitant of Chaldaea; by implication, a Magian or professional astrologer.
Usage: Chaldean.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H3778";

3780.long:
Meaning: to "grow fat" (i.e. be "covered" with flesh).
Usage: be covered. Compare "H3680".
Source: a primitive root;

3781.long:
Meaning: properly, a "feller", i.e. an "axe".
Usage: ax.
Source: from "H3782";

3782.long:
Meaning: to "totter" or "waver" (through weakness of the legs, especially the ankle); by implication, to "falter", "stumble", "faint" or "fall".
Usage: bereave (from the margin), cast down, be decayed, (cause to) fail, (cause, make to) fall (down, -ing), feeble, be (the) ruin(-ed, of), (be) overthrown, (cause to) stumble, × utterly, be weak.
Source: a primitive root;

3784.long:
Meaning: properly, to "whisper" a spell, i.e. to "inchant" or "practise magic".
Usage: sorcerer, (use) witch(-craft).
Source: a primitive root;

3787.long:
Meaning: by implication, to "be acceptable"; also to "succeed" or "prosper".
Usage: direct, be right, prosper.
Source: a primitive root properly, to be straight or right;

3789.long:
Meaning: to "grave", by implication, to "write" (describe, inscribe, prescribe, subscribe).
Usage: describe, record, prescribe, subscribe, write(-ing, -ten).
Source: a primitive root;

3791.long:
Meaning: something "written", i.e. a "writing", "record" or "book".
Usage: register, scripture, writing.
Source: from "H3789";

3793.long:
Meaning: a "letter" or other "mark" branded on the skin.
Usage: × any (mark).
Source: from "H3789";

3794.long:
Meaning: a "Kittite" or "Cypriote"; hence, an islander in general, i.e. the Greeks or Romans on the shores opposite Palestine.
Usage: Chittim, Kittim.
Source: or "כִּתִּיִּי"; patrial from an unused name denoting Cyprus (only in the plural);

3796.long:
Meaning: a "wall" (as gathering inmates).
Usage: wall.
Source: from an unused root meaning to compact;

3798.long:
Meaning: "Kithlish", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Kithlish.
Source: from "H3796" and "H376"; "wall of a man";

3799.long:
Meaning: properly, to "carve" or "engrave", i.e. (by implication) to "inscribe indelibly".
Usage: mark.
Source: a primitive root;

3800.long:
Meaning: properly, something "carved" out, i.e. "ore"; hence, "gold" (pure as originally mined).
Usage: ((most) fine, pure) gold(-en wedge).
Source: from "H3799";

3801.long:
Meaning: a "shirt".
Usage: coat, garment, robe.
Source: or "כֻּתֹּנֶת"; from an unused root meaning to cover (compare "H3802");

3802.long:
Meaning: the "shoulder" (proper, i.e. upper end of the arm; as being the spot where the garments hang); figuratively, "side-piece" or lateral projection of anything.
Usage: arm, corner, shoulder(-piece), side, undersetter.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "clothe";

3803.long:
Meaning: to "enclose"; hence (in a friendly sense) to "crown", (in a hostile one) to "besiege"; also to "wait" (as restraining oneself).
Usage: beset round, compass about, be crowned, inclose round, suffer.
Source: a primitive root;

3804.long:
Meaning: properly, a "circlet", i.e. a "diadem".
Usage: crown.
Source: from "H3803";

3805.long:
Meaning: the "capital of a column".
Usage: chapiter.
Source: feminine active participle of "H3803";

3806.long:
Meaning: to "butt" or "pound".
Usage: bray.
Source: a primitive root;

3807.long:
Meaning: to "bruise" or violently "strike".
Usage: beat (down, to pieces), break in pieces, crushed, destroy, discomfit, smite, stamp. l.
Source: a primitive root;

3808.long:
Meaning: "not" (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, "no"; often used with other particles.
Usage: × before, or else, ere, except, ig(-norant), much, less, nay, neither, never, no((-ne), -r, (-thing)), (× as though...,(can-), for) not (out of), of nought, otherwise, out of, surely, as truly as, of a truth, verily, for want, whether, without.
Source: or "לוֹא"; or "לֹה"; (Deuteronomy 3:11), a primitive particle;

3809.long:
Usage: or even, neither, no(-ne, -r), (can-) not, as nothing, without.
Source: (Aramaic) or "לָה"; (Aramaic) (Daniel 4:32), corresponding to "H3808"

3810.long:
Meaning: "Lo-Debar", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Debir, Lodebar.
Source: or "לוֹ דבַר"; (Samuel 9:4,5), or "לִדְבִר"; (Joshua 13:26), (probably rather "לֹדְבַר" ); from "H3808" and "H1699"; pastureless;

3811.long:
Meaning: to "tire"; (figuratively) to "be" (or "make") "disgusted".
Usage: faint, grieve, lothe, (be, make) weary (selves).
Source: a primitive root;

3812.long:
Meaning: "Leah", a wife of Jacob.
Usage: Leah.
Source: from "H3811"; weary;

3814.long:
Meaning: properly, "muffled", i.e. "silently".
Usage: softly.
Source: from "H3813" (or perhaps for active participle of "H3874");

3815.long:
Meaning: "Laël" an Israelite.
Usage: Lael.
Source: from the prepositional prefix and "H410"; (belonging) "to God";

3816.long:
Meaning: a "community".
Usage: nation, people.
Source: or "לְאוֹם"; from an unused root meaning to "gather";

3818.long:
Meaning: "Lo-Ammi", the symbolic name of a son of Hosea.
Usage: Lo-ammi.
Source: from "H3808" and "H5971" with pronominal suffix; "not my people";

3819.long:
Meaning: "Lo-Ruchamah", the symbolic name of a son of Hosea.
Usage: Lo-ruhamah.
Source: from "H3808" and "H7355"; "not pitied";

3820.long:
Meaning: the "heart"; also used (figuratively) very widely for the "feelings", the "will" and even the "intellect"; likewise for the "centre" of anything.
Usage: care for, comfortably, consent, × considered, courag(-eous), friend(-ly), ((broken-), (hard-), (merry-), (stiff-), (stout-), double) heart(-ed), × heed, × I, kindly, midst, mind(-ed), × regard(-ed), × themselves, × unawares, understanding, × well, willingly, wisdom.
Source: a form of "H3824";

3822.long:
Meaning: "Lebaoth", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Lebaoth. See also "H1034".
Source: plural of "H3833"; lionesses;

3823.long:
Meaning: properly, to "be enclosed" (as if with "fat"); by implication (as denominative from "H3824"); to "unheart"; i.e. (in a good sense) "transport" (with love), or (in a bad sense) "stultify"; to "make cakes".
Usage: make cakes, ravish, be wise.
Source: a primitive root;

3824.long:
Meaning: the "heart" (as the most interior organ).
Usage: bethink themselves, breast, comfortably, courage, ((faint), (tender-) heart(-ed), midst, mind, × unawares, understanding.
Source: from "H3823"; used also like "H3820"

3828.long:
Meaning: "frankincense" (from its "whiteness" or perhaps that of its smoke).
Usage: (frank-) incense.
Source: or "לְבֹנָה"; from "H3836";

3829.long:
Meaning: "Lebonah", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Lebonah.
Source: the same as "H3828";

3830.long:
Meaning: a "garment" (literally or figuratively); by implication (euphemistically) a "wife".
Usage: apparel, clothed with, clothing, garment, raiment, vestment, vesture.
Source: or "לְבֻשׁ"; from "H3847";

3832.long:
Meaning: to "overthrow"; intransposed, to "fall".
Usage: fall.
Source: a primitive root;

3833.long:
Meaning: a "lion" (properly, a lioness as the fiercer (although not a roarer;)).
Usage: (great, old, stout) lion, lioness, young (lion).
Source: or (Ezekiel 19:2) "לְבִיָּא"; irregular masculine plural "לְבָאִים"; irregular feminine plural "לְבָאוֹת"; from an unused root meaning to "roar"; compare "H738"

3834.long:
Meaning: a "cake" (either as "fried" or "turned").
Usage: cake.
Source: or rather "לְבִבָה"; from "H3823" in its original sense of "fatness" (or perhaps of "folding");

3835.long:
Meaning: to "be" (or "become") "white"; to "make bricks".
Usage: make brick, be (made, make) white(-r).
Source: a primitive root; also as denominative from "H3843"

3837.long:
Meaning: "Laban", a Mesopotamian; also a place in the Desert.
Usage: Laban.
Source: the same as "H3836";

3838.long:
Meaning: "Lebana" or "Lebanah", one of the Nethinim.
Usage: Lebana, Lebanah.
Source: or "לְבָנָה"; the same as "H3842";

3839.long:
Meaning: some sort of whitish tree, perhaps the "storax".
Usage: poplar.
Source: from "H3835";

3841.long:
Meaning: "Libnah", a place in the Desert and one in Palestine.
Usage: Libnah.
Source: the same as "H3839";

3842.long:
Meaning: properly, (the) "white", i.e. the "moon".
Usage: moon. See also "H3838".
Source: from "H3835";

3843.long:
Meaning: a "brick" (from the whiteness of the clay).
Usage: (altar of) brick, tile.
Source: from "H3835";

3844.long:
Meaning: "Lebanon", a mountain range in Palestine.
Usage: Lebanon.
Source: from "H3825"; (the) "white" mountain (from its snow);

3846.long:
Meaning: a "Libnite" or descendants of Libni (collectively).
Usage: Libnites.
Source: patronymically from "H3845";

3847.long:
Meaning: properly, "wrap around", i.e. (by implication) to "put on a garment" or "clothe" (oneself, or another), literally or figuratively.
Usage: (in) apparel, arm, array (self), clothe (self), come upon, put (on, upon), wear.
Source: or "לָבֵשׁ"; a primitive root;

3849.long:
Meaning: a "log" or "measure for liquids".
Usage: log (of oil).
Source: from an unused root apparently meaning to deepen or hollow (like "H3537");

3850.long:
Meaning: "Lod", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Lod.
Source: from an unused root of uncertain signification;

3851.long:
Meaning: a "flash"; figuratively, a sharply polished "blade" or point of a weapon.
Usage: blade, bright, flame, glittering.
Source: from an usused root meaning to "gleam";

3852.long:
Usage: flame(-ming), head (of a spear).
Source: or "לַהֶבֶת"; feminine of "H3851", and meaning the same

3853.long:
Meaning: "Lehabim", a son of Mizraim, and his descendants.
Usage: Lehabim.
Source: plural of "H3851"; "flames";

3854.long:
Meaning: "intense mental application".
Usage: study.
Source: from an unused root meaning to be eager;

3855.long:
Meaning: "Lahad", an Israelite.
Usage: Lahad.
Source: from an unused root meaning to glow (compare "H3851") or else to be earnest (compare "H3854");

3856.long:
Meaning: to "be rabid" (figuratively, insane); also (from the exhaustion of frenzy) to "languish".
Usage: faint, mad.
Source: a primitive root meaning properly, to "burn", i.e. (by implication)

3857.long:
Meaning: properly, to "lick", i.e. (by implication) to "blaze".
Usage: burn (up), set on fire, flaming, kindle.
Source: a primitive root;

3858.long:
Meaning: a "blaze"; also (from the idea of enwrapping) "magic" (as covert).
Usage: flaming, enchantment.
Source: from "H3857";

3859.long:
Meaning: properly, to "burn in", i.e. (figuratively) to "rankle".
Usage: wound.
Source: a primitive root;

3860.long:
Meaning: properly "for if"; hence, "therefore".
Usage: for them (by mistake for prepositional suffix).
Source: from the prepositional prefix meaning "to" or "for" and "H2005";

3861.long:
Meaning: "therefore"; also "except".
Usage: but, except, save, therefore, wherefore.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H3860";

3862.long:
Meaning: an "assembly".
Usage: company.
Source: probably from an unused root meaning to "gather";

3863.long:
Meaning: a conditional particle; "if"; by implication (interj. as a wish) "would that!".
Usage: if (haply), peradventure, I pray thee, though, I would, would God (that).
Source: or "לֻא"; or "לוּ";

3864.long:
Meaning: "a Libyan" or inhabitant of interior Africa (only in plural).
Usage: Lubim(-s), Libyans.
Source: or "לֻבִּי"; (Daniel 11:43), partrial from a name probably derived from an unused root meaning to thirst, i.e. a dry region; apparently

3865.long:
Meaning: "Lud", the name of two nations.
Usage: Lud, Lydia.
Source: probably of foreign derivation;

3866.long:
Meaning: a "Ludite" or inhabitants of Lud (only in plural).
Usage: Ludim. Lydians.
Source: or "לוּדִיִּי"; patrial from "H3865";

3867.long:
Meaning: properly, to "twine", i.e. (by implication) to "unite", to "remain"; also to "borrow" (as a form of obligation) or (caus.) to "lend".
Usage: abide with, borrow(-er), cleave, join (self), lend(-er).
Source: a primitive root;

3868.long:
Meaning: to "turn" aside , i.e. (literally) to "depart", (figuratively) "be perverse".
Usage: depart, froward, perverse(-ness).
Source: a primitive root; (compare "H3867", "H3874" and "H3885")

3869.long:
Meaning: some kind of nut-tree, perhaps the "almond".
Usage: hazel.
Source: probably of foreign origin;

3870.long:
Meaning: "Luz", the name of two places in Palestine.
Usage: Luz.
Source: probably from "H3869" (as growing there);

3871.long:
Meaning: probably meaning to "glisten"; a "tablet" (as polished), of stone, wood or metal.
Usage: board, plate, table.
Source: or "לֻחַ"; from a primitive root;

3872.long:
Meaning: "Luchith", a place East of the Jordan.
Usage: Luhith.
Source: or "לֻחוֹת"; (Jeremiah 48:5), from the same as "H3871"; "floored";

3873.long:
Meaning: "Lochesh", an Israelite.
Usage: Hallohesh, Haloshesh (includ. the article).
Source: active participle of "H3907"; (the) enchanter;

3874.long:
Meaning: to "wrap up".
Usage: cast, wrap.
Source: a primitive root;

3876.long:
Meaning: "Lot", Abraham's nephew.
Usage: Lot.
Source: the same as "H3875";

3878.long:
Meaning: "Levi", a son of Jacob.
Usage: Levi. See also "H3879", "H3881".
Source: from "H3867"; attached;

3881.long:
Meaning: a "Levite" or descendant of Levi.
Usage: Leviite.
Source: or "לֵוִי"; patronymically from "H3878";

3882.long:
Meaning: a "wreathed" animal, i.e. a "serpent" (especially the "crocodile" or some other large sea-monster); figuratively, the constellation of the "dragon"; also as a symbol of "Babylon".
Usage: leviathan, mourning.
Source: from "H3867";

3883.long:
Meaning: a "spiral step".
Usage: winding stair. Compare "H3924".
Source: from an unused root meaning to fold back;

3884.long:
Meaning: "if not".
Usage: except, had not, if (...not), unless, were it not that.
Source: or "לוּלֵי"; from "H3863" and "H3808";

3885.long:
Meaning: to "stop" (usually over night); by implication, to "stay permanently"; hence (in a bad sense) to "be obstinate" (especially in words, to complain).
Usage: abide (all night), continue, dwell, endure, grudge, be left, lie all night, (cause to) lodge (all night, in, -ing, this night), (make to) murmur, remain, tarry (all night, that night).
Source: or "לִין"; a primitive root;

3886.long:
Meaning: to "gulp"; figuratively, to "be rash".
Usage: swallow down (up).
Source: a primitive root;

3887.long:
Meaning: properly, to "make mouths at", i.e. to "scoff"; hence (from the effort to pronounce a foreign language) to "interpret", or (generally) "intercede".
Usage: ambassador, have in derision, interpreter, make a mock, mocker, scorn(-er, -ful), teacher.
Source: a primitive root;

3889.long:
Meaning: "Lush", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Laish (from the margin). Compare "H3919".
Source: from "H3888"; kneading;

3890.long:
Meaning: properly, "adhesion", i.e. (as preposition) "with".
Usage: × thee.
Source: (Aramaic) from a root corresponding to "H3867";

3892.long:
Meaning: "fresh", i.e. "unused" or "undried".
Usage: green, moist.
Source: from an unused root meaning to be new;

3893.long:
Meaning: "freshness", i.e. "vigor".
Usage: natural force.
Source: from the same as "H3892";

3894.long:
Meaning: properly, "eaten", i.e. "food"; also "flesh", i.e. "body".
Usage: while...is eating, flesh.
Source: or "לָחֻם"; passive participle of "H3898";

3895.long:
Meaning: the "cheek" (from its "fleshiness"); hence, the "jaw"-bone.
Usage: cheek (bone), jaw (bone).
Source: from an unused root meaning to "be soft";

3896.long:
Meaning: "Lechi", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Lehi. Compare also "H7437".
Source: a form of "H3895";

3898.long:
Meaning: to "feed on"; figuratively, to "consume"; by implication, to "battle" (as destruction).
Usage: devour, eat, × ever, fight(-ing), overcome, prevail, (make) war(-ring).
Source: a primitive root;

3899.long:
Meaning: "food" (for man or beast), especially "bread", or "grain" (for making it).
Usage: (shew-) bread, × eat, food, fruit, loaf, meat, victuals.
Source: from "H3898"; See also "H1036"

3902.long:
Meaning: "Lachmi", an Israelite; or rather probably a brief form.
Usage: Lahmi. See also "H3433".
Source: from "H3899"; foodful; (or perhaps erroneous transcription) for "H1022"

3903.long:
Meaning: "Lachmam" or "Lachmas", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Lahmam.
Source: probably by erroneous transcription for "לַחְמָם"; from "H3899"; food-like;

3904.long:
Meaning: a "concubine".
Usage: concubine.
Source: (Aramaic) from an unused root of uncertain meaning;

3905.long:
Meaning: properly, to "press", i.e. (figuratively) to "distress".
Usage: afflict, crush, force, hold fast, oppress(-or), thrust self.
Source: a primitive root;

3907.long:
Meaning: to "whisper"; by implication, to "mumble a spell" (as a magician).
Usage: charmer, whisper (together).
Source: a primitive root;

3908.long:
Meaning: properly, a "whisper", i.e. by implication, (in a good sense) a private "prayer", (in a bad one) an "incantation"; concretely, an "amulet".
Usage: charmed, earring, enchantment, orator, prayer.
Source: from "H3907";

3909.long:
Meaning: properly, "covered", i.e. "secret"; by implication, "incantation"; also "secrecy" or (adverb) "covertly".
Usage: enchantment, privily, secretly, softly.
Source: a form of "H3814" or else participle from "H3874";

3910.long:
Meaning: a "gum" (from its sticky nature), probably "ladanum".
Usage: myrrh.
Source: probably from "H3874";

3911.long:
Meaning: a "kind of lizard" (from its covert habits).
Usage: lizard.
Source: from an unused root meaning to hide;

3912.long:
Meaning: "Letushim", an Arabian tribe.
Usage: Letushim.
Source: masculine plural of passive participle of "H3913"; hammered (i.e. oppressed) ones;

3913.long:
Meaning: properly, to "hammer out" (an edge), i.e. to "sharpen".
Usage: instructer, sharp(-en), whet.
Source: a primitive root;

3915.long:
Meaning: properly, a "twist" (away of the light), i.e. "night"; figuratively, "adversity".
Usage: (mid-)night (season).
Source: or (Isaiah 21:11) "לֵיל"; also "לַיְלָה"; from the same as "H3883";

3918.long:
Meaning: a "lion" (from his destructive "blows").
Usage: (old) lion.
Source: from "H3888" in the sense of "crushing";

3919.long:
Meaning: "Laish", the name of two places in Palestine.
Usage: Laish. Compare "H3889".
Source: the same as "H3918";

3920.long:
Meaning: to "catch" (in a net, trap or pit); generally, to "capture" or occupy; also to "choose" (by lot); figuratively, to "cohere".
Usage: × at all, catch (self), be frozen, be holden, stick together, take.
Source: a primitive root;

3921.long:
Meaning: something to "capture" with, i.e. a "noose".
Usage: being taken.
Source: from "H3920";

3922.long:
Meaning: "Lekah", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Lecah.
Source: from "H3212"; a journey;

3923.long:
Meaning: "Lakish", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Lachish.
Source: from an unused root of uncertain meaning;

3924.long:
Meaning: a "loop".
Usage: loop.
Source: from the same as "H3883";

3925.long:
Meaning: properly, to "goad", i.e. (by implication) to "teach" (the rod being an Oriental "incentive").
Usage: (un-) accustomed, × diligently, expert, instruct, learn, skilful, teach(-er, -ing).
Source: a primitive root;

3926.long:
Meaning: "to" or "for".
Usage: at, for, to, upon.
Source: a prolonged and separable form of the prepositional prefix;

3927.long:
Meaning: "Lemuel" or "Lemoel", a symbolic name of Solomon.
Usage: Lemuel.
Source: or "לְמוֹאֵל"; from "H3926" and "H410"; (belonging) to God;

3928.long:
Meaning: "instructed".
Usage: accustomed, disciple, learned, taught, used.
Source: or "לִמֻּד"; from "H3925";

3929.long:
Meaning: "Lemek", the name of two antediluvian patriarchs.
Usage: Lamech.
Source: from an unused root of uncertain meaning;

3932.long:
Meaning: to "deride"; by implication (as if imitating a foreigner) to "speak unintelligibly".
Usage: have in derision, laugh (to scorn), mock (on), stammering.
Source: a primitive root;

3934.long:
Meaning: a "buffoon"; also a "foreigner".
Usage: mocker, stammering.
Source: from "H3932";

3935.long:
Meaning: "Ladah", an Israelite.
Usage: Laadah.
Source: from an unused root of uncertain meaning;

3936.long:
Meaning: "Ladan", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Laadan.
Source: from the same as "H3935";

3937.long:
Meaning: to speak in a "foreign tongue".
Usage: strange language.
Source: a primitive root;

3938.long:
Meaning: to "swallow greedily"; causatively, to "feed".
Usage: feed.
Source: a primitive root;

3939.long:
Meaning: "wormwood" (regarded as poisonous, and therefore accursed).
Usage: hemlock, wormwood.
Source: from an unused root supposed to mean to curse;

3940.long:
Meaning: a "flambeau", "lamp" or "flame".
Usage: (fire-) brand, (burning) lamp, lightning, torch.
Source: or "לַפִּד"; from an unused root probably meaning to "shine";

3941.long:
Meaning: "Lappidoth", the husband of Deborah.
Usage: Lappidoth.
Source: feminine plural of "H3940";

3942.long:
Meaning: "anterior".
Usage: before.
Source: from the prepositional prefix (to or for) and "H6440";

3943.long:
Meaning: properly, to "bend", i.e. (by implication) to "clasp"; also (reflexively) to "turn" around or aside.
Usage: take hold, turn aside (self).
Source: a primitive root;

3946.long:
Meaning: "Lakkum", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Lakum.
Source: from an unused root thought to mean to stop up by a barricade; perhaps fortification;

3947.long:
Meaning: to "take" (in the widest variety of applications).
Usage: accept, bring, buy, carry away, drawn, fetch, get, infold, × many, mingle, place, receive(-ing), reserve, seize, send for, take (away, -ing, up), use, win.
Source: a primitive root;

3948.long:
Meaning: properly, something "received", i.e. (mentally) "instruction" (whether on the part of the teacher or hearer); also (in an active and sinister sense) "inveiglement".
Usage: doctrine, learning, fair speech.
Source: from "H3947";

3950.long:
Meaning: properly, to "pick" up, i.e. (generally) to "gather"; specifically, to "glean".
Usage: gather (up), glean.
Source: a primitive root;

3952.long:
Meaning: to "lick" or "lap".
Usage: lap, lick.
Source: a primitive root;

3953.long:
Meaning: to "gather" the after crop.
Usage: gather.
Source: a primitive root;

3955.long:
Meaning: (figuratively) "vigor"; also a sweet or fat "cake".
Usage: fresh, moisture.
Source: from an unused root of uncertain meaning; apparently "juice", i.e.

3956.long:
Meaning: the "tongue" (of man or animals), used literally (as the instrument of licking, eating, or speech), and figuratively (speech, an ingot, a fork of flame, a cove of water).
Usage: babbler, bay, evil speaker, language, talker, tongue, wedge.
Source: or "לָשֹׁן"; also (in plural) feminine "לְשֹׁנָה"; from "H3960";

3957.long:
Meaning: a "room" in a building (whether for storage, eating, or lodging).
Usage: chamber, parlour. Compare "H5393".
Source: from an unused root of uncertain meaning;

3958.long:
Meaning: a "gem", perhaps the "jacinth".
Usage: ligure.
Source: from an unused root of uncertain meaning;

3959.long:
Meaning: "Leshem", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Leshem.
Source: the same as "H3958";

3960.long:
Meaning: to "wag the tongue", i.e. to "calumniate".
Usage: accuse, slander.
Source: a primitive root; properly, to lick; but used only as a denominative from "H3956";

3962.long:
Meaning: "Lesha", a place probably East of the Jordan.
Usage: Lasha.
Source: from an unused root thought to mean to break through; a boiling spring;

3963.long:
Meaning: a "measure" for things dry.
Usage: half homer.
Source: from an unused root of uncertain meaning;

3966.long:
Meaning: properly, "vehemence", i.e. (with or without preposition) "vehemently"; by implication, "wholly", "speedily", etc. (often with other words as an intensive or superlative; especially when repeated).
Usage: diligently, especially, exceeding(-ly), far, fast, good, great(-ly), × louder and louder, might(-ily, -y), (so) much, quickly, (so) sore, utterly, very ( much, sore), well.
Source: from the same as "H181";

3967.long:
Meaning: a "hundred"; also as a multiplicative and a fraction.
Usage: hundred((-fold), -th), sixscore.
Source: or "מֵאיָה"; properly, a primitive numeral

3968.long:
Meaning: "Meah", a tower in Jerusalem.
Usage: Meah.
Source: the same as "H3967";

3969.long:
Meaning: a "hundred"; also as a multiplicative and a fraction}.
Usage: hundred.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H3967"; properly, a primitive numeral

3971.long:
Meaning: a "blemish" (physically or morally).
Usage: blemish, blot, spot.
Source: usually "מוּם"; as if passive participle from an unused root probably meaning to "stain"

3972.long:
Meaning: properly, a "speck" or "point", i.e. (by implication) something; with negative, "nothing".
Usage: fault, no(-ught), ought, somewhat, any (no-)thing.
Source: apparently a form of "H3971";

3974.long:
Meaning: properly, a "luminous" body or "luminary", i.e. (abstractly) "light" (as an element); figuratively, "brightness", i.e."cheerfulness"; specifically, a "chandelier".
Usage: bright, light.
Source: or "מָאֹר"; also (in plural) feminine "מְאוֹרָה"; or "מְאֹרָה"; from "H215";

3975.long:
Meaning: something "lighted", i.e. an "aperture"; by implication, a "crevice" or "hole" (of a serpent).
Usage: den.
Source: feminine passive participle of "H215";

3976.long:
Meaning: (only in the dual) a pair of "scales".
Usage: balances.
Source: from "H239";

3978.long:
Meaning: an "eatable" (includ. provender, flesh and fruit).
Usage: food, fruit, (bake-)meat(-s), victual.
Source: from "H398";

3979.long:
Meaning: something to "eat" with, i.e. a "knife".
Usage: knife.
Source: from "H398";

3982.long:
Meaning: something (authoritatively) "said", i.e. an "edict".
Usage: commandment, decree.
Source: from "H559";

3984.long:
Meaning: a "utensil".
Usage: vessel.
Source: (Aramaic) probably from a root corresponding to "H579" in the sense of an inclosure by sides;

3985.long:
Meaning: to "refuse".
Usage: refuse, × utterly.
Source: a primitive root;

3988.long:
Meaning: to "spurn"; also (intransitively) to "disappear".
Usage: abhor, cast away (off), contemn, despise, disdain, (become) loathe(some), melt away, refuse, reject, reprobate, × utterly, vile person.
Source: a primitive root;

3990.long:
Meaning: something "opaque".
Usage: darkness.
Source: from the same as "H651";

3992.long:
Meaning: to "be bitter" or (causatively) to "embitter", i.e. "be painful".
Usage: fretting, picking.
Source: a primitive root;

3993.long:
Meaning: an "ambuscade".
Usage: lie in ambush, ambushment, lurking place, lying in wait.
Source: from "H693";

3995.long:
Meaning: a "separation", i.e. (concretely) a "separate place".
Usage: separate.
Source: from "H914";

3996.long:
Meaning: an "entrance" (the place or the act); specifically "sunset" or the "west"; also (adverb with preposition) "towards".
Usage: by which came, as cometh, in coming, as men enter into, entering, entrance into, entry, where goeth, going down, westward. Compare "H4126".
Source: from "H935"; (with or without "H8121")

3999.long:
Meaning: a "deluge".
Usage: flood.
Source: from "H2986" in the sense of flowing;

4006.long:
Meaning: "Mibchar", an Israelite.
Usage: Mibhar.
Source: the same as "H4005";

4008.long:
Meaning: a "rash utterance" (hasty vow).
Usage: (that which...) uttered (out of).
Source: from "H981";

4009.long:
Meaning: properly, a "refuge", i.e. (objective) "security", or (subjective) "assurance".
Usage: confidence, hope, sure, trust.
Source: from "H982";

4012.long:
Meaning: "Mebunnai", an Israelite.
Usage: Mebunnai.
Source: from "H1129"; built up;

4013.long:
Meaning: a "fortification", "castle", or "fortified" city; figuratively, a "defender".
Usage: (de-, most) fenced, fortress, (most) strong (hold).
Source: also (in plural) feminine (Daniel 11:l5) "מִבְצָרָה"; from "H1219";

4014.long:
Meaning: "Mibtsar", an Idumaean.
Usage: Mibzar.
Source: the same as "H4013";

4017.long:
Meaning: "Mibsam", the name of an Ishmaelite and of an Israelite.
Usage: Mibsam.
Source: from the same as "H1314"; fragrant;

4019.long:
Meaning: "Magbish", an Israelite, or a place in Palestine.
Usage: Magbish.
Source: from the same as "H1378"; stiffening;

4021.long:
Meaning: a "cap" (as "hemispherical").
Usage: bonnet.
Source: from the same as "H1389";

4022.long:
Meaning: properly, a "distinguished thing"; hence something "valuable", as a product or fruit.
Usage: pleasant, precious fruit (thing).
Source: from an unused root probably meaning to be eminent;

4023.long:
Meaning: "Megiddon" or "Megiddo", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Megiddo, Megiddon.
Source: (Zechariah "H12") or "מְגִדּוֹ"; from "H1413"; rendezvous;

4024.long:
Meaning: "Migdol", a place in Egypt.
Usage: Migdol, tower.
Source: or "מִגְדֹּל"; probably of Egyptian origin;

4025.long:
Meaning: "Magdiel", an Idumaean.
Usage: Magdiel.
Source: from "H4022" and "H410"; "preciousness of God";

4026.long:
Meaning: a "tower" (from its size or height); by analogy, a "rostrum"; figuratively, a (pyramidal) "bed of flowers".
Usage: castle, flower, tower. Compare the names following.
Source: also (in plural) feminine "מִגְדָּלָה"; from "H1431";

4027.long:
Meaning: "Migdal-El", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Migdal-el.
Source: from "H4026" and "H410"; tower of God;

4028.long:
Meaning: "Migdal-Gad", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Migdal-gad.
Source: from "H4026" and "H1408"; tower of Fortune;

4029.long:
Meaning: "Migdal-Eder", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Migdal-eder, tower of the flock.
Source: from "H4026" and "H5739"; "tower of a flock";

4030.long:
Meaning: "preciousness", i.e. a "gem".
Usage: precious thing, present.
Source: from the same as "H4022";

4031.long:
Meaning: "Magog", a son of Japheth; also a barbarous northern region.
Usage: Magog.
Source: from "H1463";

4032.long:
Meaning: a "fright" (objective or subjective).
Usage: fear, terror. Compare "H4036".
Source: or (Lamentations 2:22) "מָגוּר"; from "H1481" in the sense of "fearing";

4033.long:
Meaning: a "temporary abode"; by extension, a "permanent residence".
Usage: dwelling, pilgrimage, where sojourn, be a stranger. Compare "H4032".
Source: or "מָגֻר"; from "H1481" in the sense of lodging;

4035.long:
Meaning: a "fright"; also a "granary".
Usage: barn, fear.
Source: feminine of "H4032" or of "H4033";

4036.long:
Meaning: "Magor-mis-Sabib", a symbolic name of Pashur.
Usage: Magormissabib.
Source: from "H4032" and "H5439" with the preposition inserted; affright from around;

4037.long:
Meaning: a "cutting implement", i.e. a "blade".
Usage: axe.
Source: from "H1504";

4038.long:
Meaning: a "sickle".
Usage: sickle.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "reap";

4041.long:
Meaning: properly, "accumulation", i.e. "impulse" or "direction".
Usage: sup up.
Source: from the same as "H1571";

4042.long:
Meaning: properly, to "shield"; "encompass with"; figuratively, to "rescue", to "hand safely over" (i.e. surrender).
Usage: deliver.
Source: a denominative from "H4043";

4043.long:
Meaning: a "shield" (i.e. the small one or buckler); figuratively, a "protector"; also the scaly "hide" of the crocodile.
Usage: × armed, buckler, defence, ruler, scale, shield.
Source: also (in plural) feminine "מְגִנָּה"; from "H1598";

4044.long:
Meaning: a "covering" (in a bad sense), i.e. "blindness" or "obduracy".
Usage: sorrow. See also "H4043".
Source: from "H4042";

4046.long:
Meaning: a "pestilence"; by analogy, "defeat".
Usage: (× be) plague(-d), slaughter, stroke.
Source: from "H5062";

4047.long:
Meaning: "Magpiash", an Israelite.
Usage: Magpiash.
Source: apparently from "H1479" or "H5062" and "H6211"; exterminator of (the) moth;

4048.long:
Meaning: to "yield up"; intensively, to "precipitate".
Usage: cast down, terror.
Source: a primitive root;

4051.long:
Meaning: "Migron", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Migron.
Source: from "H4048"; "precipice";

4053.long:
Meaning: something "thrown off" (by the spade), i.e. a "clod".
Usage: clod.
Source: from "H1640";

4054.long:
Meaning: a "suburb" (i.e. open country whither flocks are driven from pasture); hence, the "area around a building", or the "margin of the sea".
Usage: cast out, suburb.
Source: also (in plural) feminine (Ezekiel 27:28) "מִגְרָשָׁה"; from "H1644";

4055.long:
Meaning: properly, "extent", i.e. "height"; also a "measure"; by implication, a "vesture" (as measured); also a "carpet".
Usage: armour, clothes, garment, judgment, measure, raiment, stature.
Source: or "מֵד"; from "H4058";

4057.long:
Meaning: a "pasture" (i.e. open field, whither cattle are driven); by implication, a "desert"; also "speech" (including its organs).
Usage: desert, south, speech, wilderness.
Source: from "H1696" in the sense of driving;

4058.long:
Meaning: properly, to "stretch"; by implication, to "measure" (as if by "stretching" a line); figuratively, to "be extended".
Usage: measure, mete, stretch self.
Source: a primitive root;

4060.long:
Meaning: properly, "extension", i.e. "height" or "breadth"; also a "measure" (including its standard); hence a "portion" (as measured) or a "vestment"; specifically, "tribute" (as measured).
Usage: garment, measure(-ing, meteyard, piece, size, (great) stature, tribute, wide.
Source: feminine of "H4055";

4061.long:
Meaning: "tribute in money".
Usage: toll, tribute.
Source: (Aramaic) or "מִנְדָּה"; (Aramaic), corresponding to "H4060";

4062.long:
Meaning: "goldmaking", i.e. "exactness".
Usage: golden city.
Source: perhaps from the equivalent of "H1722";

4063.long:
Meaning: properly, "extent", i.e. "measure"; by implication, a "dress" (as measured).
Usage: garment.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "stretch";

4066.long:
Meaning: a "contest" or "quarrel".
Usage: brawling, contention(-ous), discord, strife. Compare "H4079", "H4090".
Source: from "H1777";

4067.long:
Meaning: "extensiveness", i.e. "height".
Usage: stature.
Source: from the same as "H4063";

4068.long:
Meaning: "Madon", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Madon.
Source: the same as "H4067";

4069.long:
Meaning: "what" (is) "known?"; i.e. (by implication) (adverbially) "why?".
Usage: how, wherefore, why.
Source: or "מַדֻּעַ"; from "H4100" and the passive participle of "H3045";

4071.long:
Meaning: a "pile" of fuel.
Usage: pile (for fire).
Source: or "מְדֻרָה"; from "H1752" in the sense of "accumulation";

4074.long:
Meaning: "Madai", a country of central Asia.
Usage: Madai, Medes, Media.
Source: of foreign derivation;

4075.long:
Meaning: a "Madian" or native of Madai.
Usage: Mede.
Source: patrial from "H4074";

4080.long:
Meaning: "Midjan", a son of Abraham; also his country and (collectively) his descendants.
Usage: Midian, Midianite.
Source: the same as "H4079";

4082.long:
Meaning: properly, a "judgeship", i.e. "jurisdiction"; by implication, a "district" (as ruled by a judge); generally, a "region".
Usage: (× every) province.
Source: from "H1777";

4084.long:
Meaning: a "Midjanite" or descendant (native) of Midjan.
Usage: Midianite. Compare "H4092".
Source: patronymical or patrial from "H4080";

4086.long:
Meaning: "Madmen", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Madmen.
Source: from the same as "H1828"; dunghill;

4087.long:
Meaning: a "dunghill".
Usage: dunghill.
Source: feminine from the same as "H1828";

4088.long:
Meaning: "Madmenah", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Madmenah.
Source: the same as "H4087";

4089.long:
Meaning: "Madmannah", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Madmannah.
Source: a variation for "H4087";

4091.long:
Meaning: "Medan", a son of Abraham.
Usage: Medan.
Source: the same as "H4090";

4093.long:
Meaning: "intelligence" or "consciousness".
Usage: knowledge, science, thought.
Source: or "מַדַּע"; from "H3045";

4095.long:
Meaning: properly, a "step"; by implication, a "steep" or "inaccessible place".
Usage: stair, steep place.
Source: from an unused root meaning to step;

4096.long:
Meaning: a "treading", i.e. a place for stepping on.
Usage: (foot-) breadth.
Source: from "H1869";

4097.long:
Meaning: properly, an "investigation", i.e. (by implication) a "treatise" or "elaborate compilation".
Usage: story.
Source: from "H1875";

4098.long:
Meaning: a "threshing", i.e. (concretely and figuratively) "down-trodden" people.
Usage: threshing.
Source: from "H1758";

4099.long:
Meaning: "Medatha", the father of Haman.
Usage: Hammedatha (including the article).
Source: of Persian origin;

4100.long:
Meaning: properly, interrogative "what?" (including "how?" "why?" "when?"); but also exclamation, "what!" (including "how!"), or indefinitely "what" (including "whatever", and even relatively, "that which"); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses.
Usage: how (long, oft, (-soever)), (no-) thing, what (end, good, purpose, thing), whereby(-fore, -in, -to, -with), (for) why.
Source: or "מַה"; or "מָ"; or "מַ"; also "מֶה"; a primitive particle;

4101.long:
Usage: how great (mighty), that which, what(-soever), why.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H4100"

4102.long:
Meaning: properly, to "question" or "hesitate", i.e. (by implication) to "be reluctant".
Usage: delay, linger, stay selves, tarry.
Source: apparently a denominative from "H4100";

4103.long:
Meaning: "confusion" or uproar.
Usage: destruction, discomfiture, trouble, tumult, vexation, vexed.
Source: from "H1949";

4104.long:
Meaning: "Mehuman", a eunuch of Xerxes.
Usage: Mehuman.
Source: of Persian origin;

4105.long:
Meaning: "Mehetabel", the name of an Edomitish man and woman.
Usage: Mehetabeel, Mehetabel.
Source: from "H3190" (augmented) and "H410"; "bettered of God";

4106.long:
Meaning: "quick"; hence, "skilful".
Usage: diligent, hasty, ready.
Source: or "מָהִר"; from "H4116";

4107.long:
Meaning: properly, to "cut down" or "reduce", i.e. by implication, to "adulterate".
Usage: mixed.
Source: a primitive root;

4108.long:
Meaning: a "walking" (plural collectively), i.e. "access".
Usage: place to walk.
Source: from "H1980";

4109.long:
Meaning: a "walk", i.e. a "passage" or a "distance".
Usage: journey, walk.
Source: from "H1980";

4111.long:
Meaning: "Mahalalel", the name of an antediluvian patriarch and of an Israelite.
Usage: Mahalaleel.
Source: from "H4110" and "H410"; praise of God;

4113.long:
Meaning: perhaps "an abyss".
Usage: deep pit.
Source: from an unused root of uncertain meaning;

4115.long:
Meaning: a "wrench", i.e. the "stocks".
Usage: prison, stocks.
Source: from "H2015";

4116.long:
Meaning: properly, to "be liquid" or "flow" easily, i.e. (by implication); to "hurry" (in a good or a bad sense); often used (with another verb) adverbially, "promptly".
Usage: be carried headlong, fearful, (cause to make, in, make) haste(-n, -ily), (be) hasty, (fetch, make ready) × quickly, rash, × shortly, (be so) × soon, make speed, × speedily, × straightway, × suddenly, swift.
Source: a primitive root;

4117.long:
Meaning: to "bargain" (for a wife), i.e. to "wed".
Usage: endow, × surely.
Source: a primitive root (perhaps rather the same as "H4116" through the idea of readiness in assent);

4118.long:
Meaning: properly, "hurrying"; hence (adverbially) "in a hurry".
Usage: hasteth, hastily, at once, quickly, soon, speedily, suddenly.
Source: from "H4116";

4120.long:
Meaning: properly, a "hurry"; hence (adverbially) "promptly".
Usage: hastily, quickly, shortly, soon, make (with) speed(-ily), swiftly.
Source: feminine of "H4118";

4122.long:
Meaning: "Maher-Shalal-Chash-Baz"; the symbolical name of the son of Isaiah.
Usage: Maher-sha-lal-bash-baz.
Source: from "H4118" and "H7998" and "H2363" and "H957"; "hasting" (is he (the enemy) to the) "booty", "swift" (to the) "prey";

4124.long:
Meaning: "Moab", an incestuous son of Lot; also his territory and descendants.
Usage: Moab.
Source: from a prolonged form of the prepositional prefix m- and "H1"; "from" (her [the mother's]) "father";

4125.long:
Meaning: a "Moabite" or "Moabitess", i.e. a descendant from Moab.
Usage: (woman) of Moab, Moabite(-ish, -ss).
Source: feminine "מוֹאָבִיָּה"; or "מוֹאָבִית"; patronymical from "H4124";

4127.long:
Meaning: to "melt", i.e. literally (to "soften", flow down, "disappear"), or figuratively (to "fear", "faint").
Usage: consume, dissolve, (be) faint(-hearted), melt (away), make soft.
Source: a primitive root;

4131.long:
Meaning: to "waver"; by implication, to "slip", "shake", "fall".
Usage: be carried, cast, be out of course, be fallen in decay, × exceedingly, fall(-ing down), be (re-) moved, be ready, shake, slide, slip.
Source: a primitive root;

4132.long:
Meaning: a "wavering", i.e. "fall"; by implication, a "pole" (as shaking); hence, a "yoke" (as essentially a bent pole).
Usage: bar, be moved, staff, yoke.
Source: from "H4131";

4133.long:
Meaning: a "pole"; by implication, an ox-"bow"; hence, a "yoke" (either literal or figurative).
Usage: bands, heavy, staves, yoke.
Source: feminine of "H4132";

4134.long:
Meaning: to "become thin", i.e. (figuratively) "be impoverished".
Usage: be (waxen) poor(-er).
Source: a primitive root;

4135.long:
Meaning: to "cut" short, i.e. "curtail" (specifically the prepuce, i.e. to "circumcise"); by implication, to "blunt"; figuratively, to "destroy".
Usage: circumcise(-ing), selves), cut down (in pieces), destroy, × must needs.
Source: a primitive root;

4136.long:
Meaning: properly, "abrupt", i.e. "a precipice"; by implication, the "front"; used only adverbially (with prepositional prefix) "opposite".
Usage: (over) against, before, (fore-) front, from, (God-) ward, toward, with.
Source: or "מוֹל"; (Deuteronomy 1:1), or "מוֹאל"; (Nehemiah 12:38), or "מֻל"; (Numbers 22:5), from "H4135";

4137.long:
Meaning: "Moladah", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Moladah.
Source: from "H3205"; "birth";

4138.long:
Meaning: "nativity" (plural birth-place); by implication, "lineage", "native country"; also "offspring", "family".
Usage: begotten, born, issue, kindred, native(-ity).
Source: from "H3205";

4141.long:
Meaning: a "turn", i.e. "circuit" (of a building).
Usage: winding about.
Source: from "H5437";

4142.long:
Meaning: a "reversal", i.e. the "backside" (of a gem), "fold" (of a double-leaved door), "transmutation" (of a name).
Usage: being changed, inclosed, be set, turning.
Source: or "מֻסַבָּה"; feminine of "H4141";

4145.long:
Meaning: a "foundation"; figuratively, an "appointment".
Usage: foundation, grounded. Compare "H4328".
Source: feminine of "H4143";

4147.long:
Meaning: properly, "chastisement", i.e. (by implication) a "halter"; figuratively, "restraint".
Usage: band, bond.
Source: also (in plural) feminine "מוֹסֵרָה"; or "מֹסְרָה"; from "H3256";

4148.long:
Meaning: properly, "chastisement"; figuratively, "reproof", "warning" or "instruction"; also "restraint".
Usage: bond, chastening(-eth), chastisement, check, correction, discipline, doctrine, instruction, rebuke.
Source: from "H3256";

4149.long:
Meaning: "Moserah", a place in the Desert.
Usage: Mosera.
Source: or (plural) "מֹסְרוֹת" feminine of "H4147"; correction or corrections;

4150.long:
Meaning: properly, an "appointment", i.e. a fixed "time" or season; specifically, a "festival"; conventionally a "year"; by implication, an "assembly" (as convened for a definite purpose); technically the "congregation"; by extension, the "place of meeting"; also a "signal" (as appointed beforehand).
Usage: appointed (sign, time), (place of, solemn) assembly, congregation, (set, solemn) feast, (appointed, due) season, solemn(-ity), synogogue, (set) time (appointed).
Source: or "מֹעֵד"; or (feminine) "מוֹעָדָה"; (2 Chronicles 8:13), from "H3259";

4151.long:
Meaning: properly, an "assembly" figuratively, a "troop".
Usage: appointed time.
Source: from "H3259"; (as in "H4150");

4153.long:
Meaning: "Moadjah", an Israelite.
Usage: Moadiah. Compare "H4573".
Source: from "H4151" and "H3050"; "assembly of Jah";

4154.long:
Meaning: properly, "made to slip", i.e. "dislocated".
Usage: out of joint.
Source: feminine passive participle of "H4571";

4155.long:
Meaning: properly, "covered", i.e. "dark"; abstractly, "obscurity", i.e. "distress".
Usage: dimness.
Source: from "H5774";

4158.long:
Meaning: "Mophaath" or "Mephaath", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Mephaath.
Source: (Jeremiah 48:21) or "מֵיפַעַת"; or "מֵפַעַת"; from "H3313"; illuminative;

4159.long:
Meaning: a "miracle"; by implication, a "token" or "omen".
Usage: miracle, sign, wonder(-ed at).
Source: or "מֹפֵת"; from "H3302" in the sense of "conspicuousness";

4160.long:
Meaning: to "press", i.e. (figuratively) to "oppress".
Usage: extortioner.
Source: a primitive root;

4161.long:
Meaning: a "going forth", i.e. (the act) an "egress", or (the place) an "exit"; hence, a "source" or "product"; specifically, "dawn", the "rising" of the sun (the "East"), "exportation", "utterance", a "gate", a "fountain", a "mine", a "meadow" (as producing grass).
Usage: brought out, bud, that which came out, east, going forth, goings out, that which (thing that) is gone out, outgoing, proceeded out, spring, vein, (water-) course (springs).
Source: or "מֹצָא"; from "H3318";

4162.long:
Meaning: "Motsa", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Moza.
Source: the same as "H4161";

4163.long:
Meaning: a "family descent"; also a "sewer".
Usage: draught house; going forth.
Source: feminine of "H4161"; (marg.; compare "H6675")

4164.long:
Meaning: "narrowness"; figuratively, "distress".
Usage: anguish, is straitened, straitness.
Source: or "מוּצָק"; from "H3332";

4165.long:
Meaning: properly, "fusion", i.e. literally, a "casting" (of metal); figuratively, a "mass" (of clay).
Usage: casting, hardness.
Source: from "H5694";

4166.long:
Meaning: properly, something "poured" out, i.e. a "casting" (of metal); by implication, a tube (as cast).
Usage: when it was cast, pipe.
Source: or "מֻצָקָה"; from "H3332";

4167.long:
Meaning: to "jeer", i.e. (intens.) "blaspheme".
Usage: be corrupt.
Source: a primitive root;

4168.long:
Meaning: a "fire" or "fuel"; abstractly, a "conflagration".
Usage: burning, hearth.
Source: from "H3344";

4170.long:
Meaning: a "noose" (for catching animals) (literally or figuratively); by implication, a "hook" (for the nose).
Usage: be ensnared, gin, (is) snare(-d), trap.
Source: or "מֹקֵשׁ"; from "H3369";

4171.long:
Meaning: to "alter"; by implication, to "barter", to "dispose of".
Usage: × at all, (ex-) change, remove.
Source: a primitive root;

4172.long:
Meaning: "fear"; by implication, a "fearful" thing or deed.
Usage: dread, (that ought to be) fear(-ed), terribleness, terror.
Source: or "מֹרָא"; or "מוֹרָה"; (Psalm 9:20), from "H3372";

4173.long:
Meaning: a threshing "sledge".
Usage: threshing instrument.
Source: or "מֹרַג"; from an unused root meaning to "triturate";

4174.long:
Meaning: a "descent"; as architecture, an "ornamental appendage", perhaps a "festoon".
Usage: going down, steep place, thin work.
Source: from "H3381";

4175.long:
Meaning: an "archer"; also "teacher" or "teaching"; also the "early rain".
Usage: (early) rain.
Source: from "H3384"; (see "H3138")

4176.long:
Meaning: "Moreh", a Canaanite; also a hill (perhaps named from him).
Usage: Moreh.
Source: or "מֹרֶה"; the same as "H4175";

4177.long:
Meaning: a "razor".
Usage: razor.
Source: from "H4171" in the sense of "shearing";

4179.long:
Meaning: "Morijah", a hill in Palestine.
Usage: Moriah.
Source: or "מֹרִיָּה"; from "H7200" and "H3050"; "seen of Jah";

4181.long:
Meaning: a "possession".
Usage: heritage, inheritance, possession.
Source: feminine of "H4180";

4182.long:
Meaning: "Moresheth-Gath", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Moresheth-gath.
Source: from "H3423" and "H1661"; possession of Gath;

4183.long:
Meaning: a "Morashtite" or inhabitant of Moresheth-Gath.
Usage: Morashthite.
Source: patrial from "H4182";

4184.long:
Meaning: to "touch".
Usage: feel, handle.
Source: a primitive root;

4185.long:
Meaning: to "withdraw" (both literally and figuratively, whether intransitive or transitive).
Usage: cease, depart, go back, remove, take away.
Source: a primitive root (perhaps rather the same as "H4184" through the idea of receding by "contact");

4186.long:
Meaning: a "seat"; figuratively, a "site"; abstractly, a "session"; by extension an "abode" (the place or the time); by implication, "population".
Usage: assembly, dwell in, dwelling(-place), wherein (that) dwelt (in), inhabited place, seat, sitting, situation, sojourning.
Source: or "מֹשָׁב"; from "H3427";

4187.long:
Meaning: "Mushi", a Levite.
Usage: Mushi.
Source: or "מֻשִּׁי"; from "H4184"; sensitive;

4188.long:
Meaning: a "Mushite" (collectively) or descendants of Mushi.
Usage: Mushites.
Source: patronymical from "H4187";

4189.long:
Meaning: something "drawing", i.e. (figuratively) a "cord".
Usage: band.
Source: act participle feminine of "H4900";

4191.long:
Meaning: to "die" (literally or figuratively); causatively, to "kill".
Usage: × at all, × crying, (be) dead (body, man, one), (put to, worthy of) death, destroy(-er), (cause to, be like to, must) die, kill, necro(-mancer), × must needs, slay, × surely, × very suddenly, × in (no) wise.
Source: a primitive root;

4192.long:
Meaning: "'To die for the son'", probably the title of a popular song.
Usage: death, Muthlabben.
Source: (Psalm 48:14) or "מוּת לַבֵּן"; from "H4191" and "H1121" with the preposition and article interposed;

4194.long:
Meaning: "death" (natural or violent); concretely, the "dead", their place or state (hades); figuratively, "pestilence", "ruin".
Usage: (be) dead(-ly), death, die(-d).
Source: from "H4191";

4195.long:
Meaning: literally "gain"; figuratively, "superiority".
Usage: plenteousness, preeminence, profit.
Source: from "H3498";

4197.long:
Meaning: "tempered wine".
Usage: liquor.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "mingle" (water with wine);

4198.long:
Meaning: "exhausted".
Usage: burnt.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "suck out";

4199.long:
Meaning: "Mizzah", an Edomite.
Usage: Mizzah.
Source: probably from an unused root meaning to faint with fear; "terror";

4200.long:
Meaning: a "granary".
Usage: garner.
Source: probably from an unused root meaning to gather in;

4201.long:
Meaning: a "door-post" (as "prominent").
Usage: (door, side) post.
Source: or "מְזֻזָה"; from the same as "H2123";

4204.long:
Meaning: "treachery", i.e. a "plot".
Usage: wound.
Source: from "H2114" in the sense of turning aside from truth;

4205.long:
Meaning: a "bandage", i.e. "remedy"; hence, a "sore" (as needing a compress).
Usage: bound up, wound.
Source: or "מָזֹר"; from "H2115" in the sense of binding up;

4206.long:
Meaning: a "belt" (as movable).
Usage: girdle, strength.
Source: or "מֵזַח"; from "H2118";

4207.long:
Meaning: a "fork".
Usage: fleshhook.
Source: or (feminine) "מִזְלָגָה"; from an unused root meaning to "draw" up;

4208.long:
Meaning: a "constellation", i.e. "Zodiacal sign" (perhaps as affecting the weather).
Usage: planet. Compare "H4216".
Source: apparently from "H5140" in the sense of raining;

4209.long:
Meaning: a "plan", usually evil ("machination"), sometimes good ("sagacity").
Usage: (wicked) device, discretion, intent, witty invention, lewdness, mischievous (device), thought, wickedly.
Source: from "H2161";

4210.long:
Meaning: properly, instrumental "music"; by implication, a "poem" set to notes.
Usage: psalm.
Source: from "H2167";

4212.long:
Meaning: a "tweezer" (only in the plural).
Usage: snuffers.
Source: from "H2168";

4213.long:
Meaning: "fewness"; by implication, as superlative "diminutiveness".
Usage: few, × very.
Source: from the same as "H2191";

4214.long:
Meaning: a winnowing "shovel" (as scattering the chaff).
Usage: fan.
Source: from "H2219";

4215.long:
Meaning: properly, a "scatterer", i.e. the "north wind" (as dispersing clouds; only in plural).
Usage: north.
Source: apparently from "H2219";

4216.long:
Meaning: "some noted constellation" (only in the plural), perhaps collectively, the "zodiac".
Usage: Mazzoroth. Compare "H4208".
Source: apparently from "H5144" in the sense of distinction;

4217.long:
Meaning: "sunrise", i.e. the "east".
Usage: east (side, -ward), (sun-) rising (of the sun).
Source: from "H2224";

4219.long:
Meaning: a "bowl" (as if for sprinkling).
Usage: bason, bowl.
Source: from "H2236";

4220.long:
Meaning: "fat"; figuratively, "rich".
Usage: fatling (one).
Source: from "H4229" in the sense of "greasing";

4221.long:
Meaning: "fat", i.e. "marrow".
Usage: marrow.
Source: from the same as "H4220";

4222.long:
Meaning: to "rub" or "strike" the hands together (in exultation).
Usage: clap.
Source: a primitive root;

4223.long:
Meaning: to "strike in pieces"; also to "arrest"; specifically to "impale".
Usage: hang, smite, stay.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H4222";

4225.long:
Meaning: a "junction", i.e. seam or sewed piece.
Usage: coupling.
Source: from "H2266";

4226.long:
Meaning: a "joiner", i.e. "brace" or "cramp".
Usage: coupling, joining.
Source: from "H2266";

4227.long:
Meaning: a "pan for baking in".
Usage: pan.
Source: from the same as "H2281";

4229.long:
Meaning: properly, to "stroke" or "rub"; by implication, to "erase"; also to "smooth" (as if with oil), i.e. "grease" or "make fat"; also to "touch", i.e. "reach to".
Usage: abolish, blot out, destroy, full of marrow, put out, reach unto, × utterly, wipe (away, out).
Source: a primitive root;

4230.long:
Meaning: an instrument for marking a circle, i.e. "compasses".
Usage: compass.
Source: from "H2328";

4231.long:
Meaning: a "harbor" (as shut in by the shore).
Usage: haven.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "enclose";

4232.long:
Meaning: "Mechujael" or "Mechijael", an antediluvian patriarch.
Usage: Mehujael.
Source: or "מְחִיּיָאֵל"; from "H4229" and "H410"; smitten of God;

4233.long:
Meaning: a "Machavite" or inhabitant of some place named Machaveh.
Usage: Mahavite.
Source: apparently a patrial, but from an unknown place (in the plural only for a singular);

4235.long:
Meaning: "Machol", an Israelite.
Usage: Mahol.
Source: the same as "H4234"; "dancing";

4238.long:
Meaning: "Machazioth", an Israelite.
Usage: Mahazioth.
Source: feminine plural from "H2372"; visions;

4240.long:
Meaning: "Mechida", one of the Nethinim.
Usage: Mehida.
Source: from "H2330"; "junction";

4241.long:
Meaning: "preservation of life"; hence, "sustenance"; also the "live flesh", i.e. the "quick".
Usage: preserve life, quick, recover selves, reviving, sustenance, victuals.
Source: from "H2421";

4242.long:
Meaning: "price", "payment", "wages".
Usage: gain, hire, price, sold, worth.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "buy";

4243.long:
Meaning: "Mechir", an Israelite.
Usage: Mehir.
Source: the same as "H4242"; "price";

4244.long:
Meaning: "Machlah", the name apparently of two Israelitesses.
Usage: Mahlah.
Source: from "H2470"; "sickness";

4249.long:
Meaning: "Machli", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Mahli.
Source: from "H2470"; sick;

4250.long:
Meaning: a "Machlite" or (collectively) descendants of Machli.
Usage: Mahlites.
Source: patronymical from "H4249";

4252.long:
Meaning: a (sacrificial) "knife" (as gliding through the flesh).
Usage: knife.
Source: from "H2498";

4253.long:
Meaning: a "ringlet of hair" (as gliding over each other).
Usage: lock.
Source: from "H2498";

4254.long:
Meaning: a "mantle" (as easily "drawn off").
Usage: changeable suit of apparel, change of raiment.
Source: from "H2502";

4255.long:
Meaning: a "section" (of the Levites).
Usage: course.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H4256";

4256.long:
Meaning: a "section" (of Levites, people or soldiers).
Usage: company, course, division, portion. See also "H5555".
Source: from "H2505";

4257.long:
Meaning: "'Machalath'", probably the title (initial word) of a popular song.
Usage: Mahalath.
Source: from "H2470"; "sickness";

4258.long:
Meaning: "Machalath", the name of an Ishmaelitess and of an Israelitess.
Usage: Mahalath.
Source: the same as "H4257"; "sickness";

4259.long:
Meaning: a "Mecholathite" or inhabitant of Abel-Mecholah.
Usage: Mecholathite.
Source: patrial from "H65";

4260.long:
Meaning: something "buttery" (i.e. unctuous and pleasant), as (figuratively) "flattery".
Usage: × than butter.
Source: a denominative from "H2529";

4261.long:
Meaning: "delightful"; hence, "a delight", i.e. object of affection or desire.
Usage: beloved, desire, goodly, lovely, pleasant (thing).
Source: from "H2530";

4262.long:
Meaning: "desired"; hence, a "valuable".
Usage: pleasant thing.
Source: or "מַחְמוּד"; from "H2530";

4263.long:
Meaning: properly, "sympathy".
Usage: pitieth.
Source: from "H2550"; (by paronomasia with "H4261") delight

4264.long:
Meaning: an "encampment" (of travellers or troops); hence, an "army", whether literal (of soldiers) or figurative (of dancers, angels, cattle, locusts, stars; or even the sacred courts).
Usage: army, band, battle, camp, company, drove, host, tents.
Source: from "H2583";

4265.long:
Meaning: "Machaneh-Dan", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Mahaneh-dan.
Source: from "H4264" and "H1835"; "camp of Dan";

4266.long:
Meaning: "Machanajim", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Mahanaim.
Source: dual of "H4264"; "double camp";

4268.long:
Meaning: a "shelter" (literally or figuratively).
Usage: hope, (place of) refuge, shelter, trust.
Source: or "מַחְסֶה"; from "H2620";

4270.long:
Meaning: "deficiency"; hence, "impoverishment".
Usage: lack, need, penury, poor, poverty, want.
Source: or "מַחְסֹר"; from "H2637";

4271.long:
Meaning: "Machsejah", an Israelite.
Usage: Maaseiah.
Source: from "H4268" and "H3050"; refuge of (i.e. in) Jah;

4272.long:
Meaning: to "dash" asunder; by implication, to "crush", "smash" or violently "plunge"; figuratively, to "subdue" or "destroy".
Usage: dip, pierce (through), smite (through), strike through, wound.
Source: a primitive root;

4274.long:
Meaning: properly, a "hewing"; concretely, a "quarry".
Usage: hewed(-n).
Source: from "H2672";

4276.long:
Meaning: a "halving" or the "middle".
Usage: half (so much), mid(-day).
Source: from "H2673";

4277.long:
Meaning: to "crush".
Usage: smite off.
Source: a primitive root;

4278.long:
Meaning: properly, "scrutinized", i.e. (by implication) a "recess".
Usage: deep place.
Source: from "H2713";

4279.long:
Meaning: properly, "deferred", i.e. the "morrow"; usually (adverbially) "tomorrow"; indefinitely, "hereafter".
Usage: time to come, tomorrow.
Source: probably from "H309";

4280.long:
Meaning: a "sink".
Usage: draught house.
Source: from the same as "H2716";

4283.long:
Meaning: the "morrow" or (adverbially) "tomorrow".
Usage: morrow, next day.
Source: or "מׇחֳרָתָם"; (1 Samuel 30:17), feminine from the same as "H4279";

4284.long:
Meaning: a "contrivance", i.e. (concretely) a "texture", "machine", or (abstractly) "intention", "plan" (whether bad, a plot; or good, advice).
Usage: cunning (work), curious work, device(-sed), imagination, invented, means, purpose, thought.
Source: or "מַחֲשֶׁבֶת"; from "H2803";

4285.long:
Meaning: "darkness"; concretely, a "dark place".
Usage: dark(-ness, place).
Source: from "H2821";

4287.long:
Meaning: "Machath", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Mahath.
Source: probably from "H4229"; erasure;

4288.long:
Meaning: properly, a "dissolution"; concretely, a "ruin", or (abstractly) "consternation".
Usage: destruction, dismaying, ruin, terror.
Source: from "H2846";

4289.long:
Meaning: a "pan" for live coals.
Usage: censer, firepan, snuffdish.
Source: the same as "H4288" in the sense of "removal";

4290.long:
Meaning: a "burglary"; figuratively, "unexpected examination".
Usage: breaking up, secret search.
Source: from "H2864";

4291.long:
Meaning: to "arrive", "extend" or "happen".
Usage: come, reach.
Source: (Aramaic) or "מְטָה"; (Aramaic), apparently corresponding to "H4672" in the intransitive sense of being found present;

4292.long:
Meaning: a "broom" (as removing "dirt" (compare English 'to dust', i.e. remove dust)")".
Usage: besom.
Source: apparently a denominative from "H2916";

4294.long:
Meaning: a "branch" (as "extending"); figuratively, a "tribe"; also a "rod", whether for chastising (figuratively, "correction"), ruling (a "sceptre"), throwing (a "lance"), or walking (a "staff"; figuratively, a "support" of life, e.g. bread).
Usage: rod, staff, tribe.
Source: or (feminine) "מַטָּה"; from "H5186";

4295.long:
Meaning: "downward", "below" or "beneath"; often adverbially with or without prefixes.
Usage: beneath, down(-ward), less, very low, under(-neath).
Source: from "H5786" with directive enclitic appended;

4296.long:
Meaning: a "bed" (as extended) for sleeping or eating; by analogy, a "sofa", "litter" or "bier".
Usage: bed(-chamber), bier.
Source: from "H5186";

4300.long:
Meaning: an "iron bar" (as forged).
Usage: bar.
Source: from "H2904" in the sense of "hammering out";

4301.long:
Meaning: a "secret" storehouse; hence, a "secreted" valuable (buried); generally "money".
Usage: hidden riches, (hid) treasure(-s).
Source: or "מַטְמֹן"; or "מַטְמֻן"; from "H2934";

4302.long:
Meaning: something "planted", i.e. the place (a "garden" or vineyard), or the thing (a "plant", figuratively or men); by implication, the act, "planting".
Usage: plant(-ation, -ing).
Source: from "H5193";

4303.long:
Meaning: a "delicacy".
Usage: dainty (meat), savoury meat.
Source: or (feminine) "מַטְעַמָּה"; from "H2938";

4304.long:
Meaning: a wide "cloak" (for a woman).
Usage: vail, wimple.
Source: from "H2946";

4305.long:
Meaning: to "rain".
Usage: (cause to) rain (upon).
Source: a primitive root;

4307.long:
Meaning: a "jail" (as a guard-house); also an "aim" (as being closely watched).
Usage: mark, prison.
Source: or "מַטָּרָה"; from "H5201";

4310.long:
Meaning: "who?" (occasionally, by a peculiar idiom, of things); also (indefinitely) "whoever"; often used in oblique construction with prefix or suffix.
Usage: any (man), × he, × him, O that! what, which, who(-m, -se, -soever), would to God.
Source: an interrogative pronoun of persons, as "H4100" is of things,

4311.long:
Meaning: "Medeba", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Medeba.
Source: from "H4325" and "H1679"; "water of quiet";

4312.long:
Meaning: "Medad", an Israelite.
Usage: Medad.
Source: from "H3032" in the sense of "loving"; "affectionate";

4313.long:
Meaning: "Me-haj-Jarkon", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Me-jarkon.
Source: from "H4325" and "H3420" with the art. interposed; water of the yellowness;

4314.long:
Meaning: "Me-Zahab", an Edomite.
Usage: Mezahab.
Source: from "H4325" and "H2091", "water of gold";

4316.long:
Meaning: "Mica", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Micha.
Source: a variation for "H4318";

4317.long:
Meaning: "Mikael", the name of an archangel and of nine Israelites.
Usage: Michael.
Source: from "H4310" and (the prefix derivative from) "H3588" and "H410"; "who" (is) "like God"?;

4318.long:
Meaning: "Micah", the name of seven Israelites.
Usage: Micah, Micaiah, Michah.
Source: an abbreviated form of "H4320";

4319.long:
Meaning: "Mikehu", an Israelite prophet.
Usage: Micaiah (2 Chronicles 18:8).
Source: a contr. for "H4321";

4320.long:
Meaning: "Micajah", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Micah, Michaiah. Compare "H4318".
Source: from "H4310" and (the prefix derivative from) "H3588" and "H3050"; who (is) like Jah?;

4321.long:
Meaning: "Mikajah", the name of three Israelites.
Usage: Micah, Micaiah, Michaiah.
Source: or "מִכָיְהוּ"; (Jeremiah 36:11), abbreviated form for "H4322";

4322.long:
Meaning: "Mikajah", the name of an Israelite and an Israelitess.
Usage: Michaiah.
Source: for "H4320";

4323.long:
Meaning: properly, a "container", i.e. a "streamlet".
Usage: brook.
Source: from "H3201";

4324.long:
Meaning: "Mikal", Saul's daughter.
Usage: Michal.
Source: apparently the same as "H4323"; "revulet";

4325.long:
Meaning: "water"; figuratively, "juice"; by euphemism, "urine", "semen".
Usage: piss, wasting, water(-ing, (-course, -flood, -spring)).
Source: dual of a primitive noun (but used in a singular sense);

4326.long:
Meaning: "Mijamin", the name of three Israelites.
Usage: Miamin, Mijamin.
Source: a form for "H4509";

4327.long:
Meaning: a "sort", i.e. "species".
Usage: kind. Compare "H4480".
Source: from an unused root meaning to "portion out";

4328.long:
Meaning: "something founded", i.e. "a foundation".
Usage: foundation.
Source: properly, feminine passive participle of "H3245";

4331.long:
Meaning: "Mesha", a place in Arabia; also an Israelite.
Usage: Mesha.
Source: from "H4185"; "departure";

4332.long:
Meaning: "Mishael", the name of three Israelites.
Usage: Mishael.
Source: from "H4310" and "H410" with the abbreviated form insep. relatively (see "H834") interposed; who (is) what God (is) ?;

4334.long:
Meaning: a "level", i.e. a "plain" (often used (with the article prefix) as a proper name of certain districts); figuratively, "concord"; also "straightness", i.e. (figuratively) "justice" (sometimes adverbially, "justly").
Usage: equity, even place, plain, right(-eously), (made) straight, uprightness.
Source: or "מִישֹׁר"; from "H3474";

4336.long:
Meaning: "Meshak", the Babylonian.
Usage: Meshak.
Source: (Aramaic) of foreign origin and doubtful significance; name of "H4333"

4338.long:
Meaning: "Mesha", a Moabite.
Usage: Mesha.
Source: a variation for "H4337"; safety;

4339.long:
Meaning: "evenness", i.e. (figuratively) "prosperity" or "concord"; also "straightness", i.e. (figuratively) "rectitude" (only in plural with singular sense; often adverbially).
Usage: agreement, aright, that are equal, equity, (things that are) right(-eously, things), sweetly, upright(-ly, -ness).
Source: from "H3474";

4340.long:
Meaning: a "cord" (of a tent); or the "string" (of a bow).
Usage: cord, string.
Source: from "H3498"; (compare "H3499")

4341.long:
Meaning: "anguish" or (figuratively) "affliction".
Usage: grief, pain, sorrow.
Source: sometimes "מַכְאוֹב"; also (feminine Isaiah 53:3) "מַכְאֹבָה"; from "H3510";

4343.long:
Meaning: "Macbena", a place in Palestine settled by him.
Usage: Machbenah.
Source: from the same as "H3522"; knoll;

4344.long:
Meaning: a "Macbannite" or native of Macbena.
Usage: Machbanai.
Source: patrial from "H4343";

4345.long:
Meaning: a "grate".
Usage: grate.
Source: from "H3527" in the sense of covering (compare "H3531");

4346.long:
Meaning: a "cloth" (as netted).
Usage: thick cloth.
Source: from "H3527" in the sense of covering; (compare "H4345")

4347.long:
Meaning: a "blow" (in 2 Chronicles 2:10, of the flail); by implication, a "wound"; figuratively, "carnage", also "pestilence".
Usage: beaten, blow, plague, slaughter, smote, × sore, stripe, stroke, wound(-ed).
Source: or (masculine) "מַכֶּה"; (plural only) from "H5221";

4349.long:
Meaning: properly, a "fixture", i.e. a basis; generally a "place", especially as an "abode".
Usage: foundation, habitation, (dwelling-, settled) place.
Source: from "H3559";

4350.long:
Meaning: a "pedestal", also a "spot".
Usage: base.
Source: or "מְכֹנָה"; feminine of "H4349";

4351.long:
Meaning: "origin" (as if a mine).
Usage: birth, habitation, nativity.
Source: or "מְכֹרָה"; from the same as "H3564" in the sense of "dipping";

4354.long:
Meaning: a "Makirite" or descendant of Makir.
Usage: of Machir.
Source: patronymical from "H4353";

4355.long:
Meaning: to "tumble" (in ruins); figuratively, to "perish".
Usage: be brought low, decay.
Source: a primitive root;

4357.long:
Meaning: "completion" (in plural concrete adverbial, wholly).
Usage: perfect. Compare "H4356".
Source: from "H3615";

4358.long:
Meaning: "perfection" (i.e. concrete adverbial, splendidly).
Usage: most gorgeously, all sorts.
Source: from "H3634";

4360.long:
Meaning: something "perfect", i.e. a "splendid garment".
Usage: all sorts.
Source: from "H3634";

4362.long:
Meaning: "treasure" (as hidden).
Usage: treasure.
Source: from the same as "H3646" in the sense of hiding;

4363.long:
Meaning: "Mikmas" or "Mikmash", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Mikmas, Mikmash.
Source: (Ezra 2:2 or "מִכְמָשׁ"; or "מִכְמַשׁ"; (Nehemiah 11:31), from "H3647"; "hidden";

4364.long:
Meaning: a (hunter's) "net" (as "dark" from concealment).
Usage: net.
Source: or "מִכְמֹר"; from "H3648" in the sense of "blackening" by heat;

4365.long:
Meaning: a (fisher's) "net".
Usage: drag, net.
Source: or "מִכְמֹרֶת"; feminine of "H4364";

4366.long:
Meaning: "Mikmethath", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Michmethath.
Source: apparently from an unused root meaning to hide; concealment;

4367.long:
Meaning: "Maknadbai", an Israelite.
Usage: Machnadebai.
Source: from "H4100" and "H5068" with a particle interposed; what (is) like (a) liberal (man) ?;

4368.long:
Meaning: "Mekonah", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Mekonah.
Source: the same as "H4350"; a base;

4370.long:
Meaning: (only in dual) "drawers" (from "concealing" the private parts).
Usage: breeches.
Source: from "H3647" in the sense of "hiding";

4371.long:
Meaning: an "assessment" (as based upon a census).
Usage: tribute.
Source: probably from an unused root meaning to "enumerate";

4373.long:
Meaning: an "enumeration"; by implication, a "valuation".
Usage: number, worth.
Source: feminine of "H4371";

4374.long:
Meaning: a "covering", i.e. "garment"; specifically, a "coverlet" (for a bed), an "awning" (from the sun); also the "omentum" (as covering the intestines).
Usage: clothing, to cover, that which covereth.
Source: from "H3680";

4375.long:
Meaning: "Makpelah", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Machpelah.
Source: from "H3717"; a fold;

4376.long:
Meaning: to "sell", literally (as merchandise, a daughter in marriage, into slavery), or figuratively (to "surrender").
Usage: × at all, sell (away, -er, self).
Source: a primitive root;

4380.long:
Meaning: a "sword".
Usage: habitation.
Source: probably from the same as "H3564" in the sense of "stabbing";

4382.long:
Meaning: a "Mekerathite", or inhabitant of Mekerah.
Usage: Mecherathite.
Source: patrial from an unused name (the same as "H4380") of a place in Palestine;

4383.long:
Meaning: a "stumbling-block", literally or figuratively ("obstacle", "enticement" (specifically an idol), "scruple").
Usage: caused to fall, offence, × (no-) thing offered, ruin, stumbling-block.
Source: or "מִכְשֹׁל"; masculine from "H3782";

4384.long:
Meaning: a "stumbling-block", but only figuratively ("fall", "enticement" [idol]).
Usage: ruin, stumbling-block.
Source: feminine from "H3782";

4385.long:
Meaning: a thing "written", the characters, or a document (letter, copy, edict, poem).
Usage: writing.
Source: from "H3789";

4388.long:
Meaning: a "mortar"; by analogy, a "socket" (of a tooth).
Usage: hollow place, mortar.
Source: from "H3806";

4389.long:
Meaning: "dell"; "the Maktesh", a place in Jerusalem.
Usage: Maktesh.
Source: the same as "H4388";

4390.long:
Meaning: to "fill" or (intransitively) "be full of", in a wide application (literally and figuratively).
Usage: accomplish, confirm, consecrate, be at an end, be expired, be fenced, fill, fulfil, (be, become, × draw, give in, go) full(-ly, -ly set, tale), (over-) flow, fulness, furnish, gather (selves, together), presume, replenish, satisfy, set, space, take a (hand-) full, have wholly.
Source: or "מָלָא"; (Esther 7:5), a primitive root;

4391.long:
Meaning: to "fill".
Usage: fill, be full.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H4390";

4392.long:
Meaning: "full" (literally or figuratively) or "filling" (literally); also (concretely) "fulness"; adverbially, "fully".
Usage: × she that was with child, fill(-ed, -ed with), full(-ly), multitude, as is worth.
Source: from "H4390";

4393.long:
Meaning: "fulness" (literally or figuratively).
Usage: × all along, × all that is (there-) in, fill, (× that whereof...was) full, fulness, (hand-) full, multitude.
Source: rarely "מְלוֹא"; or "מְלוֹ"; (Ezekiel 41:8), from "H4390";

4394.long:
Meaning: a "fulfilling" (only in plural), i.e. (literally) a "setting" (of gems), or (technically) "consecration" (also concretely, a dedicatory sacrifice).
Usage: consecration, be set.
Source: from "H4390";

4395.long:
Meaning: something "fulfilled", i.e. "abundance" (of produce).
Usage: (first of ripe) fruit, fulness.
Source: feminine of "H4392";

4396.long:
Meaning: a "filling", i.e. "setting" (of gems).
Usage: enclosing, setting.
Source: feminine of "H4394";

4397.long:
Meaning: a "messenger"; specifically, of God, i.e. an "angel" (also a prophet, priest or teacher).
Usage: ambassador, angel, king, messenger.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "despatch" as a deputy;

4399.long:
Meaning: properly, "deputyship", i.e. "ministry"; generally, "employment" (never servile) or "work" (abstractly or concretely); also "property" (as the result of labor).
Usage: business, cattle, industrious, occupation, ( -pied), officer, thing (made), use, (manner of) work((-man), -manship).
Source: from the same as "H4397";

4400.long:
Meaning: a "message".
Usage: message.
Source: from the same as "H4397";

4401.long:
Meaning: "Malaki", a prophet.
Usage: Malachi.
Source: from the same as "H4397"; "ministrative";

4402.long:
Meaning: "fulness", i.e. (concretely) a "plump socket" (of the eye).
Usage: × fitly.
Source: from "H4390";

4403.long:
Meaning: a "garment", or (collectively) "clothing".
Usage: apparel, raiment, vestment.
Source: or "מַלְבֻּשׁ"; from "H3847";

4405.long:
Meaning: a "word"; collectively, a "discourse"; figuratively, a "topic".
Usage: answer, by-word, matter, any thing (what) to say, to speak(-ing), speak, talking, word.
