Source: from "H4448" (plural masculine as if from "מִלֶּה";

4406.long:
Meaning: a "word", "command", "discourse", or "subject".
Usage: commandment, matter, thing. word.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H4405";

4407.long:
Meaning: a "rampart" (as filled in), i.e. the "citadel".
Usage: Millo. See also "H1037".
Source: or "מִלֹּא"; (2 Kings 12:20), from "H4390";

4409.long:
Meaning: "Malluk", the name of five Israelites.
Usage: Malluch, Melichu (from the margin).
Source: or "מַלּוּכִי"; (Nehemiah 12:14), from "H4427"; "regnant";

4410.long:
Meaning: something "ruled", i.e. a "realm".
Usage: kingsom, king's, × royal.
Source: feminine passive participle of "H4427";

4411.long:
Meaning: a "lodgment", i.e. "caravanserai" or "encampment".
Usage: inn, place where...lodge, lodging (place).
Source: from "H3885";

4412.long:
Meaning: a "hut", a "hammock".
Usage: cottage, lodge.
Source: feminine from "H3885";

4413.long:
Meaning: "Mallothi", an Israelite.
Usage: Mallothi.
Source: apparently from "H4448"; I have talked (i.e. loquacious)

4414.long:
Meaning: properly, to "rub" to pieces or pulverize; intransitively, to "disappear" as dust; also to "salt" whether internally (to "season" with salt) or externally (to "rub" with salt).
Usage: × at all, salt, season, temper together, vanish away.
Source: a primitive root; also as denominative from "H4417"

4415.long:
Meaning: to "eat" salt, i.e. (generally) "subsist".
Usage: have maintenance.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H4414";

4417.long:
Meaning: properly, "powder", i.e. (specifically) "salt" (as easily pulverized and dissolved).
Usage: salt(-pit).
Source: from "H4414";

4418.long:
Meaning: a "rag" or "old garment".
Usage: rotten rag.
Source: from "H4414" in its original sense;

4419.long:
Meaning: a "sailor" (as following 'the salt').
Usage: mariner.
Source: from "H4414" in its second. sense;

4420.long:
Meaning: properly, "salted" (i.e. land), i.e. a "desert".
Usage: barren land(-ness), salt (land).
Source: from "H4414" (in its denominative sense); understood as land ("H776")

4421.long:
Meaning: a "battle" (i.e. the "engagement"); generally, "war" (i.e. "war-fare").
Usage: battle, fight(-ing), war(-rior).
Source: from "H3898" (in the sense of "fighting");

4422.long:
Meaning: properly, to "be smooth", i.e. (by implication) to "escape" (as if by slipperiness); causatively, to "release" or "rescue"; specifically, to "bring forth young", "emit sparks".
Usage: deliver (self), escape, lay, leap out, let alone, let go, preserve, save, × speedily, × surely.
Source: a primitive root;

4424.long:
Meaning: "Melatjah", a Gibeonite.
Usage: Melatiah.
Source: from "H4423" and "H3050"; (whom) "Jah has delivered";

4425.long:
Meaning: a "head of grain" (as cut off).
Usage: ear.
Source: from "H4448" (in the sense of cropping (compare "H4135"));

4426.long:
Meaning: an "aphorism"; also a "satire".
Usage: interpretation, taunting.
Source: from "H3887";

4427.long:
Meaning: to "reign"; inceptively, to "ascend the throne"; causatively, to "induct" into royalty; hence (by implication) to "take counsel".
Usage: consult, × indeed, be (make, set a, set up) king, be (make) queen, (begin to, make to) reign(-ing), rule, × surely.
Source: a primitive root;

4429.long:
Meaning: "Melek", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Melech, Hammelech (by including the article).
Source: the same as "H4428"; "king";

4431.long:
Meaning: "advice".
Usage: counsel.
Source: (Aramaic) from a root corresponding to "H4427" in the sense of consultation;

4432.long:
Meaning: "Molek" (i.e. king), the chief deity of the Ammonites.
Usage: Molech. Compare "H4445".
Source: from "H4427";

4435.long:
Meaning: "Milcah", the name of a Hebrewess and of an Israelite.
Usage: Milcah.
Source: a form of "H4436"; "queen";

4437.long:
Meaning: "dominion" (abstractly or concretely).
Usage: kingdom, kingly, realm, reign.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H4438";

4438.long:
Meaning: a "rule"; concretely, a "dominion".
Usage: empire, kingdom, realm, reign, royal.
Source: or "מַלְכֻת"; or (in plural) "מַלְכֻיָּה"; from "H4427";

4439.long:
Meaning: "Malkiel", an Israelite.
Usage: Malchiel.
Source: from "H4428" and "H410"; king of (i.e. appointed by) God;

4440.long:
Meaning: a "Malkielite" or descendant of Malkiel.
Usage: Malchielite.
Source: patronymical from "H4439";

4441.long:
Meaning: "Malkijah", the name of ten Israelites.
Usage: Malchiah, Malchijah.
Source: or "מַלְכִּיָּהוּ"; (Jeremiah 38:6), from "H4428" and "H3050"; "king of" (i.e. appointed by) "Jah";

4442.long:
Meaning: "Malki-Tsedek", an early king in Palestine.
Usage: Melchizedek.
Source: from "H4428" and "H6664"; "king of right";

4443.long:
Meaning: "Malkiram", an Israelite.
Usage: Malchiram.
Source: from "H4428" and "H7311"; king of a high one (i.e. of exaltation);

4444.long:
Meaning: "Malkishua", an Israelite.
Usage: Malchishua.
Source: from "H4428" and "H7769"; "king of wealth";

4445.long:
Meaning: "Malcam" or "Milcom", the national idol of the Ammonites.
Usage: Malcham, Milcom.
Source: or "מִלְכּוֹם"; from "H4428" for "H4432";

4447.long:
Meaning: "Moleketh", an Israelitess.
Usage: Hammoleketh (including the article).
Source: feminine active participle of "H4427"; "queen";

4448.long:
Meaning: to "speak" (mostly poetical) or "say".
Usage: say, speak, utter.
Source: a primitive root;

4452.long:
Meaning: to "be smooth", i.e. (figuratively) "pleasant".
Usage: be sweet.
Source: a primitive root;

4453.long:
Meaning: the "butler" or other officer in the Babylonian court.
Usage: Melzar.
Source: of Persian derivation;

4454.long:
Meaning: to "crack a joint"; by implication, to "wring the neck of a fowl" (without separating it).
Usage: wring off.
Source: a primitive root;

4455.long:
Meaning: transitively (in dual) the "jaws" (as taking food); intransitively, "spoil" [and captives] (as taken).
Usage: booty, jaws, prey.
Source: from "H3947";

4456.long:
Meaning: the "spring rain"; figuratively, "eloquence".
Usage: latter rain.
Source: from "H3953"; (compare "H3954")

4457.long:
Meaning: (only in dual) "tweezers".
Usage: snuffers, tongs.
Source: or "מַלְקָח"; from "H3947";

4458.long:
Meaning: a "wardrobe" (i.e. room where clothing is spread).
Usage: vestry.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "spread out";

4459.long:
Meaning: "a grinder", i.e. "back tooth".
Usage: great tooth.
Source: transp. for "H4973";

4460.long:
Meaning: a "granary".
Usage: barn.
Source: from "H4048" (in the sense of depositing);

4462.long:
Meaning: "Memucan" or "Momucan", a Persian satrap.
Usage: Memucan.
Source: or (transp.) "מוֹמֻכָן"; (Esther 1:16), of Persian derivation;

4463.long:
Meaning: a "mortal disease"; concretely, a "corpse".
Usage: death.
Source: from "H4191";

4464.long:
Meaning: a "mongrel", i.e. born of a Jewish father and a heathen mother.
Usage: bastard.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "alienate";

4465.long:
Meaning: "merchandise"; abstractly, a "selling".
Usage: × ought, (that which cometh of) sale, that which...sold, ware.
Source: from "H4376";

4467.long:
Meaning: "dominion", i.e. (abstractly) the estate ("rule") or (concretely) the country ("realm").
Usage: kingdom, king's, reign, royal.
Source: from "H4427";

4468.long:
Usage: kingdom, reign.
Source: a form of "H4467" and equiv. to it

4469.long:
Meaning: "mixture", i.e. (specifically) wine "mixed" (with water or spices).
Usage: drink-offering, mixed wine.
Source: from "H4537";

4470.long:
Meaning: "sorrow".
Usage: bitterness.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "grieve";

4471.long:
Meaning: "Mamre", an Amorite.
Usage: Mamre.
Source: from "H4754" (in the sense of vigor); lusty;

4473.long:
Meaning: "outspread" (i.e. with outstretched wings).
Usage: anointed.
Source: from "H4886", in the sense of expansion;

4474.long:
Meaning: a "ruler" or (abstractly) "rule".
Usage: dominion, that ruled.
Source: from "H4910";

4475.long:
Meaning: "rule"; also (concretely in plural) a "realm" or a "ruler".
Usage: dominion, government, power, to rule.
Source: feminine of "H4474";

4476.long:
Meaning: a "possession".
Usage: breeding.
Source: from the same as "H4943";

4478.long:
Meaning: literally a "whatness" (so to speak), i.e. "manna" (so called from the question about it).
Usage: manna.
Source: from "H4100";

4479.long:
Meaning: "who" or "what" (properly, interrogatively, hence, also indefinitely and relatively).
Usage: what, who(-msoever, -so).
Source: (Aramaic) from "H4101";

4480.long:
Meaning: properly, a "part" of; hence (prepositionally), "from" or "out of" in many senses.
Usage: above, after, among, at, because of, by (reason of), from (among), in, × neither, × nor, (out) of, over, since, × then, through, × whether, with.
Source: or "מִנִּי"; or "מִנֵּי"; (constructive plural) (Isaiah 30:11); for "H4482";

4481.long:
Usage: according, after, because, before, by, for, from, × him, × more than, (out) of, part, since, × these, to, upon, when.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H4480"

4482.long:
Meaning: a "part"; hence, a musical "chord" (as parted into strings).
Usage: in [the same] (Psalm 68:23), stringed instrument (Psalm 150:4), whereby (Psalm 45:8 [defective plural]).
Source: from an unused root meaning to "apportion";

4483.long:
Meaning: to "count", "appoint".
Usage: number, ordain, set.
Source: (Aramaic) or "מְנָה"; (Aramaic), corresponding to "H4487";

4486.long:
Meaning: "wisdom" or "intelligence".
Usage: knowledge, reason, understanding.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H4093";

4487.long:
Meaning: properly, to "weigh out"; by implication, to "allot" or "constitute" officially; also to "enumerate" or "enroll".
Usage: appoint, count, number, prepare, set, tell.
Source: a primitive root;

4488.long:
Meaning: properly, a "fixed weight" or "measured amount", i.e. (techn.) a "maneh" or "mina".
Usage: maneh, pound.
Source: from "H4487";

4489.long:
Meaning: properly, something "weighed out", i.e. (figuratively) a "portion" of time, i.e. an "instance".
Usage: time.
Source: from "H4487";

4490.long:
Meaning: properly, something "weighed" out, i.e. (generally) a "division"; specifically (of food) a "ration"; also a "lot".
Usage: such things as belonged, part, portion.
Source: from "H4487";

4492.long:
Meaning: properly, a "channel" or "fissure", i.e. (by implication) a "cavern".
Usage: den.
Source: from "H5102";

4493.long:
Meaning: a "nodding" or "toss" (of the head in derision).
Usage: shaking.
Source: from "H5110"

4494.long:
Meaning: "quiet", i.e. (concretely) a "settled spot", or (figuratively) a "home".
Usage: (place of) rest.
Source: from "H5117";

4495.long:
Meaning: "Manoach", an Israelite.
Usage: Manoah.
Source: the same as "H4494"; "rest";

4496.long:
Meaning: "repose" or (adverbially) "peacefully"; figuratively, "consolation" (specifically, "matrimony"); hence (concretely) an "abode".
Usage: comfortable, ease, quiet, rest(-ing place), still.
Source: or "מְנֻחָה"; feminine of "H4495";

4498.long:
Meaning: a "retreat" (literally or figuratively); abstractly, a "fleeing".
Usage: × apace, escape, way to flee, flight, refuge.
Source: from "H5127";

4500.long:
Meaning: a "yoke" (properly, for plowing), i.e. the "frame of a loom".
Usage: beam.
Source: from "H5214";

4501.long:
Meaning: a "chandelier".
Usage: candlestick.
Source: or "מְנֹרָה"; feminine of "H4500" (in the original sense of "H5216");

4503.long:
Meaning: a "donation"; euphemistically, "tribute"; specifically a "sacrificial offering" (usually bloodless and voluntary).
Usage: gift, oblation, (meat) offering, present, sacrifice.
Source: from an unused root meaning to apportion, i.e. bestow;

4504.long:
Meaning: a "sacrificial offering".
Usage: oblation, meat offering.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H4503";

4506.long:
Meaning: "Manachath", the name of an Edomite and of a place in Moab.
Usage: Manahath.
Source: from "H5117"; "rest";

4507.long:
Meaning: the "Apportioner", i.e. Fate (as an idol).
Usage: number.
Source: from "H4487";

4508.long:
Meaning: "Minni", an Armenian province.
Usage: Minni.
Source: of foreign derivation;

4509.long:
Meaning: "Minjamin", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Miniamin. Compare "H4326".
Source: from "H4480" and "H3225"; from (the) right hand;

4511.long:
Meaning: "Minnith", a place East of the Jordan.
Usage: Minnith.
Source: from the same as "H4482"; enumeration;

4513.long:
Meaning: to "debar" (negatively or positively) from benefit or injury.
Usage: deny, keep (back), refrain, restrain, withhold.
Source: a primitive root;

4517.long:
Meaning: a "sistrum" (so called from its rattling sound).
Usage: cornet.
Source: from "H5128";

4518.long:
Meaning: a "sacrificial basin" (for holding blood).
Usage: bowl.
Source: from "H5352";

4519.long:
Meaning: "Menashsheh", a grandson of Jacob, also the tribe descended from him, and its territory.
Usage: Manasseh.
Source: from "H5382"; "causing to forget";

4520.long:
Meaning: a "Menashshite" or descendant of Menashsheh.
Usage: of Manasseh, Manassites.
Source: from "H4519";

4521.long:
Meaning: an "allotment" (by courtesy, law or providence).
Usage: portion.
Source: from "H4487";

4522.long:
Meaning: properly, a "burden" (as causing to faint), i.e. a tax in the form of forced labor.
Usage: discomfited, levy, task(-master), tribute(-tary).
Source: or "מִס"; from "H4549";

4524.long:
Meaning: "a divan" (as enclosing the room); abstractly (adverbial) "around".
Usage: that compass about, (place) round about, at table.
Source: plural masculine "מְסִבִּים"; or feminine "מְסִבּוֹת"; from "H5437";

4525.long:
Meaning: a "fastener", i.e. (of a person) a "smith", (of a thing) a "prison".
Usage: prison, smith.
Source: from "H5462";

4526.long:
Meaning: something "enclosing", i.e. a "margin" (of a region, of a panel); concretely, a "stronghold".
Usage: border, close place, hole.
Source: from "H5462";

4528.long:
Meaning: a "colonnade" or "internal portico" (from its rows of pillars).
Usage: porch.
Source: from the same as "H5468";

4529.long:
Meaning: to "dissolve".
Usage: make to consume away, (make to) melt, water.
Source: a primitive root;

4530.long:
Meaning: "abundance", i.e. (adverbially) "liberally".
Usage: tribute.
Source: from "H4549" (in the sense of flowing);

4531.long:
Meaning: a "testing", of men (judicial) or of God (querulous).
Usage: temptation, trial.
Source: from "H5254";

4532.long:
Meaning: "Massah", a place in the Desert.
Usage: Massah.
Source: the same as "H4531";

4533.long:
Meaning: "a veil".
Usage: vail.
Source: apparently from an unused root meaning to "cover";

4535.long:
Meaning: a "cordon", (adverbially) or (as a) "military barrier".
Usage: broken down.
Source: from "H5255" in the sense of "staving off";

4537.long:
Meaning: to "mix", especially wine (with spices).
Usage: mingle.
Source: a primitive root;

4538.long:
Meaning: a "mixture", i.e. of wine with spices.
Usage: mixture.
Source: from "H4537";

4539.long:
Meaning: a "cover", i.e. "veil".
Usage: covering, curtain, hanging.
Source: from "H5526";

4541.long:
Meaning: properly, a "pouring" over, i.e. "fusion" of metal (especially a "cast" image); by implication, a "libation", i.e. "league"; concretely a "coverlet" (as if "poured" out).
Usage: covering, molten (image), vail.
Source: from "H5258";

4543.long:
Meaning: a "magazine".
Usage: store(-house), treasure.
Source: by transp. from "H3664";

4545.long:
Meaning: something "expanded", i.e. the "warp" in a loom (as stretched out to receive the woof).
Usage: web.
Source: from "H5259" in the sense of spreading out;

4546.long:
Meaning: a "thoroughfare" (as "turnpiked"), literally or figuratively; specifically a "viaduct", a "staircase".
Usage: causeway, course, highway, path, terrace.
Source: from "H5549";

4548.long:
Meaning: a "peg" (as "bristling" from the surface).
Usage: nail.
Source: or "מִסְמֵר"; also (feminine) "מַסְמְרָה"; or "מִסְמְרָה"; or even "מַשְׂמְרָה"; (Ecclesiastes 12:11), from "H5568";

4549.long:
Meaning: to "liquefy"; figuratively, to "waste" (with disease), to "faint" (with fatigue, fear or grief).
Usage: discourage, faint, be loosed, melt (away), refuse, × utterly.
Source: a primitive root;

4550.long:
Meaning: a "departure" (from "striking" the tents), i.e. march (not necessarily a single day's travel); by implication, a "station" (or point of "departure").
Usage: journey(-ing).
Source: from "H5265";

4551.long:
Meaning: a "missile" (spear or arrow); also a "quarry" (whence stones are, as it were, "ejected").
Usage: before it was brought, dart.
Source: from "H5265" in the sense of "projecting";

4553.long:
Meaning: a "lamentation".
Usage: lamentation, one mourneth, mourning, wailing.
Source: from "H5594";

4554.long:
Meaning: "fodder".
Usage: provender.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "collect";

4556.long:
Meaning: "scruf" (as spreading over the surface).
Usage: scab.
Source: from "H5596";

4557.long:
Meaning: a "number", definite (arithmetical) or indefinite (large, "innumerable"; small, a "few"); also (abstractly) "narration".
Usage: abundance, account, × all, × few, (in-) finite, (certain) number(-ed), tale, telling, time.
Source: from "H5608";

4558.long:
Meaning: "Mispar", an Israelite.
Usage: Mizpar. Compare "H4559".
Source: the same as "H4457"; "number";

4559.long:
Meaning: "Mispereth", an Israelite.
Usage: Mispereth. Compare "H4458".
Source: feminine of "H4437"; enumeration;

4560.long:
Meaning: to "sunder", i.e. (transitively) "set apart", or (reflex.) "apostatize".
Usage: commit, deliver.
Source: a primitive root;

4564.long:
Meaning: properly, a "hider", i.e. (abstractly) a hiding, i.e. "aversion".
Usage: hid.
Source: from "H5641";

4565.long:
Meaning: properly, a "concealer", i.e. a "covert".
Usage: secret(-ly, place).
Source: from "H5641";

4568.long:
Meaning: properly, "compact" (part of soil), i.e. "loam".
Usage: clay.
Source: from "H5666";

4569.long:
Meaning: a "crossing"-place (of a river, a "ford"; of a mountain, a "pass"); abstractly, a "transit", i.e. (figuratively) "overwhelming".
Usage: ford, place where...pass, passage.
Source: or feminine "מַעֲבָרָה"; from "H5674";

4570.long:
Meaning: a "track" (literally or figuratively); also a "rampart" (as "circular").
Usage: going, path, trench, way(-side).
Source: or feminine "מַעְגָּלָה"; from the same as "H5696";

4571.long:
Meaning: to "waver".
Usage: make to shake, slide, slip.
Source: a primitive root;

4573.long:
Meaning: "Maadjah", an Israelite.
Usage: Maadiah. Compare "H4153".
Source: from "H5710" and "H3050"; "ornament of Jah";

4574.long:
Meaning: a "delicacy" or (abstractly) "pleasure" (adverbially, cheerfully).
Usage: dainty, delicately, delight.
Source: or (feminine) "מַעֲדַנָּה"; from "H5727";

4575.long:
Meaning: a "bond", i.e. "group".
Usage: influence.
Source: by transitive from "H6029";

4577.long:
Meaning: only in plural the "bowels".
Usage: belly.
Source: (Aramaic) or "מְעָא"; (Aramaic), corresponding to "H4578";

4578.long:
Meaning: used only in plural the "intestines", or (collectively) the "abdomen", figuratively, "sympathy"; by implication, a "vest"; by extension the "stomach", the "uterus" (or of men, the seat of generation), the "heart" (figuratively).
Usage: belly, bowels, × heart, womb.
Source: from an unused root probably meaning to be soft;

4579.long:
Meaning: the "belly", i.e. (figuratively) interior.
Usage: gravel.
Source: feminine of "H4578";

4580.long:
Meaning: a "cake of bread"; "parasite".
Usage: cake, feast.
Source: from "H5746"; also with "H3934" a "table-buffoon", i.e.

4581.long:
Meaning: a "fortified" place; figuratively, a "defence".
Usage: force, fort(-ress), rock, strength(-en), (× most) strong (hold).
Source: (also "מָעוּז" ); or "מָעֹז" (also "מָעֻז"; from "H5810";

4583.long:
Meaning: an "abode", of God (the Tabernacle or the Temple), men (their home) or animals (their lair); hence, a "retreat" (asylum).
Usage: den, dwelling((-) place), habitation.
Source: or "מָעִין"; (1 Chronicles 4:41), from the same as "H5772";

4584.long:
Meaning: "Maon", the name of an Israelite and of a place in Palestine.
Usage: Maon, Maonites. Compare "H1010", "H4586".
Source: the same as "H4583"; a residence;

4585.long:
Usage: den, habitation, (dwelling) place, refuge.
Source: or "מְעֹנָה"; feminine of "H4583", and meaning the same

4586.long:
Meaning: a "Meunite", or inhabitant of Maon (only in plural).
Usage: Mehunim(-s), Meunim.
Source: or "מְעִינִי"; probably patrial from "H4584";

4588.long:
Meaning: "darkness".
Usage: dimness.
Source: from "H5774" in the sense of "covering" with shade (compare "H4155");

4590.long:
Meaning: "Maazjah", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Maaziah.
Source: or "מַעַזְיָהוּ"; probably from "H5756" (in the sense of protection) and "H3050"; "rescue of Jah";

4591.long:
Meaning: properly, to "pare" off, i.e. "lessen"; intransitively, to "be" (or causatively, to "make") "small" or "few" (or figuratively, "ineffective").
Usage: suffer to decrease, diminish, (be, × borrow a, give, make) few (in number, -ness), gather least (little), be (seem) little, (× give the) less, be minished, bring to nothing.
Source: a primitive root;

4592.long:
Meaning: a "little" or "few" (often adverbial or comparative).
Usage: almost (some, very) few(-er, -est), lightly, little (while), (very) small (matter, thing), some, soon, × very.
Source: or "מְעָט"; from "H4591";

4593.long:
Meaning: "thinned" (as to the edge), i.e. "sharp".
Usage: wrapped up.
Source: passive adjective of "H4591";

4596.long:
Meaning: a "pile" of rubbish (as "contorted"), i.e. a "ruin".
Usage: heap.
Source: from "H5753"; (compare "H5856")

4597.long:
Meaning: "Maai", an Israelite.
Usage: Maai.
Source: probably from "H4578"; sympathetic;

4598.long:
Meaning: a "robe" (i.e. upper and outer garment).
Usage: cloke, coat, mantle, robe.
Source: from "H4603" in the sense of covering;

4599.long:
Meaning: a "fountain" (also collectively), figuratively, a "source" (of satisfaction).
Usage: fountain, spring, well.
Source: or "מַעְיְנוֹ"; (Psalm 114:8), or (feminine) "מַעְיָנָה"; from "H5869" (as a denominative in the sense of a spring);

4600.long:
Meaning: to "press", i.e. to "pierce", "emasculate", "handle".
Usage: bruised, stuck, be pressed.
Source: a primitive root;

4601.long:
Meaning: "Maakah" (or Maakath), the name of a place in Syria, also of a Mesopotamian, of three Israelites, and of four Israelitesses and one Syrian woman.
Usage: Maachah, Maachathites. See also "H1038".
Source: or "מַעֲכָת"; (Joshua 13:13), from "H4600"; depression;

4602.long:
Meaning: a "Maakathite", or inhabitant of Maakah.
Usage: Maachathite.
Source: patrial from "H4601";

4603.long:
Meaning: properly, to "cover up"; used only figuratively, to "act covertly", i.e. "treacherously".
Usage: transgress, (commit, do a) trespass(-ing).
Source: a primitive root;

4604.long:
Meaning: "treachery", i.e. sin.
Usage: falsehood, grievously, sore, transgression, trespass, × very.
Source: from "H4603";

4605.long:
Meaning: properly,the "upper part", used only adverbially with prefix "upward", "above", "overhead", "from the top", etc.
Usage: above, exceeding(-ly), forward, on (× very) high, over, up(-on, -ward), very.
Source: from "H5927";

4606.long:
Meaning: (only in plural as singular) the "setting" (of the sun).
Usage: going down.
Source: (Aramaic) from "H5954";

4607.long:
Meaning: a "raising" (of the hands).
Usage: lifting up.
Source: from "H5927";

4608.long:
Meaning: an "elevation", i.e. (concretely) "acclivity" or "platform"; abstractly (the relation or state) a "rise" or (figuratively) "priority".
Usage: ascent, before, chiefest, cliff, that goeth up, going up, hill, mounting up, stairs.
Source: from "H5927";

4609.long:
Meaning: "elevation", i.e. the act (literally, a "journey" to a higher place, figuratively, a "thought" arising), or (concretely) the condition (literally, a "step" or "grade"-mark, figuratively, a "superiority" of station); specifically a climactic "progression" (in certain Psalms).
Usage: things that come up, (high) degree, deal, go up, stair, step, story.
Source: feminine of "H4608";

4610.long:
Meaning: "Steep of Scorpions", a place in the Desert.
Usage: Maaleh-accrabim, the ascent (going up) of Akrabbim.
Source: from "H4608" and (the plural of) "H6137";

4611.long:
Meaning: an "act" (good or bad).
Usage: doing, endeavour, invention, work.
Source: from "H5953";

4612.long:
Meaning: (figuratively) a "position".
Usage: attendance, office, place, state.
Source: from "H5975";

4616.long:
Meaning: properly, "heed", i.e. "purpose"; used only adverbially, "on account of" (as a motive or an aim), teleologically, "in order that".
Usage: because of, to the end (intent) that, for (to,... 's sake), lest, that, to.
Source: from "H6030";

4617.long:
Meaning: a "reply" (favorable or contradictory).
Usage: answer, × himself.
Source: from "H6030";

4618.long:
Meaning: a "furrow".
Usage: acre, furrow.
Source: from "H6031", in the sense of depression or tilling;

4621.long:
Meaning: an "axe".
Usage: ax, tongs.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "hew";

4624.long:
Meaning: a "parapet".
Usage: battlement.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "repress";

4625.long:
Meaning: a "crook" (in a road).
Usage: crooked thing.
Source: from "H6140";

4626.long:
Meaning: "a nude place", i.e. (literally) "the pudenda", or (figuratively) "a vacant space".
Usage: nakedness, proportion.
Source: from "H6168";

4627.long:
Meaning: "traffic"; by implication, "mercantile goods".
Usage: market, merchandise.
Source: from "H6148", in the sense of trading;

4628.long:
Meaning: the "west" (as a region of the "evening" sun).
Usage: west.
Source: or (feminine) "מַעֲרָבָה"; from "H6150", in the sense of "shading";

4629.long:
Meaning: a "nude place", i.e. a "common".
Usage: meadows.
Source: from "H6168";

4630.long:
Meaning: "an open spot".
Usage: army (from the margin).
Source: feminine of "H4629";

4631.long:
Meaning: a "cavern" (as dark).
Usage: cave, den, hole.
Source: from "H5783";

4632.long:
Meaning: "Mearah", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Mearah.
Source: the same as "H4631"; cave;

4634.long:
Meaning: an "arrangement"; concretely, a "pile"; specifically a military "array".
Usage: army, fight, be set in order, ordered place, rank, row.
Source: feminine of "H4633";

4635.long:
Meaning: an "arrangement", i.e. (concretely) a "pile" (of loaves).
Usage: row, shewbread.
Source: from "H6186";

4636.long:
Meaning: "bare".
Usage: naked.
Source: from "H6191", in the sense of stripping;

4638.long:
Meaning: "Maarath", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Maarath.
Source: a form of "H4630"; "waste";

4639.long:
Meaning: an "action" (good or bad); generally, a "transaction"; abstractly, "activity"; by implication, a "product" (specifically, a "poem") or (generally) "property".
Usage: act, art, bakemeat, business, deed, do(-ing), labor, thing made, ware of making, occupation, thing offered, operation, possession, × well, (handy-, needle-, net-) work(ing, -manship), wrought.
Source: from "H6213";

4641.long:
Meaning: "Maasejah", the name of sixteen Israelites.
Usage: Maaseiah.
Source: or "מַעֲשֵׂיָהוּ"; from "H4639" and "H3050"; "work of Jah";

4643.long:
Meaning: a "tenth"; especially a "tithe".
Usage: tenth (part), tithe(-ing).
Source: or "מַעֲשַׂר"; and (in plural) feminine "מַעַשְׂרָה"; from "H6240";

4644.long:
Meaning: "Moph", the capital of Lower Egypt.
Usage: Memphis. Compare "H5297".
Source: of Egyptian origin;

4646.long:
Meaning: a "breathing out" (of life), i.e. "expiring".
Usage: giving up.
Source: from "H5301";

4647.long:
Meaning: the "bellows" (i.e. blower) of a forge.
Usage: bellows.
Source: from "H5301";

4648.long:
Meaning: "Mephibosheth", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Mephibosheth.
Source: or "מְפִבֹשֶׁת"; probably from "H6284" and "H1322"; dispeller of shame (i.e. of Baal);

4649.long:
Meaning: "Muppim", an Israelite.
Usage: Muppim. Compare "H8206".
Source: a plural apparently from "H5130"; "wavings";

4651.long:
Meaning: a "falling off", i.e. "chaff"; also something "pendulous", i.e. a "flap".
Usage: flake, refuse.
Source: from "H5307";

4654.long:
Meaning: something "fallen", i.e. a "ruin".
Usage: ruin(-ous).
Source: or "מַפֵּלָה"; from "H5307";

4657.long:
Meaning: a "poising".
Usage: balancing.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "balance";

4658.long:
Meaning: "fall", i.e. "decadence"; concretely, a "ruin"; specifically a "carcase".
Usage: carcase, fall, ruin.
Source: from "H5307";

4661.long:
Meaning: a "smiter", i.e. a "war club".
Usage: battle ax.
Source: from "H5310";

4662.long:
Meaning: "an appointment", i.e. "mandate"; concretely, "a designated spot"; specifically, "a census".
Usage: appointed place, commandment, number.
Source: from "H6485";

4663.long:
Meaning: "Miphkad", the name of a gate in Jerusalem.
Usage: Miphkad.
Source: the same as "H4662"; "assignment";

4664.long:
Meaning: a "break" (in the shore), i.e. a "haven".
Usage: breach.
Source: from "H6555";

4665.long:
Meaning: properly, a "fracture", i.e. "joint" (vertebrae) of the neck.
Usage: neck.
Source: from "H6561";

4666.long:
Meaning: an "expansion".
Usage: that which...spreadest forth, spreading.
Source: from "H6566";

4667.long:
Meaning: a "stride", i.e. (by euphemism) the "crotch".
Usage: buttocks.
Source: from "H6585";

4670.long:
Meaning: a "stretcher", i.e. a "sill".
Usage: threshold.
Source: from the same as "H6620";

4671.long:
Meaning: "chaff" (as "pressed" out, i.e. "winnowed" or (rather) threshed loose).
Usage: chaff.
Source: or "מוֹץ"; (Zephaniah 2:2), from "H4160";

4672.long:
Meaning: properly, to "come" forth to, i.e. "appear" or "exist"; transitively, to "attain", i.e. "find" or "acquire"; figuratively, to "occur", "meet" or "be present".
Usage: be able, befall, being, catch, × certainly, (cause to) come (on, to, to hand), deliver, be enough (cause to) find(-ing, occasion, out), get (hold upon), × have (here), be here, hit, be left, light (up-) on, meet (with), × occasion serve, (be) present, ready, speed, suffice, take hold on.
Source: a primitive root;

4673.long:
Meaning: a fixed "spot"; figuratively, an "office", a military "post".
Usage: garrison, station, place where...stood.
Source: from "H5324";

4675.long:
Meaning: a "military guard".
Usage: army, garrison.
Source: or "מִצָּבָה"; feminine of "H4673";

4676.long:
Meaning: something "stationed", i.e. a "column" or (memorial stone); by analogy, an "idol".
Usage: garrison, (standing) image, pillar.
Source: feminine (causatively) participle of "H5324";

4677.long:
Meaning: "Metsobajah", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Mesobaite.
Source: apparently from "H4672" and "H3050"; "found of Jah";

4678.long:
Meaning: something "stationary", i.e. a monumental "stone"; also the "stock" of a tree.
Usage: pillar, substance.
Source: from "H5324";

4679.long:
Meaning: a "fastness" (as a covert of ambush).
Usage: castle, fort, (strong) hold, munition.
Source: or "מְצָד"; or (feminine) "מְצָדָה"; from "H6679";

4680.long:
Meaning: to "suck" out; by implication, to "drain", to "squeeze" out.
Usage: suck, wring (out).
Source: a primitive root;

4681.long:
Meaning: "Motsah", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Mozah.
Source: active participle feminine of "H4680"; "drained";

4682.long:
Meaning: properly, "sweetness"; concretely, "sweet" (i.e. not soured or bittered with yeast); specifically, an "unfermented cake" or loaf, or (elliptically) the festival of "Passover" (because no leaven was then used).
Usage: unleaved (bread, cake), without leaven.
Source: from "H4711" in the sense of "greedily" devouring for sweetness;

4684.long:
Meaning: a "whinnying" (through impatience for battle or lust).
Usage: neighing.
Source: from "H6670";

4685.long:
Meaning: a "net" (for "capturing" animals or fishes); a "fastness" or (beseiging) "tower".
Usage: bulwark, hold, munition, net, snare.
Source: or (feminine) "מְצוֹדָה"; or "מצֹדָה"; from "H6679"; also (by interchange for "H4679")

4686.long:
Meaning: a "net", or (abstractly) "capture"; also a "fastness".
Usage: castle, defense, fort(-ress), (strong) hold, be hunted, net, snare, strong place.
Source: or (feminine) "מְצוּדָה"; or "מְצֻדָה"; for "H4685";

4687.long:
Meaning: a "command", whether human or divine (collectively, the "Law").
Usage: (which was) commanded(-ment), law, ordinance, precept.
Source: from "H6680";

4688.long:
Meaning: a "deep" place (of water or mud).
Usage: bottom, deep, depth.
Source: or "מְצֹלָה"; also "מְצוּלָה"; or "מְצֻלָה"; from the same as "H6683";

4689.long:
Meaning: a "narrow place", i.e. (abstractly and figuratively) "confinement" or "disability".
Usage: anguish, distress, straitness.
Source: from "H6693";

4690.long:
Meaning: something "narrow", i.e. a "column" or "hilltop".
Usage: pillar, situate.
Source: or "מָצֻק"; from "H6693";

4691.long:
Meaning: "narrowness", i.e. (figuratively) "trouble".
Usage: anguish, distress.
Source: or "מְצֻקָה"; feminine of "H4690";

4692.long:
Meaning: something "hemming in", i.e. (objectively) a "mound" (of besiegers), (abstractly) a "siege", (figuratively) "distress"; or (subjectively) a "fastness".
Usage: besieged, bulwark, defence, fenced, fortress, siege, strong (hold), tower.
Source: or "מָצוּר"; from "H6696";

4693.long:
Meaning: "Egypt" (as the "border" of Palestine).
Usage: besieged places, defense, fortified.
Source: the same as "H4692" in the sense of a "limit";

4694.long:
Meaning: a "hemming" in, i.e. (objectively) a "mound" (of siege), or (subjectively) a "rampart" (of protection), (abstractly) "fortification".
Usage: fenced (city, fort, munition, strong hold.
Source: or "מְצֻרָה"; feminine of "H4692";

4696.long:
Meaning: the "forehead" (as "open" and "prominent").
Usage: brow, forehead, impudent.
Source: from an unused root meaning to be "clear", i.e. "conspicuous";

4697.long:
Meaning: a "shinpiece of armor" (as prominent), only plural.
Usage: greaves.
Source: from the same as "H4696";

4701.long:
Meaning: a "tiara", i.e. official "turban" (of a king or high priest).
Usage: diadem, mitre.
Source: from "H6801";

4705.long:
Meaning: "petty" (in size or number); adverbially, a "short" (time).
Usage: little one (while), small.
Source: from "H6819";

4706.long:
Meaning: "Mitsar", a peak of Lebanon.
Usage: Mizar.
Source: the same as "H4705";

4707.long:
Meaning: an "observatory", especially for military purposes.
Usage: watch tower.
Source: from "H6822";

4708.long:
Meaning: "Mitspeh", the name of five places in Palestine.
Usage: Mizpeh, watch tower. Compare "H4709".
Source: the same as "H4707";

4709.long:
Meaning: "Mitspah", the name of two places in Palestine.
Usage: Mitspah. (This seems rather to be only an orthographic variation of "H4708" when 'in pause'.).
Source: feminine of "H4708";

4710.long:
Meaning: a "secret" (place or thing, perhaps, treasure).
Usage: hidden thing.
Source: from "H6845";

4712.long:
Meaning: something "tight", i.e. (figuratively) "trouble".
Usage: distress, pain, strait.
Source: from "H6869";

4713.long:
Meaning: a "Mitsrite", or inhabitant of Mitsrajim.
Usage: Egyptian, of Egypt.
Source: from "H4714";

4714.long:
Meaning: "Mitsrajim", i.e. Upper and Lower Egypt.
Usage: Egypt, Egyptians, Mizraim.
Source: dual of "H4693";

4716.long:
Meaning: properly, a "melting", i.e. "putridity".
Usage: rottenness, stink.
Source: from "H4743";

4717.long:
Meaning: properly, a "perforatrix", i.e. a "hammer" (as "piercing").
Usage: hammer.
Source: from "H5344";

4718.long:
Meaning: properly, a "perforator", i.e. a "hammer" (as "piercing"); also (intransitively) a "perforation", i.e. a "quarry".
Usage: hammer, hole.
Source: from "H5344";

4719.long:
Meaning: "Makkedah", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Makkedah.
Source: from the same as "H5348" in the denominative sense of herding (compare "H5349"); "fold";

4720.long:
Meaning: a "consecrated" thing or place, especially, a "palace", "sanctuary" (whether of Jehovah or of idols) or "asylum".
Usage: chapel, hallowed part, holy place, sanctuary.
Source: or "מִקְּדָשׁ"; (Exodus 15:17), from "H6942";

4722.long:
Meaning: "Makheloth", a place in the Desert.
Usage: Makheloth.
Source: plural of "H4721" (feminine); "assemblies";

4723.long:
Meaning: something "waited" for, i.e. "confidence" (objective or subjective); also a "collection", i.e. (of water) a "pond", or (of men and horses) a "caravan" or "drove".
Usage: abiding, gathering together, hope, linen yarn, plenty (of water), pool.
Source: or "מִקְוֵה"; (1 Kings 10:28), or "מִקְוֵא"; (2 Chronicles 1:16), from "H6960";

4724.long:
Meaning: a "collection", i.e. (of water) a "reservoir".
Usage: ditch.
Source: feminine of "H4723";

4725.long:
Meaning: properly, a "standing", i.e. a "spot"; but used widely of a locality (general or specific); also (figuratively) of a "condition" (of body or mind).
Usage: country, × home, × open, place, room, space, × whither(-soever).
Source: or "מָקֹם"; also (feminine) "מְקוֹמָה"; or "מְקֹמָה"; from "H6965";

4726.long:
Meaning: properly, something "dug", i.e. a (general) "source" (of water, even when naturally flowing; also of tears, blood (by euphemism, of the female "pudenda"); figuratively, of happiness, wisdom, progeny).
Usage: fountain, issue, spring, well(-spring).
Source: or "מָקֹר"; from "H6979";

4729.long:
Meaning: something to "fume" (incense) on i.e. a "hearth" place.
Usage: to burn...upon.
Source: from "H6999";

4730.long:
Meaning: something "to fume" (incense) "in", i.e. a "coal-pan".
Usage: censer.
Source: feminine of "H4729";

4731.long:
Meaning: a "shoot", i.e. "stick" (with leaves on, or for walking, striking, guiding, divining).
Usage: rod, (hand-)staff.
Source: or (feminine) "מַקְּלָה"; from an unused root meaning apparently to germinate;

4732.long:
Meaning: "Mikloth", a place in the Desert.
Usage: Mikloth.
Source: (or perhaps mik-kel-ohth') plural of (feminine) "H4731"; "rods";

4733.long:
Meaning: an "asylum" (as a "receptacle").
Usage: refuge.
Source: from "H7038" in the sense of "taking" in;

4734.long:
Meaning: a "sculpture" (probably in bas-relief).
Usage: carved (figure), carving, graving.
Source: from "H7049";

4735.long:
Meaning: something "bought", i.e. "property", but only live "stock"; abstractly, "acquisition".
Usage: cattle, flock, herd, possession, purchase, substance.
Source: from "H7069";

4736.long:
Meaning: properly, a "buying", i.e. "acquisition"; concretely, a piece of "property" (land or living); also the "sum" paid.
Usage: (he that is) bought, possession, piece, purchase.
Source: feminine of "H4735";

4737.long:
Meaning: "Miknejah", an Israelite.
Usage: Mikneiah.
Source: from "H4735" and "H3050"; "possession of Jah";

4739.long:
Meaning: "Makats", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Makaz.
Source: from "H7112"; "end";

4740.long:
Meaning: an "angle" or recess.
Usage: corner, turning.
Source: or "מַקְצֹעַ"; or (feminine) "מַקְצֹעָה"; from "H7106" in the denominative sense of "bending";

4741.long:
Meaning: a "scraper", i.e. a carving "chisel".
Usage: plane.
Source: from "H7106";

4742.long:
Meaning: an "angle".
Usage: corner.
Source: from "H7106" in the denominative sense of bending;

4743.long:
Meaning: to "melt"; figuratively, to "flow", "dwindle", "vanish".
Usage: consume away, be corrupt, dissolve, pine away.
Source: ' a primitive root;

4744.long:
Meaning: something "called" out, i.e. a public "meeting" (the act, the persons, or the place); also a "rehearsal".
Usage: assembly, calling, convocation, reading.
Source: from "H7121";

4745.long:
Meaning: something "met" with, i.e. an "accident" or "fortune".
Usage: something befallen, befalleth, chance, event, hap(-peneth).
Source: from "H7136";

4746.long:
Meaning: properly, something "meeting", i.e. a "frame" (of timbers).
Usage: building.
Source: from "H7136";

4747.long:
Meaning: a "cooling off".
Usage: × summer.
Source: from the same as "H7119";

4748.long:
Meaning: something "turned" (rounded), i.e. a "curl" (of tresses).
Usage: × well (set) hair.
Source: from "H7185" in the sense of "knotting" up round and hard;

4749.long:
Meaning: "rounded" work, i.e. moulded by "hammering" ("repoussé").
Usage: beaten (out of one piece, work), upright, whole piece.
Source: feminine of "H4748";

4750.long:
Meaning: literally a "cucumbered" field, i.e. a "cucumber" patch.
Usage: garden of cucumbers.
Source: denominative from "H7180";

4751.long:
Meaning: "bitter" (literally or figuratively); also (as noun) "bitterness", or (adverbially) "bitterly".
Usage: angry, bitter(-ly, -ness), chafed, discontented, × great, heavy.
Source: or (feminine) "מָרָה"; from "H4843";

4752.long:
Meaning: a "drop".
Usage: drop.
Source: from "H4843" in its original sense of "distillation";

4753.long:
Meaning: "myrrh" (as "distilling" in drops, and also as "bitter").
Usage: myrrh.
Source: or "מוֹר"; from "H4843";

4754.long:
Meaning: to "rebel"; hence (through the idea of maltreating) to "whip", i.e. "lash" (self with wings, as the ostrich in running).
Usage: be filthy, lift up self.
Source: a primitive root;

4755.long:
Meaning: "Mara", a symbolic name of Naomi.
Usage: Mara.
Source: for "H4751" feminine; "bitter";

4756.long:
Meaning: a "master".
Usage: lord, Lord.
Source: (Aramaic) from a root corresponding to "H4754" in the sense of domineering;

4757.long:
Meaning: "Merodak-Baladan", a Babylonian king.
Usage: Merodach-baladan. Compare "H4781".
Source: of foreign derivation;

4758.long:
Meaning: a "view" (the act of seeing); also an "appearance" (the thing seen), whether (real) a shape (especially if handsome, comeliness; often plural the looks), or (mental) a vision.
Usage: × apparently, appearance(-reth), × as soon as beautiful(-ly), countenance, fair, favoured, form, goodly, to look (up) on (to), look(-eth), pattern, to see, seem, sight, visage, vision.
Source: from "H7200";

4759.long:
Meaning: a "vision"; also (causatively) a "mirror".
Usage: looking glass, vision.
Source: feminine of "H4758";

4760.long:
Meaning: something "conspicuous", i.e. the "craw" of a bird (from its prominence).
Usage: crop.
Source: apparently feminine passive causative participle of "H7200";

4761.long:
Meaning: properly, "headship", i.e. (plural for collective) "dominion".
Usage: principality.
Source: denominative from "H7218";

4762.long:
Meaning: "Mareshah", the name of two Israelites and of a place in Palestine.
Usage: Mareshah.
Source: or "מַרֵשָׁה"; formed like "H4761"; "summit";

4763.long:
Meaning: properly, a "headpiece", i.e. (plural for adverbial) at (or as) the "head-rest" (or pillow).
Usage: bolster, head, pillow. Compare "H4772".
Source: formed like "H4761";

4764.long:
Meaning: "Merab", a daughter of Saul.
Usage: Merab.
Source: from "H7231"; "increase";

4766.long:
Meaning: properly, "increasing"; as noun, "greatness", or (adverbially) "greatly".
Usage: great, increase.
Source: from "H7235";

4768.long:
Meaning: a "multitude"; also "offspring"; specifically "interest" (on capital).
Usage: greatest part, greatness, increase, multitude.
Source: from "H7235";

4769.long:
Meaning: a "reclining place", i.e. "fold" (for flocks).
Usage: couching place, place to lie down.
Source: from "H7257";

4770.long:
Meaning: a "stall" (for cattle).
Usage: × fat(-ted), stall.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "tie up";

4772.long:
Meaning: (plural for collective) a "footpiece", i.e. (adverbially) "at the foot", or (direct.) the "foot" itself.
Usage: feet. Compare "H4763".
Source: denominative from "H7272";

4776.long:
Meaning: "rebellion".
Usage: rebellion.
Source: (Aramaic) from a root corresponding to "H4775";

4778.long:
Meaning: "Mered", an Israelite.
Usage: Mered.
Source: the same as "H4777";

4781.long:
Meaning: "Merodak", a Babylonian idol.
Usage: Merodach. Compare "H4757".
Source: of foreign derivation;

4782.long:
Meaning: "Mordecai", an Israelite.
Usage: Mordecai.
Source: of foreign derivation;

4784.long:
Meaning: to "be" (causatively, "make") "bitter" (or unpleasant); (figuratively) to "rebel" (or resist; causatively, to "provoke").
Usage: bitter, change, be disobedient, disobey, grievously, provocation, provoke(-ing), (be) rebel (against, -lious).
Source: a primitive root;

4785.long:
Meaning: "Marah", a place in the Desert.
Usage: Marah.
Source: the same as "H4751" feminine; "bitter";

4788.long:
Meaning: an "outcast"; (abstractly) "destitution".
Usage: cast out, misery.
Source: from "H7300" in the sense of "maltreatment";

4789.long:
Meaning: "Meroz", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Meroz.
Source: of uncertain derivation;

4791.long:
Meaning: "altitude", i.e. concretely (an "elevated place"), abstractly ("elevation", figuratively ("elation"), or adverbially ("aloft").
Usage: (far) above, dignity, haughty, height, (most, on) high (one, place), loftily, upward.
Source: from "H7311";

4792.long:
Meaning: "Merom", a lake in Palestine.
Usage: Merom.
Source: formed like "H4791"; "height";

4793.long:
Meaning: a "run" (the trial of speed).
Usage: race.
Source: from "H7323";

4794.long:
Meaning: a "race" (the act), whether the manner or the progress.
Usage: course, running. Compare "H4835".
Source: or "מְרֻצָה"; feminine of "H4793";

4795.long:
Meaning: properly, "rubbed"; but used abstractly, a "rubbing" (with perfumery).
Usage: purification.
Source: from "H4838";

4796.long:
Meaning: "Maroth", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Maroth.
Source: plural of "H4751" feminine; "bitter springs";

4797.long:
Meaning: "a cry", i.e. (of job), "a revel".
Usage: banquet.
Source: from an unused root meaning to scream;

4798.long:
Meaning: a "cry", i.e. (of grief) a "lamentation".
Usage: mourning.
Source: formed like "H4797";

4799.long:
Meaning: properly, to "soften" by rubbing or pressure; hence (medicinally) to "apply" as an emollient.
Usage: lay for a plaister.
Source: a primitive root;

4800.long:
Meaning: "enlargement", either literally (an "open space", usually in a good sense), or figuratively ("liberty").
Usage: breadth, large place (room).
Source: from "H7337";

4801.long:
Meaning: "remoteness", i.e. (concretely) a "distant" place; often (adverbially) "from afar".
Usage: (a-, dwell in, very) far (country, off). See also "H1023".
Source: ; from "H7368";

4803.long:
Meaning: to "polish"; by implication, to "make bald" (the head), to "gall" (the shoulder); also, to "sharpen".
Usage: bright, furbish, (have his) hair (be) fallen off, peeled, pluck off (hair).
Source: a primitive root;

4804.long:
Meaning: to "pull off".
Usage: be plucked.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H4803";

4805.long:
Meaning: "bitterness", i.e. (figuratively) "rebellion"; concretely, "bitter", or "rebellious".
Usage: bitter, (most) rebel(-lion, -lious).
Source: from "H4784";

4806.long:
Meaning: "stall-fed"; often (as noun) a "beeve".
Usage: fat (fed) beast (cattle, -ling).
Source: from "H4754" in the sense of "grossness", through the idea of "domineering" (compare "H4756");

4807.long:
Meaning: "quarreller of Baal", "Merib-Baal", an epithet of Gideon.
Usage: Merib-baal. Compare "H4810".
Source: from "H7378" and "H1168";

4809.long:
Meaning: "Meribah", the name of two places in the Desert.
Usage: Meribah.
Source: the same as "H4808";

4810.long:
Meaning: "Meri-Baal", an epithet of Gideon.
Usage: Meri-baal. Compare "H4807".
Source: from "H4805" and "H1168"; rebellion of (i.e. against) Baal;

4812.long:
Meaning: "Merajoth", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Meraioth.
Source: plural of "H4811"; "rebellious";

4813.long:
Meaning: "Mirjam", the name of two Israelitesses.
Usage: Miriam.
Source: from "H4805"; "rebelliously";

4817.long:
Meaning: a "chariot"; also a "seat" (in a vehicle).
Usage: chariot, covering, saddle.
Source: from "H7392";

4818.long:
Meaning: a "chariot".
Usage: chariot. See also "H1024".
Source: feminine of "H4817";

4820.long:
Meaning: "fraud".
Usage: craft, deceit(-ful, -fully), false, feigned, guile, subtilly, treachery.
Source: from "H7411" in the sense of "deceiving";

4821.long:
Meaning: "Mirmah", an Israelite.
Usage: Mirma.
Source: the same as "H4820";

4822.long:
Meaning: "Meremoth", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Meremoth.
Source: plural from "H7311"; "heights";

4823.long:
Meaning: "abasement" (the act or the thing).
Usage: tread (down) -ing, (to be) trodden (down) under foot.
Source: from "H7429";

4824.long:
Meaning: a "Meronothite", or inhabitant of some (otherwise unknown) Meronoth.
Usage: Meronothite.
Source: patrial from an unused noun;

4825.long:
Meaning: "Meres", a Persian.
Usage: Meres.
Source: of foreign derivation;

4826.long:
Meaning: "Marsena", a Persian.
Usage: Marsena.
Source: of foreign derivation;

4827.long:
Meaning: used as (abstract) noun, "wickedness".
Usage: do mischief.
Source: from "H7489";

4828.long:
Meaning: a "friend".
Usage: companion, friend.
Source: from "H7462" in the sense of companionship;

4829.long:
Meaning: "pasture" (the place or the act); also the "haunt" of wild animals.
Usage: feeding place, pasture.
Source: from "H7462" in the sense of feeding;

4830.long:
Meaning: "pasturage"; concretely, a "flock".
Usage: flock, pasture.
Source: from "H7462" in the sense of "feeding";

4831.long:
Meaning: "Maralah", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Maralah.
Source: from "H7477"; perhaps, "earthquake";

4832.long:
Meaning: properly, "curative", i.e. literally (concretely) a "medicine", or (abstractly) a "cure"; figuratively (concretely) "deliverance", or (abstractly) "placidity".
Usage: (in-)cure(-able), healing(-lth), remedy, sound, wholesome, yielding.
Source: from "H7495";

4834.long:
Meaning: properly, to "press", i.e. (figuratively) to "be pungent" or "vehement"; to "irritate".
Usage: embolden, be forcible, grievous, sore.
Source: a primitive root;

4838.long:
Meaning: to "polish"; by implication, to "sharpen"; also to "rinse".
Usage: bright, furbish, scour.
Source: a primitive root;

4839.long:
Meaning: "soup" (as if a "rinsing").
Usage: broth. See also "H6564".
Source: from "H4838";

4841.long:
Meaning: abstractly, a "seasoning" (with spicery); concretely, an "unguentkettle" (for preparing spiced oil).
Usage: pot of ointment, × well.
Source: feminine of "H4840";

4842.long:
Meaning: an aromatic "unguent"; also an "unguent-pot".
Usage: prepared by the apothecaries' art, compound, ointment.
Source: from "H7543";

4843.long:
Meaning: to "be" (causatively, "make") "bitter" (literally or figuratively).
Usage: (be, be in, deal, have, make) bitter(-ly, -ness), be moved with choler, (be, have sorely, it) grieved(-eth), provoke, vex.
Source: a primitive root; properly, to trickle (see "H4752"); but used only as a denominative from "H4751";

4846.long:
Meaning: properly, "bitterness"; concretely, a "bitter thing"; specifically "bile"; also "venom" (of a serpent).
Usage: bitter (thing), gall.
Source: or "מְרוֹרָה"; from "H4843";

4847.long:
Meaning: "Merari", an Israelite.
Usage: Merari. See also "H4848".
Source: from "H4843"; "bitter";

4848.long:
Meaning: a "Merarite" (collectively), or descendants of Merari.
Usage: Merarites.
Source: from "H4847";

4849.long:
Meaning: a "female wicked doer".
Usage: wicked woman.
Source: from "H7561";

4850.long:
Meaning: "Merathajim", an epithet of Babylon.
Usage: Merathaim.
Source: dual of "H4751" feminine; "double bitterness";

4851.long:
Meaning: "Mash", a son of Aram, and the people descended from him.
Usage: Mash.
Source: of foreign derivation;

4852.long:
Meaning: "Mesha", a place in Arabia.
Usage: Mesha.
Source: of foreign derivation;

4853.long:
Meaning: a "burden"; specifically, "tribute", or (abstractly) "porterage"; figuratively, an "utterance", chiefly a "doom", especially "singing"; mental, "desire".
Usage: burden, carry away, prophecy, × they set, song, tribute.
Source: from "H5375";

4854.long:
Meaning: "Massa", a son of Ishmael.
Usage: Massa.
Source: the same as "H4853"; "burden";

4855.long:
Meaning: a "loan"; by implication, "interest on a debt".
Usage: exaction, usury.
Source: from "H5383";

4857.brief: trough for cattle to drink from
4857.long:
Meaning: a "trough for cattle to drink from".
Usage: place of drawing water.
Source: from "H7579";

4858.long:
Meaning: a "conflagration" (from the "rising" of smoke).
Usage: burden.
Source: from "H5375";

4861.long:
Meaning: "Mishal", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Mishal, Misheal. Compare "H4913".
Source: from "H7592"; "request";

4863.long:
Meaning: a "kneading-trough" (in which the dough rises).
Usage: kneading trough, store.
Source: from "H7604" in the original sense of "swelling";

4864.long:
Meaning: properly, (abstractly) a "raising" (as of the hands in prayer), or "rising" (of flame); figuratively, an "utterance"; concretely, a "beacon" (as raised); a "present" (as taken), "mess", or "tribute"; figuratively, a "reproach" (as a burden).
Usage: burden, collection, sign of fire, (great) flame, gift, lifting up, mess, oblation, reward.
Source: from "H5375";

4865.long:
Meaning: a "brocade"; by analogy, a (reticulated) "setting" of a gem.
Usage: ouch, wrought.
Source: from "H7660";

4866.long:
Meaning: the "orifice" of the womb (from which the fœtus "breaks" forth).
Usage: birth, breaking forth.
Source: from "H7665";

4867.long:
Meaning: a "breaker" (of the sea).
Usage: billow, wave.
Source: from "H7665";

4869.long:
Meaning: properly, a "cliff" (or other "lofty" or "inaccessible" place); abstractly, "altitude"; figuratively, a "refuge"; "Misgab", a place in Moab.
Usage: defence, high fort (tower), refuge, Misgab.
Source: from "H7682";

4871.long:
Meaning: to "pull out" (literally or figuratively).
Usage: draw(out).
Source: a primitive root;

4872.long:
Meaning: "Mosheh", the Israelite lawgiver.
Usage: Moses.
Source: from "H4871"; "drawing" out (of the water), i.e. "rescued";

4875.long:
Meaning: (a) "ruin", abstractly (the act) or concretely (the wreck).
Usage: desolation, waste.
Source: or "מְשֹׁאָה"; from the same as "H7722";

4879.long:
Meaning: "mistake".
Usage: error.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "stray";

4882.long:
Meaning: "spoilation".
Usage: spoil.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "plunder";

4883.long:
Meaning: a "saw".
Usage: saw.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "rasp";

4884.long:
Meaning: a "measure" (for liquids).
Usage: measure.
Source: from an unused root meaning apparently to "divide";

4885.long:
Meaning: "delight", concretely (the cause or object) or abstractly (the feeling).
Usage: joy, mirth, rejoice.
Source: from "H7797";

4886.long:
Meaning: to "rub with oil", i.e. to "anoint"; by implication, to "consecrate"; also to "paint".
Usage: anoint, paint.
Source: a primitive root;

4887.long:
Meaning: "oil".
Usage: oil.
Source: (Aramaic) from a root corresponding to "H4886";

4888.long:
Meaning: "unction" (the act); by implication, a consecratory "gift".
Usage: (to be) anointed(-ing), ointment.
Source: or "מׇשְׁחָה"; from "H4886";

4889.long:
Meaning: "destructive", i.e. (as noun) "destruction", literally (specifically a snare) or figuratively (corruption).
Usage: corruption, (to) destroy(-ing), destruction, trap, × utterly.
Source: from "H7843";

4891.long:
Meaning: "dawn".
Usage: morning.
Source: from "H7836" in the sense of day "breaking";

4897.long:
Meaning: "silk" (as drawn from the cocoon).
Usage: silk.
Source: from "H4871";

4898.long:
Meaning: "Meshezabel", an Israelite.
Usage: Meshezabeel.
Source: from an equiv. to "H7804" and "H410"; "delivered of God";

4899.long:
Meaning: "anointed"; usually a "consecrated" person (as a king, priest, or saint); specifically, the "Messiah".
Usage: anointed, Messiah.
Source: from "H4886";

4900.long:
Meaning: to "draw", used in a great variety of applications (including to "sow", to "sound", to "prolong", to "develop", to "march", to "remove", to "delay", to "be tall", etc.).
Usage: draw (along, out), continue, defer, extend, forbear, × give, handle, make (pro-, sound) long, × sow, scatter, stretch out.
Source: a primitive root;

4901.long:
Meaning: a "sowing"; also a "possession".
Usage: precious, price.
Source: from "H4900";

4902.long:
Meaning: "Meshek", a son of Japheth, and the people descended from him.
Usage: Mesech, Meshech.
Source: the same in form as "H4901", but probably of foreign derivation;

4904.long:
Meaning: a "bed" (figuratively, a "bier"); abstractly, "sleep"; by euphemism, carnal "intercourse".
Usage: bed(-chamber), couch, lieth (lying) with.
Source: from "H7901";

4906.long:
Meaning: a "figure" (carved on stone, the wall, or any object); figuratively, "imagination".
Usage: conceit, image(-ry), picture, × wish.
Source: from the same as "H7906";

4908.long:
Meaning: a "residence" (including a shepherd's "hut", the "lair" of animals, figuratively, the "grave"; also the "Temple"); specifically, "the Tabernacle" (properly, its wooden walls).
Usage: dwelleth, dwelling (place), habitation, tabernacle, tent.
Source: from "H7931";

4910.long:
Meaning: to "rule".
Usage: (have, make to have) dominion, governor, × indeed, reign, (bear, cause to, have) rule(-ing, -r), have power.
Source: a primitive root;

4911.long:
Meaning: to "liken", i.e. (transitively) to use figurative language (an allegory, adage, song or the like); intransitively, to "resemble".
Usage: be(-come) like, compare, use (as a) proverb, speak (in proverbs), utter.
Source: denominative from "H4912";

4912.long:
Meaning: properly, a "pithy" maxim, usually of metaphorical nature; hence, a "simile" (as an adage, poem, discourse).
Usage: byword, like, parable, proverb.
Source: apparently from "H4910" in some original sense of "superiority" in mental action;

4913.long:
Meaning: "Mashal", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Mashal.
Source: for "H4861";

4916.long:
Meaning: a "sending" out, i.e. (abstractly) "presentation" (favorable), or "seizure" (unfavorable); also (concretely) a place of "dismissal", or a "business" to be discharged.
Usage: to lay, to put, sending (forth), to set.
Source: or "מִשְׁלֹחַ"; also "מִשְׁלָח"; from "H7971";

4917.long:
Meaning: a "mission", i.e. (abstractly and favorable) "release", or (concretely and unfavorable) an "army".
Usage: discharge, sending.
Source: feminine of "H4916";

4918.long:
Meaning: "Meshullam", the name of seventeen Israelites.
Usage: Meshullam.
Source: from "H7999"; "allied";

4919.long:
Meaning: "Meshillemoth", an Israelite.
Usage: Meshillemoth. Compare "H4921".
Source: plural from "H7999"; "reconciliations"

4920.long:
Meaning: "Meshelemjah", an Israelite.
Usage: Meshelemiah.
Source: or "מְשֶׁלֶמְיָהוּ"; from "H7999" and "H3050"; "ally of Jah";

4921.long:
Meaning: "Meshillemith", an Israelite.
Usage: Meshillemith. Compare "H4919".
Source: from "H7999"; reconciliation;

4924.long:
Meaning: "fat", i.e. (literally and abstractly) "fatness"; but usually (figuratively and concretely) a "rich" dish, a "fertile" field, a "robust" man.
Usage: fat (one, -ness, -test, -test place).
Source: from "H8080";

4927.long:
Meaning: "Mishma", the name of a son of Ishmael, and of an Israelite.
Usage: Mishma.
Source: the same as "H4926";

4928.long:
Meaning: "audience", i.e. the royal "court"; also "obedience", i.e. (concretely) a "subject".
Usage: bidding, guard, obey.
Source: feminine of "H4926";

4929.long:
Meaning: a "guard" (the man, the post or the prison); a "deposit" (figuratively); also (as observed) a usage (abstractly), or an "example" (concretely).
Usage: diligence, guard, office, prison, ward, watch.
Source: from "H8104";

4931.long:
Meaning: "watch", i.e. the act ("custody"), or (concretely) the "sentry", the "post"; objectively "preservation", or (concretely) "safe"; figuratively "observance", i.e. (abstractly) "duty" or (objectively) "a usage" or "party".
Usage: charge, keep, or to be kept, office, ordinace, safeguard, ward, watch.
Source: feminine of "H4929";

4932.long:
Meaning: properly, a "repetition", i.e. a "duplicate" ("copy" of a document), or a "double" (in amount); by implication, a "second" (in order, rank, age, quality or location).
Usage: college, copy, double, fatlings, next, second (order), twice as much.
Source: from "H8138";

4934.long:
Meaning: a "hollow", i.e. a narrow passage.
Usage: path.
Source: from the same as "H8168";

4937.long:
Meaning: a "support" (concretely), i.e. (figuratively) a "protector" or "sustenance".
Usage: stay.
Source: or "מִשְׁעָן"; from "H8172";

4938.long:
Meaning: "support" (abstractly), i.e. (figuratively) "sustenance" or (concretely) a "walking-stick".
Usage: staff.
Source: or "מִשְׁעֶנֶת"; feminine of "H4937";

4940.long:
Meaning: a "family", i.e. "circle of relatives"; figuratively, a "class" (of persons), a "species" (of animals) or "sort" (of things); by extension a "tribe" or "people".
Usage: family, kind(-red).
Source: from "H8192" (compare "H8198");

4941.long:
Meaning: properly, a "verdict" (favorable or unfavorable) pronounced judicially, especially a "sentence" or formal decree (human or (participant's) divine "law", individual or collective), including the act, the place, the suit, the crime, and the penalty; abstractly, "justice", including a participant's "right" or "privilege" (statutory or customary), or even a "style".
Usage: adversary, ceremony, charge, × crime, custom, desert, determination, discretion, disposing, due, fashion, form, to be judged, judgment, just(-ice, -ly), (manner of) law(-ful), manner, measure, (due) order, ordinance, right, sentence, usest, × worthy, wrong.
Source: from "H8199";

4942.long:
Meaning: a "stall" for cattle (only dual).
Usage: burden, sheepfold.
Source: from "H8192";

4943.long:
Meaning: "possession".
Usage: steward.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "hold";

4944.long:
Meaning: a "traversing", i.e. "rapid motion".
Usage: running to and fro.
Source: from "H8264";

4945.long:
Meaning: properly, "causing to drink", i.e. a "butler"; by implication (intransitively), "drink" (itself); figuratively, a "well-watered" region.
Usage: butler(-ship), cupbearer, drink(-ing), fat pasture, watered.
Source: from "H8248";

4947.long:
Meaning: a "lintel".
Usage: lintel.
Source: from "H8259" in its original sense of overhanging;

4949.long:
Meaning: a "weight", i.e. a "plummet" (with line attached).
Usage: plummet.
Source: or "מִשְׁקֹלֶת"; feminine of "H4948" or "H4947";

4950.long:
Meaning: a "settling place" (of water), i.e. a "pond".
Usage: deep.
Source: from "H8257";

4952.long:
Meaning: "maceration", i.e. steeped "juice".
Usage: liquor.
Source: from "H8281" in the sense of "loosening";

4953.long:
Meaning: a (musical) "pipe" (from its whistling sound).
Usage: flute.
Source: (Aramaic) from a root corresponding to "H8319";

4954.long:
Meaning: a "Mishraite", or inhabitant (collectively) of Mishra.
Usage: Mishraites.
Source: patrial from an unused noun from an unused root; probably meaning to "stretch out"; "extension";

4955.long:
Meaning: "combustion", i.e. "cremation" (of a corpse), or "calcination" (of lime).
Usage: burning.
Source: from "H8313";

4956.long:
Meaning: "Misrephoth-Majim", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Misrephoth-mayim.
Source: from the plural of "H4955" and "H4325"; "burnings of water";

4957.long:
Meaning: "Masrekah", a place in Idumaea.
Usage: Masrekah.
Source: a form for "H7796" used denominatively; "vineyard";

4958.long:
Meaning: a "pan".
Usage: pan.
Source: apparently from an unused root meaning to "perforate", i.e. "hollow out";

4959.long:
Meaning: to "feel of"; by implication, to "grope".
Usage: feel, grope, search.
Source: a primitive root;

4960.long:
Meaning: "drink", by implication, "drinking" (the act); also (by implication) a "banquet" or (generally) "feast".
Usage: banquet, drank, drink, feast((-ed), -ing).
Source: from "H8354";

4962.long:
Meaning: properly, an "adult" (as of full length); by implication, a "man" (only in the plural).
Usage: few, × friends, men, persons, × small.
Source: from the same as "H4970";

4963.long:
Meaning: "straw" in the heap.
Usage: straw.
Source: denominative from "H8401";

4964.long:
Meaning: a "bit".
Usage: bit, bridle.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "curb";

4965.long:
Meaning: "Metheg-ha-Ammah", an epithet of Gath.
Usage: Metheg-ammah.
Source: from "H4964" and "H520" with the art. interposed; bit of the metropolis;

4967.long:
Meaning: "Methusael", an antediluvian patriarch.
Usage: Methusael.
Source: from "H4962" and "H410", with the relative interposed; man who (is) of God;

4968.long:
Meaning: "Methushelach", an antediluvian patriarch.
Usage: Methuselah.
Source: from "H4962" and "H7973"; "man of a dart";

4969.long:
Meaning: to "stretch" out.
Usage: spread out.
Source: a primitive root;

4970.long:
Meaning: properly, "extent" (of time); but used only adverbially (especially with other particle prefixes), "when" (either relative or interrogative).
Usage: long, when.
Source: from an unused root meaning to extend;

4971.long:
Meaning: "proportion" (in size, number or ingredients).
Usage: composition, measure, state, tale.
Source: or "מַתְכֻנֶת"; from "H8505" in the transferred sense of measuring;

4972.long:
Meaning: "what a trouble!".
Usage: what a weariness.
Source: from "H4100" and "H8513";

4973.long:
Meaning: properly, a "biter", i.e. a "tooth".
Usage: cheek (jaw) tooth, jaw.
Source: contr. from "H3216";

4975.long:
Meaning: properly, the "waist" or small of the back; only in plural the "loins".
Usage: greyhound, loins, side.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "be slender";

4976.long:
Meaning: a "present".
Usage: gift, to give, reward.
Source: from "H5414";

4977.long:
Meaning: "Mattan", the name of a priest of Baal, and of an Israelite.
Usage: Mattan.
Source: the same as "H4976";

4979.long:
Meaning: a "present"; specifically (in a good sense), a "sacrificial offering", (in a bad sense) a "bribe".
Usage: gift.
Source: feminine of "H4976";

4980.long:
Meaning: "Mattanah", a place in the Desert.
Usage: Mattanah.
Source: the same as "H4979";

4981.long:
Meaning: a "Mithnite", or inhabitant of Methen.
Usage: Mithnite.
Source: probably patrial from an unused noun meaning slenderness;

4982.long:
Meaning: "Mattenai", the name of three Israelites.
Usage: Mattenai.
Source: from "H4976"; "liberal";

4983.long:
Meaning: "Mattanjah", the name of ten Israelites.
Usage: Mattaniah.
Source: or "מַתַּנְיָהוּ"; from "H4976" and "H3050"; "gift of Jah";

4985.long:
Meaning: to "suck", by implication, to "relish", or (intransitively) "be sweet".
Usage: be (made, × take) sweet.
Source: a primitive root;

4989.long:
Meaning: "Mithkah", a place in the Desert.
Usage: Mithcah.
Source: feminine of "H4987"; "sweetness";

4990.long:
Meaning: "Mithredath", the name of two Persians.
Usage: Mithredath.
Source: of Persian origin;

4991.long:
Meaning: a "present".
Usage: gift.
Source: feminine of "H4976" abbreviated form;

4992.long:
Meaning: "Mattattah", an Israelite.
Usage: Mattathah.
Source: for "H4993"; "gift of Jah";

4993.long:
Meaning: "Mattithjah", the name of four Israelites.
Usage: Mattithiah. n.
Source: or "מַתִּתְיָהוּ"; from "H4991" and "H3050"; "gift of Jah";

4994.long:
Meaning: "'I pray'", "'now'", or "'then'"; added mostly to verbs (in the Imperative or Future), or to interjections, occasionally to an adverb or conjunction.
Usage: I beseech (pray) thee (you), go to, now, oh.
Source: a primitive particle of incitement and entreaty, which may usually be rendered;

4995.long:
Meaning: properly, "tough", i.e. "uncooked" (flesh).
Usage: raw.
Source: apparently from "H5106" in the sense of harshness from refusal;

4996.long:
Meaning: "No" (i.e. Thebes), the capital of Upper Egypt.
Usage: No. Compare "H528".
Source: of Egyptian origin;

4997.long:
Meaning: a (skin or leather) "bag" (for fluids).
Usage: bottle.
Source: or "נאוֹד"; also (feminine) "נֹאדָה"; from an unused root of uncertain signification;

4998.long:
Meaning: properly, to "be at home", i.e. (by implication) to be "pleasant" (or "suitable"), i.e. "beautiful".
Usage: be beautiful, become, be comely.
Source: a primitive root;

4999.long:
Meaning: a "home"; figuratively, a "pasture".
Usage: habitation, house, pasture, pleasant place.
Source: from "H4998";

5000.long:
Meaning: "suitable", or "beautiful".
Usage: becometh, comely, seemly.
Source: from "H4998" or "H5116";

5001.long:
Meaning: properly, to "whisper", i.e. (by implication) to "utter" as an oracle.
Usage: say.
Source: a primitive root;

5003.long:
Meaning: to "commit adultery"; figuratively, to "apostatize".
Usage: adulterer(-ess), commit(-ing) adultery, woman that breaketh wedlock.
Source: a primitive root;

5006.long:
Meaning: to "scorn"; or (in Ecclesiastes 12:5), by interchange for "H5132", to "bloom".
Usage: abhor, (give occasion to) blaspheme, contemn, despise, flourish, × great, provoke.
Source: a primitive root;

5010.long:
Meaning: to "reject".
Usage: abhor, make void.
Source: a primitive root;

5011.long:
Meaning: "Nob", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Nob.
Source: the same as "H5108"; "fruit";

5012.long:
Meaning: to "prophesy", i.e. "speak" (or sing) "by inspiration" (in prediction or simple discourse).
Usage: prophesy(-ing), make self a prophet.
Source: a primitive root;

5014.long:
Meaning: to "pierce"; to "be hollow", or (figuratively) "foolish".
Usage: hollow, vain.
Source: a primitive root;

5015.long:
Meaning: "Nebo", the name of a Babylonian deity, also of a mountain in Moab, and of a place in Palestine.
Usage: Nebo.
Source: probably of foreign derivation;

5018.long:
Meaning: "Nebuzaradan", a Babylonian general.
Usage: Nebuzaradan.
Source: of foreign origin;

5019.long:
Meaning: "Nebukadnetstsar" (or -"retstsar", or -"retstsor"), king of Babylon.
Usage: Nebuchadnezzar, Nebuchadrezzar.
Source: or "נְבֻּכַדְנֶאצַּר"; (2 Kings 24:1,10), or "נְבוּכַדְנֶצַּר"; (Esther 2:6; Daniel 1:18), or "נְבוּכַדְרֶאצַּר"; or "נְבוּכַדְרֶאצּוֹר"; (Ezra 2:1; Jeremiah 49:28), of foreign derivation;

5021.long:
Meaning: "Nebushazban", Nebuchadnezzar's chief eunuch.
Usage: Nebushazban.
Source: of foreign derivation;

5022.long:
Meaning: "Naboth", an Israelite.
Usage: Naboth.
Source: feminine plural from the same as "H5011"; "fruits";

5024.long:
Meaning: to "bark" (as a dog).
Usage: bark.
Source: a primitive root;

5025.long:
Meaning: "Nobach", the name of an Israelite, and of a place East of the Jordan.
Usage: Nobah.
Source: from "H5024"; a "bark";

5026.long:
Meaning: "Nibchaz", a deity of the Avites.
Usage: Nibhaz.
Source: of foreign origin;

5027.long:
Meaning: to "scan", i.e. "look intently at"; by implication, to "regard" with pleasure, favor or care.
Usage: (cause to) behold, consider, look (down), regard, have respect, see.
Source: a primitive root;

5028.long:
Meaning: "Nebat", the father of Jeroboam I.
Usage: Nebat.
Source: from "H5027"; "regard";

5030.long:
Meaning: a "prophet" or (generally) "inspired man".
Usage: prophecy, that prophesy, prophet.
Source: from "H5012";

5031.long:
Meaning: a "prophetess" or (generally) "inspired" woman; by implication, a "poetess"; by association a "prophet's wife".
Usage: prophetess.
Source: feminine of "H5030";

5032.long:
Meaning: "Nebajoth", a son of Ismael, and the country settled by him.
Usage: Nebaioth, Nebajoth.
Source: or "נְבָיֹת"; feminine plural from "H5107"; "fruitfulnesses";

5033.long:
Meaning: a "fountain".
Usage: spring.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "burst forth";

5034.long:
Meaning: to "wilt"; generally, to "fall" away, "fail", "faint"; figuratively, to "be foolish" or (morally) "wicked"; causatively, to "despise", "disgrace".
Usage: disgrace, dishounour, lightly esteem, fade (away, -ing), fall (down, -ling, off), do foolishly, come to nought, × surely, make vile, wither.
Source: a primitive root;

5035.long:
Meaning: a skin-"bag" for liquids (from "collapsing" when empty); hence, a "vase" (as similar in shape when full); also a "lyre" (as having a body of like form).
Usage: bottle, pitcher, psaltery, vessel, viol.
Source: or "נֵבֶל"; from "H5034";

5036.long:
Meaning: "stupid"; "wicked" (especially "impious").
Usage: fool(-ish, -ish man, -ish woman), vile person.
Source: from "H5034";

5037.long:
Meaning: "Nabal", an Israelite.
Usage: Nabal.
Source: the same as "H5036"; "dolt";

5038.long:
Meaning: a "flabby" thing, i.e. a "carcase" or "carrion" (human or bestial, often collectively); figuratively, an "idol".
Usage: (dead) body, (dead) carcase, dead of itself, which died, (beast) that (which) dieth of itself.
Source: from "H5034";

5039.long:
Meaning: "foolishness", i.e. (morally) "wickedness"; concretely, a "crime"; by extension, "punishment".
Usage: folly, vile, villany.
Source: feminine of "H5036";

5041.long:
Meaning: "Neballat", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Neballat.
Source: apparently from "H5036" and "H3909"; "foolish secrecy";

5042.long:
Meaning: to "gush forth"; figuratively, to "utter" (good or bad words); specifically, to "emit" (a foul odor).
Usage: belch out, flowing, pour out, send forth, utter (abundantly).
Source: a primitive root;

5043.long:
Meaning: a "light"; plural (collectively) a "chandelier".
Usage: candlestick.
Source: (Aramaic) from an unused root meaning to shine;

5044.long:
Meaning: "Nibshan", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Nibshan.
Source: of uncertain derivation;

5045.long:
Meaning: the "south" (from its drought); specifically, the "Negeb" or southern district of Judah, occasionally, "Egypt" (as south to Palestine).
Usage: south (country, side, -ward).
Source: from an unused root meaning to be parched;

5046.long:
Meaning: properly, to "front", i.e. stand boldly out opposite; by implication (causatively), to "manifest"; figuratively, to "announce" (always by word of mouth to one present); specifically, to "expose", "predict", "explain", "praise".
Usage: bewray, × certainly, certify, declare(-ing), denounce, expound, × fully, messenger, plainly, profess, rehearse, report, shew (forth), speak, × surely, tell, utter.
Source: a primitive root;

5047.long:
Meaning: to "flow" (through the idea of clearing the way).
Usage: issue.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H5046";

5048.long:
Meaning: a "front", i.e. "part opposite"; specifically a "counterpart", or "mate"; usually (adverbial, especially with preposition) "over against" or "before".
Usage: about, (over) against, × aloof, × far (off), × from, over, presence, × other side, sight, × to view.
Source: from "H5046";

5050.long:
Meaning: to "glitter"; causatively, to "illuminate".
Usage: (en-) lighten, (cause to) shine.
Source: a primitive root;

5051.long:
Meaning: "brilliancy" (literally or figuratively).
Usage: bright(-ness), light, (clear) shining.
Source: from "H5050";

5052.long:
Meaning: "Nogah", a son of David.
Usage: Nogah.
Source: the same as "H5051";

5055.long:
Meaning: to "butt" with the horns; figuratively, to "war" against.
Usage: gore, push (down, -ing).
Source: a primitive root;

5057.long:
Meaning: a "commander" (as occupying the "front"), civil, military or religious; generally (abstractly, plural), "honorable" themes.
Usage: captain, chief, excellent thing, (chief) governor, leader, noble, prince, (chief) ruler.
Source: or "נָגִד"; from "H5046";

5058.long:
Meaning: properly, "instrumental music"; by implication, a "stringed instrument"; by extension, a "poem set to music"; specifically, an "epigram".
Usage: stringed instrument, musick, Neginoth (plural), song.
Source: or "נְגִינַת"; (Psalm 61:title), from "H5059";

5059.long:
Meaning: properly, to "thrum", i.e. "beat" a tune with the fingers; expectation. to "play" on a stringed instrument; hence (generally), to "make music".
Usage: player on instruments, sing to the stringed instruments, melody, ministrel, play(-er, -ing).
Source: a primitive root;

5060.long:
Meaning: properly, to "touch", i.e. "lay the hand upon" (for any purpose; euphemistically, to lie with a woman); by implication, to "reach" (figuratively, to "arrive", "acquire"); violently, to "strike" (punish, defeat, destroy, etc.).
Usage: beat, (× be able to) bring (down), cast, come (nigh), draw near (nigh), get up, happen, join, near, plague, reach (up), smite, strike, touch.
Source: a primitive root;

5061.long:
Meaning: a "blow" (figuratively, infliction); also (by implication) a "spot" (concretely, a leprous person or dress).
Usage: plague, sore, stricken, stripe, stroke, wound.
Source: from "H5060";

5062.long:
Meaning: to "push", "gore", "defeat", "stub" (the toe), "inflict" (a disease).
Usage: beat, dash, hurt, plague, slay, smite (down), strike, stumble, × surely, put to the worse.
Source: a primitive root;

5063.long:
Meaning: a "trip" (of the foot); figuratively, an "infliction" (of disease).
Usage: plague, stumbling.
Source: from "H5062";

5064.long:
Meaning: to "flow"; figuratively, to "stretch out"; causatively, to "pour out" or "down"; figuratively, to "deliver over".
Usage: fall, flow away, pour down (out), run, shed, spilt, trickle down.
Source: a primitive root;

5065.long:
Meaning: to "drive" (an animal, a workman, a debtor, an army); by implication, to "tax", "harass", "tyrannize".
Usage: distress, driver, exact(-or), oppress(-or), × raiser of taxes, taskmaster.
Source: a primitive root;

5066.long:
Meaning: to "be" or "come" (causatively, "bring") "near" (for any purpose); euphemistically, to "lie with" a woman; as an enemy, to "attack"; religious to "worship"; causatively, to "present"; figuratively, to "adduce" an argument; by reversal, to "stand back".
Usage: (make to) approach (nigh), bring (forth, hither, near), (cause to) come (hither, near, nigh), give place, go hard (up), (be, draw, go) near (nigh), offer, overtake, present, put, stand.
Source: a primitive root;

5067.long:
Meaning: a "mound", i.e. "wave".
Usage: heap.
Source: from "H5110" in the sense of "piling" up;

5068.long:
Meaning: "to impel"; hence, "to volunteer" (as a soldier), "to present spontaneously".
Usage: offer freely, be (give, make, offer self) willing(-ly).
Source: a primitive root;

5069.long:
Meaning: "be" (or give) "liberal"(-ly).
Usage: (be minded of...own) freewill (offering), offer freely (willingly).
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H5068";

5070.long:
Meaning: "Nadab", the name of four Israelites.
Usage: Nadab.
Source: from "H5068"; liberal;

5071.long:
Meaning: properly (abstractly) "spontaneity", or (adjectively) "spontaneous"; also (concretely) a "spontaneous" or (by inference, in plural) "abundant" gift.
Usage: free(-will) offering, freely, plentiful, voluntary(-ily, offering), willing(-ly), offering).
Source: from "H5068";

5072.long:
Meaning: "Nedabjah", an Israelite.
Usage: Nedabiah.
Source: from "H5068" and "H3050"; "largess of Jah";

5073.long:
Meaning: a "layer" (of building materials).
Usage: row.
Source: (Aramaic) from a root meaning to stick;

5074.long:
Meaning: properly, to "wave" to and fro (rarely to flap up and down); figuratively, to "rove", "flee", or (causatively) to "drive away".
Usage: chase (away), × could not, depart, flee (× apace, away), (re-) move, thrust away, wander (abroad, -er, -ing).
Source: a primitive root;

5076.long:
Meaning: properly, "tossed"; abstractly, a "rolling" (on the bed).
Usage: tossing to and fro.
Source: passive participle of "H5074";

5077.long:
Meaning: properly, to "toss"; figuratively, to "exclude", i.e. "banish", "postpone", "prohibit".
Usage: cast out, drive, put far away.
Source: or "נָדָא"; (2 Kings 17:21), a primitive root;

5078.long:
Meaning: a "bounty" (for prostitution).
Usage: gifts.
Source: from "H5077" in the sense of freely flinging money;

5079.long:
Meaning: properly, "rejection"; by implication, "impurity", especially personal (menstruation) or moral (idolatry, incest).
Usage: × far, filthiness, × flowers, menstruous (woman), put apart, × removed (woman), separation, set apart, unclean(-ness, thing, with filthiness).
Source: from "H5074";

5080.long:
Meaning: to push "off"; used in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively (to expel, mislead, strike, inflict, etc.).
Usage: banish, bring, cast down (out), chase, compel, draw away, drive (away, out, quite), fetch a stroke, force, go away, outcast, thrust away (out), withdraw.
Source: a primitive root;

5081.long:
Meaning: properly, "voluntary", i.e. generous; hence, "magnanimous"; as noun, a "grandee" (sometimes a "tyrant").
Usage: free, liberal (things), noble, prince, willing (hearted).
Source: from "H5068";

5083.long:
Meaning: a "present" (for prostitution).
Usage: gift.
