Source: probably from an unused root meaning to "give";

5084.long:
Meaning: a "sheath" (of a sword).
Usage: sheath.
Source: of uncertain derivation;

5085.long:
Meaning: a "sheath"; figuratively, the "body" (as the receptacle of the soul).
Usage: body.
Source: (Aramaic) from the same as "H5084";

5086.long:
Meaning: to "shove" asunder, i.e. "disperse".
Usage: drive (away, to and fro), thrust down, shaken, tossed to and fro.
Source: a primitive root;

5087.long:
Meaning: to "promise" (pos., to do or give something to God).
Usage: (make a) vow.
Source: a primitive root;

5088.long:
Meaning: a "promise" (to God); also (concretely) a "thing promised".
Usage: vow(-ed).
Source: or "נֵדֶר"; from "H5087";

5089.long:
Meaning: "lamentation".
Usage: wailing.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "lament";

5090.long:
Meaning: to "drive" forth (a person, an animal or chariot), i.e. "lead", "carry away"; reflexively, to "proceed" (i.e. impel or guide oneself); also (from the "panting" induced by effort), to "sigh".
Usage: acquaint, bring (away), carry away, drive (away), lead (away, forth), (be) guide, lead (away, forth).
Source: a primitive root;

5091.long:
Meaning: to "groan", i.e. "bewail"; hence (through the idea of crying aloud), to "assemble" (as if on proclamation).
Usage: lament, wail.
Source: a primitive root;

5094.long:
Meaning: "illumination", i.e. (figuratively) "wisdom".
Usage: light.
Source: (Aramaic) or "נְהִירוּ"; (Aramaic), from the same as "H5105";

5095.long:
Meaning: properly, to run with a "sparkle", i.e. "flow"; hence (transitively), to "conduct", and (by inference) to "protect", "sustain".
Usage: carry, feed, guide, lead (gently, on).
Source: a primitive root;

5096.long:
Meaning: "Nahalal" or "Nahalol", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Nahalal, Nahallal, Nahalol.
Source: or "נַהֲלֹל"; the same as "H5097";

5098.long:
Meaning: to "growl".
Usage: mourn, roar(-ing).
Source: a primitive root;

5101.long:
Meaning: to "bray" (as an ass), "scream" (from hunger).
Usage: bray.
Source: a primitive root;

5102.long:
Meaning: to "sparkle", i.e. (figuratively) "be cheerful"; hence (from the "sheen" of a running stream) to "flow", i.e. (figuratively) "assemble".
Usage: flow (together), be lightened.
Source: a primitive root;

5103.long:
Meaning: a "river", especially the "Euphrates".
Usage: river, stream.
Source: (Aramaic) from a root corresponding to "H5102";

5104.long:
Meaning: a "stream" (including the sea; expectation the Nile, Euphrates, etc.); figuratively, "prosperity".
Usage: flood, river.
Source: from "H5102";

5105.long:
Meaning: "daylight".
Usage: light.
Source: from "H5102" in its original sense;

5106.long:
Meaning: to "refuse", "forbid", "dissuade", or "neutralize".
Usage: break, disallow, discourage, make of none effect.
Source: a primitive root;

5107.long:
Meaning: to "germinate", i.e. (figuratively) to (causatively, "make") "flourish"; also (of words), to "utter".
Usage: bring forth (fruit), make cheerful, increase.
Source: a primitive root;

5108.long:
Meaning: "produce", literally or figuratively.
Usage: fruit.
Source: or "נֵיב"; from "H5107";

5109.long:
Meaning: "Nobai", an Israelite.
Usage: Nebai (from the margin).
Source: from "H5108"; "fruitful";

5110.long:
Meaning: to "nod", i.e. "waver"; figuratively, to "wander", "flee", "disappear"; also (from shaking the head in sympathy), to "console", "deplore", or (from tossing the head in scorn) "taunt".
Usage: bemoan, flee, get, mourn, make to move, take pity, remove, shake, skip for joy, be sorry, vagabond, way, wandering.
Source: a primitive root;

5113.long:
Meaning: "Nod", the land of Cain.
Usage: Nod.
Source: the same as "H5112"; "vagrancy";

5115.long:
Meaning: to "rest" (as at home); causatively (through the implied idea of "beauty"), to "celebrate" (with praises).
Usage: keep at home, prepare an habitation.
Source: a primitive root; (compare "H5116")

5116.long:
Meaning: (adjectively) "at home"; hence (by implication of satisfaction) "lovely"; also (noun) a "home", of God (temple), men (residence), flocks (pasture), or wild animals ("den").
Usage: comely, dwelling (place), fold, habitation, pleasant place, sheepcote, stable, tarried.
Source: or (feminine) "נָוָה"; from "H5115";

5117.long:
Meaning: to "rest", i.e. "settle" down; used in a great variety of applications, literal and figurative, intransitive, transitive and causative (to "dwell", "stay", "let fall", "place", "let alone", "withdraw", "give comfort", etc.).
Usage: cease, be confederate, lay, let down, (be) quiet, remain, (cause to, be at, give, have, make to) rest, set down. Compare "H3241".
Source: a primitive root;

5121.long:
Meaning: "Navith", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Naioth (from the margin).
Source: from "H5115"; residence;

5122.long:
Meaning: a "sink".
Usage: dunghill.
Source: (Aramaic) or "נְוָלִי"; (Aramaic), from an unused root probably meaning to be foul;

5123.long:
Meaning: to "slumber" (from drowsiness).
Usage: sleep, slumber.
Source: a primitive root;

5125.long:
Meaning: to "resprout", i.e. "propagate by shoots"; figuratively, to "be perpetual".
Usage: be continued.
Source: a primitive root;

5126.long:
Meaning: "Nun" or "Non", the father of Joshua.
Usage: Non, Nun.
Source: or "נוֹן"; (1 Chronicles 7:27), from "H5125"; "perpetuity",

5127.long:
Meaning: to "flit", i.e. "vanish" away (subside, escape; causatively, chase, impel, deliver).
Usage: × abate, away, be displayed, (make to) flee (away, -ing), put to flight, × hide, lift up a standard.
Source: a primitive root;

5128.long:
Meaning: to "waver", in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively (as subjoined).
Usage: continually, fugitive, × make, to (go) up and down, be gone away, (be) move(-able, -d), be promoted, reel, remove, scatter, set, shake, sift, stagger, to and fro, be vagabond, wag, (make) wander (up and down).
Source: a primitive root;

5129.long:
Meaning: "Noadjah", the name of an Israelite, and a false prophetess.
Usage: Noadiah.
Source: from "H3259" and "H3050"; convened of Jah;

5130.long:
Meaning: to "quiver" (i.e. "vibrate" up and down, or "rock" to and fro); used in a great variety of applications (including sprinkling, beckoning, rubbing, bastinadoing, sawing, waving, etc.).
Usage: lift up, move, offer, perfume, send, shake, sift, strike, wave.
Source: a primitive root;

5132.long:
Meaning: properly, to "flash"; also, to "fly" away (from the quickness of motion).
Usage: flee away, bud (forth).
Source: a primitive root;

5133.long:
Meaning: a "pinion" (or wing feather); often (collectively) "plumage".
Usage: feather(-s), ostrich.
Source: or "נֹצָה"; feminine active participle of "H5327" in the sense of "flying";

5135.long:
Meaning: "fire".
Usage: fiery, fire.
Source: (Aramaic) from an unused root (corresponding to that of "H5216") meaning to shine;

5136.long:
Meaning: to "be sick", i.e. (figuratively) "distressed".
Usage: be full of heaviness.
Source: a primitive root;

5137.long:
Meaning: to "spirt", i.e. "besprinkle" (especially in expiation).
Usage: sprinkle.
Source: a primitive root;

5139.long:
Meaning: "separate", i.e. "consecrated" (as prince, a Nazirite); hence (figuratively from the latter) an "unpruned vine" (like an unshorn Nazirite).
Usage: Nazarite (by a false alliteration with Nazareth), separate(-d), vine undressed.
Source: or "נָזִר"; from "H5144";

5140.long:
Meaning: to "drip", or "shed" by trickling.
Usage: distil, drop, flood, (cause to) flow(-ing), gush out, melt, pour (down), running water, stream.
Source: a primitive root;

5141.long:
Meaning: a "nose-ring".
Usage: earring, jewel.
Source: from an unused root of uncertain meaning;

5142.long:
Meaning: to "suffer" (causatively, "inflict") "loss".
Usage: have (en-) damage, hurt(-ful).
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to the root of "H5143";

5143.long:
Meaning: "loss".
Usage: damage.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "injure";

5144.long:
Meaning: to "hold aloof", i.e. (intransitivey) "abstain" (from food and drink, from impurity, and even from divine worship (i.e. "apostatize")); specifically, to "set apart" (to sacred purposes), i.e. "devote".
Usage: consecrate, separate(-ing, self).
Source: a primitive root;

5145.long:
Meaning: properly, something "set apart", i.e. (abstractly) "dedication" (of a priet or Nazirite); hence (concretely) unshorn "locks"; also (by implication) a "chaplet" (especially of royalty).
Usage: consecration, crown, hair, separation.
Source: or "נֵזֶר"; from "H5144";

5146.long:
Meaning: "Noach", the patriarch of the flood.
Usage: Noah.
Source: the same as "H5118"; "rest";

5148.long:
Meaning: to "guide"; by implication, to "transport" (into exile, or as colonists).
Usage: bestow, bring, govern, guide, lead (forth), put, straiten.
Source: a primitive root;

5150.long:
Meaning: properly, "consoled"; abstractly, "solace".
Usage: comfort(-able), repenting.
Source: or "נִחֻם"; from "H5162";

5152.long:
Meaning: "Nachor", the name of the grandfather and a brother of Abraham.
Usage: Nahor.
Source: from the same as "H5170"; snorer;

5153.long:
Meaning: "coppery", i.e. (figuratively) "hard".
Usage: of brass.
Source: apparently passive participle of "H5172" (perhaps in the sense of ringing), i.e. bell-metal; or from the red color of the throat of a serpent ("H5175", as denominative) when hissing);

5154.long:
Meaning: "copper".
Usage: brass, steel. Compare "H5176".
Source: or "נְחֻשָׁה"; feminine of "H5153";

5156.long:
Meaning: a "nostril".
Usage: (dual) nostrils.
Source: from the same as "H5170";

5157.long:
Meaning: to "inherit" (as a (figurative) mode of descent), or (generally) to "occupy"; causatively, to "bequeath", or (generally) "distribute", "instate".
Usage: divide, have (inheritance), take as a heritage, (cause to, give to, make to) inherit, (distribute for, divide (for, for an, by), give for, have, leave for, take (for)) inheritance, (have in, cause to, be made to) possess(-ion).
Source: a primitive root;

5158.long:
Meaning: a "stream", especially a winter "torrent"; (by implication) a (narrow) "valley" (in which a brook runs); also a "shaft" (of a mine).
Usage: brook, flood, river, stream, valley.
Source: or (feminine) "נַחְלָה"; (Psalm 124:4), or "נַחֲלָה"; (Ezekiel 47:19; Ezekiel 48:28), from "H5157" in its original sense;

5159.long:
Meaning: properly, something "inherited", i.e. (abstractly) "occupancy", or (concretely) an "heirloom"; generally an "estate", "patrimony" or "portion".
Usage: heritage, to inherit, inheritance, possession. Compare "H5158".
Source: from "H5157" (in its usual sense);

5160.long:
Meaning: "Nachaliël", a place in the Desert.
Usage: Nahaliel.
Source: from "H5158" and "H410"; "valley of God";

5161.long:
Meaning: a "Nechelamite", or descendant of Nechlam.
Usage: Nehelamite.
Source: apparently a patronymic from an unused name (apparently passive participle of "H2492"); "dreamed";

5162.long:
Meaning: properly, to "sigh", i.e. "breathe" strongly; by implication, to be "sorry", i.e. (in a favorable sense) to "pity", "console" or (reflexively) "rue"; or (unfavorably) to "avenge" (oneself).
Usage: comfort (self), ease (one's self), repent(-er,-ing, self).
Source: a primitive root;

5166.long:
Meaning: "Nechemjah", the name of three Israelites.
Usage: Nehemiah.
Source: from "H5162" and "H3050"; "consolation of Jah";

5169.long:
Meaning: to "be urgent".
Usage: require haste.
Source: a primitive root;

5170.long:
Meaning: a "snorting".
Usage: nostrils, snorting.
Source: and (feminine) "נַחֲרָה"; from an unused root meaning to "snort" or "snore";

5171.long:
Meaning: "Nacharai" or "Nachrai", an Israelite.
Usage: Naharai, Nahari.
Source: or "נַחְרַי"; from the same as "H5170"; "snorer";

5172.long:
Meaning: properly, to "hiss", i.e. "whisper" a (magic) spell; generally, to "prognosticate".
Usage: × certainly, divine, enchanter, (use) × enchantment, learn by experience, × indeed, diligently observe.
Source: a primitive root;

5176.long:
Meaning: "Nachash", the name of two persons apparently non-Israelite.
Usage: Nahash.
Source: the same as "H5175";

5178.long:
Meaning: "copper", hence, something made of that metal, i.e. "coin", a "fetter"; figuratively, "base" (as compared with gold or silver).
Usage: brasen, brass, chain, copper, fetter (of brass), filthiness, steel.
Source: for "H5154";

5180.long:
Meaning: something "made of copper", i.e. the "copper serpent of the Desert".
Usage: Nehushtan.
Source: from "H5178";

5181.long:
Meaning: to "sink", i.e. "descend"; causatively, to "press" or "lead" down.
Usage: be broken, (cause to) come down, enter, go down, press sore, settle, stick fast.
Source: a primitive root;

5182.long:
Meaning: to "descend"; causatively, to "bring away", "deposit", "depose".
Usage: carry, come down, depose, lay up, place.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H5181";

5183.long:
Meaning: a "descent", i.e. imposition, unfavorable ("punishment") or favorable ("food"); "restfulness".
Usage: lighting down, quiet(-ness), to rest, be set on.
Source: from "H5182"; also (intransitively; perhaps from "H5117")

5184.long:
Meaning: "Nachath", the name of an Edomite and of two Israelites.
Usage: Nahath.
Source: the same as "H5183"; "quiet";

5186.long:
Meaning: to "stretch" or spread out; by implication, to "bend" away (including moral deflection); used in a great variety of application (as follows).
Usage: afternoon, apply, bow (down, -ing), carry aside, decline, deliver, extend, go down, be gone, incline, intend, lay, let down, offer, outstretched, overthrown, pervert, pitch, prolong, put away, shew, spread (out), stretch (forth, out), take (aside), turn (aside, away), wrest, cause to yield.
Source: a primitive root;

5188.long:
Meaning: a "pendant" for the ears (especially of pearls).
Usage: chain, collar.
Source: from "H5197";

5189.long:
Meaning: a "tendril" (as an offshoot).
Usage: battlement, branch, plant.
Source: from "H5203";

5190.long:
Meaning: to "lift"; by implication, to "impose".
Usage: bear, offer, take up.
Source: a primitive root;

5193.long:
Meaning: properly, to "strike" in, i.e. "fix"; specifically, to "plant" (literally or figuratively).
Usage: fastened, plant(-er).
Source: a primitive root;

5194.long:
Meaning: a "plant"; collectively, a "plantation"; abstractly, a "planting".
Usage: plant.
Source: from "H5193";

5196.long:
Meaning: "Netaim", a place in Palestine.
Usage: plants.
Source: plural of "H5194";

5197.long:
Meaning: to "ooze", i.e. "distil gradually"; by implication, to "fall in drops"; figuratively, to "speak by inspiration".
Usage: drop(-ping), prophesy(-et).
Source: a primitive root;

5198.long:
Meaning: a "drop"; specifically, an aromatic "gum" (probably "stacte").
Usage: drop, stacte.
Source: from "H5197";

5199.long:
Meaning: "Netophah", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Netophah.
Source: from "H5197"; "distillation";

5200.long:
Meaning: a "Netophathite", or inhabitant of Netophah.
Usage: Netophathite.
Source: patronymic from "H5199";

5201.long:
Meaning: to "guard"; figuratively, to "cherish" (anger).
Usage: bear grudge, keep(-er), reserve.
Source: a primitive root;

5203.long:
Meaning: properly, to "pound", i.e. "smite"; by implication (as if beating out, and thus expanding) to "disperse"; also, to "thrust" off, down, out or upon (inclusively, "reject", "let alone", "permit", "remit", etc.).
Usage: cast off, drawn, let fall, forsake, join (battle), leave (off), lie still, loose, spread (self) abroad, stretch out, suffer.
Source: a primitive root;

5204.long:
Meaning: "lamentation".
Usage: wailing.
Source: a doubtful word; apparently from "H5091";

5205.long:
Meaning: "motion" (of the lips in speech).
Usage: moving.
Source: from "H5110";

5207.long:
Meaning: properly, "restful", i.e. "pleasant"; abstractly, "delight".
Usage: sweet (odour).
Source: or "נִיחֹחַ"; from "H5117";

5210.long:
Meaning: "Nineveh", the capital of Assyria.
Usage: Nineveh.
Source: of foreign origin;

5212.long:
Meaning: "Nisan", the first month of the Jewish sacred year.
Usage: Nisan.
Source: probably of foreign origin;

5214.long:
Meaning: to "till the soil".
Usage: break up.
Source: a root probably identical with that of "H5216", through the idea of the gleam of a fresh furrow;

5215.long:
Meaning: properly, "plowing", i.e. (concretely) "freshly plowed land".
Usage: fallow ground, plowing, tillage.
Source: or "נִר"; from "H5214";

5216.long:
Meaning: a "lamp" (i.e. the burner) or "light" (literally or figuratively).
Usage: candle, lamp, light.
Source: or "נִר"; also "נֵיר"; or "נֵר"; or (feminine) "נֵרָה"; from a primitive root (see "H5214"; "H5135") properly, meaning to "glisten";

5217.long:
Meaning: to "smite", i.e. "drive away".
Usage: be viler.
Source: a primitive root;

5218.long:
Meaning: "smitten", i.e. (figuratively) "afflicted".
Usage: broken, stricken, wounded.
Source: or "נָכָא"; from "H5217";

5219.long:
Meaning: properly, a "smiting", i.e. (concretely) an aromatic "gum" (perhaps styrax) (as powdered).
Usage: spicery(-ces).
Source: from "H5218";

5220.long:
Meaning: "offspring".
Usage: nephew, son's son.
Source: from an unused root meaning to propagate;

5221.long:
Meaning: to "strike" (lightly or severely, literally or figuratively).
Usage: beat, cast forth, clap, give (wounds), × go forward, × indeed, kill, make (slaughter), murderer, punish, slaughter, slay(-er, -ing), smite(-r, -ing), strike, be stricken, (give) stripes, × surely, wound.
Source: a primitive root;

5223.long:
Meaning: "smitten", i.e. (literally) maimed, or (figuratively) dejected.
Usage: contrite, lame.

5224.long:
Meaning: "Neko", an Egyptian king.
Usage: Necho. Compare "H6549".
Source: probably of Egyptian origin;

5226.long:
Meaning: properly, the "fore" part; used adverbially, "opposite".
Usage: before, over against.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "be straightforward";

5227.long:
Meaning: properly, the "front" part; used adverbially (especially with preposition), "opposite", "in front of", "forward", "in behalf of".
Usage: (over) against, before, direct(-ly), for, right (on).
Source: from the same as "H5226";

5228.long:
Meaning: "straightforward", i.e. (figuratively), "equitable", "correct", or (abstractly), "integrity".
Usage: plain, right, uprightness.
Source: from the same as "H5226";

5229.long:
Meaning: properly, "straightforwardness", i.e. (figuratively) "integrity", or (concretely) a "truth".
Usage: equity, right (thing), uprightness.
Source: feminine of "H5228";

5230.long:
Meaning: to "defraud", i.e. "act treacherously".
Usage: beguile, conspire, deceiver, deal subtilly.
Source: a primitive root;

5233.long:
Meaning: "treasure".
Usage: riches, wealth.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "accumulate";

5234.long:
Meaning: properly, to "scrutinize", i.e. look intently at; hence (with "recognition" implied), to "acknowledge", "be acquainted with", "care for", "respect", "revere", or (with suspicion implied), to "disregard", "ignore", "be strange" toward, "reject", "resign", "dissimulate" (as if ignorant or disowning).
Usage: acknowledge, × could, deliver, discern, dissemble, estrange, feign self to be another, know, take knowledge (notice), perceive, regard, (have) respect, behave (make) self strange(-ly).
Source: a primitive root;

5235.long:
Meaning: something "strange", i.e. "unexpected calamity".
Usage: strange.
Source: or "נֹכֶר"; from "H5234";

5236.long:
Meaning: "foreign", or (concretely) a "foreigner", or (abstractly) "heathendom".
Usage: alien, strange ( -er).
Source: ' from "H5234";

5237.long:
Meaning: "strange", in a variety of degrees and applications ("foreign", "non-relative", "adulterous", "different", "wonderful").
Usage: alien, foreigner, outlandish, strange(-r, woman).
Source: from "H5235" (second form);

5239.long:
Meaning: to "complete".
Usage: make an end.
Source: apparently a primitive root;

5241.long:
Meaning: "Nemuel", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Nemuel.
Source: apparently for "H3223";

5242.long:
Meaning: a "Nemuelite", or descendant of Nemuel.
Usage: Nemuelite.
Source: from "H5241";

5243.long:
Meaning: to "become clipped" or (specifically) "circumcised".
Usage: (branch to) be cut down (off), circumcise.
Source: a primitive root;

5244.long:
Meaning: an "ant" (probably from its almost bisected form).
Usage: ant.
Source: feminine from "H5243";

5246.long:
Meaning: a "leopard" (from its stripes).
Usage: leopard.
Source: from an unused root meaning properly, to "filtrate", i.e. "be limpid" (comp "H5247" and "H5249"); and thus to "spot" or "stain" as if by dripping;

5247.long:
Meaning: "Nimrah", a place East of the Jordan.
Usage: Nimrah. See also "H1039", "H5249".
Source: from the same as "H5246"; "clear" water;

5248.long:
Meaning: "Nimrod", a son of Cush.
Usage: Nimrod.
Source: or "נִמְרֹד"; probably of foreign origin;

5249.long:
Meaning: "Nimrim", a place East of the Jordan.
Usage: Nimrim. Compare "H1039".
Source: plural of a masculine corresponding to "H5247"; "clear waters";

5250.long:
Meaning: "Nimshi", the (grand-) father of Jehu.
Usage: Nimshi.
Source: probably from "H4871"; "extricated";

5251.long:
Meaning: a "flag"; also a "sail"; by implication, a "flagstaff"; generally a "signal"; figuratively, a "token".
Usage: banner, pole, sail, (en-) sign, standard.
Source: from "H5264";

5252.long:
Meaning: properly, an "environment", i.e. "circumstance" or "turn of affairs".
Usage: cause.
Source: feminine participle passive of "H5437";

5253.long:
Meaning: to "retreat".
Usage: departing away, remove, take (hold), turn away.
Source: a primitive root;

5254.long:
Meaning: to "test"; by implication, to "attempt".
Usage: adventure, assay, prove, tempt, try.
Source: a primitive root;

5255.long:
Meaning: to "tear away".
Usage: destroy, pluck, root.
Source: a primitive root;

5257.long:
Meaning: properly, something "poured" out, i.e. a "libation"; also a molten "image"; by implication, a "prince" (as "anointed").
Usage: drink offering, duke, prince(-ipal).
Source: from "H5258";

5258.long:
Meaning: to "pour" out, especially a libation, or to "cast" (metal); by analogy, to "anoint" a king.
Usage: cover, melt, offer, (cause to) pour (out), set (up).
Source: a primitive root;

5259.long:
Meaning: to "interweave", i.e. (figuratively) to "overspread".
Usage: that is spread.
Source: a primitive root (probably identical with "H5258" through the idea of fusion);

5260.long:
Meaning: to "pour out a libation".
Usage: offer.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H5258";

5262.long:
Meaning: a "libation"; also a "cast idol".
Usage: cover, drink offering, molten image.
Source: or "נֵסֶךְ"; from "H5258";

5263.long:
Meaning: to "wane", i.e. "be sick".
Usage: faint.
Source: a primitive root;

5264.long:
Meaning: to "raise a beacon".
Usage: lift up as an ensign.
Source: a primitive root; to gleam from afar, i.e. to be conspicuous as a signal; or rather perhaps a denominative from "H5251" (and identical with "H5263", through the idea of a flag as fluttering in the wind);

5265.long:
Meaning: properly, to "pull" up, especially the tent-pins, i.e. "start" on a journey.
Usage: cause to blow, bring, get, (make to) go (away, forth, forward, onward, out), (take) journey, march, remove, set aside (forward), × still, be on his (go their) way.
Source: a primitive root;

5266.long:
Meaning: to "go up".
Usage: ascend.
Source: a primitive root;

5268.long:
Meaning: "Nisrok", a Babylonian idol.
Usage: Nisroch.
Source: of foreign origin;

5269.long:
Meaning: "Neah", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Neah.
Source: from "H5128"; "motion";

5271.long:
Meaning: (only in plural collective or emphatic form) "youth", the state ("juvenility") or the persons ("young" people).
Usage: childhood, youth.
Source: or "נָעֻר"; and (feminine) "נְעֻרָה"; properly, passive participle from "H5288" as denominative;

5272.long:
Meaning: "Neiel", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Neiel.
Source: from "H5128" and "H410"; "moved of God";

5273.long:
Meaning: "delightful" (objective or subjective, literal or figurative).
Usage: pleasant(-ure), sweet.
Source: from "H5276";

5274.long:
Meaning: properly, to "fasten" up, i.e. with a bar or cord; hence, to "sandal", i.e. furnish with slippers.
Usage: bolt, inclose, lock, shoe, shut up.
Source: a primitive root; also denominative from "H5275"

5275.long:
Meaning: properly, a "sandal tongue"; by extension a "sandal" or "slipper" (sometimes as a symbol of occupancy, a refusal to marry, or of something valueless).
Usage: dryshod, (pair of) shoe((-latchet), -s).
Source: or (feminine) "נַעֲלָה"; from "H5274";

5276.long:
Meaning: to "be agreeable" (literally or figuratively).
Usage: pass in beauty, be delight, be pleasant, be sweet.
Source: a primitive root;

5279.long:
Meaning: "Naamah", the name of an antediluvian woman, of an Ammonitess, and of a place in Palestine.
Usage: Naamah.
Source: feminine of "H5277"; "pleasantness";

5280.long:
Meaning: a "Naamanite", or descendant of Naaman (collectively).
Usage: Naamites.
Source: patronymic from "H5283";

5283.long:
Meaning: "Naaman", the name of an Israelite and of a Damascene.
Usage: Naaman.
Source: the same as "H5282";

5284.long:
Meaning: a "Naamathite", or inhabitant of Naamah.
Usage: Naamathite.
Source: patrial from a place corresponding in name (but not identical) with "H5279";

5285.long:
Meaning: probably a "brier"; by implication, a "thicket" of thorny bushes.
Usage: thorn.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "prick";

5287.long:
Meaning: to "tumble" about.
Usage: shake (off, out, self), overthrow, toss up and down.
Source: a primitive root (probably identical with "H5286", through the idea of the "rustling" of mane, which usually accompanies the lion's roar);

5288.long:
Meaning: (concretely) a "boy" (as active), from the age of infancy to adolescence; by implication, a "servant"; also (by interch. of sex), a "girl" (of similar latitude in age).
Usage: babe, boy, child, damsel (from the margin), lad, servant, young (man).
Source: from "H5287";

5289.long:
Meaning: a "wanderer".
Usage: young one.
Source: from "H5287" in its derivative sense of "tossing about";

5291.long:
Meaning: a "girl" (from infancy to adolescence).
Usage: damsel, maid(-en), young (woman).
Source: feminine of "H5288";

5292.long:
Meaning: "Naarah", the name of an Israelitess, and of a place in Palestine.
Usage: Naarah, Naarath.
Source: the same as "H5291";

5294.long:
Meaning: "Nearjah", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Neariah.
Source: from "H5288" and "H3050"; "servant of Jah";

5295.long:
Meaning: "Naaran", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Naaran.
Source: from "H5288"; "juvenile";

5296.long:
Meaning: something "shaken" out, i.e. "tow" (as the refuse of flax).
Usage: tow.
Source: from "H5287";

5297.long:
Meaning: "Noph", the capital of Upper Egypt.
Usage: Noph.
Source: a variation of "H4644";

5298.long:
Meaning: "Nepheg", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Nepheg.
Source: from an unused root probably meaning to "spring forth"; a "sprout";

5299.long:
Meaning: a "sieve".
Usage: border, coast, region, sieve.
Source: from "H5130" in the sense of "lifting";

5300.long:
Meaning: "Nephushesim", a Temple-servant.
Usage: Nephisesim (from the margin).
Source: for "H5304";

5301.long:
Meaning: to "puff", in various applications (literally, to "inflate", "blow hard", "scatter", "kindle", "expire"; figuratively, to "disesteem").
Usage: blow, breath, give up, cause to lose (life), seething, snuff.
Source: a primitive root;

5302.long:
Meaning: "Nophach", a place in Moab.
Usage: Nophah.
Source: from "H5301"; a "gust";

5303.long:
Meaning: properly, a "feller", i.e. a "bully" or "tyrant".
Usage: giant.
Source: or "נְפִל"; from "H5307";

5304.long:
Meaning: "Nephisim", a Temple-servant.
Usage: Nephusim (from the margin).
Source: plural from an unused root meaning to scatter; expansions;

5305.long:
Meaning: "Naphish", a son of Ishmael, and his posterity.
Usage: Naphish.
Source: from "H5314"; "refreshed";

5306.long:
Meaning: "shining"; a gem, probably the "garnet".
Usage: emerald.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "glisten";

5307.long:
Meaning: to "fall", in a great variety of applications (intransitive or causative, literal or figurative).
Usage: be accepted, cast (down, self, (lots), out), cease, die, divide (by lot), (let) fail, (cause to, let, make, ready to) fall (away, down, -en, -ing), fell(-ing), fugitive, have (inheritance), inferior, be judged (by mistake for "H6419"), lay (along), (cause to) lie down, light (down), be (× hast) lost, lying, overthrow, overwhelm, perish, present(-ed, -ing), (make to) rot, slay, smite out, × surely, throw down.
Source: a primitive root;

5309.long:
Meaning: something "fallen", i.e. an "abortion".
Usage: untimely birth.
Source: or "נֵפֶל"; from "H5307";

5310.long:
Meaning: to "dash" to pieces, or "scatter".
Usage: be beaten in sunder, break (in pieces), broken, dash (in pieces), cause to be discharged, dispersed, be overspread, scatter.
Source: a primitive root;

5312.long:
Meaning: to "issue"; causatively, to "bring out".
Usage: come (go, take) forth (out).
Source: (Aramaic) a primitive root;

5314.long:
Meaning: to "breathe"; passively, to be breathed upon , i.e. (figuratively) "refreshed" (as if by a current of air).
Usage: (be) refresh selves (-ed).
Source: a primitive root;

5315.long:
Meaning: properly, a "breathing creature", i.e. "animal" of (abstractly) "vitality"; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental).
Usage: any, appetite, beast, body, breath, creature, × dead(-ly), desire, × (dis-) contented, × fish, ghost, greedy, he, heart(-y), (hath, × jeopardy of) life (× in jeopardy), lust, man, me, mind, mortally, one, own, person, pleasure, (her-, him-, my-, thy-) self, them (your) -selves, slay, soul, tablet, they, thing, (× she) will, × would have it.
Source: from "H5314";

5317.long:
Meaning: a "dripping" i.e. of honey (from the comb).
Usage: honeycomb.
Source: from "H5130" in the sense of shaking to pieces;

5318.long:
Meaning: "Nephtoach", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Neptoah.
Source: from "H6605"; opened, i.e. a "spring";

5319.long:
Meaning: properly, "wrestled"; but used (in the plural) transitively, a "struggle".
Usage: wrestling.
Source: from "H6617";

5320.long:
Meaning: "Naphtuchim", an Egyptian tribe.
Usage: Naptuhim.
Source: plural of foreign origin,

5321.long:
Meaning: "Naphtali", a son of Jacob, with the tribe descended from him, and its territory.
Usage: Naphtali.
Source: from "H6617"; my wrestling;

5322.long:
Meaning: a "flower" (from its "brilliancy"); also a "hawk" (from it "flashing" speed).
Usage: blossom, hawk.
Source: from "H5340";

5323.long:
Meaning: to "go away".
Usage: flee.
Source: a primitive root;

5324.long:
Meaning: to "station", in various applications (literally or figuratively).
Usage: appointed, deputy, erect, establish, × Huzzah (by mistake for a proper name), lay, officer, pillar, present, rear up, set (over, up), settle, sharpen, establish, (make to) stand(-ing, still, up, upright), best state.
Source: a primitive root;

5325.long:
Meaning: "fixed", i.e. a "handle".
Usage: haft.
Source: passive participle of "H5324";

5326.long:
Meaning: "fixedness", i.e. "firmness".
Usage: strength.
Source: (Aramaic) from a root corresponding to "H5324";

5327.long:
Meaning: properly, to "go forth", i.e. (by implication) to "be expelled", and (consequently) "desolate"; causatively, to "lay waste"; also (specifically), to "quarrel".
Usage: be laid waste, runinous, strive (together).
Source: a primitive root;

5329.long:
Meaning: properly, to "glitter from afar", i.e. to "be eminent" (as a superintendent, especially of the Temple services and its music); to "be permanent".
Usage: excel, chief musician (singer), oversee(-r), set forward.
Source: a primitive root; also as denominative from "H5331"

5330.long:
Meaning: to "become chief".
Usage: be preferred.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H5329";

5331.long:
Meaning: properly, a "goal", i.e. the bright object at a distance travelled towards; hence (figuratively), "splendor", or (subjectively) "truthfulness", or (objectively) "confidence"; but usually (adverbially), "continually" (i.e. to the most distant point of view).
Usage: alway(-s), constantly, end, ( n-) ever(more), perpetual, strength, victory.
Source: or "נֵצַח"; from "H5329";

5332.long:
Meaning: "juice" of the grape (as blood red).
Usage: blood, strength.
Source: probably identical with "H5331", through the idea of "brilliancy" of color;

5333.long:
Meaning: something "stationary", i.e. a "prefect", a military "post", a "statue".
Usage: garrison, officer, pillar.
Source: or "נְצִב"; from "H5324";

5334.long:
Meaning: "Netsib", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Nezib.
Source: the same as "H5333"; "station";

5336.long:
Meaning: properly, "conservative"; but used passively, "delivered".
Usage: preserved.
Source: from "H5341";

5337.long:
Meaning: to "snatch" away, whether in a good or a bad sense.
Usage: × at all, defend, deliver (self), escape, × without fail, part, pluck, preserve, recover, rescue, rid, save, spoil, strip, × surely, take (out).
Source: a primitive root;

5340.long:
Meaning: to "glare", i.e. "be bright-colored".
Usage: sparkle.
Source: a primitive root;

5341.long:
Meaning: to "guard", in a good sense (to "protect", "maintain", "obey", etc.) or a bad one (to "conceal", etc.).
Usage: besieged, hidden thing, keep(-er, -ing), monument, observe, preserve(-r), subtil, watcher(-man).
Source: a primitive root;

5342.long:
Meaning: a "shoot"; figuratively, a "descendant".
Usage: branch.
Source: from "H5341" in the sense of "greenness" as a striking color;

5343.long:
Meaning: "clean".
Usage: pure.
Source: (Aramaic) from a root corresponding to "H5352";

5344.long:
Meaning: to "puncture", literally (to "perforate", with more or less violence) or figuratively (to "specify", "designate", "libel").
Usage: appoint, blaspheme, bore, curse, express, with holes, name, pierce, strike through.
Source: a primitive root;

5346.long:
Meaning: "Nekeb", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Nekeb.
Source: the same as "H5345"; "dell";

5348.long:
Meaning: "spotted".
Usage: speckled.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "mark" (by puncturing or branding);

5349.long:
Meaning: a "spotter" (of sheep or cattle), i.e. the "owner" or "tender" (who thus marks them).
Usage: herdman, sheepmaster.
Source: active participle from the same as "H5348";

5350.long:
Meaning: a "crumb" (as broken to spots); also a "biscuit" (as pricked).
Usage: cracknel, mouldy.
Source: from the same as "H5348";

5352.long:
Meaning: to "be" (or "make") "clean" (literally or figuratively); by implication (in an adverse sense) to "be bare", i.e. "extirpated".
Usage: acquit × at all, × altogether, be blameless, cleanse, (be) clear(-ing), cut off, be desolate, be free, be (hold) guiltless, be (hold) innocent, × by no means, be quit, be (leave) unpunished, × utterly, × wholly.
Source: a primitive root;

5353.long:
Meaning: "Nekoda", a Temple-servant.
Usage: Nekoda.
Source: feminine of "H5348" (in the figurative sense of marked); "distinction";

5355.long:
Meaning: "innocent".
Usage: blameless, clean, clear, exempted, free, guiltless, innocent, quit.
Source: or "נָקִיא"; (Joel 4:19; Jonah 1:14), from "H5352";

5356.long:
Meaning: "clearness" (literally or figuratively).
Usage: cleanness, innocency.
Source: or "נִקָּיֹן"; from "H5352";

5357.long:
Meaning: a "cleft".
Usage: hole.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "bore";

5358.long:
Meaning: to "grudge", i.e. "avenge" or "punish".
Usage: avenge(-r, self), punish, revenge (self), × surely, take vengeance.
Source: a primitive root;

5360.long:
Meaning: "avengement", whether the act or the passion.
Usage: avenge, revenge(-ing), vengeance.
Source: feminine of "H5359";

5361.long:
Meaning: to "feel aversion".
Usage: be alienated.
Source: a primitive root;

5362.long:
Meaning: to "strike" with more or less violence ("beat", "fell", "corrode"); by implication (of attack) to "knock together", i.e. "surround" or "circulate".
Usage: compass (about, -ing), cut down, destroy, go round (about), inclose, round.
Source: a primitive root;

5365.long:
Meaning: to "bore" ("penetrate", "quarry").
Usage: dig, pick out, pierce, put (thrust) out.
Source: a primitive root;

5367.long:
Meaning: to "entrap" (with a noose), literally or figuratively.
Usage: catch (lay a) snare.
Source: a primitive root;

5368.long:
Meaning: to "knock".
Usage: smote.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H5367"; used in the sense of "H5362";

5369.long:
Meaning: "Ner", an Israelite.
Usage: Ner.
Source: the same as "H5216"; "lamp";

5370.long:
Meaning: "Nergal", a Cuthite deity.
Usage: Nergal.
Source: of foreign origin;

5371.long:
Meaning: "Nergal-Sharetser", the name of two Babylonians.
Usage: Nergal-sharezer.
Source: from "H5370" and "H8272";

5372.long:
Meaning: a "slanderer".
Usage: talebearer, whisperer.
Source: from an unused root meaning to roll to pieces;

5373.long:
Meaning: "nard", an aromatic.
Usage: spikenard.
Source: of foreign origin;

5374.long:
Meaning: "Nerijah", an Israelite.
Usage: Neriah.
Source: or "נֵרִיָּהוּ"; from "H5216" and "H3050"; "light of Jah";

5375.long:
Meaning: to "lift", in a great variety of applications, literal and figurative, absolute and relative.
Usage: accept, advance, arise, (able to, (armor), suffer to) bear(-er, up), bring (forth), burn, carry (away), cast, contain, desire, ease, exact, exalt (self), extol, fetch, forgive, furnish, further, give, go on, help, high, hold up, honorable ( man), lade, lay, lift (self) up, lofty, marry, magnify, × needs, obtain, pardon, raise (up), receive, regard, respect, set (up), spare, stir up, swear, take (away, up), × utterly, wear, yield.
Source: or "נָסָה"; (Psalm 4:6 [7]), a primitive root;

5376.long:
Usage: carry away, make insurrection, take.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H5375"

5377.long:
Meaning: to "lead astray", i.e. (mentally) to "delude", or (morally) to "seduce".
Usage: beguile, deceive, × greatly, × utterly.
Source: a primitive root;

5378.long:
Meaning: to "lend" on interest; by implication, to "dun" for debt.
Usage: × debt, exact, giver of usury.
Source: a primitive root (perhaps identical with "H5377", through the idea of "imposition");

5379.long:
Meaning: "something taken", i.e. "a present".
Usage: gift.
Source: passive participle feminine of "H5375";

5380.long:
Meaning: to "blow"; by implication, to "disperse".
Usage: (cause to) blow, drive away.
Source: a primitive root;

5381.long:
Meaning: to "reach" (literally or figuratively).
Usage: ability, be able, attain (unto), (be able to, can) get, lay at, put, reach, remove, wax rich, × surely, (over-) take (hold of, on, upon).
Source: a primitive root;

5382.long:
Meaning: to "forget"; figuratively, to "neglect"; causatively, to "remit", "remove".
Usage: forget, deprive, exact.
Source: a primitive root;

5383.long:
Meaning: to "lend" or (by reciprocity) "borrow" on security or interest.
Usage: creditor, exact, extortioner, lend, usurer, lend on (taker on) usury.
Source: a primitive root (rather identical with "H5382", in the sense of "H5378");

5384.long:
Meaning: "rheumatic" or "crippled" (from the incident to Jacob).
Usage: which shrank.
Source: from "H5382", in the sense of failure;

5385.long:
Meaning: something "borne", i.e. a "load".
Usage: carriage.
Source: or rather, "נְשֻׂאָה"; feminine. passive participle of "H5375";

5387.long:
Meaning: properly, an "exalted" one, i.e. a "king" or "sheik"; also a rising "mist".
Usage: captain, chief, cloud, governor, prince, ruler, vapour.
Source: or "נָשִׂא"; from "H5375";

5391.long:
Meaning: to "strike" with a sting (as a serpent); figuratively, to "oppress" with interest on a loan.
Usage: bite, lend upon usury.
Source: a primitive root;

5394.long:
Meaning: to "pluck off", i.e. "divest", "eject" or "drop".
Usage: cast (out), drive, loose, put off (out), slip.
Source: a primitive root;

5395.long:
Meaning: properly, to "blow" away, i.e. "destroy".
Usage: destroy.
Source: a primitive root;

5397.long:
Meaning: a "puff", i.e. "wind", "angry" or "vital breath", "divine inspiration", "intellect". or (concretely) an "animal".
Usage: blast, (that) breath(-eth), inspiration, soul, spirit.
Source: from "H5395";

5398.long:
Meaning: to "breeze", i.e. "blow" up fresh (as the wind).
Usage: blow.
Source: a primitive root;

5399.long:
Meaning: properly, a "breeze", i.e. (by implication) "dusk" (when the evening breeze prevails).
Usage: dark, dawning of the day (morning), night, twilight.
Source: from "H5398";

5400.long:
Meaning: to "catch" fire.
Usage: burn, kindle.
Source: a primitive root;

5401.long:
Meaning: to "kiss", literally or figuratively ("touch"); also (as a mode of "attachment"), to "equip" with weapons.
Usage: armed (men), rule, kiss, that touched.
Source: a primitive root (identical with "H5400", through the idea of "fastening" up; compare "H2388", "H2836");

5402.long:
Meaning: military "equipment", i.e. (collectively) "arms" (offensive or defensive), or (concretely) an "arsenal".
Usage: armed men, armour(-y), battle, harness, weapon.
Source: or "נֵשֶׁק"; from "H5401";

5404.long:
Meaning: the "eagle" (or other large bird of prey).
Usage: eagle.
Source: from an unused root meaning to lacerate;

5405.long:
Meaning: properly, to "eliminate", i.e. (intransitively) to "dry" up.
Usage: fail.
Source: a primitive root;

5406.long:
Meaning: an "epistle".
Usage: letter.
Source: probably of Persian origin;

5408.long:
Meaning: to "dismember".
Usage: cut (in pieces), divide, hew in pieces.
Source: a primitive root;

5410.long:
Meaning: a (beaten) "track".
Usage: path(-way), × travel(-ler), way.
Source: or (feminine) "נְתִיבָה"; or "נְתִבָה"; (Jeremiah 6:16), from an unused root meaning to "tramp";

5411.long:
Meaning: the "Nethinim", or "Temple-servants" (as given to that duty).
Usage: Nethinims.
Source: or "נָתוּן" (Ezra 8:17), (the proper form as passive participle), from "H5414"; "one given", i.e. (in the plural only)

5413.long:
Meaning: to "flow forth" (literally or figuratively); by implication, to "liquify".
Usage: drop, gather (together), melt, pour (forth, out).
Source: a primitive root;

5414.long:
Meaning: to "give", used with greatest latitude of application ("put", "make", etc.).
Usage: add, apply, appoint, ascribe, assign, × avenge, × be (healed), bestow, bring (forth, hither), cast, cause, charge, come, commit, consider, count, cry, deliver (up), direct, distribute, do, × doubtless, × without fail, fasten, frame, × get, give (forth, over, up), grant, hang (up), × have, × indeed, lay (unto charge, up), (give) leave, lend, let (out), lie, lift up, make, O that, occupy, offer, ordain, pay, perform, place, pour, print, × pull, put (forth), recompense, render, requite, restore, send (out), set (forth), shew, shoot forth (up), sing, slander, strike, (sub-) mit, suffer, × surely, × take, thrust, trade, turn, utter, weep, willingly, withdraw, would (to) God, yield.
Source: a primitive root;

5416.long:
Meaning: "Nathan", the name of five Israelites.
Usage: Nathan.
Source: from "H5414"; "given";

5417.long:
Meaning: "Nethanel", the name of ten Israelites.
Usage: Nethaneel.
Source: from "H5414" and "H410"; "given of God";

5418.long:
Meaning: "Nethanjah", the name of four Israelites.
Usage: Nethaniah.
Source: or "נְתַנְיָהוּ"; from "H5414" and "H3050"; "given of Jah";

5419.long:
Meaning: "Nethan-Melek", an Israelite.
Usage: Nathanmelech.
Source: from "H5414" and "H4428"; given of (the) king;

5420.long:
Meaning: to "tear up".
Usage: mar.
Source: a primitive root;

5422.long:
Meaning: to "tear" down.
Usage: beat down, break down (out), cast down, destroy, overthrow, pull down, throw down.
Source: a primitive root;

5423.long:
Meaning: to "tear" off.
Usage: break (off), burst, draw (away), lift up, pluck (away, off), pull (out), root out.
Source: a primitive root;

5425.long:
Meaning: to "jump", i.e. "be" violently "agitated"; causatively, to "terrify", "shake" off, "untie".
Usage: drive asunder, leap, (let) loose, × make, move, undo.
Source: a primitive root;

5427.long:
Meaning: "mineral potash" (so called from effervescing with acid).
Usage: nitre.
Source: from "H5425";

5428.long:
Meaning: to "tear away".
Usage: destroy, forsake, pluck (out, up, by the roots), pull up, root out (up), × utterly. s.
Source: a primitive root;

5429.long:
Meaning: a "seah", or certain measure (as "determinative") for grain.
Usage: measure.
Source: from an unused root meaning to define;

5430.long:
Meaning: perhaps a military "boot" (as a protection from "mud").
Usage: battle.
Source: from "H5431";

5431.long:
Meaning: to "shoe", i.e. (active participle) a "soldier shod".
Usage: warrior.
Source: a primitive root; to be miry; used only as denominative from "H5430";

5433.long:
Meaning: to "quaff" to satiety, i.e. "become tipsy".
Usage: drunkard, fill self, Sabean, (wine-) bibber.
Source: a primitive root;

5434.long:
Meaning: "Seba", a son of Cush, and the country settled by him.
Usage: Seba.
Source: of foreign origin;

5435.long:
Meaning: "potation", concretely ("wine"), or abstractly ("carousal").
Usage: drink, drunken, wine.
Source: from "H5433";

5436.long:
Meaning: a "Sebaite", or inhabitant of Seba.
Usage: Sabean.
Source: patrial from "H5434";

5437.long:
Meaning: to "revolve", "surround", or "border"; used in various applications, literally and figuratively.
Usage: bring, cast, fetch, lead, make, walk, × whirl, × round about, be about on every side, apply, avoid, beset (about), besiege, bring again, carry (about), change, cause to come about, × circuit, (fetch a) compass (about, round), drive, environ, × on every side, beset (close, come, compass, go, stand) round about, inclose, remove, return, set, sit down, turn (self) (about, aside, away, back).
Source: a primitive root;

5439.long:
Meaning: (as noun) a "circle", "neighbour", or "environs"; but chiefly (as adverb, with or without preposition) "around".
Usage: (place, round) about, circuit, compass, on every side.
Source: or (feminine) "סְבִיבָה"; from "H5437";

5440.long:
Meaning: to "entwine".
Usage: fold together, wrap.
Source: a primitive root;

5443.long:
Meaning: a "lyre".
Usage: sackbut.
Source: (Aramaic) or "שַׂבְּכָא"; (Aramaic), from a root corresponding to "H5440";

5445.long:
Meaning: to "carry" (literally or figuratively), or (reflexively) "be burdensome"; specifically, to "be gravid".
Usage: bear, be a burden, carry, strong to labour.
Source: a primitive root;

5447.long:
Meaning: a "load" (literally or figuratively).
Usage: burden, charge.
Source: from "H5445";

5449.long:
Meaning: a "porter".
Usage: (to bear, bearer of) burden(-s).
Source: from "H5445";

5452.long:
Meaning: to "bear in mind", i.e. "hope".
Usage: think.
Source: (Aramaic) a primitive root;

5453.long:
Meaning: "Sibrajim", a place in Syria.
Usage: Sibraim.
Source: dual from a root corresponding to "H5452"; "double hope";

5454.long:
Meaning: "Sabta" or "Sabtah", the name of a son of Cush, and the country occupied by his posterity.
Usage: Sabta, Sabtah.
Source: or "סַבְתָּה"; probably of foreign derivation;

5455.long:
Meaning: "Sabteca", the name of a son of Cush, and the region settled by him.
Usage: Sabtecha, Sabtechah.
Source: probably of foreign derivation;

5456.long:
Meaning: to "prostrate" oneself (in homage).
Usage: fall down.
Source: a primitive root;

5458.long:
Meaning: properly, "shut up", i.e. the "breast" (as enclosing the heart); also "gold" (as generally shut up safely).
Usage: caul, gold.
Source: from "H5462";

5459.long:
Meaning: "wealth" (as closely "shut" up).
Usage: jewel, peculiar (treasure), proper good, special.
Source: feminine passive participle of an unused root meaning to "shut" up;

5461.long:
Meaning: a "præfect" of a province.
Usage: prince, ruler.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "superintend";

5462.long:
Meaning: to "shut" up; figuratively, to "surrender".
Usage: close up, deliver (up), give over (up), inclose, × pure, repair, shut (in, self, out, up, up together), stop, × straitly.
Source: a primitive root;

5464.long:
Meaning: a "pouring rain".
Usage: very rainy.
Source: probably from "H5462" in the sense of sweeping away;

5465.long:
Meaning: the "stocks".
Usage: stocks.
Source: from an unused root meaning to stop;

5466.long:
Meaning: a "wrapper", i.e. "shirt".
Usage: fine linen, sheet.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "envelop";

5467.long:
Meaning: "Sedom", a place near the Dead Sea.
Usage: Sodom.
Source: from an unused root meaning to scorch; burnt (i.e. volcanic or bituminous) district;

5468.long:
Meaning: "order".
Usage: order.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "arrange";

5469.long:
Meaning: "roundness".
Usage: round.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "be round";

5470.long:
Meaning: a "dungeon" (as surrounded by walls).
Usage: prison.
Source: from the same as "H5469";

5471.long:
Meaning: "So", an Egyptian king.
Usage: So.
Source: of foreign derivation;

5472.long:
Meaning: properly, to "flinch", i.e. (by implication) to "go back", literally (to "retreat") or figuratively (to "apostatize").
Usage: backslider, drive, go back, turn (away, back).
Source: a primitive root;

5473.long:
Meaning: to "hem in", i.e. "bind".
Usage: set about.
Source: a primitive root (probably rather identical with "H5472" through the idea of shrinking from a hedge; compare "H7735");

5474.long:
Meaning: an "inclosure", i.e. "cage" (for an animal).
Usage: ward.
Source: from "H5462";

5475.long:
Meaning: a "session", i.e. "company" of persons (in close deliberation); by implication, "intimacy", "consultation", a "secret".
Usage: assembly, consel, inward, secret (counsel).
Source: from "H3245";

5477.long:
Meaning: "Suach", an Israelite.
Usage: Suah.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "wipe away"; "sweeping";

5478.long:
Meaning: something "swept" away, i.e. "filth".
Usage: torn.
Source: from the same as "H5477";

5479.long:
Meaning: "Sotai", one of the Nethinim.
Usage: Sotai.
Source: from "H7750"; "roving";

5480.long:
Meaning: properly, to "smear over" (with oil), i.e. "anoint".
Usage: anoint (self), × at all.
Source: a primitive root;

5481.long:
Meaning: a "bagpipe" (with a double pipe).
Usage: dulcimer.
Source: (Aramaic) or "סוּמְפֹּנְיָה"; (Aramaic), or "סִיפֹנְיָא"; (Daniel 3:10) (Aramaic), of Greek origin;

5482.long:
Meaning: "Seven", a place in Upper Egypt.
Usage: Syene.
Source: (rather to be written "סְוֵנָה"; for "סְוֵן"; i.e to Seven); of Egyptian derivation;

5483.long:
Meaning: a "horse" (as leaping); also a "swallow" (from its rapid "flight").
Usage: crane, horse (-back, -hoof). Compare "H6571".
Source: or "סֻס"; from an unused root meaning to "skip" (properly, for joy);

5484.long:
Meaning: a "mare".
Usage: company of horses.
Source: feminine of "H5483";

5486.long:
Meaning: to "snatch" away, i.e. "terminate".
Usage: consume, have an end, perish, × be utterly.
Source: a primitive root;

5487.long:
Meaning: to "come to an end".
Usage: consume, fulfill.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H5486";

5488.long:
Meaning: a "reed", especially the "papyrus".
Usage: flag, Red (sea), weed. Compare "H5489".
Source: probably of Egyptian origin;

5489.long:
Meaning: the "Reed" (Sea).
Usage: Red Sea.
Source: for "H5488" (by ellipsis of "H3220");

5490.long:
Meaning: a "termination".
Usage: conclusion, end, hinder participle.
Source: from "H5486";

5492.long:
Meaning: a "hurricane".
Usage: Red Sea, storm, tempest, whirlwind, Red sea.
Source: from "H5486";

5493.long:
Meaning: to "turn" off (literally or figuratively).
Usage: be(-head), bring, call back, decline, depart, eschew, get (you), go (aside), × grievous, lay away (by), leave undone, be past, pluck away, put (away, down), rebel, remove (to and fro), revolt, × be sour, take (away, off), turn (aside, away, in), withdraw, be without.
Source: or "שׂוּר"; (Hosea 9:12), a primitive root;

5494.long:
Meaning: "turned off", i.e. "deteriorated".
Usage: degenerate.
Source: probably passive participle of "H5493";

5495.long:
Meaning: "Sur", a gate of the temple.
Usage: Sur.
Source: the same as "H5494";

5496.long:
Meaning: properly, to "prick", i.e. (figuratively) "stimulate"; by implication, to "seduce".
Usage: entice, move, persuade, provoke, remove, set on, stir up, take away.
Source: perhaps denominative from "H7898";

5497.long:
Meaning: "covering", i.e. "clothing".
Usage: clothes.
Source: probably from the same root as "H4533";

5498.long:
Meaning: to "trail" along.
Usage: draw (out), tear.
Source: a primitive root;

5500.long:
Meaning: to "sweep away".
Usage: scrape.
Source: a primitive root;

5502.long:
Meaning: to "scrape off".
Usage: sweep (away).
Source: a primitive root;

5503.long:
Meaning: to "travel round" (specifically as a pedlar); intensively, to "palpitate".
Usage: go about, merchant(-man), occupy with, pant, trade, traffick.
Source: a primitive root;

5505.long:
Meaning: an "emporium"; abstractly, "profit" (from trade).
Usage: mart, merchandise.
Source: from "H5503";

5507.long:
Meaning: something "surrounding" the person, i.e. a "shield".
Usage: buckler.
Source: properly, active participle feminine of "H5503";

5508.long:
Meaning: probably a (black) "tile" (or tessara) for laying borders with.
Usage: black marble.
Source: similar to "H5507";

5509.long:
Meaning: "scoria".
Usage: dross.
Source: or "סוּג"; (Ezekiel 22:18), from "H5472" in the sense of "refuse";

5510.long:
Meaning: "Sivan", the third Hebrew month.
Usage: Sivan.
Source: probably of Persian origin;

5511.long:
Meaning: "Sichon", an Amoritish king.
Usage: Sihon.
Source: or "סִיחֹן"; from the same as "H5477"; "tempestuous";

5512.long:
Meaning: "Sin" the name of an Egyptian town and (probably) desert adjoining.
Usage: Sin.
Source: of uncertain derivation;

5513.long:
Meaning: a "Sinite", or descendant of one of the sons of Canaan.
Usage: Sinite.
Source: from an otherwise unknown name of a man;

5514.long:
Meaning: "Sinai", mountain of Arabia.
Usage: Sinai.
Source: of uncertain derivation;

5515.long:
Meaning: "Sinim", a distant Oriental region.
Usage: Sinim.
Source: plural of an otherwise unknown name;

5516.long:
Meaning: "Sisera", the name of a Canaanitish king and of one of the Nethinim.
Usage: Sisera.
Source: of uncertain derivation;

5517.long:
Meaning: "Sia" or "Siaha", one of the Nethinim.
Usage: Sia, Siaha.
Source: or "סִיעֲהָא"; from an unused root meaning to "converse"; "congregation";

5518.long:
Meaning: a "pot"; also a "thorn" (as springing up rapidly); by implication, a "hook".
Usage: caldron, fishhook, pan, (wash-)pot, thorn.
Source: or (feminine) "סִירָה"; or "סִרָה"; (Jeremiah 52:18), from a primitive root meaning to "boil" up;

5519.long:
Meaning: properly, a "thicket of men", i.e. a "crowd".
Usage: multitude.
Source: from "H5526";

5520.long:
Meaning: a "hut" (as of "entwined" boughs); also a "lair".
Usage: covert, den, pavilion, tabernacle.
Source: from "H5526";

5521.long:
Meaning: a "hut" or "lair".
Usage: booth, cottage, covert, pavilion, tabernacle, tent.
Source: feminine of "H5520";

5523.long:
Meaning: "Succoth", the name of a place in Egypt and of three in Palestine.
Usage: Succoth.
Source: or "סֻכֹּת"; plural of "H5521"; "booths";

5524.long:
Meaning: "booths of" (the) "daughters"; "brothels", i.e. "idoalatrous tents for impure purpose".
Usage: Succothbenoth.
Source: from "H5523" and the (irregular) plural of "H1323";

5525.long:
Meaning: a "Sukkite", or inhabitant of some place near Egypt (i.e. hut-dwellers).
Usage: Sukkiims.
Source: patrial from an unknown name (perhaps "H5520");

5526.long:
Meaning: properly, to "entwine" as a screen; by implication, to "fence" in, "cover" over, (figuratively) "protect".
Usage: cover, defence, defend, hedge in, join together, set, shut up.
Source: or "שָׂכַךְ"; (Exodus 33:22), a primitive root;

5527.long:
Meaning: "Secacah", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Secacah.
Source: from "H5526"; "inclosure";

5528.long:
Meaning: to "be silly".
Usage: do (make, play the, turn into) fool(-ish, -ishly, -ishness).
Source: for "H3688";

5532.long:
Meaning: to "be familiar" with; by implication, to "minister" to, "be serviceable" to, to "cherish", "be customary".
Usage: acquaint (self), be advantage, × ever, (be, (un-)) profit(-able), treasurer, be wont.
Source: a primitive root;

5533.long:
Meaning: properly, to "cut", i.e. "damage"; also to "grow" (causatively, "make") "poor".
Usage: endanger, impoverish.
Source: probably a denominative from "H7915";

5534.long:
Meaning: to "shut up"; by implication, to "surrender".
Usage: stop, give over. See also "H5462", "H7936".
Source: a primitive root;

5535.long:
Meaning: by implication, to "observe quietly".
Usage: take heed.
Source: a primitive root to be silent;

5536.long:
Meaning: properly, a "willow twig" (as pendulous), i.e. an "osier"; but only as "woven" into a basket.
Usage: basket.
Source: from "H5549";

5537.long:
Meaning: to "suspend" in a balance, i.e. "weigh".
Usage: compare.
Source: a primitive root;

5538.long:
Meaning: "Silla", a place in Jerusalem.
Usage: Silla.
Source: from "H5549"; an "embankment";

5539.long:
Meaning: probably to "leap" (with joy), i.e. "exult".
Usage: harden self.
Source: a primitive root;

5541.long:
Meaning: to "hang" up, i.e. "weigh", or (figuratively) "contemn".
Usage: tread down (under foot), value.
Source: a primitive root;

5543.long:
Meaning: "Sallu" or "Sallai", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Sallai, Sallu, Salu.
Source: or "סַלּוּא"; or "סָלוּא"; or "סַלַּי"; from "H5541"; weighed;

5544.long:
Meaning: a "prickle" (as if pendulous).
Usage: brier, thorn.
Source: or "סַלּוֹן"; from "H5541";

5545.long:
Meaning: to "forgive".
Usage: forgive, pardon, spare.
Source: a primitive root;

5548.long:
Meaning: "Salcah", a place East of the Jordan.
Usage: Salcah, Salchah.
Source: from an unused root. meaning to walk; "walking";

5549.long:
Meaning: to "mound" up (especially a turnpike); figurative, to "exalt"; reflexively, to "oppose" (as by a dam).
Usage: cast up, exalt (self), extol, make plain, raise up.
Source: a primitive root;

5550.long:
Meaning: a military "mound", i.e. rampart of "besiegers".
Usage: bank, mount.
Source: or "סוֹלְלָה"; active participle feminine of "H5549", but used passively;

5553.long:
Meaning: a craggy "rock", literally or figuratively (a "fortress").
Usage: (ragged) rock, stone(-ny), strong hold.
Source: from an unused root meaning to be "lofty";

5554.long:
Meaning: "Sela", the rock-city of Idumaea.
Usage: rock, Sela(-h).
Source: the same as "H5553";

5555.long:
Meaning: "Sela-ham-Machlekoth", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Sela-hammalekoth.
Source: from "H5553" and the plural of "H4256" with the article interposed; rock of the divisions;

5556.long:
Meaning: a "kind of locust" (from its destructiveness).
Usage: bald locust.
Source: apparently from the same as "H5553" in the sense of crushing as with a rock, i.e. consuming;

5557.long:
Meaning: properly, to "wrench", i.e. (figuratively) to "subvert".
Usage: overthrow, pervert.
Source: a primitive root;

5560.long:
Meaning: "flour" (as chipped off).
Usage: (fine) flour, meal.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "strip";

5561.long:
Meaning: an "aroma".
Usage: sweet (spice).
Source: from an unused root meaning to "smell" sweet;

5562.long:
Meaning: "Samgar-Nebo", a Babylonian general.
Usage: Samgar-nebo.
Source: of foreign origin;

5563.long:
Meaning: "a vine blossom"; used also adverbially, "abloom".
Usage: tender grape.
Source: of uncertain derivation;

5564.long:
Meaning: to "prop" (literally or figuratively); reflexively, to "lean upon" or "take hold of" (in a favorable or unfavorable sense).
Usage: bear up, establish, (up-) hold, lay, lean, lie hard, put, rest self, set self, stand fast, stay (self), sustain.
Source: a primitive root;

5565.long:
Meaning: "Semakjah", an Israelite.
Usage: Semachiah.
Source: from "H5564" and "H3050"; "supported of Jah";

5566.long:
Meaning: a "likeness".
Usage: figure, idol, image.
Source: or "סֵמֶל"; from an unused root meaning to "resemble";

5568.long:
Meaning: to "be erect", i.e. "bristle" as hair.
Usage: stand up, tremble.
Source: a primitive root;

5570.long:
Meaning: "Senaah", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Senaah, Hassenaah (with the article).
Source: from an unused root meaning to prick; "thorny";

5571.long:
Meaning: "Sanballat", a Persian satrap of Samaria.
Usage: Sanballat.
Source: of foreign origin;

5572.long:
Meaning: a "bramble".
Usage: bush.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "prick";

5573.long:
Meaning: "Seneh", a crag in Palestine.
Usage: Seneh.
Source: the same as "H5572"; "thorn";

5574.long:
Meaning: "pointed"; (used with the article as a proper name) "Senuah", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Hasenuah (including the art), Senuah.
Source: or "סְנֻאָה" from the same as "H5570";

5576.long:
Meaning: "Sancherib", an Assyrian king.
Usage: Sennacherib.
Source: of foreign origin;

5577.long:
Meaning: a "twig" (as tapering).
Usage: bough.
Source: from an unused root meaning to be "pointed";

5578.long:
Meaning: "Sansannah", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Sansannah.
Source: feminine of a form of "H5577"; a "bough";

5580.long:
Meaning: a "moth" (from the "agility" of the fly).
Usage: moth.
Source: from the same as "H5483";

5581.long:
Meaning: "Sismai", an Israelite.
Usage: Sisamai.
Source: of uncertain derivation;

5582.long:
Meaning: to "support" (mostly figurative).
Usage: comfort, establish, hold up, refresh self, strengthen, be upholden.
Source: a primitive root;

5585.long:
Meaning: a "fissure" (of rocks); also a "bough" (as "subdivided").
Usage: (outmost) branch, clift, top.
Source: from "H5586";

5586.long:
Meaning: to "disbranch" (a tree).
Usage: top.
Source: a primitive root; properly, to divide up; but used only as denominative from "H5585",

5587.long:
Meaning: "divided" (in mind), i.e. (abstractly) a "sentiment".
Usage: opinion.
Source: or "שָׂעִף"; from "H5586";

5589.long:
Meaning: a "twig" or "branch".
Usage: bough. Compare "H5634".
Source: feminine of "H5585";

5590.long:
Meaning: to "rush upon"; by implication, to "toss" (transitive or intransitive, literal or figurative).
Usage: be (toss with) tempest(-uous), be sore, troubled, come out as a (drive with the, scatter with a) whirlwind.
Source: a primitive root;

5591.long:
Meaning: a "hurricane".
Usage: storm(-y), tempest, whirlwind.
Source: or (feminine) "סְעָרָה"; from "H5590";

5592.long:
Meaning: a "vestibule" (as a limit); also a "dish" (for holding blood or wine).
Usage: bason, bowl, cup, door (post), gate, post, threshold.
Source: from "H5605", in its original sense of containing;

5593.long:
Meaning: "Saph", a Philistine.
Usage: Saph. Compare "H5598".
Source: the same as "H5592";

5594.long:
Meaning: properly, to tear the hair and beat the breasts (as Orientals do in grief); generally to "lament"; by implication, to "wail".
Usage: lament, mourn(-er), wail.
Source: a primitive root;

5595.long:
Meaning: properly, to "scrape" (literally, to shave; but usually figuratively) "together" (i.e. to accumulate or increase) or "away" (i.e. to scatter, remove, or ruin; intransitively, to perish).
Usage: add, augment, consume, destroy, heap, join, perish, put.
Source: a primitive root;

5596.long:
Meaning: properly, to "scrape" out, but in certain peculiar senses (of "removal" or "association").
Usage: abiding, gather together, cleave, smite with the scab.
Source: or "שָׂפַח"; (Isaiah 3:17), a primitive root;

5597.long:
Meaning: the "mange" (as making the hair fall off).
Usage: scab.
Source: from "H5596";

5598.long:
Meaning: "Sippai", a Philistine.
Usage: Sippai. Compare "H5593".
Source: from "H5592"; bason-like;

5599.long:
Meaning: something (spontaneously) "falling" off, i.e. a "self-sown" crop; figuratively, a "freshet".
Usage: (such) things as (which) grow (of themselves), which groweth of its own accord (itself).
Source: from "H5596";

5600.long:
Meaning: a (sea-going) "vessel" (as ceiled with a deck).
Usage: ship.
Source: from "H5603";

5601.long:
Meaning: a "gem" (perhaps used for "scratching" other substances), probably the "sapphire".
Usage: sapphire.
Source: from "H5608";

5602.long:
Meaning: a "basin" (as deepened out).
Usage: bowl, dish.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "depress";

5603.long:
Meaning: to "hide by covering"; specifically, to "roof" (passive participle as noun, a roof) or "wainscot"; figuratively, to "reserve".
Usage: cieled, cover, seated.
Source: a primitive root;

5605.long:
Meaning: to "wait at the threshold".
Usage: be a doorkeeper.
Source: a primitive root; properly, to snatch away, i.e. terminate; but used only as denominative from "H5592" (in the sense of a vestibule),

5606.long:
Meaning: to "clap" the hands (in token of compact, derision, grief, indignation, or punishment); by implication of satisfaction, to "be enough"; by implication of excess, to "vomit".
Usage: clap, smite, strike, suffice, wallow.
Source: or "שָׂפַק"; (1 Kings 20:10; Job 27:23; Isaiah 2:6), a primitive root;

5607.long:
Meaning: "chastisement"; also "satiety".
Usage: stroke, sufficiency.
Source: or "שֶׂפֶק"; (Job 20:22; Job 36:18), from "H5606";

5608.long:
Meaning: properly, to "score" with a mark as a tally or record, i.e. (by implication) to "inscribe", and also to "enumerate"; intensively, to "recount", i.e. "celebrate".
Usage: commune, (ac-) count; declare, number, penknife, reckon, scribe, shew forth, speak, talk, tell (out), writer.
Source: a primitive root;

5609.long:
Meaning: a "book".
Usage: book, roll.
Source: (Aramaic) from a root corresponding to "H5608";

5611.long:
Meaning: "Sephar", a place in Arabia.
Usage: Sephar.
Source: the same as "H5610";

5612.long:
Meaning: properly, "writing" (the art or a document); by implication, a "book".
Usage: bill, book, evidence, × learn(-ed) (-ing), letter, register, scroll.
Source: or (feminine) "סִפְרָה"; (Psalm 56:8 ("H9")), from "H5608";

5613.long:
Meaning: a "scribe" (secular or sacred).
Usage: scribe.
Source: (Aramaic) from the same as "H5609";

5614.long:
Meaning: "Sepharad", a region of Assyria.
Usage: Sepharad.
Source: of foreign derivation;

5616.long:
Meaning: a "Sepharvite" or inhabitant of Sepharvain.
Usage: Sepharvite.
Source: patrial from "H5617";

5617.long:
Meaning: "Sepharvajim" or "Sepharim".
Usage: Sepharvaim.
Source: (dual); or "סְפָרִים"; of foreign derivation;

5618.long:
Meaning: "Sophereth", a temple servant.
Usage: Sophereth.
Source: feminine active participle of "H5608"; a scribe (properly, female);

5619.long:
Meaning: properly, to "be weighty"; but used only in the sense of "lapidation" or its contrary (as if a "de"lapidation).
Usage: (cast, gather out, throw) stone(-s), × surely.
Source: a primitive root;

5621.long:
Meaning: a "thistle".
Usage: brier.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "sting";

5623.long:
Meaning: "Sargon", an Assyrian king.
Usage: Sargon.
Source: of foreign derivation;

5624.long:
Meaning: "Sered", an Israelite.
Usage: Sered.
Source: from a primitive root meaning to "tremble"; "trembling";

5625.long:
Meaning: a "Seredite" (collectively) or descendants of Sered.
Usage: Sardites.
Source: patron from "H5624";

5626.long:
Meaning: "Sirah", a cistern so-called.
Usage: Sirah. See also "H5518".
Source: from "H5493"; departure;

5627.long:
Meaning: "apostasy", "crime"; figuratively, "remission".
Usage: × continual, rebellion, revolt(-ed), turn away, wrong.
Source: from "H5493";

5628.long:
Meaning: to "extend" (even to "excess").
Usage: exceeding, hand, spread, stretch self, banish.
Source: a primitive root;

5631.long:
Meaning: a "eunuch"; by implication, "valet" (especially of the female apartments), and thus, a "minister" of state.
Usage: chamberlain, eunuch, officer. Compare "H7249".
Source: or "סָרִס"; from an unused root meaning to "castrate";

5633.long:
Meaning: an "axle"; figuratively, a "peer".
Usage: lord, plate.
Source: from an unused root of uncertain meaning;

5635.long:
Meaning: to "cremate", i.e. to "be" (near) "of kin" (such being privileged to kindle the pyre).
Usage: burn.
Source: a primitive root;

5636.long:
Meaning: a "nettle" (as stinging like a "burn").
Usage: brier.
Source: from "H5635";

5637.long:
Meaning: to "turn" away, i.e. (morally) "be refractory".
Usage: × away, backsliding, rebellious, revolter(-ing), slide back, stubborn, withdrew.
Source: a primitive root;

5638.long:
Meaning: "winter" (as the dark season).
Usage: winter.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "hide";

5640.long:
Meaning: to "stop" up; by implication, to "repair"; figuratively, to "keep secret".
Usage: closed up, hidden, secret, shut out (up), stop.
Source: or "שָׂתַם"; (Numbers 24:15), a primitive root;

5641.long:
Meaning: to "hide" (by covering), literally or figuratively.
Usage: be absent, keep close, conceal, hide (self), (keep) secret, × surely.
Source: a primitive root;

5642.long:
Meaning: to "conceal"; figuratively, to "demolish".
Usage: destroy, secret thing.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H5641";

5643.long:
Meaning: a "cover" (in a good or a bad, a literal or a figurative sense).
Usage: backbiting, covering, covert, × disguise(-th), hiding place, privily, protection, secret(-ly, place).
Source: or (feminine) "סִתְרָה"; (Deuteronomy 32:38), from "H5641";

5645.long:
Meaning: properly, an "envelope", i.e. "darkness" (or "density", 2 Chronicles 4:17); specifically, a (scud) "cloud"; also a "copse".
Usage: clay, (thick) cloud, × thick, thicket. Compare "H5672".
Source: (masculine and feminine); from "H5743";

5646.long:
Meaning: an "architrave" (as shading the pillars).
Usage: thick (beam, plant).
Source: or "עֹב"; from an unused root meaning to cover; properly, equivalent to "H5645"; but used only as an architectural term,

5647.long:
Meaning: to "work" (in any sense); by implication, to "serve", "till", (causatively) "enslave", etc.
Usage: × be, keep in bondage, be bondmen, bond-service, compel, do, dress, ear, execute, husbandman, keep, labour(-ing man, bring to pass, (cause to, make to) serve(-ing, self), (be, become) servant(-s), do (use) service, till(-er), transgress (from margin), (set a) work, be wrought, worshipper.
Source: a primitive root;

5648.long:
Meaning: to "do", "make", "prepare", "keep", etc.
Usage: × cut, do, execute, go on, make, move, work.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H5647";

5650.long:
Meaning: a "servant".
Usage: × bondage, bondman, (bond-) servant, (man-) servant.
Source: from "H5647";

5651.long:
Meaning: "Ebed", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Ebed.
Source: the same as "H5650";

5653.long:
Meaning: "Abda", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Abda.
Source: from "H5647"; "work";

5654.long:
Meaning: "Obed-Edom", the name of five Israelites.
Usage: Obed-edom.
Source: from the active participle of "H5647" and "H123"; worker of Edom;

5655.long:
Meaning: "Abdeel", an Israelite.
Usage: Abdeel. Compare "H5661".
Source: from "H5647" and "H410"; "serving God";

5656.long:
Meaning: "work" of any kind.
Usage: act, bondage, bondservant, effect, labour, ministering(-try), office, service(-ile, -itude), tillage, use, work, × wrought.
Source: or "עֲבוֹדָה"; from "H5647";

5657.long:
Meaning: something "wrought", i.e. (concretely) "service".
Usage: household, store of servants.
Source: passive participle of "H5647";

5658.long:
Meaning: "Abdon", the name of a place in Palestine and of four Israelites.
Usage: Abdon. Compare "H5683".
Source: from "H5647"; "servitude";

5660.long:
Meaning: "Abdi", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Abdi.
Source: from "H5647"; "serviceable";

5661.long:
Meaning: "Abdiel", an Israelite.
Usage: Abdiel. Compare "H5655".
Source: from "H5650" and "H410"; "servant of God";

5662.long:
Meaning: "Obadjah", the name of thirteen Israelites.
Usage: Obadiah.
Source: or "עֹבַדְיָהוּ"; active participle of "H5647" and "H3050"; "serving Jah";

5663.long:
Meaning: "Ebed-Melek", a eunuch of Zedekeah.
Usage: Ebed-melech.
Source: from "H5650" and "H4428"; "servant of a king";

5664.long:
Meaning: "Abed-Nego", the Babylonian name of one of Daniel's companions.
Usage: Abed-nego.
Source: the same as "H5665";

5665.long:
Meaning: "Abed-Nego", the name of Azariah.
Usage: Abed-nego.
Source: (Aramaic) of foreign origin;

5666.long:
Meaning: to "be dense".
Usage: be (grow) thick(-er).
Source: a primitive root;

5668.long:
Meaning: properly, "crossed", i.e. (abstractly) "transit"; used only adverbially, on "account" of, in "order" that.
Usage: because of, for (...'s sake), (intent) that, to.
Source: or "עָבֻר"; passive participle of "H5674";

5669.long:
Meaning: "passed", i.e. "kept over"; used only of "stored grain".
Usage: old corn.
Source: the same as "H5668";

5670.long:
Meaning: to "pawn"; causatively, to "lend" (on security); figuratively, to "entangle".
Usage: borrow, break (ranks), fetch (a pledge), lend, × surely.
Source: a primitive root;

5671.long:
Meaning: something "pledged", i.e. (collectively) "pawned goods".
Usage: thick clay (by a false etym.).
Source: from "H5670";

5672.long:
Meaning: "density", i.e. "depth" or "width".
Usage: thick(-ness). Compare "H5645".
Source: or "עֳבִי"]; from "H5666";

5674.long:
Meaning: to "cross" over; used very widely of any "transition" (literal or figurative; transitive, intransitive, intensive, causative); specifically, to "cover" (in copulation).
Usage: alienate, alter, × at all, beyond, bring (over, through), carry over, (over-) come (on, over), conduct (over), convey over, current, deliver, do away, enter, escape, fail, gender, get over, (make) go (away, beyond, by, forth, his way, in, on, over, through), have away (more), lay, meddle, overrun, make partition, (cause to, give, make to, over) pass(-age, along, away, beyond, by, -enger, on, out, over, through), (cause to, make) proclaim(-amation), perish, provoke to anger, put away, rage, raiser of taxes, remove, send over, set apart, shave, cause to (make) sound, × speedily, × sweet smelling, take (away), (make to) transgress(-or), translate, turn away, (way-) faring man, be wrath.
Source: a primitive root;

5676.long:
Meaning: properly, a region "across"; but used only adverbially (with or without a preposition) on the "opposite" side (especially of the Jordan; ususally meaning the "east").
Usage: × against, beyond, by, × from, over, passage, quarter, (other, this) side, straight.
Source: from "H5674";

5677.long:
Meaning: "Eber", the name of two patriarchs and four Israelites.
Usage: Eber, Heber.
Source: the same as "H5676";

5678.long:
Meaning: an "outburst" of passion.
Usage: anger, rage, wrath.
Source: feminine of "H5676";

5679.long:
Meaning: a "crossing-place".
Usage: ferry, plain (from the margin).
Source: from "H5674";

5680.long:
Meaning: an "Eberite" (i.e. Hebrew) or descendant of Eber.
Usage: Hebrew(-ess, woman).
Source: patronymic from "H5677";

5681.long:
Meaning: "Ibri", an Israelite.
Usage: Ibri.
Source: the same as "H5680";

5682.long:
Meaning: "Abarim", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Abarim, passages.
Source: plural of "H5676"; "regions beyond";

5683.long:
Meaning: "Ebron", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Hebron. Perhaps a clerical error for "H5658".
Source: from "H5676"; transitional;

5684.long:
Meaning: "Ebronah", place in the Desert.
Usage: Ebronah.
Source: feminine of "H5683";

5685.long:
Meaning: to "dry up".
Usage: be rotten.
Source: a primitive root;

5686.long:
Meaning: to "interlace", i.e. (figuratively) to "pervert".
Usage: wrap up.
Source: a primitive root;

5688.long:
Meaning: something "intwined", i.e. a "string", "wreath" or "foliage".
Usage: band, cord, rope, thick bough (branch), wreathen (chain).
Source: or "עֲבוֹת"; or (feminine) "עֲבֹתָה"; the same as "H5687";

5689.long:
Meaning: to "breathe after", i.e. to "love" (sensually).
Usage: dote, lover.
Source: a primitive root;

5690.long:
Meaning: "love" (concretely), i.e. "amative words".
Usage: much love, very lovely.
Source: from "H5689";

5693.long:
Meaning: probably the "swallow".
Usage: swallow.
Source: passive part (but with active sense) of an unused root meaning to "twitter";

5694.long:
Meaning: something "round", i.e. a "ring" (for the ears).
Usage: earring.
Source: from the same as "H5696";

5695.long:
Meaning: a (male) "calf" (as "frisking" round), especially one nearly grown (i.e. a "steer").
Usage: bullock, calf.
Source: from the same as "H5696";

5696.long:
Meaning: "circular".
Usage: round.
Source: or "עָגוֹל"; from an unused root meaning to "revolve",

5697.long:
Meaning: a (female) "calf", especially one nearly grown (i.e. a "heifer").
Usage: calf, cow, heifer.
Source: feminine of "H5695";

5698.long:
Meaning: "Eglah", a wife of David.
Usage: Eglah.
Source: the same as "H5697";

5699.long:
Meaning: something "revolving", i.e. a wheeled "vehicle".
Usage: cart, chariot, wagon.
Source: from the same as "H5696";

5700.long:
Meaning: "Eglon", the name of a place in Palestine and of a Moabitish king.
Usage: Eglon.
Source: from "H5695"; vituline;

5701.long:
Meaning: to "be sad".
Usage: grieve.
Source: a primitive root;

5702.long:
Meaning: to "debar", i.e. from marriage.
Usage: stay.
Source: a primitive root;

5703.long:
Meaning: properly, a (peremptory) "terminus", i.e. (by implication) "duration", in the sense of "advance" or "perpetuity" (substantially as a noun, either with or without a preposition).
Usage: eternity, ever(-lasting, -more), old, perpetually, world without end.
Source: from "H5710";

5704.long:
Meaning: "as far" (or "long", or "much") "as", whether of space ("even unto") or time ("during", "while", "until") or degree ("equally with").
Usage: against, and, as, at, before, by (that), even (to), for(-asmuch as), (hither-) to, how long, into, as long (much) as, (so) that, till, toward, until, when, while, ( as) yet.
Source: properly, the same as "H5703" (used as a preposition, adverb or conjunction; especially with a preposition);

5705.long:
Usage: × and, at, for, (hither-) to, on till, (un-) to, until, within.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H5704"

5706.long:
Meaning: "booty".
Usage: prey.
Source: the same as "H5703" in the sense of the aim of an attack;

5707.long:
Meaning: concretely, a "witness"; abstractly, "testimony"; specifically, a "recorder", i.e. "prince".
Usage: witness.
Source: contracted from "H5749";

5708.long:
Meaning: the "menstrual" flux (as periodical); by implication (in plural) "soiling".
Usage: filthy.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "set" a period (compare "H5710", "H5749");

5709.long:
Usage: alter, depart, pass (away), remove, take (away).
Source: (Aramaic) or "עֲדָה"; (Aramaic), corresponding to "H5710"

5710.long:
Meaning: to "advance", i.e. "pass" on or "continue"; causatively, to "remove"; specifically, to "bedeck" (i.e. bring an ornament upon).
Usage: adorn, deck (self), pass by, take away.
Source: a primitive root;

5711.long:
Meaning: "Adah", the name of two women.
Usage: Adah.
Source: from "H5710"; ornament;

5712.long:
Meaning: a stated "assemblage" (specifically, a "concourse", or generally, a "family" or "crowd").
Usage: assembly, company, congregation, multitude, people, swarm. Compare "H5713".
Source: feminine of "H5707" in the original sense of "fixture";

5713.long:
Meaning: "testimony".
Usage: testimony, witness. Compare "H5712".
Source: feminine of "H5707" in its techn. sense;

5714.long:
Meaning: "Iddo" (or Iddi), the name of five Israelites.
Usage: Iddo. Compare "H3035", "H3260".
Source: or "עִדּוֹא"; or "עִדִּיא"; from "H5710"; "timely";

5716.long:
Meaning: "finery"; generally an "outfit"; specifically, a "headstall".
Usage: × excellent, mouth, ornament.
Source: from "H5710" in the sense of "trappings";

5717.long:
Meaning: "Adiel", the name of three Israelites.
Usage: Adiel.
Source: from "H5716" and "H410"; "ornament of God";

5718.long:
Meaning: "Adajah", the name of eight Israelites.
Usage: Adaiah.
Source: or "עֲדָיָהוּ"; from "H5710" and "H3050"; Jah has adorned;

5720.long:
Meaning: "Adin", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Adin.
Source: the same as "H5719";

5722.long:
Meaning: "his spear".
Usage: Adino.
Source: probably from "H5719" in the original sense of slender (i.e. a spear);

5723.long:
