Meaning: "Adithajim", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Adithaim.
Source: dual of a feminine of "H5706"; "double prey";

5724.long:
Meaning: "Adlai", an Israelite.
Usage: Adlai.
Source: probably from an unused root of uncertain meaning;

5725.long:
Meaning: "Adullam", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Adullam.
Source: probably from the passive participle of the same as "H5724";

5726.long:
Meaning: an "Adullamite" or native of Adullam.
Usage: Adullamite.
Source: patrial from "H5725";

5727.long:
Meaning: to "be soft" or "pleasant"; figuratively and reflexively, to "live voluptuously".
Usage: delight self.
Source: a primitive root;

5729.long:
Meaning: "Eden", a place in Mesopotamia.
Usage: Eden.
Source: from "H5727"; "pleasure";

5730.long:
Meaning: "pleasure".
Usage: delicate, delight, pleasure. See also "H1040".
Source: or (feminine) "עֶדְנָה"; from "H5727";

5731.long:
Meaning: "Eden", the region of Adam's home.
Usage: Eden.
Source: the same as "H5730" (masculine);

5732.long:
Meaning: a "set time"; technically, a "year".
Usage: time.
Source: (Aramaic) from a root corresponding to that of "H5708";

5733.long:
Meaning: "Adna", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Adna.
Source: from "H5727"; "pleasure";

5734.long:
Meaning: "Adnah", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Adnah.
Source: from "H5727"; "pleasure";

5735.long:
Meaning: "Adadah", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Adadah.
Source: from "H5712"; festival;

5736.long:
Meaning: to "be" (causatively "have") "redundant".
Usage: be more, odd number, be (have) over (and above), overplus, remain.
Source: a primitive root;

5737.long:
Meaning: to "arrange", as a battle, a vineyard (to "hoe"); hence, to "muster" and so to "miss" (or find "wanting").
Usage: dig, fail, keep (rank), lack.
Source: a primitive root;

5738.long:
Meaning: "Eder", an Israelite.
Usage: Ader.
Source: from "H5737"; an "arrangement" (i.e. drove);

5739.long:
Meaning: an "arrangement", i.e. "muster" (of animals).
Usage: drove, flock, herd.
Source: from "H5737";

5740.long:
Meaning: "Eder", the name of an Israelite and of two places in Palestine.
Usage: Edar, Eder.
Source: the same as "H5739";

5741.long:
Meaning: "Adriel", an Israelite.
Usage: Adriel.
Source: from "H5739" and "H410"; "flock of God";

5742.long:
Meaning: a "lentil".
Usage: lentile.
Source: from an unused root of uncertain meaning;

5743.long:
Meaning: to "be dense" or "dark", i.e. to "becloud".
Usage: cover with a cloud.
Source: a primitive root;

5744.long:
Meaning: "Obed", the name of five Israelites.
Usage: Obed.
Source: active participle of "H5647"; "serving";

5745.long:
Meaning: "Obal", a son of Joktan.
Usage: Obal.
Source: of foreign derivation;

5746.long:
Meaning: to "bake" (round cakes on the hearth).
Usage: bake.
Source: a primitive root; properly, to gyrate; but used only as a denominative from "H5692",

5747.long:
Meaning: "Og", a king of Bashan.
Usage: Og.
Source: probably from "H5746"; "round";

5748.long:
Meaning: a "reed-instrument" of music.
Usage: organ.
Source: or "עֻגָּב"; from "H5689" in the original sense of breathing;

5749.long:
Meaning: to "duplicate" or "repeat"; by implication, to "protest", "testify" (as by reiteration); intensively, to "encompass", "restore" (as a sort of reduplication).
Usage: admonish, charge, earnestly, lift up, protest, call (take) to record, relieve, rob, solemnly, stand upright, testify, give warning, (bear, call to, give, take to) witness.
Source: a primitive root;

5750.long:
Meaning: properly, "iteration" or "continuance"; used only adverbially (with or without preposition), "again", "repeatedly", "still", "more".
Usage: again, × all life long, at all, besides, but, else, further(-more), henceforth, (any) longer, (any) more(-over), × once, since, (be) still, when, (good, the) while (having being), (as, because, whether, while) yet (within).
Source: or "עֹד"; from "H5749";

5752.long:
Meaning: "Oded", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Oded.
Source: or "עֹדֵד"; from "H5749"; "reiteration";

5753.long:
Meaning: to "crook", literally or figuratively.
Usage: do amiss, bow down, make crooked, commit iniquity, pervert, (do) perverse(-ly), trouble, × turn, do wickedly, do wrong.
Source: a primitive root;

5755.long:
Meaning: "Ivvah" or "Avva", a region of Assyria.
Usage: Ava, Ivah.
Source: or "עַוָּא"; (2 Kings 17:24), for "H5754";

5756.long:
Meaning: to "be strong"; causatively, to "strengthen", i.e. (figuratively) to "save" (by flight).
Usage: gather (self, self to flee), retire.
Source: a primitive root;

5757.long:
Meaning: an "Avvite" or native of Avvah (only plural).
Usage: Avims, Avites.
Source: patrial from "H5755";

5758.long:
Meaning: "perverseness".
Usage: iniquity.
Source: (Aramaic) from a root corresponding to "H5753";

5759.long:
Meaning: a "babe".
Usage: young child, little one.
Source: from "H5764";

5761.long:
Meaning: "Avvim" (as inhabited by Avvites), a place in Palestine (with the article prefix).
Usage: Avim.
Source: plural of "H5757";

5762.long:
Meaning: "Avvith" (or Avvoth), a place in Palestine.
Usage: Avith.
Source: or perhaps ("עַיּוֹת" (as if plural of "H5857") ("עַיוּת"; from "H5753"; "ruin";

5763.long:
Meaning: to "suckle", i.e. "give milk".
Usage: milch, (ewe great) with young.
Source: a primitive root;

5765.long:
Meaning: to "distort" (morally).
Usage: deal unjustly, unrighteous.
Source: a primitive root;

5766.long:
Meaning: (moral) "evil".
Usage: iniquity, perverseness, unjust(-ly), unrighteousness(-ly); wicked(-ness).
Source: or "עָוֶל"; and (feminine) "עַוְלָה"; or "עוֹלָה"; or "עֹלָה"; from "H5765";

5768.long:
Meaning: a "suckling".
Usage: babe, (young) child, infant, little one.
Source: or "עֹלָל"; from "H5763";

5769.long:
Meaning: properly, "concealed", i.e. the "vanishing" point; generally, time "out of mind" (past or future), i.e. (practically) "eternity"; frequentatively, adverbial (especially with prepositional prefix) "always".
Usage: alway(-s), ancient (time), any more, continuance, eternal, (for, (n-)) ever(-lasting, -more, of old), lasting, long (time), (of) old (time), perpetual, at any time, (beginning of the) world ( without end). Compare "H5331", "H5703".
Source: or "עֹלָם"; from "H5956";

5771.long:
Meaning: "perversity", i.e. (moral) "evil".
Usage: fault, iniquity, mischeif, punishment (of iniquity), sin.
Source: or "עָווֹן"; (2 Kings 7:9; Psalm 51:5 [7]), from "H5753";

5772.long:
Meaning: (sexual) "cohabitation".
Usage: duty of marriage.
Source: from an unused root apparently meaning to "dwell" together;

5774.long:
Meaning: to "fly"; also (by implication of dimness) to "faint" (from the darkness of swooning).
Usage: brandish, be (wax) faint, flee away, fly (away), × set, shine forth, weary.
Source: a primitive root; to "cover" (with wings or obscurity); hence (as denominative from "H5775")

5775.long:
Meaning: a "bird" (as covered with feathers, or rather as covering with wings), often collectively.
Usage: bird, that flieth, flying, fowl.
Source: from "H5774";

5777.long:
Meaning: "lead" (from its "dusty" color).
Usage: lead.
Source: or "עֹפֶרֶת"; feminine participle active of "H6080";

5779.long:
Meaning: to "consult".
Usage: take advice ((counsel) together).
Source: a primitive root;

5780.long:
Meaning: "Uts", a son of Aram, also a Seirite, and the regions settled by them.
Usage: Uz.
Source: apparently from "H5779"; consultation;

5781.long:
Meaning: to "pack".
Usage: be pressed.
Source: a primitive root;

5782.long:
Meaning: to "wake" (literally or figuratively).
Usage: (a-) wake(-n, up), lift up (self), × master, raise (up), stir up (self).
Source: a primitive root (rather identical with through the idea of "opening" the eyes);

5783.long:
Meaning: to (be) "bare".
Usage: be made naked.
Source: a primitive root;

5785.long:
Meaning: "skin" (as naked); by implication, "hide", "leather".
Usage: hide, leather, skin.
Source: from "H5783";

5786.long:
Meaning: to "blind".
Usage: blind, put out. See also "H5895".
Source: a primitive root (rather denominatively from "H5785" through the idea of a film over the eyes);

5787.long:
Meaning: "blind" (literally or figuratively).
Usage: blind (men, people).
Source: intensive from "H5786";

5789.long:
Meaning: to "hasten".
Usage: assemble self.
Source: a primitive root;

5790.long:
Meaning: to "hasten", i.e. "succor".
Usage: speak in season.
Source: for "H5789";

5791.long:
Meaning: to "wrest".
Usage: bow self, (make) crooked., falsifying, overthrow, deal perversely, pervert, subvert, turn upside down.
Source: a primitive root;

5793.long:
Meaning: "Uthai", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Uthai.
Source: from "H5790"; "succoring";

5794.long:
Meaning: "strong", "vehement", "harsh".
Usage: fierce, greedy, mighty, power, roughly, strong.
Source: from "H5810";

5795.long:
Meaning: a "she-goat" (as strong), but masculine in plural (which also is used elliptically for goat's hair).
Usage: (she) goat, kid.
Source: from "H5810";

5797.long:
Meaning: "strength" in various applications ("force", "security", "majesty", "praise").
Usage: boldness, loud, might, power, strength, strong.
Source: or (fully) "עוֹז"; from "H5810";

5798.long:
Meaning: "Uzza" or "Uzzah", the name of five Israelites.
Usage: Uzza, Uzzah.
Source: or "עֻזָּה"; feminine of "H5797"; strength;

5799.long:
Meaning: "goat of departure"; the "scapegoat".
Usage: scapegoat.
Source: from "H5795" and "H235";

5800.long:
Meaning: to "loosen", i.e. "relinquish", "permit", etc.
Usage: commit self, fail, forsake, fortify, help, leave (destitute, off), refuse, × surely.
Source: a primitive root;

5801.long:
Meaning: "trade", i.e. the "place" (mart) or the "payment" (revenue).
Usage: fair, ware.
Source: from "H5800" in the sense of letting go (for a price, i.e. selling);

5802.long:
Meaning: "Azbuk", an Israelite.
Usage: Azbuk.
Source: from "H5794" and the root of "H950"; "stern depopulator";

5803.long:
Meaning: "Azgad", an Israelite.
Usage: Azgad.
Source: from "H5794" and "H1409"; "stern troop";

5804.long:
Meaning: "Azzah", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Azzah, Gaza.
Source: feminine of "H5794"; strong;

5805.long:
Meaning: "desertion" (of inhabitants).
Usage: forsaking.
Source: feminine passive participle of "H5800";

5806.long:
Meaning: "Azubah", the name of two Israelitesses.
Usage: Azubah.
Source: the same as "H5805";

5808.long:
Meaning: "forcible"; collectively and concretely, an "army".
Usage: power, strong.
Source: from "H5810";

5809.long:
Meaning: "Azzur", the name of three Israelites.
Usage: Azur, Azzur.
Source: or "עַזֻּר"; from "H5826"; "helpful";

5810.long:
Meaning: to "be stout" (literally or figuratively).
Usage: harden, impudent, prevail, strengthen (self), be strong.
Source: a primitive root;

5812.long:
Meaning: "Azazjah", the name of three Israelites.
Usage: Azaziah.
Source: from "H5810" and "H3050"; "Jah has strengthened";

5813.long:
Meaning: "Uzzi", the name of six Israelites.
Usage: Uzzi.
Source: from "H5810"; "forceful";

5815.long:
Meaning: "Aziel", an Israelite.
Usage: Aziel. Compare "H3268".
Source: from "H5756" and "H410"; strengthened of God;

5816.long:
Meaning: "Uzziel", the name of six Israelites.
Usage: Uzziel.
Source: from "H5797" and "H410"; "strength of God";

5817.long:
Meaning: an "Uzzielite" (collectively) or descendants of Uzziel.
Usage: Uzzielites.
Source: patronymically from "H5816";

5818.long:
Meaning: "Uzzijah", the name of five Israelites.
Usage: Uzziah.
Source: or "עֻזִּיָּהוּ"; from "H5797" and "H3050"; "strength of Jah";

5820.long:
Meaning: "Azmaveth", the name of three Israelites and of a place in Palestine.
Usage: Azmaveth. See also "H1041".
Source: from "H5794" and "H4194"; "strong one of death";

5822.long:
Meaning: probably the "sea-eagle" (from its strength).
Usage: ospray.
Source: probably feminine of "H5797";

5823.long:
Meaning: to "grub" over.
Usage: fence about.
Source: a primitive root;

5824.long:
Meaning: a "signet-ring" (as engraved).
Usage: signet.
Source: (Aramaic) from a root corresponding to "H5823";

5825.long:
Meaning: "Azekah", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Azekah.
Source: from "H5823"; "tilled";

5826.long:
Meaning: to "surround", i.e. "protect" or "aid".
Usage: help, succour.
Source: a primitive root;

5827.long:
Meaning: "Ezer", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Ezer. Compare "H5829".
Source: from "H5826"; "help";

5829.long:
Meaning: "Ezer", the name of four Israelites.
Usage: Ezer. Compare "H5827".
Source: the same as "H5828";

5830.long:
Meaning: "Ezra", an Israelite.
Usage: Ezra.
Source: a variation of "H5833";

5832.long:
Meaning: "Azarel", the name of five Israelites.
Usage: Azarael, Azareel.
Source: from "H5826" and "H410"; "God has helped";

5834.long:
Meaning: "Ezrah", an Israelite.
Usage: Ezrah.
Source: the same as "H5833";

5835.long:
Meaning: an "inclosure"; also a "border".
Usage: court, settle.
Source: from "H5826" in its original meaning of surrounding;

5837.long:
Meaning: "Azriel", the name of three Israelites.
Usage: Azriel.
Source: from "H5828" and "H410"; "help of God";

5838.long:
Meaning: "Azarjah", the name of nineteen Israelites.
Usage: Azariah.
Source: or "עֲזַרְיָהוּ"; from "H5826" and "H3050"; "Jah has helped";

5839.long:
Meaning: "Azarjah", one of Daniel's companions.
Usage: Azariah.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H5838";

5840.long:
Meaning: "Azrikam", the name of four Israelites.
Usage: Azrikam.
Source: from "H5828" and active participle of "H6965"; "help of an enemy";

5841.long:
Meaning: an "Azzathite" or inhabitant of Azzah.
Usage: Gazathite, Gazite.
Source: patrial from "H5804";

5842.long:
Meaning: a "stylus" or "marking stick".
Usage: pen.
Source: from "H5860" (contracted) in the sense of swooping, i.e. side-long stroke;

5844.long:
Meaning: to "wrap", i.e. "cover", "veil", "clothe", or "roll".
Usage: array self, be clad, (put a) cover (-ing, self), fill, put on, × surely, turn aside.
Source: a primitive root;

5845.long:
Meaning: a "receptacle" (for milk, i.e. pail; figuratively, breast).
Usage: breast.
Source: from an unused root meaning apparently to contain;

5846.long:
Meaning: "sneezing".
Usage: sneezing.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "sneeze";

5848.long:
Meaning: to "shroud", i.e. "clothe" (whether transitive or reflex.); hence (from the idea of "darkness") to "languish".
Usage: cover (over), fail, faint, feebler, hide self, be overwhelmed, swoon.
Source: a primitive root;

5849.long:
Meaning: to "encircle" (for attack or protection); especially to "crown" (literally or figuratively).
Usage: compass, crown.
Source: a primitive root;

5851.long:
Meaning: "Atarah", an Israelitess.
Usage: Atarah.
Source: the same as "H5850";

5852.long:
Meaning: "Ataroth", the name (thus simply) of two places in Palestine.
Usage: Ataroth.
Source: or "עֲטָרֹת"; plural of "H5850";

5853.long:
Meaning: "Atroth-Addar", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Ataroth-adar(-addar).
Source: from the same as "H5852" and "H146"; crowns of Addar;

5854.long:
Meaning: "Atroth-beth-Joab", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Ataroth the house of Joab.
Source: from the same as "H5852" and "H1004" and "H3097"; crowns of the house of Joab;

5855.long:
Meaning: "Atroth-Shophan", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Atroth, Shophan (as if two places).
Source: from the same as "H5852" and a name otherwise unused (being from the same as "H8226") meaning "hidden"; "crowns of Shophan";

5857.long:
Meaning: "Ai", "Aja" or "Ajath", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Ai, Aija, Aijath, Hai.
Source: or (feminine) "עַיָּא"; (Nehemiah 11:31), or "עַיָּת"; (Isaiah 10:28), for "H5856";

5858.long:
Meaning: "Ebal", a mountain of Palestine.
Usage: Ebal.
Source: perhaps from an unused root probably meaning to "be bald"; "bare";

5859.long:
Meaning: "Ijon", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Ijon.
Source: from "H5856"; "ruin";

5860.long:
Meaning: to "swoop" down upon (literally or figuratively).
Usage: fly, rail.
Source: a primitive root;

5861.long:
Meaning: a "hawk" or other bird of prey.
Usage: bird, fowl, ravenous (bird).
Source: from "H5860";

5862.long:
Meaning: "Etam", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Etam.
Source: from "H5861"; "hawk-ground";

5863.long:
Meaning: "Ije-ha-Abarim", a place near Palestine.
Usage: Ije-abarim.
Source: from the plural of "H5856" and the plural of the active participle of "H5674" with the article interposed; "ruins of the passers";

5864.long:
Meaning: "Ijim", a place in the Desert.
Usage: Iim.
Source: plural of "H5856"; "ruins";

5867.long:
Meaning: "Elam", a son of Shem and his descendants, with their country; also of six Israelites.
Usage: Elam.
Source: or "עוֹלָם"; (Ezra 10:2; Jeremiah 49:36), probably from "H5956"; hidden, i.e. distant;

5868.long:
Meaning: probably meaning "strength".
Usage: mighty.
Source: of doubtful origin and authenticity;

5869.long:
Meaning: an "eye" (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a "fountain" (as the "eye" of the landscape).
Usage: affliction, outward appearance, before, think best, colour, conceit, be content, countenance, displease, eye((-brow), (-d), -sight), face, favour, fountain, furrow (from the margin), × him, humble, knowledge, look, ( well), × me, open(-ly), (not) please, presence, regard, resemblance, sight, × thee, × them, think, × us, well, × you(-rselves).
Source: probably a primitive word;

5871.long:
Meaning: "Ajin", the name (thus simply) of two places in Palestine.
Usage: Ain.
Source: the same as "H5869"; "fountain";

5872.long:
Meaning: "En-Gedi", a place in Palestine.
Usage: En-gedi.
Source: from "H5869" and "H1423"; fountain of a kid;

5873.long:
Meaning: "En-Gannim", a place in Palestine.
Usage: En-gannim.
Source: from "H5869" and the plural of "H1588"; "fountain of gardens";

5874.long:
Meaning: "En-Dor", a place in Palestine.
Usage: En-dor.
Source: or "עֵין דּוֹר"; or "עֵין־דֹּר"; from "H5869" and "H1755"; "fountain of dwelling";

5875.long:
Meaning: "En-hak-Kore", a place near Palestine.
Usage: En-hakhore.
Source: from "H5869" and the active participle of "H7121"; fountain of One calling;

5876.long:
Meaning: "En-Chaddah", a place in Palestine.
Usage: En-haddah.
Source: from "H5869" and the feminine of a derivative from "H2300"; "fountain of sharpness";

5877.long:
Meaning: "En-Chatsor", a place in Palestine.
Usage: En-hazor.
Source: from "H5869" and the same as "H2674"; "fountain of a village";

5878.long:
Meaning: "En-Charod", a place in Palestine.
Usage: well of Harod.
Source: from "H5869" and a derivative of "H2729"; fountain of trembling;

5879.long:
Meaning: "Enajim" or "Enam", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Enaim, openly (Genesis 38:21).
Source: or "עֵינָם"; dual of "H5869"; "double fountain";

5880.long:
Meaning: "En-Mishpat", a place near Palestine.
Usage: En-mishpat.
Source: from "H5869" and "H4941"; "fountain of judgment";

5881.long:
Meaning: "Enan", an Israelite.
Usage: Enan. Compare "H2704".
Source: from "H5869"; having eyes;

5882.long:
Meaning: "En-Eglajim", a place in Palestine.
Usage: En-eglaim.
Source: "עַיִן" and the dual of "H5695"; fountain of two calves;

5883.long:
Meaning: "En-Rogel", a place near Jerusalem.
Usage: En-rogel.
Source: from "H5869" and the active participle of "H7270"; fountain of a traveller;

5884.long:
Meaning: "En-Rimmon", a place in Palestine.
Usage: En-rimmon.
Source: from "H5869" and "H7416"; "fountain of a pomegranate";

5885.long:
Meaning: "En-Shemesh", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Enshemesh.
Source: from "H5869" and "H8121"; "fountain of the sun";

5886.long:
Meaning: "En-Tannim", a pool near Jerusalem.
Usage: dragon well.
Source: from "H5869" and the plural of "H8565"; fountain of jackals;

5887.long:
Meaning: "En-Tappuach", a place in Palestine.
Usage: En-tappuah.
Source: from "H5869" and "H8598"; fountain of an apple-tree;

5888.long:
Meaning: to "languish".
Usage: be wearied.
Source: a primitive root;

5890.long:
Meaning: "obscurity" (as if from covering).
Usage: darkness.
Source: feminine from "H5774";

5891.long:
Meaning: "Ephah", the name of a son of Midian, and of the region settled by him; also of an Israelite and of an Israelitess.
Usage: Ephah.
Source: the same as "H5890";

5892.long:
Meaning: a "city" (a place guarded by "waking" or a watch) in the widest sense (even of a mere "encampment" or "post").
Usage: Ai (from margin), city, court (from margin), town.
Source: or (in the plural) "עָר"; or "עָיַר"; (Judges 10:4), from "H5782"

5893.long:
Meaning: "Ir", an Israelite.
Usage: Ir.
Source: the same as "H5892";

5894.long:
Meaning: a "watcher", i.e. an "angel" (as guardian).
Usage: watcher.
Source: (Aramaic) from a root corresponding to "H5782";

5895.long:
Meaning: properly, a "young ass" (as just broken to a load); hence an "ass-colt".
Usage: (ass) colt, foal, young ass.
Source: from "H5782" in the sense of raising (i.e. bearing a burden);

5896.long:
Meaning: "Ira", the name of three Israelites.
Usage: Ira.
Source: from "H5782"; "wakefulness";

5897.long:
Meaning: "Irad", an antediluvian.
Usage: Irad.
Source: from the same as "H6166"; "fugitive";

5898.long:
Meaning: "Irham-Melach", a place near Palestine.
Usage: the city of salt.
Source: from "H5892" and "H4417" with the article of substance interp.; city of (the) salt;

5899.long:
Meaning: "Ir-hat-Temarim", a place in Palestine.
Usage: the city of palmtrees.
Source: from "H5892" and the plural of "H8558" with the article interpolated; city of the palmtrees;

5904.long:
Meaning: "Ir-Nachash", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Irnahash.
Source: from "H5892" and "H5175"; city of a serpent;

5905.long:
Meaning: "Ir-Shemesh", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Irshemesh.
Source: from "H5892" and "H8121"; "city of the sun";

5906.long:
Meaning: the "constellation of the Great Bear" (perhaps from its migration through the heavens).
Usage: Arcturus.
Source: or "עָשׁ"; from "H5789";

5907.long:
Meaning: "Akbor", the name of an Idumaean and of two Israelites.
Usage: Achbor.
Source: probably for "H5909";

5908.long:
Meaning: a "spider" (as "weaving" a network).
Usage: spider.
Source: probably from an unused root in the literal sense of "entangling";

5909.long:
Meaning: a "mouse" (as "nibbling").
Usage: mouse.
Source: probably from the same as "H5908" in the secondary sense of "attacking";

5910.long:
Meaning: "Akko" (from its situation on a bay).
Usage: Accho.
Source: apparently from an unused root meaning to hem in;

5911.long:
Meaning: "Akor", the name of a place in Palestine.
Usage: Achor.
Source: from "H5916"; "troubled";

5912.long:
Meaning: "Akan", an Israelite.
Usage: Achan. Compare "H5917".
Source: from an unused root meaning to trouble; "troublesome";

5913.long:
Meaning: to "put on anklets".
Usage: make a tinkling ornament.
Source: a primitive root; properly, to tie, specifically, with fetters; but used only as denominative from "H5914";

5914.long:
Meaning: a "fetter"; hence, an "anklet".
Usage: stocks, tinkling ornament.
Source: from "H5913";

5916.long:
Meaning: properly, to "roil water"; figuratively, to "disturb" or "affict".
Usage: trouble, stir.
Source: a primitive root;

5917.long:
Meaning: "Akar", an Israelite.
Usage: Achar. Compare "H5912".
Source: from "H5916"; troublesome;

5919.long:
Meaning: an "asp" (from lurking coiled up).
Usage: adder.
Source: probably from an unused root meaning to "coil";

5920.long:
Meaning: properly, the "top"; specifically, the "Highest" (i.e. "God"); also (adverb) "aloft", "to Jehovah".
Usage: above, high, most High.
Source: from "H5927";

5921.long:
Meaning: "above", "over", "upon", or "against" (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications.
Usage: above, according to(-ly), after, (as) against, among, and, × as, at, because of, beside (the rest of), between, beyond the time, × both and, by (reason of), × had the charge of, concerning for, in (that), (forth, out) of, (from) (off), (up-) on, over, than, through(-out), to, touching, × with.
Source: properly, the same as "H5920" used as a preposition (in the singular or plural often with prefix, or as conjunction with a particle following);

5922.long:
Usage: about, against, concerning, for, (there-) fore, from, in, × more, of, (there-, up-) on, (in-) to, why with.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H5921"

5923.long:
Meaning: a "yoke" (as imposed on the neck), literally or figuratively.
Usage: yoke.
Source: or "עוֹל"; from "H5953";

5926.long:
Meaning: "stuttering".
Usage: stammerer.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "stutter";

5927.long:
Meaning: to "ascend", intransitively (be "high") or actively ("mount"); used in a great variety of senses, primary and secondary, literal and figurative.
Usage: arise (up), (cause to) ascend up, at once, break (the day) (up), bring (up), (cause to) burn, carry up, cast up, shew, climb (up), (cause to, make to) come (up), cut off, dawn, depart, exalt, excel, fall, fetch up, get up, (make to) go (away, up); grow (over) increase, lay, leap, levy, lift (self) up, light, (make) up, × mention, mount up, offer, make to pay, perfect, prefer, put (on), raise, recover, restore, (make to) rise (up), scale, set (up), shoot forth (up), (begin to) spring (up), stir up, take away (up), work.
Source: a primitive root;

5929.long:
Meaning: a "leaf" (as coming up on a tree); collectively, "foliage".
Usage: branch, leaf.
Source: from "H5927";

5930.long:
Meaning: a "step" or (collectively, stairs, as ascending); usually a "holocaust" (as going up in smoke).
Usage: ascent, burnt offering (sacrifice), go up to. See also "H5766".
Source: or "עוֹלָה"; feminine active participle of "H5927";

5931.long:
Meaning: a "pretext" (as arising artificially).
Usage: occasion.
Source: (Aramaic) feminine from a root corresponding to "H5927";

5933.long:
Meaning: "Alvah" or "Aljah", an Idumaean.
Usage: Aliah, Alvah.
Source: or "עַליָה"; the same as "H5932";

5934.long:
Meaning: (only in plural as abstract) "adolescence"; figuratively, "vigor".
Usage: youth.
Source: passive participle of "H5956" in the denominative sense of "H5958";

5935.long:
Meaning: "Alvan" or "Aljan", an Idumaean.
Usage: Alian, Alvan.
Source: or "עַלְיָן"; from "H5927"; "lofty";

5936.long:
Meaning: the "leech".
Usage: horse-leech.
Source: feminine passive participle of an unused root meaning to "suck";

5937.long:
Meaning: to "jump" for joy, i.e. "exult".
Usage: be joyful, rejoice, triumph.
Source: a primitive root;

5939.long:
Meaning: "dusk".
Usage: dark, twilight.
Source: feminine from an unused root meaning to "cover";

5944.long:
Meaning: something "lofty", i.e. a "stair-way"; also a "second-story" room (or even one on the roof); figuratively, the "sky".
Usage: ascent, (upper) chamber, going up, loft, parlour.
Source: feminine from "H5927";

5945.long:
Meaning: an "elevation", i.e. (adj.) "lofty" (compar.); as title, the "Supreme".
Usage: (Most, on) high(-er, -est), upper(-most).
Source: from "H5927";

5948.long:
Meaning: probably a "crucible" (as working over the metal).
Usage: furnace.
Source: from "H5953" in the sense of completing;

5949.long:
Meaning: an "exploit" (of God), or a "performance" (of man, often in a bad sense); by implication, an "opportunity".
Usage: act(-ion), deed, doing, invention, occasion, work.
Source: or "עֲלִלָה"; from "H5953" in the sense of "effecting";

5953.long:
Meaning: to "effect thoroughly"; specifically, to "glean" (also figuratively); by implication (in a bad sense) to "overdo", i.e. "maltreat", "be saucy to", "pain", "impose" (also literal).
Usage: abuse, affect, × child, defile, do, glean, mock, practise, thoroughly, work (wonderfully).
Source: a primitive root;

5954.long:
Meaning: to "enter"; causatively, to "introduce".
Usage: bring in, come in, go in.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H5953" (in the sense of thrusting oneself in),

5955.long:
Meaning: only in plural "gleanings"; by extension "gleaning-time".
Usage: (gleaning) (of the) grapes, grapegleanings.
Source: feminine active participle of "H5953";

5956.long:
Meaning: to "veil" from sight, i.e. "conceal" (literally or figuratively).
Usage: × any ways, blind, dissembler, hide (self), secret (thing).
Source: a primitive root;

5957.long:
Meaning: "remote time", i.e. the "future" or "past" indefinitely; often adverb, "forever".
Usage: for (n-)ever (lasting), old.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H5769";

5958.long:
Meaning: properly, something "kept out of sight", i.e. a "lad".
Usage: young man, stripling.
Source: from "H5956"; (compare "H5959")

5959.long:
Meaning: a "lass" (as veiled or private).
Usage: damsel, maid, virgin.
Source: feminine of "H5958";

5960.long:
Meaning: "Almon", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Almon.
Source: from "H5956"; "hidden"; See also "H5963".

5961.long:
Meaning: properly, "girls", i.e. the "soprano" or female voice, perhaps "falsetto".
Usage: Alamoth.
Source: plural of "H5959";

5962.long:
Meaning: an "Elamite" or inhabitant of Elam.
Usage: Elamite.
Source: (Aramaic) patrial from a name corresponding to "H5867" contracted;

5963.long:
Meaning: "Almon-Diblathajemah", a place in Moab.
Usage: Almondilathaim.
Source: from the same as "H5960" and the dual of "H1960" (compare "H1015") with enclitic of direction; Almon towards Diblathajim;

5964.long:
Meaning: "Alemeth", the name of a place in Palestine and of two Israelites.
Usage: Alameth, Alemeth.
Source: from "H5956"; a covering;

5965.long:
Meaning: to "leap for joy", i.e. "exult", "wave joyously".
Usage: × peacock, rejoice, solace self.
Source: a primitive root;

5966.long:
Meaning: to "sip up".
Usage: suck up.
Source: a primitive root;

5968.long:
Meaning: to "veil" or "cover"; figuratively, to "be languid".
Usage: faint, overlaid, wrap self.
Source: a primitive root;

5970.long:
Meaning: to "jump for joy", i.e. "exult".
Usage: be joyful, rejoice, triumph.
Source: a primitive root;

5971.long:
Meaning: a "people" (as a congregated unit); specifically, a "tribe" (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) "troops" or "attendants"; figuratively, a "flock".
Usage: folk, men, nation, people.
Source: from "H6004";

5973.long:
Meaning: adverb or preposition, "with" (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, "equally with"; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English).
Usage: accompanying, against, and, as (× long as), before, beside, by (reason of), for all, from (among, between), in, like, more than, of, (un-) to, with(-al).
Source: from "H6004";

5974.long:
Usage: by, from, like, to(-ward), with.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H5973"

5975.long:
Meaning: to "stand", in various relations (literal and figurative, intransitive and transitive).
Usage: abide (behind), appoint, arise, cease, confirm, continue, dwell, be employed, endure, establish, leave, make, ordain, be (over), place, (be) present (self), raise up, remain, repair, serve, set (forth, over, -tle, up), (make to, make to be at a, with-) stand (by, fast, firm, still, up), (be at a) stay (up), tarry.
Source: a primitive root;

5976.long:
Meaning: "to shake".
Usage: be at a stand.
Source: for "H4571";

5977.long:
Meaning: a "spot" (as being fixed).
Usage: place, ( where) stood, upright.
Source: from "H5975";

5978.long:
Meaning: "along with".
Usage: against, by, from, + me, + mine, of, + that I take, unto, upon, with(-in.).
Source: prolonged for "H5973";

5980.long:
Meaning: "conjunction", i.e. "society"; mostly adverb or preposition (with prepositional prefix), "near", "beside", "along with".
Usage: (over) against, at, beside, hard by, in points.
Source: from "H6004";

5981.long:
Meaning: "Ummah", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Ummah.
Source: the same as "H5980"; "association";

5982.long:
Meaning: a "column" (as "standing"); also a "stand", i.e. platform.
Usage: × apiece, pillar.
Source: or "עַמֻּד"; from "H5975";

5983.long:
Meaning: "Ammon", a son of Lot; also his posterity and their country.
Usage: Ammon, Ammonites.
Source: from "H5971"; tribal, i.e. inbred;

5984.long:
Meaning: an "Ammonite" or (the adjective) "Ammonitish".
Usage: Ammonite(-s).
Source: patronymically from "H5983";

5988.long:
Meaning: "Ammiel", the name of three or four Israelites.
Usage: Ammiel.
Source: from "H5971" and "H410"; "people of God";

5989.long:
Meaning: "Ammihud", the name of three Israelites.
Usage: Ammihud.
Source: from "H5971" and "H1935"; "people of splendor";

5990.long:
Meaning: "Ammizabad", an Israelite.
Usage: Ammizabad.
Source: from "H5971" and "H2064"; "people of endowment";

5991.long:
Meaning: "Ammichur", a Syrian prince.
Usage: Ammihud (from the margin).
Source: from "H5971" and "H2353"; people of nobility;

5992.long:
Meaning: "Amminadab", the name of four Israelites.
Usage: Amminadab.
Source: from "H5971" and "H5068"; "people of liberality";

5993.long:
Meaning: "Ammi-Nadib", probably an Israelite.
Usage: Amminadib.
Source: from "H5971" and "H5081"; my people (is) liberal;

5995.long:
Meaning: a "bunch of grain".
Usage: handful, sheaf.
Source: from "H6014";

5996.long:
Meaning: "Ammishaddai", an Israelite.
Usage: Ammishaddai.
Source: from "H5971" and "H7706"; "people of" (the) "Almighty";

5997.long:
Meaning: "companionship"; hence (concretely) a "comrade" or kindred man.
Usage: another, fellow, neighbour.
Source: from a primitive root meaning to "associate";

5998.long:
Meaning: to "toil", i.e. "work severely and with irksomeness".
Usage: (take) labour (in).
Source: a primitive root;

5999.long:
Meaning: "toil", i.e. "wearing effort"; hence, "worry", whether of body or mind.
Usage: grievance(-vousness), iniquity, labour, mischief, miserable(-sery), pain(-ful), perverseness, sorrow, toil, travail, trouble, wearisome, wickedness.
Source: from "H5998";

6000.long:
Meaning: "Amal", an Israelite.
Usage: Amal.
Source: the same as "H5999";

6001.long:
Meaning: "toiling"; concretely, a "laborer"; figuratively, "sorrowful".
Usage: that laboureth, that is a misery, had taken (labour), wicked, workman.
Source: from "H5998";

6002.long:
Meaning: "Amalek", a descendant of Esau; also his posterity and their country.
Usage: Amalek.
Source: probably of foreign origin;

6003.long:
Meaning: an "Amalekite" (or collectively the Amalekites) or descendants of Amalek.
Usage: Amalekite(-s).
Source: patronymically from "H6002";

6004.long:
Meaning: to "associate"; by implication, to "overshadow" (by "huddling" together).
Usage: become dim, hide.
Source: a primitive root;

6005.long:
Meaning: "Immanuel", a type name of Isaiah's son.
Usage: Immanuel.
Source: from "H5973" and with a pronominal suffix inserted; "with us" (is) "God";

6006.long:
Meaning: to "load", i.e. "impose" a burden (or figuratively, infliction).
Usage: be borne, (heavy) burden (self), lade, load, put.
Source: or "עָמַשׂ"; a primitive root;

6007.long:
Meaning: "Amasjah", an Israelite.
Usage: Amasiah.
Source: from "H6006" and "H3050"; "Jah has loaded";

6008.long:
Meaning: "Amad", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Amad.
Source: from "H5971" and "H5703"; "people of time";

6009.long:
Meaning: to "be" (causatively, "make") "deep" (literally or figuratively).
Usage: (be, have, make, seek) deep(-ly), depth, be profound.
Source: a primitive root;

6010.long:
Meaning: a "vale" (i.e. broad depression).
Usage: dale, vale, valley (often used as a part of proper names). See also "H1025".
Source: from "H6009";

6012.long:
Meaning: "deep" (literally or figuratively).
Usage: deeper, depth, strange.
Source: from "H6009";

6014.long:
Meaning: properly, apparently to "heap"; figuratively, to "chastise" (as if piling blows); to "gather grain".
Usage: bind sheaves, make merchandise of.
Source: a primitive root; specifically (as denominative from "H6016")

6016.long:
Meaning: properly, a "heap", i.e. a "sheaf"; also an "omer", as a dry measure.
Usage: omer, sheaf.
Source: from "H6014";

6017.long:
Meaning: "Amorah", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Gomorrah.
Source: from "H6014"; a (ruined) "heap";

6019.long:
Meaning: "Amram", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Amram.
Source: probably from "H5971" and "H7311"; high people;

6020.long:
Meaning: an "Amramite" or descendant of Amram.
Usage: Amramite.
Source: from "H6019";

6021.long:
Meaning: "Amasa", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Amasa.
Source: from "H6006"; "burden";

6022.long:
Meaning: "Amasai", the name of three Israelites.
Usage: Amasai.
Source: from "H6006"; "burdensome";

6024.long:
Meaning: "Anab", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Anab.
Source: from the same as "H6025"; "fruit";

6025.long:
Meaning: a "grape".
Usage: (ripe) grape, wine.
Source: from an unused root probably meaning to "bear" fruit;

6026.long:
Meaning: to be "soft" or pliable, i.e. (figuratively) "effeminate" or luxurious.
Usage: delicate(-ness), (have) delight (self), sport self.
Source: a primitive root;

6029.long:
Meaning: to "lace fast".
Usage: bind, tie.
Source: a primitive root;

6030.long:
Meaning: properly, to "eye" or (generally) to "heed", i.e. "pay attention"; by implication, to "respond"; by extension to "begin to speak"; specifically to "sing", "shout", "testify", "announce".
Usage: give account, afflict (by mistake for "H6031"), (cause to, give) answer, bring low (by mistake for "H6031"), cry, hear, Leannoth, lift up, say, × scholar, (give a) shout, sing (together by course), speak, testify, utter, (bear) witness. See also "H1042", "H1043".
Source: a primitive root;

6031.long:
Meaning: to "depress" literally or figuratively, transitive or intransitive (in various applications, as follows).
Usage: abase self, afflict(-ion, self), answer (by mistake for "H6030"), chasten self, deal hardly with, defile, exercise, force, gentleness, humble (self), hurt, ravish, sing (by mistake for "H6030"), speak (by mistake for "H6030"), submit self, weaken, × in any wise.
Source: a primitive root (possibly rather identical with "H6030" through the idea of looking down or browbeating);

6034.long:
Meaning: "Anah", the name of two Edomites and one Edomitess.
Usage: Anah.
Source: probably from "H6030"; an "answer";

6035.long:
Meaning: "depressed" (figuratively), in mind ("gentle") or circumstances ("needy", especially "saintly").
Usage: humble, lowly, meek, poor. Compare "H6041".
Source: or (by intermixture with "H6041") "עָנָיו"; from "H6031";

6036.long:
Meaning: "Anub", an Israelite.
Usage: Anub.
Source: passive participle from the same as "H6025"; "borne" (as fruit);

6038.long:
Meaning: "condescension", human and subjective (modesty), or divine and objective (clemency).
Usage: gentleness, humility, meekness.
Source: from "H6035";

6041.long:
Meaning: "depressed", in mind or circumstances.
Usage: afflicted, humble, lowly, needy, poor.
Source: from "H6031"; (practically the same as "H6035", although the margin constantly disputes this, making "H6035" subjective and objective);

6042.long:
Meaning: "Unni", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Unni.
Source: from "H6031"; "afflicted";

6043.long:
Meaning: "Anajah", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Anaiah.
Source: from "H6030"; "Jah has answered";

6044.long:
Meaning: "Anim", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Anim.
Source: for plural of "H5869"; "fountains";

6045.long:
Meaning: "ado", i.e. (generally) "employment" or (specifically) an "affair".
Usage: business, travail.
Source: from "H6031";

6046.long:
Meaning: "Anem", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Anem.
Source: from the dual of "H5869"; two fountains;

6047.long:
Meaning: "Anamim", a son of Mizraim and his descendants, with their country.
Usage: Anamim.
Source: as if plural of some Egyptian word;

6048.long:
Meaning: "Anammelek", an Assyrian deity.
Usage: Anammelech.
Source: of foreign origin;

6049.long:
Meaning: figuratively, to "act covertly", i.e. "practise magic".
Usage: × bring, enchanter, Meonemin, observe(-r of) times, soothsayer, sorcerer.
Source: a primitive root; to cover; used only as a denominative from "H6051", to cloud over;

6051.long:
Meaning: a "cloud" (as "covering" the sky), i.e. the "nimbus" or thunder-cloud.
Usage: cloud(-y).
Source: from "H6049";

6052.long:
Meaning: "Anan", an Israelite.
Usage: Anan.
Source: the same as "H6051"; "cloud";

6055.long:
Meaning: "Ananjah", the name of an Israelite and of a place in Palestine.
Usage: Ananiah.
Source: from "H6049" and "H3050"; "Jah has covered";

6057.long:
Meaning: a "twig" (as covering the limbs).
Usage: bough, branch.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "cover";

6058.long:
Meaning: "branching".
Usage: full of branches.
Source: from the same as "H6057";

6059.long:
Meaning: to "collar", i.e. "adorn with a necklace"; figuratively, to "fit out with supplies".
Usage: compass about as a chain, furnish, liberally.
Source: a primitive root; properly, to choke; used only as denominative from "H6060",

6061.long:
Meaning: "Anak", a Canaanite.
Usage: Anak.
Source: the same as "H6060";

6062.long:
Meaning: an "Anakite" or descendant of Anak.
Usage: Anakim.
Source: patronymically from "H6061";

6063.long:
Meaning: "Aner", a Amorite, also a place in Palestine.
Usage: Aner.
Source: probably for "H5288";

6064.long:
Meaning: properly, to "urge"; by implication, to "inflict a penalty", specifically, to "fine".
Usage: amerce, condemn, punish, × surely.
Source: a primitive root;

6068.long:
Meaning: "Anathoth", the name of two Israelites, also of a place in Pal.
Usage: Anathoth.
Source: plural of "H6067";

6069.long:
Meaning: a "Antothite" or inhabitant of Anathoth.
Usage: of Anathoth, Anethothite, Anetothite, Antothite.
Source: or "עַנְּתוֹתִי"; patrial from "H6068";

6070.long:
Meaning: "Anthothijah", an Israelite.
Usage: Antothijah.
Source: from the same as "H6068" and "H3050"; "answers of Jah";

6071.long:
Meaning: "must" or fresh grape-juice (as just "trodden" out).
Usage: juice, new (sweet) wine.
Source: from "H6072";

6072.long:
Meaning: to "squeeze out juice"; figuratively, to "trample".
Usage: tread down.
Source: a primitive root;

6073.long:
Meaning: a "bough" (as covering the tree).
Usage: branch.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "cover";

6075.long:
Meaning: to "swell"; figuratively, "be elated".
Usage: be lifted up, presume.
Source: a primitive root;

6076.long:
Meaning: a "tumor"; also a "mound", i.e. "fortress".
Usage: emerod, fort, strong hold, tower.
Source: from "H6075";

6077.long:
Meaning: "Ophel", a ridge in Jerusalem.
Usage: Ophel.
Source: the same as "H6076";

6078.long:
Meaning: an "Ophnite" (collectively) or inhabitants of Ophen.
Usage: Ophni.
Source: from an unused noun (denoting a place in Palestine; from an unused root of uncertain meaning);

6079.long:
Meaning: an "eyelash" (as fluttering); figuratively, "morning ray".
Usage: dawning, eye-lid.
Source: from "H5774";

6080.long:
Meaning: to "be dust".
Usage: cast (dust).
Source: ; a primitive root; meaning either to be gray or perhaps rather to pulverize; used only as denominative from "H6083",

6081.long:
Meaning: "Epher", the name of an Arabian and of two Israelites.
Usage: Epher.
Source: probably a variation of "H6082"; "gazelle";

6082.long:
Meaning: a "fawn" (from the dusty color).
Usage: young roe (hart).
Source: from "H6080";

6083.long:
Meaning: "dust" (as powdered or gray); hence, "clay", "earth", "mud".
Usage: ashes, dust, earth, ground, morter, powder, rubbish.
Source: from "H6080";

6084.long:
Meaning: "Ophrah", the name of an Israelite and of two places in Palestine.
Usage: Ophrah.
Source: feminine of "H6082"; "female fawn";

6085.long:
Meaning: "Ephron", the name of a Canaanite and of two places in Palestine.
Usage: Ephron, Ephrain (from the margin).
Source: from the same as "H6081"; "fawn-like";

6086.long:
Meaning: a "tree" (from its firmness); hence, "wood" (plural sticks).
Usage: carpenter, gallows, helve, pine, plank, staff, stalk, stick, stock, timber, tree, wood.
Source: from "H6095";

6087.long:
Meaning: properly, to "carve", i.e. "fabricate" or "fashion"; hence (in a bad sense) to "worry", "pain" or "anger".
Usage: displease, grieve, hurt, make, be sorry, vex, worship, wrest.
Source: a primitive root;

6089.long:
Meaning: an "earthen vessel"; usually (painful) "toil"; also a "pang" (whether of body or mind).
Usage: grievous, idol, labor, sorrow.
Source: from "H6087";

6090.long:
Meaning: an "idol" (as fashioned); also "pain" (bodily or mental).
Usage: idol, sorrow, × wicked.
Source: a variation of "H6089";

6094.long:
Meaning: a "idol"; also, a "pain" or "wound".
Usage: sorrow, wound.
Source: from "H6087";

6095.long:
Meaning: properly, to "fasten" (or make firm), i.e. to "close" (the eyes).
Usage: shut.
Source: a primitive root;

6096.long:
Meaning: the "spine" (as giving "firmness" to the body).
Usage: backbone.
Source: from "H6095";

6098.long:
Meaning: "advice"; by implication, "plan"; also "prudence".
Usage: advice, advisement, counsel([-lor]), purpose.
Source: from "H3289";

6099.long:
Meaning: "powerful" (specifically, a paw); by implication, "numerous".
Usage: feeble, great, mighty, must, strong.
Source: or "עָצֻם"; passive participle of "H6105";

6100.long:
Meaning: "Etsjon-Geber", a place on the Red Sea.
Usage: Ezion-geber.
Source: from "H6096" and "H1397"; backbone-like of a man;

6101.long:
Meaning: to "lean idly", i.e. to "be indolent" or "slack".
Usage: be slothful.
Source: a primitive root;

6105.long:
Meaning: to "bind fast", i.e. "close" (the eyes); intransitively, to be (causatively, make) "powerful" or "numerous"; to "crunch the bones".
Usage: break the bones, close, be great, be increased, be (wax) mighty(-ier), be more, shut, be(-come, make) strong(-er).
Source: a primitive root; also denominatively (from "H6106")

6106.long:
Meaning: a "bone" (as "strong"); by extension, the "body"; figuratively, the "substance", i.e. (as pron.) "selfsame".
Usage: body, bone, × life, (self-) same, strength, × very.
Source: from "H6105";

6107.long:
Meaning: "Etsem", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Azem, Ezem.
Source: the same as "H6106"; "bone";

6109.long:
Meaning: "powerfulness"; by extension, "numerousness".
Usage: abundance, strength.
Source: feminine of "H6108";

6111.long:
Meaning: "Atsmon", a place near Palestine.
Usage: Azmon.
Source: or "עַצְמֹן"; from "H6107"; "bone-like";

6112.long:
Meaning: "a spear".
Usage: Eznite (from the margin).
Source: from an unused root meaning to be sharp or strong;

6113.long:
Meaning: to "inclose"; by analogy, to "hold back"; also to "maintain", "rule", "assemble".
Usage: × be able, close up, detain, fast, keep (self close, still), prevail, recover, refrain, × reign, restrain, retain, shut (up), slack, stay, stop, withhold (self).
Source: a primitive root;

6116.long:
Meaning: an "assembly", especially on a "festival" or "holiday".
Usage: (solemn) assembly (meeting).
Source: or "עֲצֶרֶת"; from "H6113";

6117.long:
Meaning: to "seize by the heel"; figuratively, to "circumvent" (as if tripping up the heels); also to "restrain" (as if holding by the heel).
Usage: take by the heel, stay, supplant, × utterly.
Source: a primitive root; properly, to swell out or up; used only as denominative from "H6119",

6118.long:
Meaning: a "heel", i.e. (figuratively) the "last" of anything (used adverbially, for ever); also "result", i.e. "compensation"; and so (adverb with preposition or relatively) "on account of".
Usage: × because, by, end, for, if, reward.
Source: from "H6117" in the sense of "H6119";

6119.long:
Meaning: a "heel" (as protuberant); hence, a "track"; figuratively, the "rear" (of an army).
Usage: heel, (horse-) hoof, last, lier in wait (by mistake for "H6120"), (foot-) step.
Source: or (feminine) "עִקְּבָה"; from "H6117";

6120.long:
Meaning: a "lier in wait".
Usage: heel (by mistake for "H6119").
Source: from "H6117" in its denominative sense;

6121.long:
Meaning: (transitive) "fraudulent" or (intransitive) "tracked".
Usage: crooked, deceitful, polluted.
Source: from "H6117"; in the original sense, a knoll (as swelling up); in the denominative sense

6122.long:
Meaning: "trickery".
Usage: subtilty.
Source: feminine of an unused form from "H6117" meaning a "trick";

6123.long:
Meaning: to "tie with thongs".
Usage: bind.
Source: a primitive root;

6126.long:
Meaning: "Akkub", the name of five Israelites.
Usage: Akkub.
Source: from "H6117"; "insidious";

6130.long:
Meaning: "Akan", an Idummaean.
Usage: Akan. Compare "H3292".
Source: from an unused root meaning to twist; "tortuous";

6131.long:
Meaning: to "pluck" up (especially by the roots); specifically, to "hamstring"; figuratively, to "exterminate".
Usage: dig down, hough, pluck up, root up.
Source: a primitive root;

6132.long:
Usage: pluck up by the roots.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H6131"

6133.long:
Meaning: figuratively, a "transplanted person", i.e. "naturalized citizen".
Usage: stock.
Source: from "H6131";

6134.long:
Meaning: "Eker", an Israelite.
Usage: Eker.
Source: the same as "H6133";

6135.long:
Meaning: "sterile" (as if extirpated in the generative organs).
Usage: (× male or female) barren (woman).
Source: from "H6131";

6137.long:
Meaning: a "scorpion"; figuratively, a "scourge" or "knotted whip".
Usage: scorpion.
Source: of uncertain derivation;

6138.long:
Meaning: "Ekron", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Ekron.
Source: from "H6131"; "eradication";

6139.long:
Meaning: an "Ekronite" or inhabitant of Ekron.
Usage: Ekronite.
Source: or "עֶקְרֹנִי"; patrial from "H6138";

6140.long:
Meaning: to "knot" or "distort"; figuratively, to "pervert" (act or declare perverse).
Usage: make crooked, (prove, that is) perverse(-rt).
Source: a primitive root;

6142.long:
Meaning: "Ikkesh", an Israelite.
Usage: Ikkesh.
Source: the same as "H6141"; "perverse";

6144.long:
Meaning: "Ar", a place in Moab.
Usage: Ar.
Source: the same as "H5892"; a "city";

6145.long:
Meaning: a "foe" (as watchful for mischief).
Usage: enemy.
Source: from "H5782";

6147.long:
Meaning: "Er", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Er.
Source: from "H5782"; "watchful";

6148.long:
Meaning: to "braid", i.e. "intermix"; technically, to "traffic" (as if by barter); also or "give to be security" (as a kind of exchange).
Usage: engage, (inter-) meddle (with), mingle (self), mortgage, occupy, give pledges, be(-come, put in) surety, undertake.
Source: a primitive root;

6149.long:
Meaning: to be "agreeable".
Usage: be pleasant(-ing), take pleasure in, be sweet.
Source: a primitive root (rather identical with "H6148" through the idea of close association);

6150.long:
Meaning: to "grow dusky" at sundown.
Usage: be darkened, (toward) evening.
Source: a primitive root (rather identical with "H6148" through the idea of covering with a texture);

6152.long:
Meaning: "Arab" (i.e. "Arabia"), a country East of Palestine.
Usage: Arabia.
Source: or "עֲרַב"; from "H6150" in the figurative sense of "sterility";

6154.long:
Meaning: the "web" (or transverse threads of cloth); also a "mixture", (or "mongrel" race).
Usage: Arabia, mingled people, mixed (multitude), woof.
Source: or "עֶרֶב"; (1 Kings 10:15), (with the article prefix), from "H6148";

6155.long:
Meaning: a "willow" (from the use of osiers as wattles).
Usage: willow.
Source: from "H6148";

6157.long:
Meaning: a "mosquito" (from its swarming).
Usage: divers sorts of flies, swarm.
Source: from "H6148";

6158.long:
Meaning: a "raven" (from its dusky hue).
Usage: raven.
Source: or "עוֹרֵב"; from "H6150";

6159.long:
Meaning: "Oreb", the name of a Midianite and of the cliff near the Jordan.
Usage: Oreb.
Source: or "עוֹרֵב"; the same as "H6158";

6160.long:
Meaning: a "desert"; especially (with the article prefix) the (generally) sterile valley of the Jordan and its continuation to the Red Sea.
Usage: Arabah, champaign, desert, evening, heaven, plain, wilderness. See also "H1026".
Source: from "H6150" (in the sense of sterility);

6161.long:
Meaning: something "given as security", i.e. (literally) a "token" (of safety) or (metaphorically) a "bondsman".
Usage: pledge, surety.
Source: feminine passive participle of "H6048" in the sense of a bargain or exchange;

6162.long:
Meaning: a "pawn" (given as security).
Usage: pledge.
Source: from "H6148" (in the sense of exchange);

6163.long:
Meaning: an "Arabian" or inhabitant of Arab (i.e. Arabia).
Usage: Arabian.
Source: or "עַרְבִי"; patrial from "H6152";

6164.long:
Meaning: "an Arbathite" or inhabitant of (Beth-) Arabah.
Usage: Arbahite.
Source: patrial from "H1026";

6165.long:
Meaning: to "long for".
Usage: cry, pant.
Source: a primitive root;

6166.long:
Meaning: "Arad", the name of a place near Palestine, also of a Canaanite and an Israelite.
Usage: Arad.
Source: from an unused root meaning to sequester itself; "fugitive";

6168.long:
Meaning: to "be" (causatively, "make") "bare"; hence, to "empty", "pour out", "demolish".
Usage: leave destitute, discover, empty, make naked, pour (out), rase, spread self, uncover.
Source: a primitive root;

6169.long:
Meaning: a "naked" (i.e. level) plot.
Usage: paper reed.
Source: feminine from "H6168";

6170.long:
Meaning: something "piled up" (as if (figuratively) "raised by mental aspiration)", i.e. a "paterre".
Usage: bed, furrow.
Source: or "עֲרֻגָה"; feminine passive participle of "H6165";

6171.long:
Meaning: an "onager" (from his lonesome habits).
Usage: wild ass.
Source: from the same as "H6166";

6172.long:
Meaning: "nudity", literally (especially the pudenda) or figuratively (disgrace, blemish).
Usage: nakedness, shame, unclean(-ness).
Source: from "H6168";

6174.long:
Meaning: "nude", either partially or totally.
Usage: naked.
Source: or "עָרֹם"; from "H6191" (in its original sense);

6175.long:
Meaning: "cunning" (usually in a bad sense).
Usage: crafty, prudent, subtil.
Source: passive participle of "H6191";

6176.long:
Meaning: a "juniper" (from its "nudity" of situation).
Usage: health.
Source: or "עַרְעָר"; from "H6209" reduplicated;

6177.long:
Meaning: "Aroër", the name of three places in or near Palestine.
Usage: Aroer.
Source: or "עֲרֹעֵר"; or "עַרְעוֹר"; the same as "H6176"; "nudity" of situation;

6178.long:
Meaning: "feared", i.e. (concretely) a "horrible place" or "chasm".
Usage: cliffs.
Source: passive participle of "H6206";

6180.long:
Meaning: an "Erite" (collectively) or descendants of Eri.
Usage: Erites.
Source: patronymically of "H6179";

6182.long:
Meaning: "meal".
Usage: dough.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "comminute";

6183.long:
Meaning: the "sky" (as "drooping" at the horizon).
Usage: heaven.
Source: from "H6201";

6184.long:
Meaning: "fearful", i.e. "powerful" or "tyrannical".
Usage: mighty, oppressor, in great power, strong, terrible, violent.
Source: from "H6206";

6186.long:
Meaning: to set in a "row", i.e. "arrange", put in "order" (in a very wide variety of applications).
Usage: put (set) (the battle, self) in array, compare, direct, equal, esteem, estimate, expert (in war), furnish, handle, join (battle), ordain, (lay, put, reckon up, set) (in) order, prepare, tax, value.
Source: a primitive root;

6187.long:
Meaning: a "pile", "equipment", "estimate".
Usage: equal, estimation, (things that are set in) order, price, proportion, × set at, suit, taxation, × valuest.
Source: from "H6186";

6188.long:
Meaning: to "expose" or "remove the prepuce", whether literal (to go naked) or figurative (to refrain from using).
Usage: count uncircumcised, foreskin to be uncovered.
Source: a primitive root; properly, to strip; but used as denominative from "H6189";

6189.long:
Meaning: properly, "exposed", i.e. projecting loose (as to the prepuce); used only technically, "uncircumcised" (i.e. still having the prepuce uncurtailed).
Usage: uncircumcised (person).
Source: from "H6188";

6191.long:
Meaning: properly, to "be" (or "make") "bare"; but used only in the derivative sense (through the idea perhaps of smoothness) to "be cunning" (usually in a bad sense).
Usage: × very, beware, take crafty (counsel), be prudent, deal subtilly.
Source: a primitive root;

6192.long:
Meaning: to "pile" up.
Usage: gather together.
Source: a primitive root;

6194.long:
Meaning: a "heap"; specifically, a "sheaf".
Usage: heap (of corn), sheaf.
Source: (Jeremiah 50:26) or (feminine) "עֲרֵמָה"; from "H6192";

6195.long:
Meaning: "trickery"; or (in a good sense) "discretion".
Usage: guile, prudence, subtilty, wilily, wisdom.
Source: feminine of "H6193";

6196.long:
Meaning: the "plane tree" (from its smooth and shed bark).
Usage: chestnut tree.
Source: probably from "H6191";

6198.long:
Meaning: an "Eranite" or descendant (collectively) of Eran.
Usage: Eranites.
Source: patronymically from "H6197";

6200.long:
Meaning: an "Aroerite" or inhabitant of Aroer.
Usage: Aroerite.
Source: patronymically from "H6177";

6201.long:
Meaning: to "droop"; hence, to "drip".
Usage: drop (down).
Source: a primitive root;

6202.long:
Meaning: to "break the neck"; hence (figuratively) to "destroy".
Usage: that is beheaded, break down, break (cut off, strike off) neck.
Source: a primitive root (identical with through the idea of "slopping"); properly, to "bend" downward; but used only as a denominative from "H6203",

6203.long:
Meaning: the "nape" or back of the neck (as "declining"); hence, the "back" generally (whether literal or figurative).
Usage: back ((stiff-) neck((-ed).
Source: from "H6202";

6205.long:
Meaning: "gloom" (as of a "lowering" sky).
Usage: (gross, thick) dark (cloud, -ness).
Source: probably from "H6201";

6206.long:
Meaning: to "awe" or (intransitive) to "dread"; hence, to "harass".
Usage: be affrighted (afraid, dread, feared, terrified), break, dread, fear, oppress, prevail, shake terribly.
Source: a primitive root;

6207.long:
Meaning: to "gnaw", i.e. (figuratively) "eat" (by hyberbole); also (participle) a "pain".
Usage: fleeing, sinew.
Source: a primitive root;

6208.long:
Meaning: an "Arkite" or inhabitant of Erek.
Usage: Arkite.
Source: patrial from an unused name meaning a tush;

6209.long:
Meaning: to "bare"; figuratively, to "demolish".
Usage: make bare, break, raise up (perhaps by clerical error for raze), × utterly.
Source: a primitive root;

6210.long:
Meaning: a "couch" (properly, with a canopy).
Usage: bed(-stead), couch.
Source: from an unused root meaning perhaps to arch;

6212.long:
Meaning: "grass" (or any tender shoot).
Usage: grass, herb.
Source: from an unused root meaning to glisten (or be green);

6213.long:
Meaning: to "do" or "make", in the broadest sense and widest application.
Usage: accomplish, advance, appoint, apt, be at, become, bear, bestow, bring forth, bruise, be busy, × certainly, have the charge of, commit, deal (with), deck, displease, do, (ready) dress(-ed), (put in) execute(-ion), exercise, fashion, feast, (fight-) ing man, finish, fit, fly, follow, fulfill, furnish, gather, get, go about, govern, grant, great, hinder, hold (a feast), × indeed, be industrious, journey, keep, labour, maintain, make, be meet, observe, be occupied, offer, officer, pare, bring (come) to pass, perform, pracise, prepare, procure, provide, put, requite, × sacrifice, serve, set, shew, × sin, spend, × surely, take, × thoroughly, trim, × very, vex, be (warr-) ior, work(-man), yield, use.
Source: a primitive root;

6214.long:
Meaning: "Asahel", the name of four Israelites.
Usage: Asahel.
Source: from "H6213" and "H410"; "God has made";

6215.long:
Meaning: "Esav", a son of Isaac, including his posterity.
Usage: Esau.
Source: apparently a form of the passive participle of "H6213" in the original sense of handling; "rough" (i.e. sensibly felt);

6217.long:
Meaning: used in plural masculine as abstractly, "tyranny".
Usage: oppressed(-ion). [Doubtful.].
Source: or "עָשֻׁק"; passive participle of "H6231";

6218.long:
Meaning: "ten"; by abbreviated form "ten strings", and so a "decachord".
Usage: (instrument of) ten (strings, -th).
Source: or "עָשֹׂר"; from "H6235";

6221.long:
Meaning: "Asiel", an Israelite.
Usage: Asiel.
Source: from "H6213" and "H410"; "made of God";

6222.long:
Meaning: "Asajah", the name of three or four Israelites.
Usage: Asaiah.
Source: from "H6213" and "H3050"; "Jah has made";

6223.long:
Meaning: "rich", whether literal or figurative ("noble").
Usage: rich (man).
Source: from "H6238";

6224.long:
Meaning: "tenth"; by abbreviation, "tenth month" or (feminine) "part".
Usage: tenth (part).
Source: from "H6235";

6225.long:
Meaning: to "smoke", whether literal or figurative.
Usage: be angry (be on a) smoke.
Source: a primitive root;

6228.long:
Meaning: "Ashan", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Ashan.
Source: the same as "H6227";

6229.long:
Meaning: to "press upon", i.e. "quarrel".
Usage: strive with.
Source: a primitive root (identical with "H6231");

6231.long:
Meaning: to "press upon", i.e. "oppress", "defraud", "violate", "overflow".
Usage: get deceitfully, deceive, defraud, drink up, (use) oppress(-ion), -or), do violence (wrong).
Source: a primitive root (compare "H6229");

6233.long:
Meaning: "injury", "fraud", (subjectively) "distress", (concretely) "unjust gain".
Usage: cruelly, extortion, oppression, thing (deceitfully gotten).
Source: from "H6231";

6235.long:
Meaning: "ten" (as an accumulation to the extent of the digits).
Usage: ten, (fif-, seven-) teen.
Source: masculine of term "עֲשָׂרָה"; from "H6237";

6237.long:
Meaning: to "tithe", i.e. to "take" or "give a tenth".
Usage: × surely, give (take) the tenth, (have, take) tithe(-ing, -s), × truly.
Source: a primitive root (identical with "H6238"); to accumulate; but used only as denominative from "H6235";

6238.long:
Meaning: properly, to "accumulate"; chiefly (specifically) to "grow" (causatively, "make") "rich".
Usage: be(-come, en-, make, make self, wax) rich, make (1 Kings 22:48 marg). See "H6240".
Source: a primitive root;

6240.long:
Meaning: "ten" (only in combination), i.e. "-teen"; also (ordinal) "-teenth".
Usage: (eigh-, fif-, four-, nine-, seven-, six-, thir-) teen(-th), + eleven(-th), + sixscore thousand, + twelve(-th).
Source: for "H6235";

6241.long:
Meaning: (fractional) a "tenth" part.
Usage: tenth deal.
Source: or "עִשָּׂרֹן"; from "H6235";

6244.long:
Meaning: probably to "shrink", i.e. "fail".
Usage: be consumed.
Source: a primitive root;

6245.long:
Meaning: probably to be "sleek", i.e. "glossy"; hence (through the idea of "polishing") to "excogitate" (as if "forming" in the mind).
Usage: shine, think.
Source: a primitive root;

6249.long:
Meaning: "eleven" or (ordinal) "eleventh".
Usage: eleven(-th).
Source: apparently masculine plural construction of "H6247" in the sense of an afterthought (used only in connection with "H6240" in lieu of "H259")

6252.long:
Meaning: "Ashtaroth", the name of a Sidonian deity, and of a place East of the Jordan.
Usage: Asharoth, Astaroth. See also "H1045", "H6253", "H6255".
Source: or "עַשְׁתָּרֹת"; plural of "H6251";

6253.long:
Meaning: "Ashtoreth", the Phoenician goddess of love (and increase).
Usage: Ashtoreth.
Source: probably for "H6251";

6254.long:
Meaning: an "Ashterathite" or inhabitant of Ashtaroth.
Usage: Ashterathite.
Source: patrial from "H6252";

6255.long:
Meaning: "Ashteroth-Karnaim", a place East of the Jordan.
Usage: Ashtoreth Karnaim.
Source: from "H6252" and the dual of "H7161"; Ashtaroth of (the) double horns (a symbol of the deity);

6256.long:
Meaning: "time", especially (adverb with preposition) "now", "when", etc.
Usage: after, (al-) ways, × certain, continually, evening, long, (due) season, so (long) as, (even-, evening-, noon-) tide, (meal-), what) time, when.
Source: from "H5703";

6257.long:
Meaning: to "prepare".
Usage: make fit, be ready to become.
Source: a primitive root;

6258.long:
Meaning: "at this time", whether adverb, conjunction or expletive.
Usage: henceforth, now, straightway, this time, whereas.
Source: from "H6256";

6260.long:
Meaning: "prepared", i.e. "full grown"; spoken only (in plural) of "he-goats", or (figuratively) "leaders" of the people.
Usage: chief one, (he) goat, ram.
Source: or "עַתֻּד"; from "H6257";

6262.long:
Meaning: "Attai", the name of three Israelites.
Usage: Attai.
Source: for "H6261";

6264.long:
Meaning: "prepared"; by implication, "skilful"; feminine plural the "future"; also "treasure".
Usage: things that shall come, ready, treasures.
Source: from "H6257";

6265.long:
Meaning: "Athajah", an Israelite.
Usage: Athaiah.
Source: from "H5790" and "H3050"; "Jah has helped";

6269.long:
Meaning: "Athak", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Athach.
Source: from an unused root meaning to sojourn; "lodging";

6270.long:
Meaning: "Athlai", an Israelite.
Usage: Athlai.
Source: from an unused root meaning to compress; constringent;

6271.long:
Meaning: "Athaljah", the name of an Israelitess and two Israelites.
Usage: Athaliah.
Source: or "עֲתַלְיָהוּ"; from the same as "H6270" and "H3050"; "Jah has constrained";

6272.long:
Meaning: probably to "glow", i.e. (figuratively) "be desolated".
Usage: be darkened.
Source: a primitive root;

6273.long:
Meaning: "Othni", an Israelite.
Usage: Othni.
Source: from an unused root meaning to force; "forcible";

6274.long:
Meaning: "Othniel", an Israelite.
Usage: Othniel.
Source: from the same as "H6273" and "H410"; "force of God";

6275.long:
Meaning: to "remove" (intransitive or transitive) figuratively, to "grow old"; specifically, to "transcribe".
Usage: copy out, leave off, become (wax) old, remove.
Source: a primitive root;

6277.long:
Meaning: "impudent".
Usage: arrogancy, grievous (hard) things, stiff.
Source: from "H6275" in the sense of license;

6278.long:
Meaning: "Eth-Katsin", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Ittahkazin (by including directive enclitic).
Source: from "H6256" and "H7011"; "time of a judge";

6279.long:
Meaning: to "burn incense" in worship, i.e. "intercede" (reciprocally, listen to prayer).
Usage: intreat, (make) pray(-er).
Source: a primitive root (rather denominative from "H6281");

6280.long:
Meaning: to "be" (causatively, "make") "abundant".
Usage: deceitful, multiply.
Source: a primitive root;

6281.long:
Meaning: "Ether", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Ether.
Source: from "H6280"; "abundance";

6282.long:
Meaning: "incense" (as increasing to a "volume" of smoke); hence a "worshipper".
Usage: suppliant, thick.
Source: from "H6280"; also compare "H6279"

6284.long:
Meaning: to "puff", i.e. "blow away".
Usage: scatter into corners.
Source: a primitive root;

6285.long:
Meaning: properly, "mouth" in a figurative sense, i.e. "direction", "region", "extremity".
Usage: corner, end, quarter, side.
Source: feminine of "H6311";

6286.long:
Meaning: to "gleam", i.e. (causatively) "embellish"; figuratively, to "boast"; also to "explain" (i.e. make clear) oneself; to "shake" a tree.
Usage: beautify, boast self, go over the boughs, glorify (self), glory, vaunt self.
Source: a primitive root; also denominative from "H6288",

6287.long:
Meaning: an "embellishment", i.e. fancy "head-dress".
Usage: beauty, bonnet, goodly, ornament, tire.
Source: from "H6286";

6288.long:
Meaning: properly, "ornamentation", i.e. (plural) "foliage" (including the limbs) as "bright green".
Usage: bough, branch, sprig.
Source: or "פֹּרָאה"; or "פֻּארָה"; from "H6286";

6289.long:
Meaning: properly, "illuminated", i.e. a "glow"; as noun, a "flush" (of anxiety).
Usage: blackness.
Source: from "H6286";

6290.long:
Meaning: "Paran", a desert of Arabia.
Usage: Paran.
Source: from "H6286"; "ornamental";

6291.long:
Meaning: "crude"; an "unripe fig".
Usage: green figuratively.
Source: from an unused root meaning to be torpid, i.e.

6292.long:
Meaning: properly, "fetid", i.e. (figuratively) "unclean" (ceremonially).
Usage: abominable(-tion, thing).
Source: or "פִּגֻּל"; from an unused root meaning to "stink";

6293.long:
Meaning: to "impinge", by accident or violence, or (figuratively) by importunity.
Usage: come (betwixt), cause to entreat, fall (upon), make intercession, intercessor, intreat, lay, light (upon), meet (together), pray, reach, run.
Source: a primitive root;

6295.long:
Meaning: "Pagiel", an Israelite.
Usage: Pagiel.
Source: from "H6294" and "H410"; "accident of God";

6296.long:
Meaning: to "relax", i.e. "become exhausted".
Usage: be faint.
Source: a primitive root;

6297.long:
Meaning: a "carcase" (as limp), whether of man or beast; figuratively, an "idolatrous image".
Usage: carcase, corpse, dead body.
Source: from "H6296";

6298.long:
Meaning: to "come in contact with", whether by accident or violence; figuratively, to "concur".
Usage: meet (with, together).
Source: a primitive root;

6299.long:
Meaning: to "sever", i.e. "ransom"; generally to "release", "preserve".
Usage: × at all, deliver, × by any means, ransom, (that are to be, let be) redeem(-ed), rescue, × surely.
Source: a primitive root;

6300.long:
Meaning: "Pedahel", an Israelite.
Usage: Pedahel.
Source: from "H6299" and "H410"; "God has ransomed";

6301.long:
Meaning: "Pedahtsur", an Israelite.
Usage: Pedahzur.
Source: from "H6299" and "H6697"; a "rock" (i.e. God) "has ransomed";

6302.long:
Meaning: as abstractly (in plural masculine) a "ransom".
Usage: (that are) to be (that were) redeemed.
Source: passive participle of "H6299". "ransomed" (and so occurring under "H6299");

6303.long:
Meaning: "Padon", one of the Nethinim.
Usage: Padon.
Source: from "H6299"; "ransom";

6304.long:
Meaning: "distinction"; also "deliverance".
Usage: division, redeem, redemption.
Source: or "פְּדֻת"; from "H6929";

6305.long:
Meaning: "Pedajah", the name of six Israelites.
Usage: Pedaiah.
Source: or "פְּדָיָהוּ"; from "H6299" and "H3050"; "Jah has ransomed";

6306.long:
Meaning: a "ransom".
Usage: ransom, that were redeemed, redemption.
Source: or "פִּדְיֹם"; also "פִּדְיוֹן"; or "פִּדְיֹן"; from "H6299";

6307.long:
Meaning: "Paddan" or "Paddan-Aram", a region of Syria.
Usage: Padan, Padan-aram.
Source: from an unused root meaning to extend; a plateau; or "פַּדַּן אֲרָם"; from the same and "H758"; the table-land of Aram;

6309.long:
Meaning: "suet".
Usage: fat.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "be greasy";

6310.long:
Meaning: the "mouth" (as the means of "blowing"), whether literal or figurative (particularly "speech"); specifically "edge", "portion" or "side"; adverbially (with preposition) "according to".
Usage: accord(-ing as, -ing to), after, appointment, assent, collar, command(-ment), × eat, edge, end, entry, file, hole, × in, mind, mouth, part, portion, × (should) say(-ing), sentence, skirt, sound, speech, × spoken, talk, tenor, × to, two-edged, wish, word.
Source: from "H6284";

6311.long:
Meaning: "this place" (French ici), i.e. "here" or hence.
Usage: here, hither, the one (other, this, that) side.
Source: or "פֹּא"; (Job 38:11), or "פּוֹ"; probably from a primitive inseparable particle 'p' (of demonstrative force) and "H1931";

6312.long:
Meaning: "Puah" or "Puvvah", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Phuvah, Pua, Puah.
Source: or "פֻּוָּה"; from "H6284"; a "blast";

6313.long:
Meaning: to "be sluggish".
Usage: cease, be feeble, faint, be slacked.
Source: a primitive root;

6315.long:
Meaning: to "puff", i.e. "blow with the breath" or "air"; hence, to "fan" (as a breeze), to "utter", to "kindle" (a fire), to "scoff".
Usage: blow (upon), break, puff, bring into a snare, speak, utter.
Source: a primitive root;

6316.long:
Meaning: "Put", a son of Ham, also the name of his descendants or their region, and of a Persian tribe.
Usage: Phut, Put.
Source: of foreign origin;

6317.long:
Meaning: "Putiel", an Israelite.
Usage: Putiel.
Source: from an unused root (probably meaning to disparage) and "H410"; "contempt of God";

6318.long:
Meaning: "Potiphar", an Egyptian.
Usage: Potiphar.
Source: of Egyptian derivation;

6319.long:
Meaning: "Poti-Phera", an Egyptian.
Usage: Poti-pherah.
Source: of Egyptian derivation;

6320.long:
Meaning: "dye" (specifically, stibium for the eyes).
Usage: fair colours, glistering, paint(-ed) (-ing).
Source: from an unused root meaning to "paint";

6321.long:
Meaning: a "bean" (as plump).
Usage: beans.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "be thick";

6322.long:
Meaning: "Pul", the name of an Assyrian king and of an Ethiopian tribe.
Usage: Pul.
Source: of foreign origin;

6323.long:
Meaning: meaning to "turn", i.e. "be perplexed".
Usage: be distracted.
Source: a primitive root

6324.long:
Meaning: a "Punite" (collectively) or descendants of an unknown Pun.
Usage: Punites.
Source: patronymically from an unused name meaning a "turn";

6325.long:
Meaning: "Punon", a place in the Desert.
Usage: Punon.
Source: from "H6323"; "perplexity";

6326.long:
Meaning: "Puah", an Israelitess.
Usage: Puah.
Source: from an unused root meaning to glitter; "brilliancy";

6327.long:
Meaning: to "dash" in pieces, literally or figuratively (especially to "disperse").
Usage: break (dash, shake) in (to) pieces, cast (abroad), disperse (selves), drive, retire, scatter (abroad), spread abroad.
Source: a primitive root;

6328.long:
Meaning: to "waver".
Usage: stumble, move.
Source: a primitive root;

6329.long:
Meaning: to "issue", i.e. "furnish"; causatively, to "secure"; figuratively, to "succeed".
Usage: afford, draw out, further, get, obtain.
Source: a primitive root [rather identical with "H6328" through the idea of "dropping" out; compare "H5312"];

6331.long:
Meaning: to "crush".
Usage: break, bring to nought, × utterly take.
Source: a primitive root;

6332.long:
Meaning: a "lot" (as by means of a broken piece).
Usage: Pur, Purim.
Source: also (plural) "פּוּרִים"; or "פֻּרִים"; from "H6331";

6334.long:
Meaning: "Poratha", a son of Haman.
Usage: Poratha.
Source: of Persian origin;

6335.long:
Meaning: to "spread"; figuratively, "act proudly".
Usage: grow up, be grown fat, spread selves, be scattered.
Source: a primitive root;

6336.long:
Meaning: a "Puthite" (collectively) or descendants of an unknown Puth.
Usage: Puhites (as if from "H6312").
Source: patronymically from an unused name meaning a "hinge";

6337.long:
Meaning: "pure" (gold); hence, "gold" itself (as refined).
Usage: fine (pure) gold.
Source: from "H6338";

6339.long:
Meaning: to "solidify" (as if by refining); also to "spring" (as if separating the limbs).
Usage: leap, be made strong.
Source: a primitive root (identical with "H6338");

6340.long:
Meaning: to "scatter", whether in enmity or bounty.
Usage: disperse, scatter (abroad).
Source: a primitive root;

6341.long:
Meaning: a (metallic) "sheet" (as pounded thin); also a "spring net" (as spread out like a lamina).
Usage: gin, (thin) plate, snare.
Source: from "H6351";

6342.long:
Meaning: to "be startled" (by a sudden alarm); hence, to "fear" in general.
Usage: be afraid, stand in awe, (be in) fear, make to shake.
Source: a primitive root;

6343.long:
Meaning: a (sudden) "alarm" (properly, the object feared, by implication, the feeling).
Usage: dread(-ful), fear, (thing) great (fear, -ly feared), terror.
Source: from "H6342";

6344.long:
Meaning: a "testicle" (as a cause of shame akin to fear).
Usage: stone.
Source: the same as "H6343";

6346.long:
Meaning: a "prefect" (of a city or small district).
Usage: captain, deputy, governor.
Source: of foreign origin;

6348.long:
Meaning: to "bubble up" or "froth" (as boiling water), i.e. (figuratively) to "be unimportant".
Usage: light.
Source: a primitive root;

6351.long:
Meaning: to "spread a net".
Usage: be snared.
Source: a primitive root; to batter out; but used only as denominative from "H6341",

6352.long:
Meaning: a "coal", whether charred or live.
Usage: coals.
Source: perhaps from an unused root probably meaning to "be black";

6353.long:
Meaning: a "potter".
Usage: potter.
Source: (Aramaic) from an unused root probably meaning to fashion;

6354.long:
Meaning: a "pit", especially for catching animals.
Usage: hole, pit, snare.
Source: probably from an unused root apparently meaning to "dig";

6355.long:
Meaning: "Pachath-Moab", an Israelite.
Usage: Pahathmoab.
Source: from "H6354" and "H4124"; "pit of Moab";

6356.long:
Meaning: a "hole" (by mildew in a garment).
Usage: fret inward.
Source: from the same as "H6354";

6357.long:
Meaning: a "gem", probably the "topaz".
Usage: topaz.
Source: of foreign derivation;

6358.long:
Meaning: "opened", i.e. (as noun) "a bud".
Usage: open.
Source: passive participle of "H6362";

6360.long:
Meaning: a "hammer".
Usage: hammer.
Source: intensively from an unused root meaning to "pound";

6361.long:
Meaning: a "gown" (as if hammered out wide).
Usage: hose.
Source: (Aramaic) from a root corresponding to that of "H6360";

6362.long:
Meaning: to "cleave" or "burst through", i.e. (causatively) to "emit", whether literal or figurative (gape).
Usage: dismiss, free, let (shoot) out, slip away.
Source: a primitive root;

6363.long:
Meaning: a "fissure", i.e. (concretely) "firstling" (as opening the matrix).
Usage: firstling, openeth, such as open.
Source: or "פִּטְרָה"; from "H6362";

6364.long:
Meaning: "Pi-Beseth", a place in Egypt.
Usage: Pi-beseth.
Source: of Egyptian origin;

6365.long:
Meaning: (figuratively) "misfortune".
Usage: destruction, ruin.
Source: from an unused root probably meaning to "pierce";

6367.long:
Meaning: "Pi-ha-Chiroth", a place in Egypt.
Usage: Pi-hahiroth. (In Numbers 14:19 without Pi-.).
Source: from "H6310" and the feminine plural of a noun (from the same root as "H2356"), with the article interpolated; "mouth of the gorges";

6368.long:
Meaning: a "powder" (as easily puffed away), i.e. "ashes" or "dust".
Usage: ashes.
Source: from "H6315";

6369.long:
Meaning: "Picol", a Philistine.
Usage: Phichol.
Source: apparently from "H6310" and "H3605"; "mouth of all";

6370.long:
Meaning: a "concubine"; also (masculine) a "paramour".
Usage: concubine, paramour.
Source: or "פִּלֶגֶשׁ"; of uncertain derivation;

6371.long:
Meaning: "obesity".
Usage: collops.
Source: probably from an unused root meaning to "be plump";

6372.long:
Meaning: "Pinechas", the name of three Israelites.
Usage: Phinehas.
Source: apparently from "H6310" and a variation of "H5175"; mouth of a serpent;

6373.long:
Meaning: "Pinon", an Idumaean.
Usage: Pinon.
Source: probably the same as "H6325";

6376.long:
Meaning: "Pishon", a river of Eden.
Usage: Pison.
Source: from "H6335"; "dispersive";

6377.long:
Meaning: "Pithon", an Israelite.
Usage: Pithon.
Source: probably from the same as "H6596"; "expansive";

6378.long:
Meaning: a "flask" (from which a liquid may flow).
Usage: box, vial.
Source: from "H6379";

6379.long:
Meaning: to "pour".
Usage: run out.
Source: a primitive root;

6380.long:
Meaning: "Pokereth-Tsebajim", one of the 'servants of Solomon'.
Usage: Pochereth of Zebaim.
Source: from the active participle (of the same form as the first word) feminine of an unused root (meaning to entrap) and plural of "H6643"; "trap of gazelles";

6381.long:
Meaning: properly, perhaps to "separate", i.e. "distinguish" (literally or figuratively); by implication, to "be" (causatively, "make") "great", "difficult", "wonderful".
Usage: accomplish, (arise...too, be too) hard, hidden, things too high, (be, do, do a, shew) marvelous(-ly, -els, things, work), miracles, perform, separate, make singular, (be, great, make) wonderful(-ers, -ly, things, works), wondrous (things, works, -ly).
Source: a primitive root;

6384.long:
Meaning: a "Palluite" (collectively) or descendants of Pallu.
Usage: Palluites.
Source: patronymically from "H6396";

6385.long:
Meaning: to "split" (literally or figuratively).
Usage: divide.
Source: a primitive root;

6388.long:
Meaning: a "rill" (i.e. small channel of water, as in irrigation).
Usage: river, stream.
Source: from "H6385";

6389.long:
Meaning: "Peleg", a son of Shem.
Usage: Peleg.
Source: the same as "H6388"; "earthquake";

6393.long:
Meaning: a "cleaver", i.e. "iron armature" (of a chariot).
Usage: torch.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "divide";

6394.long:
Meaning: "Pildash", a relative of Abraham.
Usage: Pildash.
Source: of uncertain derivation;

6395.long:
Meaning: to "distinguish" (literally or figuratively).
Usage: put a difference, show marvellous, separate, set apart, sever, make wonderfully.
Source: a primitive root;

6397.long:
Meaning: a "Pelonite" or inhabitant of an unknown Palon.
Usage: Pelonite.
Source: patronymically from an unused name (from "H6395") meaning "separate";

6398.long:
Meaning: to "slice", i.e. "break open" or "pierce".
Usage: bring forth, cleave, cut, shred, strike through.
Source: a primitive root;

6399.long:
Meaning: to "serve" or "worship".
Usage: minister, serve.
