Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H6398";

6403.long:
Meaning: to "slip" out, i.e. "escape"; causatively, to "deliver".
Usage: calve, carry away safe, deliver, (cause to) escape.
Source: a primitive root;

6404.long:
Meaning: "Pelet", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Pelet. See also "H1046".
Source: from "H6403"; "escape";

6406.long:
Meaning: "Palti", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Palti, Phalti.
Source: from "H6403"; "delivered";

6407.long:
Meaning: "a Paltite" or descendant of Palti.
Usage: Paltite.
Source: patronymically from "H6406";

6409.long:
Meaning: "Paltiel", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Paltiel, Phaltiel.
Source: from the same as "H6404" and "H410"; "deliverance of God";

6410.long:
Meaning: "Pelatjah", the name of four Israelites.
Usage: Pelatiah.
Source: or "פְּלַטְיָהוּ"; from "H6403" and "H3050"; "Jah has delivered";

6411.long:
Meaning: "Pelajah", the name of three Israelites.
Usage: Pelaiah.
Source: or "פְּלָאיָה"; from "H6381" and "H3050"; "Jah has distinguished";

6412.long:
Meaning: a "refugee".
Usage: (that have) escape(-d, -th), fugitive.
Source: or "פָּלֵיט"; or "פָּלֵט"; from "H6403";

6413.long:
Meaning: "deliverance"; concretely, an "escaped" portion.
Usage: deliverance, (that is) escape(-d), remnant.
Source: or "פְּלֵטָה"; feminine of "H6412";

6418.long:
Meaning: a "circuit" (i.e. district); also a "spindle" (as whirled); hence, a "crutch".
Usage: (di-) staff, participle.
Source: from an unused root meaning to be round;

6419.long:
Meaning: to "judge" (officially or mentally); by extension, to "intercede", "pray".
Usage: intreat, judge(-ment), (make) pray(-er, -ing), make supplication.
Source: a primitive root;

6421.long:
Meaning: "Pelaljah", an Israelite.
Usage: Pelaliah.
Source: from "H6419" and "H3050"; "Jah has judged";

6422.long:
Meaning: "a certain one", i.e. "so-and-so".
Usage: certain.
Source: probably for "H6423";

6423.long:
Meaning: "such" a one, i.e. a specified "person".
Usage: such.
Source: from "H6395";

6424.long:
Meaning: properly, to "roll flat", i.e. "prepare" (a road); also to "revolve", i.e. "weigh" (mentally).
Usage: make, ponder, weigh.
Source: a primitive root;

6426.long:
Meaning: properly, perhaps to "rend", i.e. (by implication) to "quiver".
Usage: tremble.
Source: a primitive root;

6428.long:
Meaning: to "roll" (in dust).
Usage: roll (wallow) self.
Source: a primitive root;

6429.long:
Meaning: "Pelesheth", a region of Syria.
Usage: Palestina, Palestine, Philistia, Philistines.
Source: from "H6428"; "rolling", i.e. "migratory";

6430.long:
Meaning: a "Pelishtite" or inhabitant of Pelesheth.
Usage: Philistine.
Source: patrial from "H6429";

6431.long:
Meaning: "Peleth", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Peleth.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "flee"; "swiftness";

6432.long:
Meaning: a "courier" (collectively) or "official messenger".
Usage: Pelethites.
Source: from the same form as "H6431";

6433.long:
Meaning: the "mouth" (literally or figuratively).
Usage: mouth.
Source: (Aramaic) probably for "H6310";

6434.long:
Meaning: an "angle" (of a street or wall).
Usage: corner.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "turn";

6435.long:
Meaning: properly, "removal"; used only (in the construction) adverb as conjunction, "lest".
Usage: (lest) (peradventure), that...not.
Source: from "H6437";

6437.long:
Meaning: to "turn"; by implication, to "face", i.e. "appear", "look", etc.
Usage: appear, at (even-) tide, behold, cast out, come on, × corner, dawning, empty, go away, lie, look, mark, pass away, prepare, regard, (have) respect (to), (re-) turn (aside, away, back, face, self), × right (early).
Source: a primitive root;

6438.long:
Meaning: an "angle"; by implication, a "pinnacle"; figuratively, a "chieftain".
Usage: bulwark, chief, corner, stay, tower.
Source: feminine of "H6434";

6439.long:
Meaning: "Penuel" or "Peniel", a place East of Jordan; also (as Penuel) the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Peniel, Penuel.
Source: or (more properly,) "פְּנִיאֵל"; from "H6437" and "H410"; "face of God";

6440.long:
Meaning: the "face" (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition ("before", etc.).
Usage: accept, a-(be-) fore(-time), against, anger, × as (long as), at, battle, because (of), beseech, countenance, edge, employ, endure, enquire, face, favour, fear of, for, forefront(-part), form(-er time, -ward), from, front, heaviness, × him(-self), honourable, impudent, in, it, look(-eth) (-s), × me, meet, × more than, mouth, of, off, (of) old (time), × on, open, out of, over against, the partial, person, please, presence, propect, was purposed, by reason of, regard, right forth, serve, × shewbread, sight, state, straight, street, × thee, × them(-selves), through ( -out), till, time(-s) past, (un-) to(-ward), upon, upside ( down), with(-in, -stand), × ye, × you.
Source: plural (but always as singular) of an unused noun "פָּנֶה"; from "H6437");

6441.long:
Meaning: "faceward", i.e. "indoors".
Usage: (with-) in(-ner part, -ward).
Source: from "H6440" with directive enclitic;

6443.long:
Meaning: probably a "pearl" (as round).
Usage: ruby.
Source: or "פָּנִי"; from the same as "H6434";

6444.long:
Meaning: "Peninnah", an Israelitess.
Usage: Peninnah.
Source: probably feminine from "H6443" contr.;

6445.long:
Meaning: to "enervate".
Usage: bring up.
Source: a primitive root;

6446.long:
Meaning: a "long and sleeved tunic" (perhaps simply a wide one; from the original sense of the root, i.e. of many breadths).
Usage: (divers) colours.
Source: from "H6461"; properly, the palm (of the hand) or sole (of the foot) (compare "H6447"); by implication (plural)

6447.long:
Meaning: the "palm" (of the hand, as being spread out).
Usage: participle.
Source: (Aramaic) from a root corresponding to "H6461";

6448.long:
Meaning: to "cut up", i.e. (figuratively) "contemplate".
Usage: consider.
Source: a primitive root;

6449.long:
Meaning: "Pisgah", a Mountain East of Jordan.
Usage: Pisgah.
Source: from "H6448"; a "cleft";

6450.long:
Meaning: "Pas-Dammim", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Pas-dammim. Compare "H658".
Source: from "H6446" and the plural of "H1818"; palm (i.e. dell) of bloodshed;

6452.long:
Meaning: to "hop", i.e. (figuratively) "skip over" (or spare); by implication, to "hesitate"; also (literally) to "limp", to "dance".
Usage: halt, become lame, leap, pass over.
Source: a primitive root;

6453.long:
Meaning: a "pretermission", i.e. "exemption"; used only techically of the Jewish "Passover" (the festival or the victim).
Usage: passover (offering).
Source: from "H6452";

6454.long:
Meaning: "Paseach", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Paseah, Phaseah.
Source: from "H6452"; "limping";

6457.long:
Meaning: "Pasak", an Israelite.
Usage: Pasach.
Source: from an unused root meaning to divide; "divider";

6458.long:
Meaning: to "carve", whether wood or stone.
Usage: grave, hew.
Source: a primitive root;

6460.long:
Meaning: "psalterion"; a "lyre".
Usage: psaltery.
Source: (Aramaic) or "פְּסַנְתֵּרִין"; a transliteration of the Greek,

6461.long:
Meaning: probably to "disperse", i.e. (intransitive) "disappear".
Usage: cease.
Source: a primitive root;

6464.long:
Meaning: "Pau" or "Pai", a place in Edom.
Usage: Pai, Pau.
Source: or "פָּעִי"; from "H6463"; "screaming";

6465.long:
Meaning: "Peör", a mountain East of Jordan; Baal Peor, (for a deity worshipped there.
Usage: Peor. See also "H1047".
Source: from "H6473"; a "gap"; also "H1187")

6466.long:
Meaning: to "do" or "make" (systematically and habitually), especially to "practise".
Usage: commit, (evil-) do(-er), make(-r), ordain, work(-er).
Source: a primitive root;

6467.long:
Meaning: an "act" or "work" (concretely).
Usage: act, deed, do, getting, maker, work.
Source: from "H6466";

6468.long:
Meaning: (abstractly) "work".
Usage: labour, reward, wages, work.
Source: feminine passive participle of "H6466";

6470.long:
Meaning: to "tap", i.e. "beat regularly"; hence (generally) to "impel" or "agitate".
Usage: move, trouble.
Source: a primitive root;

6471.long:
Meaning: a "stroke", literally or figuratively (in various applications, as follow).
Usage: anvil, corner, foot(-step), going, (hundred-) fold, × now, (this) once, order, rank, step, thrice, (often-), second, this, two) time(-s), twice, wheel.
Source: or (feminine) "פַּעֲמָה"; from "H6470";

6473.long:
Meaning: to "yawn", i.e. "open" wide (literally or figuratively).
Usage: gape, open (wide).
Source: a primitive root;

6475.long:
Meaning: to "rend", i.e. "open" (especially the mouth).
Usage: deliver, gape, open, rid, utter.
Source: a primitive root;

6476.long:
Meaning: to "break" out (in joyful sound).
Usage: break (forth, forth into joy), make a loud noise.
Source: a primitive root;

6480.long:
Meaning: to "rend" (by earthquake).
Usage: break.
Source: a primitive root;

6481.long:
Meaning: to "split", i.e. "wound".
Usage: wound.
Source: a primitive root;

6483.long:
Meaning: "Pitstsets", a priest.
Usage: Apses (including the article).
Source: from an unused root meaning to dissever; "dispersive";

6484.long:
Meaning: to "peck at", i.e. (figuratively) "stun" or "dull".
Usage: press, urge, stubbornness.
Source: a primitive root;

6485.long:
Meaning: to "visit" (with friendly or hostile intent); by analogy, to "oversee", "muster", "charge", "care for", "miss", "deposit", etc.
Usage: appoint, × at all, avenge, bestow, (appoint to have the, give a) charge, commit, count, deliver to keep, be empty, enjoin, go see, hurt, do judgment, lack, lay up, look, make, × by any means, miss, number, officer, (make) overseer, have (the) oversight, punish, reckon, (call to) remember(-brance), set (over), sum, × surely, visit, want.
Source: a primitive root;

6486.long:
Meaning: "visitation" (in many senses, chiefly official).
Usage: account, (that have the) charge, custody, that which...laid up, numbers, office(-r), ordering, oversight, prison, reckoning, visitation.
Source: feminine passive participle of "H6485";

6487.long:
Meaning: a "deposit".
Usage: that which was delivered (to keep), store.
Source: from "H6485";

6489.long:
Meaning: "Pekod", a symbolic name for Babylon.
Usage: Pekod.
Source: from "H6485"; "punishment";

6490.long:
Meaning: properly, "appointed", i.e. a "mandate" (of God; plural only, collectively, for the Law).
Usage: commandment, precept, statute.
Source: or "פִּקֻּד"; from "H6485";

6491.long:
Meaning: to "open" (the senses, especially the eyes); figuratively, to "be observant".
Usage: open.
Source: a primitive root;

6494.long:
Meaning: "Pekachjah", an Israelite king.
Usage: Pekahiah.
Source: from "H6491" and "H3050"; "Jah has observed";

6495.long:
Meaning: "opening" (of a dungeon), i.e. "jail-delivery" (figuratively, "salvation" for sin).
Usage: opening of the prison.
Source: from "H6491" redoubled;

6496.long:
Meaning: a "superintendent" (civil, military or religious).
Usage: which had the charge, governor, office, overseer, (that) was set.
Source: from "H6485";

6497.long:
Meaning: a "semi-globe".
Usage: knop.
Source: from an unused root meaning to burst; only used as an architectural term of an ornament similar to "H6498",

6498.long:
Meaning: the "wild cucumber" (from splitting open to shed its seeds).
Usage: gourd.
Source: from the same as "H6497";

6499.long:
Meaning: a "bullock" (apparently as "breaking" forth in wild strength, or perhaps as "dividing" the hoof).
Usage: ( young) bull(-ock), calf, ox.
Source: or "פָּר"; from "H6565";

6500.long:
Meaning: to "bear fruit".
Usage: be fruitful.
Source: a primitive root;

6501.long:
Meaning: the "onager".
Usage: wild (ass).
Source: or "פֶּרֶה"; (Jeremiah 2:24), from "H6500" in the secondary sense of running wild;

6503.long:
Meaning: "Parbar" or "Parvar", a quarter of Jerusalem.
Usage: Parbar, suburb.
Source: or "פַּרְוָר"; of foreign origin;

6504.long:
Meaning: to "break through", i.e. "spread" or "separate" (oneself).
Usage: disperse, divide, be out of joint, part, scatter (abroad), separate (self), sever self, stretch, sunder.
Source: a primitive root;

6505.long:
Meaning: a "mule" (perhaps from his "lonely" habits).
Usage: mule.
Source: from "H6504";

6507.long:
Meaning: something "separated", i.e. a "kernel".
Usage: seed.
Source: feminine passive participle of "H6504";

6508.long:
Meaning: a "park".
Usage: forest, orchard.
Source: of foreign origin;

6509.long:
Meaning: to "bear fruit" (literally or figuratively).
Usage: bear, bring forth (fruit), (be, cause to be, make) fruitful, grow, increase.
Source: a primitive root;

6510.long:
Meaning: a "heifer".
Usage: cow, heifer, kine.
Source: feminine of "H6499";

6511.long:
Meaning: "Parah", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Parah.
Source: the same as "H6510";

6512.long:
Meaning: a "hole" (as "broken", i.e. dug).
Usage: + mole. Compare "H2661".
Source: from "H6331";

6514.long:
Meaning: "Peruda" or "Perida", one of 'Solomon's servants'.
Usage: Perida, Peruda.
Source: or "פְּרִידָא"; from "H6504"; "dispersion";

6515.long:
Meaning: "Paruach", an Israelite.
Usage: Paruah.
Source: passive participle of "H6524"; "blossomed";

6516.long:
Meaning: "Parvajim", an Oriental region.
Usage: Parvaim.
Source: of foreign origin;

6517.long:
Meaning: "a skillet" (as "flat" or "deep").
Usage: pan, pot.
Source: passive participle of "H6565" in the sense of "spreading" out (compare "H6524");

6518.long:
Meaning: a "chieftain".
Usage: village.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "separate", i.e. "decide";

6519.long:
Meaning: an "open country".
Usage: (unwalled) town (without walls), unwalled village.
Source: from the same as "H6518";

6520.long:
Meaning: "magistracy", i.e. "leadership" (also concretely, chieftains).
Usage: village.
Source: from the same as "H6518";

6522.long:
Meaning: a "Perizzite", one of the Canaanitish tribes.
Usage: Perizzite.
Source: for "H6521"; inhabitant of the open country;

6524.long:
Meaning: to "break forth" as a bud, i.e. "bloom"; generally, to "spread"; specifically, to "fly" (as extending the wings); figuratively, to "flourish".
Usage: × abroad, × abundantly, blossom, break forth (out), bud, flourish, make fly, grow, spread, spring (up).
Source: a primitive root;

6525.long:
Meaning: a "calyx" (natural or artificial); generally, "bloom".
Usage: blossom, bud, flower.
Source: from "H6524";

6527.long:
Meaning: to "scatter words", i.e. "prate" (or hum).
Usage: chant.
Source: a primitive root;

6530.long:
Meaning: "violent", i.e. a "tyrant".
Usage: destroyer, ravenous, robber.
Source: from "H6555";

6531.long:
Meaning: "fracture", i.e. "severity".
Usage: cruelty, rigour.
Source: from an unused root meaning to break apart;

6532.long:
Meaning: a "separatrix", i.e. (the sacred) "screen".
Usage: vail.
Source: feminine active participle of the same as "H6531";

6534.long:
Meaning: "Parmashta", a son of Haman.
Usage: Parmasta.
Source: of Persian origin;

6535.long:
Meaning: "Parnak", an Israelite.
Usage: Parnach.
Source: of uncertain derivation;

6536.long:
Meaning: to "break" in pieces, i.e. (usually without violence) to "split", "distribute".
Usage: deal, divide, have hoofs, part, tear.
Source: a primitive root;

6537.long:
Meaning: to "split up".
Usage: divide, (U-) pharsin.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H6536";

6538.long:
Meaning: a "claw"; also a "kind of eagle".
Usage: claw, ossifrage.
Source: from "H6536";

6539.long:
Meaning: "Paras" (i.e. Persia), an Eastern country, including its inhabitants.
Usage: Persia, Persians.
Source: of foreign origin;

6541.long:
Meaning: a "claw" or split "hoof".
Usage: claw, (cloven-) footed, hoof.
Source: feminine of "H6538";

6542.long:
Meaning: a "Parsite" (i.e. Persian), or inhabitant of Peres.
Usage: Persian.
Source: patrial from "H6539";

6544.long:
Meaning: to "loosen"; by implication, to "expose", "dismiss"; figuratively, "absolve", "begin".
Usage: avenge, avoid, bare, go back, let, (make) naked, set at nought, perish, refuse, uncover.
Source: a primitive root;

6546.long:
Meaning: "leadership" (plural concretely, leaders).
Usage: avenging, revenge.
Source: feminine of "H6545" (in the sense of beginning);

6547.long:
Meaning: "Paroh", a general title of Egyptian kings.
Usage: Pharaoh.
Source: of Egyptian derivation;

6548.long:
Meaning: "Paroh-Chophra", an Egyptian king.
Usage: Pharaoh-hophra.
Source: of Egyptian derivation;

6549.long:
Meaning: "Paroh-Nekoh" (or -Neko), an Egyptian king.
Usage: Pharaoh-necho, Pharaohnechoh.
Source: or "פַּרְעֹה נְכוֹ"; of Egyptian derivation;

6550.long:
Meaning: a "flea" (as the isolated insect).
Usage: flea.
Source: probably from "H6544" and "H6211";

6551.long:
Meaning: "Parosh", the name of our Israelite.
Usage: Parosh, Pharosh.
Source: the same as "H6550";

6552.long:
Meaning: "Pirathon", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Pirathon.
Source: from "H6546"; "chieftaincy";

6553.long:
Meaning: a "Pirathonite" or inhabitant of Pirathon.
Usage: Pirathonite.
Source: or "פִּרְעָתֹנִי"; patrial from "H6552";

6554.long:
Meaning: "Parpar", a river of Syria.
Usage: Pharpar.
Source: probably from "H6565" in the sense of rushing; "rapid";

6555.long:
Meaning: to "break" out (in many applications, direct and indirect, literal and figurative).
Usage: × abroad, (make a) breach, break (away, down, -er, forth, in, up), burst out, come (spread) abroad, compel, disperse, grow, increase, open, press, scatter, urge.
Source: a primitive root;

6556.long:
Meaning: a "break" (literally or figuratively).
Usage: breach, breaking forth (in), × forth, gap.
Source: from "H6555";

6557.long:
Meaning: "Perets", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Perez, Pharez.
Source: the same as "H6556";

6558.long:
Meaning: a "Partsite" (collectively) or descendants of Perets.
Usage: Pharzites.
Source: patronymically from "H6557";

6559.long:
Meaning: "Peratsim", a mountain in Palestine.
Usage: Perazim.
Source: plural of "H6556"; "breaks";

6560.long:
Meaning: "Perets-Uzza", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Perezuzza.
Source: from "H6556" and "H5798"; break of Uzza;

6561.long:
Meaning: to "break off" or "crunch"; figuratively, to "deliver".
Usage: break (off), deliver, redeem, rend (in pieces), tear in pieces.
Source: a primitive root;

6563.long:
Meaning: "rapine"; also a "fork" (in roads).
Usage: crossway, robbery.
Source: from "H6561";

6564.long:
Meaning: "soup" (as full of "crumbed" meat).
Usage: broth. See also "H4832".
Source: from "H6561";

6565.long:
Meaning: to "break up" (usually figuratively), i.e. to "violate", "frustrate".
Usage: × any ways, break (asunder), cast off, cause to cease, × clean, defeat, disannul, disappoint, dissolve, divide, make of none effect, fail, frustrate, bring (come) to nought, × utterly, make void.
Source: a primitive root;

6566.long:
Meaning: to "break" apart, "disperse", etc.
Usage: break, chop in pieces, lay open, scatter, spread (abroad, forth, selves, out), stretch (forth, out).
Source: a primitive root;

6567.long:
Meaning: to "separate", literally (to disperse) or figuratively (to specify); also (by implication) to "wound".
Usage: scatter, declare, distinctly, shew, sting.
Source: a primitive root;

6570.long:
Meaning: "Peresh", an Israelite.
Usage: Peresh.
Source: the same as "H6569";

6571.long:
Meaning: a "steed" (as stretched out to a vehicle, not single nor for mounting ); also (by implication) a "driver" (in a chariot), i.e. (collectively) "cavalry".
Usage: horseman.
Source: from "H6567"; (compare "H5483")

6572.long:
Meaning: a "transcript".
Usage: copy.
Source: or "פַּתְשֶׁגֶן"; of foreign origin;

6574.long:
Meaning: the "crotch" (or anus).
Usage: dirt.
Source: perhaps by compounding "H6567" and "H6504" (in the sense of straddling) (compare "H6576");

6576.long:
Meaning: to "expand".
Usage: spread.
Source: a root apparently formed by compounding "H6567" and that of "H6518" (compare "H6574");

6577.long:
Meaning: "Parshandatha", a son of Haman.
Usage: Parshandatha.
Source: of Persian origin;

6578.long:
Meaning: "Perath" (i.e. Euphrates), a river of the East.
Usage: Euphrates.
Source: from an unused root meaning to break forth; rushing;

6579.long:
Meaning: a "grandee".
Usage: (most) noble, prince.
Source: of Persian origin;

6580.long:
Meaning: "stupidity" (as a result of grossness or of degeneracy).
Usage: extremity.
Source: probably from an unused root meaning to "disintegrate";

6582.long:
Meaning: to "tear in pieces".
Usage: pull in pieces.
Source: a primitive root;

6583.long:
Meaning: "Pashchur", the name of four Israelites.
Usage: Pashur.
Source: probably from "H6582"; "liberation";

6584.long:
Meaning: to "spread out" (i.e. deploy in hostile array); by analogy, to "strip" (i.e. unclothe, plunder, flay, etc.).
Usage: fall upon, flay, invade, make an invasion, pull off, put off, make a road, run upon, rush, set, spoil, spread selves (abroad), strip (off, self).
Source: a primitive root;

6585.long:
Meaning: to "stride" (from "spreading" the legs), i.e. "rush" upon.
Usage: go.
Source: a primitive root;

6586.long:
Meaning: to "break" away (from just authority), i.e. "trespass", "apostatize", "quarrel".
Usage: offend, rebel, revolt, transgress(-ion, -or).
Source: a primitive root (identical with through the idea of "expansion");

6588.long:
Meaning: a "revolt" (national, moral or religious).
Usage: rebellion, sin, transgression, trespass.
Source: from "H6586";

6589.long:
Meaning: to "dispart" (the feet or lips), i.e. "become licentious".
Usage: open (wide).
Source: a primitive root;

6593.long:
Meaning: "linen" (i.e. the thread, as "carded").
Usage: flax, linen.
Source: from the same as "H6580" as in the sense of "comminuting";

6594.long:
Meaning: "flax"; by implication, a "wick".
Usage: flax, tow.
Source: feminine of "H6593";

6596.long:
Meaning: a "hole", i.e. "hinge" or the female "pudenda".
Usage: hinge, secret participle.
Source: or "פֹּתָה"; (Ezekiel 13:19), from an unused root meaning to "open";

6598.long:
Meaning: a "dainty".
Usage: portion (provision) of meat.
Source: of Persian origin;

6599.long:
Meaning: a (judicial) "sentence".
Usage: decree, sentence.
Source: of Persian origin;

6600.long:
Meaning: a "word", "answer", "letter" or "decree".
Usage: answer, letter, matter, word.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H6599";

6601.long:
Meaning: to "open", i.e. "be" (causatively, "make") "roomy"; usually figuratively (in a mental or moral sense) to "be" (causatively, "make") "simple" or (in a sinister way) "delude".
Usage: allure, deceive, enlarge, entice, flatter, persuade, silly (one).
Source: a primitive root;

6602.long:
Meaning: "Pethuel", an Israelite.
Usage: Pethuel.
Source: from "H6601" and "H410"; "enlarged of God";

6603.long:
Meaning: "sculpture" (in low or high relief or even intaglio).
Usage: carved (work) (are, en-) grave(-ing, -n).
Source: or "פִּתֻּחַ" ; passive participle of "H6605";

6604.long:
Meaning: "Pethor", a place in Mesopotamia.
Usage: Pethor.
Source: of foreign origin;

6605.long:
Meaning: to "open wide" (literally or figuratively); specifically, to "loosen", "begin", "plough", "carve".
Usage: appear, break forth, draw (out), let go free, (en-) grave(-n), loose (self), (be, be set) open(-ing), put off, ungird, unstop, have vent.
Source: a primitive root;

6607.long:
Meaning: an "opening" (literally), i.e. "door" (gate) or "entrance way".
Usage: door, entering (in), entrance (-ry), gate, opening, place.
Source: from "H6605";

6609.long:
Meaning: something "opened", i.e. a "drawn" sword.
Usage: drawn sword.
Source: from "H6605";

6611.long:
Meaning: "Pethachjah", the name of four Israelites.
Usage: Pethakiah.
Source: from "H6605" and "H3050"; "Jah has opened";

6612.long:
Meaning: "silly" (i.e. seducible).
Usage: foolish, simple(-icity, one).
Source: or "פֶּתִי"; or "פְּתָאִי"; from "H6601";

6613.long:
Meaning: "open", i.e. (as noun) "width".
Usage: breadth.
Source: (Aramaic) from a root corresponding to "H6601";

6614.long:
Meaning: probably a figured "mantle" for holidays.
Usage: stomacher.
Source: of uncertain derivation;

6616.long:
Meaning: "twine".
Usage: bound, bracelet, lace, line, ribband, thread, wire.
Source: from "H6617";

6617.long:
Meaning: to "twine", i.e. (literally) to "struggle" or (figuratively) be (morally) "tortuous".
Usage: (shew self) froward, shew self unsavoury, wrestle.
Source: a primitive root;

6619.long:
Meaning: "Pithom", a place in Egypt.
Usage: Pithom.
Source: of Egyptian derivation;

6620.long:
Meaning: an "asp" (from its "contortions").
Usage: adder.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "twist";

6621.long:
Meaning: a "wink", i.e. "moment" (used only [with or without preposition] adverbially, "quickly" or "unexpectedly").
Usage: at an instant, suddenly, × very.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "open" (the eyes); (compare "H6597")

6622.long:
Meaning: to "open up", i.e. (figuratively) "interpret" (a dream).
Usage: interpret(-ation, -er).
Source: a primitive root;

6624.long:
Meaning: "Pathros", a part of Egypt.
Usage: Pathros.
Source: of Egyptian derivation;

6625.long:
Meaning: a "Pathrusite", or inhabitant of Pathros.
Usage: Pathrusim.
Source: patrial from "H6624";

6626.long:
Meaning: to "open", i.e. "break".
Usage: participle x.
Source: a primitive root;

6628.long:
Meaning: the "lotus tree".
Usage: shady tree.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "be slender";

6629.long:
Meaning: a collective name for a "flock" (of sheep or goats); also figuratively (of men).
Usage: (small) cattle, flock ( -s), lamb ( -s), sheep(-cote, -fold, -shearer, -herds).
Source: or "צאוֹן"; (Psalm 144:13), from an unused root meaning to "migrate";

6630.long:
Meaning: "Zaanan", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Zaanan.
Source: from the same as "H6629" used denominatively; "sheep pasture";

6631.long:
Meaning: "issue", i.e. "produce", "children".
Usage: that which cometh forth (out), offspring.
Source: from "H3318";

6632.long:
Meaning: a "palanquin" or "canopy" (as a "fixture"); also a species of "lizard" (probably as clinging "fast").
Usage: covered, litter, tortoise.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "establish";

6633.long:
Meaning: to "mass" (an army or servants).
Usage: assemble, fight, perform, muster, wait upon, war.
Source: a primitive root;

6634.long:
Meaning: to "please".
Usage: will, would.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H6623" in the figurative sense of summoning one's wishes;

6635.long:
Meaning: a "mass" of persons (or figuratively, things), especially reg. organized for war (an "army"); by implication, a "campaign", literally or figuratively (specifically, "hardship", "worship").
Usage: appointed time, ( ) army, ( ) battle, company, host, service, soldiers, waiting upon, war(-fare).
Source: or (feminine) "צְבָאָה"; from "H6633";

6636.long:
Meaning: "Tseboim" or "Tsebijim", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Zeboiim, Zeboim.
Source: or (more correctly) "צְבִיִּים"; or "צְבִיִּם"; plural of "H6643"; "gazelles";

6637.long:
Meaning: "Tsobebah", an Israelitess.
Usage: Zobebah.
Source: feminine active participle of the same as "H6632"; the canopier (with the article);

6638.long:
Meaning: to "amass", i.e. "grow turgid"; specifically, to "array" an army against.
Usage: fight swell.
Source: a primitive root;

6640.long:
Meaning: properly, "will"; concretely, an "affair" (as a matter of determination).
Usage: purpose.
Source: (Aramaic) from "H6634";

6641.long:
Meaning: "dyed" (in stripes), i.e. the "hyena".
Usage: speckled.
Source: passive participle of the same as "H6648";

6642.long:
Meaning: to "grasp", i.e. "hand out".
Usage: reach.
Source: a primitive root;

6643.long:
Meaning: "splendor" (as "conspicuous").
Usage: beautiful(-ty), glorious (-ry), goodly, pleasant, roe(-buck).
Source: from "H6638" in the sense of "prominence";

6647.long:
Meaning: to "dip".
Usage: wet.
Source: (Aramaic) a root corresponding to that of "H6648";

6648.long:
Meaning: a "dye".
Usage: divers, colours.
Source: from an unused root meaning to dip (into coloring fluid);

6649.long:
Meaning: "Tsibon", an Idumaean.
Usage: Zibeon.
Source: from the same as "H6648"; "variegated";

6650.long:
Meaning: "Tseboim", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Zeboim.
Source: plural of "H6641"; "hyenas";

6651.long:
Meaning: to "aggregate".
Usage: gather (together), heap (up), lay up.
Source: a primitive root;

6653.long:
Meaning: a "lock" of stalks.
Usage: handful.
Source: from an unused root apparently meaning to "grip";

6654.long:
Meaning: a "side"; figuratively, an "adversary".
Usage: (be-) side.
Source: contr. from an unused root meaning to sidle off;

6655.long:
Meaning: used adverbially (with preposition) "at" or "upon the side of".
Usage: against, concerning.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H6654";

6656.long:
Meaning: a (sinister) "design".
Usage: true.
Source: (Aramaic) from an unused root corresponding to "H6658" in the sense of intentness;

6657.long:
Meaning: "Tsedad", a place near Palestine.
Usage: Zedad.
Source: from the same as "H6654"; a "siding";

6658.long:
Meaning: to "chase"; by implication, to "desolate".
Usage: destroy, hunt, lie in wait.
Source: a primitive root;

6659.long:
Meaning: "Tsadok", the name of eight or nine Israelites.
Usage: Zadok.
Source: from "H6663"; "just";

6661.long:
Meaning: "Tsiddim" (with the article), a place in Palestine.
Usage: Ziddim.
Source: plural of "H6654"; "sides";

6663.long:
Meaning: to "be" (causatively, "make") "right" (in a moral or forensic sense).
Usage: cleanse, clear self, (be, do) just(-ice, -ify, -ify self), (be turn to) righteous(-ness).
Source: a primitive root;

6664.long:
Meaning: the "right" (natural, moral or legal); also (abstractly) "equity" or (figuratively) "prosperity".
Usage: × even, (× that which is altogether) just(-ice), (un-)right(-eous) (cause, -ly, -ness).
Source: from "H6663";

6666.long:
Meaning: "rightness" (abstractly), subjectively ("rectitude"), objectively ("justice"), morally ("virtue") or figuratively ("prosperity").
Usage: justice, moderately, right(-eous) (act, -ly, -ness).
Source: from "H6663";

6667.long:
Meaning: "Tsidkijah", the name of six Israelites.
Usage: Zedekiah, Zidkijah.
Source: or "צִדְקִיָּהוּ"; from "H6664" and "H3050"; "right of Jah";

6668.long:
Meaning: to "glitter", i.e. "be golden in color".
Usage: × fine.
Source: a primitive root;

6670.long:
Meaning: to "gleam", i.e. (figuratively) "be cheerful"; by transference to "sound" clear (of various animal or human expressions).
Usage: bellow, cry aloud (out), lift up, neigh, rejoice, make to shine, shout.
Source: a primitive root;

6671.long:
Meaning: to "press out oil".
Usage: make oil.
Source: a primitive root; to glisten; used only as denominative from "H3323",

6672.long:
Meaning: a "light" (i.e. "window"); dual "double light", i.e. "noon".
Usage: midday, noon(-day, -tide), window.
Source: from "H6671";

6674.long:
Meaning: "soiled" (as if excrementitious).
Usage: filthy.
Source: or "צֹא"; from an unused root meaning to issue;

6675.long:
Meaning: "excrement"; generally, "dirt"; figuratively, "pollution".
Usage: dung, filth(-iness). Marg. for "H2716".
Source: or "צֹאָה" ; feminine of "H6674";

6677.long:
Meaning: the back of the "neck" (as that on which burdens are "bound").
Usage: neck.
Source: or "צַוָּר"; (Nehemiah 3:5), or "צַוָּרֹן"; (Song of Solomon 4:9), or (feminine) "צַוָּארָה"; (Micah 2:3), intensively from "H6696" in the sense of "binding";

6678.long:
Meaning: "Zoba" or "Zobah", a region of Syria.
Usage: Zoba, Zobah.
Source: or "צוֹבָה"; or "צֹבָה"; from an unused root meaning to station; a station;

6679.long:
Meaning: to "lie" alongside (i.e. in wait); by implication, to "catch" an animal (figuratively, men); to "victual" (for a journey).
Usage: chase, hunt, sore, take (provision).
Source: a primitive root; also denominative from "H6718"

6680.long:
Meaning: (intensively) to "constitute", "enjoin".
Usage: appoint, (for-) bid, (give a) charge, (give a, give in, send with) command(-er, -ment), send a messenger, put, (set) in order.
Source: a primitive root;

6683.long:
Meaning: an "abyss" (of the sea).
Usage: deep.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "sink";

6684.long:
Meaning: to "cover" over (the mouth), i.e. to "fast".
Usage: × at all, fast.
Source: a primitive root;

6687.long:
Meaning: to "overflow".
Usage: (make to over-) flow, swim.
Source: a primitive root;

6689.long:
Meaning: "Tsuph" or "Tsophai" or "Tsiph", the name of an Israelite and of a place in Palestine.
Usage: Zophai, Zuph.
Source: or "צוֹפַי"; or "צִיף"; from "H6688"; "honey-comb";

6690.long:
Meaning: "Tsophach", an Israelite.
Usage: Zophah.
Source: from an unused root meaning to expand, "breadth";

6691.long:
Meaning: "Tsophar", a friend of Job.
Usage: Zophar.
Source: from "H6852"; "departing";

6692.long:
Meaning: to "twinkle", i.e. "glance"; by analogy, to "blossom" (figuratively, "flourish").
Usage: bloom, blossom, flourish, shew self.
Source: a primitive root;

6693.long:
Meaning: to "compress", i.e. (figuratively) "oppress", "distress".
Usage: constrain, distress, lie sore, (op-) press(-or), straiten.
Source: a primitive root;

6694.long:
Meaning: to "pour" out, i.e. (figuratively) "smelt", "utter".
Usage: be molten, pour.
Source: a primitive root (identical with through the idea of "narrowness" (of orifice));

6695.long:
Meaning: a "strait", i.e. (figuratively) "distress".
Usage: anguish, × troublous.
Source: or (feminine) "צוּקָה"; from "H6693";

6696.long:
Meaning: to "cramp", i.e. "confine" (in many applications, literally and figuratively, formative or hostile).
Usage: adversary, assault, beset, besiege, bind (up), cast, distress, fashion, fortify, inclose, lay siege, put up in bags.
Source: a primitive root;

6697.long:
Meaning: properly, a "cliff" (or sharp rock, as "compressed"); generally, a "rock" or "boulder"; figuratively, a "refuge"; also an "edge" (as "precipitous").
Usage: edge, × (mighty) God (one), rock, × sharp, stone, × strength, × strong. See also "H1049".
Source: or "צֻר"; from "H6696";

6698.long:
Meaning: "Tsur", the name of a Midianite and of an Israelite.
Usage: Zur.
Source: the same as "H6697"; "rock";

6699.long:
Meaning: a "rock" (Job 28:10); also a "form" (as if pressed out).
Usage: form, rock.
Source: feminine of "H6697";

6700.long:
Meaning: "Tsuriël", an Israelite.
Usage: Zuriel.
Source: from "H6697" and "H410"; "rock of God";

6701.long:
Meaning: "Tsurishaddai", an Israelite.
Usage: Zurishaddai.
Source: from "H6697" and "H7706"; "rock of" (the) "Almighty";

6703.long:
Meaning: "dazzling", i.e. "sunny", "bright", (figuratively) "evident".
Usage: clear, dry, plainly, white.
Source: from "H6705";

6704.long:
Meaning: "parched".
Usage: dried up.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "glow";

6705.long:
Meaning: to "glare", i.e. "be dazzling white".
Usage: be whiter.
Source: a primitive root;

6706.long:
Meaning: "glaring", i.e. "exposed" to the bright sun.
Usage: higher place, top.
Source: from "H6705";

6707.long:
Meaning: a "parched region", i.e. the "desert".
Usage: dry land.
Source: feminine of "H6706";

6708.long:
Meaning: "bare spot", i.e. in the "glaring" sun.
Usage: higher place.
Source: from "H6706";

6709.long:
Meaning: "stench".
Usage: ill savour.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "putrefy";

6711.long:
Meaning: to "laugh outright" (in merriment or scorn); by implication, to "sport".
Usage: laugh, mock, play, make sport.
Source: a primitive root;

6712.long:
Meaning: "laughter" (in pleasure or derision).
Usage: laugh(-ed to scorn).
Source: from "H6711";

6713.long:
Meaning: "sheen", i.e. "whiteness".
Usage: white.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "dazzle";

6714.long:
Meaning: "Tsochar", the name of a Hittite and of an Israelite.
Usage: Zohar. Compare "H3328".
Source: from the same as "H6713"; whiteness;

6717.long:
Meaning: "Tsiba", an Israelite.
Usage: Ziba.
Source: from the same as "H6678"; "station";

6718.long:
Meaning: the "chase"; also "game" (thus taken).
Usage: × catcheth, food, × hunter, (that which he took in) hunting, venison, victuals.
Source: from a form of "H6679" and meaning the same;

6719.long:
Meaning: a "huntsman".
Usage: hunter.
Source: from the same as "H6718";

6720.long:
Meaning: "food".
Usage: meat, provision, venison, victuals.
Source: or "צֵדָה"; feminine of "H6718";

6721.long:
Meaning: "Tsidon", the name of a son of Canaan, and of a place in Palestine.
Usage: Sidon, Zidon.
Source: or "צִידֹן"; from "H6679" in the sense of catching fish; fishery;

6722.long:
Meaning: a "Tsidonian" or inhabitant of Tsidon.
Usage: Sidonian, of Sidon, Zidonian.
Source: patrial from "H6721";

6723.long:
Meaning: "aridity"; concretely, a "desert".
Usage: barren, drought, dry (land, place), solitary place, wilderness.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "parch";

6724.long:
Meaning: a "desert".
Usage: dry place.
Source: from the same as "H6723";

6725.long:
Meaning: a "monumental" or "guiding pillar".
Usage: sign, title, waymark.
Source: from the same as "H6723" in the sense of conspicuousness (compare "H5329");

6726.long:
Meaning: "Tsijon" (as a permanent "capital"), a mountain of Jerusalem.
Usage: Zion.
Source: the same (regularly) as "H6725";

6727.long:
Meaning: "Tsicha", the name of two Nethinim.
Usage: Ziha.
Source: or "צִחָא"; as if feminine of "H6704"; "drought";

6728.long:
Meaning: a "desert-dweller", i.e. "nomad" or wild "beast".
Usage: wild beast of the desert, that dwell in (inhabiting) the wilderness.
Source: from the same as "H6723";

6729.long:
Meaning: the "pillory".
Usage: stocks.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "confine";

6730.long:
Meaning: "Tsior", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Zior.
Source: from "H6819"; "small";

6731.long:
Meaning: properly, "glistening", i.e. a burnished "plate"; also a "flower" (as "bright" colored); a "wing" (as "gleaming" in the air).
Usage: blossom, flower, plate, wing.
Source: or "צִץ"; from "H6692";

6732.long:
Meaning: "Tsits", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Ziz.
Source: the same as "H6731"; "bloom";

6734.long:
Meaning: a "floral" or "wing"-like projection, i.e. a "fore-lock" of hair, a "tassel".
Usage: fringe, lock.
Source: feminine of "H6731";

6735.long:
Meaning: a "hinge" (as "pressed" in turning); also a "throe" (as a phys. or mental "pressure"); also a "herald" or errand-doer (as "constrained" by the principal).
Usage: ambassador, hinge, messenger, pain, pang, sorrow. Compare "H6736".
Source: from "H6696";

6736.long:
Meaning: a "form" (of beauty; as if "pressed" out, i.e. carved); hence, an (idolatrous) "image".
Usage: beauty, idol.
Source: the same as "H6735";

6737.long:
Meaning: to "make an errand", i.e. "betake oneself".
Usage: make as if...had been ambassador.
Source: a denominative from "H6735" in the sense of ambassador;

6738.long:
Meaning: "shade", whether literal or figurative.
Usage: defence, shade(-ow).
Source: from "H6751";

6739.long:
Meaning: "pray".
Usage: pray.
Source: (Aramaic) probably corresponding to "H6760" in the sense of bowing;

6741.long:
Meaning: "Tsillah", an antediluvian woman.
Usage: Zillah.
Source: feminine of "H6738";

6742.long:
Meaning: a (round or flattened) "cake".
Usage: cake.
Source: from "H6749" in the sense of rolling;

6743.long:
Meaning: to "push" forward, in various senses (literal or figurative, transitive or intransitive).
Usage: break out, come (mightily), go over, be good, be meet, be profitable, (cause to, effect, make to, send) prosper(-ity, -ous, -ously).
Source: or "צָלֵחַ"; a primitive root;

6744.long:
Meaning: to "advance" (transitive or intransitive).
Usage: promote, prosper.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H6743";

6745.long:
Meaning: something "protracted" or "flattened out", i.e. a "platter".
Usage: pan.
Source: from "H6743";

6746.long:
Meaning: something "prolonged" or "tall", i.e. a "vial" or "salt-cellar".
Usage: cruse.
Source: from "H6743";

6747.long:
Meaning: something "advanced" or "deep", i.e. a "bowl"; figuratively, the "bosom".
Usage: bosom, dish.
Source: from "H6743";

6749.long:
Meaning: properly, to "tumble" down, i.e. "settle" by a waving motion.
Usage: sink. Compare "H6750", "H6751".
Source: a primitive root;

6750.long:
Meaning: to "tinkle", i.e. "rattle together" (as the ears in reddening with shame, or the teeth in chattering with fear).
Usage: quiver, tingle.
Source: a primitive root (identical with through the idea of vibration);

6751.long:
Meaning: to "shade", as twilight or an opaque object.
Usage: begin to be dark, shadowing.
Source: a primitive root (identical with through the idea of "hovering" over (compare "H6754"));

6753.long:
Meaning: "Tselelponi", an Israelitess.
Usage: Hazelelponi (including the article).
Source: from "H6752" and the active participle of "H6437"; "shade-facing";

6754.long:
Meaning: a "phantom", i.e. (figuratively) "illusion", "resemblance"; hence, a "representative figure", especially an "idol".
Usage: image, vain shew.
Source: from an unused root meaning to shade;

6755.long:
Meaning: an "idolatrous figure".
Usage: form, image.
Source: (Aramaic) or "צְלֶם"; (Aramaic), corresponding to "H6754";

6756.long:
Meaning: "Tsalmon", the name of a place in Palestine and of an Israelite.
Usage: Zalmon.
Source: from "H6754"; "shady";

6757.long:
Meaning: "shade of death", i.e. the "grave" (figuratively, "calamity").
Usage: shadow of death.
Source: from "H6738" and "H4194";

6758.long:
Meaning: "Tsalmonah", a place in the Desert.
Usage: Zalmonah.
Source: feminine of "H6757"; "shadiness";

6759.long:
Meaning: "Tsalmunna", a Midianite.
Usage: Zalmunna.
Source: from "H6738" and "H4513"; "shade has been denied";

6760.long:
Meaning: to "limp" (as if one-sided).
Usage: halt.
Source: a primitive root; probably to curve; used only as denominative from "H6763",

6762.long:
Meaning: "Tsela", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Zelah.
Source: the same as "H6761";

6763.long:
Meaning: a "rib" (as curved), literally (of the body) or figuratively (of a door, i.e. leaf); hence, a "side", literally (of a person) or figuratively (of an object or the sky, i.e. quarter); architecturally, "a" (especially floor or ceiling) "timber" or "plank" (single or collective, i.e. a flooring).
Usage: beam, board, chamber, corner, leaf, plank, rib, side (chamber).
Source: or (feminine) "צַלְעָה"; from "H6760";

6764.long:
Meaning: "Tsalaph", an Israelite.
Usage: Zalaph.
Source: from an unused root of unknown meaning;

6765.long:
Meaning: "Tselophchad", an Israelite.
Usage: Zelophehad.
Source: from the same as "H6764" and "H259";

6766.long:
Meaning: "Tseltsach", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Zelzah.
Source: from "H6738" and "H6703"; "clear shade";

6767.long:
Meaning: a "clatter", i.e. (abstractly) "whirring" (of wings); (concretely) a "cricket"; also a "harpoon" (as "rattling"),a "cymbal" (as "clanging").
Usage: cymbal, locust, shadowing, spear.
Source: from "H6750" reduplicated;

6768.long:
Meaning: "Tselek", an Israelite.
Usage: Zelek.
Source: from an unused root meaning to split; "fissure";

6769.long:
Meaning: "Tsillethai", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Zilthai.
Source: from the feminine of "H6738"; "shady";

6770.long:
Meaning: to "thirst" (literally or figuratively).
Usage: (be a-, suffer) thirst(-y).
Source: a primitive root;

6774.long:
Meaning: a "thirsty place", i.e. "desert".
Usage: drought, dry ground, thirsty land.
Source: from "H6771";

6775.long:
Meaning: to "link", i.e. "gird"; figuratively, to "serve", (mentally) "contrive".
Usage: fasten, frame, join (self).
Source: a primitive root;

6776.long:
Meaning: a "yoke" or "team" (i.e. pair); hence, an "acre" (i.e. day's task for a yoke of cattle to plough).
Usage: acre, couple, × together, two (donkeys), yoke (of oxen).

6777.long:
Meaning: a "veil".
Usage: locks.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "fasten" on;

6778.long:
Meaning: a "cake of dried grapes".
Usage: bunch (cluster) of raisins.
Source: from "H6784";

6779.long:
Meaning: to "sprout" (transitive or intransitive, literal or figurative).
Usage: bear, bring forth, (cause to, make to) bud (forth), (cause to, make to) grow (again, up), (cause to) spring (forth, up).
Source: a primitive root;

6780.long:
Meaning: a "sprout" (usually concrete), literal or figurative.
Usage: branch, bud, that which (where) grew (upon), spring(-ing).
Source: from "H6779";

6781.long:
Meaning: a "bracelet" or "arm-clasp"; generally, a "lid".
Usage: bracelet, covering.
Source: or "צָמִד"; from "H6775";

6782.long:
Meaning: a "noose" (as fastening); figuratively, "destruction".
Usage: robber.
Source: from the same as "H6777";

6783.long:
Meaning: "excision", i.e. "destruction"; used only (adverbially) with prepositional prefix to "extinction", i.e. "perpetually".
Usage: ever.
Source: or "צְמִתֻת"; from "H6789";

6784.long:
Meaning: to "dry up".
Usage: dry.
Source: a primitive root;

6785.long:
Meaning: "wool".
Usage: wool(-len).
Source: from an unused root probably meaning to "be shaggy";

6786.long:
Meaning: a "Tsemarite" or branch of the Canaanites.
Usage: Zemarite.
Source: patrial from an unused name of a place in Palestine;

6787.long:
Meaning: "Tsemarajim", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Zemaraim.
Source: dual of "H6785"; "double fleece";

6788.long:
Meaning: "fleeciness", i.e. "foliage".
Usage: highest branch, top.
Source: from the same as "H6785";

6789.long:
Meaning: to "extirpate" (literally or figuratively).
Usage: consume, cut off, destroy, vanish.
Source: a primitive root;

6790.long:
Meaning: "Tsin", a part of the Desert.
Usage: Zin.
Source: from an unused root meaning to prick; a "crag";

6791.long:
Meaning: a "thorn"; hence, a "cactus-hedge".
Usage: thorn.
Source: from an unused root meaning to be prickly;

6793.long:
Meaning: a "hook" (as "pointed"); also a (large) "shield" (as if guarding by "prickliness"); also "cold" (as "piercing").
Usage: buckler, cold, hook, shield, target.
Source: feminine of "H6791";

6794.long:
Meaning: a "culvert".
Usage: gutter, water-spout.
Source: from an unused root perhaps meaning to "be hollow";

6795.long:
Meaning: to "alight"; (transitive) to "cause to descend", i.e. "drive down".
Usage: fasten, light (from off).
Source: a primitive root;

6796.long:
Meaning: a "thorn".
Usage: thorn.
Source: or "צָנִן"; from the same as "H6791";

6797.long:
Meaning: a "head-dress" (i.e. piece of cloth "wrapped" around).
Usage: diadem, hood, mitre.
Source: or "צָנוֹף"; or (feminine) "צָנִיפָה"; from "H6801";

6798.long:
Meaning: to "blast" or "shrink".
Usage: withered.
Source: a primitive root;

6799.long:
Meaning: "Tsenan", a place near Palestine.
Usage: Zenan.
Source: probably for "H6630";

6800.long:
Meaning: to "humiliate".
Usage: humbly, lowly.
Source: a primitive root;

6801.long:
Meaning: to "wrap", i.e. "roll" or "dress".
Usage: be attired, × surely, violently turn.
Source: a primitive root;

6803.long:
Meaning: a "vase" (probably a vial "tapering" at the top).
Usage: pot.
Source: from the same as "H6791";

6804.long:
Meaning: a "tube".
Usage: pipe.
Source: probably from the same as "H6794";

6805.long:
Meaning: to "pace", i.e. "step regularly"; (upward) to "mount"; (along) to "march"; (down and causatively) to "hurl".
Usage: bring, go, march (through), run over.
Source: a primitive root;

6806.long:
Meaning: a "pace" or "regular step".
Usage: pace, step.
Source: from "H6804";

6807.long:
Meaning: a "march"; (concretely) an (ornamental) "ankle-chain".
Usage: going, ornament of the legs.
Source: feminine of "H6806";

6808.long:
Meaning: to "tip" over (for the purpose of "spilling" or "pouring" out), i.e. (figuratively) "depopulate"; by implication, to "imprison" or "conquer"; (reflexive) to "lie down" (for coitus).
Usage: captive exile, travelling, (cause to) wander(-er).
Source: a primitive root;

6809.long:
Meaning: a "veil".
Usage: vail.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "wrap over";

6810.long:
Meaning: "little"; (in number) "few"; (in age) "young", (in value) "ignoble".
Usage: least, little (one), small (one), young(-er, -est).
Source: or "צָעוֹר"; from "H6819";

6811.long:
Meaning: "Tsair", a place in Idumaea.
Usage: Zair.
Source: the same as "H6810";

6813.long:
Meaning: to "load" up (beasts), i.e. to "migrate".
Usage: be taken down.
Source: a primitive root;

6814.long:
Meaning: "Tsoän", a place in Egypt.
Usage: Zoan.
Source: of Egyptian derivation;

6815.long:
Meaning: "Tsaanannim" or "Tsaanajim", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Zaannannim, Zaanaim.
Source: or (dual) "צַעֲנַיִם"; plural from "H6813"; "removals";

6816.long:
Meaning: "sculpture".
Usage: image (work).
Source: from an unused root meaning to bestrew with carvings;

6817.long:
Meaning: to "shriek"; (by implication) to "proclaim" (an assembly).
Usage: × at all, call together, cry (out), gather (selves) (together).
Source: a primitive root;

6819.long:
Meaning: to "be small", i.e. (figuratively) "ignoble".
Usage: be brought low, little one, be small.
Source: a primitive root;

6820.long:
Meaning: "Tsoar", a place East of the Jordan.
Usage: Zoar.
Source: from "H6819"; "little";

6822.long:
Meaning: properly, to "lean" forward, i.e. to "peer" into the distance; by implication, to "observe", "await".
Usage: behold, espy, look up (well), wait for, (keep the) watch(-man).
Source: a primitive root;

6823.long:
Meaning: to "sheet" over (especially with metal).
Usage: cover, overlay.
Source: a primitive root (probably identical with "H6822" through the idea of "expansion" in outlook, transferring to action);

6825.long:
Meaning: "Tsepho" or "Tsephi", an Idumaean.
Usage: Zephi, Zepho.
Source: or "צְפִי"; from "H6822"; "observant";

6828.long:
Meaning: properly, "hidden", i.e. "dark"; used only of the "north" as a quarter (gloomy and unknown).
Usage: north(-ern, side, -ward, wind).
Source: or "צָפֹן"; from "H6845";

6829.long:
Meaning: "Tsaphon", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Zaphon.
Source: the same as "H6828"; "boreal";

6831.long:
Meaning: a "Tsephonite", or (collectively) descendants of Tsephon.
Usage: Zephonites.
Source: patronymically from "H6827";

6832.long:
Meaning: "excrement" (as protruded).
Usage: dung.
Source: from the same as "H6848";

6833.long:
Meaning: a "little bird" (as hopping).
Usage: bird, fowl, sparrow.
Source: or "צִפֹּר"; from "H6852";

6834.long:
Meaning: "Tsippor", a Moabite.
Usage: Zippor.
Source: the same as "H6833";

6835.long:
Meaning: "a saucer" (as flat).
Usage: cruse.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "expand";

6838.long:
Meaning: a flat thin "cake".
Usage: wafer.
Source: from the same as "H6835";

6839.long:
Meaning: "Tsophim", a place East of the Jordan.
Usage: Zophim.
Source: plural of active participle of "H6822"; "watchers";

6843.long:
Meaning: a "crown" (as "encircling" the head); also a "turn" of affairs (i.e. "mishap").
Usage: diadem, morning.
Source: feminine formed like "H6842";

6845.long:
Meaning: to "hide" (by "covering" over); by implication, to "hoard" or "reserve"; figuratively to "deny"; specifically (favorably) to "protect", (unfavorably) to "lurk".
Usage: esteem, hide(-den one, self), lay up, lurk (be set) privily, (keep) secret(-ly, place).
Source: a primitive root;

6846.long:
Meaning: "Tsephanjah", the name of four Israelites.
Usage: Zephaniah.
Source: or "צְפַנְיָהוּ"; from "H6845" and "H3050"; "Jah has secreted";

6847.long:
Meaning: "Tsophnath-Paneach", Joseph's Egyptian name.
Usage: Zaphnath-paaneah.
Source: of Egyptian derivation;

6848.long:
Meaning: a "viper" (as "thrusting" out the tongue, i.e. "hissing").
Usage: adder, cockatrice.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "extrude";

6849.long:
Meaning: an "outcast" thing.
Usage: issue.
Source: feminine from the same as "H6848";

6850.long:
Meaning: to "coo" or "chirp" (as a bird).
Usage: chatter, peep, whisper.
Source: a primitive root;

6851.long:
Meaning: a "willow" (as growing in overflowed places).
Usage: willow tree.
Source: from "H6687";

6852.long:
Meaning: to "skip about", i.e. "return".
Usage: depart early.
Source: a primitive root;

6854.long:
Meaning: a "marsh-leaper", i.e. "frog".
Usage: frog.
Source: from "H6852" and a word elsewhere unused meaning a swamp;

6856.long:
Meaning: properly, a "claw", i.e. (human) "nail"; also the "point" of a style (or pen, tipped with adamant).
Usage: nail, point.
Source: from "H6852" (in the denominative sense (from "H6833") of scratching);

6857.long:
Meaning: "Tsephath", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Zephath.
Source: from "H6822"; "watch-tower";

6858.long:
Meaning: a "capital of a column".
Usage: chapiter.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "encircle";

6859.long:
Meaning: "Tsephathah", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Zephathah.
Source: the same as "H6857";

6860.long:
Meaning: "Tsiklag" or "Tsikelag", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Ziklag.
Source: or "צִיקלַג"; (1 Chronicles 12:1,20), of uncertain derivation;

6861.long:
Meaning: a "sack" (as tied at the mouth).
Usage: husk.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "wind";

6862.long:
Meaning: "narrow"; (as a noun) a "tight" place (usually figuratively, i.e. "trouble"); also a "pebble" (as in "H6864"); (transitive) an "opponent" (as "crowding").
Usage: adversary, afflicted(-tion), anguish, close, distress, enemy, flint, foe, narrow, small, sorrow, strait, tribulation, trouble.
Source: or "צָר"; from "H6887";

6863.long:
Meaning: "Tser", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Zer.
Source: from "H6887"; "rock";

6864.long:
Meaning: a "stone" (as if pressed hard or to a point); (by implication, of use) a "knife".
Usage: flint, sharp stone.
Source: from "H6696";

6865.long:
Meaning: "Tsor", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Tyre, Tyrus.
Source: or "צוֹר"; the same as "H6864"; a "rock";

6867.long:
Meaning: "conflagration" (of fire or disease).
Usage: burning, inflammation.
Source: from "H6866";

6868.long:
Meaning: "Tseredah", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Zereda, Zeredathah.
Source: or "צְרֵדָתָה"; apparently from an unused root meaning to pierce; "puncture";

6869.long:
Meaning: "tightness" (i.e. figuratively, "trouble"); transitively, a female "rival".
Usage: adversary, adversity, affliction, anguish, distress, tribulation, trouble.
Source: feminine of "H6862";

6870.long:
Meaning: "Tserujah", an Israelitess.
Usage: Zeruiah.
Source: feminine passive participle from the same as "H6875"; "wounded";

6871.long:
Meaning: "Tseruah", an Israelitess.
Usage: Zeruah.
Source: feminine passive participle of "H6879"; "leprous";

6872.long:
Meaning: a "parcel" (as "packed" up); also a "kernel" or "particle" (as if a "package").
Usage: bag, × bendeth, bundle, least grain, small stone.
Source: or (shorter) "צְרֹר"; from "H6887";

6873.long:
Meaning: to "be clear" (in tone, i.e. "shrill"), i.e. to "whoop".
Usage: cry, roar.
Source: a primitive root;

6874.long:
Meaning: "Tseri", an Israelite.
Usage: Zeri. Compare "H3340".
Source: the same as "H6875";

6875.long:
Meaning: "distillation", i.e. "balsam".
Usage: balm.
Source: or "צֳרִי"; from an unused root meaning to crack (as by pressure), hence, to leak;

6876.long:
Meaning: a "Tsorite" or inhabitant of Tsor (i.e. Syrian).
Usage: (man) of Tyre.
Source: patrial from "H6865";

6877.long:
Meaning: a "citadel".
Usage: high place, hold.
Source: from "H6873" in the sense of clearness of vision;

6878.long:
Meaning: "need".
Usage: need.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "need";

6879.long:
Meaning: to "scourge", i.e. (intransitive and figurative) to "be stricken with leprosy".
Usage: leper, leprous.
Source: a primitive root;

6881.long:
Meaning: "Tsorah", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Zareah, Zorah, Zoreah.
Source: apparently another form for "H6880";

6882.long:
Meaning: a "Tsorite" or "Tsorathite", i.e. inhabitants of Tsorah.
Usage: Zorites, Zareathites, Zorathites.
Source: or "צׇרְעָתִי"; patrial from "H6881";

6884.long:
Meaning: to "fuse" (metal), i.e. "refine" (literally or figuratively).
Usage: cast, (re-) fine(-er), founder, goldsmith, melt, pure, purge away, try.
Source: a primitive root;

6885.long:
Meaning: "Tsorephi" (with the article), an Israelite.
Usage: goldsmith's.
Source: from "H6884"; "refiner";

6886.long:
Meaning: "Tsarephath", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Zarephath.
Source: from "H6884"; "refinement";

6887.long:
Meaning: to "cramp", literally or figuratively, transitive or intransitive.
Usage: adversary, (be in) afflict(-ion), beseige, bind (up), (be in, bring) distress, enemy, narrower, oppress, pangs, shut up, be in a strait (trouble), vex.
Source: a primitive root;

6888.long:
Meaning: "Tsererah for Tseredah".
Usage: Zererath.
Source: apparently by erroneous transcription for "H6868";

6890.long:
Meaning: "Tsereth-hash-Shachar", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Zareth-shahar.
Source: from the same as "H6889" and "H7837" with the article interposed; "splendor of the dawn";

6891.long:
Meaning: "Tsarethan", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Zarthan.
Source: perhaps for "H6868";

6894.long:
Meaning: a "hollow", i.e. "vessel" used as a (dry) "measure".
Usage: cab.
Source: from "H6895";

6895.long:
Meaning: to "scoop" out, i.e. (figuratively) to "malign" or "execrate" (i.e. "stab" with words).
Usage: × at all, curse.
Source: a primitive root;

6896.long:
Meaning: the "paunch" (as a cavity) or "first stomach of ruminants".
Usage: maw.
Source: from "H6895";

6900.long:
Meaning: "sepulture"; (concretely) a "sepulchre".
Usage: burial, burying place, grave, sepulchre.
Source: or "קְבֻרָה"; feminine passive participle of "H6912";

6901.long:
Meaning: to "admit", i.e. "take" (literally or figuratively).
Usage: choose, (take) hold, receive, (under-) take.
Source: a primitive root;

6903.long:
Meaning: (adverbially) "in front of"; usually (with other particles) "on account of", "so as", "since", hence.
Usage: according to, as, because, before, for this cause, forasmuch as, by this means, over against, by reason of, that, therefore, though, wherefore.
Source: (Aramaic) or "קֳבֵל"; (Aramaic), (corresponding to "H6905";

6904.long:
Meaning: a "battering-ram".
Usage: war.
Source: from "H6901" in the sense of confronting (as standing opposite in order to receive);

6905.long:
Meaning: the "presence", i.e. (adverbially) "in front of".
Usage: before.
Source: from "H6901" in the sense of opposite (see "H6904");

6906.long:
Meaning: to "cover", i.e. (figuratively) "defraud".
Usage: rob, spoil.
Source: a primitive root;

6907.long:
Meaning: a "goblet" (as deep like a "cover").
Usage: dregs.
Source: from "H6906";

6908.long:
Meaning: to "grasp", i.e. "collect".
Usage: assemble (selves), gather (bring) (together, selves together, up), heap, resort, × surely, take up.
Source: a primitive root;

6909.long:
Meaning: "Kabtseel", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Kabzeel. Compare "H3343".
Source: from "H6908" and "H410"; God has gathered;

6910.long:
Meaning: a "hoard".
Usage: × gather.
Source: feminine passive participle of "H6908";

6911.long:
Meaning: "Kibtsajim", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Kibzaim.
Source: dual from "H6908"; a "double heap";

6912.long:
Meaning: to "inter".
Usage: × in any wise, bury(-ier).
Source: a primitive root;

6913.long:
Meaning: a "sepulchre".
Usage: burying place, grave, sepulchre.
Source: or (feminine) "קִבְרָה"; from "H6912";

6914.long:
Meaning: "Kibroth-hat-Taavh", a place in the Desert.
Usage: Kibroth-hattaavah.
Source: from the feminine plural of "H6913" and "H8378" with the article interposed; "graves of the longing";

6915.long:
Meaning: to "shrivel up", i.e. "contract" or "bend the body" (or neck) "in deference".
Usage: bow (down) (the) head, stoop.
Source: a primitive root;

6917.long:
Meaning: a "pristine hero".
Usage: ancient.
Source: passive participle of "H6923";

6918.long:
Meaning: "sacred" (ceremonially or morally); (as noun) "God" (by eminence), an "angel", a "saint", a "sanctuary".
Usage: holy (One), saint.
Source: or "קָדֹשׁ"; from "H6942";

6919.long:
Meaning: to "inflame".
Usage: burn, kindle.
Source: a primitive root to inflame

6920.long:
Meaning: "inflammation", i.e. "febrile disease".
Usage: burning ague, fever.
Source: from "H6919";

6921.long:
Meaning: the "fore" or front part; hence (by orientation) the "East" (often adverbially, "eastward", for brevity the "east wind").
Usage: east(-ward, wind).
Source: or "קָדִם"; from "H6923";

6923.long:
Meaning: to "project" (one self), i.e. "precede"; hence, to "anticipate", "hasten", "meet" (usually for help).
Usage: come (go, (flee)) before, disappoint, meet, prevent.
Source: a primitive root;

6924.long:
Meaning: the "front", of place (absolutely, the "fore part", relatively the "East") or time ("antiquity"); often used adverbially ("before", "anciently", "eastward").
Usage: aforetime, ancient (time), before, east (end, part, side, -ward), eternal, × ever(-lasting), forward, old, past. Compare "H6926".
Source: or "קֵדְמָה"; from "H6923";

6925.long:
Meaning: "before".
Usage: before, × from, × I (thought), × me, of, × it pleased, presence.
Source: (Aramaic) or "קְדָם"; (Aramaic) (Daniel 7:13), corresponding to "H6924";

6926.long:
Meaning: the "forward" part (or relatively) "East" (often adverbially, on the east or in front).
Usage: east(-ward).
Source: feminine of "H6924";

6927.long:
Meaning: "priority" (in time); also used adverbially ("before").
Usage: afore, antiquity, former (old) estate.
Source: from "H6923";

6929.long:
Meaning: "Kedemah", a son of Ishmael.
Usage: Kedemah.
Source: from "H6923"; "precedence";

6931.long:
Meaning: (of time) "anterior" or (of place) "oriental".
Usage: ancient, they that went before, east, (thing of) old.
Source: or "קַדְמֹנִי"; from "H6930";

6932.long:
Meaning: "Kedemoth", a place in eastern Palestine.
Usage: Kedemoth.
Source: from "H6923"; beginnings;

6933.long:
Meaning: "first".
Usage: first.
Source: (Aramaic) from a root corresponding to "H6923";

6934.long:
Meaning: "Kadmiel", the name of three Israelites.
Usage: Kadmiel.
Source: from "H6924" and "H410"; "presence of God";

6935.long:
Meaning: "Kadmonite" (collectively), the name of a tribe in Palestine.
Usage: Kadmonites.
Source: the same as "H6931"; ancient, i.e. aboriginal;

6936.long:
Meaning: the "crown" of the head (as the part most "bowed").
Usage: crown (of the head), pate, scalp, top of the head.
Source: from "H6915";

6937.long:
Meaning: to "be ashy", i.e. "dark"-colored; by implication, to "mourn" (in sackcloth or sordid garments).
Usage: be black(-ish), be (make) dark(-en), × heavily, (cause to) mourn.
Source: a primitive root;

6938.long:
Meaning: "Kedar", a son of Ishmael; also (collectively) Bedouin (as his descendants or representatives).
Usage: Kedar.
Source: from "H6937"; "dusky" (of the skin or the tent);

6939.long:
Meaning: "Kidron", a brook near Jerusalem.
Usage: Kidron.
Source: from "H6937"; "dusky place";

6941.long:
Meaning: "blackish" ones (i.e. in sackcloth); used adverbially, in "mourning weeds".
Usage: mournfully.
Source: adverb from "H6937";

6942.long:
Meaning: to "be" (causatively, "make", "pronounce" or "observe" as) "clean" (ceremonially or morally).
Usage: appoint, bid, consecrate, dedicate, defile, hallow, (be, keep) holy(-er, place), keep, prepare, proclaim, purify, sanctify(-ied one, self), × wholly.
Source: a primitive root;

6943.long:
Meaning: "Kedesh", the name of four places in Palestine.
Usage: Kedesh.
Source: from "H6942"; a "sanctum";

6944.long:
Meaning: a "sacred" place or thing; rarely abstract, "sanctity".
Usage: consecrated (thing), dedicated (thing), hallowed (thing), holiness, (× most) holy (× day, portion, thing), saint, sanctuary.
Source: from "H6942";

6945.long:
Meaning: a (quasi) "sacred person", i.e. (technically) a (male) "devotee" (by prostitution) to "licentious idolatry".
Usage: sodomite, unclean.
Source: from "H6942";

6946.long:
Meaning: "Kadesh", a place in the Desert.
Usage: Kadesh. Compare "H6947".
Source: the same as "H6945"; "sanctuary";

6947.long:
Meaning: "Kadesh-Barnea", a place in the Desert.
Usage: Kadeshbarnea.
Source: from the same as "H6946" and an otherwise unused word (apparently compounded of a correspondent to "H1251" and a derivative of "H5128") meaning desert of a fugitive; Kadesh of (the) Wilderness of Wandering;

6948.long:
Meaning: a "female devotee" (i.e. prostitute).
Usage: harlot, whore.
Source: feminine of "H6945";

6949.long:
Meaning: to "be dull".
Usage: be set on edge, be blunt.
Source: a primitive root;

6950.long:
Meaning: to "convoke".
Usage: assemble (selves) (together), gather (selves) (together).
Source: a primitive root;

6951.long:
Meaning: "assemblage" (usually concretely).
Usage: assembly, company, congregation, multitude.
Source: from "H6950";

6953.long:
Meaning: a (female) "assembler" (i.e. lecturer); abstractly, "preaching" (used as a 'nom de plume', Koheleth).
Usage: preacher.
Source: feminine of active participle from "H6950";

6954.long:
Meaning: "Kehelathah", a place in the Desert.
Usage: Kehelathah.
Source: from "H6950"; "convocation";

6955.long:
Meaning: "Kehath", an Israelite.
Usage: Kohath.
Source: from an unused root meaning to ally oneself; "allied";

6956.long:
Meaning: a "Kohathite" (collectively) or descendants of Kehath.
Usage: Kohathites.
Source: patronymically from "H6955";

6957.long:
Meaning: a "cord" (as connecting), especially for "measuring"; figuratively, a "rule"; also a "rim", a "musical string" or "accord".
Usage: line. Compare "H6978".
Source: or "קָו"; from "H6960" (compare "H6961");

6958.long:
Meaning: to "vomit".
Usage: spue (out), vomit (out, up, up again).
Source: or "קָיָה"; (Jeremiah 25:27), a primitive root;

6959.long:
Meaning: a "helmet".
Usage: helmet.
Source: a form collateral to "H3553";

6960.long:
Meaning: to "bind" together (perhaps by twisting), i.e. "collect"; (figuratively) to "expect".
Usage: gather (together), look, patiently, tarry, wait (for, on, upon).
Source: a primitive root;

6961.long:
Meaning: a (measuring) "cord" (as if for binding).
Usage: line.
Source: from "H6960";

6962.long:
Meaning: properly, to "cut off", i.e. (figuratively) "detest".
Usage: begrieved, loathe self.
Source: a primitive root;

6963.long:
Meaning: a "voice" or "sound".
Usage: aloud, bleating, crackling, cry ( out), fame, lightness, lowing, noise, hold peace, (pro-) claim, proclamation, sing, sound, spark, thunder(-ing), voice, yell.
Source: or "קֹל"; from an unused root meaning to call aloud;

6964.long:
Meaning: "Kolajah", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Kolaiah.
Source: from "H6963" and "H3050"; "voice of Jah";

6965.long:
Meaning: to "rise" (in various applications, literal, figurative, intensive and causative).
Usage: abide, accomplish, × be clearer, confirm, continue, decree, × be dim, endure, × enemy, enjoin, get up, make good, help, hold, (help to) lift up (again), make, × but newly, ordain, perform, pitch, raise (up), rear (up), remain, (a-) rise (up) (again, against), rouse up, set (up), (e-) stablish, (make to) stand (up), stir up, strengthen, succeed, (as-, make) sure(-ly), (be) up(-hold, -rising).
Source: a primitive root;

6966.long:
Usage: appoint, establish, make, raise up self, (a-) rise (up), (make to) stand, set (up).
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H6965"

6967.long:
Meaning: "height".
Usage: × along, height, high, stature, tall.
Source: from "H6965";

6969.long:
Meaning: to "strike a musical note", i.e. "chant" or "wail" (at a funeral).
Usage: lament, mourning woman.
Source: a primitive root;

6970.long:
Meaning: "Koa", a region of Babylon.
Usage: Koa.
Source: probably from "H6972" in the original sense of cutting off; "curtailment";

6971.long:
Meaning: a "monkey".
Usage: ape.
Source: or "קֹף"; of foreign origin,

6972.long:
Meaning: to "spend the harvest" season.
Usage: summer.
Source: a primitive root; to "clip" off; used only as denominative from "H7019";

6973.long:
Meaning: to "be" (causatively, "make") "disgusted" or "anxious".
Usage: abhor, be distressed, be grieved, loathe, vex, be weary.
Source: a primitive root (identical with through the idea of severing oneself from (compare "H6962"));

6974.long:
Meaning: to "awake" (literally or figuratively).
Usage: arise, (be) (a-) wake, watch.
Source: a primitive root (identical with through the idea of abruptness in starting up from sleep (compare "H3364"));

6975.long:
Meaning: a "thorn".
Usage: thorn.
Source: or "קֹץ"; from "H6972" (in the sense of pricking);

6976.long:
Meaning: "Kots", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Koz, Hakkoz (including the article).
Source: the same as "H6975";

6977.long:
Meaning: a "forelock" (as shorn).
Usage: lock.
Source: feminine passive participle of "H6972" in its original sense;

6978.long:
Meaning: "stalwart".
Usage: × meted out.
Source: from "H6957" (in the sense of a "fastening");

6979.long:
Meaning: to "trench"; by implication, to "throw forth"; to "wall up", whether literal (to build a wall) or figurative (to estop).
Usage: break down, cast out, destroy, dig.
Source: a primitive root; also denominative from "H7023"

6980.long:
Meaning: (only plural) "trenches", i.e. a "web" (as if so formed).
Usage: web.
Source: from "H6979";

6981.long:
Meaning: "Kore", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Kore.
Source: or "קֹרֵא"; (1 Chronicles 26:1), active participle of "H7121"; "crier";

6982.long:
Meaning: a "rafter" (forming trenches as it were); by implication, a "roof".
Usage: beam, roof.
Source: or "קֹרָה"; from "H6979";

6983.long:
Meaning: to "set a trap".
Usage: lay a snare.
Source: a primitive root; to bend; used only as denominative for "H3369",

6984.long:
Meaning: "Kushajah", an Israelite.
Usage: Kushaiah.
Source: from the passive participle of "H6983" and "H3050"; "entrapped of Jah";

6985.long:
Meaning: a "little", i.e. (adverbially) "merely".
Usage: very.
Source: from "H6990" in the sense of abbreviation;

6986.long:
Meaning: "ruin".
Usage: destroying, destruction.
Source: from an unused root meaning to cut off;

6989.long:
Meaning: "Keturah", a wife of Abraham.
Usage: Keturah.
Source: feminine passive participle of "H6999"; "perfumed";

6990.long:
Meaning: to "clip off", i.e. (figuratively) "destroy".
Usage: be cut off.
Source: a primitive root;

6991.long:
Meaning: properly, to "cut off", i.e. (figuratively) "put to death".
Usage: kill, slay.
Source: a primitive root;

6994.long:
Meaning: to "diminish", i.e. "be" (causatively, "make") "diminutive" or (figuratively) "of no account".
Usage: be a (make) small (thing), be not worthy.
Source: a primitive root (rather denominative from "H6996");

6995.long:
Meaning: a "pettiness", i.e. the "little finger".
Usage: little finger.
Source: from "H6994";

6996.long:
Meaning: "abbreviated", i.e. "diminutive", literally (in quantity, size or number) or figuratively (in age or importance).
Usage: least, less(-er), little (one), small(-est, one, quantity, thing), young(-er, -est).
Source: or "קָטֹן"; from "H6962";

6997.long:
Meaning: "Katan", an Israelite.
Usage: Hakkatan (including the article).
Source: the same as "H6996"; "small";

6998.long:
Meaning: to "strip off".
Usage: crop off, cut down (up), pluck.
Source: a primitive root;

6999.long:
Meaning: to "smoke", i.e. "turn into fragrance by fire" (especially as an act of worship).
Usage: burn (incense, sacrifice) (upon), (altar for) incense, kindle, offer (incense, a sacrifice).
Source: a primitive root (identical with through the idea of fumigation in a close place and perhaps thus driving out the occupants);

7001.long:
Meaning: a "knot" (as tied up), i.e. (figuratively) a "riddle"; also a "vertebra" (as if a knot).
Usage: doubt, joint.
Source: (Aramaic) from a root corresponding to "H7000";

7003.long:
Meaning: "Kitron", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Kitron.
Source: from "H6999"; "fumigative";

7005.long:
Meaning: "Kattath", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Kattath.
Source: from "H6996"; "littleness";

7008.long:
Meaning: a "fume", i.e. "cloud".
Usage: smoke, vapour.
Source: or "קִיטֹר"; from "H6999";

7009.long:
Meaning: an "opponent" (as rising against one), i.e. (collectively) "enemies".
Usage: substance.
Source: from "H6965";

7010.long:
Meaning: an "edict" (as arising in law).
Usage: decree, statute.
Source: (Aramaic) from "H6966";

7013.long:
Meaning: a "lance" (as striking fast).
Usage: spear.
Source: from "H6969" in the original sense of fixity;

7014.long:
Meaning: "Kajin", the name of the first child, also of a place in Palestine, and of an Oriental tribe.
Usage: Cain, Kenite(-s).
Source: the same as "H7013" (with a play upon the affinity to "H7069");

7015.long:
Meaning: a "dirge" (as accompanied by beating the breasts or on instruments).
Usage: lamentation.
Source: from "H6969";

7016.long:
Meaning: "Kinah", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Kinah.
Source: the same as "H7015";

7017.long:
Meaning: a "Kenite" or member of the tribe of Kajin.
Usage: Kenite.
Source: or "קִינִי"; (1 Chronicles 2:55), patronymic from "H7014";

7018.long:
Meaning: "Kenan", an antediluvian.
Usage: Cainan, Kenan.
Source: from the same as "H7064"; "fixed";

7019.long:
Meaning: "harvest" (as the crop), whether the product (grain or fruit) or the (dry) season.
Usage: summer (fruit, house).
Source: from "H6972";

7023.long:
Meaning: a "wall" (as built in a "trench").
Usage: mason, side, town, × very, wall.
Source: or "קִר"; (Isaiah 22:5), or (feminine) "קִירָה"; from "H6979";

7024.long:
Meaning: "Kir", a place in Assyrian; also one in Moab.
Usage: Kir. Compare "H7025".
Source: the same as "H7023"; "fortress";

7025.long:
Meaning: "Kir-Cheres" or "Kir-Chareseth", a place in Moab.
Usage: Kir-haraseth, Kir-hareseth, Kirharesh, Kir-heres.
Source: or (feminine of the latter word) "קִיר חֲרֶשֶׂת"; from "H7023" and "H2789"; "fortress of earthenware";

7026.long:
Meaning: "Keros", one of the Nethinim.
Usage: Keros.
Source: or "קֵרֹס"; from the same as "H7166"; "ankled";

7027.long:
Meaning: "Kish", the name of five Israelites.
Usage: Kish.
Source: from "H6983"; a "bow";

7028.long:
Meaning: "Kishon", a river of Palestine.
Usage: Kishon, Kison.
Source: from "H6983"; "winding";

7031.long:
Meaning: "light"; (by implication) "rapid" (also adverbial).
Usage: light, swift(-ly).
Source: contracted from "H7043";

7033.long:
Meaning: to "toast", i.e. "scorch" partially or slowly.
Usage: dried, loathsome, parch, roast.
Source: a primitive root (rather identical with "H7034" through the idea of "shrinkage" by heat);

7034.long:
Meaning: to "be light" (as implied in "rapid" motion), but figuratively, only ("be" [causatively, "hold"] "in contempt").
Usage: base, contemn, despise, lightly esteem, set light, seem vile.
Source: a primitive root;

7036.long:
Meaning: "disgrace"; (by implication) the "pudenda".
Usage: confusion, dishonour, ignominy, reproach, shame.
Source: from "H7034";

7037.long:
Meaning: a "kettle".
Usage: caldron.
Source: apparently but a form for "H6747";

7038.long:
Meaning: to "maim".
Usage: lacking in his parts.
Source: a primitive root;

7039.long:
Meaning: "roasted" ears of grain.
Usage: parched corn.
Source: or "קָלִיא"; from "H7033";

7042.long:
Meaning: "Kelita", the name of three Israelites.
Usage: Kelita.
Source: from "H7038"; "maiming";

7043.long:
Meaning: to "be" (causatively, "make") "light", literally ("swift", "small", "sharp", etc.) or figuratively ("easy", "trifling", "vile", etc.).
Usage: abate, make bright, bring into contempt, (ac-) curse, despise, (be) ease(-y, -ier), (be a, make, make somewhat, move, seem a, set) light(-en, -er, -ly, -ly afflict, -ly esteem, thing), × slight(-ly), be swift(-er), (be, be more, make, re-) vile, whet.
Source: a primitive root;

7046.long:
Meaning: to "disparage", i.e. "ridicule".
Usage: mock, scoff, scorn.
Source: a primitive root;

7049.long:
Meaning: to "sling"; also to "carve" (as if a circular motion, or into light forms).
Usage: carve, sling (out).
Source: a primitive root;

7050.long:
Meaning: a "sling"; also a (door) "screen" (as if slung across), or the "valve" (of the door) itself.
Usage: hanging, leaf, sling.
Source: from "H7049";

7053.long:
Meaning: a "prong", i.e. "hay-fork".
Usage: fork.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "prick";

7054.long:
Meaning: something that "rises", i.e. a "stalk" of grain.
Usage: (standing) corn, grown up, stalk.
Source: feminine of active participle of "H6965";

7055.long:
Meaning: "Kemuel", the name of a relative of Abraham, and of two Israelites.
Usage: Kemuel.
Source: from "H6965" and "H410"; "raised of God";

7056.long:
Meaning: "Kamon", a place East of the Jordan.
Usage: Camon.
Source: from "H6965"; an "elevation";

7057.long:
Meaning: a "prickly" plant.
Usage: nettle. Compare "H7063".
Source: or "קִימוֹשׁ"; from an unused root meaning to "sting";

7058.long:
Meaning: "flour".
Usage: flour, meal.
Source: from an unused root probably meaning to "grind";

7059.long:
Meaning: to "pluck", i.e. "destroy".
Usage: cut down, fill with wrinkles.
Source: a primitive root;

7060.long:
Meaning: to "wither".
Usage: hew down, wither.
Source: a primitive root;

7061.long:
Meaning: to "grasp" with the hand.
Usage: take an handful.
Source: a primitive root;

7063.long:
Meaning: "a prickly plant".
Usage: thorn.
Source: from the same as "H7057";

7064.long:
Meaning: a "nest" (as fixed), sometimes including the "nestlings"; figuratively, a "chamber" or "dwelling".
Usage: nest, room.
Source: contracted from "H7077";

7065.long:
Meaning: to "be" (causatively, "make") "zealous", i.e. (in a bad sense) "jealous" or "envious".
Usage: (be) envy(-ious), be (move to, provoke to) jealous(-y), × very, (be) zeal(-ous).
Source: a primitive root;

7068.long:
Meaning: "jealousy" or "envy".
Usage: envy(-ied), jealousy, × sake, zeal.
Source: from "H7065";

7069.long:
Meaning: to "erect", i.e. "create"; by extension, to "procure", especially by purchase (causatively, "sell"); by implication to "own".
Usage: attain, buy(-er), teach to keep cattle, get, provoke to jealousy, possess(-or), purchase, recover, redeem, × surely, × verily.
Source: a primitive root;

7070.long:
Meaning: a "reed" (as "erect"); by resemblance a "rod" (especially for measuring), "shaft", "tube", "stem", the "radius" (of the arm), "beam" (of a steelyard).
Usage: balance, bone, branch, calamus, cane, reed, × spearman, stalk.
Source: from "H7069";

7071.long:
Meaning: "Kanah", the name of a stream and of a place in Palestine.
Usage: Kanah.
Source: feminine of "H7070"; "reediness";

7073.long:
Meaning: "Kenaz", the name of an Edomite and of two Israelites.
Usage: Kenaz.
Source: probably from an unused root meaning to hunt; "hunter";

7074.long:
Meaning: a "Kenizzite" or descendant of Kenaz.
Usage: Kenezite, Kenizzites.
Source: patronymic from "H7073",

7075.long:
Meaning: "creation", i.e. (concretely) "creatures"; also "acquisition", "purchase", "wealth".
Usage: getting, goods, × with money, riches, substance.
Source: from "H7069";

7076.long:
Meaning: "cinnamon" bark (as in "upright" rolls).
Usage: cinnamon.
Source: from an unused root (meaning to "erect");

7077.long:
Meaning: to "nestle", i.e. "build" or "occupy as a nest".
Usage: make...nest.
Source: a primitive root; to erect; but used only as denominative from "H7064";

7078.long:
Meaning: "perversion".
Usage: end.
Source: from an unused root probably meaning to "wrench";

7079.long:
Meaning: "Kenath", a place East of the Jordan.
Usage: Kenath.
Source: from "H7069"; "possession";

7080.long:
Meaning: properly, to "distribute", i.e. "determine by lot" or "magical scroll"; by implication, to "divine".
Usage: divine(-r, -ation), prudent, soothsayer, use (divination).
Source: a primitive root;

7081.long:
Meaning: a "lot"; also "divination" (including its fee), "oracle".
Usage: (reward of) divination, divine sentence, witchcraft.
Source: from "H7080";

7082.long:
Meaning: to "lop off".
Usage: cut off.
Source: a primitive root;

7083.long:
Meaning: properly, a "cup", i.e. an "ink-stand".
Usage: inkhorn.
Source: from the same as "H3563" (or as "H7185");

7084.long:
Meaning: "Keilah", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Keilah.
Source: perhaps from "H7049" in the sense of enclosing; "citadel";

7085.long:
Meaning: an "incision" or "gash".
Usage: mark.
Source: from the same as "H6970";

7086.long:
Meaning: a "bowl" (as "cut" out hollow).
Usage: charger, dish.
Source: probably from "H7167";

7087.long:
Meaning: to "shrink", i.e. "thicken" (as unracked wine, curdled milk, clouded sky, frozen water).
