Usage: congeal, curdle, dark, settle.
Source: a primitive root;

7088.long:
Meaning: to "contract", i.e. roll together.
Usage: cut off.
Source: a primitive root;

7090.long:
Meaning: a species of bird, perhaps the "bittern" (from its "contracted" form).
Usage: bittern.
Source: or "קִפֹּד"; from "H7088";

7091.long:
Meaning: "spring" forward; an "arrow-snake" (as "darting" on its prey).
Usage: great owl.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "contract", i.e.

7092.long:
Meaning: to "draw" together, i.e. close; by implication, to "leap" (by "contracting" the limbs); specifically, to "die" (from "gathering" up the feet).
Usage: shut (up), skip, stop, take out of the way.
Source: a primitive root;

7093.long:
Meaning: an "extremity"; adverbially (with prepositional prefix) "after".
Usage: after, (utmost) border, end, (in-) finite, × process.
Source: contracted from "H7112";

7094.long:
Meaning: to "clip", or (generally) "chop".
Usage: cut down, shorn.
Source: a primitive root;

7095.long:
Meaning: "shape" (as if cut out); "base" (as if there cut off).
Usage: bottom, size.
Source: from "H7094";

7096.long:
Meaning: to "cut" off; (figuratively) to "destroy"; (partially) to "scrape" off.
Usage: cut off, cut short, scrape (off).
Source: a primitive root;

7097.long:
Meaning: an "extremity".
Usage: × after, border, brim, brink, edge, end, (in-) finite, frontier, outmost coast, quarter, shore, (out-) side, × some, ut(-ter-) most (part).
Source: or (negative only) "קֵצֶה"; from "H7096"; (used in a great variety of applications and idioms; compare "H7093")

7098.long:
Meaning: a "termination".
Usage: coast, corner, (selv-) edge, lowest, (uttermost) participle.
Source: feminine of "H7097"; (used like "H7097")

7099.long:
Meaning: a "limit".
Usage: end, edge, uttermost participle.
Source: and (feminine) "קִצְוָה"; from "H7096"; (used like "H7097", but with less variety)

7100.long:
Meaning: "fennel-flower" (from its "pungency").
Usage: fitches.
Source: from an unused root apparently meaning to "incise";

7101.long:
Meaning: a "magistrate" (as "deciding") or other "leader".
Usage: captain, guide, prince, ruler. Compare "H6278".
Source: from "H7096" in the sense of "determining";

7102.long:
Meaning: "cassia" (as peeled; plural the bark).
Usage: cassia.
Source: from "H7106";

7103.long:
Meaning: "Ketsiah", a daughter of Job.
Usage: Kezia.
Source: the same as "H7102";

7104.long:
Meaning: "Keziz", a valley in Palestine.
Usage: Keziz.
Source: from "H7112"; "abrupt";

7105.long:
Meaning: "severed", i.e. "harvest" (as reaped), the "crop", the "time", the "reaper", or figuratively; also a "limb" (of a tree, or simply foliage).
Usage: bough, branch, harvest (man).
Source: from "H7114";

7106.long:
Meaning: to "strip" off, i.e. (partially) "scrape"; by implication, to "segregate" (as an angle).
Usage: cause to scrape, corner.
Source: a primitive root;

7107.long:
Meaning: to "crack" off, i.e. (figuratively) "burst" out in rage.
Usage: (be) anger(-ry), displease, fret self, (provoke to) wrath (come), be wroth.
Source: a primitive root;

7108.long:
Meaning: to "become enraged".
Usage: be furious.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H7107";

7110.long:
Meaning: a "splinter" (as chipped off); figuratively, "rage" or "strife".
Usage: foam, indignation, × sore, wrath.
Source: from "H7107";

7112.long:
Meaning: to "chop off" (literally or figuratively).
Usage: cut (asunder, in pieces, in sunder, off), × utmost.
Source: a primitive root;

7114.long:
Meaning: to "dock off", i.e. "curtail" (transitive or intransitive, literal or figurative); especially to "harvest" (grass or grain).
Usage: × at all, cut down, much discouraged, grieve, harvestman, lothe, mourn, reap(-er), (be, wax) short(-en, -er), straiten, trouble, vex.
Source: a primitive root;

7116.long:
Meaning: "short" (whether in size, number, life, strength or temper).
Usage: few, hasty, small, soon.
Source: from "H7114";

7117.long:
Meaning: a "termination" (literally or figuratively); also (by implication) a "portion"; adverbially (with prepositional prefix) "after".
Usage: end, part, × some.
Source: from "H7096";

7119.long:
Meaning: "cool"; figuratively, "quiet".
Usage: cold, excellent (from the margin).
Source: contracted from an unused root meaning to "chill";

7121.long:
Meaning: to "call out to" (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications).
Usage: bewray (self), that are bidden, call (for, forth, self, upon), cry (unto), (be) famous, guest, invite, mention, (give) name, preach, (make) proclaim(-ation), pronounce, publish, read, renowned, say.
Source: a primitive root (rather identical with "H7122" through the idea of accosting a person met);

7122.long:
Meaning: to "encounter", whether accidentally or in a hostile manner.
Usage: befall, (by) chance, (cause to) come (upon), fall out, happen, meet.
Source: a primitive root;

7124.long:
Meaning: a "caller", i.e. "partridge" (from its cry).
Usage: partridge. See also "H6981".
Source: properly, active participle of "H7121";

7125.long:
Meaning: an "encountering", accidental, friendly or hostile (also adverbially, "opposite").
Usage: × against (he come), help, meet, seek, × to, × in the way.
Source: from "H7122";

7126.long:
Meaning: to "approach" (causatively, "bring near") for whatever purpose.
Usage: (cause to) approach, (cause to) bring (forth, near), (cause to) come (near, nigh), (cause to) draw near (nigh), go (near), be at hand, join, be near, offer, present, produce, make ready, stand, take.
Source: a primitive root;

7127.long:
Usage: approach, come (near, nigh), draw near.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H7126"

7130.long:
Meaning: properly, the "nearest" part, i.e. the "center", whether literal, figurative or adverbial (especially with preposition).
Usage: × among, × before, bowels, × unto charge, eat (up), × heart, × him, × in, inward (× -ly, part, -s, thought), midst, out of, purtenance, × therein, × through, × within self.
Source: from "H7126";

7131.long:
Meaning: "near".
Usage: approach, come (near, nigh), draw near.
Source: from "H7126";

7133.long:
Meaning: something "brought near" the altar, i.e. a sacrificial "present".
Usage: oblation, that is offered, offering.
Source: or "קֻרְבָּן"; from "H7126";

7134.long:
Meaning: an "axe".
Usage: ax.
Source: perhaps from "H6923" in the sense of striking upon;

7136.long:
Meaning: to "light upon" (chiefly by accident); causatively, to "bring about"; specifically, to "impose timbers" (for roof or floor).
Usage: appoint, lay (make) beams, befall, bring, come (to pass unto), floor, (hap) was, happen (unto), meet, send good speed.
Source: a primitive root;

7137.long:
Meaning: an (unfortunate) "occurrence", i.e. some "accidental" (ceremonial) "disqualification".
Usage: uncleanness that chanceth.
Source: from "H7136";

7138.long:
Meaning: "near" (in place, kindred or time).
Usage: allied, approach, at hand, any of kin, kinsfold(-sman), (that is) near (of kin), neighbour, (that is) next, (them that come) nigh (at hand), more ready, short(-ly).
Source: or "קָרֹב"; from "H7126";

7139.long:
Meaning: to "depilate".
Usage: make (self) bald.
Source: a primitive root;

7140.long:
Meaning: "ice" (as if bald, i.e. smooth); hence, "hail"; by resemblance, "rock crystal".
Usage: crystal, frost, ice.
Source: or "קֹרַח"; from "H7139";

7141.long:
Meaning: "Korach", the name of two Edomites and three Israelites.
Usage: Korah.
Source: from "H7139"; "ice";

7142.long:
Meaning: "bald" (on the back of the head).
Usage: bald (head).
Source: from "H7139";

7145.long:
Meaning: "a Korchite" (collectively) or descendants of Korach.
Usage: Korahite, Korathite, sons of Kore, Korhite.
Source: patronymic from "H7141";

7146.long:
Meaning: a "bald" spot (on the back of the head); figuratively, a "threadbare" spot (on the back side of the cloth).
Usage: bald head, bare within.
Source: from "H7139";

7151.long:
Meaning: a "city".
Usage: city.
Source: from "H7136" in the sense of "flooring", i.e. building;

7152.long:
Meaning: "Kerioth", the name of two places in Palestine.
Usage: Kerioth, Kirioth.
Source: plural of "H7151"; "buildings";

7153.long:
Meaning: "Kirjath-Arba" or "Kirjath-ha-Arba", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Kirjath-arba.
Source: or (with the article interposed) "קִרְיַת הָאַרְבַּע"; (Nehemiah 11:25), from "H7151" and "H704" or "H702"; city of Arba, or city of the four (giants);

7154.long:
Meaning: "Kirjath-Baal", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Kirjathbaal.
Source: from "H7151" and "H1168"; city of Baal;

7155.long:
Meaning: "Kirjath-Chutsoth", a place in Moab.
Usage: Kirjath-huzoth.
Source: from "H7151" and the feminine plural of "H2351"; "city of streets";

7156.long:
Meaning: "Kirjathaim", the name of two placed in Palestine.
Usage: Kiriathaim, Kirjathaim.
Source: dual of "H7151"; "double city";

7157.long:
Meaning: "Kirjath-Jearim" or "Kirjath-Arim", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Kirjath, Kirjath-jearim, Kirjath-arim.
Source: or (Jeremiah 26:20) with the article interposed; or (Joshua 18:28) simply the former part of the word; or "קִרְיַת עָרִים"; from "H7151" and the plural of "H3293" or "H5892"; city of forests, or city of towns;

7158.long:
Meaning: "Kirjath-Sannah" or "Kirjath-Sepher", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Kirjath-sannah, Kirjath-sepher.
Source: or "קִרְיַת סֵפֶר"; from "H7151" and a simpler feminine from the same as "H5577", or (for the latter name) "H5612"; city of branches, or of a book;

7160.long:
Meaning: to "shoot out horns"; figuratively, "rays".
Usage: have horns, shine.
Source: a primitive root; to "push" or gore; used only as denominative from "H7161",

7161.long:
Meaning: a "horn" (as projecting); by implication, a "flask", "cornet"; by resemblance. an "elephant's tooth" (i.e. ivory), a "corner" (of the altar), a "peak" (of a mountain), a "ray" (of light); figuratively, "power".
Usage: × hill, horn.
Source: from "H7160";

7162.long:
Meaning: a "horn" (literally or for sound).
Usage: horn, cornet.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H7161";

7163.long:
Meaning: "Keren-hap-Puk", one of Job's daughters.
Usage: Keren-happuch.
Source: from "H7161" and "H6320"; "horn of cosmetic";

7164.long:
Meaning: to "hunch", i.e. be hump-backed.
Usage: stoop.
Source: a primitive root; properly, to "protrude"; used only as denominative from "H7165" (for alliteration with "H7167"),

7165.long:
Meaning: a "knob" or belaying-pin (from its swelling form).
Usage: tache.
Source: from "H7164";

7166.long:
Meaning: an "ankle" (as a protuberance or joint).
Usage: foot.
Source: from "H7164";

7167.long:
Meaning: to "rend", literally or figuratively (revile, paint the eyes, as if enlarging them).
Usage: cut out, rend, × surely, tear.
Source: a primitive root;

7169.long:
Meaning: to "pinch", i.e. (partially) to "bite the lips", "blink the eyes" (as a gesture of malice), or (fully) to "squeeze off" (a piece of clay in order to mould a vessel from it).
Usage: form, move, wink.
Source: a primitive root;

7170.long:
Meaning: "chew him up" (figuratively) "by slander".
Usage: accuse.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H7171" in the sense of a bit (to 'eat the morsels of' any one, i.e.

7172.long:
Meaning: "floor" (as if a pavement of pieces or "tesseræ"), of a building or the sea.
Usage: bottom, (× one side of the) floor.
Source: from "H7167";

7173.long:
Meaning: "Karka" (with the article prefix), a place in Palestine.
Usage: Karkaa.
Source: the same as "H7172"; "ground-floor";

7174.long:
Meaning: "Karkor", a place East of the Jordan.
Usage: Karkor.
Source: from "H6979"; "foundation";

7175.long:
Meaning: a "slab" or plank; by implication, a "deck" of a ship.
Usage: bench, board.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "split" off;

7176.long:
Meaning: a "city".
Usage: city.
Source: from "H7136" in the sense of building;

7177.long:
Meaning: "Kartah", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Kartah.
Source: from "H7176"; "city";

7178.long:
Meaning: "Kartan", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Kartan.
Source: from "H7176"; city-plot;

7180.long:
Meaning: a "cucumber" (from the difficulty of "digestion").
Usage: cucumber.
Source: from an unused root (meaning to be "hard");

7181.long:
Meaning: to "prick up" the ears, i.e. "hearken".
Usage: attend, (cause to) hear(-ken), give heed, incline, mark (well), regard.
Source: a primitive root;

7182.long:
Meaning: a "hearkening".
Usage: × diligently, hearing, much heed, that regarded.
Source: from "H7181";

7184.long:
Meaning: a "jug" (from its shape).
Usage: cover, cup.
Source: or "קַשְׂוָה"; from an unused root meaning to be "round";

7185.long:
Meaning: properly, to "be dense", i.e. tough or "severe" (in various applications).
Usage: be cruel, be fiercer, make grievous, be ((ask a), be in, have, seem, would) hard(-en, (labour), -ly, thing), be sore, (be, make) stiff(-en, (-necked)).
Source: a primitive root;

7186.long:
Meaning: "severe" (in various applications).
Usage: churlish, cruel, grievous, hard((-hearted), thing), heavy, impudent, obstinate, prevailed, rough(-ly), sore, sorrowful, stiff(necked), stubborn, in trouble.
Source: from "H7185";

7189.long:
Meaning: "equity" (as evenly weighed), i.e. "reality".
Usage: truth.
Source: or "קֹשְׁטְ"; from an unused root meaning to balance;

7191.long:
Meaning: "Kishjon", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Kishion, Keshon.
Source: from "H7190"; "hard ground";

7192.long:
Meaning: an "ingot" (as definitely estimated and stamped for a coin).
Usage: piece of money (silver).
Source: from an unused root (probably meaning to weigh out);

7193.long:
Meaning: a "scale" (of a fish); hence a "coat of mail" (as composed of or covered with jointed plates of metal).
Usage: mail, scale.
Source: by reduplication from an unused root meaning to shale off as bark;

7194.long:
Meaning: to "tie", physically ("gird", "confine", "compact") or mentally (in "love", "league").
Usage: bind (up), (make a) conspire(-acy, -ator), join together, knit, stronger, work (treason).
Source: a primitive root;

7197.long:
Meaning: to "forage for straw", "stubble" or "wood"; figuratively, to "assemble".
Usage: gather (selves) (together).
Source: a primitive root; to become sapless through drought; used only as denominative from "H7179";

7198.long:
Meaning: a "bow", for shooting (hence, figuratively, "strength") or the "iris".
Usage: × arch(-er), arrow, bow(-man, -shot).
Source: from "H7185" in the original sense (of "H6983") of bending;

7200.long:
Meaning: to "see", literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative).
Usage: advise self, appear, approve, behold, × certainly, consider, discern, (make to) enjoy, have experience, gaze, take heed, × indeed, × joyfully, lo, look (on, one another, one on another, one upon another, out, up, upon), mark, meet, × be near, perceive, present, provide, regard, (have) respect, (fore-, cause to, let) see(-r, -m, one another), shew (self), × sight of others, (e-) spy, stare, × surely, × think, view, visions.
Source: a primitive root;

7201.long:
Meaning: a "bird of prey" (probably the vulture, from its sharp sight).
Usage: glede. Compare "H1676".
Source: from "H7200";

7203.long:
Meaning: a "seer" (as often rendered); but also (abstractly) a "vision".
Usage: vision.
Source: active participle of "H7200";

7204.long:
Meaning: "Roeh", an Israelite.
Usage: Haroeh (including the article).
Source: for "H7203"; prophet;

7205.long:
Meaning: "Reuben", a son of Jacob.
Usage: Reuben.
Source: from the imperative of "H7200" and "H1121"; "see ye a son";

7206.long:
Meaning: a "Reubenite" or descendant of Reuben.
Usage: children of Reuben, Reubenites.
Source: patronymic from "H7205";

7208.long:
Meaning: "Reumah", a Syrian woman.
Usage: Reumah.
Source: feminine passive participle of "H7213"; "raised";

7210.long:
Meaning: "sight", whether abstractly ("vision") or concretely (a "spectacle").
Usage: gazingstock, look to, (that) see(-th).
Source: from "H7200";

7211.long:
Meaning: "Reajah", the name of three Israelites.
Usage: Reaia, Reaiah.
Source: from "H7200" and "H3050"; "Jah has seen";

7213.long:
Meaning: to "rise".
Usage: be lifted up.
Source: a primitive root;

7214.long:
Meaning: a "wild bull" (from its conspicuousness).
Usage: unicorn.
Source: or "רְאֵים"; or "רֵים"; or "רֵם"; from "H7213";

7215.long:
Meaning: something "high in value", i.e. perhaps "coral".
Usage: coral.
Source: from "H7213";

7216.long:
Meaning: "Ramoth", the name of two places in Palestine.
Usage: Ramoth.
Source: or "רָאמֹת"; plural of "H7215"; "heights";

7217.long:
Meaning: the "head"; figuratively, the "sum".
Usage: chief, head, sum.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H7218";

7218.long:
Meaning: the "head" (as most easily shaken), whether literal or figurative (in many applications, of place, time, rank, itc.).
Usage: band, beginning, captain, chapiter, chief(-est place, man, things), company, end, × every (man), excellent, first, forefront, (be-)head, height, (on) high(-est part, (priest)), × lead, × poor, principal, ruler, sum, top.
Source: from an unused root apparently meaning to shake;

7219.long:
Meaning: a "poisonous plant", probably the "poppy" (from its conspicuous head); generally "poison" (even of serpents).
Usage: gall, hemlock, poison, venom.
Source: or "רוֹשׁ"; (Deuteronomy 32:32), apparently the same as "H7218";

7220.long:
Meaning: "Rosh", the name of an Israelite and of a foreign nation.
Usage: Rosh.
Source: probably the same as "H7218";

7221.long:
Meaning: a "beginning".
Usage: beginning.
Source: from the same as "H7218";

7223.long:
Meaning: "first", in place, time or rank (as adjective or noun).
Usage: ancestor, (that were) before(-time), beginning, eldest, first, fore(-father) (-most), former (thing), of old time, past.
Source: or "רִאשֹׁן"; from "H7221";

7225.long:
Meaning: the "first", in place, time, order or rank (specifically, a "firstfruit").
Usage: beginning, chief(-est), first(-fruits, part, time), principal thing.
Source: from the same as "H7218";

7226.long:
Meaning: "a pillow" (being for the head).
Usage: bolster.
Source: from "H7218";

7227.long:
Meaning: "abundant" (in quantity, size, age, number, rank, quality).
Usage: (in) abound(-undance, -ant, -antly), captain, elder, enough, exceedingly, full, great(-ly, man, one), increase, long (enough, (time)), (do, have) many(-ifold, things, a time), (ship-)master, mighty, more, (too, very) much, multiply(-tude), officer, often(-times), plenteous, populous, prince, process (of time), suffice(-lent).
Source: by contracted from "H7231";

7228.long:
Meaning: an "archer".
Usage: archer.
Source: by contraction from "H7232"; (or perhaps the same as "H7227")

7229.long:
Usage: captain, chief, great, lord, master, stout.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H7227"

7230.long:
Meaning: "abundance" (in any respect).
Usage: abundance(-antly), all, × common (sort), excellent, great(-ly, -ness, number), huge, be increased, long, many, more in number, most, much, multitude, plenty(-ifully), × very (age).
Source: from "H7231";

7231.long:
Meaning: properly, to "cast together" , i.e. "increase", especially in number; to "multiply by the myriad".
Usage: increase, be many(-ifold), be more, multiply, ten thousands.
Source: a primitive root; (compare "H7241"); also as denominative from "H7233";

7232.long:
Meaning: to "shoot" an arrow.
Usage: shoot.
Source: a primitive root (rather identical with "H7231" through the idea of projection);

7233.long:
Meaning: "abundance" (in number), i.e. (specifically) a "myriad" (whether definite or indefinite).
Usage: many, million, × multiply, ten thousand.
Source: from "H7231";

7235.long:
Meaning: to "increase" (in whatever respect).
Usage: (bring in) abundance (× -antly), archer (by mistake for "H7232"), be in authority, bring up, × continue, enlarge, excel, exceeding(-ly), be full of, (be, make) great(-er, -ly, × -ness), grow up, heap, increase, be long, (be, give, have, make, use) many (a time), (any, be, give, give the, have) more (in number), (ask, be, be so, gather, over, take, yield) much (greater, more), (make to) multiply, nourish, plenty(-eous), × process (of time), sore, store, thoroughly, very.
Source: a primitive root;

7236.long:
Usage: make a great man, grow.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H7235"

7237.long:
Meaning: "Rabbah", the name of two places in Palestine, East and West.
Usage: Rabbah, Rabbath.
Source: feminine of "H7227"; "great";

7238.long:
Meaning: "increase" (of dignity).
Usage: greatness, majesty.
Source: (Aramaic) from a root corresponding to "H7235";

7239.long:
Meaning: a "myriad", i.e. indefinitely, "large number".
Usage: great things, ten ((eight) -een, (for) -ty, sixscore, threescore, × twenty, (twen) -ty) thousand.
Source: from "H7231"; or "רִבּוֹא" from "H7231";

7240.long:
Usage: × ten thousand times ten thousand.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H7239"

7241.long:
Meaning: a "rain" (as an "accumulation" of drops).
Usage: shower.
Source: from "H7231";

7242.long:
Meaning: a "collar" (as spread around the neck).
Usage: chain.
Source: from "H7234";

7243.long:
Meaning: "fourth"; also (fractionally) a "fourth".
Usage: foursquare, fourth (part).
Source: or "רְבִעִי"; from "H7251";

7245.long:
Meaning: "Rabbith", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Rabbith.
Source: from "H7231"; "multitude";

7246.long:
Meaning: to "soak" (bread in oil).
Usage: baken, (that which is) fried.
Source: a primitive root;

7247.long:
Meaning: "Riblah", a place in Syria.
Usage: Riblah.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "be fruitful"; "fertile";

7248.long:
Meaning: "Rab-Mag", a Babylonian official.
Usage: Rab-mag.
Source: from "H7227" and a foreign word for a Magian; chief Magian;

7249.long:
Meaning: "Rab-Saris", a Babylonian official.
Usage: Rab-saris.
Source: from "H7227" and a foreign word for a eunuch; chief chamberlain;

7250.long:
Meaning: to "squat" or "lie" out flat, i.e. (specifically) in copulation.
Usage: let gender, lie down.
Source: a primitive root;

7251.long:
Meaning: to "be quadrate".
Usage: (four-) square(-d).
Source: a primitive root (rather identical with "H7250" through the idea of sprawling 'at all fours' (or possibly the reverse is the order of deriv.); compare "H702"); properly, to be four (sided); used only as denominative of "H7253";

7253.long:
Meaning: a "fourth" (part or side).
Usage: fourth part, side, square.
Source: from "H7251";

7254.long:
Meaning: "Reba", a Midianite.
Usage: Reba.
Source: the same as "H7253";

7256.long:
Meaning: a descendant of the "fourth" generation, i.e. "great great grandchild".
Usage: fourth.
Source: from "H7251";

7257.long:
Meaning: to "crouch" (on all four legs folded, like a recumbent animal); by implication, to "recline", "repose", "brood", "lurk", "imbed".
Usage: crouch (down), fall down, make a fold, lay, (cause to, make to) lie (down), make to rest, sit.
Source: a primitive root;

7258.long:
Meaning: a "couch" or place of repose.
Usage: where each lay, lie down in, resting place.
Source: from "H7257";

7259.long:
Meaning: "Ribkah", the wife of Isaac.
Usage: Rebekah.
Source: from an unused root probably meaning to clog by tying up the fetlock; fettering (by beauty);

7262.long:
Meaning: "Rabshakeh", a Babylonian official.
Usage: Rabshakeh.
Source: from "H7227" and "H8248"; "chief butler";

7263.long:
Meaning: a "lump of clay".
Usage: clod.
Source: from an unused root meaning to pile together;

7264.long:
Meaning: to "quiver" (with any violent emotion, especially anger or fear).
Usage: be afraid, stand in awe, disquiet, fall out, fret, move, provoke, quake, rage, shake, tremble, trouble, be wroth.
Source: a primitive root;

7267.long:
Meaning: "commotion", "restlessness" (of a horse), "crash" (of thunder), "disquiet", "anger".
Usage: fear, noise, rage, trouble(-ing), wrath.
Source: from "H7264";

7270.long:
Meaning: to "walk along"; but only in specifically, applications, to "reconnoiter", to "be a tale-bearer" (i.e. slander); to "lead about".
Usage: backbite, search, slander, (e-) spy (out), teach to go, view.
Source: a primitive root; also as denominative from "H7272"

7272.long:
Meaning: a "foot" (as used in walking); by implication, a "step"; by euphemistically the "pudenda".
Usage: × be able to endure, × according as, × after, × coming, × follow, (broken-)foot(-ed, -stool), × great toe, × haunt, × journey, leg, piss, possession, time.
Source: from "H7270";

7274.long:
Meaning: "Rogelim", a place East of the Jordan.
Usage: Rogelim.
Source: plural of active participle of "H7270"; fullers (as tramping the cloth in washing);

7275.long:
Meaning: to "cast together" (stones), i.e. to "lapidate".
Usage: × certainly, stone.
Source: a primitive root (compare "H7263", "H7321", "H7551");

7277.long:
Meaning: a "pile" (of stones), i.e. (figuratively) a "throng".
Usage: council.
Source: feminine of the same as "H7276";

7278.long:
Meaning: "Regem-Melek", an Israelite.
Usage: Regem-melech.
Source: from "H7276" and "H4428"; "king's heap";

7279.long:
Meaning: to "grumble", i.e. "rebel".
Usage: murmur.
Source: a primitive root;

7280.long:
Meaning: properly, to "toss" violently and suddenly (the sea with waves, the skin with boils); figuratively (in a favorable manner) to "settle", i.e. quiet; specifically, to "wink" (from the motion of the eye-lids).
Usage: break, divide, find ease, be a moment, (cause, give, make to) rest, make suddenly.
Source: a primitive root;

7281.long:
Meaning: a "wink" (of the eyes), i.e. a very "short space" of time.
Usage: instant, moment, space, suddenly.
Source: from "H7280".

7283.long:
Meaning: to "be tumultuous".
Usage: rage.
Source: a primitive root;

7285.long:
Meaning: a tumultuous "crowd".
Usage: company, insurrection.
Source: or (feminine) "רִגְשָׁה"; from "H7283";

7286.long:
Meaning: to "tread" in pieces, i.e. (figuratively) to "conquer", or (specifically) to "overlay".
Usage: spend, spread, subdue.
Source: a primitive root;

7287.long:
Meaning: to "tread" down, i.e. "subjugate"; specifically, to "crumble" off.
Usage: (come to, make to) have dominion, prevail against, reign, (bear, make to) rule,(-r, over), take.
Source: a primitive root;

7289.long:
Meaning: a "veil" (as expanded).
Usage: vail, veil.
Source: from "H7286" in the sense of "spreading";

7290.long:
Meaning: to "stun", i.e. "stupefy" (with sleep or death).
Usage: (be fast a-, be in a deep, cast into a dead, that) sleep(-er, -eth).
Source: a primitive root;

7291.long:
Meaning: to "run after" (usually with hostile intent; figuratively [of time] "gone by").
Usage: chase, put to flight, follow (after, on), hunt, (be under) persecute(-ion, -or), pursue(-r).
Source: a primitive root;

7292.long:
Meaning: to "urge" severely, i.e. (figuratively) "importune", "embolden", "capture", "act insolently".
Usage: overcome, behave self proudly, make sure, strengthen.
Source: a primitive root;

7294.long:
Meaning: "Rahab" (i.e. "boaster"), an epithet of Egypt.
Usage: Rahab.
Source: the same as "H7293";

7297.long:
Meaning: to "fear".
Usage: be afraid.
Source: a primitive root;

7298.long:
Meaning: a "channel" or watering-box; by resemblance a "ringlet" of hair (as forming parallel lines).
Usage: gallery, gutter, trough.
Source: from an unused root apparently meaning to "hollow out";

7299.long:
Meaning: "aspect".
Usage: form.
Source: (Aramaic) from a root corresponding to "H7200";

7300.long:
Meaning: to "tramp about", i.e. "ramble" (free or disconsolate).
Usage: have the dominion, be lord, mourn, rule.
Source: a primitive root;

7301.long:
Meaning: to "slake" the thirst (occasionally of other appetites).
Usage: bathe, make drunk, (take the) fill, satiate, (abundantly) satisfy, soak, water (abundantly).
Source: a primitive root;

7303.long:
Meaning: "Rohagah", an Israelite.
Usage: Rohgah.
Source: from an unused root probably meaning to cry out; "outcry";

7304.long:
Meaning: properly, to "breathe" freely, i.e. "revive"; by implication, to "have ample room".
Usage: be refreshed, large.
Source: a primitive root (identical with "H7306");

7305.long:
Meaning: "room", literally (an interval) or figuratively (deliverance).
Usage: enlargement, space.
Source: from "H7304";

7306.long:
Meaning: properly, to "blow", i.e. "breathe"; only (literally) to "smell" or (by implication, perceive (figuratively, to anticipate, enjoy).
Usage: accept, smell, × touch, make of quick understanding.
Source: a primitive root;

7307.long:
Meaning: "wind"; by resemblance "breath", i.e. a sensible (or even violent) "exhalation"; figuratively, "life", "anger", "unsubstantiality"; by extension, a "region of the sky"; by resemblance "spirit", but only of a rational being (including its expression and functions).
Usage: air, anger, blast, breath, × cool, courage, mind, × quarter, × side, spirit(-ual), tempest, × vain, (whirl-) wind(-y).
Source: from "H7306";

7311.long:
Meaning: to "be high" actively, to "rise" or "raise" (in various applications, literally or figuratively).
Usage: bring up, exalt (self), extol, give, go up, haughty, heave (up), (be, lift up on, make on, set up on, too) high(-er, one), hold up, levy, lift(-er) up, (be) lofty, (× a-) loud, mount up, offer (up), presumptuously, (be) promote(-ion), proud, set up, tall(-er), take (away, off, up), breed worms.
Source: a primitive root;

7312.long:
Meaning: (literally) "elevation" or (figuratively) "elation".
Usage: haughtiness, height, × high.
Source: or "רֻם"; from "H7311";

7313.long:
Usage: extol, lift up (self), set up.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H7311";

7316.long:
Meaning: "Rumah", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Rumah.
Source: from "H7311"; "height";

7318.long:
Meaning: "exaltation", i.e. (figuratively and specifically) "praise".
Usage: be extolled.
Source: from "H7426";

7319.long:
Meaning: "exaltation", i.e. "praise".
Usage: high.
Source: feminine active participle of "H7426";

7320.long:
Meaning: "Romamti-Ezer", an Israelite.
Usage: Romamti-ezer.
Source: (or Romam from "H7311" and "H5828"; "I have raised up a help";

7321.long:
Meaning: to "mar" (especially by breaking); figuratively, to "split" the ears (with sound), i.e. "shout" (for alarm or joy).
Usage: blow an alarm, cry (alarm, aloud, out), destroy, make a joyful noise, smart, shout (for joy), sound an alarm, triumph.
Source: a primitive root;

7322.long:
Meaning: properly, to "triturate" (in a mortar), i.e. (figuratively) to "agitate" (by concussion).
Usage: tremble.
Source: a primitive root;

7323.long:
Meaning: to "run" (for whatever reason, especially to "rush").
Usage: break down, divide speedily, footman, guard, bring hastily, (make) run (away, through), post.
Source: a primitive root;

7324.long:
Meaning: to "pour" out (literally or figuratively), i.e. "empty".
Usage: × arm, cast out, draw (out), (make) empty, pour forth (out).
Source: a primitive root;

7325.long:
Meaning: to "slaver" (with spittle), i.e. (by analogy) to "emit a fluid" (ulcerous or natural).
Usage: run.
Source: a primitive root;

7326.long:
Meaning: to "be destitute".
Usage: lack, needy, (make self) poor (man).
Source: a primitive root;

7328.long:
Meaning: to "attenuate", i.e. (figuratively) "hide"; a "mystery".
Usage: secret.
Source: (Aramaic) from an unused root probably meaning

7329.long:
Meaning: to "emaciate", i.e. "make" ("become") "thin" (literally or figuratively).
Usage: famish, wax lean.
Source: a primitive root;

7335.long:
Meaning: to "twinkle the eye" (in mockery).
Usage: wink.
Source: a primitive root;

7336.long:
Meaning: probably to be "heavy", i.e. (figuratively) "honorable".
Usage: prince, ruler.
Source: a primitive root;

7337.long:
Meaning: to "broaden" (intransitive or transitive, literal or figurative).
Usage: be an en-(make) large(-ing), make room, make (open) wide.
Source: a primitive root;

7339.long:
Meaning: a "width", i.e. (concretely) "avenue" or "area".
Usage: broad place (way), street. See also "H1050".
Source: or "רְחוֹב"; from "H7337";

7340.long:
Meaning: "Rechob", the name of a place in Syria, also of a Syrian and an Israelite.
Usage: Rehob.
Source: or "רְחוֹב"; the same as "H7339";

7341.long:
Meaning: "width" (literally or figuratively).
Usage: breadth, broad, largeness, thickness, wideness.
Source: from "H7337";

7342.long:
Meaning: "roomy", in any (or every) direction, literally or figuratively.
Usage: broad, large, at liberty, proud, wide.
Source: from "H7337";

7343.long:
Meaning: "Rachab", a Canaanitess.
Usage: Rahab.
Source: the same as "H7342"; "proud";

7344.long:
Meaning: "Rechoboth", a place in Assyria and one in Palestine.
Usage: Rehoboth.
Source: or "רְחֹבֹת"; plural of "H7339"; "streets";

7345.long:
Meaning: "Rechabjah", an Israelite.
Usage: Rehabiah.
Source: or "רְחַבְיָהוּ"; from "H7337" and "H3050"; "Jah has enlarged";

7346.long:
Meaning: "Rechabam", an Israelite king.
Usage: Rehoboam.
Source: from "H7337" and "H5971"; a "people has enlarged";

7347.long:
Meaning: a "mill"-stone.
Usage: mill (stone).
Source: from an unused root meaning to "pulverize";

7348.long:
Meaning: "Rechum", the name of a Persian and of three Israelites.
Usage: Rehum.
Source: a form of "H7349";

7350.long:
Meaning: "remote", literally or figuratively, of place or time; specifically, "precious"; often used adverbially (with preposition).
Usage: (a-) far (abroad, off), long ago, of old, space, great while to come.
Source: or "רָחֹק"; from "H7368";

7351.long:
Meaning: a "panel" (as resembling a trough).
Usage: rafter.
Source: from the same as "H7298";

7353.long:
Meaning: a "ewe" [the "females" being the predominant element of a flock] (as a good "traveller").
Usage: ewe, sheep.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "journey";

7354.long:
Meaning: "Rachel", a wife of Jacob.
Usage: Rachel.
Source: the same as "H7353";

7355.long:
Meaning: to "fondle"; by implication, to "love", especially to "compassionate".
Usage: have compassion (on, upon), love, (find, have, obtain, shew) mercy(-iful, on, upon), (have) pity, Ruhamah, × surely.
Source: a primitive root;

7356.long:
Meaning: "compassion" (in the plural); by extension, the "womb" (as "cherishing" the fetus); by implication, a "maiden".
Usage: bowels, compassion, damsel, tender love, (great, tender) mercy, pity, womb.
Source: from "H7355";

7357.long:
Meaning: "Racham", an Israelite.
Usage: Raham.
Source: the same as "H7356"; "pity";

7360.long:
Meaning: a "kind of vulture" (supposed to be tender towards its young).
Usage: gier-eagle.
Source: or (feminine) "רָחָמָה"; from "H7355";

7363.long:
Meaning: to "brood"; by implication, to "be relaxed".
Usage: flutter, move, shake.
Source: a primitive root;

7364.long:
Meaning: to "lave" (the whole or a part of a thing).
Usage: bathe (self), wash (self).
Source: a primitive root;

7365.long:
Meaning: to "attend upon".
Usage: trust.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H7364" (probably through the accessory idea of ministering as a servant at the bath);

7368.long:
Meaning: to "widen" (in any direction), i.e. (intransitively) "recede" or (transitively) "remove" (literally or figuratively, of place or relation).
Usage: (a-, be, cast, drive, get, go, keep (self), put, remove, be too, (wander), withdraw) far (away, off), loose, × refrain, very, (be) a good way (off).
Source: a primitive root;

7371.long:
Meaning: a "winnowing"-fork (as blowing the chaff away).
Usage: shovel.
Source: from "H7306";

7372.long:
Meaning: to "be moist".
Usage: be wet.
Source: a primitive root;

7374.long:
Meaning: "terror".
Usage: fear.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "tremble";

7375.long:
Meaning: to "be rejuvenated".
Usage: be fresh.
Source: a root compounded from "H7373" and "H2954";

7376.long:
Meaning: to "dash" down.
Usage: dash (in pieces).
Source: a primitive root;

7378.long:
Meaning: properly, to "toss", i.e. "grapple"; mostly figuratively, to "wrangle", i.e. "hold a controversy"; (by implication) to "defend".
Usage: adversary, chide, complain, contend, debate, × ever, × lay wait, plead, rebuke, strive, × thoroughly.
Source: or "רוּב"; a primitive root;

7379.long:
Meaning: a "contest" (personal or legal).
Usage: adversary, cause, chiding, contend(-tion), controversy, multitude (from the margin), pleading, strife, strive(-ing), suit.
Source: or "רִב"; from "H7378";

7381.long:
Meaning: "odor" (as if blown).
Usage: savour, scent, smell.
Source: from "H7306";

7383.long:
Meaning: (only plural), "grits" (as pounded).
Usage: ground corn, wheat.
Source: or "רִפָה"; from "H7322";

7384.long:
Meaning: "Riphath", a grandson of Japheth and his descendants.
Usage: Riphath.
Source: or (probably by orthographical error) "דִּיפַת"; of foreign origin;

7385.long:
Meaning: "emptiness"; figuratively, a "worthless" thing; adverbially, "in vain".
Usage: empty, to no purpose, (in) vain (thing), vanity.
Source: from "H7324";

7386.long:
Meaning: "empty"; figuratively, "worthless".
Usage: emptied(-ty), vain (fellow, man).
Source: or (shorter) "רֵק"; from "H7324";

7387.long:
Meaning: "emptily"; figuratively (objective) "ineffectually", (subjective) "undeservedly".
Usage: without cause, empty, in vain, void.
Source: from "H7386";

7388.long:
Meaning: "saliva"; by resemblance, "broth".
Usage: spittle, white (of an egg).
Source: from "H7325";

7390.long:
Meaning: "tender" (literally or figuratively); by implication, "weak".
Usage: faint((-hearted), soft, tender ((-hearted), one), weak.
Source: from "H7401";

7392.long:
Meaning: to "ride" (on an animal or in a vehicle); causatively, to "place upon" (for riding or generally), to "despatch".
Usage: bring (on (horse-) back), carry, get (oneself) up, on (horse-) back, put, (cause to, make to) ride (in a chariot, on, -r), set.
Source: a primitive root;

7393.long:
Meaning: a "vehicle"; by implication, a "team"; by extension, "cavalry"; by analogy a "rider", i.e. "the upper millstone".
Usage: chariot, (upper) millstone, multitude (from the margin), wagon.
Source: from "H7392";

7394.long:
Meaning: "Rekab", the name of two Arabs and of two Israelites.
Usage: Rechab.
Source: from "H7392"; "rider";

7395.long:
Meaning: a "charioteer".
Usage: chariot man, driver of a chariot, horseman.
Source: from "H7392";

7397.long:
Meaning: "Rekah", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Rechah.
Source: probably feminine from "H7401"; "softness";

7398.long:
Meaning: a "vehicle" (as ridden on).
Usage: chariot.
Source: from passive participle of "H7392";

7399.long:
Meaning: "property" (as gathered).
Usage: good, riches, substance.
Source: or "רְכֻשׁ"; from passive participle of "H7408";

7400.long:
Meaning: a "scandal-monger" (as travelling about).
Usage: slander, carry tales, talebearer.
Source: from "H7402"

7401.long:
Meaning: to "soften" (intransitively or transitively), used figuratively.
Usage: (be) faint(-hearted), mollify, (be, make) soft(-er), be tender.
Source: a primitive root;

7402.long:
Meaning: to "travel for trading".
Usage: (spice) merchant.
Source: a primitive root;

7403.long:
Meaning: "Rakal", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Rachal.
Source: from "H7402"; "merchant";

7404.long:
Meaning: "trade" (as peddled).
Usage: merchandise, traffic.
Source: feminine passive participle of "H7402";

7406.long:
Meaning: a mountain "ridge" (as of "tied" summits).
Usage: rough place.
Source: from "H7405";

7408.long:
Meaning: to "lay up", i.e. "collect".
Usage: gather, get.
Source: a primitive root;

7409.brief: relay of animals on a post-route
7409.long:
Meaning: a "relay of animals on a post-route" (as stored up for that purpose); by implication, a "courser".
Usage: dromedary, mule, swift beast.
Source: from "H7408";

7410.long:
Meaning: "Ram", the name of an Arabian and of an Israelite.
Usage: Ram. See also "H1027".
Source: active participle of "H7311"; "high";

7411.long:
Meaning: to "hurl"; specifically, to "shoot"; figuratively, to "delude" or "betray" (as if causing to fall).
Usage: beguile, betray, (bow-) man, carry, deceive, throw.
Source: a primitive root;

7413.long:
Meaning: a "height" (as a seat of idolatry).
Usage: high place.
Source: feminine active participle of "H7311";

7414.long:
Meaning: "Ramah", the name of four places in Palestine.
Usage: Ramah.
Source: the same as "H7413";

7415.long:
Meaning: a "maggot" (as rapidly "bred"), literally or figuratively.
Usage: worm.
Source: from "H7426" in the sense of "breeding" (compare "H7311");

7416.long:
Meaning: a "pomegranate", the tree (from its upright growth) or the fruit (also an artificial ornament).
Usage: pomegranate.
Source: or "רִמֹּן"; from "H7426";

7417.long:
Meaning: "Rimmon", the name of a Syrian deity, also of five places in Palestine.
Usage: Remmon, Rimmon.
Source: or (shorter) ("רִמֹּן"; or "רִמּוֹנוֹ"; (1 Chronicles 6:62 (77)), the same as "H7416"; in Joshua 19:13: "הַמְּתֹאָר" is mistaken for part of a name; article with the passive participle of "H8388"; the (one) marked off, i.e. which pertains).

7418.long:
Meaning: "Ramoth-Negeb" or "Ramath-Negeb", a place in Palestine.
Usage: south Ramoth, Ramath of the south.
Source: or "רָמַת נֶגֶב"; from the plural or construct form of "H7413" and "H5045"; heights (or height) of the South;

7420.long:
Meaning: a "lance" (as "thrown"); especially the iron "point".
Usage: buckler, javelin, lancet, spear.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "hurl";

7422.long:
Meaning: "Ramjah", an Israelite.
Usage: Ramiah.
Source: from "H7311" and "H3050"; "Jah has raised";

7423.long:
Meaning: "remissness", "treachery".
Usage: deceit(-ful, -fully), false, guile, idle, slack, slothful.
Source: from "H7411";

7424.long:
Meaning: a "brood mare".
Usage: dromedary.
Source: of foreign origin;

7425.long:
Meaning: "Remaljah", an Israelite.
Usage: Remaliah.
Source: from an unused root and "H3050" (perhaps meaning to "deck"); "Jah has bedecked";

7426.long:
Meaning: to "rise" (literally or figuratively).
Usage: exalt, get (oneself) up, lift up (self), mount up.
Source: a primitive root;

7427.long:
Meaning: "exaltation".
Usage: lifting up of self.
Source: from the active participle of "H7426";

7428.long:
Meaning: "Rimmon-Perets", a place in the Desert.
Usage: Rimmon-parez.
Source: from "H7416" and "H6556"; "pomegranate of the breach";

7429.long:
Meaning: to "tread" upon (as a potter, in walking or abusively).
Usage: oppressor, stamp upon, trample (under feet), tread (down, upon).
Source: a primitive root;

7430.long:
Meaning: properly, to "glide swiftly", i.e. to "crawl" or "move with short steps"; by analogy to "swarm".
Usage: creep, move.
Source: a primitive root;

7431.long:
Meaning: a "reptile" or any other rapidly moving animal.
Usage: that creepeth, creeping (moving) thing.
Source: from "H7430";

7432.long:
Meaning: "Remeth", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Remeth.
Source: from "H7411"; height;

7433.long:
Meaning: "Ramoth-Gilad", a place East of the Jordan.
Usage: Ramoth-gilead, Ramoth in Gilead. See also "H7216".
Source: or "רָמוֹת גִּלעָד"; (2 Chronicles 22:5), from the plural of "H7413" and "H1568"; "heights of Gilad";

7434.long:
Meaning: "Ramath-ham-Mitspeh", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Ramath-mizpeh.
Source: from "H7413" and "H4707" with the article interpolated; height of the watch-tower;

7435.long:
Meaning: a "Ramathite" or inhabitant of Ramah.
Usage: Ramathite.
Source: patronymic of "H7414";

7436.long:
Meaning: "Ramathajim-Tsophim", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Ramathaimzophim.
Source: from the dual of "H7413" and the plural of the active participle of "H6822"; double height of watchers;

7437.long:
Meaning: "Ramath-Lechi", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Ramath-lehi.
Source: from "H7413" and "H3895"; height of a jaw-bone;

7440.long:
Meaning: properly, a "creaking" (or shrill sound), i.e. "shout" (of joy or grief).
Usage: cry, gladness, joy, proclamation, rejoicing, shouting, sing(-ing), triumph.
Source: from "H7442";

7441.long:
Meaning: "Rinnah", an Israelite.
Usage: Rinnah.
Source: the same as "H7440";

7442.long:
Meaning: properly, to "creak" (or emit a stridulous sound), i.e. to "shout" (usually for joy).
Usage: aloud for joy, cry out, be joyful (greatly, make to) rejoice, (cause to) shout (for joy), (cause to) sing (aloud, for joy, out), triumph.
Source: a primitive root;

7445.long:
Meaning: a "shout" (for joy).
Usage: joyful (voice), singing, triumphing.
Source: from "H7442";

7446.long:
Meaning: "Rissah", a place in the Desert.
Usage: Rissah.
Source: from "H7450"; a "ruin" (as "dripping" to pieces);

7447.long:
Meaning: properly, "dripping" to pieces, i.e. a "ruin"; also a dew-"drop".
Usage: breach, drop.
Source: from "H7450";

7448.long:
Meaning: a "halter" (as "restraining"); by implication, the "jaw".
Usage: bridle.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "curb";

7449.long:
Meaning: "Resen", a place in Assyrian.
Usage: Resen.
Source: the same as "H7448";

7450.long:
Meaning: to "moisten" (with drops).
Usage: temper.
Source: a primitive root; to comminute; used only as denominative from "H7447",

7451.long:
Meaning: "bad" or (as noun) "evil" (natural or moral).
Usage: adversity, affliction, bad, calamity, displease(-ure), distress, evil((-favouredness), man, thing), exceedingly, × great, grief(-vous), harm, heavy, hurt(-ful), ill (favoured), mark, mischief(-vous), misery, naught(-ty), noisome, not please, sad(-ly), sore, sorrow, trouble, vex, wicked(-ly, -ness, one), worse(-st), wretchedness, wrong. (Incl. feminine raaah; as adjective or noun.).
Source: from "H7489";

7452.long:
Meaning: a "crash" (of thunder), "noise" (of war), "shout" (of joy).
Usage: × aloud, noise, shouted.
Source: from "H7321";

7453.long:
Meaning: an "associate" (more or less close).
Usage: brother, companion, fellow, friend, husband, lover, neighbour, × (an-) other.
Source: or "רֵיעַ"; from "H7462";

7454.long:
Meaning: a "thought" (as association of ideas).
Usage: thought.
Source: from "H7462";

7455.long:
Meaning: "badness" (as "marring"), physically or morally.
Usage: × be so bad, badness, (× be so) evil, naughtiness, sadness, sorrow, wickedness.
Source: from "H7489";

7456.long:
Meaning: to "hunger".
Usage: (suffer to) famish, (be, have, suffer, suffer to) hunger(-ry).
Source: a primitive root;

7457.long:
Meaning: "hungry" (more or less intensely).
Usage: hunger bitten, hungry.
Source: from "H7456";

7458.long:
Meaning: "hunger" (more or less extensive).
Usage: dearth, famine, famished, hunger.
Source: from "H7456";

7460.long:
Meaning: to "shudder" (more or less violently).
Usage: tremble.
Source: a primitive root;

7462.long:
Meaning: to "tend" a flock; i.e. "pasture" it; intransitively, to "graze" (literally or figuratively); generally to "rule"; by extension, to "associate" with (as a friend).
Usage: × break, companion, keep company with, devour, eat up, evil entreat, feed, use as a friend, make friendship with, herdman, keep (sheep) (-er), pastor, shearing house, shepherd, wander, waste.
Source: a primitive root;

7464.long:
Meaning: a "female associate".
Usage: companion, fellow.
Source: feminine of "H7453";

7466.long:
Meaning: "Reu", a postdiluvian patriarch.
Usage: Reu.
Source: for "H7471" in the sense of "H7453"; "friend";

7467.long:
Meaning: "Reuel", the name of Moses' father-in-law, also of an Edomite and an Israelite.
Usage: Raguel, Reuel.
Source: from the same as "H7466" and "H410"; friend of God;

7468.long:
Meaning: a female "associate"; generally an "additional" one.
Usage: another, mate, neighbour.
Source: from "H7462" in the sense of "H7453";

7469.long:
Meaning: a "feeding" upon, i.e. grasping after.
Usage: vexation.
Source: probably from "H7462";

7473.long:
Meaning: "pastoral"; as noun, a "shepherd".
Usage: shipherd.
Source: from active participle of "H7462";

7474.long:
Meaning: a "female associate".
Usage: fellow, love.
Source: feminine of "H7453";

7475.long:
Meaning: "desire".
Usage: vexation.
Source: from "H7462" in the sense of "H7469";

7476.long:
Meaning: a "grasp". i.e. (figuratively) "mental conception".
Usage: cogitation, thought.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H7475";

7477.long:
Meaning: to "reel", i.e. (figuratively) to "brandish".
Usage: terribly shake.
Source: a primitive root;

7480.long:
Meaning: "Reelajah", an Israelite.
Usage: Reeliah.
Source: from "H7477" and "H3050"; made to tremble (i.e. fearful) of Jah;

7481.long:
Meaning: to "tumble", i.e. "be violently agitated"; specifically, to "crash" (of thunder); figuratively, to "irritate" (with anger).
Usage: make to fret, roar, thunder, trouble.
Source: a primitive root;

7483.long:
Meaning: the "mane of a horse" (as quivering in the wind).
Usage: thunder.
Source: feminine of "H7482";

7484.long:
Meaning: "Ramah", the name of a grandson of Ham, and of a place (perhaps founded by him).
Usage: Raamah.
Source: the same as "H7483";

7485.long:
Meaning: "Raamjah", an Israelite.
Usage: Raamiah.
Source: from "H7481" and "H3050"; "Jah has shaken";

7486.long:
Meaning: "Rameses" or "Raamses", a place in Egypt.
Usage: Raamses, Rameses.
Source: or "רַעַמְסֵס"; of Egyptian origin;

7488.long:
Meaning: "verdant"; by analogy, "new"; figuratively, "prosperous".
Usage: green, flourishing.
Source: from an unused root meaning to be green;

7489.long:
Meaning: properly, to "spoil" (literally, by breaking to pieces); figuratively, to "make" (or "be") "good for nothing", i.e. "bad" (physically, socially or morally).
Usage: afflict, associate selves (by mistake for "H7462"), break (down, in pieces), displease, (be, bring, do) evil (doer, entreat, man), show self friendly (by mistake for "H7462"), do harm, (do) hurt, (behave self, deal) ill, × indeed, do mischief, punish, still, vex, (do) wicked (doer, -ly), be (deal, do) worse.
Source: a primitive root;

7491.long:
Meaning: to "drip".
Usage: distil, drop (down).
Source: a primitive root;

7492.long:
Meaning: to "break" in pieces; figuratively, "harass".
Usage: dash in pieces, vex.
Source: a primitive root;

7493.long:
Meaning: to "undulate" (as the earth, the sky, etc.; also a field of grain), particularly through fear; specifically, to "spring" (as a locust).
Usage: make afraid, (re-) move, quake, (make to) shake, (make to) tremble.
Source: a primitive root;

7494.long:
Meaning: "vibration", "bounding", "uproar".
Usage: commotion, confused noise, earthquake, fierceness, quaking, rattling, rushing, shaking.
Source: from "H7493";

7495.long:
Meaning: properly, to "mend" (by stitching), i.e. (figuratively) to "cure".
Usage: cure, (cause to) heal, physician, repair, × thoroughly, make whole. See "H7503".
Source: or "רָפָה"; a primitive root;

7496.long:
Meaning: properly, "lax", i.e. (figuratively) a "ghost" (as "dead"; in plural only).
Usage: dead, deceased.
Source: from "H7495" in the sense of "H7503";

7497.long:
Meaning: a "giant".
Usage: giant, Rapha, Rephaim(-s). See also "H1051".
Source: or "רָפָה"; from "H7495" in the sense of invigorating;

7498.long:
Meaning: "Rapha" or "Raphah", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Rapha.
Source: or "רָפָה"; probably the same as "H7497"; "giant";

7499.long:
Meaning: a "medicament".
Usage: heal(-ed), medicine.
Source: feminine passive participle of "H7495";

7501.long:
Meaning: "Rephael", an Israelite.
Usage: Rephael.
Source: from "H7495" and "H410"; "God has cured";

7502.long:
Meaning: to "spread" (a bed); by implication, to "refresh".
Usage: comfort, make (a bed), spread.
Source: a primitive root;

7503.long:
Meaning: to "slacken" (in many applications, literal or figurative).
Usage: abate, cease, consume, draw (toward evening), fail, (be) faint, be (wax) feeble, forsake, idle, leave, let alone (go, down), (be) slack, stay, be still, be slothful, (be) weak(-en). See "H7495".
Source: a primitive root;

7504.long:
Meaning: "slack" (in body or mind).
Usage: weak. raphah, Raphah. See "H7497", "H7498". riphah. See "H7383".
Source: from "H7503";

7505.long:
Meaning: "Raphu", an Israelite.
Usage: Raphu.
Source: passive participle of "H7495"; "cured";

7506.long:
Meaning: "Rephach", an Israelite.
Usage: Rephah.
Source: from an unused root apparently meaning to sustain; "support";

7508.long:
Meaning: "Rephidim", a place in the Desert.
Usage: Rephidim.
Source: plural of the masculine of the same as "H7507"; "ballusters";

7509.long:
Meaning: "Rephajah", the name of five Israelites.
Usage: Rephaiah.
Source: from "H7495" and "H3050"; "Jah has cured";

7511.long:
Meaning: to "trample", i.e. "prostrate".
Usage: humble self, submit self.
Source: a primitive root;

7513.long:
Meaning: a "raft" (as flat on the water).
Usage: flote.
Source: from "H7511";

7515.long:
Meaning: to "trample", i.e. "roil water".
Usage: foul, trouble.
Source: a primitive root;

7517.long:
Meaning: a "stall for cattle" (from their resting there).
Usage: stall.
Source: probably from "H7503";

7519.long:
Meaning: to "run"; also to "delight in".
Usage: accept, run.
Source: a primitive root;

7520.long:
Meaning: probably to "look askant", i.e. (figuratively) "be jealous".
Usage: leap.
Source: a primitive root;

7521.long:
Meaning: to "be pleased with"; specifically, to "satisfy" a debt.
Usage: (be) accept(-able), accomplish, set affection, approve, consent with, delight (self), enjoy, (be, have a) favour(-able), like, observe, pardon, (be, have, take) please(-ure), reconcile self.
Source: a primitive root;

7522.long:
Meaning: "delight" (especially as shown).
Usage: (be) acceptable(-ance, -ed), delight, desire, favour, (good) pleasure, (own, self, voluntary) will, as...(what) would.
Source: or "רָצֹן"; from "H7521";

7523.long:
Meaning: properly, to "dash" in pieces, i.e. "kill" (a human being), especially to "murder".
Usage: put to death, kill, (man-) slay(-er), murder(-er).
Source: a primitive root;

7524.long:
Meaning: a "crushing"; specifically, a "murder-cry".
Usage: slaughter, sword.
Source: from "H7523";

7526.long:
Meaning: "Retsin", the name of a Syrian and of an Israelite.
Usage: Rezin.
Source: probably for "H7522";

7528.long:
Meaning: to "tessellate", i.e. "embroider" (as if with bright stones).
Usage: pave.
Source: a denominative from "H7529";

7530.long:
Meaning: "Retseph", a place in Assyria.
Usage: Rezeph.
Source: the same as "H7529";

7531.long:
Meaning: a hot "stone"; also a tessellated "pavement".
Usage: live coal, pavement.
Source: feminine of "H7529";

7532.long:
Meaning: "Ritspah", an Israelitess.
Usage: Rizpah.
Source: the same as "H7531";

7533.long:
Meaning: to "crack" in pieces, literally or figuratively.
Usage: break, bruise, crush, discourage, oppress, struggle together.
Source: a primitive root;

7534.long:
Meaning: "emaciated" (as if flattened out).
Usage: lean(-fleshed), thin.
Source: from "H7556" in its original sense;

7535.long:
Meaning: properly, "leanness", i.e. (figuratively) "limitation"; only adverbial, "merely", or conjunctional, "although".
Usage: but, even, except, howbeit howsoever, at the least, nevertheless, nothing but, notwithstanding, only, save, so (that), surely, yet (so), in any wise.
Source: the same as "H7534" as a noun;

7537.long:
Meaning: to "decay" (as by worm-eating).
Usage: rot.
Source: a primitive root;

7540.long:
Meaning: properly, to "stamp", i.e. to "spring" about (wildly or for joy).
Usage: dance, jump, leap, skip.
Source: a primitive root;

7541.long:
Meaning: properly, "thinness", i.e. the "side of the head".
Usage: temple.
Source: feminine of "H7534";

7542.long:
Meaning: "Rakkon", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Rakkon.
Source: from "H7534"; "thinness";

7543.long:
Meaning: "to perfume".
Usage: apothecary, compound, make (ointment), prepare, spice.
Source: a primitive root;

7544.long:
Meaning: properly, "perfumery", i.e. (by implication) "spicery" (for flavor).
Usage: spiced.
Source: from "H7543";

7549.long:
Meaning: properly, an "expanse", i.e. the "firmament" or (apparently) "visible arch of the sky".
Usage: firmament.
Source: from "H7554";

7550.long:
Meaning: a thin "cake".
Usage: cake, wafer.
Source: from, "H7556" in its original sense;

7551.long:
Meaning: to "variegate" color, i.e. "embroider"; by implication, to "fabricate".
Usage: embroiderer, needlework, curiously work.
Source: a primitive root;

7552.long:
Meaning: "Rekem", the name of a place in Palestine, also of a Midianite and an Israelite.
Usage: Rekem.
Source: from "H7551"; "versicolor";

7553.long:
Meaning: "variegation of color"; specifically, "embroidery".
Usage: broidered (work), divers colours, (raiment of) needlework (on both sides).
Source: from "H7551";

7554.long:
Meaning: to "pound" the earth (as a sign of passion); by analogy to "expand" (by hammering); by implication, to "overlay" (with thin sheets of metal).
Usage: beat, make broad, spread abroad (forth, over, out, into plates), stamp, stretch.
Source: a primitive root;

7557.long:
Meaning: "Rakkath", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Rakkath.
Source: from "H7556" in its original sense of diffusing; a beach (as expanded shingle);

7558.long:
Meaning: a "permit".
Usage: grant.
Source: from an unused root meaning to have leave;

7561.long:
Meaning: to "be" (causatively, "do" or "declare") "wrong"; by implication, to "disturb", "violate".
Usage: condemn, make trouble, vex, be (commit, deal, depart, do) wicked(-ly, -ness).
Source: a primitive root;

7563.long:
Meaning: morally "wrong"; concretely, an (actively) "bad" person.
Usage: condemned, guilty, ungodly, wicked (man), that did wrong.
Source: from "H7561";

7565.long:
Meaning: a "live coal"; by analogy "lightning"; figuratively, an "arrow", (as flashing through the air); specifically, "fever".
Usage: arrow, (burning) coal, burning heat, spark, hot thunderbolt.
Source: from "H8313";

7566.long:
Meaning: "Resheph", an Israelite.
Usage: Resheph.
Source: the same as "H7565";

7573.long:
Meaning: to "yoke up" (to the pole of a vehicle).
Usage: bind.
Source: a primitive root;

7574.long:
Meaning: the "Spanish broom" (from its pole-like stems).
Usage: juniper (tree).
Source: or "רֹתֶם"; from "H7573";

7575.long:
Meaning: "Rithmah", a place in the Desert.
Usage: Rithmah.
Source: feminine of "H7574";

7577.long:
Meaning: something "fastened", i.e. a "chain".
Usage: chain.
Source: feminine passive participle of "H7576";

7579.long:
Meaning: to "bale up" water.
Usage: (woman to) draw(-er, water).
Source: a primitive root;

7580.long:
Meaning: to "rumble" or "moan".
Usage: × mightily, roar.
Source: a primitive root;

7582.long:
Meaning: to "rush"; by implication, to "desolate".
Usage: be desolate, (make a) rush(-ing), (lay) waste.
Source: a primitive root;

7583.long:
Meaning: to "stun", i.e. (intransitively) "be astonished".
Usage: wonder.
Source: a primitive root (identical with through the idea of whirling to giddiness);

7585.long:
Meaning: "hades" or the world of the dead (as if a subterranean "retreat"), including its accessories and inmates.
Usage: grave, hell, pit.
Source: or "שְׁאֹל"; from "H7592";

7586.long:
Meaning: "Shaul", the name of an Edomite and two Israelites.
Usage: Saul, Shaul.
Source: passive participle of "H7592"; "asked";

7587.long:
Meaning: a "Shaülite" or descendant of Shaul.
Usage: Shaulites.
Source: patronymic from "H7856";

7588.long:
Meaning: "uproar" (as of "rushing"); by implication, "destruction".
Usage: × horrible, noise, pomp, rushing, tumult (× -uous).
Source: from "H7582";

7589.long:
Meaning: "contempt".
Usage: despite(-ful).
Source: from an unused root meaning to "push aside";

7590.long:
Meaning: "one contemning".
Usage: that (which) despise(-d).
Source: for active part of "H7750" (compare "H7589");

7592.long:
Meaning: to "inquire"; by implication, to "request"; by extension, to "demand".
Usage: ask (counsel, on), beg, borrow, lay to charge, consult, demand, desire, × earnestly, enquire, greet, obtain leave, lend, pray, request, require, salute, × straitly, × surely, wish.
Source: or "שָׁאֵל"; a primitive root;

7595.long:
Meaning: properly, a "question" (at law), i.e. "judicial decision" or "mandate".
Usage: demand.
Source: (Aramaic) from "H7593";

7596.long:
Meaning: "a petition"; by implication, "a loan".
Usage: loan, petition, request.
Source: or "שֵׁלָה"; (1 Samuel 1:17), from "H7592";

7597.long:
Meaning: "Shealtiel", an Israelite.
Usage: Shalthiel, Shealtiel.
Source: or "שַׁלְתִּיאֵל"; from "H7592" and "H410"; "I have asked God";

7599.long:
Meaning: to "loll", i.e. "be peaceful".
Usage: be at ease, be quiet, rest. See also "H1052".
Source: a primitive root;

7600.long:
Meaning: "secure"; in a bad sense, "haughty".
Usage: that is at ease, quiet, tumult. Compare "H7946".
Source: from "H7599";

7602.long:
Meaning: to "inhale eagerly"; figuratively, to "cover"; by implication, to "be angry"; also to "hasten".
Usage: desire (earnestly), devour, haste, pant, snuff up, swallow up.
Source: a primitive root;

7603.long:
Meaning: "barm" or yeast-cake (as "swelling" by fermentation).
Usage: leaven.
Source: from "H7604";

7604.long:
Meaning: properly, to "swell" up, i.e. "be" (causatively, "make") "redundant".
Usage: leave, (be) left, let, remain, remnant, reserve, the rest.
Source: a primitive root;

7605.long:
Meaning: a "remainder".
Usage: × other, remnant, residue, rest.
Source: from "H7604";

7606.long:
Usage: × whatsoever more, residue, rest.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H7605"

7607.long:
Meaning: "flesh" (as "swelling" out), as living or for food; generally "food" of any kind; figuratively, "kindred" by blood.
Usage: body, flesh, food, (near) kin(-sman, -swoman), near (nigh) (of kin).
Source: from "H7604";

7608.long:
Meaning: female "kindred" by blood.
Usage: near kinswomen.
Source: feminine of "H7607";

7609.long:
Meaning: "Sheerah", an Israelitess.
Usage: Sherah.
Source: the same as "H7608";

7610.long:
Meaning: "Shear-Jashub", the symbolic name of one of Isaiah's sons.
Usage: Shear-jashub.
Source: from "H7605" and "H7725"; a "remnant will return";

7611.long:
Meaning: a "remainder" or residual (surviving, final) portion.
Usage: that had escaped, be left, posterity, remain(-der), remnant, residue, rest.
Source: from "H7604";

7613.long:
Meaning: an "elevation" or "leprous scab"; figuratively, "elation" or "cheerfulness"; "exaltation" in rank or character.
Usage: be accepted, dignity, excellency, highness, raise up self, rising.
Source: from "H5375";

7614.long:
Meaning: "Sheba", the name of three early progenitors of tribes and of an Ethiopian district.
Usage: Sheba, Sabeans.
Source: of foreign origin;

7615.long:
Meaning: a "Shebaite" or descendant of Sheba.
Usage: Sabean.
Source: patronymic from "H7614";

7616.long:
Meaning: a "fragment", i.e. "ruin".
Usage: broken in pieces.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "break up";

7617.long:
Meaning: to "transport into captivity".
Usage: (bring away, carry, carry away, lead, lead away, take) captive(-s), drive (take) away.
Source: a primitive root;

7618.long:
Meaning: a "gem" (from its sparkle), probably the "agate".
Usage: agate.
Source: from an unused root (probably identical with that of "H7617" through the idea of "subdivision" into flashes or streamers (compare "H7632") meaning to "flame";

7619.long:
Meaning: "Shebuel" or "Shubael", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Shebuel, Shubael.
Source: or "שׁוּבָאֵל"; from "H7617" (abbreviated form) or "H7725" and "H410"; captive (or returned) of God;

7620.long:
Meaning: literally, "sevened", i.e. a "week" (specifically, of years).
Usage: seven, week.
Source: or "שָׁבֻעַ"; also (feminine) "שְׁבֻעָה"; properly, passive participle of "H7650" as a denominative of "H7651";

7621.long:
Meaning: properly, something "sworn", i.e. an "oath".
Usage: curse, oath, × sworn.
Source: feminine passive participle of "H7650";

7622.long:
Meaning: "exile", concretely, "prisoners"; figuratively, a "former state of prosperity".
Usage: captive(-ity).
Source: or "שְׁבִית"; from "H7617";

7623.long:
Meaning: properly, to "address in a loud tone", i.e. (specifically) "loud"; figuratively, to "pacify" (as if by words).
Usage: commend, glory, keep in, praise, still, triumph.
Source: a primitive root;

7626.long:
Meaning: a "scion", i.e. (literally) a "stick" (for punishing, writing, fighting, ruling, walking, etc.) or (figuratively) a "clan".
Usage: × correction, dart, rod, sceptre, staff, tribe.
Source: from an unused root probably meaning to "branch" off;

7627.long:
Meaning: "Shebat", a Jewish month.
Usage: Sebat.
Source: of foreign origin;

7628.long:
Meaning: "exiled"; "captured"; as noun, "exile" (abstractly or concretely and collectively); by extension, "booty".
Usage: captive(-ity), prisoners, × take away, that was taken.
Source: from "H7618";

7632.long:
Meaning: "flame" (as split into tongues).
Usage: spark.
Source: from the same as "H7616";

7633.long:
Meaning: "exile" (abstractly or concretely and collectively).
Usage: captives(-ity).
Source: feminine of "H7628";

7634.long:
Meaning: "Shobjah", an Israelite.
Usage: Shachia (from the margin).
Source: feminine of the same as "H7629"; "captivation";

7635.long:
Meaning: "a track" or "passage-way" (as if flowing along).
Usage: path.
Source: from the same as "H7640";

7636.long:
Meaning: a "netting" for the hair.
Usage: caul.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "interweave";

7638.long:
Meaning: "a netting" (ornament to the capital of a column).
Usage: net.
Source: from an unused root meaning to intwine;

7639.long:
Meaning: a "net-work", i.e. (in hunting) a "snare", (in architecture) a "ballustrade"; also a "reticulated ornament to a pillar".
Usage: checker, lattice, network, snare, wreath(-enwork).
Source: feminine of "H7638";

7640.long:
Meaning: a lady's "train" (as "trailing" after her).
Usage: leg.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "flow";

7641.long:
Meaning: a "stream" (as flowing); also an "ear of grain" (as growing out); by analogy, a "branch".
Usage: branch, channel, ear (of corn), (water-)flood, Shibboleth. Compare "H5451".
Source: or (feminine) "שִׁבֹּלֶת"; from the same as "H7640";

7642.long:
Meaning: a "snail" (as if floating in its own slime).
Usage: snail.
Source: from the same as "H7640";

7643.long:
Meaning: "Sebam" or "Sibmah", a place in Moab.
Usage: Shebam, Shibmah, Sibmah.
Source: or (feminine) "שִׂבְמָה"; probably from "H1313"; "spice";

7644.long:
Meaning: "Shebna" or "Shebnah", an Israelite.
Usage: Shebna, Shebnah.
Source: or "שֶׁבְנָה"; from an unused root meaning to "grow"; "growth";

7645.long:
Meaning: "Shebanjah", the name of three or four Israelites.
Usage: Shebaniah.
Source: or "שְׁבַנְיָהוּ"; from the same as "H7644" and "H3050"; "Jah has grown" (i.e. prospered);

7646.long:
Meaning: to "sate", i.e. "fill" to satisfaction (literally or figuratively).
Usage: have enough, fill (full, self, with), be (to the) full (of), have plenty of, be satiate, satisfy (with), suffice, be weary of.
Source: or "שָׂבֵעַ"; a primitive root;

7648.long:
Meaning: "satisfaction" (of food or [figuratively] joy).
Usage: fill, full(-ness), satisfying, be satisfied.
Source: from "H7646";

7649.long:
Meaning: "satiated" (in a pleasant or disagreeable sense).
Usage: full (of), satisfied (with).
Source: from "H7646";

7650.long:
Meaning: to "seven" oneself, i.e. "swear" (as if by repeating a declaration seven times).
Usage: adjure, charge (by an oath, with an oath), feed to the full (by mistake for "H7646"), take an oath, × straitly, (cause to, make to) swear.
Source: a primitive root; properly to "be complete", but used only as a denominative from "H7651";

7651.long:
Meaning: "seven" (as the sacred "full" one); also (adverbially) "seven times"; by implication, a "week"; by extension, an "indefinite" number.
Usage: ( by) seven(-fold),-s, (-teen, -teenth), -th, times). Compare "H7658".
Source: or (masculine) ("שִׁבְעָה"); from "H7650"; a primitive cardinal number;

7652.long:
Meaning: "Sheba", the name of a place in Palestine, and of two Israelites.
Usage: Sheba.
Source: the same as "H7651"; "seven";

7654.long:
Meaning: "satiety".
Usage: (to have) enough, × till...be full, (un-) satiable, satisfy, × sufficiently.
Source: feminine of "H7648";

7656.long:
Meaning: "Shebah", a well in Palestine.
Usage: Shebah.
Source: masculine of "H7651"; seven(-th);

7657.long:
Meaning: "seventy".
Usage: seventy, threescore and ten ( -teen).
Source: multiple of "H7651";

7658.long:
Meaning: "seven".
Usage: seven.
Source: prolonged for the masculine of "H7651";

7660.long:
Meaning: to "interweave" (colored) threads in squares; by implication ("of reticulation") to "inchase" gems in gold.
Usage: embroider, set.
Source: a primitive root;

7662.long:
Meaning: to "quit", i.e. "allow to remain".
Usage: leave, let alone.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to the root of "H7733";

7663.long:
Meaning: to "scrutinize"; by implication (of watching) to "expect" (with hope and patience).
Usage: hope, tarry, view, wait.
Source: erroneously "שָׁבַר"; (Nehemiah 2:13,15), a primitive root;

7665.long:
Meaning: to "burst" (literally or figuratively).
Usage: break (down, off, in pieces, up), broken (-hearted), bring to the birth, crush, destroy, hurt, quench, × quite, tear, view (by mistake for "H7663").
Source: a primitive root;

7666.long:
Meaning: to "deal" in grain.
Usage: buy, sell.
Source: denominative from "H7668";

7667.long:
Meaning: a "fracture", figuratively, "ruin"; specifically, a "solution" (of a dream).
Usage: affliction, breach, breaking, broken(-footed, -handed), bruise, crashing, destruction, hurt, interpretation, vexation.
Source: or "שֵׁבֶר"; from "H7665";

7668.long:
Meaning: "grain" (as if broken into kernels).
Usage: corn, victuals.
Source: the same as "H7667";

7669.long:
Meaning: "Sheber", an Israelite.
Usage: Sheber.
Source: the same as "H7667";

7670.long:
Meaning: "rupture", i.e. a "pang"; figuratively, "ruin".
Usage: breaking, destruction.
Source: from "H7665";

7671.long:
Meaning: "Shebarim", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Shebarim.
Source: plural of "H7667"; "ruins";

7672.long:
Meaning: to "entangle", i.e. "perplex".
Usage: be astonished.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H7660";

7673.long:
Meaning: to "repose", i.e. "desist from exertion"; used in many implied relations (causative, figurative or specific).
Usage: (cause to, let, make to) cease, celebrate, cause (make) to fail, keep (sabbath), suffer to be lacking, leave, put away (down), (make to) rest, rid, still, take away.
Source: a primitive root;

7674.long:
Meaning: "rest", "interruption", "cessation".
Usage: cease, sit still, loss of time.
Source: from "H7673";

7675.long:
Meaning: properly, "session"; but used also concretely, an "abode" or "locality".
Usage: place, seat. Compare "H3429".
Source: infinitive of "H3427";

7676.long:
Meaning: "intermission", i.e (specifically) the "Sabbath".
Usage: ( every) sabbath.
Source: intensive from "H7673";

7677.long:
Meaning: a "sabbatism" or special holiday.
Usage: rest, sabbath.
Source: from "H7676";

7678.long:
Meaning: "Shabbethai", the name of three Israelites.
Usage: Shabbethai.
Source: from "H7676"; "restful";

7679.long:
Meaning: "to grow", i.e. (causatively) "to enlarge", (figuratively) "laud".
Usage: increase, magnify.
Source: ; a primitive root;

7680.long:
Meaning: to "increase".
Usage: grow, be multiplied.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H7679";

7682.long:
Meaning: to "be" (causatively, "make") "lofty", especially "inaccessible"; by implication, "safe", "strong"; used literally and figuratively.
Usage: defend, exalt, be excellent, (be, set on) high, lofty, be safe, set up (on high), be too strong.
Source: a primitive root;

7683.long:
Meaning: to "stray", i.e. (figuratively) "sin" (with more or less apology).
Usage: × also for that, deceived, err, go astray, sin ignorantly.
Source: a primitive root;

7684.long:
Meaning: a "mistake" or inadvertent "transgression".
Usage: error, ignorance, at unawares; unwittingly.
Source: from "H7683";

7685.long:
Meaning: to "enlarge" (especially upward, also figuratively).
Usage: grow (up), increase.
Source: a primitive root;

7686.long:
Meaning: to "stray" (causatively, "mislead"), usually (figuratively) to "mistake", especially (morally) to "transgress"; by extension (through the idea of intoxication) "to reel", (figuratively) "be enraptured".
Usage: (cause to) go astray, deceive, err, be ravished, sin through ignorance, (let, make to) wander.
Source: a primitive root;

7687.long:
Meaning: "Segub", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Segub.
Source: from "H7682"; "aloft";

7688.long:
Meaning: to "peep", i.e. "glance" sharply at.
Usage: look (narrowly).
Source: a primitive root;

7690.long:
Meaning: "large" (in size, quantity or number, also adverbial).
Usage: exceeding, great(-ly); many, much, sore, very.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H7689";

7692.long:
Meaning: properly, "aberration", i.e. (technically) a "dithyramb" or "rambling poem".
Usage: Shiggaion, Shigionoth.
Source: or "שִׁגָּיֹנָה"; from "H7686";

7693.long:
Meaning: to "copulate" with.
Usage: lie with, ravish.
Source: a primitive root;

7696.long:
Meaning: to "rave through insanity".
Usage: (be, play the) mad (man).
Source: a primitive root;

7698.long:
Meaning: the "fœtus" (as finally "expelled").
Usage: that cometh of, increase.
Source: from an unused root probably meaning to "eject";

7699.long:
Meaning: the "breast of a woman" or "animal" (as bulging).
Usage: breast, pap, teat.
Source: or "שֹׁד"; probably from "H7736" (in its original sense) contracted;

7701.long:
Meaning: "violence", "ravage".
Usage: desolation, destruction, oppression, robbery, spoil(-ed, -er, -ing), wasting.
Source: or "שׁוֹד"; (Job 5:21), from "H7736";

7702.long:
Meaning: to "abrade", i.e. "harrow" a field.
Usage: break clods, harrow.
Source: a primitive root;

7703.long:
Meaning: properly, to "be burly", i.e. (figuratively) "powerful" (passively, "impregnable"); by implication, to "ravage".
Usage: dead, destroy(-er), oppress, robber, spoil(-er), × utterly, (lay) waste.
Source: a primitive root;

7704.long:
Meaning: a "field" (as flat).
Usage: country, field, ground, land, soil, × wild.
Source: or "שָׂדַי"; from an unused root meaning to spread out;

7705.long:
Meaning: a "wife" (as "mistress" of the house).
Usage: × all sorts, musical instrument.
Source: from "H7703";

7707.long:
Meaning: "Shedejur", an Israelite.
Usage: Shedeur.
Source: from the same as "H7704" and "H217"; "spreader of light";

7708.long:
Meaning: "Siddim", a valley in Palestine.
Usage: Siddim.
Source: plural from the same as "H7704"; "flats";

7709.long:
Meaning: a cultivated "field".
Usage: blasted, field.
Source: apparently from "H7704";

7713.long:
Meaning: a "row", i.e. "rank" (of soldiers), "story" (of rooms).
Usage: board, range.
Source: from an unused root meaning to regulate;

7714.long:
Meaning: "Shadrak", the Babylonian name of one of Daniel's companions.
Usage: Shadrach.
Source: probably of foreign origin;

7716.long:
Meaning: a member of a flock, i.e. a "sheep" or "goat".
Usage: (lesser, small) cattle, ewe, goat, lamb, sheep. Compare "H2089".
Source: or "שֵׂי"; probably from "H7582" through the idea of "pushing" out to graze;

7717.long:
Meaning: a "witness".
Usage: record.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "testify";

7718.long:
Meaning: a "gem", probably the "beryl" (from its pale green color).
Usage: onyx.
Source: from an unused root probably mean to blanch;

7719.long:
Meaning: "Shoham", an Israelite.
Usage: Shoham.
Source: the same as "H7718";

7720.long:
Meaning: a round "pendant" for the neck.
Usage: ornament, round tire like the moon.
Source: from the same as "H5469";

7721.long:
Meaning: a "rising".
Usage: arise.
Source: from an unused root (akin to "H5375" and "H7722") meaning to "rise";

7722.long:
Meaning: a "tempest"; by implication, "devastation".
Usage: desolate(-ion), destroy, destruction, storm, wasteness.
Source: or (feminine) "שׁוֹאָה"; or "שֹׁאָה"; from an unused root meaning to rush over;

7723.long:
Meaning: "evil" (as "destructive"), literally ("ruin") or morally (especially "guile"); figuratively "idolatry" (as false, subjective), "uselessness" (as deceptive, objective; also adverbially, in "vain").
Usage: false(-ly), lie, lying, vain, vanity.
Source: or "שַׁו"; from the same as "H7722" in the sense of "desolating";

7724.long:
Meaning: "Sheva", an Israelite.
Usage: Sheva.
Source: from the same as "H7723"; "false";

7725.long:
Meaning: to "turn" back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of "return" to the starting point); generally to "retreat"; often adverbial, "again".
Usage: ((break, build, circumcise, dig, do anything, do evil, feed, lay down, lie down, lodge, make, rejoice, send, take, weep)) × again, (cause to) answer ( again), × in any case (wise), × at all, averse, bring (again, back, home again), call (to mind), carry again (back), cease, × certainly, come again (back), × consider, continually, convert, deliver (again), deny, draw back, fetch home again, × fro, get (oneself) (back) again, × give (again), go again (back, home), (go) out, hinder, let, (see) more, × needs, be past, × pay, pervert, pull in again, put (again, up again), recall, recompense, recover, refresh, relieve, render (again), requite, rescue, restore, retrieve, (cause to, make to) return, reverse, reward, say nay, send back, set again, slide back, still, × surely, take back (off), (cause to, make to) turn (again, self again, away, back, back again, backward, from, off), withdraw.
Source: a primitive root;

7726.long:
Meaning: "apostate", i.e. idolatrous.
Usage: backsliding, frowardly, turn away (from margin).
Source: from "H7725";

7727.long:
Meaning: "Shobab", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Shobab.
Source: the same as "H7726"; "rebellious";

7730.long:
Meaning: a "thicket", i.e. "interlaced branches".
Usage: thick boughs.
Source: for "H5441";

7732.long:
Meaning: "Shobal", the name of an Edomite and two Israelites.
Usage: Shobal.
Source: from the same as "H7640"; "overflowing";

7733.long:
Meaning: "Shobek", an Israelite.
Usage: Shobek.
Source: active participle from a primitive root meaning to leave (compare "H7662"); "forsaking";

7734.long:
Meaning: to "retreat".
Usage: turn back.
Source: a primitive root;

7735.long:
Meaning: to "hedge" in.
Usage: make to grow.
Source: a primitive root;

7736.long:
Meaning: properly, to "swell up", i.e. figuratively (by implication of insolence) to "devastate".
Usage: waste.
Source: a primitive root;

7737.long:
Meaning: properly, to "level", i.e. "equalize"; figuratively, to "resemble"; by implication, to "adjust" (i.e. counterbalance, be suitable, compose, place, yield, etc.).
Usage: avail, behave, bring forth, compare, countervail, (be, make) equal, lay, be (make, a-) like, make plain, profit, reckon.
Source: a primitive root;

7738.long:
Meaning: "to destroy".
Usage: × substance (from the margin).
Source: a primitive root;

7740.long:
Meaning: "Shaveh", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Shaveh.
Source: from "H7737"; "plain";

7741.long:
Meaning: "Shaveh-Kirjathajim", a place East of the Jordan.
Usage: Shaveh Kiriathaim.
Source: from the same as "H7740" and the dual of "H7151"; "plain of a double city";

7742.long:
Meaning: to "muse pensively".
Usage: meditate.
Source: a primitive root;

7743.long:
Meaning: to "sink", literally or figuratively.
Usage: bow down, incline, humble.
Source: a primitive root;

7744.long:
Meaning: "Shuach", a son of Abraham.
Usage: Shuah.
Source: from "H7743"; "dell";

7746.long:
Meaning: "Shuchah", an Israelite.
Usage: Shuah.
Source: the same as "H7745";

7747.long:
Meaning: a "Shuchite" or descendant of Shuach.
Usage: Shuhite.
Source: patronymic from "H7744";

7750.long:
Meaning: to "detrude", i.e. (intransitively and figuratively) "become derelict" (wrongly practise; namely, idolatry).
Usage: turn aside to.
Source: or (by permutation) "סוּט"; a primitive root;

7751.long:
Meaning: properly, to "push forth"; (but used only figuratively) to "lash", i.e. (the sea with oars) to "row"; by implication, to "travel".
Usage: go (about, through, to and fro), mariner, rower, run to and fro.
Source: a primitive root;

7752.long:
Meaning: a "lash" (literally or figuratively).
Usage: scourge, whip.
Source: from "H7751";

7753.long:
Meaning: to "entwine", i.e. "shut in" (for formation, protection or restraint).
Usage: fence, (make an) hedge (up).
Source: a primitive root;

7755.long:
