Meaning: "Sokoh" or "Soko", the name of two places in Palestine.
Usage: Shocho, Shochoh, Sochoh, Soco, Socoh.
Source: or "שֹׂכֹה"; or "שׂוֹכוֹ"; from "H7753";

7756.long:
Meaning: a "Sukathite" or descendant of an unknown Israelite named Sukah.
Usage: Suchathite.
Source: probably patronymic from a name corresponding to "H7754" (feminine);

7757.long:
Meaning: a "skirt"; by implication, a bottom "edge".
Usage: hem, skirt, train.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "hang" down;

7758.long:
Meaning: "nude" (especially bare-foot); by implication, "captive".
Usage: spoiled, stripped.
Source: or "שֵׁילָל"; (Micah 1:8), from "H7997";

7759.long:
Meaning: "peaceful" (with the article always prefixed, making it a pet name); the "Shulammith", an epithet of Solomon's queen.
Usage: Shulamite.
Source: from "H7999";

7760.long:
Meaning: to "put" (used in a great variety of applications, literal, figurative, inferentially, and elliptically).
Usage: × any wise, appoint, bring, call (a name), care, cast in, change, charge, commit, consider, convey, determine, disguise, dispose, do, get, give, heap up, hold, impute, lay (down, up), leave, look, make (out), mark, name, × on, ordain, order, paint, place, preserve, purpose, put (on), regard, rehearse, reward, (cause to) set (on, up), shew, stedfastly, take, × tell, tread down, (over-)turn, × wholly, work.
Source: or "שִׂים"; a primitive root;

7761.long:
Usage: command, give, lay, make, name, regard, set.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H7760"

7762.long:
Meaning: "garlic" (from its rank "odor").
Usage: garlic.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "exhale";

7763.long:
Meaning: "Shomer", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Shomer.
Source: or "שֹׁמֵר"; active participle of "H8104"; "keeper";

7764.long:
Meaning: "Shuni", an Israelite.
Usage: Shuni.
Source: from an unused root meaning to rest; "quiet";

7765.long:
Meaning: "a Shunite" (collectively) or descendants of Shuni.
Usage: Shunites.
Source: patronymic from "H7764";

7766.long:
Meaning: "Shunem", a place in Pal.
Usage: Shunem.
Source: probably from the same as "H7764"; "quietly";

7767.long:
Meaning: a "Shunammitess", or female inhabitant of Shunem.
Usage: Shunamite.
Source: patrial from "H7766";

7768.long:
Meaning: properly, to "be free"; but used only causatively and reflexively, to "halloo" (for help, i.e. "freedom" from some trouble).
Usage: cry (aloud, out), shout.
Source: a primitive root;

7770.long:
Meaning: "Shua", a Canaanite.
Usage: Shua, Shuah.
Source: the same as "H7769";

7771.long:
Meaning: a "noble", i.e. "liberal", "opulent"; also (as noun in the derived sense) a "halloo".
Usage: bountiful, crying, rich.
Source: from "H7768" in the original sense of freedom;

7772.long:
Meaning: "Shoa", an Oriental people.
Usage: Shoa.
Source: the same as "H7771"; "rich";

7776.long:
Meaning: a "jackal" (as a "burrower").
Usage: fox.
Source: or "שֻׁעָל"; from the same as "H8168";

7777.long:
Meaning: "Shual", the name of an Israelite and of a place in Palestine.
Usage: Shual.
Source: the same as "H7776";

7778.long:
Meaning: a "janitor".
Usage: doorkeeper, porter.
Source: or "שֹׁעֵר" active participle of "H8176" (as denominative from "H8179");

7779.long:
Meaning: properly, to "gape", i.e. "snap at"; figuratively, to "overwhelm".
Usage: break, bruise, cover.
Source: a primitive root;

7781.long:
Meaning: a "Shuphamite" (collectively) or descendants of Shephupham.
Usage: Shuphamite.
Source: patronymic from "H8197";

7782.long:
Meaning: a "cornet" (as giving a "clear" sound) or curved horn.
Usage: cornet, trumpet.
Source: or "שֹׁפָר"; from "H8231" in the original sense of "incising";

7783.long:
Meaning: to "run after" or "over", i.e. "overflow".
Usage: overflow, water.
Source: a primitive root;

7785.long:
Meaning: the (lower) "leg" (as a "runner").
Usage: hip, leg, shoulder, thigh.
Source: from "H7783";

7786.long:
Meaning: properly, to "vanquish"; by implication, to "rule" (causatively, crown).
Usage: make princes, have power, reign. See "H5493".
Source: a primitive root;

7787.long:
Meaning: to "saw".
Usage: cut.
Source: a primitive root (identical with "H7786" through the idea of reducing to pieces; compare "H4883");

7788.long:
Meaning: properly, to "turn", i.e. "travel" about (as a harlot or a merchant).
Usage: go, singular See also "H7891".
Source: a primitive root;

7789.long:
Meaning: to "spy" out, i.e. (generally) "survey", (for evil) "lurk for", (for good) "care for".
Usage: behold, lay wait, look, observe, perceive, regard, see.
Source: a primitive root (identical with through the idea of "going round" for inspection);

7790.long:
Meaning: a "foe" (as lying in wait).
Usage: enemy.
Source: from "H7889";

7793.long:
Meaning: "Shur", a region of the Desert.
Usage: Shur.
Source: the same as "H7791";

7794.long:
Meaning: a "bullock" (as a "traveller").
Usage: bull(-ock), cow, ox, wall (by mistake for "H7791").
Source: from "H7788";

7795.long:
Meaning: properly, a "ring", i.e. (by analogy) a "row" (adverbially).
Usage: principal.
Source: from "H7786" in the primitive sense of "H5493";

7796.long:
Meaning: "Sorek", a valley in Palestine.
Usage: Sorek.
Source: the same as "H8321"; a "vine";

7797.long:
Meaning: to "be bright", i.e. "cheerful".
Usage: be glad, × greatly, joy, make mirth, rejoice.
Source: or "שִׂישׂ"; a primitive root;

7799.long:
Meaning: "a lily" (from its whiteness), "as a flower of architectural ornament"; also "a" (straight) "trumpet" (from the tubular shape).
Usage: lily, Shoshannim.
Source: or "שׁוֹשָׁן"; or "שֹׁשָׁן"; and (feminine) "שׁוֹשַׁנָּה"; from "H7797";

7800.long:
Meaning: "Shushan", a place in Persia.
Usage: Shushan.
Source: the same as "H7799";

7801.long:
Meaning: a "Shushankite" (collectively) or inhabitants of some unknown place in Assyrian.
Usage: Susanchites.
Source: (Aramaic) of foreign origin;

7802.long:
Meaning: "Shushan-Eduth" or "Shoshannim-Eduth", the title of a popular song.
Usage: Shoshannim-Eduth, Shushan-eduth.
Source: or (plural of former) "שׁוֹשַׁנִּים עֵדוּת"; from "H7799" and "H5715"; lily (or trumpet) of assemblage;

7803.long:
Meaning: "Shuthelach", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Shuthelah.
Source: probably from "H7582" and the same as "H8520"; "crash of breakage";

7805.long:
Meaning: to "tan" (by sunburning); figuratively (as if by a piercing ray) to "scan".
Usage: look up, see.
Source: a primitive root;

7806.long:
Meaning: to "twist" (a thread of straw).
Usage: twine.
Source: a primitive root;

7809.long:
Meaning: to "donate", i.e. "bribe".
Usage: hire, give a reward.
Source: a primitive root;

7810.long:
Meaning: a "donation" (venal or redemptive).
Usage: bribe(-ry), gift, present, reward.
Source: from "H7809";

7811.long:
Meaning: to "swim"; causatively, to "inundate".
Usage: (make to) swim.
Source: a primitive root;

7812.long:
Meaning: to "depress", i.e. "prostrate" (especially reflexive, in homage to royalty or God).
Usage: bow (self) down, crouch, fall down (flat), humbly beseech, do (make) obeisance, do reverence, make to stoop, worship.
Source: a primitive root;

7813.long:
Meaning: a "pond" (for swimming).
Usage: to swim in.
Source: from "H7811";

7814.long:
Meaning: "laughter" (in merriment or defiance).
Usage: derision, laughter(-ed to scorn, -ing), mocked, sport.
Source: or "שְׂחֹק"; from "H7832";

7817.long:
Meaning: to "sink" or "depress" (reflexive or causative).
Usage: bend, bow (down), bring (cast) down, couch, humble self, be (bring) low, stoop.
Source: a primitive root;

7818.long:
Meaning: to "tread out", i.e. "squeeze" (grapes).
Usage: press.
Source: a primitive root;

7819.long:
Meaning: to "slaughter" (in sacrifice or massacre).
Usage: kill, offer, shoot out, slay, slaughter.
Source: a primitive root;

7820.long:
Meaning: to "hammer out".
Usage: beat.
Source: a primitive root (identical with "H7819" through the idea of striking);

7822.long:
Meaning: "inflammation", i.e. an "ulcer".
Usage: boil, botch.
Source: from an unused root probably meaning to burn;

7823.long:
Meaning: "after-growth".
Usage: (that) which springeth of the same.
Source: or "סָחִישׁ"; from an unused root apparently meaning to "sprout";

7824.long:
Meaning: a "board" (as chipped thin).
Usage: cieled with.
Source: from the same as "H7828";

7825.long:
Meaning: a "pit-fall" (literally or figuratively).
Usage: destruction, pit.
Source: from "H7812";

7826.long:
Meaning: a "lion" (from his characteristic roar).
Usage: (fierce) lion.
Source: from an unused root probably meaning to "roar";

7827.long:
Meaning: a "scale" or shell, i.e. the aromatic "mussel".
Usage: onycha.
Source: apparently from the same as "H7826" through some obscure idea, perhaps that of "peeling" off by concussion of sound;

7828.long:
Meaning: the "gull" (as thin).
Usage: cuckoo.
Source: from an unused root meaning to peel, i.e. emaciate;

7830.long:
Meaning: "haughtiness" (as evinced by the attitude).
Usage: × lion, pride.
Source: from an unused root apparently meaning to "strut";

7831.long:
Meaning: "Shachatsom", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Shahazimah (from the margin).
Source: from the same as "H7830"; "proudly";

7832.long:
Meaning: to "laugh" (in pleasure or detraction); by implication, to "play".
Usage: deride, have in derision, laugh, make merry, mock(-er), play, rejoice, (laugh to) scorn, be in (make) sport.
Source: a primitive root;

7833.long:
Meaning: to "comminate" (by trituration or attrition).
Usage: beat, wear.
Source: a primitive root;

7834.long:
Meaning: a "powder" (as "beaten" small); by analogy, a thin "vapor"; by extension, the "firmament".
Usage: cloud, small dust, heaven, sky.
Source: from "H7833";

7835.long:
Meaning: to "be dim" or "dark" (in color).
Usage: be black.
Source: a primitive root (identical with "H7836" through the idea of the duskiness of early dawn);

7836.long:
Meaning: properly, to "dawn", i.e. (figuratively) "be" (up) "early at any task" (with the implication of earnestness); by extension, to "search for" (with painstaking).
Usage: (do something) betimes, enquire early, rise (seek) betimes, seek diligently) early, in the morning).
Source: a primitive root;

7837.long:
Meaning: "dawn" (literal, figurative or adverbial).
Usage: day(-spring), early, light, morning, whence riseth.
Source: from "H7836";

7838.long:
Meaning: properly, "dusky", but also (absol.) "jetty".
Usage: black.
Source: or "שָׁחוֹר"; from "H7835";

7841.long:
Meaning: "Shecharjah", an Israelite.
Usage: Shehariah.
Source: from "H7836" and "H3050"; "Jah has sought";

7842.long:
Meaning: "Shacharajim", an Israelite.
Usage: Shaharaim.
Source: dual of "H7837"; "double dawn";

7843.long:
Meaning: to "decay", i.e. (causatively) "ruin" (literally or figuratively).
Usage: batter, cast off, corrupt(-er, thing), destroy(-er, -uction), lose, mar, perish, spill, spoiler, × utterly, waste(-r).
Source: a primitive root;

7845.long:
Meaning: a "pit" (especially as a trap); figuratively, "destruction".
Usage: corruption, destruction, ditch, grave, pit.
Source: from "H7743";

7846.long:
Meaning: a "departure from right", i.e. "sin".
Usage: revolter, that turn aside.
Source: or "סֵט"; from "H7750";

7847.long:
Meaning: to "deviate" from duty.
Usage: decline, go aside, turn.
Source: a primitive root;

7848.long:
Meaning: the "acacia" (from its "scourging" thorns).
Usage: shittah, shittim. See also "H1029".
Source: feminine of a derivative (only in the plural "שִׁטִּים"; meaning the "sticks" of wood) from the same as "H7850";

7849.long:
Meaning: to "expand".
Usage: all abroad, enlarge, spread, stretch out.
Source: a primitive root;

7850.long:
Meaning: to "flog"; a "goad".
Usage: scourge.
Source: active participle of an otherwise unused root meaning (properly, to pierce; but only as a denominative from "H7752")

7851.long:
Meaning: "Shittim", a place East of the Jordan.
Usage: Shittim.
Source: the same as the plural of "H7848"; "acacia" trees;

7852.long:
Meaning: properly, to "lurk for", i.e. "persecute".
Usage: hate, oppose self against.
Source: a primitive root;

7853.long:
Meaning: to "attack", (figuratively) "accuse".
Usage: (be an) adversary, resist.
Source: a primitive root;

7854.long:
Meaning: an "opponent"; especially (with the article prefixed) "Satan", the arch-enemy of good.
Usage: adversary, Satan, withstand.
Source: from "H7853";

7856.long:
Meaning: "Sitnah", the name of a well in Pal.
Usage: Sitnah.
Source: the same as "H7855";

7857.long:
Meaning: to "gush"; by implication, to "inundate", "cleanse"; by analogy, to "gallop", "conquer".
Usage: drown, (over-) flow(-whelm, rinse, run, rush, (throughly) wash (away).
Source: a primitive root;

7858.long:
Meaning: "a deluge" (literally or figuratively).
Usage: flood, outrageous, overflowing.
Source: or "שֵׁטֶף"; from "H7857";

7860.long:
Meaning: properly, a "scribe", i.e. (by analogy or implication) an "official superintendent" or "magistrate".
Usage: officer, overseer, ruler.
Source: active participle of an otherwise unused root probably meaning to write;

7861.long:
Meaning: "Shitrai", an Israelite.
Usage: Shitrai.
Source: from the same as "H7860"; "magisterial";

7863.long:
Meaning: "elevation".
Usage: excellency.
Source: from the same as "H7721" by permutation;

7864.long:
Meaning: "Sheja", an Israelite.
Usage: Sheva (from the margin).
Source: for "H7724";

7865.long:
Meaning: "Sion", the summit of Mount Hermon.
Usage: Sion.
Source: from "H7863"; "peak";

7866.long:
Meaning: "Shijon", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Shihon.
Source: from the same as "H7722"; "ruin";

7867.long:
Meaning: properly, to "become aged", i.e. (by implication) to "grow gray".
Usage: (be) grayheaded.
Source: a primitive root;

7870.long:
Meaning: a "return" (of property).
Usage: captivity.
Source: by permutation from "H7725";

7872.long:
Meaning: "old age".
Usage: (be) gray (grey hoar,-y) hairs (head,-ed), old age.
Source: feminine of "H7869";

7873.long:
Meaning: "a withdrawal" (into a private place).
Usage: pursuing.
Source: from "H7734";

7874.long:
Meaning: to "plaster".
Usage: plaister.
Source: a primitive root probably meaning to boil up (compare "H7736"); used only as denominative from "H7875";

7876.long:
Meaning: to "keep in memory".
Usage: be unmindful. (Render Deuteronomy 32:18, 'A Rock bore thee, thou must recollect; and (yet) thou hast forgotten,' etc.).
Source: a primitive root;

7877.long:
Meaning: "Shiza", an Israelite.
Usage: Shiza.
Source: of unknown derivation;

7878.long:
Meaning: to "ponder", i.e. (by implication) "converse" (with oneself, and hence, aloud) or (transitively) "utter".
Usage: commune, complain, declare, meditate, muse, pray, speak, talk (with).
Source: a primitive root;

7879.long:
Meaning: a "contemplation"; by implication, an "utterance".
Usage: babbling, communication, complaint, meditation, prayer, talk.
Source: from "H7878";

7880.long:
Meaning: a "shoot" (as if uttered or put forth), i.e. (generally) "shrubbery".
Usage: bush, plant, shrub.
Source: from "H7878";

7881.long:
Meaning: "reflection"; by extension, "devotion".
Usage: meditation, prayer.
Source: feminine of "H7879";

7883.long:
Meaning: "Shichor", a stream of Egypt.
Usage: Shihor, Sihor.
Source: or "שִׁחוֹר"; or "שִׁחֹר"; probably from "H7835"; "dark", i.e. "turbid";

7884.long:
Meaning: "Shichor-Libnath", a stream of Palestine.
Usage: Shihor-libnath.
Source: from the same as "H7883" and "H3835"; "darkish whiteness";

7885.long:
Meaning: an "oar"; a "scourge" (figuratively).
Usage: oar, scourge.
Source: from "H7751"; also (compare "H7752")

7886.long:
Meaning: "Shiloh", an epithet of the Messiah.
Usage: Shiloh.
Source: from "H7951"; tranquil;

7887.long:
Meaning: "Shiloh", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Shiloh.
Source: or "שִׁלֹה"; or "שִׁילוֹ"; or "שִׁלוֹ"; from the same as "H7886";

7888.long:
Meaning: a "Shilonite" or inhabitant of Shiloh.
Usage: Shilonite.
Source: or "שִׁילֹנִי"; or "שִׁלֹנִי"; from "H7887";

7890.long:
Meaning: "urine".
Usage: piss.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "urinate";

7891.long:
Meaning: to "sing".
Usage: behold (by mistake for "H7789"), sing(-er, -ing man, -ing woman).
Source: or (the original form) "שׁוּר"; (1 Samuel 18:6), a primitive root (rather identical with "H7788" through the idea of "strolling" minstrelsy);

7892.long:
Meaning: a "song"; abstractly, "singing".
Usage: musical(-ick), × sing(-er, -ing), song.
Source: or feminine "שִׁירָה"; from "H7891";

7893.long:
Meaning: "white", i.e. "marble".
Usage: marble.
Source: from an unused root meaning to bleach, i.e. whiten; See "H8336".

7894.long:
Meaning: "Shisha", an Israelite.
Usage: Shisha.
Source: from the same as "H7893"; "whiteness";

7895.long:
Meaning: "Shishak", an Egyptian king.
Usage: Shishak.
Source: or "שׁוּשַׁק"; of Egyptian derivation;

7896.long:
Meaning: to "place" (in a very wide application).
Usage: apply, appoint, array, bring, consider, lay (up), let alone, × look, make, mark, put (on), regard, set, shew, be stayed, × take.
Source: a primitive root;

7898.long:
Meaning: "scrub" or "trash", i.e. wild "growth" of weeds or briers (as if "put" on the field).
Usage: thorns.
Source: from "H7896";

7899.long:
Meaning: a "brier" (as of a hedge).
Usage: prick.
Source: from "H5526" in the sense of "H7753";

7900.long:
Meaning: a "booth" (as interlaced).
Usage: tabernacle.
Source: from "H5526" in the sense of "H7753";

7901.long:
Meaning: to "lie down" (for rest, sexual connection, decease or any other purpose).
Usage: × at all, cast down, (lover-)lay (self) (down), (make to) lie (down, down to sleep, still with), lodge, ravish, take rest, sleep, stay.
Source: a primitive root;

7902.long:
Meaning: a "lying" down (of dew, or for the sexual act).
Usage: × carnally, copulation, × lay, seed.
Source: from "H7901";

7904.long:
Meaning: to "roam" (through lust).
Usage: in the morning (by mistake for "H7925").
Source: a primitive root;

7905.long:
Meaning: a "dart" (as pointed like a thorn).
Usage: barbed iron.
Source: feminine of "H7900" in the sense of "H7899";

7906.long:
Meaning: "Seku", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Sechu.
Source: from an unused root apparently meaning to surmount; an observatory (with the article);

7907.long:
Meaning: "observant", i.e. (concretely) the "mind".
Usage: heart.
Source: from the same as "H7906";

7908.long:
Meaning: "bereavement".
Usage: loss of children, spoiling.
Source: infinitive of "H7921";

7909.long:
Meaning: "bereaved".
Usage: barren, bereaved (robbed) of children (whelps).
Source: or "שַׁכֻּל"; from "H7921";

7910.long:
Meaning: "intoxicated", as a state or a habit.
Usage: drunk(-ard, -en, -en man).
Source: or "שִׁכֹּר"; from "H7937";

7911.long:
Meaning: to "mislay", i.e. to "be oblivious" of, from want of memory or attention.
Usage: × at all, (cause to) forget.
Source: or "שָׁכֵחַ"; a primitive root;

7912.long:
Meaning: to "discover" (literally or figuratively).
Usage: find.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H7911" through the idea of disclosure of a covered or forgotten thing;

7914.long:
Meaning: a "conspicuous" object.
Usage: picture.
Source: feminine from the same as "H7906";

7915.long:
Meaning: a "knife" (as pointed or edged).
Usage: knife.
Source: intensive perhaps from the same as "H7906" in the sense of "H7753";

7916.long:
Meaning: a man "at wages" by the day or year.
Usage: hired (man, servant), hireling.
Source: from "H7936";

7917.long:
Meaning: a "hiring".
Usage: that is hired.
Source: feminine of "H7916";

7918.long:
Meaning: to "weave" (i.e. lay) a "trap"; figuratively, (through the idea of secreting) to "allay" (passions; physically, abate a flood).
Usage: appease, assuage, make to cease, pacify, set.
Source: a primitive root;

7919.long:
Meaning: to "be" (causatively, "make" or "act") "circumspect" and hence, "intelligent".
Usage: consider, expert, instruct, prosper, (deal) prudent(-ly), (give) skill(-ful), have good success, teach, (have, make to) understand(-ing), wisdom, (be, behave self, consider, make) wise(-ly), guide wittingly.
Source: a primitive root;

7921.long:
Meaning: properly, to "miscarry", i.e. "suffer abortion"; by analogy, to "bereave" (literally or figuratively).
Usage: bereave (of children), barren, cast calf (fruit, young), be (make) childless, deprive, destroy, × expect, lose children, miscarry, rob of children, spoil.
Source: a primitive root;

7922.long:
Meaning: "intelligence"; by implication, "success".
Usage: discretion, knowledge, policy, prudence, sense, understanding, wisdom, wise.
Source: or "שֵׂכֶל"; from "H7919";

7923.long:
Meaning: "childlessness" (by continued bereavements).
Usage: to have after loss of others.
Source: plural from "H7921";

7925.long:
Meaning: literally, to "load up" (on the back of man or beast), i.e. to "start early in the morning".
Usage: (arise, be up, get (oneself) up, rise up) early (betimes), morning.
Source: a primitive root; properly, to incline (the shoulder to a burden); but used only as denominative from "H7926";

7926.long:
Meaning: the "neck" (between the shoulders) as the place of burdens; figuratively, the "spur" of a hill.
Usage: back, × consent, portion, shoulder.
Source: from "H7925";

7927.long:
Meaning: "Shekem", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Shechem.
Source: the same as "H7926"; "ridge";

7928.long:
Meaning: "Shekem", the name of a Hivite and two Israelites.
Usage: Shechem.
Source: for "H7926";

7930.long:
Meaning: a "Shikmite" (collectively), or descendants of Shekem.
Usage: Shichemites.
Source: patronymic from "H7928";

7931.long:
Meaning: to "reside" or "permanently stay" (literally or figuratively).
Usage: abide, continue, (cause to, make to) dwell(-er), have habitation, inhabit, lay, place, (cause to) remain, rest, set (up).
Source: a primitive root (apparently akin (by transmission) to "H7901" through the idea of lodging; compare "H5531", "H7925");

7932.long:
Usage: cause to dwell, have habitation.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H7931"

7934.long:
Meaning: a "resident"; by extension, a "fellow-citizen".
Usage: inhabitant, neighbour, nigh.
Source: from "H7931";

7935.long:
Meaning: "Shekanjah", the name of nine Israelites.
Usage: Shecaniah, Shechaniah.
Source: or (prolonged) "שְׁכַנְיָהוּ"; from "H7931" and "H3050"; "Jah has dwelt";

7936.long:
Meaning: to "hire".
Usage: earn wages, hire (out self), reward, × surely.
Source: or (by permutation) "סָכַר"; (Ezra 4:5), a primitive root (apparently akin (by prosthesis) to "H3739" through the idea of temporary purchase; compare "H7937");

7937.long:
Meaning: to "become tipsy"; in a qualified sense, to "satiate" with a stimulating drink or (figuratively) "influence".
Usage: (be filled with) drink (abundantly), (be, make) drunk(-en), be merry. (Superlative of "H8248".).
Source: a primitive root;

7939.long:
Meaning: "payment of contract"; concretely, "salary", "fare", "maintenance"; by implication, "compensation", "benefit".
Usage: hire, price, reward(-ed), wages, worth.
Source: from "H7936";

7940.long:
Meaning: "Sakar", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Sacar.
Source: the same as "H7939"; "recompense";

7941.long:
Meaning: an "intoxicant", i.e. intensely alcoholic "liquor".
Usage: strong drink, drunkard, strong wine.
Source: from "H7937";

7942.long:
Meaning: "drunkenness", "Shikkeron", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Shicron.
Source: for "H7943";

7945.long:
Meaning: "on account of", "whatsoever", "whichsoever".
Usage: cause, sake.
Source: for the rel. "H834"; used with prepositional prefix, and often followed by some pronominal affix;

7947.long:
Meaning: to "space" off; intensive ("evenly") to "make equi-distant".
Usage: equally distant, set in order.
Source: a primitive root;

7948.long:
Meaning: a "spacer" or "raised interval", i.e. the "stile in a frame" or "panel".
Usage: ledge.
Source: from "H7947";

7949.long:
Meaning: to "be snow-white" (with the linen clothing of the slain).
Usage: be as snow.
Source: a primitive root; properly, meaning to be white; used only as denominative from "H7950";

7951.long:
Meaning: "to be tranquil", i.e. "secure" or "successful".
Usage: be happy, prosper, be in safety.
Source: or "שָׁלַו"; (Job 3:26), a primitive root;

7952.long:
Meaning: "to mislead".
Usage: deceive, be negligent.
Source: a primitive root (probably identical with "H7953" through the idea of educing);

7953.long:
Meaning: to "draw out" or "off", i.e. "remove" (the soul by death).
Usage: take away.
Source: a primitive root (rather cognate (by contraction) to the base of "H5394", "H7997" and their congeners through the idea of extracting);

7954.long:
Meaning: to "be secure".
Usage: at rest.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H7951";

7955.long:
Meaning: "a wrong".
Usage: thing amiss.
Source: (Aramaic) from a root corresponding to "H7952";

7956.long:
Meaning: "Shelah", the name of a postdiluvian patriarch and of an Israelite.
Usage: Shelah.
Source: the same as "H7596" (shortened); "request";

7957.long:
Meaning: a "flare of fire".
Usage: (flaming) flame.
Source: from the same as "H3851" with sibilant prefix;

7958.long:
Meaning: the "quail" collectively (as "slow" in flight from its weight).
Usage: quails.
Source: or "שְׂלָיו"; by orthographical variation from "H7951" through the idea of "sluggishness";

7960.long:
Meaning: a "fault".
Usage: error, × fail, thing amiss.
Source: (Aramaic) or "שָׁלוּת"; (Aramaic), from the same as "H7955";

7961.long:
Meaning: "tranquil"; (in a bad sense) "careless"; abstractly, "security".
Usage: (being) at ease, peaceable, (in) prosper(-ity), quiet(-ness), wealthy.
Source: or "שָׁלֵיו"; feminine "שְׁלֵוָה"; from "H7951";

7962.long:
Meaning: "security" (genuine or false).
Usage: abundance, peace(-ably), prosperity, quietness.
Source: from "H7951";

7964.long:
Meaning: (only in plural) a "dismissal", i.e. (of a wife) "divorce" (especially the document); also (of a daughter) "dower".
Usage: presents, have sent back.
Source: or "שִׁלֻּחַ"; from "H7971";

7965.long:
Meaning: "safe", i.e. (figuratively) "well", "happy", "friendly"; also (abstractly) "welfare", i.e. health, prosperity, peace.
Usage: × do, familiar, × fare, favour, friend, × great, (good) health, (× perfect, such as be at) peace(-able, -ably), prosper(-ity, -ous), rest, safe(-ty), salute, welfare, (× all is, be) well, × wholly.
Source: or "שָׁלֹם"; from "H7999";

7966.long:
Meaning: a "requital", i.e. (secure) "retribution", (venal) a "fee".
Usage: recompense, reward.
Source: or "שִׁלֻּם"; from "H7999";

7967.long:
Meaning: "Shallum", the name of fourteen Israelites.
Usage: Shallum.
Source: or (shorter) "שַׁלֻּם"; the same as "H7966";

7969.long:
Meaning: "three"; occasionally (ordinal) "third", or (multiple) "thrice".
Usage: fork, often(-times), third, thir(-teen, -teenth), three, thrice. Compare "H7991".
Source: or "שָׁלֹשׁ"; masculine "שְׁלוֹשָׁה"; or "שְׁלֹשָׁה"; a primitive number;

7970.long:
Meaning: "thirty"; or (ordinal) "thirtieth".
Usage: thirty, thirtieth. Compare "H7991".
Source: or "שְׁלֹשִׁים"; multiple of "H7969";

7971.long:
Meaning: to "send" away, for, or out (in a great variety of applications).
Usage: × any wise, appoint, bring (on the way), cast (away, out), conduct, × earnestly, forsake, give (up), grow long, lay, leave, let depart (down, go, loose), push away, put (away, forth, in, out), reach forth, send (away, forth, out), set, shoot (forth, out), sow, spread, stretch forth (out).
Source: a primitive root;

7973.long:
Meaning: a "missile" of attack, i.e. "spear"; also (figuratively) a "shoot" of growth; i.e. "branch".
Usage: dart, plant, × put off, sword, weapon.
Source: from "H7971";

7974.long:
Meaning: "Shelach", a postdiluvian patriarch.
Usage: Salah, Shelah. Compare "H7975".
Source: the same as "H7973";

7975.long:
Meaning: "Shiloach", a fountain of Jerusalem.
Usage: Shiloah, Siloah.
Source: or (in imitation of "H7974") "שֶׁלַח"; (Nehemiah 3:15), from "H7971"; "rill";

7977.long:
Meaning: "Shilchi", an Israelite.
Usage: Shilhi.
Source: from "H7973"; missive, i.e. "armed";

7978.long:
Meaning: "Shilchim", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Shilhim.
Source: plural of "H7973"; javelins or sprouts;

7979.long:
Meaning: a "table" (as "spread" out); by implication, a "meal".
Usage: table.
Source: from "H7971";

7980.long:
Meaning: to "dominate", i.e. "govern"; by implication, to "permit".
Usage: (bear, have) rule, have dominion, give (have) power.
Source: a primitive root;

7981.long:
Usage: have the mastery, have power, bear rule, be (make) ruler.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H7980"

7982.long:
Meaning: probably a "shield" (as "controlling", i.e. protecting the person).
Usage: shield.
Source: from "H7980";

7988.long:
Meaning: a "fetus" or "babe" (as extruded in birth).
Usage: young one.
Source: feminine from "H7953";

7989.long:
Meaning: "potent"; concretely, a "prince" or "warrior".
Usage: governor, mighty, that hath power, ruler.
Source: from "H7980";

7990.long:
Meaning: "mighty"; abstractly, "permission"; concretely, a "premier".
Usage: captain, be lawful, rule(-r).
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H7989";

7991.long:
Meaning: a "triple", i.e. (as a musical instrument) a "triangle" (or perhaps rather "three"-stringed lute); also (as an indefinite, great quantity) a "three"-fold measure (perhaps a "treble" ephah); also (as an officer) a general of the "third" rank (upward, i.e. the highest).
Usage: captain, instrument of musick, (great) lord, (great) measure, prince, three (from the margin).
Source: or "שָׁלוֹשׁ"; (1 Chronicles 11:11; 1 Chronicles 12:18), or "שָׁלֹשׁ"; (2 Samuel 23:13), from "H7969";

7992.long:
Meaning: "third"; feminine a "third" (part); by extension, a "third" (day, year or time); specifically, a "third-story cell)".
Usage: third (part, rank, time), three (years old).
Source: ordinal from "H7969";

7993.long:
Meaning: to "throw" out, down or away (literally or figuratively).
Usage: adventure, cast (away, down, forth, off, out), hurl, pluck, throw.
Source: a primitive root;

7994.long:
Meaning: "bird of prey", usually thought to be the "pelican" (from casting itself into the sea).
Usage: cormorant.
Source: from "H7993";

7996.long:
Meaning: "Shalleketh", a gate in Jerusalem.
Usage: Shalleketh.
Source: the same as "H7995";

7997.long:
Meaning: to "drop" or "strip"; by implication, to "plunder".
Usage: let fall, make self a prey, × of purpose, (make a, (take)) spoil.
Source: a primitive root;

7999.long:
Meaning: to "be safe" (in mind, body or estate); figuratively, to "be" (causatively, "make") "completed"; by implication, to "be friendly"; by extension, to "reciprocate" (in various applications).
Usage: make amends, (make an) end, finish, full, give again, make good, (re-) pay (again), (make) (to) (be at) peace(-able), that is perfect, perform, (make) prosper(-ous), recompense, render, requite, make restitution, restore, reward, × surely.
Source: a primitive root;

8000.long:
Meaning: to "complete", to "restore".
Usage: deliver, finish.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H7999";

8002.long:
Meaning: properly, "requital", i.e. a (voluntary) sacrifice in "thanks".
Usage: peace offering.
Source: from "H7999";

8003.long:
Meaning: "complete" (literally or figuratively); especially "friendly".
Usage: full, just, made ready, peaceable, perfect(-ed), quiet, Shalem (by mistake for a name), whole.
Source: from "H7999";

8004.long:
Meaning: "Shalem", an early name of Jerusalem.
Usage: Salem.
Source: the same as "H8003"; "peaceful";

8006.long:
Meaning: "Shillem", an Israelite.
Usage: Shillem.
Source: the same as "H8005";

8007.long:
Meaning: "Salma", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Salma.
Source: probably for "H8008"; clothing;

8008.long:
Meaning: a "dress".
Usage: clothes, garment, raiment.
Source: transp. for "H8071";

8009.long:
Meaning: "Salmah", an Israelite.
Usage: Salmon. Compare "H8012".
Source: the same as "H8008"; "clothing";

8013.long:
Meaning: "Shelomoth", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Shelomith (from the margin), Shelomoth. Compare "H8019".
Source: feminine plural of "H7965"; "pacifications";

8016.long:
Meaning: a "Shilemite" (collectively) or descendants of Shillem.
Usage: Shillemites.
Source: patronymically from "H8006";

8017.long:
Meaning: "Shelumiel", an Israelite.
Usage: Shelumiel.
Source: from "H7965" and "H410"; "peace of God";

8018.long:
Meaning: "Shelemjah", the name of nine Israelites.
Usage: Shelemiah.
Source: or "שֶׁלֶמְיָהוּ"; from "H8002" and "H3050"; "thank-offering of Jah";

8019.long:
Meaning: "Shelomith", the name of five Israelites and three Israelitesses.
Usage: Shelomith.
Source: or "שׁלוֹמִית"; (Ezra 8:10), from "H7965"; "peaceableness";

8020.long:
Meaning: "Shalman", a king apparently of Assyria.
Usage: Shalman. Compare "H8022".
Source: of foreign derivation;

8022.long:
Meaning: "Shalmaneser", an Assyrian king.
Usage: Shalmaneser. Comp "H8020".
Source: of foreign derivation;

8023.long:
Meaning: "Shiloni", an Israelite.
Usage: Shiloni.
Source: the same as "H7888";

8024.long:
Meaning: a "Shelanite" (collectively), or descendants of Shelah.
Usage: Shelanites.
Source: from "H7956";

8025.long:
Meaning: to "pull" out, up or off.
Usage: draw (off), grow up, pluck off.
Source: a primitive root;

8026.long:
Meaning: "Sheleph", a son of Jokthan.
Usage: Sheleph.
Source: from "H8025"; extract;

8027.long:
Meaning: to "be" (causatively, "make") "triplicate" (by restoration, in portions, strands, days or years).
Usage: do the third time, (divide into, stay) three (days, -fold, parts, years old).
Source: a primitive root perhaps originally to intensify, i.e. treble; but apparently used only as denominative from "H7969",

8029.long:
Meaning: a descendant of the "third" degree, i.e. "great grandchild".
Usage: third (generation).
Source: from "H8027";

8030.long:
Meaning: "Shilshah", an Israelite.
Usage: Shilshah.
Source: feminine from the same as "H8028"; "triplication";

8031.long:
Meaning: "Shalishah", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Shalisha.
Source: feminine from "H8027"; "trebled land";

8032.long:
Meaning: "trebly", i.e. (in time) "day before yesterday".
Usage: before (that time, -time), excellent things (from the margin), heretofore, three days, time past.
Source: or "שִׁלְשֹׁם"; from the same as "H8028";

8033.long:
Meaning: "there" (transferring to time) "then"; often "thither", or "thence".
Usage: in it, thence, there (-in, of, out), thither, whither.
Source: a primitive particle (rather from the relative pronoun, "H834");

8034.long:
Meaning: an "appellation", as a mark or memorial of individuality; by implication "honor", "authority", "character".
Usage: base, (in-) fame(-ous), named(-d), renown, report.
Source: a primitive word [perhaps rather from "H7760" through the idea of definite and conspicuous "position"; compare "H8064"];

8035.long:
Meaning: "Shem", a son of Noah (often includ. his posterity).
Usage: Sem, Shem.
Source: the same as "H8034"; "name";

8038.long:
Meaning: "Shemeber", a king of Zeboim.
Usage: Shemeber.
Source: apparently from "H8034" and "H83"; name of pinion, i.e. illustrious;

8039.long:
Meaning: "Shimah", an Israelite.
Usage: Shimah. Compare "H8043".
Source: perhaps for "H8093";

8040.long:
Meaning: properly, "dark" (as "enveloped"), i.e. the "north"; hence (by orientation), the "left" hand.
Usage: left (hand, side).
Source: or "שְׂמֹאל"; a primitive word (rather perhaps from the same as "H8071" (by insertion of the aleph) through the idea of "wrapping" up);

8041.long:
Meaning: to "use the left hand" or "pass in that direction".
Usage: (go, turn) (on the, to the) left.
Source: a primitive root (denominative from "H8040");

8042.long:
Meaning: situated on the "left" side.
Usage: left.
Source: from "H8040";

8044.long:
Meaning: "Shamgar", an Israelite judge.
Usage: Shamgar.
Source: of uncertain derivation;

8045.long:
Meaning: to "desolate".
Usage: destory(-uction), bring to nought, overthrow, perish, pluck down, × utterly.
Source: a primitive root;

8047.long:
Meaning: "ruin"; by implication, "consternation".
Usage: astonishment, desolate(-ion), waste, wonderful thing.
Source: from "H8074";

8048.long:
Meaning: "Shammah", the name of an Edomite and four Israelites.
Usage: Shammah.
Source: the same as "H8047";

8050.long:
Meaning: "Shemuël", the name of three Israelites.
Usage: Samuel, Shemuel.
Source: from the passive participle of "H8085" and "H410"; heard of God;

8051.long:
Meaning: "Shammua", the name of four Israelites.
Usage: Shammua, Shammuah.
Source: from "H8074"; "renowned";

8052.long:
Meaning: something "heard", i.e. an "announcement".
Usage: bruit, doctrine, fame, mentioned, news, report, rumor, tidings.
Source: feminine passive participle of "H8074";

8053.long:
Meaning: "Shamur", an Israelite.
Usage: Shamir (from the margin).
Source: passive participle of "H8103"; "observed";

8054.long:
Meaning: "Shammoth", an Israelite.
Usage: Shamoth.
Source: plural of "H8047"; ruins;

8055.long:
Meaning: probably to "brighten" up, i.e. (figuratively) "be" (causatively, make) "blithe" or "gleesome".
Usage: cheer up, be (make) glad, (have, make) joy(-ful), be (make) merry, (cause to, make to) rejoice, × very.
Source: a primitive root;

8056.long:
Meaning: "blithe" or "gleeful".
Usage: (be) glad, joyful, (making) merry((-hearted), -ily), rejoice(-ing).
Source: from "H8055";

8057.long:
Meaning: "blithesomeness" or "glee", (religious or festival).
Usage: × exceeding(-ly), gladness, joy(-fulness), mirth, pleasure, rejoice(-ing).
Source: from "H8056";

8058.long:
Meaning: to "fling down"; incipiently to "jostle"; figuratively, to "let alone", "desist", "remit".
Usage: discontinue, overthrow, release, let rest, shake, stumble, throw down.
Source: a primitive root;

8059.long:
Meaning: "remission" (of debt) or "suspension of labor)".
Usage: release.
Source: from "H8058";

8060.long:
Meaning: "Shammai", the name of three Israelites.
Usage: Shammai.
Source: from "H8073"; "destructive";

8061.long:
Meaning: "Shemida", an Israelite.
Usage: Shemida, Shemidah.
Source: apparently from "H8034" and "H3045"; "name of knowing";

8062.long:
Meaning: a "Shemidaite" (collectively) or descendants of Shemida.
Usage: Shemidaites.
Source: patronymically from "H8061";

8063.long:
Meaning: a "run" (as sustaining the Oriental sitter).
Usage: mantle.
Source: from "H5564";

8064.long:
Meaning: the "sky" (as "aloft"; the dual perhaps alluding to the visible arch in which the clouds move, as well as to the higher ether where the celestial bodies revolve).
Usage: air, × astrologer, heaven(-s).
Source: dual of an unused singular "שָׁמֶה"; from an unused root meaning to "be lofty";

8067.long:
Meaning: probably an "eight-stringed lyre".
Usage: Sheminith.
Source: feminine of "H8066";

8068.long:
Meaning: a "thorn"; also (from its "keenness" for scratching) a gem, probably the "diamond".
Usage: adamant (stone), brier, diamond.
Source: from "H8104" in the original sense of "pricking";

8069.long:
Meaning: "Shamir", the name of two places in Palestine.
Usage: Shamir. Compare "H8053".
Source: the same as "H8068";

8070.long:
Meaning: "Shemiramoth", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Shemiramoth.
Source: or "שְׁמָרִימוֹת"; probably from "H8034" and plural of "H7413"; "name of heights";

8071.long:
Meaning: a "dress", especially a "mantle".
Usage: apparel, cloth(-es, -ing), garment, raiment. Compare "H8008".
Source: perhaps by permutation for the feminine of "H5566" (through the idea of a "cover" assuming the shape of the object beneath);

8072.long:
Meaning: "Samlah", an Edomite.
Usage: Samlah.
Source: probably for the same as "H8071";

8073.long:
Meaning: "Shamlai", one of the Nethinim.
Usage: Shalmai (from the margin).
Source: for "H8014";

8074.long:
Meaning: to "stun" (or intransitively, "grow numb"), i.e. "devastate" or (figuratively) "stupefy" (both usually in a passive sense).
Usage: make amazed, be astonied, (be an) astonish(-ment), (be, bring into, unto, lay, lie, make) desolate(-ion, places), be destitute, destroy (self), (lay, lie, make) waste, wonder.
Source: a primitive root;

8077.long:
Meaning: "devastation"; figuratively, "astonishment".
Usage: (laid, × most) desolate(-ion), waste.
Source: or "שִׁמָמָה"; feminine of "H8076";

8079.long:
Meaning: a "lizard" (from the superstition of its noxiousness).
Usage: spider.
Source: probably from "H8074" (in the sense of poisoning);

8080.long:
Meaning: to "shine", i.e. (by analogy) "be" (causatively, "make") "oily" or "gross".
Usage: become (make, wax) fat.
Source: a primitive root;

8081.long:
Meaning: "grease", especially liquid (as from the olive, often perfumed); figuratively, "richness".
Usage: anointing, × fat (things), × fruitful, oil(-ed), ointment, olive, pine.
Source: from "H8080";

8082.long:
Meaning: "greasy", i.e. "gross"; figuratively, "rich".
Usage: fat, lusty, plenteous.
Source: from "H8080";

8083.long:
Meaning: a cardinal number, "eight" (as if a surplus above the 'perfect' seven); also (as ordinal) "eighth".
Usage: eight(-een, -eenth), eighth.
Source: or "שְׁמוֹנֶה"; feminine "שְׁמֹנָה"; or "שְׁמוֹנָה"; apparently from "H8082" through the idea of plumpness;

8084.long:
Meaning: "eighty", also "eightieth".
Usage: eighty(-ieth), fourscore.
Source: or "שְׁמוֹנִים"; multiple from "H8083";

8085.long:
Meaning: to "hear" intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to "tell", etc.).
Usage: × attentively, call (gather) together, × carefully, × certainly, consent, consider, be content, declare, × diligently, discern, give ear, (cause to, let, make to) hear(-ken, tell), × indeed, listen, make (a) noise, (be) obedient, obey, perceive, (make a) proclaim(-ation), publish, regard, report, shew (forth), (make a) sound, × surely, tell, understand, whosoever (heareth), witness.
Source: a primitive root;

8087.long:
Meaning: "Shema", the name of a place in Palestine and of four Israelites.
Usage: Shema.
Source: for the same as "H8088";

8088.long:
Meaning: something "heard", i.e. a "sound", "rumor", "announcement"; abstractly, "audience".
Usage: bruit, fame, hear(-ing), loud, report, speech, tidings.
Source: from "H8085";

8090.long:
Meaning: "Shema", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Shema.
Source: for "H8087";

8092.long:
Meaning: "Shima", the name of four Israelites.
Usage: Shimea, Shimei, Shamma.
Source: for "H8093";

8093.long:
Meaning: "Shimah", an Israelite.
Usage: Shimeah.
Source: feminine of "H8088"; annunciation;

8095.long:
Meaning: "Shimon", one of Jacob's sons, also the tribe descended from him.
Usage: Simeon.
Source: from "H8085"; "hearing";

8096.long:
Meaning: "Shimi", the name of twenty Israelites.
Usage: Shimeah (from the margin), Shimei, Shimhi, Shimi.
Source: from "H8088"; "famous";

8097.long:
Meaning: a "Shimite" (collectively) or descendants of Shimi.
Usage: of Shimi, Shimites.
Source: patronymically from "H8096";

8098.long:
Meaning: "Shemajah", the name of twenty-five Israelites.
Usage: Shemaiah.
Source: or "שְׁמַעְיָהוּ"; from "H8085" and "H3050"; "Jah has heard";

8099.long:
Meaning: a "Shimonite" (collectively) or descendants of Shimon.
Usage: tribe of Simeon, Simeonites.
Source: patronymically from "H8095";

8101.long:
Meaning: a "Shimathite" (collectively) or descendants of Shimah.
Usage: Shimeathites.
Source: patronymically from "H8093";

8102.long:
Meaning: an "inkling".
Usage: a little.
Source: from an unused root meaning to emit a sound;

8103.long:
Meaning: scornful "whispering" (of hostile spectators).
Usage: shame.
Source: feminine of "H8102";

8104.long:
Meaning: properly, to "hedge" about (as with thorns), i.e. "guard"; generally, to "protect", "attend to", etc.
Usage: beward, be circumspect, take heed (to self), keep(-er, self), mark, look narrowly, observe, preserve, regard, reserve, save (self), sure, (that lay) wait (for), watch(-man).
Source: a primitive root;

8105.long:
Meaning: something "preserved", i.e. the "settlings" (plural only) of wine.
Usage: dregs, (wines on the) lees.
Source: from "H8104";

8106.long:
Meaning: "Shemer", the name of three Israelites.
Usage: Shamer, Shemer.
Source: the same as "H8105";

8108.long:
Meaning: "watchfulness".
Usage: watch.
Source: feminine of an unused noun from "H8104" meaning a "guard";

8109.long:
Meaning: something "guarded", i.e. an "eye-lid".
Usage: waking.
Source: feminine of passive participle of "H8104";

8110.long:
Meaning: "Shimron", the name of an Israelite and of a place in Palestine.
Usage: Shimron.
Source: from "H8105" in its original sense; "guardianship";

8111.long:
Meaning: "Shomeron", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Samaria.
Source: from the active participle of "H8104"; "watch-station";

8112.long:
Meaning: "Shimron-Meron", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Shimon-meron.
Source: from "H8110" and a derivative of "H4754"; guard of lashing;

8113.long:
Meaning: "Shimri", the name of four Israelites.
Usage: Shimri.
Source: from "H8105" in its original sense; "watchful";

8114.long:
Meaning: "Shemarjah", the name of four Israelites.
Usage: Shamariah, Shemariah.
Source: or "שְׁמַרְיָהוּ"; from "H8104" and "H3050"; "Jah has guarded";

8115.long:
Meaning: "Shomrain", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Samaria.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H8111";

8116.long:
Meaning: "Shimrith", a Moabitess.
Usage: Shimrith.
Source: feminine of "H8113"; female guard;

8117.long:
Meaning: a "Shimronite" (collectively) or descendants of Shimron.
Usage: Shimronites.
Source: patronymically from "H8110";

8118.long:
Meaning: a "Shomeronite" (collectively) or inhabitants of Shomeron.
Usage: Samaritans.
Source: patrial from "H8111";

8120.long:
Meaning: to "serve".
Usage: minister.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to the root of "H8121" through the idea of activity implied in day-light;

8121.long:
Meaning: the "sun"; by implication, the "east"; figuratively, a "ray", i.e. (architectural) a notched "battlement".
Usage: east side(-ward), sun (rising), west(-ward), window. See also "H1053".
Source: from an unused root meaning to be "brilliant";

8126.long:
Meaning: a "Shumathite" (collectively) or descendants of Shumah.
Usage: Shumathites.
Source: patronymically from an unused name from "H7762" probably meaning garlic-smell;

8127.long:
Meaning: a "tooth" (as "sharp"); specifically "ivory"; figuratively, a "cliff".
Usage: crag, × forefront, ivory, × sharp, tooth.
Source: from "H8150"; compare "H8143"

8129.long:
Meaning: "Shen", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Shen.
Source: the same as "H8127"; "crag";

8130.long:
Meaning: to "hate" (personally).
Usage: enemy, foe, (be) hate(-ful, -r), odious, × utterly.
Source: a primitive root;

8134.long:
Meaning: "Shinab", a Canaanite.
Usage: Shinab.
Source: probably from "H8132" and "H1"; a father has turned;

8137.long:
Meaning: "Shenatstsar", an Israelite.
Usage: Senazar.
Source: apparently of Babylonian origin;

8138.long:
Meaning: to "fold", i.e. "duplicate" (literally or figuratively); by implication, to "transmute" (transitive or intransitive).
Usage: do (speak, strike) again, alter, double, (be given to) change, disguise, (be) diverse, pervert, prefer, repeat, return, do the second time.
Source: a primitive root;

8141.long:
Meaning: a "year" (as a "revolution" of time).
Usage: whole age, × long, old, year(× -ly).
Source: (in plural or (feminine) "שָׁנָה"; from "H8138";

8143.long:
Meaning: probably, "tooth of elephants", i.e. "ivory tusk".
Usage: ivory.
Source: from "H8127" and the plural apparently of a foreign word;

8144.long:
Meaning: "crimson", properly, the insect or its color, also stuff dyed with it.
Usage: crimson, scarlet (thread).
Source: of uncertain derivation;

8145.long:
Meaning: properly, "double", i.e. "second"; also adverbially, "again".
Usage: again, either (of them), (an-) other, second (time).
Source: from "H8138";

8147.long:
Meaning: "two"; also (as ordinal) "twofold".
Usage: both, couple, double, second, twain, twelfth, twelve, twenty (sixscore) thousand, twice, two.
Source: dual of "H8145"; feminine "שְׁתַּיִם";

8148.long:
Meaning: something "pointed", i.e. a "gibe".
Usage: byword, taunt.
Source: from "H8150";

8149.long:
Meaning: "Shenir" or "Senir", a summit of Lebanon.
Usage: Senir, Shenir.
Source: or "שְׂנִיר"; from an unused root meaning to be pointed; "peak";

8150.long:
Meaning: to "point" (transitive or intransitive); intensively, to "pierce"; figuratively, to "inculcate".
Usage: prick, sharp(-en), teach diligently, whet.
Source: a primitive root;

8151.long:
Meaning: to "compress" (with a belt).
Usage: gird up.
Source: a primitive root;

8152.long:
Meaning: "Shinar", a plain in Babylonia.
Usage: Shinar.
Source: probably of foreign derivation;

8154.long:
Meaning: to "plunder".
Usage: destroyer, rob, spoil(-er).
Source: or "שָׁשָׂה"; (Isaiah 10:13), a primitive root;

8155.long:
Meaning: to "plunder".
Usage: rifle, spoil.
Source: a primitive root;

8156.long:
Meaning: to "split" or "tear"; figuratively, to "upbraid".
Usage: cleave, (be) cloven (footed), rend, stay.
Source: a primitive root;

8158.long:
Meaning: to "cut in pieces", i.e. "slaughter".
Usage: hew in pieces.
Source: a primitive root;

8159.long:
Meaning: to "gaze" at or about (properly, for help); by implication, to "inspect", "consider", "compassionate", "be nonplussed" (as looking around in amazement) or "bewildered".
Usage: depart, be dim, be dismayed, look (away), regard, have respect, spare, turn.
Source: a primitive root;

8160.long:
Meaning: properly, a "look", i.e. a "moment".
Usage: hour.
Source: (Aramaic) from a root corresponding to "H8159";

8161.long:
Meaning: a "clatter" (of hoofs).
Usage: stamping.
Source: feminine from an unused root meaning to "stamp";

8162.long:
Meaning: "linsey-woolsey", i.e. cloth of linen and wool carded and spun together.
Usage: garment of divers sorts, linen and wollen.
Source: probably of foreign derivation;

8163.long:
Meaning: "shaggy"; as noun, a "he-goat"; by analogy, a "faun".
Usage: devil, goat, hairy, kid, rough, satyr.
Source: or "שָׂעִר"; from "H8175";

8164.long:
Meaning: a "shower" (as tempestuous).
Usage: small rain.
Source: formed the same as "H8163";

8165.long:
Meaning: "Seir", a mountain of Idumaea and its aboriginal occupants, also one in Palestine.
Usage: Seir.
Source: formed like "H8163"; "rough";

8167.long:
Meaning: "Seirah", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Seirath.
Source: formed as "H8166"; "roughness";

8168.long:
Meaning: the "palm"; by extension, a "handful".
Usage: handful, hollow of the hand.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "hollow" out;

8169.long:
Meaning: "Shaalbim" or "Shaalabbin", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Shaalabbin, Shaalbim.
Source: or "שַׁעֲלַבִּין"; plural from "H7776"; "fox-holes";

8170.long:
Meaning: a "Shaalbonite" or inhabitant of Shaalbin.
Usage: Shaalbonite.
Source: patrial from "H8169";

8171.long:
Meaning: "Shaalim", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Shalim.
Source: plural of "H7776"; "foxes";

8172.long:
Meaning: to "support" one's self.
Usage: lean, lie, rely, rest (on, self), stay.
Source: a primitive root;

8173.long:
Meaning: (in a good acceptation) to "look upon" (with complacency), i.e. "fondle", "please" or "amuse" (self); (in a bad one) to "look about" (in dismay), i.e. "stare".
Usage: cry (out) (by confusion with "H7768"), dandle, delight (self), play, shut.
Source: a primitive root;

8174.long:
Meaning: "Shaaph", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Shaaph.
Source: from "H5586"; "fluctuation";

8175.long:
Meaning: to "storm"; by implication, to "shiver", i.e. "fear".
Usage: be (horribly) afraid, fear, hurl as a storm, be tempestuous, come like (take away as with) a whirlwind.
Source: a primitive root;

8176.long:
Meaning: to "act as gatekeeper"; (figuratively) to "estimate".
Usage: think.
Source: a primitive root; to "split" or "open", i.e. (literally, but only as denominative from "H8179"); compare see "H7778"

8178.long:
Meaning: a "terror".
Usage: affrighted, × horribly, × sore, storm. See "H8181".
Source: from "H8175";

8179.long:
Meaning: an "opening", i.e. "door" or "gate".
Usage: city, door, gate, port (× -er).
Source: from "H8176" in its original sense;

8181.long:
Meaning: "hair" (as if tossed or bristling).
Usage: hair(-y), × rough.
Source: or "שַׂעַר"; (Isaiah 7:20), from "H8175" in the sense of dishevelling;

8184.long:
Meaning: "barley" (as villose).
Usage: barley.
Source: or "שְׂעוֹרָה" (feminine meaning the plant); and (masculine meaning the grain); also "שְׂעֹר"; or "שְׂעוֹר"; from "H8175" in the sense of roughness;

8186.long:
Meaning: something "fearful".
Usage: horrible thing.
Source: or "שַׁעֲרִירִיָּה"; or "שַׁעֲרֻרִת"; feminine from "H8176" in the sense of "H8175";

8187.long:
Meaning: "Shearjah", an Israelite.
Usage: Sheariah.
Source: from "H8176" and "H3050"; "Jah has stormed";

8188.long:
Meaning: "Seorim", an Israelite.
Usage: Seorim.
Source: masculine plural of "H8184"; "barley grains";

8189.long:
Meaning: "Shaarajim", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Shaaraim.
Source: dual of "H8179"; "double gates";

8190.long:
Meaning: "Shaashgaz", a eunuch of Xerxes.
Usage: Shaashgaz.
Source: of Persian derivation;

8192.long:
Meaning: to "abrade", i.e. "bare".
Usage: high, stick out.
Source: a primitive root;

8193.long:
Meaning: the "lip" (as a natural boundary); by implication, "language"; by analogy, a "margin" (of a vessel, water, cloth, etc.).
Usage: band, bank, binding, border, brim, brink, edge, language, lip, prating, (sea-)shore, side, speech, talk, (vain) words.
Source: or (in dual and plural) "שֶׂפֶת"; probably from "H5595" or "H8192" through the idea of "termination" (compare "H5490");

8194.long:
Meaning: a "cheese" (as strained from the whey).
Usage: cheese.
Source: from "H8192" in the sense of clarifying;

8195.long:
Meaning: "Shepho" or "Shephi", an Idumaean.
Usage: Shephi, Shepho.
Source: or "שְׁפִי"; from "H8192"; "baldness" (compare "H8205");

8196.long:
Meaning: a "judicial sentence", i.e. "punishment".
Usage: judgment.
Source: or "שְׁפוּט"; from "H8199";

8197.long:
Meaning: "Shephupham", an Israelite.
Usage: Shephuphan, Shupham.
Source: or "שְׁפוּפָן"; from the same as "H8207"; "serpent-like";

8198.long:
Meaning: a "female slave" (as a member of the household).
Usage: (bond-, hand-) maid(-en, -servant), wench, bondwoman, womanservant.
Source: feminine from an unused root meaning to spread out (as a family; see "H4940");

8199.long:
Meaning: to "judge", i.e. pronounce "sentence" (for or against); by implication, to "vindicate" or "punish"; by extenssion, to "govern"; passively, to "litigate" (literally or figuratively).
Usage: avenge, × that condemn, contend, defend, execute (judgment), (be a) judge(-ment), × needs, plead, reason, rule.
Source: a primitive root;

8202.long:
Meaning: "Shaphat", the name of four Israelites.
Usage: Shaphat.
Source: from "H8199"; "judge";

8203.long:
Meaning: "Shephatjah", the name of ten Israelites.
Usage: Shephatiah.
Source: or "שְׁפַטְיָהוּ"; from "H8199" and "H3050"; "Jah has judged";

8205.long:
Meaning: "bareness"; concretely, a "bare" hill or plain.
Usage: high place, stick out.
Source: from "H8192";

8206.long:
Meaning: "Shuppim", an Israelite.
Usage: Shuppim.
Source: plural of an unused noun from the same as "H8207" and meaning the same; "serpents";

8207.long:
Meaning: a kind of "serpent" (as "snapping"), probably the "cerastes" or "horned adder".
Usage: adder.
Source: from an unused root meaning the same as "H7779";

8208.long:
Meaning: "Shaphir", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Saphir.
Source: from "H8231"; "beautiful";

8209.long:
Meaning: "beautiful".
Usage: fair.
Source: (Aramaic) intensive of a form corresponding to "H8208";

8210.long:
Meaning: to "spill forth" (blood, a libation, liquid metal; or even a solid, i.e. to mound up); also (figuratively) to "expend" (life, soul, complaint, money, etc.); intensively, to "sprawl out".
Usage: cast (up), gush out, pour (out), shed(-der, out), slip.
Source: a primitive root;

8211.long:
Meaning: an "emptying" place, e.g. an ash-"heap".
Usage: are poured out.
Source: from "H8210";

8212.long:
Meaning: a "pipe" (for pouring forth, e.g. wine), i.e. the "penis".
Usage: privy member.
Source: feminine of a derivative from "H8210";

8213.long:
Meaning: to "depress" or "sink" (especially figuratively, to "humiliate", intransitive or transitive).
Usage: abase, bring (cast, put) down, debase, humble (self), be (bring, lay, make, put) low(-er).
Source: a primitive root;

8214.long:
Usage: abase, humble, put down, subdue.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H8213"

8217.long:
Meaning: "depressed", literally or figuratively.
Usage: base(-st), humble, low(-er, -ly).
Source: from "H8213";

8219.long:
Meaning: "Lowland", i.e. (with the article) the maritime slope of Palestine.
Usage: low country, (low) plain, vale(-ley).
Source: from "H8213";

8221.long:
Meaning: "Shepham", a place in or near Palestine.
Usage: Shepham.
Source: probably from "H8192"; "bare spot";

8224.long:
Meaning: "Siphmoth", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Siphmoth.
Source: feminine plural of "H8221";

8225.long:
Meaning: a "Shiphmite" or inhabitant of Shepham.
Usage: Shiphmite.
Source: patrial from "H8221";

8226.long:
Meaning: to "conceal" (as a valuable).
Usage: treasure.
Source: a primitive root;

8227.long:
Meaning: a species of "rock-rabbit" (from its "hiding"), i.e. probably the "hyrax".
Usage: coney.
Source: from "H8226";

8228.long:
Meaning: "resources".
Usage: abundance.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "abound";

8231.long:
Meaning: to "glisten", i.e. (figuratively) "be" (causatively, "make") "fair".
Usage: × goodly.
Source: a primitive root;

8232.long:
Meaning: to "be beautiful".
Usage: be acceptable, please, think good.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H8231";

8234.long:
Meaning: "Shepher", a place in the Desert.
Usage: Shapper.
Source: the same as "H8233";

8236.long:
Meaning: "Shiphrah", an Israelitess.
Usage: Shiphrah.
Source: the same as "H8235";

8237.long:
Meaning: "splendid", i.e. "a tapestry" or "canopy".
Usage: royal pavilion.
Source: from "H8231";

8238.long:
Meaning: the "dawn" (as brilliant with aurora).
Usage: × very early in the morning.
Source: (Aramaic) from "H8231";

8239.long:
Meaning: to "locate", i.e. (generally) "hang on" or (figuratively) "establish", "reduce".
Usage: bring, ordain, set on.
Source: a primitive root;

8240.long:
Meaning: a (double) "stall" (for cattle); also a (two-pronged) "hook" (for flaying animals on).
Usage: hook, pot.
Source: from "H8239";

8241.long:
Meaning: "an outburst" (of anger).
Usage: little.
Source: from "H7857" (for alliteration with "H7110");

8242.long:
Meaning: properly, a "mesh" (as allowing a liquid to "run" through), i.e. coarse loose cloth or "sacking" (used in mourning and for bagging); hence, a "bag" (for grain, etc.).
Usage: sack(-cloth, -clothes).
Source: from "H8264";

8245.long:
Meaning: to "be alert", i.e. "sleepless"; hence to "be on the lookout" (whether for good or ill).
Usage: hasten, remain, wake, watch (for).
Source: a primitive root;

8246.long:
Meaning: to "be" (intensively, "make") "almond-shaped".
Usage: make like (unto, after the fashion of) almonds.
Source: a denominative from "H8247";

8247.long:
Meaning: the "almond" (tree or nut; as being the earliest in bloom).
Usage: almond (tree).
Source: from "H8245";

8248.long:
Meaning: to "quaff", i.e. (causatively) to "irrigate" or "furnish a potion to".
Usage: cause to (give, give to, let, make to) drink, drown, moisten, water. See "H7937", "H8354".
Source: a primitive root;

8251.long:
Meaning: "disgusting", i.e. "filthy"; especially "idolatrous" or (concretely) an "idol".
Usage: abominable filth (idol, -ation), detestable (thing).
Source: or "שִׁקֻּץ"; from "H8262";

8252.long:
Meaning: to "repose" (usually figurative).
Usage: appease, idleness, (at, be at, be in, give) quiet(-ness), (be at, be in, give, have, take) rest, settle, be still.
Source: a primitive root;

8254.long:
Meaning: to "suspend" or "poise" (especially in trade).
Usage: pay, receive(-r), spend, × throughly, weigh.
Source: a primitive root;

8255.long:
Meaning: probably a "weight"; used as a commercial standard.
Usage: shekel.
Source: from "H8254";

8256.long:
Meaning: a "sycamore" (usually the tree).
Usage: sycamore (fruit, tree).
Source: or (feminine) "שִׁקְמָה"; of uncertain derivation;

8257.long:
Meaning: to "subside"; by implication, to "be overflowed", "cease"; causatively, to "abate", "subdue".
Usage: make deep, let down, drown, quench, sink.
Source: (abbreviated Amos 8:8); a primitive root;

8259.long:
Meaning: properly, to "lean out" (of a window), i.e. (by implication) "peep" or "gaze" (passively, "be a spectacle").
Usage: appear, look (down, forth, out).
Source: a primitive root;

8260.long:
Meaning: a "loophole" (for looking out), to "admit light and air".
Usage: window.
Source: from "H8259";

8261.long:
Meaning: an "embrasure" or "opening" with bevelled jam.
Usage: light, window.
Source: passive participle of "H8259"; (compare "H8260")

8262.long:
Meaning: to "be filthy", i.e. (intensively) to "loathe", "pollute".
Usage: abhor, make abominable, have in abomination, detest, × utterly.
Source: a primitive root;

8263.long:
Meaning: "filth", i.e. (figuratively and specifically) an "idolatrous" object.
Usage: abominable(-tion).
Source: from "H8262";

8264.long:
Meaning: to "course" (like a beast of prey); by implication, to "seek" greedily.
Usage: have appetite, justle one against another, long, range, run (to and fro).
Source: a primitive root;

8265.long:
Meaning: to "ogle", i.e. "blink" coquettishly.
Usage: wanton.
Source: a primitive root;

8266.long:
Meaning: to "cheat", i.e. "be untrue" (usually in words).
Usage: fail, deal falsely, lie.
Source: a primitive root;

8267.long:
Meaning: an "untruth"; by implication, a "sham" (often adverbial).
Usage: without a cause, deceit(-ful), false(-hood, -ly), feignedly, liar, lie, lying, vain (thing), wrongfully.
Source: from "H8266";

8269.long:
Meaning: a "head" person (of any rank or class).
Usage: captain (that had rule), chief (captain), general, governor, keeper, lord,(-task-)master, prince(-ipal), ruler, steward.
Source: from "H8323";

8270.long:
Meaning: a "string" (as twisted ), i.e. (specifically) the "umbilical cord" (also figuratively, as the centre of strength).
Usage: navel.
Source: from "H8324"; (compare "H8306")

8271.long:
Meaning: to "free", "separate"; figuratively, to "unravel", "commence"; by implication (of unloading beasts) to "reside".
Usage: begin, dissolve, dwell, loose.
Source: (Aramaic) a root corresponding to that of "H8293";

8272.long:
Meaning: "Sharetser", the name of an Assyrian and an Israelite.
Usage: Sharezer.
Source: of foreign derivation;

8273.long:
Meaning: quivering "glow" (of the air), especially the "mirage".
Usage: heat, parched ground.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "glare";

8274.long:
Meaning: "Sherebjah", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Sherebiah.
Source: from "H8273" and "H3050"; "Jah has brought heat";

8276.long:
Meaning: to "intwine".
Usage: wrap together, wreath.
Source: a primitive root;

8277.long:
Meaning: properly, to "puncture", i.e. (figuratively through the idea of slipping out) to "escape" or "survive".
Usage: remain.
Source: a primitive root; (compare "H8279")

8279.long:
Meaning: a (carpenter's) "scribing-awl" (for "pricking" or scratching measurements).
Usage: line.
Source: from "H8277";

8280.long:
Meaning: to "prevail".
Usage: have power (as a prince).
Source: a primitive root;

8282.long:
Meaning: a "mistress", i.e. female noble.
Usage: lady, princess, queen.
Source: feminine of "H8269";

8283.long:
Meaning: "Sarah", Abraham's wife.
Usage: Sarah.
Source: the same as "H8282";

8284.long:
Meaning: a "fortification" (literally or figuratively).
Usage: sing (by mistake for "H7891"), wall.
Source: probably feminine of "H7791";

8285.long:
Meaning: a wrist-"band" (as "compact" or "clasping").
Usage: bracelet.
Source: from "H8324" in its original sense of "pressing";

8286.long:
Meaning: "Serug", a postdiluvian patriarch.
Usage: Serug.
Source: from "H8276"; tendril;

8287.long:
Meaning: "Sharuchen", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Sharuhen.
Source: probably from "H8281" (in the sense of dwelling (compare "H8271") and "H2580"; "abode of pleasure";

8289.long:
Meaning: "Sharon", the name of a place in Palestine.
Usage: Lasharon, Sharon.
Source: probably abridged from "H3474"; "plain";

8290.long:
Meaning: a "Sharonite" or inhabitant of Sharon.
Usage: Sharonite.
Source: patrial from "H8289";

8291.long:
Meaning: a "grapevine".
Usage: principal plant. See "H8320", "H8321".
Source: passive participle from the same as "H8321";

8292.long:
Meaning: a "whistling" (in scorn); by analogy, a "piping".
Usage: bleating, hissing.
Source: or (by permutation) "שְׁרִיקָה"; feminine passive participle of "H8319";

8294.long:
Meaning: "Serach", an Israelitess.
Usage: Sarah, Serah.
Source: by permutation for "H5629"; "superfluity";

8295.long:
Meaning: to "gash".
Usage: cut in pieces, make [cuttings] pieces.
Source: a primitive root;

8297.long:
Meaning: "Sarai", the wife of Abraham.
Usage: Sarai.
Source: from "H8269"; dominative;

8300.long:
Meaning: a "survivor".
Usage: × alive, left, remain(-ing), remnant, rest.
Source: from "H8277";

8301.long:
Meaning: "Sarid", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Sarid.
Source: the same as "H8300";

8302.long:
Meaning: a "corslet" (as if "twisted").
Usage: breastplate, coat of mail, habergeon, harness. See "H5630".
Source: or "שִׁרְיֹן"; and "שִׁרְיָן"; also (feminine) "שִׁרְיָה"; and "שִׁרְיֹנָה"; from "H8281" in the original sense of "turning";

8303.long:
Meaning: "Shirjon" or "Sirjon", a peak of the Lebanon.
Usage: Sirion.
Source: and "שִׂרְיֹן"; the same as "H8302" (i.e. "sheeted" with snow);

8304.long:
Meaning: "Serajah", the name of nine Israelites.
Usage: Seraiah.
Source: or "שְׂרָיָהוּ"; from "H8280" and "H3050"; "Jah has prevailed";

8305.long:
Meaning: "hetchelling" (or combing flax), i.e. (concretely) "tow" (by extension, "linen" cloth).
Usage: fine.
Source: from the same as "H8321" in the original sense of "piercing";

8306.long:
Meaning: a "cord", i.e. (by analogy) "sinew".
Usage: navel.
Source: from "H8324" in the original sense as in "H8270" (compare "H8326");

8307.long:
Meaning: "obstinacy".
Usage: imagination, lust.
Source: from "H8324" in the sense of twisted, i.e. firm;

8309.long:
Meaning: "a common".
Usage: field.
Source: probably by an orthographical error for "H7709";

8310.long:
Meaning: "Sarsekim", a Babylonian general.
Usage: Sarsechim.
Source: of foreign derivation;

8311.long:
Meaning: to "prolong", i.e. (reflex) "be deformed" by excess of members.
Usage: stretch out self, (have any) superfluous thing.
Source: a primitive root;

8313.long:
Meaning: to "be" (causatively, "set") "on fire".
Usage: (cause to, make a) burn((-ing), up) kindle, × utterly.
Source: a primitive root;

8314.long:
Meaning: "burning", i.e. (figuratively) "poisonous" (serpent); specifically, a "saraph" or symbolical creature (from their copper color).
Usage: fiery (serpent), seraph.
Source: from "H8313";

8315.long:
Meaning: "Saraph", an Israelite.
Usage: Saraph.
Source: the same as "H8314";

8317.long:
Meaning: to "wriggle", i.e. (by implication) "swarm" or "abound".
Usage: breed (bring forth, increase) abundantly (in abundance), creep, move.
Source: a primitive root;

8318.long:
Meaning: a "swarm", i.e. "active mass of minute animals".
Usage: creep(-ing thing), move(-ing creature).
Source: from "H8317";

8319.long:
Meaning: properly, to "be shrill", i.e. to whistle or "hiss" (as a call or in scorn).
Usage: hiss.
Source: a primitive root;

8320.long:
Meaning: "bright red" (as "piercing" to the sight), i.e. "bay".
Usage: speckled. See "H8291".
Source: from "H8319";

8321.long:
Meaning: a "vine" stock (properly, one yielding "purple" grapes, the richest variety).
Usage: choice(-st, noble) wine. Compare "H8291".
Source: or "שׂוֹרֵק"; and (feminine) "שֹׂרֵקָה"; from "H8319" in the sense of "redness" (compare "H8320");

8323.long:
Meaning: to "have" (transitively, "exercise"; reflexively, "get") "dominion".
Usage: × altogether, make self a prince, (bear) rule.
Source: a primitive root;

8324.long:
Meaning: to "be hostile" (only active participle an opponent).
Usage: enemy.
Source: a primitive root;

8326.long:
Meaning: "the umbilical cord", i.e. (by extension) "a bodice".
Usage: navel.
Source: from "H8324" in the sense of twisting (compare "H8270");

8327.long:
Meaning: to "root", i.e. "strike into the soil", or (by implication) to "pluck from it".
Usage: (take, cause to take) root (out).
Source: a primitive root;

8328.long:
Meaning: a "root" (literally or figuratively).
Usage: bottom, deep, heel, root.
Source: from "H8327";

8329.long:
Meaning: "Sheresh", an Israelite.
Usage: Sharesh.
Source: the same as "H8328";

8331.long:
Meaning: "a chain" (as rooted, i.e. linked).
Usage: chain. Compare "H8333".
Source: from "H8327";

8332.long:
Meaning: "eradication", i.e. (figuratively) "exile".
Usage: banishment.
Source: (Aramaic) from a root corresponding to "H8327";

8334.long:
Meaning: to "attend" as a menial or worshipper; figuratively, to "contribute" to.
Usage: minister (unto), (do) serve(-ant, -ice, -itor), wait on.
Source: a primitive root;

8336.long:
Meaning: "bleached" stuff, i.e. "white" linen or (by analogy) marble.
Usage: × blue, fine (twined) linen, marble, silk.
Source: or (for alliteration with "H4897") "שְׁשִׁי"; for "H7893";

8337.long:
Meaning: "six" (as an overplus beyond five or the fingers of the hand); as ordinal "sixth".
Usage: six(-teen, -teenth), sixth.
Source: masculine "שִׁשָּׁה"; a primitive number; see "H7797"

8338.long:
Meaning: to "annihilate".
Usage: leave by the sixth part (by confusion with "H8341").
Source: a primitive root; apparently,

8339.long:
Meaning: "Sheshbatstsar", Zerubbabel's Persian name.
Usage: Sheshbazzar.
Source: of foreign derivation;

8341.long:
Meaning: to "sixth" or "divide into sixths".
Usage: give the sixth participle.
Source: a denominative from "H8337";

8342.long:
Meaning: "cheerfulness"; specifically, "welcome".
Usage: gladness, joy, mirth, rejoicing.
Source: or "שָׂשֹׂן"; from "H7797";

8347.long:
Meaning: "Sheshak", a symbolic name of Babylon.
Usage: Sheshach.
Source: of foreign derivation;

8349.long:
Meaning: "Shashak", an Israelite.
Usage: Shashak.
Source: probably from the base of "H7785"; "pedestrian";

8350.long:
Meaning: "red" ochre (from its "piercing" color).
Usage: vermillion.
Source: perhaps from the base of "H8324" in the sense of that of "H8320";

8352.long:
Meaning: "Sheth", third son of Adam.
Usage: Seth, Sheth.
Source: from "H7896"; put, i.e. substituted;

8354.long:
Meaning: to "imbibe" (literally or figuratively).
Usage: × assuredly, banquet, × certainly, drink(-er, -ing), drunk (× -ard), surely. (Prop. intensive of "H8248".).
Source: a primitive root;

8356.long:
Meaning: a "basis", i.e. (figuratively) political or moral "support".
Usage: foundation, purpose.
Source: from "H7896";

8359.long:
Meaning: a "fixture", i.e. the "warp" in weaving.
Usage: warp.
Source: from "H7896";

8363.long:
Meaning: a "sprig" (as if transplanted), i.e. "sucker".
Usage: plant.
Source: from "H8362";

8364.long:
Meaning: a "Shuthalchite" (collectively) or descendants of Shuthelach.
Usage: Shuthalhites.
Source: patronymically from "H7803";

8365.long:
Meaning: to "unveil" (figuratively).
Usage: be open.
Source: a primitive root;

8366.long:
Meaning: (causatively) to "make water", i.e. "urinate".
Usage: piss.
Source: a primitive root;

8367.long:
Meaning: to "subside".
Usage: be calm, cease, be quiet.
Source: a primitive root;

8368.long:
Meaning: to "break out" (as an eruption).
Usage: have in (one's) secret parts.
Source: a primitive root;

8369.long:
Meaning: "Shethar", a Persian satrap.
Usage: Shethar.
Source: of foreign derivation;

8370.long:
Meaning: "Shethar-Bozenai", a Persian officer.
Usage: Shetharboznai.
Source: of foreign derivation;

8371.long:
Meaning: to "place", i.e. "array"; reflex. to "lie".
Usage: be laid, set. t.
Source: a primitive root;

8372.long:
Meaning: a "room" (as circumscribed).
Usage: (little) chamber.
Source: and (feminine) "תָּאָה"; (Ezekiel 40:12), from (the base of) "H8376";

8374.long:
Meaning: to "loathe" (morally).
Usage: abhor.
Source: a primitive root (probably identical with "H8373" through the idea of puffing disdainfully at; compare "H340");

8376.long:
Meaning: to "mark off", i.e. (intensively) "designate".
Usage: point out.
Source: a primitive root;

8377.long:
Meaning: a species of "antelope" (probably from the white "stripe" on the cheek).
Usage: wild bull (ox).
Source: and "תּוֹא"; (the original form), from "H8376";

8378.long:
Meaning: a "longing"; by implication, a "delight" (subjectively, satisfaction, objectively, a charm).
Usage: dainty, desire, × exceedingly, × greedily, lust(ing), pleasant. See also "H6914".
Source: from "H183" (abbreviated);

8379.long:
Meaning: a "limit", i.e. "full extent".
Usage: utmost bound.
Source: from "H8376";

8380.long:
Meaning: a "twin" (in plural only), literally or figuratively.
Usage: twins.
Source: or "תָּאֹם"; from "H8382";

8382.long:
Meaning: to "be" (causatively, "make") "twinned", i.e. (figuratively) "duplicate" or (architectural) "jointed".
Usage: coupled (together), bear twins.
Source: a primitive root; to be complete; but used only as denominative from "H8380",

8384.long:
Meaning: the "fig" (tree or fruit).
Usage: fig (tree).
Source: or (in the singular, feminine) "תְּאֵנָה"; perhaps of foreign derivation

8387.long:
Meaning: "Taanath-Shiloh", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Taanath-shiloh.
Source: from "H8385" and "H7887"; "approach of Shiloh";

8388.long:
Meaning: to "delineate"; reflex. to "extend".
Usage: be drawn, mark out, (Rimmon-) methoar (by union with "H7417").
Source: a primitive root;

8389.long:
Meaning: "outline", i.e. "figure" or "appearance".
Usage: beautiful, × comely, countenance, fair, × favoured, form, × goodly, × resemble, visage.
Source: from "H8388";

8390.long:
Meaning: "Taarea", an Israelite.
Usage: Tarea. See "H8475".
Source: perhaps from "H772";

8391.long:
Meaning: a species of "cedar" (from its "erectness").
Usage: box (tree).
Source: from "H833";

8392.long:
Meaning: a "box".
Usage: ark.
Source: perhaps of foreign derivation;

8393.long:
Meaning: "income", i.e. "produce" (literally or figuratively).
Usage: fruit, gain, increase, revenue.
Source: from "H935";

8394.long:
Meaning: "intelligence"; by implication, an "argument"; by extension, "caprice".
Usage: discretion, reason, skilfulness, understanding, wisdom.
Source: and (feminine) "תְּבוּנָה"; or "תּוֹבֻנָה"; from "H995";

8396.long:
Meaning: "Tabor", a mountain in Palestine, also a city adjacent.
Usage: Tabor.
Source: from a root corresponding to "H8406"; "broken region";

8398.long:
Meaning: the "earth" (as "moist" and therefore inhabited); by extension, the "globe"; by implication, its "inhabitants"; specifically, a particular "land", as Babylonia, Palestine.
Usage: habitable part, world.
Source: from "H2986";

8400.long:
Meaning: a "cataract" (in the eye).
Usage: blemish.
Source: from "H1101" in the original sense of flowing;

8401.long:
Meaning: properly, "material", i.e. (specifically) "refuse haum" or "stalks of grain" (as chopped in threshing and used for fodder).
Usage: chaff, straw, stubble.
Source: probably from "H1129";

8403.long:
Meaning: "structure"; by implication, a "model", "resemblance".
Usage: figure, form, likeness, pattern, similitude.
Source: from "H1129";

8404.long:
Meaning: "Taberah", a place in the Desert.
Usage: Taberah.
Source: from "H1197"; "burning";

8405.long:
Meaning: "Tebets", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Thebez.
Source: from the same as "H948"; "whiteness";

8407.long:
Meaning: "Tiglath-Pileser" or "Tilgath-pilneser", an Assyryrian king.
Usage: Tiglath-pileser, Tilgath-pilneser.
Source: or "תִּגְלַת פְּלֶסֶר"; or "תִּלְגַּת פִּלְנְאֶסֶר" or "תִּלְגַּת פִּלְנֶסֶר"; of foreign derivation;

8410.long:
Meaning: "enduring"; a species of hard-wood or "lasting" tree (perhaps "oak").
Usage: pine (tree).
Source: apparently from "H1725";

8411.long:
Meaning: "permanence", i.e. (adverb) "constantly".
Usage: continually.
Source: (Aramaic) from "H1753" in the original sense of enduring;

8412.long:
Meaning: "Tadmor", a place near Palestine.
Usage: Tadmor.
Source: or "תַּמֹּר"; (1 Kings 9:18), apparently from "H8558"; "palm-city";

8414.long:
Meaning: a "desolation" (of surface), i.e. "desert"; figuratively, a "worthless thing"; adverbially, "in vain".
Usage: confusion, empty place, without form, nothing, (thing of) nought, vain, vanity, waste, wilderness.
Source: from an unused root meaning to lie waste;

8415.long:
Meaning: an "abyss" (as a surging mass of water), especially the "deep" (the main sea or the subterranean watersupply).
Usage: deep (place), depth.
Source: or "תְּהֹם"; (usually feminine) from "H1949";

8417.long:
Meaning: "braggadocio", i.e. (by implication) "fatuity".
Usage: folly.
Source: feminine of an unused noun (apparently from "H1984") meaning "bluster";

8419.long:
Meaning: a "perversity" or "fraud".
Usage: (very) froward(-ness, thing), perverse thing.
Source: from "H2015";

8420.long:
Meaning: a "mark"; by implication, a "signature".
Usage: desire, mark.
Source: from "H8427";

8421.long:
Meaning: specifically (transitive and ellip.) to "reply".
Usage: answer, restore, return (an answer).
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H7725", to come back;

8422.long:
Meaning: "Tubal", a postdiluvian patriarch and his posterity.
Usage: Tubal.
Source: or "תֻּבַל"; probably of foreign derivation;

8423.long:
Meaning: "Tubal-Kajin", an antidiluvian patriarch.
Usage: Tubal-cain.
Source: apparently from "H2986" (compare "H2981") and "H7014"; offspring of Cain;

8424.long:
Meaning: "depression" (of spirits); concretely a "grief".
Usage: heaviness, sorrow.
Source: from "H3013";

8425.long:
Meaning: "Togarmah", a son of Gomer and his posterity.
Usage: Togarmah.
Source: or "תֹּגַרְמָה"; probably of foreign derivation;

8426.long:
Meaning: properly, an "extension" of the hand, i.e. (by implication) "avowal", or (usually) "adoration"; specifically, a "choir" of worshippers.
Usage: confession, (sacrifice of) praise, thanks(-giving, offering).
Source: from "H3034";

8427.long:
Meaning: to "mark out", i.e. (primitive) "scratch" or (definite) "imprint".
Usage: scrabble, set (a mark).
Source: a primitive root;

8428.long:
Meaning: to "grieve".
Usage: limit (by confusion with "H8427").
Source: a primitive root (or perhaps identical with "H8427" through a similar idea from scraping to pieces);

8429.long:
Meaning: to "amaze", i.e. (reflex. by implication) "take alarm".
Usage: be astonied.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H8539" or perhaps to "H7582" through the idea of sweeping to ruin (compare "H8428");

8430.long:
Meaning: "Toach", an Israelite.
Usage: Toah.
Source: from an unused root meaning to depress; "humble";

8432.long:
Meaning: a "bisection", i.e. (by implication) the "centre".
Usage: among(-st), × between, half, × (there-, where-), in(-to), middle, mid(-night), midst (among), × out (of), × through, × with(-in).
Source: from an unused root meaning to "sever";

8433.long:
Meaning: "chastisement"; figuratively (by words) "correction", "refutation", "proof" (even in defence).
Usage: argument, × chastened, correction, reasoning, rebuke, reproof, × be (often) reproved.
Source: and "תּוֹכַחַת"; from "H3198";

8434.long:
Meaning: "Tolad", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Tolad. Compare "H513".
Source: from "H3205"; "posterity";

8435.long:
Meaning: (plural only) "descent", i.e. "family"; (figuratively) "history".
Usage: birth, generations.
Source: or "תֹּלְדָה"; from "H3205";

8436.long:
Meaning: "Tulon", an Israelite.
Usage: Tilon (from the margin).
Source: from "H8524"; "suspension";

8437.long:
Meaning: "causing to howl", i.e. an "oppressor".
Usage: that wasted.
Source: from "H3213";

8438.long:
Meaning: a "maggot" (as "voracious"); specifically (often with ellipsis of "H8144") the crimson-"grub", but used only (in this connection) of the color from it, and cloths dyed therewith.
Usage: crimson, scarlet, worm.
Source: and (feminine) "תּוֹלֵעָה"; or "תּוֹלַעַת"; or "תֹּלַעַת"; from "H3216";
