8439.long:
Meaning: "Tola", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Tola.
Source: the same as "H8438"; "worm";

8440.long:
Meaning: a "Tolaïte" (collectively) or descendants of Tola.
Usage: Tolaites.
Source: patronymically from "H8439";

8441.long:
Meaning: properly, something "disgusting" (morally), i.e. (as noun) an "abhorrence"; especially "idolatry" or (concretely) an "idol".
Usage: abominable (custom, thing), abomination.
Source: or "תֹּעֵבַה"; feminine active participle of "H8581";

8442.long:
Meaning: "mistake", i.e. (morally) "impiety", or (political) "injury".
Usage: error, hinder.
Source: feminine active participle of "H8582";

8443.long:
Meaning: (only in plural collective) "weariness", i.e. (by implication) "toil" ("treasure" so obtained) or "speed".
Usage: plenty, strength.
Source: from "H3286";

8444.long:
Meaning: (only in plural collective) "exit", i.e. (geographical) "boundary", or (figuratively) "deliverance", (actively) "source".
Usage: border(-s), going(-s) forth (out), issues, outgoings.
Source: or "תֹּצָאָה"; from "H3318";

8445.long:
Meaning: "Tokahath", an Israelite.
Usage: Tikvath (by correction for "H8616").
Source: from the same as "H3349"; obedience;

8446.long:
Meaning: to "meander" (causatively, "guide") "about", especially for "trade" or "reconnoitring".
Usage: chap(-man), sent to descry, be excellent, merchant(-man), search (out), seek, (e-) spy (out).
Source: a primitive root;

8447.long:
Meaning: a "succession", i.e. a "string" or (abstractly) "order".
Usage: border, row, turn.
Source: or "תֹּר"; from "H8446";

8448.long:
Meaning: "a manner" (as a sort of turn).
Usage: estate.
Source: probably the same as "H8447";

8449.long:
Meaning: a "ring-dove", often (figuratively) as a term of endearment.
Usage: (turtle) dove.
Source: or "תֹּר"; probably the same as "H8447";

8450.long:
Meaning: a "bull".
Usage: bullock, ox.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding (by permutation) to "H7794";

8451.long:
Meaning: a "precept" or "statute", especially the "Decalogue" or "Pentateuch".
Usage: law.
Source: or "תֹּרָה"; from "H3384";

8453.long:
Meaning: a "dweller" but not outlandish ["H5237"]; especially (as distinguished from a native citizen [active participle of "H3427"] and a temporary inmate ["H1616"] or mere lodger ["H3885"]) resident "alien".
Usage: foreigner, inhabitant, sojourner, stranger.
Source: or "תֹּשָׁב"; (1 Kings 17:1), from "H3427";

8454.long:
Meaning: "support" or (by implication) "ability", i.e. (direct) "help", (in purpose) an "undertaking", (intellectual) "understanding".
Usage: enterprise, that which (thing as it) is, substance, (sound) wisdom, working.
Source: or "תֻּשִׁיָּה"; from an unused root probably meaning to "substantiate";

8455.long:
Meaning: a "club".
Usage: darts.
Source: from an unused root meaning to smite;

8456.long:
Meaning: to "lop" off.
Usage: cut down.
Source: a primitive root;

8458.long:
Meaning: (only in plural) properly, "steerage" (as a management of ropes), i.e. (figuratively) "guidance" or (by implication) a "plan".
Usage: good advice, (wise) counsels.
Source: or "תַּחְבּוּלָה"; from "H2254" as denominative from "H2256";

8459.long:
Meaning: "Tochu", an Israelite.
Usage: Tohu.
Source: from an unused root meaning to depress; abasement;

8461.long:
Meaning: "Tachkemoni", an Israelite.
Usage: Tachmonite.
Source: probably for "H2453"; sagacious;

8462.long:
Meaning: a "commencement"; relatively "original" (adverb, -ly).
Usage: begin(-ning), first (time).
Source: from "H2490" in the sense of opening;

8463.long:
Meaning: a "malady".
Usage: disease, × grievous, (that are) sick(-ness).
Source: or "תַּחֲלֻא"; from "H2456";

8464.long:
Meaning: a "species of unclean bird" (from its violence), perhaps an "owl".
Usage: night hawk.
Source: from "H2554";

8465.long:
Meaning: "Tachan", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Tahan.
Source: probably from "H2583"; "station";

8468.long:
Meaning: "Techinnah", an Israelite.
Usage: Tehinnah.
Source: the same as "H8467";

8470.long:
Meaning: a "Tachanite" (collectively) or descendants of Tachan.
Usage: Tahanites.
Source: patronymically from "H8465";

8471.long:
Meaning: "Tachpanches", Techaphneches or Tachpenes, a place in Egypt.
Usage: Tahapanes, Tahpanhes, Tehaphnehes.
Source: or "תְּחַפְנְחֵס"; (Ezekiel 30:18), or "תַּחְפְּנֵס"; (Jeremiah 2:16), of Egyptian derivation;

8472.long:
Meaning: "Tachpenes", an Egyptian woman.
Usage: Tahpenes.
Source: of Egyptian derivation;

8473.long:
Meaning: a linen "corslet" (as "white" or "hollow").
Usage: habergeon.
Source: from "H2734" in the original sense of "H2352" or "H2353";

8474.long:
Meaning: to "vie with a rival".
Usage: close, contend.
Source: a facitious root from "H2734" through the idea of the heat of jealousy;

8476.long:
Meaning: a (clean) "animal with fur", probably a "species of antelope".
Usage: badger.
Source: probably of foreign derivation;

8477.long:
Meaning: "Tachash", a relative of Abraham.
Usage: Thahash.
Source: the same as "H8476";

8478.long:
Meaning: the "bottom" (as depressed); only adverbially, "below" (often with prepositional prefix underneath), "in lieu of", etc.
Usage: as, beneath, × flat, in(-stead), (same) place (where...is), room, for...sake, stead of, under, × unto, × when...was mine, whereas, (where-) fore, with.
Source: from the same as "H8430";

8480.long:
Meaning: "Tachath", the name of a place in the Desert, also of three Israelites.
Usage: Tahath.
Source: the same as "H8478";

8482.long:
Meaning: "lowermost"; as noun (feminine plural) the "depths" (figuratively, a "pit", the "womb").
Usage: low (parts, -er, -er parts, -est), nether (part).
Source: from "H8478";

8483.long:
Meaning: "Tachtim-Chodshi", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Tahtim-hodshi.
Source: apparently from the plural masculine of "H8482" or "H8478" and "H2320"; lower (ones) monthly;

8485.long:
Meaning: "Tema", a son of Ishmael, and the region settled by him.
Usage: Tema.
Source: or "תֵּמָא"; probably of foreign derivation;

8486.long:
Meaning: the "south" (as being on the "right" hand of a person facing the east).
Usage: south (side, -ward, wind).
Source: or "תֵּמָן"; denominative from "H3225";

8487.long:
Meaning: "Teman", the name of two Edomites, and of the region and descendant of one of them.
Usage: south, Teman.
Source: or "תֵּמָן"; the same as "H8486";

8489.long:
Meaning: a "Temanite" or descendant of Teman.
Usage: Temani, Temanite.
Source: patronymically from "H8487";

8490.long:
Meaning: a "column", i.e. "cloud".
Usage: pillar.
Source: or "תִּמָרָה"; from the same as "H8558";

8491.long:
Meaning: a "Titsite" or descendant or inhabitant of an unknown Tits.
Usage: Tizite.
Source: patrial or patronymically from an unused noun of uncertain meaning;

8492.long:
Meaning: "must" or "fresh grape-juice" (as just squeezed out); by implication (rarely) "fermented wine".
Usage: (new, sweet) wine.
Source: or "תִּירֹשׁ"; from "H3423" in the sense of expulsion;

8494.long:
Meaning: "Tiras", a son of Japheth.
Usage: Tiras.
Source: probably of foreign derivation;

8495.long:
Meaning: a "buck" or "he-goat" (as given to butting).
Usage: he goat.
Source: from an unused root meaning to butt;

8496.long:
Meaning: "oppression".
Usage: deceit, fraud.
Source: or "תּוֹך"; (Psalm 72:14), from the same base as "H8432" (in the sense of cutting to pieces);

8497.long:
Meaning: to "strew", i.e. "encamp".
Usage: sit down.
Source: a primitive root;

8498.long:
Meaning: "adjustment", i.e. "structure"; by implication, "equipage".
Usage: fashion, store.
Source: feminine passive participle of "H8505";

8499.long:
Meaning: "something arranged" or "fixed", i.e. a place.
Usage: seat.
Source: from "H3559"; or probably identical with "H8498";

8500.long:
Meaning: probably of foreign derivation; some "imported creature", probably a "peacock".
Usage: peacock.
Source: or "תּוּכִּי";

8501.long:
Meaning: "to dissever", i.e. "crush".
Usage: deceitful.
Source: from an unused root meaning

8503.long:
Meaning: "completion"; by implication, an "extremity".
Usage: end, perfect(-ion).
Source: from "H3615";

8504.long:
Meaning: the cerulean "mussel", i.e. the color ("violet") obtained therefrom or stuff dyed therewith.
Usage: blue.
Source: probably for "H7827";

8505.long:
Meaning: to "balance", i.e. "measure" out (by weight or dimension); figuratively to "arrange", "equalize", through the idea of "levelling" (ment, "estimate", "test").
Usage: bear up, direct, be (un-)equal, mete, ponder, tell, weigh.
Source: a primitive root;

8507.long:
Meaning: "Token", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Tochen.
Source: the same as "H8506";

8509.long:
Meaning: a "wrapper" or "robe".
Usage: garment.
Source: apparently from an unused root meaning to encompass;

8510.long:
Meaning: a "mound".
Usage: heap, × strength.
Source: by contraction from "H8524";

8511.long:
Meaning: to "suspend"; figuratively (through hesitation) to "be uncertain"; by implication (of mental dependence) to "habituate".
Usage: be bent, hang (in doubt).
Source: a primitive root;

8512.long:
Meaning: "Tel-Abib", a place in Chaldaea.
Usage: Tel-abib.
Source: from "H8510" and "H24"; "mound of green growth";

8515.long:
Meaning: "Telassar", a region of Assyria.
Usage: Telassar.
Source: or "תְּלַשַּׂר"; of foreign derivation;

8518.long:
Meaning: to "suspend" (especially to gibbet).
Usage: hang (up).
Source: a primitive root;

8519.long:
Meaning: a "grumbling".
Usage: murmuring.
Source: or "תּלֻנָּה"; from "H3885" in the sense of "obstinacy";

8520.long:
Meaning: "Telach", an Israelite.
Usage: Telah.
Source: probably from an unused root meaning to dissever; "breach";

8521.long:
Meaning: "Tel-Charsha", a place in Babylonia.
Usage: Tel-haresha, Tel-harsa.
Source: from "H8510" and the feminine of "H2798"; "mound of workmanship";

8524.long:
Meaning: to "pile up", i.e. "elevate".
Usage: eminent. Compare "H2048".
Source: a primitive root;

8525.long:
Meaning: a "bank" or "terrace".
Usage: furrow, ridge.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "accumulate";

8526.long:
Meaning: "Talmai", the name of a Canaanite and a Syrian.
Usage: Talmai.
Source: from "H8525"; "ridged";

8528.long:
Meaning: "Tel-Melach", a place in Babylonia.
Usage: Tel-melah.
Source: from "H8510" and "H4417"; "mound of salt";

8529.long:
Meaning: to "crimson", i.e. "dye that color".
Usage: × scarlet.
Source: a denominative from "H8438";

8530.long:
Meaning: something "tall", i.e. (plural collective) "slenderness".
Usage: armoury.
Source: feminine from an unused root meaning to tower;

8532.long:
Meaning: "three" or "third".
Usage: third, three.
Source: (Aramaic) masculine "תְּלָתָה"; (Aramaic), or "תְּלָתָא"; (Aramaic), corresponding to "H7969";

8534.long:
Meaning: a "trailing bough" (as pendulous).
Usage: bushy.
Source: by reduplication, from "H8524" through the idea of vibration;

8535.long:
Meaning: "complete"; usually (morally) "pious"; specifically, "gentle", "dear".
Usage: coupled together, perfect, plain, undefiled, upright.
Source: from "H8552";

8537.long:
Meaning: "completeness"; figuratively, "prosperity"; usually (morally) "innocence".
Usage: full, integrity, perfect(-ion), simplicity, upright(-ly, -ness), at a venture. See "H8550".
Source: from "H8552";

8539.long:
Meaning: to "be in consternation".
Usage: be amazed, be astonished, marvel(-lously), wonder.
Source: a primitive root;

8540.long:
Meaning: a "miracle".
Usage: wonder.
Source: (Aramaic) from a root corresponding to "H8539";

8542.long:
Meaning: "Tammuz", a Phoenician deity.
Usage: Tammuz.
Source: of uncertain derivation;

8543.long:
Meaning: properly, "ago", i.e. a (short or long) "time since"; especially "yesterday", or "day before" yesterday.
Usage: before (-time), these (three) days, heretofore, time past, yesterday.
Source: or "תְּמֹל"; probably for "H865"; sometimes with "H8032"

8544.long:
Meaning: something "portioned" (i.e. "fashioned") out, as a "shape", i.e. (indefinitely) "phantom", or (specifically) "embodiment", or (figuratively) "manifestation" (of favor).
Usage: image, likeness, similitude.
Source: or "תְּמֻנָה"; from "H4327";

8547.long:
Meaning: "Temach", one of the Nethinim.
Usage: Tamah, Thamah.
Source: of uncertain derivation;

8548.long:
Meaning: properly, "continuance" (as indefinite "extension"); but used only (attributively as adjective) "constant" (or adverbially, "constantly"); elliptically the "regular" (daily) sacrifice.
Usage: alway(-s), continual (employment, -ly), daily, (n-)ever(-more), perpetual.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "stretch";

8549.long:
Meaning: "entire" (literally, figuratively or morally); also (as noun) "integrity", "truth".
Usage: without blemish, complete, full, perfect, sincerely (-ity), sound, without spot, undefiled, upright(-ly), whole.
Source: from "H8552";

8550.long:
Meaning: "perfections", i.e. (techn.) one of the epithets of the objects in the high-priest's breastplate as an emblem of complete Truth.
Usage: Thummim.
Source: plural of "H8537";

8551.long:
Meaning: to "sustain"; by implication, to "obtain", "keep fast"; figuratively, to "help", "follow close".
Usage: (take, up-) hold (up), maintain, retain, stay (up).
Source: a primitive root;

8552.long:
Meaning: to "complete", in a good or a bad sense, literal, or figurative, transitive or intransitive.
Usage: accomplish, cease, be clean (pass-) ed, consume, have done, (come to an, have an, make an) end, fail, come to the full, be all gone, × be all here, be (make) perfect, be spent, sum, be (shew self) upright, be wasted, whole.
Source: a primitive root;

8553.long:
Meaning: "Timnah", the name of two places in Palestine.
Usage: Timnah, Timnath, Thimnathah.
Source: from "H4487"; a portion assigned;

8554.long:
Meaning: a "Timnite" or inhabitant of Timnah.
Usage: Timnite.
Source: patrial from "H8553";

8555.long:
Meaning: "Timna", the name of two Edomites.
Usage: Timna, Timnah.
Source: from "H4513"; "restraint";

8556.long:
Meaning: "Timnath-Cheres", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Timnath-heres, Timnath-serah.
Source: or "תִּמְנַת סֶרַח"; from "H8553" and "H2775"; portion of (the) sun;

8558.long:
Meaning: a "palm" tree.
Usage: palm (tree).
Source: from an unused root meaning to "be erect";

8559.long:
Meaning: "Tamar", the name of three women and a place.
Usage: Tamar.
Source: the same as "H8558";

8560.long:
Meaning: a "palm trunk".
Usage: palm tree.
Source: from the same root as "H8558";

8561.long:
Meaning: (architectural) a "palm-like pilaster" (i.e. umbellate).
Usage: palm tree.
Source: (plural or (feminine) "תִּמֹּרָה"; (singular and plural), from the same root as "H8558";

8562.long:
Meaning: properly, a "scouring", i.e. "soap" or "perfumery" for the bath; figuratively, a "detergent".
Usage: × cleanse, (thing for) purification(-fying).
Source: or "תַּמְרֻק"; or "תַּמְרִיק"; from "H4838";

8564.long:
Meaning: an "erection", i.e. "pillar" (probably for a guide-board).
Usage: high heap.
Source: from the same root as "H8558";

8565.long:
Meaning: a "monster" (as preternaturally formed), i.e. a "sea-serpent" (or other huge marine animal); also a "jackal" (or other hideous land animal).
Usage: dragon, whale. Compare "H8577".
Source: from an unused root probably meaning to "elongate";

8566.long:
Meaning: to "present" (a mercenary inducement), i.e. "bargain with" (a harlot).
Usage: hire.
Source: a primitive root;

8567.long:
Meaning: to "ascribe" (praise), i.e. "celebrate", "commemorate".
Usage: lament, rehearse.
Source: a primitive root (identical with through the idea of attributing honor);

8568.long:
Meaning: a female "jackal".
Usage: dragon.
Source: probably feminine of "H8565";

8569.long:
Meaning: "alienation"; by implication, "enmity".
Usage: breach of promise, occasion.
Source: from "H5106";

8571.long:
Meaning: a "pinnacle", i.e. "extremity".
Usage: tip.
Source: perhaps from the same as "H594" through the idea of "protraction";

8573.long:
Meaning: a "brandishing" (in threat); by implication, "tumult"; specifically, the official "undulation" of sacrificial offerings.
Usage: offering, shaking, wave (offering).
Source: from "H5130";

8577.long:
Meaning: a marine or land "monster", i.e. "sea-serpent" or "jackal".
Usage: dragon, sea-monster, serpent, whale.
Source: or "תַּנִּים"; (Ezekiel 29:3), intensive from the same as "H8565";

8580.long:
Meaning: properly, a "hard breather", i.e. the name of two unclean creatures, a "lizard" and a "bird" (both perhaps from changing color through their irascibility), probably the "tree-toad" and the "water-hen".
Usage: mole, swan.
Source: from "H5395";

8581.long:
Meaning: to "loathe", i.e. (morally) "detest".
Usage: (make to be) abhor(-red), (be, commit more, do) abominable(-y), × utterly.
Source: a primitive root;

8582.long:
Meaning: to "vacillate", i.e. "reel" or "stray" (literally or figuratively); also causative of both.
Usage: (cause to) go astray, deceive, dissemble, (cause to, make to) err, pant, seduce, (make to) stagger, (cause to) wander, be out of the way.
Source: a primitive root;

8583.long:
Meaning: "Tou" or "Toi", a Syrian king.
Usage: Toi, Tou.
Source: or "תֹּעִי"; from "H8582"; error

8585.long:
Meaning: a "channel" (into which water is raised for irrigation); also a "bandage" or "plaster" (as placed "upon" a wound).
Usage: conduit, cured, healing, little river, trench, watercourse.
Source: from "H5927";

8586.long:
Meaning: "caprice" (as a fit "coming on"), i.e. "vexation"; concretely a "tyrant".
Usage: babe, delusion.
Source: from "H5953";

8587.long:
Meaning: a "secret".
Usage: thing that is hid, secret.
Source: from "H5956";

8588.long:
Meaning: "luxury".
Usage: delicate, delight, pleasant.
Source: or "תַּעֲנֻג"; and (feminine) "תַּעֲנֻגָה"; from "H6026";

8590.long:
Meaning: "Taanak" or "Tanak", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Taanach, Tanach.
Source: or "תַּעְנָךְ"; of uncertain derivation;

8591.long:
Meaning: to "cheat"; by analogy, to "maltreat".
Usage: deceive, misuse.
Source: a primitive root;

8593.long:
Meaning: a "knife" or "razor" (as "making" bare); also a "scabbard" (as "being bare", i.e. empty).
Usage: (pen-) knife, razor, scabbard, shave, sheath.
Source: from "H6168";

8597.long:
Meaning: "ornament" (abstractly or concretely, literally or figuratively).
Usage: beauty(-iful), bravery, comely, fair, glory(-ious), honour, majesty.
Source: or "תִּפְאֶרֶת"; from "H6286";

8598.long:
Meaning: an "apple" (from its fragrance), i.e. the "fruit" or the "tree" (probably includ. others of the pome order, as the quince, the orange, etc.).
Usage: apple (tree). See also "H1054".
Source: from "H5301";

8599.long:
Meaning: "Tappuach", the name of two places in Palestine, also of an Israelite.
Usage: Tappuah.
Source: the same as "H8598";

8602.long:
Meaning: "plaster" (as "gummy") or "slime"; (figuratively) "frivolity".
Usage: foolish things, unsavoury, untempered.
Source: from an unused root meaning to "smear";

8603.long:
Meaning: "Tophel", a place near the Desert.
Usage: Tophel.
Source: from the same as "H8602"; "quagmire";

8604.long:
Meaning: "frivolity".
Usage: folly, foolishly.
Source: from the same as "H8602";

8607.long:
Meaning: "Tiphsach", a place in Mesopotamia.
Usage: Tipsah.
Source: from "H6452"; "ford";

8608.long:
Meaning: to "drum", i.e. "play" (as) "on the tambourine".
Usage: taber, play with timbrels.
Source: a primitive root;

8609.long:
Meaning: to "sew".
Usage: (women that) sew (together).
Source: a primitive root;

8610.long:
Meaning: to "manipulate", i.e. "seize"; chiefly to "capture", "wield", specifically, to "overlay"; figuratively, to "use unwarrantably".
Usage: catch, handle, (lay, take) hold (on, over), stop, × surely, surprise, take.
Source: a primitive root;

8611.long:
Meaning: a "smiting", i.e. (figuratively) "contempt".
Usage: tabret.
Source: from the base of "H8608";

8612.long:
Meaning: "Topheth", a place near Jerusalem.
Usage: Tophet, Topheth.
Source: the same as "H8611";

8613.long:
Meaning: "Tophteh", a place of cremation.
Usage: Tophet.
Source: probably a form of "H8612";

8615.long:
Meaning: literally a "cord" (as an "attachment"); figuratively, "expectancy".
Usage: expectation(-ted), hope, live, thing that I long for.
Source: from "H6960"; (compare "H6961")

8616.long:
Meaning: "Tikvah", the name of two Israelites.
Usage: Tikvah.
Source: the same as "H8615";

8619.long:
Meaning: a "trumpet".
Usage: trumpet.
Source: from "H8628" (in the musical sense);

8620.long:
Meaning: "Tekoa", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Tekoa, Tekoah.
Source: a form of "H8619";

8621.long:
Meaning: a "Tekoite" or inhabitant of Tekoah.
Usage: Tekoite.
Source: or "תְּקֹעִי"; patronymically from "H8620";

8622.long:
Meaning: a "revolution", i.e. (of the sun) "course", (of time) "lapse".
Usage: circuit, come about, end.
Source: or "תְּקֻפָה"; from "H5362";

8625.long:
Meaning: to "balance".
Usage: Tekel, be weighed.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H8254";

8626.long:
Meaning: to "equalize", i.e. "straighten" (intransitive or transitive); figuratively, to "compose".
Usage: set in order, make straight.
Source: a primitive root;

8627.long:
Meaning: to "straighten up", i.e. "confirm".
Usage: establish.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H8626";

8628.long:
Meaning: to "clatter", i.e. "slap" (the hands together), "clang" (an instrument); by analogy, to "drive" (a nail or tent-pin, a dart, etc.); by implication, to "become bondsman" by handclasping).
Usage: blow (a trumpet), cast, clap, fasten, pitch (tent), smite, sound, strike, × suretiship, thrust.
Source: a primitive root;

8629.long:
Meaning: a "blast of a trumpet".
Usage: sound.
Source: from "H8628";

8631.long:
Meaning: to "become" (causatively, make) "mighty" or (figuratively) "obstinate".
Usage: make firm, harden, be(-come) strong.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H8630";

8634.long:
Meaning: "Taralah", a place in Palestine.
Usage: Taralah.
Source: probably for "H8653"; a "reeling";

8636.long:
Meaning: "multiplication", i.e. "percentage" or "bonus" in addition to principal.
Usage: increase, unjust gain.
Source: from "H7235";

8637.long:
Meaning: to "cause to walk".
Usage: teach to go.
Source: a denominative from "H7270";

8638.long:
Meaning: to "transfer", i.e. "translate".
Usage: interpret.
Source: a denominative from "H7275" in the sense of throwing over;

8639.long:
Meaning: a "lethargy" or (by implication) "trance".
Usage: deep sleep.
Source: from "H7290";

8640.long:
Meaning: "Tirhakah", a king of Kush.
Usage: Tirhakah.
Source: of foreign derivation;

8641.long:
Meaning: a "present" (as offered "up"), especially in "sacrifice" or as "tribute".
Usage: gift, heave offering (shoulder), oblation, offered(-ing).
Source: or "תְּרֻמָה"; (Deuteronomy 12:11), from "H7311";

8643.long:
Meaning: "clamor", i.e. "acclamation" of joy or a "battle-cry"; especially "clangor" of trumpets, as an "alarum".
Usage: alarm, blow(-ing) (of, the) (trumpets), joy, jubile, loud noise, rejoicing, shout(-ing), (high, joyful) sound(-ing).
Source: from "H7321";

8644.long:
Meaning: a "remedy".
Usage: medicine.
Source: from "H7322" in the sense of its congener "H7495";

8645.long:
Meaning: a species of tree (apparently from its "slenderness"), perhaps the "cypress".
Usage: cypress.
Source: probably from "H7329";

8646.long:
Meaning: "Terach", the father of Abraham; also a place in the Desert.
Usage: Tarah, Terah.
Source: of uncertain derivation;

8647.long:
Meaning: "Tirchanah", an Israelite.
Usage: Tirhanah.
Source: of uncertain derivation;

8648.long:
Meaning: "two".
Usage: second, twelve, two.
Source: (Aramaic) feminine "תַּרְתֵּין"; corresponding to "H8147";

8650.long:
Meaning: a "pole" (as a mast or flagstaff).
Usage: beacon, mast.
Source: probably for "H766";

8651.long:
Meaning: a "door"; by implication, a "palace".
Usage: gate mouth.
Source: (Aramaic) corresponding to "H8179";

8654.long:
Meaning: a "Tirathite" or inhabitant of an unknown Tirah.
Usage: Tirathite.
Source: patrial from an unused name meaning gate;

8655.long:
Meaning: "Teraphim" (singular or plural) a family idol.
Usage: idols(-atry), images, teraphim.
Source: plural from "H7495"; a "healer";

8656.long:
Meaning: "Tirtsah", a place in Palestine; also an Israelitess.
Usage: Tirzah.
Source: from "H7521"; "delightsomeness";

8657.long:
Meaning: "Teresh", a eunuch of Xerxes.
Usage: Teresh.
Source: of foreign derivation;

8658.long:
Meaning: a gem, perhaps the "topaz".
Usage: beryl.
Source: probably of foreign derivation (compare "H8659");

8659.long:
Meaning: "Tarshish", a place on the Mediterranean, hence, the ephithet of a merchant vessel (as if for or from that port); also the name of a Persian and of an Israelite.
Usage: Tarshish, Tharshish.
Source: probably the same as "H8658" (as the region of the stone, or the reverse);

8660.long:
Meaning: the title of a Persian deputy or "governor".
Usage: Tirshatha.
Source: of foreign derivation;

8661.long:
Meaning: "Tartan", an Assyrian.
Usage: Tartan.
Source: of foreign derivation;

8662.long:
Meaning: "Tartak", a deity of the Avvites.
Usage: Tartak.
Source: of foreign derivation;

8663.long:
Meaning: a "crashing" or loud "clamor".
Usage: crying, noise, shouting, stir.
Source: from "H7722";

8664.long:
Meaning: a "Tishbite" or inhabitant of Tishbeh (in Gilead).
Usage: Tishbite.
Source: patrial from an unused name meaning recourse;

8666.long:
Meaning: a "recurrence" (of time or place); a "reply" (as returned).
Usage: answer, be expired, return.
Source: or "תְּשֻׁבָה"; from "H7725";

8668.long:
Meaning: "rescue" (literal or figurative, persons, national or spiritual).
Usage: deliverance, help, safety, salvation, victory.
Source: or "תְּשֻׁעָה"; from "H7768" in the sense of "H3467";

8669.long:
Meaning: a "longing".
Usage: desire.
Source: from "H7783" in the original sense of stretching out after;

8670.long:
Meaning: a "gift".
Usage: present.
Source: from "H7788" in the sense of arrival;

8672.long:
Meaning: "nine" or (ordinal) "ninth".
Usage: nine ( -teen, -teenth, -th).
Source: or (masculine) "תִּשְׁעָה"; perhaps from "H8159" through the idea of a turn to the next or full number ten;

8674.long:
Meaning: "Tattenai", a Persian.
Usage: Tatnai.
Source: of foreign derivation;
